description: iPNOTE is a streamlined platform for managing and securing intellectual property. It allows customers to engage with vetted legal vendors, oversee the entire collaboration process and manage their IP portfolio in a single place.   iPNOTE strives to enable companies to take control of their IP and leverage it to expand their business. With this platform, businesses handle administrative and financial processes on their own, without completely relying on third-party lawyers.    Requirements English level C1–C2. Do you agree that it is easier to communicate with foreign clients and partners in excellent English? Experience of active sales. You should not have a wild fear of calls or meetings. Excitement-yes, it's even good. Experience working with CRM.  Experience in b2b sales. It would be great if you sold an IT product, but if not, it is important that you learn quickly. Possession and understanding of marketing tools is an advantage.  Tasks Brief the client, make a commercial offer and enter the transaction. Track the performance of business indicators. Meet with clients, negotiate-turn the lead into a client. Maintain reports in CRM.  Conditions Annual base pay is 33 600 $ + we pay monthly sales-based commissions. As a Sales Manager, you will play a critical and active role in the day-to-day operations. This is an excellent opportunity to be one of the key members of our Sales team and position yourself for unique career growth opportunities. If you’re killing it, you’ll be our Head of Sales to lead our Sales Team and help spearhead our growth. TFor remote users: the ability to work from anywhere in the world, a schedule for your biorhythm, but not in relation to agreed meetings. Direct interaction with the product owner, who is also the CEO, so that you are always in the context of events and involved in the final result. The opportunity to attend and participate in major innovation events, including international ones.

Join us as our Regional Sales Manager in the Eastern US!  Powered by the most adaptive, simple, and secure zero trust solution on the market, we are on a mission to connect every entity in cyberspace.  In addition to our strong belief in the zero-trust architectural principles for Enterprise IT (never trust, always verify), we also believe that there’s nothing more important than building and maintaining trusted relationships with our current and prospective customers.  What’s in it for you? A fresh, dynamic startup environment The opportunity to join an early stage, make a difference, and grow your career alongside the company Early-stage stock options Ownership and independence of the entire go-to-market process for the Eastern US Your Objectives In The Role Build and execute the US Go-To-Market strategy for the Eastern region Lead from the front as a player coach while we establish the region Recruit and develop Account Executives and Channel Partners The Ideal Candidate Will Bring 5+ years of proven success in outcome-based enterprise sales Ability to learn new technologies quickly Experience selling via the channel and MSSPs Experience presenting to C-Level executives and an IT security audience Excellent work ethic and hunter mentality Excellent written and verbal communication skills Beneficial Experience Experience selling enterprise security solutions IDP, SSO, PAM, VPN, or remote connectivity experience None

Mission: The mission of Blue Square is simple: to manufacture and supply the most innovative and high-quality products possible to the pool industry.  Vision:    To become a global leader in pool equipment manufacturing.  Values:    Integrity: Do what we say we will. Quality: Provide outstanding products and unsurpassed service that, together, deliver premium value to our customers.   Continuous Improvement: Display a constant desire for progress.  Honest Communication: Communicate fearlessly to build trust.  Initiative: Exhibit a strong will to win by leaning forward and displaying urgency. Have Fun: Smile and enjoy the ride.    As a swimming pool equipment manufacturer, we are looking for a National Sales Manager candidate. We prefer candidates with combined selling experience and a technical product or engineering background. The successful candidate will be naturally driven and have strong relationship building and presentation skills. Candidate will have a strong track record in a sales and business development position with experience in the pool industry.   Role and Responsibilities: Develop and implement sales strategies to grow and scale the business Lead the nationwide sales team by setting and achieving sales targets Travel throughout the United States to train and guide company representative firms, call on distributors, dealers, builders, OEM’s, and prospective customers to obtain new business and expand existing business Advise dealers and distributors concerning sales and advertising techniques Analyze market trends and sales data to assist in sales promotions for present and future business Display or demonstrate products, using samples to explain features, attributes, and advantages over competition Review market analyses to determine customer requirements, volume potential and competitive pricing Coordinate between customer service, technical service, engineering, and other departments as appropriate to improve products and customer experience Manage expenditures of the sales team to conform to budgetary requirements Develop and maintain a comprehensive list and profile of key accounts and contacts (direct and non-direct) in a computerized database program such as Salesforce Prepare monthly progress reports, monthly itinerary, weekly call reports and weekly expense reports in a timely manner and submit to Chief Operating Officer May be responsible for the training and management of sales representatives and regional sales managers Develop a national strategy for attending trade shows and/or association meetings to promote company products  EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS: BSc degree in Sales, Business Administration, or relevant field PREFERRED SKILLS: 5+ years managing a high-performance sales team in the pool industry Exposure to and connections within pool equipment distribution channels nationwide Technical certifications related to the pool industry a plus Ability to understand and analyze sales performance metrics Sound negotiation and consultative sales skills Effective communication skills Exceptional customer service skills Travel up to 75%, including day trips and overnight trips (must reside within 1 hour of a major international airport if not in AZ)  As an Equal Opportunity Employer, Blue Square Manufacturing is committed to a diverse workforce.

The Role  The role of the Inside Advisor team is to educate, inspire and skillfully guide Tesla’s potential customers through the vehicle and energy configuration and sales process. The Inside team focuses on financing options, trade-ins, DMV requirements, unique state requirements, delivery scheduling and providing a world class experience. The Inside Advisor Supervisor is responsible for their team executing these activities at the highest possible level, while innovating and improving processes to make them more efficient and streamlined for both our advisors and customers. It is our mission to accelerate the world’s transition to sustainable transportation.  Responsibilities Build, develop and grow a team of Inside Advisors for Tesla North America Monitor employee productivity which consist of but not limited to: Direct Sales, Online Chat, Delivery Functions, Inbound & Outbound queues and Ownership Outreach Communicate and implement all relevant changes that impact the team regarding policy and procedure Collaborate with other departments in efforts to clear roadblocks and build stronger relationship Set goals to meet minimum expectations and manage on-going performance Train and mentor new team members as well as identify and mentor future team leaders Work on the continuous improvement of processes and procedures related with the purchase of Tesla products Actively coaching team members on sales conversations while providing real time feedback Create a fun, inclusive culture that rewards hard work, production and innovation Qualifications 1-3+ years of phone sales or customer service or experience in managing an inbound/outbound contact center environment Excellent communication and relationship management skills, both oral and written Experience in managing in a contact center environment Great organizational skills with an eye for detail and the ability to make decisions that are in line with Tesla standards Strong relationship management skills and the capability to explain complex technical concepts Proficient with standard corporate productivity tools (email, voicemail, MS Office, SharePoint, internet navigation, CRM applications) Legal right to work in the United States Ability to obtain DMV Salesperson’s License. Tesla will provide guidance and monetary assistance in obtaining licenses. Licensing process must be initiated by the third week of employment. Failure to obtain a license by the second month of employment will result in termination Requirement to follow Tesla Motor’s information security policy

Growth Sales Team Lead - Brand, Agency, and Direct Response  Company Overview: TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. We have global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.  About the Team and Job: The Growth Business team is a scaled midmarket sales team that is part of TikTok's Global Business Solutions Division. The focus of this team is to connect TikTok's vibrant and growing creators and users with the brands and businesses they know and love. The Team Lead role is directly responsible for building relationships and helping clients drive business results on TikTok through consultation, education, and support. Ideal candidates will combine an exceptional ability to lead and grow a team of sales professionals, acts as a consultative sales player/coach, and deliver against sales quota. This person should have a passion for growing our business exponentially, an outstanding ability to set the strategic vision, and a willingness to develop and execute scaled processes. Success in this position requires strong sales and problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and the ability to thrive in a dynamic environment. We are looking to hire Team Leads within our direct sales team which separates focus on Brand, Direct Response, and Agency on our Growth sales teams. The position is full-time and located in our Austin, TX office.  Responsibilities: - Collaborate with our Growth leadership to establish a sales strategy and execution plan to achieve team goals. - Partner with cross-functional subject matter experts to develop, identify, and implement effective client advertising strategies. - Leverage data to identify consumer trends - spot wins, opportunities, and optimizations. - Become an expert in the assigned segments – collect and analyze competitive intelligence and market factors to anticipate client opportunities. - Consult clients on TikTok product offerings and demonstrate a deep understanding of product capabilities, measurement, attribution, and KPIs. - Coach Brand Partnership Managers in setting long and short-term goals, milestones, and tracking performance towards revenue objectives. - Guide Brand Partnership Managers on consultative, client-centric selling and best-in-class presentations, coach and develop for career growth. - Act as player-coach and support team to develop client leads, onboard, and cultivate long-term brand partner relationships.  Qualifications - 7-10 years of marketing, brand advertising, agency, sales, and/or e-commerce experience. - Direct people management experience.  Preferred Requirements - Expert knowledge of social media, mobile apps, digital/e-commerce, and performance marketing. - Knowledge of the self-serve ads platforms and biddable forms of digital ads buying. - Experience in Media/Publishing, Healthcare, CPG, Finserv, Entertainment/Hospitality, EDU. - Excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills. - Proven track record of reaching and exceeding sales goals. - Creative, outside-the-box thinker, and strategist. - A team player and collaborator, strong relationship-building, and leadership skills. - Passion for leading teams and career coaching. - Strong analytical and consultative selling skills to help identify and measure customer objectives. - Ability to thrive in a rapid, agile, and often ambiguous growth environment.  TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience.  TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please reach out to us at accommodations@tiktok.com.

Be the front-line seller who drives sales, identifying and generating opportunities for Grocery Retailers and Refrigeration OEMs. You will foster client satisfaction by maintaining regular customer contact and managing customer expectations. You will develop customer relationships through direct sales calls and by coordinating and/or attending trade shows, seminars, and similar events. You will provide education of Honeywell offerings through technical presentations to drive specifications of our products. You will maintain and provide reports and opportunity status using our customer relationship management system. You will provide competitive intelligence and market trends for use by Offering Management and New Product development. You will provide forecast/demand input to Sales Inventory Operations Planning (SIOP). This role will work remote and can sit anywhere in the United States near a major airport. Drive business growth of Honeywell Multisite control offerings by calling directly on new grocer end users and by fostering channel sales through existing refrigeration OEM partners  Deliver value by forging new strategic relationships Grow your knowledge of Honeywell products in a team-based culture focused on innovation and customer satisfaction  YOU MUST HAVE Minimum of 5 years of experience in the Grocery/Refrigeration industry  WE VALUE Bachelor’s degree A proficient understanding of key sales principles and best practices Excellent team and communication skills An ability to take initiative and work with limited direction An ability to influence across a broader organization An ability to influence customers, while maintaining healthy relationships Significant experience in selling (industrial) products Deep technical expertise Understanding of the Honeywell value proposition as well as the competitive landscape  Additional Information JOB ID: HRD136299 Category: Sales Location: 715 Peachtree Street, N.E.,Atlanta,Georgia,30308,United States Exempt

Western Sales Manager We are working with a Keto friendly snack & cereal company that is looking to fill a newly created Western Regional sales position! This is an opportunity to be apart of a fast growing team in the natural food space! Must have previous sales experience in natural/organic CPG industry and be west of Chicago. Job Responsibilities: · Coordinate with brokers and distributor partners to secure and expand placement · Manage select retail, wholesale and distributor accounts located throughout the west, both in the natural and conventional channels · Travel to buyer meetings to represent the brand and product portfolio in person (when travel begins again) · Manage trade spend and negotiate promo deals with buyers and distributors · Build sales presentations and other sales materials in collaboration with Marketing team · Report monthly sales performances · Represent the company at trade shows · Consistently looks for new ways to achieve cost awareness · Makes recommendations for new product introductions or product improvements based on feedback from customers  Required Skills/Qualifications: · Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing or business-related field is preferred · 3-5 years’ experience in the food CPG industry · Past experience selling natural/organic CPG with an emerging brand is highly preferred · Experience managing, optimizing and reporting against an annual trade-spend budget · Proven history managing food broker teams on a regional and national basis · Comfortable analyzing, understanding and presenting syndicated data · Knows how to prioritize accounts efficiently · Consistently displays a positive attitude with strong business acumen · Understand the importance of building relationships internally and with stakeholder groups · Frequent travel required (when travel opens up) · Understanding of key retailer category management principles · Proven history of delivering presentations in front of external and internal audiences

description: The Eastern Wisconsin Regional Sales Manager position is responsible for executing sales and distribution initiatives. Focusing on the development of relationships and management of spirits wholesalers in the designated regions and overlapping markets. The Sales Manager will ensure that distributors are adhering to brand policies and company goals are being met. Furthering the brand reach and awareness through engaging in special promotions, marketing initiatives, tastings, trade shows, and special events. The Sales Manager is responsible for market depletions, pricing, and programming the brands within the distributor networks of the designated region. This will include both on-premise and off-premise work, focused on the Eastern side of Wisconsin, specifically in the Milwaukee and Fox Valley regions. The Sales Manager will be responsible for representing Driftless Glen out in the market in a positive way.   Key Skills and Competencies: Strong communication skills – written, verbal, persuasion, motivation Relationship building Time management. Manage deadlines and reach goals Responsible for educating distributor, sales team, and retail trade Observe competitive market activity and evaluate distributor execution against initiatives Provide weekly recaps for accounts sold, visited, and follow up directives Manage all T&E expenses and local budgets for the region Successfully work toward exceeding volume goals in specific territories. Remain knowledgeable of all laws, regulations, and policies that govern the market and keep management informed of all information pertaining to changes  Minimum Qualifications 5+ years experience in sales, bonus if it’s in the alcoholic beverage industry  Valid state motor vehicle operator’s license Must have reliable transportation Ability to secure and maintain auto-liability insurance in accordance with state laws. Ability to secure and maintain a State Sales Permit in accordance with state laws Must be 21 years of age or older. Must pass a drug test. Must be able to travel and proactively plan out your sales routes, arrangements, scheduling. Must be available to work evening and weekend events as they come up. Travel: Significant travel within the assigned regions. Extensive knowledge of the whiskey/craft spirits industry specifically is a plus!  About Driftless Glen Distillery Driftless Glen Distillery is an award-winning craft distillery located at the edge of the Driftless Area in Baraboo, WI. In addition to bourbon and rye whiskey, they have a full range of products that include brandy, vodka, and gin. Most recently rated by Whisky Advocate with a “90” for their Bourbon Whiskey, the company has been named “Wisconsin Distillery of the Year” by New York International Spirits Competition and shared as a “Top Ten US Spirits Brand You Must Try” by London Spirits Competition. They distribute their spirits in 20+ states and continue to grow. As they expand, they are looking for the right people to join their team!

National Account Manager – Melinda’s Foods, LLC CPG Experience Required  Melinda’s is the original Habanero pepper sauce company in the US! Established in 1989, Melinda’s set the culinary world on fire and was the first brand to achieve a fine balance of heat and flavor. Almost 30 years later, the award-winning brand continues to delight fiery food enthusiasts with an array of artfully crafted pepper sauces and ketchups, spanning multiple heat levels – Melinda’s has flavors everyone can enjoy! Geographically, the ideal candidate would be based in the Dallas/Ft. Worth area, but consideration will be given to candidates that live near a major US airport. This position requires extensive knowledge of the US food retailer market and the ability to sell to major, national/strategic food accounts. There will be a focus on maximizing sales to top tier accounts through advanced business planning, forecasting, analytical and category management expertise. The ability to form strong relationships with buyers, category managers and c-suite executives as well as effectively managing a network of brokers, will be integral to success in this position. Customer scope will vary from Food, Mass, Club, and Foodservice, so candidates with CPG sales experience in multiple channels will be thoughtfully considered. There is potential for international travel to develop business with Melinda’s, so candidates with an international sales background will be thoughtfully considered.  Core Position Responsibilities: •    Demonstrate ability to drive sales results while providing best in class customer service. •    Negotiate slotting and terms of trade activity with customers. •    Create & present business reviews – Excel, Word and PowerPoint proficient. •    Gain customer approval for in-store activation (IRC, Tear Pads, Signs, etc.) •    Address retail pricing issues with customers. •    Manage routine cuts/supply issues with customers. •    Manage new product launches. •    Expand distribution of full Melinda’s portfolio to include pepper sauces, condiments, banana chips, cookies, dried fruits, and ketchups. •    Conduct sales analytics using available insights to provide solutions to customer needs. •    Align customer strategies with Melinda’s strategic plan to build a collaborative business plan •    Monitor trade activity execution. •    Closely manage and work with broker networks to maximize retail effectiveness and gauge strategy success. •    Proactively develop new customers across multiple channels to expand the Melinda’s brand presence.   Qualifications/Education/Experience/Skills: •    Bachelor’s Degree in business, finance, marketing (or related field or equivalent work experience) •    Minimum four years industry related experience with at least three years direct CPG sales experience. •    Proven sales ability with strong negotiation skills. •    Experience in sales planning & forecasting. •    Must show proven ability to build and maintain strong, effective relationships with •    customers and functional groups. Must show aptitude to effectively interpret and use •    multiple information sources to develop customer specific tactical plans and options. •    Strong business and financial acumen: advanced business analytics skills, customer P & L agility, ability to plan, track and evaluate trade management. •    Strong attention to detail •    Understanding of the total business process and procedures. •    Ability to manage trade spending. •    Strong technical, report running and analytical abilities. •    Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite. •    Strong verbal and written communication skills. •    Ability to work within a matrix organization. Work with multiple Account Managers/Sales Directors to discuss and prioritize work initiatives  Melinda’s, LLC., is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, veteran status or any other protected factor under federal, state or local law.  Visit us at melindas.com and send a resume and cover letter to greg@melindas.com

WHO WE ARE SwipeSense, a sister company to SC Johnson Professional, is a healthcare technology company on a mission to eliminate harm and waste in medicine. Hospitals use our platform to prevent infections, make greater use of their equipment, and improve the patient experience. We believe in the power of data and partner with hospital teams to provide them with insights to sustain positive behavior change and deliver a predictable patient journey. We value relentless experimentation, a locked-arms attitude, and a shared purpose to improve the future of healthcare. Our vision is to be the safety platform for hospitals with a growing number of applications such as hand-hygiene compliance monitoring, asset tracking, and nursing insights.  WHO WE NEED We are looking for an experienced enterprise sales professional, who has sold into multi-hospital systems as well as independent facilities, and has managed complex agreements with long sales cycles (6-12 months). You will leverage your industry expertise to build the sales engine for SwipeSense.  The ideal candidate has experience building a new territory and selling into new growth markets. Sales records include selling technology/software as a service to C-level executives. This is a dynamic leadership position that will be responsible for developing strategic plans and expanding our commercial efforts.  At SwipeSense, we build products that help save lives, and in turn, you are excited to imagine and integrate industry standard best-practices, introducing the value of new technology offerings/solutions for a safer healthcare experience. You’re a value-based leader who puts people and building relationships first.  PRIMARY ROLE You are responsible for building and managing a sales pipeline to help achieve business objectives, and which is aligned to fiscal year targets set by corporate leadership. You will guide sales relationships from prospect to signature, manage the team, and partner closely with marketing to craft strategies for growth and expansion.   KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Develop, close and manage business with major health care systems, hospital GPOs, and national/regional accounts; including and not limited to hospitals, ALFs, and SNFs. Generate ROI analysis for prospects, leveraging public and private data, to demonstrate financial impact created by SwipeSense Work closely with senior management to reach strategic goals and to provide input into the company’s healthcare strategy. Develop annual sales plan and team budget, analyzing the national market to determine customer needs, trends, and practices Generate and execute on strategies for expansion and growth within enterprise systems. Maintain, analyze, and present sales projections and data. Manage the sales and marketing team; providing coaching and development, and fostering an environment of collaboration. Lead channel partnerships including go-to-market processes. Support promotional campaigns in concert with the Director of Marketing. Manage the contracting process through pricing proposals, preparation of new customer contracts, renewal, expansion and cross sale agreements. Continuously educate the market on the impact of SwipeSense technology and maintain the organization’s position as an industry thought-leader.   QUALIFICATIONS 8+ years in leading healthcare sales initiatives as a seller and a leader Experience with long sales cycles and SAAS products in healthcare Enterprise sales experience Demonstrated ability to think strategically and lead in a complex environment Preferred experience selling a new technology to a market Strong empathy for customers and passion for revenue and growth Ability to engage and energize internal and external stakeholders Motivated by the opportunity to introduce new technologies to the market Bonus if you have: Experience operating in a start-up environment  Please note: position is full-time, at our Chicago headquarters. Must be local or willing to relocate. Candidates must be a US Citizen, or a foreign citizen with a required work visa.

About The Team  You will join a new team that is at the center of Zillow’s effort to transform the future of home selling. This team will be responsible for establishing and developing best-in-class operations for residential real estate transactions, central to our mission to make the process of buying or selling a home a consumer friendly, state of the art experience that can be launched with just the click of a button.  About The Role  Zillow is looking for a Market Sales Manager who will communicate and negotiate directly with prospective buyers and their agents to resell Zillow-owned Homes. The Market Sales Manager will support a growing portfolio of Zillow-owned and listed properties spanning multiple markets, working closely with Acquisitions, Asset Management and Field Renovations teams to ensure the resale process is efficient and effective.  You Will Manage offer volume on ZO-owned homes within a designated region Evaluate offers against expected outcomes and communicate responses within defined SLAs Negotiate inspection objections and facilitate repair work. Analyze low appraisals and determine course of action while following standards of practice and prioritizing profitability. Partner with Asset Management to monitor and evaluate listed property inventory across multiple markets. Provide property feedback and work with cross-functional teams to effectively manage inventory. Analyze market data and individual home demand metrics to optimize price and days on market. Execute (review & sign) documents and manage process flow from pre-list to resale closing. Work closely with transaction management to ensure closing dates are met Facilitate critical issues and conflict resolution Perform additional duties, as needed This role has been categorized as a Remote position. “Remote” employees do not have a permanent corporate office workplace and, instead, work from a physical location of their choice which must be identified to the Company. Employees may live in any of the 50 US States, with limited exceptions. In certain cases, an employee in a remote-designated job may need to live in a specific region or time zone to support customers or clients as part of their role.  In Colorado, the standard pay range for this role is $30.40 - $48.60 Hourly. This range is specific to Colorado and may not be applicable to other locations.  Who you are A minimum of two years of customer service is required. Active real estate license highly preferred In-depth knowledge of residential real estate practices Strong negotiation skills and the ability to create win-win solutions Knowledge and understanding of real estate contracts and the title/escrow closing process. Strong real estate valuation and market analysis skills. Ability to analyze large amounts of data and various reports/sources Excellent organization, project management skills and capable of multi-tasking Excellent communication and ability to develop relationships at all levels across the organization Intermediate to sophisticated computer skills with proficiency in applications such as Google and MS Office Suite. Salesforce is a plus. Experience with REO/Asset Management, appraisal, loan financing, transaction management, or title/escrow a plus In addition to a competitive base salary this position is also eligible for equity awards based on factors such as experience, performance and location.  Get to know us  Zillow is reimagining real estate to make it easier to unlock life’s next chapter.  As the most-visited real estate website in the United States, Zillow® and its affiliates offer customers an on-demand experience for selling, buying, renting or financing with transparency and nearly seamless end-to-end service. Millions of people visit Zillow and its affiliate sites every month to start their home search, and now they can rely on Zillow to help them finish it — and no matter what job you're in, you will play a critical role in making this vision a reality.  At Zillow, we're powered by our innovative and inclusive work culture, where everyone has the flexibility, support and resources to do the best work of their careers. Our efforts to streamline the real estate transaction is supported by our passion to redefine the employee experience, a deep-rooted culture of innovation, a fundamental commitment to Equity and Belonging, and world-class benefits. But don't just take our word for it. Read our reviews on Glassdoor and recent recognition from multiple organizations, including: Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work For® List 2021 Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index 2021, Human Rights Campaign (HRC) Corporate Equity Index and HRC’s Best Place to Work for LGBTQ Equality 2021, Fortune Best Workplaces for Technology 2020, Fortune Best Workplaces for Millennials 2020, Fortune Best Workplaces for Parents 2020, and the Deloitte Technology Fast 500.  Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at RecruitingAccessibility@zillowgroup.com.  Applicants who receive job offers from Zillow Group will be asked to sign a Proprietary Rights Agreement which includes confidentiality, intellectual property assignment, customer and employee non-solicitation, and non-competition provisions. If you are contacted for a role at Zillow Group and wish to review a copy of the Proprietary Rights Agreement prior to receiving an offer, you may request a copy from your Recruiter.

description: At Henkel, you can make a difference and craft your career. That's why you own your projects and take full responsibility from an early stage. Our unique brands in markets around the world open up countless opportunities to follow your convictions and explore new paths. If you have an entrepreneurial mindset that allows you to always think out of the box - take the chance and shape the digital future together with us.  YOUR ROLE With megatrends such as Sustainability (Renewable Energy & Efficient Energy Consumption), Global Connectivity & Automation (Industry 4.0, Internet of Things, 5G, E#Mobility), and a Rapidly Rising World Population (Upgrading Infrastructures), the area of Power and Industrial Automation in a key focus for Henkel. Henkel is a key global player in facilitating this progress, with a variety of integrated solutions, enabling efficient converting, managing, and controlling of power from supply to load across industries and enhancing sustainability. As the market demands expand, we are increasing our focus on the key market players who are the forefront of progress. Our goal is to be the trusted partner of choice and therefore we require a new global key account manager to facilitate this journey. Leader of a global cross functional matrixed team. Formulation and execution of global key account strategy (short-/mid-/long term), including an ambitious annual revenue plan and long term target 4 year plan. Regularly updates the Key account strategic plan, 5 year strategic business plan and annual forecast/execution. Providing strategic plan presentations to internally and externally to an executive level audience. Responsibility for global revenue targets (top line and profit goals) as well as overall customer satisfaction. Providing clear direction and leadership to cross functional Henkel team(s) regarding account strategy, team member responsibilities and expectations. Driving execution of key priorities and sales opportunities into revenue generating projects. Translating customer's strategy and priorities into a joint innovation roadmaps. Building a new product development pipeline.  YOUR SKILLS Bachelor in Engineering, a Science, Business Administration or similar. Five to ten years of experience in a specification role within manufacturing or engineering (ideally with a focus on electronics), as a high performance materials supplier Five to ten years of experience in technical service/technical sales in a B2B environment. A strong focus on value selling and business/sales management with experience of International markets/teams. Experience in Marketing and Strategy is beneficial. Outstanding persuasion skills. Highly systematic and conceptual thinking. Very good leadership skills. Strong English. German would be an advantage, but not a requirement.  Henkel is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, and other legally protected characteristics.  Henkel does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firms or employment agencies. Unsolicited referrals and resumes are considered Henkel property and therefore, Henkel will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited referral. At Henkel's request only, preferred vendors may be invited to refer talent for specific open positions. In these cases, a fully-executed agreement with Henkel must be in place and current.  All employees applying for an internal position must have a discussion with his/her manager about their interest in a job posting opportunity. The discussion will not preclude the employee from interviewing if their skills meet the job requirements.

ACUMEN INTERNATIONAL is a global provider of Global Employment Outsourcing/Global Employer of Record/International PEO services. We enjoy a culture of mutual respect, growth and development, and professional attitude. We are looking for an ambitious and high-skilled Global Sales Manager. About the position: Responsible for sustaining the business with existing customers, the role will also include finding new clients, both end employers, and partners, and developing relationships with them. In addition, the sales manager will be responsible for selling new SaaS products. Key responsibilities: Communicate with clients, both end clients, and partners and create and sustain a long-term relationship with them. Discuss and understand the client requirements and fit the Acumen services to this requirement. Maintain customer relationships and ensure our customers are provided with accurate product knowledge and guidance on compliant global employee onboarding and offboarding. To provide customers with an efficient solution through aligning customers ‘needs with realities of a country labor law, requirements of an ideal buyer profile and Acumen’s profitability standards. Competently explain in-country legislation and practices. To work with figures and prepare accurate calculations from total employment cost simulations to commercial offers to clients; discuss proposals with clients and agree, and reciprocate terms in service agreements with in-country partners. Provide quotes to international clients. To work with legal documentation – to review service agreements, non-disclosure agreements, employment agreements, and other HR documents. Review client and partner contracts to ensure the terms and other information is correct before sending it to the client. Work with inbound leads to increase sales of the global PEO solution (95% vs outbound) To dive deep and acquire knowledge on Acumen’s products and provide value to customers based on this. Monitor and analyze business trends, and find new leads from channels, including outbound calling/ To assimilate complex data and information from disparate sources and process it to address a certain need or issue in the sales department. Participate in the new products – online SaaS calculator and country hiring guides – market launch and fulfill sales KPIs. To conduct reviews on the existent sales department strategies and weigh them against results to identify areas of improvement. To work together with other departments, such as finance, marketing, network, and customer support, to coordinate efforts and achieve the best results. To work closely with the customer care department when setting up new projects. Participate in monthly, quarterly, and annual reporting. To participate in other cross-departmental tasks. Requirements: University diploma in business, marketing, economics, or other closely related areas 1-3 years experience in international sales, experience in industries like recruiting, contractor or contingent workforce engagement, staffing, global PEO is required/a big plus. Advanced English verbal and writing skills. Proficient computer and digital skills including knowledge of the MS Office, advanced knowledge of Excel, experience in using CRM systems. Figures-oriented and detail-oriented. Good at multitasking and with strong project management skills. Self-starter who takes the initiative, capable of accountability Excellent communication skills, strong practical experience, and customer service skills Capacity to work with versatile complex data, both text and figures Ability to communicate with global clients in a global environment, both orally and in written form. Why Join Acumen International: Excellent compensation package Excellent opportunity to pursue an international career in a global company; Professional growth and development, training programs; Fantastic team

Job Summary:  Do you have the gift of making quick, easy connections with people? Do you instinctively know how to sell in a way that’s as friendly as it is persuasive? And do you have a true passion for the Disney legacy and brand? If you’re nodding your head yes, then a Vacation Club Guide position at Aulani might be the opportunity you’ve been looking for.  The Disney Vacation Club (DVC) is a vacation ownership/timeshare that gives our Guests the chance to enjoy Disney experiences around the country for years to come. Selling the Disney Vacation Club is a true team effort, but it all comes down to the Vacation Club Guide, who helps our Guests understand why ownership makes sense for their future. Vacation Club Guides earn a guaranteed salary -- plus commission -- so if you think you have the skills and personality to unleash unlimited earning potential, please apply today!  Responsibilities:  Imagine creating magic through Disney. As a leading brand in entertainment and timeshare, your commitment will be to deliver a guest experience defined by quality and excellence. As a Disney Vacation Club Guide, you would be in an exceptional position of selling the essence of Disney and all the emotion, nostalgia and joy that comes with the name by engaging with prospects and Members in-person, via phone, or by email and on-line chat. By joining us, you will become a part of an innovative team and take a step towards the next level of your career success.  Every single day as a Vacation Club Guide is different! On any given day you might:  Capture high interest leads through various sales and marketing tactics, including in-person and virtual opportunities Interact with people in Hawaii, the U.S. mainland and from around the world Display sales versatility by being able to offer program overview by phone, chat, webinar, and in-person Exercise your acumen and knowledge of the Disney Vacation Club products and relevant information on the Disney Brand Develop referrals and leads through guest contact and consistent follow up activities Give descriptive details on features of Disney Vacation Club properties, as well as articulate the benefits of vacationing with the Disney Vacation Club Advocate the allocation of appropriate amounts of points to accommodate both prospects and Members Work alongside your fellow Disney Vacation Club team members at various locations, including the resort model rooms and off-site destinations to service guests and DVC Members Generate sales through the utilization of proper sales closing techniques and initiate transactions in the contract system Have access to sales specific training and ongoing professional development opportunities unique to the Disney brand  Basic Qualifications:  Excellent telephone skills, computer proficiency, guest service and relationship building skills Have impeccable follow up skills to nurture pipeline opportunities that contribute to growth of individual prospect and member base Have a dynamic win-win attitude and the ability to communicate with people effectively Ability to handle multiple lead opportunities on a daily basis Proven success working in a competitive sales environment Excellent people skills and a friendly attitude Demonstrated history of taking the initiative and being a self-starter Exceptional verbal and writing skills Ability to work both independently and as part of a team Experience shifting from a single location to multi-site environment and from in-person to telephone sales Possess a true passion for Guest service and for Disney Ability to work well under pressure in a fast-paced business Proficiency with computers and with Windows-based systems like Microsoft Office programs Full time availability required including nights, weekends and holidays Reliable transportation to work at the DVC Sales Center at Aulani, A Disney Resort & Spa  Preferred Qualifications:  Proficiency in a language other than English Experience with sales consultation Knowledge of the timeshare industry programs  Required Education  High school degree or equivalent Current, active and in good-standing Hawaii Real Estate License  Additional Information:  keyword:disneyvacationclub  840384BR

description: Description Does building business partnerships excite you? Are you passionate about helping local businesses succeed? Do you love thinking outside the box and trying a new approach?  If this describes you and your sales philosophy, you might just be the Regional Sales Manager we’re looking for!  Lovingly has tremendous plans for growth and is building a driven team of Regional Sales Managers to help double our market share domestically and internationally. In this role, you’ll develop and nurture a regional network of florist partners and help them find the Lovingly solutions that are best for their business.  Who we are Lovingly has built a better way to buy flowers and gifts online. Our curated marketplace connects shoppers to the most talented independent florists across the U.S. and Canada. Equally important are the e-commerce technologies, tools, and support we deliver to our community of florist partners. The result is an exceptional gifting experience every time. Lovingly is fully remote, with team members across North America. No matter the distance, we stay united through our people-first culture built on curiosity, positivity, and collaboration.  What you’ll do Improve market share within your territory via in-store visits, industry events, and other key sales activities Develop a strategy and business plan for your territory to meet organizational, team, and individual objectives Assess florist partner needs and recommend solutions from our line of products and services, including e-commerce tools, point of sale technology, online marketing, and more Collaborate cross-functionally on territory-specific sales planning and initiatives  Requirements A growth mindset along with a genuine passion for sales 5+ years of sales experience in B2B sales, field sales, or small business sales Excellent presentation and communication skills both in-person and online Technologically savvy and able to leverage resources such as Salesforce, Salesloft, GSuite, and Docusign A willingness to travel up to 50% to visit prospective and current partners Nice-to-haves Sales experience in a software/SaaS environment Fluency in Spanish and/or French  Benefits A competitive base salary with OTE compensation 22 PTO—use them however you want! 12 paid holidays Comprehensive benefits, including health, dental, and vision 401k with guaranteed 3% salary contribution Ongoing growth and development opportunities, plus a 25% tuition discount at Marist College (including online programs)

description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.  Job Category Sales Job Details  Slack is on a mission to make your working life simpler, more pleasant and more productive. We are looking for highly motivated Sales Development Manager to build and lead our Toronto sales team.  Our culture is the north star that guides how we work together and with our customers. Are you looking to build something greater than yourself? Do you want to work alongside some of the most talented and dynamic people in the industry? If so, Slack just might be the place for you.  We'll help you build your career in Sales while you collaborate with a diverse team of talented individuals. If you are a self-starter who is deeply passionate about customer happiness, read on.  We are searching for an exceptional Sales Development Manager to set up and manage our Denver and Toronto sales development team. The Sales Development Manager will set team goals, motivate and develop team members, and work closely with sales and marketing leaders. This person needs to communicate effectively across multiple departments, have the ability to shift gears at a moment's notice, and enjoy the challenges of providing excellent customer service in a dynamic environment.  This is a role for both experienced and up-and-coming sales leaders who are passionate about the opportunity to join one of the fastest growing technology startups globally.  Responsibilities  Recruit, lead and develop a team of SDRs & BDRs, applying best practices to produce maximum results Assist the Head of SMB & SDR in determining the process, playbooks, career paths and appropriate measurements for SDRs & BDRs Develop a highly scalable yet personal outbound outreach strategy Work with Sales Managers and Executives toward common goals of pipeline generation Utilize quantitative methods to measure, manage, and optimize efforts and allocation of resources Identify and make recommendations for improvement in the areas of process, efficiency, and productivity Maintain focus and commitment on assigned targets Help build a fun, high energy environment where people love coming to work  Requirements  Desire to lead, coach and develop others around you. You have a passion for developing talent and coaching a team to success Relevant experience in a hands-on lead generation role, driving key metrics and daily activity, preferably in a SaaS organization Consistent track record in achieving and exceeding targets in a closing role Desire for developing new business opportunities Ability to forecast your business – lead conversion data through to pipeline build and win rates Excellent written and verbal communication skills You can adapt easily to a rapidly-changing environment Bachelor's degree required  Slack is a layer of the business technology stack that brings together people, data, and applications – a single place where people can effectively work together, find important information, and access hundreds of thousands of critical applications and services to do their best work. From global Fortune 100 companies to corner markets, businesses and teams of all kinds use Slack to bring the right people together with all the right information. Slack is headquartered in San Francisco, CA and has offices around the world. For more information on how Slack makes teams better connected, visit slack.com .  Ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other is core to Slack’s values. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and a pleasant and supportive place to work.  Slack is registered as an employer in many, but not all, states. If you are not located in or able to work from a state where Slack is registered, you will not be eligible for employment. Visa sponsorship may not be available in certain remote locations.  Visa sponsorship is not available for candidates living outside the country of this position.  For Colorado-based roles: The base pay range targeted for this role is $75,790. This base pay range is for illustrative purposes only. This position is eligible for additional compensation and benefits including: incentive compensation; health benefits; flexible spending account; retirement benefits; life insurance; commuter benefits; paid time off (including PTO, emergency time off, paid sick leave, medical leave, volunteer time off, civic duty leave, bereavement leave, floating holidays and paid holidays); parental leave and benefits; mobile phone and internet allowance; perks stipend; and other employee perks and benefits.  The actual offer, reflecting the total compensation package and benefits, will be at the company’s sole discretion, and determined by a myriad of factors including, but not limited to, years of experience, depth of experience, and other relevant business considerations. The company also reserves the right to amend or modify employee perks and benefits at any time.”  Accommodations  If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .  Posting Statement  At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.  Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .  Salesforce welcomes all.

description: Thank you for considering a career with Golden State Foods! Established in 1947, this $5 billion global company is one of the largest diversified suppliers to the foodservice industry. GSF manufactures and distributes a variety of products to approximately 125,000+ restaurants in more than 40 countries from 50+ locations on five continents.  Golden State Foods is a values based company committed to investing in our people, our culture and giving back to those in need. We treat others as we want to be treated. We believe in the dignity of all people. We promote growth, trust, inspirational leadership, teamwork and social responsibility. Joining GSF provides opportunities to make a difference, to be valued, to learn and to grow. This is a launch pad for infinite possibilities and we are honored you're considering joining us!  Responsibilities: Coordinate GSF Quality activities and operations to meet objective for quality, food safety, integrity, regulatory compliances, cost, safety and customer satisfaction Participate in formulating and administering division’s short and long range goals and objectives for business growth. Establishes productive, professional relationships with key personnel in assigned and potential customer accounts. Coordinates the involvement of company personnel, including support, service, and management resources, to meet account performance objectives and customers' expectations for respective divisions. Coordinating all customer events for the company. Meets assigned targets for profitable sales volume and objectives in assigned and potential accounts. Collecting and identifying market and customer information to utilize in performance with customer. Proactively leads a joint company-strategic account planning process that develops mutual performance objectives, financial targets, and critical milestones for predetermined timeframes. Proactively assesses, clarifies, and validates customer needs on an ongoing basis. Leads solution development efforts that best address customer needs, while coordinating the involvement of all necessary company personnel.  Performance Measures: Achieves assigned sales quota in designated accounts. Achieves customer objectives defined by company management. Completes customer and potential customer account plans that meet company standards. Maintains high customer satisfaction ratings that meet company standards. Completes required training and development objectives within the assigned time frame.  Minimum Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree Minimum ten years of strategic sales experience in a business-to- business sales environment B2B experience servicing Chick-fil-A is a plus 2 years of successful Food Manufacturing industry sales experience required Experience in Aseptic Food Processing (highly preferred) Must be officed out of the Atlanta metropolitan area. Superior communication skills Ability to learn, utilize and navigate through various systems/software Strong organizational skills

About Us:  Passport is a modern international shipping carrier built for e-commerce. We’re a growing, ambitious team looking to upend the trillion-dollar international parcel shipping industry through a world-class experience. Passport works with hundreds of DTC brands like Native, Bombas, Betabrand and others to serve their global consumers. At Passport, you will have the opportunity to work with some of the biggest e-commerce merchants in the world and think strategically on how to add value to their international business. To learn more about why leading brands trust and love us,  What you’ll be doing:  The Account Executive role is an individual contributor position working to expand Passport’s client base of some of the best known direct to consumer brands. You will be reporting to the VP of Sales and working along-side fellow Account Executives and a team of Business Development Representatives. Once you join we’ll provide an extensive sales training program to help you hit your immediate pipeline targets, and more importantly help you grow as a sales professional.  Responsibilities: Build Passport’s client base Actively manage pipeline and develop a strategy to hit your sales goals Collaborate with your peers across departments to support each other’s success Be a leader by helping your team and new Account Executives grow and develop Willing to travel to client meetings, trade shows and other industry events (once allowed by CDC guidelines)  Who You Are: 2+ years software sales experience, ideally selling to Operations teams Experience selling to e-commerce merchants is a plus Competitive and driven by goal-oriented metrics Has a history of overcoming challenges Shows ability to learn quickly and under pressure Willing to do the work - researching, prospecting, selling, maintaining relationships  Compensation And Benefits Competitive cash and equity packages Healthcare, dental, and vision 401K Monthly fitness stipend Monthly phone/internet stipend 100% remote work environment Company issued laptop Unlimited PTO Themed happy hours - bring on the Zoom comedians, pop-a-shot contests, and sip ‘n paints! Quarterly team (virtual) gatherings and annual all-company offsites in cities around North America (this year we're going to Nashville!) Learning & Development Fund for upskilling or products to improve your day-to-day work life One time remote work set-up stipend to make your at-home office dazzle Teammates around the world in 8 different time zones! description: Acquired by American Express in 2020, Kabbage is a leading FinTech company changing the way small businesses manage their cash flow. Applying automation and real-time data, Kabbage provides small businesses a suite of integrated cash-flow technologies from flexible lines of credit, digital business checking accounts, fast payments and predictive business analytics. Now with the powerful backing of American Express, Kabbage can offer millions of small businesses the opportunity to access digital tools to help them grow bigger, lasting companies. While we've received numerous awards and recognition—such as Entrepreneur's Top Company Cultures, Inc Magazine's Top Private Companies, GlassDoor’s Best Places to Work, and Forbes FinTech 50—it is our people, our culture, and our leaders that make Kabbage such a great place to work.  At Kabbage, we strive to be the place where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, to stay, and do their best work. Our commitment to diversity and inclusion is reflected in our people, our partners, and our customers. We are fully focused on equality and believe deeply in diversity of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, national origin and all the other wonderful characteristics that make us different.  You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.  At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible - and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day.  Your Mission  In this role, you will be directly responsible for signing up customers to various Kabbage solutions – Kabbage Funding, Kabbage Checking, and Kabbage Payments. You will be assisting customers with getting through the application, activating a solution for the first time (e.g. pulling their first loan, receiving their first deposit, processing their first payment), and managing the customer relationship. This role requires heavy telephone sales, but it is not a cold call. You will be calling leads who have filled out an application or have responded through one of our marketing campaigns. Success in this role is measured by hitting and exceeding monthly sales goals and achieving daily metrics in a competitive yet collaborative environment.  What You'll Be Doing Prospecting new business through heavy telephone sales to warm leads Diligently handle incoming calls -- understand the customer's needs, overcome objections, handle rejection in stride and ultimately close the sale Guide prospects through the application and/or onboarding process for Kabbage's suit of products, including working with internal department to troubleshoot potential issues Cross sell products as needed Become an expert in the SMB landscape - you will understand the cash flow trends and successfully coach SMB owners on how to grow their revenues What We’re Looking For In You 2-3+ years of sales experience selling to SMBs Past telephone sales experience History of consistently exceeding monthly sales goals Experience selling software, platform and/or SaaS solutions to SMBs Has a desire to grow personally and professionally Strong negotiating and prospecting Skills Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.  American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.

REGIONAL SALES MANAGER – WESTERN US RETAIL - Remote The Regional Sales Manager is responsible for developing profitable growth in Western regional customers via active broker and distributor partnerships and by creating excellent Customer Experience. You build strong customer relationships and future growth for Valio USA’s business, in growing plant-based categories for Oddlygood as well as Valio USA’s cheese and dairy portfolio. With an entrepreneurial spirit and close collaboration with your colleagues in other functions, you will achieve the short-term and long-term business goals in a highly competitive and developing environment. The successful achievement of the sales and profitability objectives will require the execution and delivery of the ongoing Merchandising, Assortment, Pricing and Shelving objectives established each year. Scope of the position includes all conventional grocery retailers in the defined geography and Target Stores. This position will report directly to the VP of Sales and at this time does not have any direct reports.  Essential Capabilities & Functions (not limited to): Drive Western US Retail sales and business growth opportunities Develop and implement strategic selling plans and objectives including volume/profits targets and KPIs Maximize distribution of current portfolio and work effectively with internal groups in the development and execution of new product innovation Leverage cross-functional support groups to drive growth, provide insights and improve customer experience Utilize business and financial acumen to deliver assigned revenue and profit goals, solid understanding of P&L and financial inputs Demonstrate decision making agility and be able to effectively manage ambiguity and complexity in the marketplace Work closely with our broker partners in the development of customer level sales plan and the attainment of KPI’s Work closely with business development, finance and supply chain colleagues to ensure effective execution Communicate openly and effectively with all key counterparts: customers, brokers, distributors, colleagues  Required Experience: Bachelor’s degree, Master’s degree preferred in a relevant field 5-10 years of Branded CPG retail sales experience managing either regional or direct customer relationships Proven track record on building profitable growth in a highly competitive business environment Proactive approach to problem solving, developing win-win outcomes Experience in managing P&L and implementing sales strategy at grass-root level Ability to work effectively under tight timelines Effective communication skills and ability to communicate with a variety of stake holders Strong leadership and interpersonal skills to influence key stakeholders at all levels Excellent verbal and written communication skills Proficient in data management and analysis; strong proficiency working with syndicated data Proficient with Microsoft Office; excellent Excel and PowerPoint skills Ability to travel for sales calls, broker meetings, trade shows and sales meetings - approximately 40% of time  VALIO USA, INC. – producer of Finlandia Cheese and butter, is a subsidiary of Valio Ltd., the largest and most innovative dairy co-operative in Finland. Our mission is to deliver the best tasting and award-winning cheese and butter products that are crafted with pure, natural and high-quality ingredients. We are a small team doing big things. We are proud to be a part of several international subsidiaries of Valio Ltd., and share over 110 years of experience and passion. Please visit us at www.valio.com/us for additional information.

The Manager, Suite Sales drives both short and long-term sales revenue for the organization by selling annual and multi-year suite leases. This role is responsible for managing an annual book of business year over year. This position requires a skilled negotiator, proficient in conducting and executing sales presentations with C-Level Executives and prominent individuals. The individual must also have a comprehensive understanding of the Bay Area market trends, including multiple business industries.   Responsibilities and Duties: ●   Focuses on prospecting, cold outreach via cold calls, emails, LinkedIn, etc. ●   Sets and conducts sales meetings in office, out of office and virtually. ●   Conducts sales research and identifies key B2B categories and prospects. ●   Efficiently manages multiple prospects and keeps a robust pipeline.   ●   Works with colleagues on crafting proposals for sales pitches. ●   Builds and fosters relationships with current and upcoming renewal accounts. ●   Negotiates with prospective clients to close sales. ●   Provides accurate sales pipeline information and feedback on accounts. ●   Continually creates and implements unique sales strategies. ●   Implements and engages sales training techniques.  ●   Attends events such as speaking engagements, lunches/dinners and various networking events. ●   Exercises professional judgement in understanding when to move on from a prospect. ●   Leads teambuilding sessions and encourages colleague participation. ●   Researches and implements industry trends and best practices including participating in major leagues best practice sessions. Develops “out of the box” ideas to stay ahead of market trends. ●   Records daily prospecting activity notes in CRM. ●   Responds to all inbound leads and premium inquires. ●   Accountable for closed sales revenue. ●   Participates in 1:1 & group meetings in which feedback is given and solicited for continual process improvement. ●   Collaborates with suite activation and sponsorship departments. ●   Other duties as assigned.  Required Abilities and Skills: ●   Ability to use focus on a speaker using verbal and non-verbal clues to understand their message, comprehend the information and respond thoughtfully. ●   Establish credibility through timely, responsive and truthful interactions. ●   Ability to use logic and reasoning to evaluate information to determine how it should be best interpreted. ●   Lead meetings in which stakeholders come together to focus ideas in a single direction. ●   Able to communicate confidently and competently to all types of audiences within a variety of delivery methods. ●   Organizational skills with the ability to manage time effectively, while balancing and prioritizing multiple or competing tasks. ●   Empowers all employees to report unethical behavior or conflicts of interest without fear of retaliation.  Education and Experience: ●   Bachelor’s degree or equivalent degree and 5-7 years of experience; or an equivalent combination of education and experience. ●   Experience with Microsoft Suite including Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint and Word. ●   Experience with CRM (Microsoft Dynamics preferred), ZoomInfo, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, Zoom, Canva, DialSource and Zoom. ●   Experience gaining meetings through cold calling, email communication, letters and other forms of custom outreach.  Physical Demands and Work Environment: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the functions.   The employee will be sitting in a typical office environment the majority of the time and may be exposed to outdoor weather conditions.   The employee is frequently required to sit, use hands or fingers, handle or feel objects, tools, or controls and reach with hands and arms. The employee is regularly required to talk or hear and taste or smell. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk and lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. The employee is occasionally required to climb or balance and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. Specific vision abilities required by this position include close vision.  Travel: 45% of local travel time and 5% of intra and interstate travel requiring overnight stay are expected for the position.

About The Team  You will join a new team that is at the center of Zillow’s effort to transform the future of home selling. This team will be responsible for establishing and developing outstanding operations for residential real estate transactions, central to our mission to make the process of buying or selling a home a consumer friendly, state of the art experience that can be launched with just the click of a button.  About The Role  Zillow Offers is looking for a Supervisor to develop a team responsible for reviewing and communicating offers for the Zillow Home Sales (ZHS) organization across Zillow Offers’ (ZO) markets. The Supervisor’s primary focus will be to lead and develop a cohesive team in a distributed workforce environment. In addition to developing a team, the Supervisor will be responsible for cross-collaborating with other department leaders to build outstanding processes, procedures, and tooling. This position works closely with Acquisitions, Asset Management, Transaction Management, and Renovation teams to ensure portfolio-level return and customer happiness metrics are achieved.  You Will Hire, train, develop, and lead a team of Market Sales Managers across multiple markets Monitor team performance metrics and identify mentoring/training opportunities Drive communication and collaboration across the team, organization, and with cross-functional partners Review and provide mentorship on offer activity, inspection responses, appraisals, and general transactional friction Participate in listing agent activities in assigned market(s) in form of listing back-up, overflow activity or in event of thresholds beyond team approval Act as brand ambassador in expectation setting, negotiation and direct communication with home buyer agents for listed ZO properties Partner with cross-functional leaders and stakeholders for market-specific and national best practice identification and root cause analysis Act as a change agent to identify and communicate areas for process improvement and formulate remedies within current processes and procedures; not limited to inter-ZHS Represent ZHS in development of tech tooling and cross functional initiatives, inclusive of organizational change associated program development Collaborate with Asset Management and Field Operation teams to evaluate property specific condition, marketing, and pricing, focusing feedback that facilitates successful buyer experience Maintain market level expertise to identify home sale trends and communicate market conditions to adjacent partners Identify, define and drive cross-functional operational and strategic initiatives This role has been categorized as a Remote position. “Remote” employees do not have a permanent corporate office workplace and, instead, work from a physical location of their choice which must be identified to the Company. Employees may live in any of the 50 US States, with limited exceptions. In certain cases, an employee in a remote-designated job may need to live in a specific region or time zone to support customers or clients as part of their role.  In Colorado, the standard pay range for this role is $82,400.00 - $131,600.00 Annually. This range is specific to Colorado and may not be applicable to other locations.  Who you are Comfortable transitioning back-and-forth from mentor to player in escalated situations A people leader who thrives in acting as a change agent in a rapid paced environment Self-starter who embraces change and operates with a mentality of “how can we make this work?” as opposed to “this will never work” Strong real estate valuation, contract, negotiation, and market analysis skills Ability to analyze large amounts of data and various reports/sources Excellent organizational, project management skills and the ability to multitask Excellent communication and ability to develop relationships at all levels across the organization Ability to provide solutions and conclusive direction in fast-paced environment Strong conflict resolution skills Hold an active real estate license in a market of posted position, broker license preferred In addition to a competitive base salary this position is also eligible for equity awards based on factors such as experience, performance and location.  Get to know us  Zillow is reimagining real estate to make it easier to unlock life’s next chapter.  As the most-visited real estate website in the United States, Zillow® and its affiliates offer customers an on-demand experience for selling, buying, renting or financing with transparency and nearly seamless end-to-end service. Millions of people visit Zillow and its affiliate sites every month to start their home search, and now they can rely on Zillow to help them finish it — and no matter what job you're in, you will play a critical role in making this vision a reality.  At Zillow, we're powered by our innovative and inclusive work culture, where everyone has the flexibility, support and resources to do the best work of their careers. Our efforts to streamline the real estate transaction is supported by our passion to redefine the employee experience, a deep-rooted culture of innovation, a fundamental commitment to Equity and Belonging, and world-class benefits. But don't just take our word for it. Read our reviews on Glassdoor and recent recognition from multiple organizations, including: Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work For® List 2021 Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index 2021, Human Rights Campaign (HRC) Corporate Equity Index and HRC’s Best Place to Work for LGBTQ Equality 2021, Fortune Best Workplaces for Technology 2020, Fortune Best Workplaces for Millennials 2020, Fortune Best Workplaces for Parents 2020, and the Deloitte Technology Fast 500.  Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at RecruitingAccessibility@zillowgroup.com.  Applicants who receive job offers from Zillow Group will be asked to sign a Proprietary Rights Agreement which includes confidentiality, intellectual property assignment, customer and employee non-solicitation, and non-competition provisions. If you are contacted for a role at Zillow Group and wish to review a copy of the Proprietary Rights Agreement prior to receiving an offer, you may request a copy from your Recruiter.
