Excellent verbal presentation and written communication skills plus the ability to communicate with a wide range of individuals from employees, consumers to management at Headquarters, as well as a diverse customer base Experience in POS (Point of Sale) both front and back office experience is required Strong IT skills including proficiency in MS Excel and MS Word Excellent written and verbal communication skills  To view our US Applicant Privacy Policy, please visit https://pandoragroup.com/careers/pandora-in-your-region/united-states

There are 2 actors on a network, people and machines. Just as usernames and passwords are used by people to access machines, keys and certificates are used by machines to identify and access each other. Venafi is the inventor of the technology that secures and protects keys and certificates, the most important assets of our Global 5000 customers. We are Warriors!  Are you passionate about making a positive impact and protecting the world from cybercriminals? If so, you may be a natural Venafi Warrior!  How You’ll Be Protecting The World  Due to our rapid growth, we are seeking an SDR to join our energetic and collaborative Sales Development team.  Success in the SDR role requires a hunter-mentality to generate qualified prospects for our Enterprise Sales team. You will follow leads by phone that are generated from Venafi’s marketing programs. You will prospect independently into enterprise accounts. Working cross-functionally with marketing and field sales teams across the United States region you will generate demand and pipeline for Venafi solutions. This role requires a smart, energetic, resilient results-driven individual who has the desire and ability to become familiar with a wide range of concepts, market trends and effective demand generation techniques within the Machine Identify Management space. The SDR role is a great career path for an individual that wants to progress into Sales, Sales Ops or Marketing roles.  Compensation is a competitive base salary plus performance-based monthly commission.  Responsibilities Include Researching target/named accounts prior to first contact to understand the prospect’s needs and educate the prospects on the benefits of the Venafi platform Educating prospects on the Venafi story and nurture them until they are qualified and ready to talk/meet with an Account Executive Setting appointments for the enterprise sales team when a prospect fulfills the qualified stage criteria Ensuring successful follow through of sales cycle by maintaining accurate activity and lead qualification information within Salesforce Collaborating with marketing to support successful outbound campaigns Driving attendance for webinars and set pre-scheduled meetings for conferences/events Occasional event support to engage prospects face-to-face Collaborating with sales and marketing team members on strategic sales approach Achieving a set number of calls and emails to prospects on a daily basis The Ideal Venafi Warrior Will Be Armed With Bachelor’s Degree 2+ years of experience outbound cold-calling, targeting multiple levels of contacts including executive management Excellent lead follow-up skills responding to and qualifying leads from marketing generated campaigns and incoming phone and web inquiries Superior pre-call planning, opportunity qualification and objection handling skills Aptitude to manage numerous requests and time demands concurrently, while achieving your objectives and goals Drive, passion and competitiveness with strong desire to compete and win Extremely self-motivated and independent with a diligent work ethic High level of integrity and strong commitment to building a successful company Fearlessness/Resilience– willing to call new people daily to educate and explain the Venafi value proposition as it relates to them The courage to challenge the status quo when logic and reason require it 100% reliable and detailed-oriented - a drive to execute flawlessly Ability to work independently as well as part of a team in a fast-paced environment Excellent references from prior employers, verifying targets and quota achievement What sets you apart? Knowledge and experience of the SFDC CRM system and modern selling tools (i.e. Connectandsell, ConnectLeader, Outreach, SalesLoft, Gong, etc.) Prior experience in an outbound Sales or Business Development role While you are busy protecting the world, we’ve got you covered!  In addition to fostering a work environment with strong work from anywhere ethic, Venafi offers a benefits package that is in the top 1%. We provide 100% employer-paid premiums for both team members and their families. That includes health, dental, and vision insurance. YES, REALLY! We offer four weeks of PTO (Paid Time Off), eleven holidays, and a "pick your own community service day." We also offer 401(k) and company matching, company HSA contribution, 2x salary employer-paid life insurance, and parental leave. We even offer pet insurance!  More About Venafi  Venafi is the undisputed heavyweight champion in Machine Identity Management. Why? Because we created the category and are light years ahead of anyone that would consider competing! Gartner has recognized Venafi as number one in our space and as it turns out, one is NOT the loneliest number!  Venafi is the inventor of the technology that secures and protects keys and certificates. Venafi protects machine identity types by orchestrating cryptographic keys and digital certificates for SSL/TLS, IoT, mobile, and SSH. Many of the largest organizations in the world use Venafi.  Billions of dollars have been spent protecting usernames and passwords and almost nothing protecting keys and certificates—organizations are just now realizing that protecting keys and certificates is as important as protecting usernames and passwords. The bad guys know this and are using stolen or forged keys and certificates to attack networks and steal data. In fact, Gartner says 50% of network attacks will use certificates.  Come help us protect the world!
industries: Computer Software, Computer & Network Security, and Information Technology and Services

description: Established health IT software company with a large client base is seeking a results oriented SVP of Sales with a healthcare technology sales background to lead the company’s significant new growth opportunities. The successful candidate is a leader with proven expertise in building and guiding a team to drive sales through cross selling to existing clients, and net new business growth. He or she will partner with existing sales and marketing teams to bring new ideas and strategies to the table. We seek a strong collaborator and proactive, creative problem solver.  The SVP of Sales will: Build and organize Medisolv’s sales team. Oversee management of all phases of the sales and business development cycle. Support team members, including opportunity development, proposal development, project scoping, client presentations, negotiation, and close. Establish and proactively manage sales executive quotas and overall incentive driven performance Work closely with Marketing leadership to coordinate sales follow through after marketing campaigns and inside sales.  Actively participate in professional trade shows, associations, and other events to generate new business. Focus individual effort on pursuing business development through targeted large corporate accounts and Enterprise sales. Develop new and maintain existing strategic partnerships Work with Company leadership to develop annual sales plan, budget, strategies, tactics and resources necessary to achieve goals for increasing the company’s sales. Assist with creation of efficient and effective onboarding of new sales executives. Gain a solid understanding of the Company’s software solutions. Refine and assist the sales executives with effective communication of our unique business value proposition for clients.  POSITION REQUIREMENTS  Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Healthcare or other relevant field Minimum of 7 years hands on progressive operational experience leading health IT sales to hospitals, physician practices and health system organizations.  Experience selling to C-Level in hospital and health systems Proven track record of leading and motivating national sales organizations Must successfully pass a pre-hire background check  Medisolv’s headquarters is in Columbia, MD. Remote work is available for this position. Must be able to travel approximately 30%. We offer a competitive compensation package.  LOCATION Columbia, MD /Remote U.S.

Who are we?  We’re Booksy and we have a passion for keeping the world’s beauty professionals busy and organized. We love connecting clients with their beauty professionals, so they can look and feel their best making the appointment process as easy and painless as possible is an obsession of ours. Booksy is the world's leading beauty and wellness app that solves the more complicated aspects of running a beauty business by taking the nitty-gritty everyday tasks off their hands. Now they have the time to do what they do best, help you be you, only better!  Pre COVID, as with any start-up, we were finding our way, working out the kinks, putting the wheels on the moving bus. 2020 happened and our bus stalled for a few months. We brought it to the shop, swapped some new parts for the old, buffed and waxed it, and came out on the other side stronger, smarter, and yet, still working out the kinks. As the stakes rise, we’re not the puny pre-teen we once were. All that being said, our 90-year-old grandpa tells us we never have it all figured out, so we’re not over here trying to. Here we are in the middle of our journey, thankful for the past that built us, and excited for the future that awaits us. Practice makes progress and that’s all we can say about where we are today.  We are psyched about where Booksy is headed. Chances are high that we need you on board to help execute our big plans.  Why are you here? Because you saw the job title and want to know more!  As the leader of our Midwest Field Sales team, you will work closely with the VP of Sales and will be responsible for managing all aspects of Field Sales in the Midwest region.  Requirements  What you’ll do Drive daily and weekly input (activity) and output (sales) metrics Conduct detailed weekly pipeline reviews Spend at least 50% of your time actively in the field coaching, taking meetings, doing demos etc… Hire, train, motivate and retain top talent in our core cities Spot check and QA that all sales processes are being adhered to Identify local events and marketing opportunities to connect with our core potential customers Encourage and offer transparency and constant feedback within your team; embrace new ideas and problem-solving while driving adoption of fundamental processes Be a respected and trusted leader throughout the organization Work closely with other sales leaders to develop effective coaching strategies and ensure consistent communication and alignment across various teams and departments Contribute to the overall sales strategy as it relates to the department and the company as a whole Identify opportunities for improvement including tools, processes, employee development and product Establish consistent tracking and reporting of key performance metrics and interpret these metrics into suggestions and recommendations for individual, team and company performance Align “big picture” company initiatives with department goals Develop and maintain clear expectations and drive accountability for your team members Take on projects as needed outside of the scope of day to day responsibilities  Who You Are You have proven experience coaching, developing and inspiring others, creating and executing processes and crushing goals You are a hands-on leader, and have experience closing deals and taking clients through the entire sales cycle yourself You’re an effective, metric-driven leader with a proven track record of success You are detail-oriented and very organized You can analyze, understand and breakdown metrics for improvement purposes You enjoy and thrive in fast-paced, always changing, always growing work environments You’re human (click here to prove you aren’t a bot) You are passionate. Passion is what our industry runs on. Put that first before any sales tactic you’ve ever learned You’re a self-starter, we’re a start-up. Innovation is a requirement and ideas are expected You’ll let us know if you suck at something. We suck at things too At the end of the day, you fully see the reward in this job (hint: it’s not just green) You have 5+ years of solid sales leadership experience under your belt You’ve worked closing deals with small businesses and/or in the health and beauty space You’re a straight shooter who can talk to other straight shooters  Benefits  What we offer Health/Dental/Vision/Commuter Benefits & 401k Service & Training Stipends Awesome (paid) Parental Leave Policy Unlimited Paid Time Off Ample opportunities for professional growth Amazing co-workers Work/Life balance Fun Team Outings (when not in the midst of a global pandemic) Creative and collaborative culture to flourish in

description: The nation’s largest independent alkaline water company, is seeking a Western Regional Sales Manager to manage and drive sales of the company’s bottled water products. This is a tremendous opportunity to join a rapidly growing public company, offering a competitive compensation package including stock options.  The ideal candidate is self-motivated, demonstrates excellent sales and organizational skills, and most importantly is a team player with a “roll-up your sleeves” mentality.  This person should be passionate about leading and managing The Alkaline Water Company’s Western sales channel and want to take it to the next level. The Western Regional Sales Manager will report directly to the Executive Director of National Sales.  Key Responsibilities Manage all brokers, distributors, and retail grocery, drug, club, and mass customers within the Western Region (CA, OR, WA, AZ, NV, and UT) Develop and ensure the execution of regional account strategies for all products and achieve sales, profit, and market share objectives for all regional accounts and/or programs Manage brokers, retail customers, and distributors in the region through the execution and management of sales programs Attend industry trade events (e.g., UNFI/KeHE/Core-Mark/Sysco Shows, Natural Products EXPO, NACS, etc.) towards advancing relationships with existing customers as well as developing new relationships Monitor market/retailer activity to develop the most cost-effective strategies in order to drive volume and profitability through increased penetration and promotion. Use data, objectives, and feedback in order to establish performance goals and gain results Maintain a high level of interaction with key trade customers to ensure customer satisfaction, educate on product line and category developments and trends Responsible for managing/achieving/exceeding regional sales forecast, as well as opening up new key accounts Create sales presentations, as well as develop and manage promotional calendars for all regional accounts Education, Experience, & Requirements BA/BS degree required. MBA is a plus 5+ years sales experience, preferably in the beverage, or CPG industry Strong understanding of The Alkaline Water Company’s business model; grounded in the Company’s purpose and values Knowledge of programs such as Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Word, IRI/Nielsen Data. Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills (verbal/written) Clear and proven ability to develop and implement successful sales and trade marketing strategies. Aptitude for promotional strategy and program scheduling. Experience/knowledge of the retail grocery industry Excellent analytical, and problem solving abilities Able to work independently from home based office, as well as in a team environment Must excel in multi-tasking in a fast paced industry, and organization Must live within the Western territory of the United States Ability to travel extensively; projected at 50% of your time Valid Driver’s License Compensation & Benefits Base salary will be in line with market and experience. Compensation to include competitive salary, bonus and benefits (healthcare, vision, dental, paid vacation), along with stock options. About The Alkaline Water Company  Founded in 2012, The Alkaline Water Company (NASDAQ and CSE: WTER) is headquartered in Scottsdale, Arizona. Its flagship product, Alkaline88®, is a leading premier alkaline water brand available in bulk and single-serve sizes along with eco-friendly aluminum packaging options. With its innovative, state-of-the-art proprietary electrolysis process, Alkaline88® delivers perfect 8.8 pH balanced alkaline drinking water with trace minerals and electrolytes and boasts our trademarked label ‘Clean Beverage.’ Quickly being recognized as a growing lifestyle brand, Alkaline88® launched A88 Infused™ in 2019 to meet consumer demand for flavor-infused products. A88 Infused™ flavored water is available in six unique all-natural flavors.  To purchase Alkaline88® and A88 Flavor Infused products online, visit us at www.alkaline88.com. To learn more about The Alkaline Water Company, please visit www.thealkalinewaterco.com or connect with us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or LinkedIn. description: Sunday Riley Modern Skincare is looking for an experienced Account Executive to join our field team to build our business in the Greater Austin / San Antonio market.   The Account Executive generates & increases in-store sales through relationship building, impactful store visits, training, and events. Success in this role is achieved by positive team morale, team development, strong store relationships, and consistently increasing sales performance in all assigned stores.   The ideal candidate must have strong selling skills, outstanding communication skills, best-in-class customer service, and a passion for learning. All applicants must be a team player and have cosmetics experience.   Key Job Responsibilities:  Sell and educate in stores and manage / coach a team of Retail Sales Specialists to hit and exceed sales goals for the territory  Strategize and maximize personal and team schedules to drive the business. Develop and maximize store visit call cycle for self and direct reports.  Activate corporate-approved education and event initiatives and exceed sales goals  Coach and develop direct reports Develop and build strong relationships with retail partners  Support recruiting, interviewing, and onboarding  Collaborate with Regional Sales Manager to build impactful store-by-store action plans to address store needs and support sales goals regionally  Must have a passion for skincare and the Brand  Work Location:  5-day work week, total of 40 hours. Weekends are required. Monthly travel may be required depending on territory size  It is expected that 32 hours a week will be spent in the field   Other Duties: Please note this is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.  Perks:  Competitive salary  Vacation days  Paid holidays  401k  Life Insurance Health/dental/vision benefits  Physical Demands:  The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.  While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to stand; walk; sit; apply products on clients; reach with hands and arms; climb stairs; talk or hear.   Preferred Qualification and Experience:  Minimum of 3 years of retail, sales and/or beauty industry experience, preferably in the skincare industry at the AE or AC level Memorable, positive, professional, and enthusiastic presence  Strong aptitude for product knowledge, brand messaging, training, and selling  Ability to manage multiple calendars and multi-store visits  Excellent oral, written, and presentation skills; email and phone skills essential  Ability to take strategic direction based on sales and business analysis  Basic computer skills a must- Microsoft Word, Outlook, Excel, Teams, T-Sheets scheduling app  Self-motivated, committed and goal-oriented  Energetic and passionate with an entrepreneurial, flexible spirit  Ability to travel required  Driver’s license a plus (in most cases a necessity)  Flexibility regarding work hours, i.e. weekend  Equal Opportunity Employer:  Sunday Riley actively creates a culture of inclusivity and respects that diversity in the workplace leads to a positive and stronger team. It is our policy to provide equal opportunity for all employees, contractors, and prospective employees, regardless of race, color, national origin, age, pregnancy, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, disability, genetic information, or any other criteria protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

Overview  The District Sales Manager will drive the overall sales plan and implement a game plan that focuses on achieving the sales plan for the current year. The person in this role will work with the local manufacturing rep agency, wholesalers, contractors, engineers and other key influencers to drive sales across all product categories. In addition to sales and margin growth, the District Sales Manager will lead/direct all local sales initiatives that focus on plumber, builder and showroom incentive programs. This position will report to the Regional General Manager and will work closely with projects and key accounts teams, product managers and sales leadership. Meet assigned targets for profitable sales growth and share of wallet for products for prescribed district/ geographic area. Develop, prepare and deliver customer specific sales presentations. Manage, monitor and control the entire sales process life cycle from lead to closing. Develop “pull through” opportunities for all customers. Support development of activities to increase product knowledge to assigned customer(s) account(s). Develop and maintain strategic partnerships with customers at all decision points; liaise with key internal stakeholders to sustain well-regarded customer service and relationships. Own and coordinate the activities that take place at the showroom level: coordinate product training personnel and schedule timing of presentations; coordinate displays and updated changes to display products. Support development of activities to increase product knowledge to assigned customer(s) account(s). Responsible for developing pricing scenarios for local jobs that require competitive pricing. Liaise and engage with marketing and product development to identify trends, marketing intelligence and new product opportunities. Work closely with marketing to support and engage in the development of effective marketing tools to drive demand creation at the customer level. Provide regular internal reporting on business that includes forecasting for financial and demand planning (Supply Chain).  Skills  Financial acumen; Analytical Skills; Ability to build and execute business and development plans; People Management Skills; Empathy Active Listening; Patience, Create a Vision; Agile, Perseverance, Passion, Self-Starter, Good Coach and mentor; Ability to communicate at an Exec level; more hands on, Time management, Follow up, Conflict management, Sales Force, CRM.  Competencies  Strategic Thinker, Analytical, Consumer Centric, Results Driven, Accountable, Adaptable, Learning Oriented, Collaborative, Trustworthy, Courage.  Knowledge & Experience  Experience managing direct and third party reps. description: The primary responsibility of the National Sales Manager is to develop and manage large group business opportunities/accounts, in accordance with thresholds defined by management, that align with the Company’s financial goals, maximize revenues and drive customer loyalty. All duties are to be performed in accordance with department and The Venetian Resort’s policies, practices, and procedures.  Essential Duties & Responsibilities Meet and exceed quotas and financial goals set by Management. Effectively solicit all existing, prospective target accounts and qualify (leads) that meet defined business parameters, resulting in closing contracts through effective contract negotiations that align with meeting Company’s financial objectives, maximize revenues, and drives customer loyalty. Develop and maintain account base of business through outbound efforts and customer relationships which maximizes revenue for Company. Partner with customers to understand their buying process, identify multiple key meeting influencers and roles within the process to effectively cultivate the account. Partner with customers to understand key meeting priorities and effectively position and align properties unique insights and benefits to customer key priorities to close business. Understand the overall market competitors’ strengths and weaknesses, economic trends, supply and demand and how to sell against them.  Accurately forecast and report sales pipeline. Regularly and independently engage with cross-functional departmental leaders and teammates to understand product and services available to Convention groups and how the Hotel differentiates itself from the competitive set. Travel and participate in sales calls, site inspections, entertainment, networking events, training (as assigned) midweek, evenings and weekends as needed. Support other members of the Sales Team as needed. Strong business acumen with keen ability to build and maintain relationships at all business levels. Sell and close sales across various industries and at all levels of business. Independently develop, plan, and implement sales strategies aligned with Company values and objectives which are also appropriate for assigned market. Document all pertinent daily sales activities, cataloging account and client information accurately as defined by department SOP’s. Manage effectively within the defined sales roles, internal sales processes and departmental/Company policies and procedures to evaluate and execute sales contracts. Safety is an essential function of this job. Consistent and regular attendance is an essential function of this job. Performs other related duties as assigned.  Company Standards of Conduct All The Venetian Resort Team Members are expected to conduct and carry themselves in a professional manner at all times. Team Members are required to observe the Company’s standards, work requirements and rules of conduct.  Minimum Qualifications 21 years of age. Proof of authorization/eligibility to work in the United States. High School Diploma or GED required, bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience preferred. Must be able to obtain and maintain Alcohol Awareness card, and any other certification or license, as required by law or policy.  Minimum three years of experience in hotel sales required. Two or more years of experience selling large complex group business, either at property or sales office, preferred. PC proficient in applications such as Microsoft Excel, Access, Word and Power Point. Strong presentation skills, both in virtual and in-person formats Ability to use problem solving and critical thinking skills to build relationships, negotiate, and close sales. Ability to critically and effectively listen and respond to customers. Ability to communicate clearly and effectively in English, both in spoken and written form.  Demonstrated experience: Working with meeting planners within large technology companies to secure large meetings, conferences, and events. Building and maintaining relationships at all levels of busines, including at senior and C-level positions. Selling and closing high-end or luxury property sales, preferred. Meeting and exceeding high-level and aggressive sales goals. Effectively utilizing a variety of sales negotiation, presentation, and communication skills. Successfully planning, developing, and executing sales strategies particular to assigned market areas. Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively with guests and other Team Members of different backgrounds and levels of experience. Ability to work a varied shift, including midweek, evenings and weekends as needed required. Local, regional, and national travel to participate in sales calls, site inspections, entertainment, networking events, training is required.  Must be able to: Physically access all areas of the property and drive areas with or without a reasonable accommodation. Maintain composure under pressure and consistently meet deadlines with internal and external customers and contacts. Ability to interact appropriately and effectively with guests, management, other Team Members, and outside contacts. Ability for prolonged periods of time to walk, stand, stretch, bend and kneel. Work in a fast-paced and busy environment. Work indoors and be exposed to various environmental factors such as, but not limited to, CRT, noise, dust, and cigarette smoke.

description: FreeWire Technologies is seeking a Sales Development Representative (SDR) to join our team. At FreeWire, we fundamentally change the way energy is delivered to electric vehicles. FreeWire’s solutions will evolve from providing just EV charging to a full suite of energy services to accelerate sustainable electrification. We build battery-based energy storage systems that provide clean and quiet power anywhere it’s needed. Our hardware includes an industrial IoT device with integrated sensors and onboard control systems. It is connected to a cloud-based analytics platform and remote-controlled through our customer-facing mobile and web apps. FreeWire has secured major strategic investors from Fortune 100 companies and serves leading corporate, utility and retail customers. To meet our ambitious goals, we are growing rapidly.  We are seeking an extremely motivated individual committed to learning fundamental prospecting, lead qualification and market segmentation skills needed to develop into a top performing sales professional. Key attributes will be exceeding expectations, flexibility in performing tasks, a commitment to organization and documentation, and enthusiasm to do what it takes to get the job done. In this role, you will generate new business opportunities by following a proven process to prospect into business accounts. You are motivated to identify and research lists of companies and contacts to target, and to develop and manage email and telephone campaigns to generate new business.  The SDR will work with the Segment Directors to create and prioritize their target market and is accountable for generating qualified warm leads which they will pass over to the SD to close. The successful candidate will be a self-motivated and driven individual who is goal-oriented, methodical, tenacious, and not afraid of cold calling. This position has advancement potential within the rapidly growing sales organization.  The ideal candidate will possess a desire to develop their professional selling skills and must be a fit for our fun, entrepreneurial, team-based culture. This role is not targeted at an experienced sales rep, rather an individual who is driven to learn and succeed with a great attitude—we will train you on the rest!  Responsibilities: Learn and execute proven processes, including cold calling and email, to generate new sales opportunities Follow up effectively with leads to qualify them and to conduct initial discovery of their requirements Strategize with sales executives and the marketing team to support their prospecting programs with direct outreach Engage executives in targeted prospect accounts Orchestrate discussions with customers around their business needs Discover and engage new prospect accounts and contacts within your assigned territory Leverage CRM tools to prospect into specific geographic territories and sectors Managing inventory on site Placing and fulfilling orders Representing FreeWire at trade shows and events  Qualifications: A commanding desire to learn, grow and succeed in tech sales 1+ years of sales or related demand generation experience in a solution selling based structure Candidates should have one of the following: sales experience or other related business experience. Experience with sales tools – CRM, Email Automation, Prospecting Proficiency with standard corporate productivity tools (Microsoft Office Suite, email, phone skills) The ability to write succinct, crisp emails and have a great phone manner A proven track record of achieving and exceeding assigned targets and personal goals Committed to constant growth. You love learning and improving yourself. Team player. You thrive in an environment where there are many moving pieces and where success is measured for the organization as well as the individual. You are naturally entrepreneurial and highly organized You are a confident and genuine communicator with great listening skills. Energetic, upbeat, tenacious team player with excellent verbal and written communications skills Above all, you must be results driven—you are always looking to achieve great things for yourself and your team!  In the video below, FreeWire’s CEO, CFO, COO, and VP of Sales explain the Boost Charger and the FreeWire vision.  At FreeWire Technologies, we offer fair and equal opportunities to all our candidates and team members regardless of race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual identity, national origin, citizenship, marital status, disability status, parental status protected veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law. FreeWire Technologies believes in hiring individuals only based on their qualifications and experiences that meet our business requirements to fill the positions.  Powered by JazzHR  ly0HpRWNEs

Regional Sales Manager needed to develop the sales of services surrounding biopharmaceutical process equipment. This is a home office based sales position requiring that the candidate must reside in the West Coast region. Expect 40% travel, depending on your location. Could be day trips or flights to customer sites. You will influence decision makers within a customer’s organization. Examples of key functional groups: plant engineering, process engineering, maintenance operations, quality, process development, procurement, etc. The clients – biopharmaceutical manufacturers - are typically in and around San Diego, Los Angles, San Francisco Bay Area, Las Vegas, and Salt Lake City. Summary of Position: OYO is a high growth, disruptive and technology-led business that is transforming the era of the hospitality industry. The Business Development Manager (“BDM”) is OYO’s central sales position, which has as the primary duty the making sales and obtaining orders for OYO’s proprietary suite of services. This work is performed customarily and regularly in the field, including at hotel properties.  Essential Functions: Prospecting and qualifying leads through cold calling, e-mail, and face to face meetings Frequent travel (3 - 4 days per week) within sales territory to hotel properties to meet with property owners, solicit sales and obtain orders for OYO’s proprietary suite of services Drive new revenue by analyzing key market trends and real estate developments in the BDM’s assigned territory, identifying new hotel and hospitality leads through research and relationships, and updating internal software to add quality supply to the pipeline Negotiate deals to close consistent with OYO guidelines, and in a manner that leverages internal resources to create a mutually-profitable business relationship Develop territory plans, establish rapport and form long-term relationships with property owners and other key stakeholders from initial lead generation through sale, transformation, and “go-live” date of property Other duties as assigned  Qualifications: Minimum 3 years of experience in sales or business development, preferably in the hospitality industry Ability to work, cold call, prospect, negotiate, and close deals as an individual contributor Reliable access to a motor vehicle and acceptable driving record; current, valid driver’s license appropriate for the vehicle; insurance appropriate for the vehicle Demonstrated success with structuring and negotiating complex deals, and solving business problems.  Business-savvy with a sales-oriented mindset that will help establish OYO as a key technology-driven hotel network in an ethical manner Successful track record as a self-starter; internally motivated, organized, and disciplined Bachelor’s, Associate, or other post-high school degree, or comparable work experience, preferred Intermediate to Expert proficiency with CRM systems, G Suite and Microsoft Office products including: Docs/Word, Sheets/Excel, Slides/PowerPoint, and other SaaS business tools Knowledge of local hospitality associations and pre established relationships with hotel owners is preferred

Job Description for SDR  Who is Leanplum: Leanplum is a mobile engagement platform that helps forward-looking brands like Electronic Arts, Nordstrom, and TD Bank meet the real-time engagement needs of their customers. Leanplum personalizes the customer journey across all touch points, messaging and product experience alike. We deliver unified experiences that are timely, tested,and relevant, and building the customer loyalty that fuels business growth. Founded in San Francisco, Leanplum has offices across North America, Europe, and Asia, and has received more than $100million in funding from leading Silicon Valley venture capital firms.  Want to learn more about us? Check out this recent video to learn more about who we are: https://youtu.be/-lpE4u9U0QQ  Role Description:  The Sales Development Representative is an individual contributor role and a future member of one of our Sales, Marketing, Customer Success teams etc. Our SDRs will play a valuable role in expanding our presence in the market by discovering, researching and then converting sales conversations into Leanplum Sales opportunities.    The Marketplace:  Mobile is one of the fastest growing sectors in marketing and you will be in the center of one of the fastest growing sectors in the marketplace: Mobile Application Marketing. As the first contact, you will quarterback  key engagements as you find, qualify and then transition  business opportunities to the direct sales team in a competitive and exciting environment.   What Great Looks Like at Leanplum:  You regularly meet or exceed your monthly opportunity generation goals as you define and build your own relationships in-territory. You are comfortable with outbound prospecting and the tools of the trade: Email, Phone, Social Selling, Networking, Meeting Strangers, as well as any sales activity that would contribute to expanding the Leanplum brand.  You partner well with others and are not easily deterred by adversity.  You know your territory better than anyone else, contributing regularly to prospecting, planning and execution within your territory. You are a team player.  You are here to make others better (customer, company, team as well as yourself.) You are detail minded and a great listener. When it comes to activity, your idea of success is more about climbing a mountain than enjoying the campsite at the foot of it.   Who you are::  Adaptable and flexible mentality. Every problem has a solution and you are that person. Analytical thinker with a curious nature  Coachable, inspired to learn and challenge yourself to grow and develop  Strong organizational and time management skills Must be able to work in Denver Metropolitan Area, CO  Must have 1+ years of experience Must have experience outbounding and researching leads  Preferred Qualifications:Experience working in Salesforce.com and Outreach.io  Responsibilities: Remain promotable at all times Manage daily strategy of outbound emails and calls to targeted accounts Develop targeted account lists and research company goals (competitor goals?) Personalize outreach strategy to persona and industry Qualify customers based on our model for success Schedule value driven meetings for our Account Executives  Collaborate with Sales and Marketing to support successful campaigns  Other duties may be assigned as needed.

Develop and implement sales tactics to generate prospects’ interest and discovery conversations leading to new pipeline development (targeting, message templates, campaigns, etc.) Leverage systems and tools to increase efficiency and productivity  Requirements: Bachelor degree required 3+ years of inside sales or sales development experience in food catering industry Working experience at Doordash, Eat Club, ezCater, ZeroCater, Sweetgreen, etc is a plus   Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high-intensity start up environment Self-starter, results oriented with strong analytical and managerial skills Knowledge and experience with using a CRM and SDR productivity tools

Description  AWS is seeking a world class sales professional to manage our global customer relationship with one of the largest companies in the world.  The Global Account Manager will be responsible for providing global business leadership and management of this global account. You will build and maintain key relationships, develop and manage opportunities, monitor deployment projects and engage virtual resources. You will define a CXO relationship strategy within the account, including engaging with AWS senior leadership team for executive sponsorships, coordinating executive business reviews and maintain customer satisfaction.  Responsibilities  The Global Account Manager is responsible for teaming with the customer’s IT Organization to build strategic relationships across the account, articulating a clear vision and generating enthusiasm, while impacting all business groups. The rep is responsible for selling at the most strategic level within the account and implementing a broad strategy for earning customer acceptance and service implementation. The rep will work with all appropriate AWS resources (Executives, Solution Architects, Business Development, Marketing, Partners, Support, Service teams and Professional Services) to support customer interests. This includes dotted line responsibility for downstream sales and technical resources that may be geographically distributed.  Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.  Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.  Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.  Development of formal case studies and other forms of references highlighting activity and workloads running on AWS is core to the role.  This position is based in Atlanta, GA   Basic Qualifications  A bachelor's degree in business or technology or equivalent work experience.  The candidate must have 15+ years experience working with a large Global organization as lead and Relationship Manager. Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication, analytical and presentation skills are required. Candidate must possess demonstrated decision making, problem solving, and negotiating skills.   Preferred Qualifications  Experience as the primary account manager for a global federated enterprise working with multiple business units and influencing governance and policy is a plus. A BA or BS degree in computer science, engineering, business, marketing, or related field (MBA preferred) and a minimum of 15+ years of enterprise selling experience in large global accounts. Other experiences to include: experience in large complex deal negotiations with a successful track record; ability to navigate across AWS and the customer in a trusted advisor/consultative approach; and, establishing credibility quickly with senior level executives across the organizations.  A strong understanding of AWS and/or technology as a service (Iaas, SaaS, PaaS) would be preferred but not required.  Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.   Company - Amazon Web Services, Inc.  Job ID: A1742540

Description  Amazon Advertising operates at the intersection of advertising and ecommerce, and offers advertisers a rich array of media solutions across Amazon’s mobile and desktop websites, proprietary devices including kindle and Fire TV, and the Amazon Programmatic Demand Side Platform. We are looking for a highly motivated Account Manager who is passionate about helping our advertisers make effective, analytically driven marketing decisions.  As an Account Manager, you are someone with strong analytical reasoning and problem solving skills. You not only dive deep into data to understand trends, you clearly communicate the “why” behind results and make actionable recommendations to internal and external partners. You are strategic in your use of Amazon’s proprietary data and can provide personalized campaign and targeting recommendations that meet your customer’s business goals. You thrive in ambiguous situations and are a self-starter who can find solutions without guidance.  This role is highly collaborative, working across Creative, Sales, Product, Retail, and External Teams. The Account Manager’s strategic and consultative digital expertise is considered critical to unlocking greater value and impact for our advertisers.  Responsibilities Become a knowledgeable partner on Amazon Advertising solutions Develop annual brand and media strategies for growth based on overall advertiser goals/objectives Develop campaign strategies and audience targeting recommendations per brand and product line Evaluate KPIs and optimize campaign performance using a data driven approach Perform in-depth data analysis to deliver actionable insights & recommendations that influence short term / long term digital media strategy Educate advertisers on performance metrics, insights, and how to achieve greater results on Amazon Work cross-functionally with sales and other Amazon partners to drive incremental revenue and increase advertiser satisfaction  Basic Qualifications Bachelor's degree required 5+ years experience in digital advertising, product marketing, consulting, business development, and/or other customer facing roles Experience with digital media/marketing strategy, data analysis and data analytics & visualization Success in optimizing products and services based on client needs Strong Proficiency in Microsoft Excel Demonstrated success working with cross-functional teams and building strong relationships internally and externally Preferred Qualifications Bachelors’ degree in Economics, Marketing, Advertising, Statistics, Engineering or Business; MBA is a plus Experience in digital or hospitality marketing Experience in Omni-channel Marketing, display, online video, or over-the-top (OTT) Media planning capabilities Adept at solving problems that span business and technology Influence process improvement that scales broadly; inventing and simplifying within existing processes Excellent organizational, interpersonal, and communication (written and verbal) skills Open to hiring in multiple locations  Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. Company Description  Square builds common business tools in unconventional ways so more people can start, run, and grow their businesses. When Square started, it was difficult and expensive (or just plain impossible) for some businesses to take credit cards. Square made credit card payments possible for all by turning a mobile phone into a credit card reader. Since then Square has been building an entire business toolkit of both hardware and software products including Square Capital, Square Terminal, Square Payroll, and more. We’re working to find new and better ways to help businesses succeed on their own terms—and we’re looking for people like you to help shape tomorrow at Square.  Job Description  Square is seeking a data-driven self-starter with strong sales & marketing skills to join our team as Sales Growth Program Manager. Our ideal candidate has a deep understanding of the power of data-driven decision making, and has a proven track record of using technology, process optimization and cross-functional collaboration to drive transformational improvements in top of funnel sales growth and efficiency.  In this role, you will be responsible for influencing the top of the funnel build for the sales team, tracking leads through the funnel, defining the processes for follow up, tracking and reporting on key metrics like lead conversion rates and other sales success metrics. You will encompass a mindset of iteration and experimentation, you will be proactive with communication to ensure the sales lead growth and optimization function delivers results. You will report to the Head of Sales Strategy and partner with senior sales leadership and our cross functional teams to identify opportunities and make things happen.  You Will Work closely with cross functional GTM teams to build ToF for the sales team that is correlated with profit and future product updates, using data-driven insights and decision making. Organize and establish best practices for sales lead generation operations for the Sales organization through strong partnerships with our cross functional GTM teams. Create and influence new avenues for lead capture like web chat tools and/or booking features on the public web. Through analyzing our data, constantly track new and innovative ways to capture and convert prospective customers and evangelize our learnings through thought leadership activities. Analyze and present findings as they relate the global pipeline build and related sales lead channels and their current and future states (for both inbound and outbound targeting). Develop and constantly iterate on a testing plan designed to identify incremental improvements - establish and track KPIs and leading indicators as part of these tests. You Have  Qualifications 5+ years of generating and driving demand for sales BA/BS Degree Experience with Marketo, Salesforce, and 3rd party lead partners, web chat tools, etc. Understanding of full lifecycle marketing, demand generation, and sales inbound leads Proven ability to work with and influence cross-functional teams and departments in a rapidly growing environment Experience working with multi-channel inbound engagement strategies that include implementation, tracking, and process improvement. Proven ability to communicate and manage relationships with senior executives Strong strategic planning and execution skills Strong analytical skills and a structured approach to solving unique business problems Excellent interpersonal, leadership, organizational, and communication skills Nice To Have Advanced proficiency in SQL and Excel Advanced proficiency in Looker Experience in high transaction volume SaaS application or financial services sales Additional Information  We’re working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace. Square is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.  We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible.  Additionally, we consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment on our team, assessing candidates in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.  Perks  We want you to be well and thrive. (NYSE: SQ) builds tools to empower businesses and individuals to participate in the economy. Sellers use Square to reach buyers online and in person, manage their business, and access financing. description: The Strategic Account Manager will lead the National/Regional Chain off premise account activity in an effort to maximize sales opportunities within their strategic area of responsibility. He/she will oversee all sales and marketing activities including strategic planning, program development and management of execution of programming. The Strategic Account Manager will work collaboratively with Regional Sales within Proximo, Marketing Teams within Proximo, and National/Regional Sales within the Distributor Network, to deliver sales and profit goals.  Role & Responsibilities Build and develop strong working relationships with Chain Strategic Account “decision makers” and their teams Develop channel/customer specific marketing/sales programs to help achieve Proximo/customer profit, sales goals an to secure feature ads and display planner activity Analyze depletion and consumption trends to manage sales goals Develop appropriate call frequency on all National/Regional Accounts, Distributor Sales teams, and Regional Proximo Sales teams to ensure maximization of customer/market intelligence Direct/attend Distributor meetings (Planning/Kick-off/etc.) Oversee day to day shelf management initiatives within the Off-Premise Chain marketplace including pricing, distribution, programming Work with distributor management to oversee market conditions Work closely with Marketing Team to develop sales/marketing opportunities that are consistent with Brand Plans and National/Regional Customer strategies Become expert on Regional pricing strategies of Proximo brands Develop keen understanding of competitive Spirit brands pricing and marketing strategies Understand National/Regional Customer gross profit margins to develop customer specific pricing strategies Monitor and communicate Retail Pricing monthly for specified area of responsibility Strong understanding of distribution, shelf positioning, feature advertising activities, and feature displays in each National/Regional Account Manage Tactical Brand and Travel and Entertainment Budgets appropriately as directed Analyze impact of Key programs and evaluate them for their effectiveness and build on successful programs Develop beverage alcohol insights to advise and inform team on strategies that drive volume and profit growth Broad understanding of marketplace dynamics, including chain, independents On & Off, Regional Chain Accounts Track & manage accurate planning and programming calendars for strategic account responsibility. Develop an understanding of category analytics to enhance “decision maker” presentations and distributor engagement   Key Competencies Analytical--Synthesizes complex or diverse information; Collects and researches data; Uses intuition and experience to complement data; Designs work flows and procedures. Problem Solving--Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; Gathers and analyzes information skillfully; Develops alternative solutions; Works well in group problem solving situations; Business Acumen--Understands business implications of decisions; Displays orientation to profitability; Demonstrates knowledge of market and competition; Aligns work with strategic goals. Initiative--Volunteers readily; Undertakes self-development activities; Seeks increased responsibilities; Takes independent actions and calculated risks; Looks for and takes advantage of opportunities; Asks for and offers help when needed. Oral Communication--Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations; Listens and gets clarification; Responds well to questions; Demonstrates group presentation skills; Participates in meetings. Written Communication--Writes clearly and informatively; Edits work for spelling and grammar; Varies writing style to meet needs; Presents numerical data effectively; Able to read and interpret written information. Project Management--Develops project plans; Coordinates projects; Communicates changes and progress; Completes projects on time and budget.  Knowledge and Experience Bachelor’s degree preferred 5+ years’ relevant experience in the consumer goods industry, spirits experience and/or 3 -tier distribution experience preferred. National Account call responsibility experience preferred Demonstrated sales management abilities with proven success in delivering sales goals and objectives Ability to build and maintain strategic working relationships with distributors and accounts Knowledge of industry regulations, market trends and competition Proven team leadership Strong interpersonal, influencing, negotiation, time management and presentation skills required Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office Must have a valid state drivers license.

description: Area Sales Manager  JOB DESCRIPTION: Signing Day Sports, a rapidly growing sports technology application in the recruitment platform space, seeks an Area Sales Manager.  COMPANY PROFILE: at Signing Day Sports, our mission is to empower all athletes and coaches to build connections between them by providing recruitment tools and guidance. Founded in 2020, we aspire to create a community using proprietary and world-class technology that provides every athlete and coach in the world maximum exposure.  OUR MARKET POSITION: Signing Day Sports is the most holistic and forward-thinking college recruitment platform available. Our world-class technology is trusted by coaches and recruiters as a tool to take the guesswork out of the recruiting process and allow coaches to dial into the specific needs of their unique program. It allows athletes to form valuable relationships by capturing video verified data and pertinent information coaches are looking for in real time. Currently, we have launched football, baseball, softball and are launching soccer and basketball in the near future.  Position Summary: The Area Sales Manager must have a positive attitude and a passion for sales and delivering effective service to all customers. The Area Sales Manager position reports to the VP of Sales and is a member of the Signing Day Sports Sales Team. This position will be remote and will be responsible for pre- and post-sales support, building and maintaining customer relationships, organizing and maintaining Salesforce CRM, ability to work closely with club, high school, and collegiate coaches, and providing overall customer satisfaction.  Responsibilities Prospect and qualify new sales leads Schedule meetings and presentations with prospects (club, high school, collegiate coaches); both in-person and remotely Create, plan, and deliver presentations on Signing Day Sports’ products Maintain a well-developed pipeline of prospects Develop strong, ongoing relationships with prospects and customers Meet and/or exceed sales quotas Coordinate with other team members and departments to optimize the sales effort Works collaboratively with sales team members Communicates a clear and thorough understanding of the organization’s products, offerings, and policies Keeps clear and meticulous records of customer interactions through Salesforce - the organization’s Customer Relations Management (CRM) tool Collaborates with multiple program teams to stay informed of all new and ongoing developments and projects Requirements Minimum of 3 years of successful experience in sales Ability to thrive in a results-driven environment Self-motivated with excellent creative and proactive problem-solving skills Incomparable people skills (especially with coaches) with ability to handle difficult situations with poise Flexibility in adapting to the growing and changing needs of the organization Ability to efficiently multitask in a fast-paced environment Detail oriented Excellent verbal and written communication skills Key relationships with sports teams, coaches, athletic directors, and athletic programs within a specific territory Willingness to learn about company products and policies to better assist customers Proficient skills in Microsoft Office Suite, specifically in: Word, Excel, and PowerPoint Experience with Salesforce preferred, but not required Details Full-time Excellent benefits package A resume is required to be considered for this position.  If selected for a role within the company, a background check will be required.  Signing Day Sports is an equal opportunity employer. We will extend equal opportunity to all individuals without regard to race, religion, color, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity), national origin, disability, age, genetic information, or any other status protected under applicable federal, state, or local laws. Our policy reflects and affirms the organization’s commitment to the principles of fair employment and the elimination of all discriminatory practices.  Employment Type: Full Time  Years Experience: 1 - 3 years  Bonus/Commission: No

Summary of Position: OYO is a high growth, disruptive and technology-led business that is transforming the era of the hospitality industry. The Business Development Manager (“BDM”) is OYO’s central sales position, which has as the primary duty the making sales and obtaining orders for OYO’s proprietary suite of services. This work is performed customarily and regularly in the field, including at hotel properties.  Essential Functions: Prospecting and qualifying leads through cold calling, e-mail, and face to face meetings Frequent travel (3 - 4 days per week) within sales territory to hotel properties to meet with property owners, solicit sales and obtain orders for OYO’s proprietary suite of services Drive new revenue by analyzing key market trends and real estate developments in the BDM’s assigned territory, identifying new hotel and hospitality leads through research and relationships, and updating internal software to add quality supply to the pipeline Negotiate deals to close consistent with OYO guidelines, and in a manner that leverages internal resources to create a mutually-profitable business relationship Develop territory plans, establish rapport and form long-term relationships with property owners and other key stakeholders from initial lead generation through sale, transformation, and “go-live” date of property Other duties as assigned  Qualifications: Minimum 3 years of experience in sales or business development, preferably in the hospitality industry Ability to work, cold call, prospect, negotiate, and close deals as an individual contributor Reliable access to a motor vehicle and acceptable driving record; current, valid driver’s license appropriate for the vehicle; insurance appropriate for the vehicle Demonstrated success with structuring and negotiating complex deals, and solving business problems.  Business-savvy with a sales-oriented mindset that will help establish OYO as a key technology-driven hotel network in an ethical manner Successful track record as a self-starter; internally motivated, organized, and disciplined Bachelor’s, Associate, or other post-high school degree, or comparable work experience, preferred Intermediate to Expert proficiency with CRM systems, G Suite and Microsoft Office products including: Docs/Word, Sheets/Excel, Slides/PowerPoint, and other SaaS business tools Knowledge of local hospitality associations and pre established relationships with hotel owners is preferred

Sales Development Representative Remote - US Based  Argyle is a remote-first, Series A fast-growing tech startup that has reimagined how we can use employment data.  Renting an apartment, buying a car, refinancing a home, applying for a loan. The first question that they will ask you is, "how do you earn your money?" Wouldn’t you think that information foundational to our society would be simple to manage, transfer and control? Well, it’s not!  Argyle provides businesses with a single global access point to employment data. Any company can process work verifications, gain real-time transparency into earnings and view worker profile details.  We are a fun and passionate group of people working remotely across 19 different countries and counting. We are now looking for a Business Development Representative to join our Growth team. Given team size and rapid company growth, Business Development Representatives will have the opportunity for meaningful professional growth and career progression.  The Growth team at Argyle combines product, technical, and industry knowledge to help our customers build amazing products and better businesses. We believe that there is incredible value in harnessing payroll information for consumers and clients alike, and we help create and implement solutions for our clients to leverage that data.  You are a driven individual, excited to grow the business rapidly through creative, well-executed outbound strategies. You will build, refine, and execute the outbound sales process & strategy, driving critical top of funnel opportunities for Argyle.  What will you do?  Identify high-potential strategic and enterprise prospects and new verticals, developing and executing outbound strategies to bring them to Argyle Develop creative strategies for targeting decision makers at prospect accounts Lead and test outbound cross-channel campaigns to drive top of funnel pipeline Craft and codify best practices and sales workflows for automated and high touch outbound campaigns Work with cross-functional teams like Marketing and Product to develop sales enablement and product content.  Requirements  1-3 years of work experience, preferably in customer facing roles and/or technology Superior verbal and written communication skills Desire to develop product expertise and evangelize Argyle’s mission & value proposition to drive sales growth Strong interest in technology and financial services; intellectually curious Proficiency in using Salesforce and/or other CRMs Self starter who is able to define and manage their own workstreams  Why Argyle?  Remote first company International environment Flexible working hours Stock Options Flexible vacation leave $1000 after a month of employment to set up your home office. MacBook  Argyle embraces diversity and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We believe the more inclusive we are, the better our company will be.

jobTitle: Sales Development Manager - Olive Helps (Open to Remote)
description: Description  Olive’s AI workforce is built to fix our broken healthcare system by addressing healthcare’s most burdensome issues -- delivering hospitals and health systems increased revenue, reduced costs, and increased capacity. People feel lost in the system today and healthcare employees are essentially working in the dark due to outdated technology that creates a lack of shared knowledge and siloed data. Olive is designed to drive connections, shining a new light on the broken healthcare processes that stand between providers and patient care. She uses AI to reveal life-changing insights that make healthcare more efficient, affordable and effective. Olive’s vision is to unleash a trillion dollars of hidden potential within healthcare by connecting its disconnected systems. Olive is improving healthcare operations today, so everyone can benefit from a healthier industry tomorrow.  Through a lightweight desktop application, Olive Helps whisper real-time information to healthcare workers, and she drives them directly to the task-specific intelligence they need. Olive Helps improve efficiency and decisions, increases human ROI and reduces human error. Olive Helps  This innovative new offering turns human workers into superhuman workers by eliminating the divide between work and wisdom. The Olive Helps platform helps improve accuracy and efficiency while reducing avoidable mistakes. Olive Helps provides relevant, contextual information that is evoked by a human worker’s activity and coexists in their work environment with a seamless augmented reality application.  SDMs go through a hands-on training program to prepare for implementing effective sales development programs and managing several sales development representatives. You bring a unique combination of sales development knowledge and experience to proactively guide, mentor, encourage, motivate and nurture a team of sales professionals.  Responsibilities Knowledge transfer & product training, prospecting strategy & campaign creation, Salesforce/CRM build-out, list sourcing Creating reports and dashboards using CRM and other tools to support the SDR process Meeting with & training Sales Development Reps (SDR) consistently Managing SDR KPIs Ability to work cross functionally to ensure SDRs onboard successfully Ensure SDRs are well versed on all business units - upsell opportunities Reporting weekly and quarterly on project status and providing real-time updates on progress - what’s working and where do we need to pivot Identify trends in the healthcare industry as it relates to outreach and call volume Interacting with both sales and growth programs marketing Report to and collaborate with Sr. Director of Growth Programs to ensure retention Requirements Strong written and verbal communication skills Strategic thinker, organized, and detail-oriented Bachelor’s degree, preferably in a business-related field Experience in Sales Development management in the technology / healthcare space is preferred Hands-on experience working within Salesforce.com At Olive, we're committed to growing and empowering an inclusive community within our company and industry. This is why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of the best and brightest from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives across our organization. Research shows that oftentimes women and other minority groups only apply to open roles if they meet 100% of the listed criteria. Olive encourages everyone — including women, people of color, individuals with disabilities and those in the LGBTQIA+ community — to apply for our available positions, even if they don't necessarily check every box on the job description.  Disclaimer  This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change or new ones may be assigned.  This job description does not constitute a contract of employment and Olive AI, Inc. may exercise its employment-at-will rights at any time.

Job Category Sales Job Details  About Salesforce  Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. The company was founded on three disruptive ideas: a new technology model in cloud computing, a pay-as-you-go business model, and a new integrated corporate philanthropy model. These founding principles have taken our company to great heights, including being named one of Forbes’s “World’s Most Innovative Company” seven years in a row and #1 on the FORTUNE ‘100 Best Companies to Work For®’ List. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, and this level of growth equals incredible opportunities to grow a career at Salesforce. Together, with our whole Ohana (Hawaiian for "family") made up of our employees, customers, partners and communities, we are working to improve the state of the world.  About Slack Business Unit  Slack has transformed business communication. It’s the leading channel-based collaboration platform, used by millions to align their teams, unify their systems, and drive their businesses forward. Only Slack offers a secure, enterprise-grade environment that can scale with the largest companies in the world. It is a new layer of the business technology stack where people can work together more effectively, connect all their other software tools and services, and find the information they need to do their best work. Slack is where work happens. business with customers Provide recommendations based on a customer’s business needs and usage patterns Handle inbound customer communication and organize/escalate issues appropriately including: billing, legal, security, and technical inquiries Collaborate and work with different members of the Accounts team (Technical Account Managers, Customer Success Managers, Leadership, etc.) to build strategic adoption plans for customers Educate customers on the value of Slack in a thoughtful way Serve as the voice of the customer and collect feedback to drive continuous improvement across all areas including product  You will do this by:  Partnering with internal resources in order to drive additional value and expertise Educating customers on the value of our products in a consultative way Generating pipeline that leads to closed revenue and quota attainment Selling on value and return on investment vs. technical functionality Building credibility and trust while influencing buying decisions Uncovering business initiatives and pain points to map back our solutions across multiple lines of business Creating demand by uncovering business problems and matching them to our solution Having a deep understanding of the way businesses operate, and the priorities that drive decisions from the C-level  What you should have:  5+ years of full cycle SaaS closing experience Experience selling SaaS software that can be used across multiple departments, preferably company-wide Experience engaging multiple stakeholders throughout the sales cycle including Legal, IT, Security, Finance, and Procurement Experience (and enjoy!) collaborating with internal sales teams like Solutions Engineers and Custom Success Managers Experience creating global engagement across multiple lines of business and broadening product support within an organization You are an expert storyteller, effectively developing relationships with senior managers and the C-suite You love traveling and have the ability to travel 20-30% of the time  Our investment in you:  World class enablement and on-demand training - check out Trailhead.com for a sneak peek! Sandler Sales Training Week-long product bootcamp Fast Ramp mentorship program Weekly 1:1 coaching with your leadership Clear path to promotion with accelerated leadership development programs Exposure to executive thought leaders with a passion for living our values Accommodations  If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .  Posting Statement  At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Candidate(s) will report to VP of Sales & Merchandising; work alongside existing team of sales reps.
