Attend Trade shows as needed to support current accounts and acquire new key accounts.  Assist in all aspects of customer support including on-site visits, clinics, online education, etc  Complete proper research and planning to establish new relationships, open new key accounts, and provide the proper support and service to prepare these accounts for success.  Attain knowledge of Glyder’s history as a brand and our mission, and successfully communicate this message to all accounts and prospective accounts  Attain expertise in our fabrics, price points and catalog of 200+ revolving styles and successfully communicate the unique qualities of our products and wholesale services we offer  Work with marketing team to develop and execute new sales initiatives, promotions, etc  Develop strong, effective relationships with internal & external partners  Make effective and persuasive presentations to large and small groups.  Schedule, organize and conduct key account meetings seasonally to present key initiatives, present our marketing plan, and establish the buy for the season.  Evaluate the performance of competition and implement sales tools and initiatives to increase Glyder’s market share.  Job Requirements  Minimum 5+ years of experience in a similar role.  Extensive experience selling apparel and more specifically active apparel will be highly regarded  Extensive Experience In The Sporting Goods Channel Is Preferred  Strong problem-solving, analytical and qualitative abilities.  Ability to influence at all levels within the organizations and work effectively with cross-functional teams.  Track record in delivering sales results through creative programmatic selling.  Demonstrated understanding of basic retail math and analytics  Demonstrated ability to build strategic business partnerships.  Ability to effectively present strategic concepts, as well as products.  Exceptional organizational skills and follow through.  Effective time management, planning and prioritizing skills.  Strong understanding of excel, sales analysis, reporting and forecasting required.  Ability to travel as required to build relationships and meet the needs of our key accounts.  Qualificatons  Successful candidates are goal-oriented, outgoing, motivated, persuasive, able to multi-task and possess a desire to learn.  Must have ability to work well both independently and as part of a team  High School Diploma (required)  Bachelor's Degree- Business (preferred)  Retail Experience (required)  Experience with e -commerce /retail (a plus)  What Glyder Offers You  Salary and performance based annual bonus.  401(k) / profit sharing  Medical Insurance  Hybrid workplace allowing employees to mix in office and home-based work (based on job functions and business needs)  Paid holidays  Employee/ Family discounts  Career advancement opportunities with a growing brand.  Be part of a growing brand!  Glyder provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (gender), age, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, medical condition, genetic information, sexual orientation, or any other category protected by federal, state, or local laws. description: Meriplex is a managed IT and SD-WAN solutions provider specializing in intelligent networks, cybersecurity, cloud communications and managed services for the enterprise market. Using a collaborative approach, we provide pioneering, secure and reliable solutions customized to advance business growth.  Meriplex has leadership growth opening within our Sales team. We are looking for a candidate interested in joining an established organic and heavy acquisition growth team to drive value across our portfolio to include MSP, MSSP, telecommunication and other (XaaS) IT solutions to our new customers. The Vice President of Business Development will lead Meriplex business development team and New Logo Acquisition strategy to achieve revenue goals and expand Meriplex’ s client base nationwide. The Vice President Business Development will be accountable for the development of a robust pipeline of new logos and the management of the full sales process, including target market development, prospecting, corporate presentations, and supporting deal closure while continuously driving significant revenue growth. This role provides the strategic thought leadership for national expansion leveraging all possible venues including our strategic Alliance and Partners, Business Association, Private Equity Partners and leads referrals.  This role is also accountable for the Business Development KPIs essential to sales force productivity, including planning, reporting, quota setting and management, sales training and administration. The individual will utilize their network to introduce new prospects and strategic partners, provide input into strategic initiatives for market differentiation, and drive new logo/solution revenue growth. The individual collaborates with Sales leaders and operations leadership across Meriplex to ensure all new business prospects fall within the scope of services. The successful candidate in this role will be one that trives in a demanding, fast paced, high-growth organization. This is a highly visible role that will be a critical element of the setting ourselves up for continued long-term success in the Managed IT, Cyber Security, SDWAN, and Physical Security markets.  This role is based in Houston or Plano/Dallas where Meriplex currently holds physical offices. This role will report to the SVP, Sales - the Department Leader and have operational support based out of Houston and Dallas. Direct reports will be in Anaheim, Dallas, Houston, Sacramento and remote. description: Description  Amazon Advertising operates at the intersection of advertising and ecommerce, and offers advertisers a rich array of media solutions across Amazon’s mobile and desktop websites, proprietary devices including kindle and Fire TV, and the Amazon Programmatic Demand Side Platform. We are looking for a highly motivated Account Manager who is passionate about helping our advertisers make effective, analytically driven marketing decisions.  As an Account Manager, you are someone with strong analytical reasoning and problem solving skills. You not only dive deep into data to understand trends, you clearly communicate the “why” behind results and make actionable recommendations to internal and external partners. You are strategic in your use of Amazon’s proprietary data and can provide personalized campaign and targeting recommendations that meet your customer’s business goals. You thrive in ambiguous situations and are a self-starter who can find solutions without guidance.  This role is highly collaborative, working across Creative, Sales, Product, Retail, and External Teams. The Account Manager’s strategic and consultative digital expertise is considered critical to unlocking greater value and impact for our advertisers.  Responsibilities Become a knowledgeable partner on Amazon Advertising solutions Develop annual brand and media strategies for growth based on overall advertiser goals/objectives Develop campaign strategies and audience targeting recommendations per brand and product line Evaluate KPIs and optimize campaign performance using a data driven approach Perform in-depth data analysis to deliver actionable insights & recommendations that influence short term / long term digital media strategy Educate advertisers on performance metrics, insights, and how to achieve greater results on Amazon Work cross-functionally with sales and other Amazon partners to drive incremental revenue and increase advertiser satisfaction  Basic Qualifications  5+ years experience in digital advertising, product marketing, consulting, business development, and/or other customer facing roles 5+ years experience with digital media/marketing strategy, data analysis and data analytics & visualization Media planning & brand planning capabilities Success in optimizing products and services based on client needs Strong Proficiency in Microsoft Excel Demonstrated success working with cross-functional teams and building strong relationships internally and externally Preferred Qualifications Bachelors’ degree in Economics, Marketing, Advertising, Statistics, Engineering or Business; MBA is a plus Experience in digital or hospitality marketing Experience in Omni-channel Marketing, display, online video, or over-the-top (OTT) Media planning capabilities Adept at solving problems that span business and technology Influence process improvement that scales broadly; inventing and simplifying within existing processes Excellent organizational, interpersonal, and communication (written and verbal) skills Open to hiring in multiple locations  Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.   Company - Amazon Advertising LLC  Job ID: A1746758

description: Account Executive  Company Overview Bardy Diagnostics, Inc. (“BardyDx”) is an innovator in digital health and remote patient monitoring, with a focus on providing the most diagnostically accurate and patient-friendly cardiac and vital signs patch monitors in the industry. Currently, BardyDx has FDA 510(k) clearance and CE Mark approval to market the Carnation Ambulatory Monitor (CAM) Patch and is presently launched in the U.S. and multiple international countries with over 60,000 patients helped already.  Position Overview & Purpose Bardy Diagnostics is building a team of passionate people who share an entrepreneurial spirit and are dedicated to making a difference in advancing patient care. It is our desire to create a “family – like” culture among the commercial team and across the company as we continue to build the team and grow. Currently, we are looking for Account Executives to join our Sales Team who are passionate about digital health and helping cardiac patients through our innovative remote patient monitoring body sensor technologies. The right individuals will join a dynamic and fast paced start-up environment and work with cross-functional teams to raise awareness about BardyDx and our innovative CAM Patch, and to drive market adoption of the CAM Patch as the new standard of care in cardiac monitoring. Ideal candidates will have a combination of medical sales (ideally with a focus on Cardiology or EP) and B2B sales experience, with some start-up or small company experience preferred. The ability to deal with adversity, and to quickly adapt new sales strategies as market conditions change, are ideal traits for this position.  Core Job Functions & Responsibilities • Develop and implement a territory business plan and sales strategy • Increase revenue in assigned territory by promoting BardyDx’s Core products and services • Develop relationships with Electrophysiologists, Cardiologists, Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Neurologists and Emergency Medicine Physicians to drive increased adoption of products & services • Develop and maintain relationships with physicians, office staff, and practice/hospital administration • Spend 80% of your time in the assigned territory promoting the company’s products and services • Gain a deep understanding of customer needs, determine ways to improve the overall customer experience, and generate new sales and marketing tactics that grow market share, and drive growth • Manage your business ethically and stay within company budget guidelines with business expenses • Train staff, physicians and administration on the proper usage and billing codes for our products & services • Perform other duties as assigned or required  Required Experience & Skills • Bachelor’s degree with a combination of successful medical sales (ideally with a focus on Cardiology or Electrophysiology) and B2B sales experience is the ideal target background experience • Previous Cardiology or Electrophysiology Sales experience preferred • Previous Medical Device or Diagnostic Services Sales experience strongly preferred • Previous Cardiac Monitoring or Cardiology preferred • Experience selling to hospitals, including Emergency Departments, is strongly preferred, but not required • Some start-up or small company experience preferred (ability to deal with adversity, to execute with limited resources, and to quickly adapt new sales strategies as market conditions change)

We are looking for an Account Manager, Enterprise to join our Inside Sales and Customer Success team. Snap Raise Account Managers are empowered to make a critical impact on the future growth of our business. The Account Manager is responsible for ensuring a positive customer experience by being the primary point of contact for key decision makers. This will be done via leading the onboarding process of customers handed off by our Sales team and managing the ongoing customer relationship post-onboarding. Responsibilities include daily management of relationships, upselling, cross-selling, and managing renewals. Candidates will provide best-in-class support for key decision makers, and Snap employees.  A successful candidate is self-motivated, dependable, well-organized, and adaptable with excellent time management skills. Since a majority of this role’s communication with key decision makers and the Snap Team is done via email and phone; excellent communication skills are a must! A “can-do” attitude is required, and the individual must thrive in a fast-paced, energetic work environment. We now utilize those skills and tools to provide best-in-class service to our group leaders in a variety of channels.  This is a full-time, remote position.  Account Manager, Enterprise Sales Responsibilities: Cultivate and maintain strong relationships as the primary point of contact for key decision makers. Learn about their unique challenges and provide proactive and mutually beneficial sales solutions to help their programs succeed. This is measured by: product adoption rates post-onboarding, upsells, cross-sells, and renewal rates. Utilize tools within our Snap Raise platform to set groups up for success. Partner with Account Executives to ensure the on-boarding experience is smooth and painless for the customer. Review accounts proactively for renewal and upsells opportunities Practice a will to win mindset and maintain a commitment to teamwork, accountability, and a constant desire to beat your own best. Build a weekly plan of action and hold yourself accountable to that schedule. Be flexible in your business hours to support key decision makers, especially in instances of seasonality volume increases and differences in time zones.  What we are looking for in the Account Manager, Enterprise Sales: A self-starter mentality and competitive by nature with a proven ability to meet and exceed goals Must be an expert communicator with the ability to present complex ideas in a way that anyone can understand -- both verbally and in writing. Experience in the Fintech industry is strongly preferred Builds credibility and trust with customers Proven success in meeting quotas in a goal-driven, fast paced sales environment Strong organizational and time management skills, ability to work independently Two-three years of experience in sales or customer service in a customer centric environment Coachable and eager to ask questions, receive feedback, and refine your skill set Experience working with HubSpot or alternative CRM preferred Bachelor’s Degree preferred  About Snap Raise:  We are an organization built on the fundamentals and principles largely learned early in life through the sports and activities we participated in while attending school. We now utilize those skills and tools to give back to Coaches and Group Leaders who are focused on helping the next generation through athletics and extracurricular activities.  Snap Raise is proud to offer the following benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision 401K with a 4% match from the company 12 paid holidays Flex Birthday day off Monthly Wellness Classes (virtually!) description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.  Job Category Sales Job Details  About Salesforce  Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. The company was founded on three disruptive ideas: a new technology model in cloud computing, a pay-as-you-go business model, and a new integrated corporate philanthropy model. These founding principles have taken our company to great heights, including being named one of Forbes’s “World’s Most Innovative Company” seven years in a row and #1 on the FORTUNE ‘100 Best Companies to Work For®’ List. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, and this level of growth equals incredible opportunities to grow a career at Salesforce. Together, with our whole Ohana (Hawaiian for "family") made up of our employees, customers, partners and communities, we are working to improve the state of the world.  About Slack Business Unit  Slack has transformed business communication. It’s the leading channel-based collaboration platform, used by millions to align their teams, unify their systems, and drive their businesses forward. Only Slack offers a secure, enterprise-grade environment that can scale with the largest companies in the world. It is a new layer of the business technology stack where people can work together more effectively, connect all their other software tools and services, and find the information they need to do their best work. Slack is where work happens.  About Role:  Drive revenue and own the full cycle sales process including prospecting new leads, navigating the C-suite and business line owners, negotiating contracts, and closing new and renewal business with customers Provide recommendations based on a customer’s business needs and usage patterns Handle inbound customer communication and organize/escalate issues appropriately including: billing, legal, security, and technical inquiries Collaborate and work with different members of the Accounts team (Technical Account Managers, Customer Success Managers, Leadership, etc.) to build strategic adoption plans for customers Educate customers on the value of Slack in a thoughtful way Serve as the voice of the customer and collect feedback to drive continuous improvement across all areas including product  You will do this by:  Partnering with internal resources in order to drive additional value and expertise Educating customers on the value of our products in a consultative way Generating pipeline that leads to closed revenue and quota attainment Selling on value and return on investment vs. technical functionality Building credibility and trust while influencing buying decisions Uncovering business initiatives and pain points to map back our solutions across multiple lines of business Creating demand by uncovering business problems and matching them to our solution Having a deep understanding of the way businesses operate, and the priorities that drive decisions from the C-level  What you should have:  5+ years of full cycle SaaS closing experience Experience selling SaaS software that can be used across multiple departments, preferably company-wide Experience engaging multiple stakeholders throughout the sales cycle including Legal, IT, Security, Finance, and Procurement Experience (and enjoy!) collaborating with internal sales teams like Solutions Engineers and Custom Success Managers Experience creating global engagement across multiple lines of business and broadening product support within an organization You are an expert storyteller, effectively developing relationships with senior managers and the C-suite You love traveling and have the ability to travel 20-30% of the time  Our investment in you:  World class enablement and on-demand training - check out Trailhead.com for a sneak peek! Sandler Sales Training Week-long product bootcamp Fast Ramp mentorship program Weekly 1:1 coaching with your leadership Clear path to promotion with accelerated leadership development programs Exposure to executive thought leaders with a passion for living our values Accommodations  If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .  Posting Statement  At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.  Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .  Salesforce welcomes all.

description: Location: Preferably New York, Washington or Miami  Type: Full-time  Experience: Mid-Senior level  Position taking: Immediately  Salary: According to background and experience  This is an exciting opportunity for an applicant with an outstanding track record in selling high-technology products to US broadcasters and Video Professionals.  Working under the leadership of one of our Sales Directors, responsibilities will include: Managing the complete sales cycle, from lead generation to deal closures Traveling extensively across across the USA (up to 50-75%) to make presentations to prospective key accounts and close deals Defining and applying the business strategy for your area jointly with the Sales Director Extending our network and ensuring coordination among master distributor, integrators and resellers Representing AVIWEST at major domestic and international Broadcast exhibitions linked to your area Monitoring leads and projects following internal processes using the company’s CRM Sharing customer feedback with the marketing and R&D teams The applicant will have an excellent understanding of IP networks and a background in broadcast, as well as a proven record of sales experience in the broadcast and/or security markets.

About The Team  The Rentals Sales Team provides best-in-class advertising solutions and business consultation for Multi-Family partners. We are a team of high-energy individuals committed to helping Zillow Group users make smarter decisions about buying, renting, owning, and selling homes. Specifically, the Multi-Family Rental sales team works with owners and operators of rental properties throughout the US, helping to connect rental shoppers with the property they will next call home. We provide creative technological solutions, strategic data, and excellent training and development to amplify our clients' growth as true partners in their business. Our team embodies the spirit of all our core values and plays a vital part in our organization's success.  Zillow has streamlined the way people search, tour, apply and pay rent for leased properties. Zillow’s rental listings offer our customers a variety of property types, from s large-scale multifamily complexes to unique, single-family homes. Simultaneously, we provide our valued partners with a complete set of digital tools to help them market their properties, identify prospective tenants, sign a lease and collect payments -- delivering a complete end-to-end online experience  About The Role  The Rentals business operates in a very collaborative environment, working together to provide the best client experience in the industry. At all levels, we work hard, roll up our sleeves, dig in and get work done. We are looking for a Senior Regional Sales Manager who can help us exponentially grow the Rentals marketplace. This role is responsible for the overall performance of a dynamic sales team working with large, medium and small partners across the Western region. A key focus will be on coaching a team to high sales productivity while fostering deep, meaningful, and long-term client partnerships.  You Will Get To Own, develop, and lead all aspects of a regional sales team including strategy, personnel development, client relationships, sales production, reporting, etc Focus on implementation of consistent and high-quality sales output; excited to get into the details, roll up sleeves, and push improvement through ongoing iteration Supervise and continuously improve metrics focused on revenue, sales velocity, and closing ratios Facilitate process standardization including, but not limited to, activity metrics, sales process, and operational cadence Improve retention and client loyalty through consistent, thoughtful and data driven mentorship Excellent at leading teams through change in a hyper-growth environment. Grow and develop a sales culture with a focus on a growth mentality Strategically lead organizational initiatives from start to finish including implementation sales tames Obsessed toward our sales team’s employee satisfaction, manages a team passionate about positivity and continual improvement, is not afraid to set big goals, and has the leadership skills to align focus to achieve them Ability to build and cultivate a dynamic and growth oriented team environment virtually or in-person Be an effective partner with other internal teams such as billing, operations, finance, product, marketing, and more Successfully communicates ZG Rental’s value proposition through presentations, industry events, executive meetings, and sales proposals to upscale the team, meetings, and opportunities Please note: Candidates being considered for Team West must reside in a state located in the Western Territory which includes the following states: Washington, Oregon, California, Utah, Nevada, Idaho, Montana, Arizona, New Mexico, Wyoming, North Dakota, South Dakota, Nebraska, Iowa, Minnesota, Wisconsin, Michigan, Hawaii, Alaska This role has been categorized as a Field position. “Field” employees perform the majority of their work in the field, not at any specific corporate or other office location. Employees must live within reasonable commuting distance of their designated ZG office. ZG has not defined a reasonable distance, and expects employees will use judgment in determining this for themselves and understand the implications re: time commitment and cost of daily commute.  Who you are Ability to lead through ambiguity and in an ever-evolving, fast-paced environment Excel at mentoring sales teams on handling a complex sales process that may include multiple decision makers and influencers Strong presentation skills, influencing multiple levels within an organization, including at the C-level with outstanding communication skills, both oral and written Ability to coach up peer leaders and drive the overall organization to success Qualifications 4+ years sales leadership experience, including implementation and ongoing management of goal setting, accountability metrics, and pipeline management Proven track record in meeting and exceeding sales goals A solid understanding of CRM software – preferably Salesforce Available to travel 30-40% to meet with industry decision makers in corporate marketing as well as at divisional and national levels Transferable Skills  Here at Zillow - we value the experience and perspective of candidates with non-traditional backgrounds. We encourage you to apply if you have transferable skills or related experiences.  In addition to a competitive base salary this position is also eligible for variable incentives and/or equity awards based on factors such as experience, performance and location.  Get to know us  Zillow is reimagining real estate to make it easier to unlock life’s next chapter.  As the most-visited real estate website in the United States, Zillow® and its affiliates offer customers an on-demand experience for selling, buying, renting or financing with transparency and nearly seamless end-to-end service. Millions of people visit Zillow and its affiliate sites every month to start their home search, and now they can rely on Zillow to help them finish it — and no matter what job you're in, you will play a critical role in making this vision a reality.  At Zillow, we're powered by our innovative and inclusive work culture, where everyone has the flexibility, support and resources to do the best work of their careers. Our efforts to streamline the real estate transaction is supported by our passion to redefine the employee experience, a deep-rooted culture of innovation, a fundamental commitment to Equity and Belonging, and world-class benefits. But don't just take our word for it. Read our reviews on Glassdoor and recent recognition from multiple organizations, including: Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work For® List 2021 Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index 2021, Human Rights Campaign (HRC) Corporate Equity Index and HRC’s Best Place to Work for LGBTQ Equality 2021, Fortune Best Workplaces for Technology 2020, Fortune Best Workplaces for Millennials 2020, Fortune Best Workplaces for Parents 2020, and the Deloitte Technology Fast 500.  Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at RecruitingAccessibility@zillowgroup.com.  Applicants who receive job offers from Zillow Group will be asked to sign a Proprietary Rights Agreement which includes confidentiality, intellectual property assignment, customer and employee non-solicitation, and non-competition provisions. If you are contacted for a role at Zillow Group and wish to review a copy of the Proprietary Rights Agreement prior to receiving an offer, you may request a copy from your Recruiter.

description: Job Description As a member of the Drata SDR team, you will be a critical component to an innovative fast-paced Sales Team. You will drive outbound prospecting campaigns (email, phone calls, & social media) to identify potential customers that would benefit from Drata’s solution. You will often be the first point of contact with potential customers with the objective to set qualified meetings for a team of Account Executives.  Qualifications Responsibilities Research accounts, identify key players and generate interest through cold discovery calls, and email campaigns Methodically qualify, build, and manage an accurate sales pipeline; maintain a high volume of activity including outbound cold calls, emails, & social selling Discovering new leads through internet research and social media monitoring/messaging, using tools such as LinkedIn Navigator, Twitter Responding to inbound customer interest and developing these accounts to create opportunities Utilize your active listening skills to understand and uncover customer needs and business problems to effectively communicate how Drata can solve them Achieving, and exceeding, weekly/monthly metrics (meetings, qualified opportunities, new contacts, etc.) Responsible for accurately tracking customer interactions and information in our CRM, HubSpot Conduct high-level conversations with C-Suite executives in prospect accounts Thrive on change while remaining highly organized, optimistic, and coachable  Qualities A Proven Track Record: 1-3 years of experience in a sales development associate or inside sales role; sales experience in the SaaS space is a plus. We are looking for candidates who thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial business environment and who have a proven track record of success in their past roles and experiences.   Intensely Curious: You thrive on learning new concepts, technologies, personas, and can rapidly absorb and integrate that material into your day to day role A Doer: You are driven, self-motivated and a self-starter who brings your ideas to life and takes pride in results. You are resourceful and find ways to get things done regardless of the obstacles. You are not fearful of failure and realize that failure is often a step closer to figuring out what works. Taking on complex challenges excites you, even if you need to ask for help or spend some time figuring out where to begin. Organized: You are detail-oriented and can juggle having a variety of different projects on your plate at one time because you are good at keeping track of them. You can create structure for yourself to be the most successful. A Talented Communicator: You are a “people person” who enjoys communicating with people and has a strong awareness of those around you. You are thoughtful about the ways you communicate and the impression that may have on a client.  Mission-Driven: You want to use your talents to make the world a better place and you are in a rush to do it. Confident but Self-Critical: You are confident in your skills and the quality of your work product. At the same time, you are not afraid to ask for help and want to constantly be improving. You value honest, action-oriented feedback and believe that we can use it as a tool to improve as a team.

Position Description:  Samsung has developed a proprietary ad platform that leverages unique first party TV data to help brands connect to their audience as they explore content across desktop, mobile, tablets and our SMART TVs. The Samsung Ad Platform delivers high-quality audience targeting powered by three key components: first-party audience data at scale, world-class data science, and brand-safe cross-device ad inventory.  We are currently looking for a talented account executive focused on growing revenue and building new relationships with assigned agencies and advertisers. Emerging Accounts is Samsung Ads’ fastest growing customer category and is inclusive of many national advertisers – some have run in TV for years and others are brand new to the medium. The ideal candidate should have a passion for streaming video, expertise in data driven audience activation, and a pulse on new multi-channel advertising technologies. With the rapid growth of programmatic activation in Connected TV, this seller should be equally comfortable speaking in terms like PG, PMP, and SSP as they are with insertion orders. This individual must be able to think strategically, anticipate how buying decisions are made, uncover the business needs of key clients and have a proven ability to close deals. Additionally, this sales executive will be the consummate team-player and have the ability to work collaboratively across the sales organization within a fluid and fast-paced environment.  The individual should have a passion for video, advanced TV, and the rapidly changing way consumers are viewing premium content across all screens. It’s key to have a pulse on how the media agency community is thinking about and allocating client spend to video channels and what solutions they need to do so more seamlessly. This passion and knowledge will fuel the growth of both your and Samsung Ads’ business.  This individual should have existing relationships across both video/digital strategy and investment teams as well as programmatic buying teams at the major agencies and holding companies, including key senior level contacts. This account executive must be able to think strategically, anticipate how buying decisions are made, uncover the business needs of key clients, and have a proven ability to drive spend through Programmatic Guaranteed (PG) , Private Marketplace (PMP), and Insertion Order (IO) buy types. This position will carry an annual revenue goal.  This Emerging Accounts Seller position is based in New York with domestic US travel as needed, occasional visits to the product/engineering offices in Montreal, Canada and Mountain View, CA. You will report to our Emerging Accounts Lead. If you're interested in joining a rapidly growing team working to build a unique, world-class advertising sales organization with a relentless focus on data and customer experience, you've come to the right place.  As an individual contributor, you'll be supported by our world class ad operations team and will benefit from working with a leadership team that is chartering our explosive growth.  Responsibilities:  ·       Build strong relationships with named advertisers, agencies, and agency trading desks ·       Develop a deep technical understanding of the Samsung Ads platform, capabilities, and unique inventory (including Samsung TV Plus) ·       Create a plan to build and grow Samsung Ads’ business with named agencies and accounts ·       Continuously provide value to your customers and serve as a trusted consultant to drive advertising growth with Samsung Ads ·       Monitor daily run rate across assigned accounts and work with product and support teams to troubleshoot any issues ·       Act as an internal champion for your advertising customers across Samsung  Required Experience: ·       Deep understanding of the video and connected TV media ecosystem ·       7+ years of industry or relatable experience with a significant portion spent working at a video publisher or SSP ·       Proven track record of securing and growing spend from advertisers and agencies via all buy types: Programmatic Guaranteed (PG), Private Marketplace (PMP), and Insertion Order (IO) ·       Successful internal and external relationship management ·       Experience working in both entrepreneurial and established corporate cultures ·       Excellent written and verbal communication skills, strong attention to detail, and good follow-through ·       Talent at explaining complex topics in simple terms in person, over the phone or video conference ·       Bachelor's Degree; MBA or other advanced degree a plus  Preferred Experience ·       Experience with selling or using video advertising platforms on the supply side (e.g. Magnite)  Join the Best We are looking for the best people. People who are prepared to dig in and live on the edge of a fast paced and rapidly evolving industry.   When you look back on your career, do you want to be able to look at what you have accomplished and see that you had a major impact, in an industry that is transforming the way people live and work every day? If so, then Samsung is the place for you.

description: Account Executive, Active Footwear New York, NY  Who You Are: You are a results-driven account manager with strong communication skills, who thrives in a fast-paced environment. You are a multi-tasker and team player who can work collaboratively. You have deep knowledge of the performance footwear wholesale business with a firm understanding of retail math.  What You’ll Do:  Maintain and cultivate strong relationships with both Major and Specialty accounts across the US with a large focus on launching and researching Active Accounts, while managing Men’s Major and Women’s Specialty Accounts. Analyze fiscal and style selling on a weekly, monthly, and seasonal basis in order to identify opportunities to drive business. Drive and present in seasonal market appointments, store product knowledge clinics and events  You’ll Need to Have:  4+ years of experience in wholesale sales, footwear experience preferred Strong analytical skills and firm understanding of retail math Strong communication skills both internally and externally, able to respond effectively to both client and division needs Thorough knowledge of Excel, PowerPoint, Word and relative fashion industry systems such as Micro Strategy, RLM, Skypad Dynamic presentation skills High level of organizational and time management skills  We’d love to see:  The ability to analyze monthly markdowns in partnership with planning to achieve Margin and MDA goals Proven ability to strategize with Planning and sales Director to achieve sales goals each season through product assortment and event opportunities The wiliness to do seasonal market visits to department stores to maintain and promote brand awareness and observe specific market The ability to represent the values of our brand and communicates our goals and initiatives effectively both internally and externally  MK Perks:  Generous Holiday Schedule Internal mobility across Capri Brands (Michael Kors, Jimmy Choo, Versace) Cross Brand Discounts Exclusive Employee Sales Fav 5 Cards (MK Discount for friends and family) 401k Match Paid Parental Leave Thrive Wellness Program (seasonal in-office massages and more!) Commuter Benefits Gym Discounts  At Capri, we are all responsible for creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. We try to inspire change and growth within each other and believe success is a result that comes from our differences. **THIS IS NOT A JOB AT FORCEBRANDS**  The Retail Sales Manager will integrate the food and beverage wellness brands into Manhattan retail outlets (bodegas, local grocery stores, mom and pop shops, etc). The ideal candidate will be passionate about the fitness industry as the brands are a clean energy drink and protein bar. This person will be highly entrepreneurial, tenacious, and a self-starter with a resilient mindset.  Responsibilities Drive distribution & sales of the product Develop & maintain network Work with the distributor partner to maximize sales Scale this business primarily in the Manhattan market and other boroughs and surrounding areas as needed  Qualifications Proven sales experience Must have a strong work ethic and an entrepreneurial spirit Have a can do attitude Ability to develop impactful relationships at all levels of an organization Enjoy influencing others with passion Passionate about fitness Self-motivated, hungry, and confident, with the ability to ask questions as needed
jobFunction: Sales, Business Development, and Customer Service

description: The ideal candidate has an enthusiastic and passionate coach's mentality, with a deep interest to work for a rapidly evolving company. They should have experience leading a sales team of at least 7-8, while working in a high activity, high volume environment! The candidate should have an understanding of new business development, while also being able to analyze metrics and using them to improve team performance. They should also posses strong interpersonal skills, the ability to work across multiple internal group, and has experience in developing processes, meeting deadlines, paying attention to detail, while remaining organized. You will need to be comfortable managing & helping remote insides sales executives on your team thrive & succeed.  Grubhub is dedicated to connecting hungry diners with our wide network of restaurants across the country. Our innovative technology, easy-to-use platforms and streamlined delivery capabilities make us an industry leader today, and in the future of online food ordering.  We strive to create a workplace that reflects the diversity of our customers and the communities we serve. When you join our team, you become part of a community that works together to innovate, solve problems, take risks, grow, work hard and have a ton of fun in the process!  Why Work For Us We have a fast-paced environment and that is what our teams thrive on. Grubhub believes in empowering people and offering opportunities for development, as well as professional growth. We value strong, positive relationships in all areas: with each other, our customers and our greater community. Want to be a part of a team of diverse collaborators in an authentically fun culture? If so, we want to talk to you - and hear what’s your favorite restaurant for food delivery!  The Impact You Will Make Work closely with the Senior Manager of Restaurant Sales and the Director of Restaurant Sales to lead an inside sales team Train, coach, motivate, and manage a team of Sales Executives to improve individual results Identify opportunities to improve effectiveness and efficiencies with processes, tools, product offerings, and employee development Use Salesforce.com to develop regular tracking and reporting of key performance metrics and translate these metrics into implications and recommendations Develop effective coaching strategies and content for team meetings Encourage transparency and align broader company initiatives with department goals Monitor success outcomes from each team member through the creation of recognition programs, dashboards, and leader boards Coordinate with The Restaurant Sales Management Team to ensure proper communication and alignment across teams Be a respected leader while maintaining our collaborative and dynamic team culture Develop clear expectations and instill accountability for employees across all aspects of their performance Cultivate an open sales environment while maintaining competition and self-reliance Encourage employees to contribute new ideas and solutions to problems Take on projects outside of the scope of day to day responsibilities as needed by the sales department Contribute to the sales strategy as it relates to the department as a whole  What You Bring to the Table Have a coach’s mentality: you love helping others succeed and strive at pushing your team to its fullest potential Experience in developing processes, meeting deadlines, paying attention to detail, while remaining organized Possess a analytical, data driven mindset Experience working in a metrics/data-driven environment Have a deep interest and enthusiasm to work for a rapidly evolving company Experience with working in a high activity, high volume environment Have an understanding on how to analyze metrics and using them to improve performance Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to work across multiple internal groups Basic proficiency in Microsoft Excel Bachelor’s degree Experience with Salesforce is a plus!  Of Course, Our Perks!!! Flexible PTO. Grubhub employees are provided a generous amount of time to recharge their batteries.  Health and Wellness. We provide programs that support your overall well-being such as generous medical benefits, employee network groups, company-wide fitness challenges, and a comfortable and casual workplace! We also support our parents by offering 8 weeks of paid parent bonding time, a 4-week returnship program, and 6-8 weeks paid medical leave. Learning and Career Growth. Your personal and professional development is a priority at Grubhub. From day one, we empower you to lead and be an active participant in your career growth. We provide continuous learning opportunities, training, and coaching and mentorship programs.   MealPerks. Who’s ready for some lunch? We provide our employees with a weekly Grubhub credit to enjoy and support local restaurants. We also offer company-wide meals several times a year to bring our Grubhub family together. Fun. Every Grubhub office has an employee-led Culture Crew that connects people through fun, meaningful events and initiatives. Some of our popular past events include: Wing-eating contests, Grubtoberfest, 5k Runs, Bring Your Child to Work Day, regular happy hours, and more! Social Impact. We believe in the importance of serving the communities that support our business. In addition, employees are given paid time off each year to support the causes that are important to them.  Grubhub is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster is available here: DOL Poster. If you are applying for a job in the U.S. and need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to TalentAcquisition@grubhub.com and let us know the nature of your request and contact information. Please note that only those inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this email address.    CA Privacy Notice: If you are a resident of the State of California and would like a copy of our CA privacy notice, please email privacy@grubhub.com.

Position Title: Manager, Prestige Sales, New York Location: New York, NY (Remote)  Position Summary:  Deliver elevated sales performance across PRUSA’s luxury spirts and champagne portfolio’s through a disciplined sales process and dedicated approach within a designated Prestige account universe. Uphold clear lines of communication with PRUSA General Market and Distributor personnel by taking lead role in strategic account management ensuring alignment on tactics, resources and approach to winning point of purchase (at-POP) opportunities. Orchestrate programming at key Prestige accounts facilitating brand-building activities designed to maximize consideration, trial and purchase. Leverage activations within key accounts to maximize consumer engagement and build brand equity. Build enduring relations with top operators and key stake-holders to improve availability, visibility and velocity positions for our PRUSA portfolio. The primary focus of this role is Metro New York – incumbent is responsible for the sales of PRUSA’s full spirit and champagne portfolios.  Major Responsibilities / Accountabilities:  Market Execution: Elevate PRUSA’s Prestige market share and growth across targeted commercial segments:  Deliver first-class sales execution in support of the Prestige core range, beating the competition in the L3F and dominating share of market within their key account universe. Achieve Total Net-Net Sales & Prestige SKU growth targets Achieve Targeted Availability (Point of Distribution) KPI’s across focus SKU’s Achieve Targeted Visibility & Velocity (Back Bar, Drink Menu, etc.) KPI’s Maintain high-level of interaction and collaboration with local field sales teams. Lead (QB Role) communication with all relevant parties to maintain focus on strategic commercial partnerships.  Customer Engagement: Establish powerful partnerships designed to maximize value creation for the Prestige portfolio:  Execute in-depth product/brand trainings with key decision makers. Recruit and retain trade advocates as gatekeepers of our luxury brands. Increase ROI on A&P and trade investments to drive better value realization Leverage multi-brand co-activation programs to drive growth  Distributor Engagement:   Work with Senior leadership on monthly cadence to enhance forecasting on priority SKU’s, mitigate OOS’s and increase S&OP effectiveness. Maintain clear lines of communication to ensure alignment on tactics, resources and approach to winning the L3F (at POP).  Coordinate selling efforts with core distributor team in Prestige account universe Manage day-to-day performance thru internal KPI trackers and local market data.   Prestige HQ Leadership Engagement:   Work-with Prestige HQ team to cultivate relationships with key top Prestige operator’s/decision makers Architect and implement partnership agreements aligned on achieving Prestige KPI expectations. Align all relevant PR resources to achieve primary vendor status.  Business Administration:   Fiscally responsible for proper administration of A&P budget to achieve NNS targets. Update Fiscal Year Budget Tracker monthly Manage T&E responsibly and effectively while remaining within budget for FY  Nature & Scope: Please describe relationships, level of confidentiality, and financial responsibility (e.g. budgets). Position works directly with VP, Prestige on Prestige brands, as well as other key sales and Prestige marketing staff within the company and is recognized for the mastery of all aspects of sales management, long and short range business planning, motivation, and team building. Communication will include high-level contacts within and outside the company, and position has accountability for critical levels of company resources, including maintenance of distribution channels, and observance of sales management policies and activities. Incumbent plans activities for areas of responsibility on both a long-term and short-term basis, including strategic growth plans.  Decisions will impact the entire organization, and errors may cause critical delays, inefficiencies, and expense to the organization.  Key Contact points (external and internal)  Regional Director, Sales Vice President Sales, Prestige Senior Brand Manager, Prestige Division Sales Teams National Accounts Brand Managers Distributor Partners  Requirements: List the minimum requirements necessary to satisfactorily perform the current position.  If an item is preferred, please designate it as such. Education: Bachelor’s degree preferred Experience / Background:  Requires a minimum of 5-7 years’ general work experience; over 5 years of sales experience required; distribution and finance experience a plus.  Spirits experience is desired.  Relationships with Chicago iconic accounts is a plus.  Working Conditions:  Work is performed in a typical office environment, with limited demands for movement and lifting. Normal visual acuity required for correspondence and computer terminal usage.  Must have valid driver's license.  Travel Estimate:  10% of time.

Phillips Distilling Company is currently inviting candidates to apply for a full-time Regional Key Account Manager opportunity. The candidate selected for this role will enjoy competitive compensation, annual bonus potential, development opportunities, and a comprehensive benefits package!  This is a remote position. The candidate selected for this opportunity must reside in California, preferably near the Orange County metro area.  Since 1912, Phillips Distilling Company (PDC) has been producing high-quality spirits and popular brands. As one of America's oldest family-owned spirits companies, we pride ourselves on our independent spirit and our commitment to innovation, quality and community. This is your opportunity to be part of a movement where you will be the steward of an amazing portfolio of Phillips brands, such as UV Vodka, Prairie Organic Spirits, and Revel Stoke Canadian Whiskey. Our passion for quality and craft is evident in our expansive and diverse portfolio of premium brands.  The Regional Key Account Manager is responsible for developing and maintaining positive business relationships with existing regional accounts and key independent customers in the on and off sale and continuously gaining share for the PDC portfolio. They spearhead the implementation of strategies for selling products and initiatives to customers designed to exceed sales goals. They are responsible for working cross functionally to develop influential programming to cut through the competitive set and win for the PDC brand portfolio.   Essential Duties Call on all key accounts within assigned District. Accounts may include on-premise, off-premise, and Regional Chain accounts. Meet or exceed net sales goals and all annual company objectives. Work with Distributor personnel to achieve sales goals. Goals may include new placements, displays, menu placements, and depletions goals. Inspire and motivate distributor partner and employees. Construct unique and engaging portfolio presentations and sales tools that embrace PDC company standards, programs, and initiatives Provide educational training to distributor partner and key accounts through tastings and special events. Establish and maintain strong professional relationships with key customers, distributors, and trade professionals in all markets. Effectively manage new business through Phillips and Distributor Sales Teams. Develop and activate annual customer plans that reflect PDC’s brand, customer, and consumer engagement strategies. Generate regular communication reports for internal and external sales teams. Construct an annual plan against assigned key objectives, to include budget by account (goals, programming elements, incentives, etc.). Display original thinking and creativity for problem solving. Implement and run incentive programs with input from the Senior Regional Manager Develop a comprehensive understanding of all components of cost-of-goods, FOB, distributor, and retail pricing; manage all promotional, travel and entertainment budgets to ensure PDC maximum profitability. Utilize company systems, including expense reports, marketing & brand plans, analytics tools, etc. Be an ambassador for the company and its brands and above all, have fun!   Minimum Job Requirements  Bachelor’s degree with 5+ years’ sales management experience in the distilled spirits industry, or equivalent combination of education and experience. Must be highly energetic, creative, and self-motivated; with ability to work independently to meet and/or exceed business goals and objectives. Ability to effectively prepare and manage a budget; prioritize, organize, and delegate assignments. Excellent verbal and written communications; exceptional interpersonal and collaborative skills; ability to work with “team first” approach. Strong analytical, communication, negotiation, and presentation skills. Proficient computer skills including E-Mail, Spreadsheets, Word, PowerPoint, etc. Up to 75% travel within assigned geographic area, occasional evening and weekend work attending events as required. Valid driver’s license.  Must reside in CA.  Reports To: Sr Regional Manager  Candidates offered employment will be required to submit to a background check and drug test. Phillips Distilling Company is an E-Verify participating employer.  Phillips Distilling is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors. If a disability prevents you from applying for a job online, contact us via e-mail or in writing.

Who we are:  Modern Hire is an innovative, science-driven organization. Our more than 40 PhD-level psychologists and data scientists are committed to creating and validating new ways of measuring and understanding human potential.  What does it mean to be science-driven? We rigorously test our offerings and never market tools that do not meet our high standards for predicting job performance accurately and fairly.  Modern Hire’s innovative platform allows diverse data sources to be analyzed and understood like never before. We are combining the predictive power of assessment, interview technology, advanced analytics, and artificial intelligence into an all-in-one solution to create a fairer, more efficient hiring process that provides a better candidate experience and better outcomes.  The role:  We are looking for an Account Manager to join our team! As an Account Manager with Modern Hire, you will be responsible for maintaining existing client partnerships for mid to large enterprise accounts. Through these relationships you will be responsible for maintaining a high level of health with each account, building strategic relationships with the accounts, and expanding new business within those accounts. This role is focused on relationship management, retaining, and expanding accounts, and negotiating and securing renewal contracts within an account portfolio.  Day-to-day you'll:  Assume ownership of implemented clients that have been transitioned from the new business sales team Partner with a Client Success Manager (CSM) to service and manage the account Build, maintain and support assigned account relationships Follow up on leads to expand new business within accounts, identify new sales opportunities within target accounts, expand ARR within accounts  Communicate with owned clients to determine needs and satisfaction. Must have an awareness for client contract terms at time of taking ownership Provide client specific reports and metrics to justify ongoing usage, drive increased adoption, and prove value of current or future investment Conduct business reviews with named accounts Serve as a contact for clients with escalations. Coordinate with internal teams to resolve and communicate with clients. Log enhancement requests captured from client base with Modern Hire Product team Responsible for assigned retention targets Manage timely renewals and maximize expansion opportunities. Responsible for annual growth target to be determined based upon portfolio.  If you can answer "yes" to the following, then we want you to apply!  Do you have experience working in the Talent Acquisition or HCM industry? Do you have SaaS or hiring assessment experience/knowledge? Do you have three (3) or more years’ experience managing enterprise accounts? Do you have CRM knowledge? Do you have previous account management or sales experience with a proven ability to upsell? Strong business acumen working with senior leadership or executives Do you have a proven track record of building and maintaining strong client partnerships? Do you have technical aptitude and understanding how software applications/systems work? Are you able to understand metrics and report out on and identify key insights and be able to tailor and present information to clients? Are you detail oriented with experience documenting client activity? Do you have excellent written, verbal and presentation skills? Do you have strong negotiating skills? Are you able to multi-task and manage several ongoing projects and commitments? Are you able to troubleshoot and logically solve problems?   Modern Hire provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, citizenship status, gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, sexual orientation, transgender status, marital status, religion, creed, age, physical or mental disability, results of genetic testing, genetic information, past, present or prospective service in the military, or any other characteristic or activity protected under federal, state, or local law. Equal employment opportunity applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including but not limited to hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leave of absence, compensation, and training.

jobTitle: District Sales Manager Wine and Spirits
description: District Sales Manager Milwaukee and surrounding counties Role: A District Manager is responsible to manage a district in such a way that General Beverage and the team of sales associates will obtain the maximum return from each sales territory within the district. A successful District Manager is someone who can consistently achieve expected sales results through a team of sale associates while developing each individual sales associate to reach their potential. Responsibilities and Requirements: · Team Leadership: Responsible for achieving results through a team. · Personal Development: The ability to hire candidates with the qualities to be successful and develop them into outstanding sales associates. Strong teaching and mentoring skills are essential. · Planning and Organizing: Responsible for seeing that objectives are set, programs are implemented, and schedules are created and followed. · Directing: Responsible for seeing that sales associates are motivated to do their best, trained to get results and given opportunities to develop themselves by delegating assignments. · Control: Responsible for measuring and evaluating performance and for taking corrective action when desired results are not being obtained. · Communicating: Requires good oral communication skills, the ability to ask probing questions and good listening skills. · Problem Solving/Decision Making: The ability to define problems, skill to consider alternative solutions, effective information gathering and sound decision making capabilities. · Key Account Management: The ability to coordinate activities as directed by GB chain personnel and in compliance with account standards. Demonstrate proficiency with all proprietary technical systems. · Customer Relations: A District Manager must demonstrate a strong working relationship with all GB customers. Through the District Managers efforts and the conduct of the DM’s team the trust and respect of a customer is earned. Every effort must be directed to earn trust and respect each day. Problems are addressed with a sense of urgency and followed through to a satisfactory resolution. · Market Awareness: Establish sound observation of changing market trends, competitors initiatives and business opportunities. Experience: · Minimum of three years as a sales representative within an alcohol beverage distributor. · Management experience at the district management level or above preferred · Teaching, mentoring and/or coaching experience at secondary or collegiate level. Job Type: Full-time

DESCRIPTION Our client is the provider of the world’s first SASE platform. If you don’t know what SASE (Secure Access Service Edge) is, Google it now. What they envisioned already 5 years ago is now being formally endorsed by Gartner as the future of network and security.   If you are a high-energy, high activity sales professional with a track record of success and a keen interest to work with market innovators and thought leaders, then this is your next career move. Our client has developed network security as a service and secure, global SD-WAN (software-defined WAN) into a single, groundbreaking cloud-native carrier architecture, the world’s first Secure Access Services Edge (SASE) platform. They are well funded from global leading VC’s, lead by recognized innovative leadership and growing quickly as they revolutionize networking and security to meet the critical needs of digital business.   RESPONSIBILITIES As a Enterprise Sales Representative, you will own a region, generating new business through Dallas. In this role you will lead revenue generation, develop new opportunities, manage the pipeline, build & execute account strategies, close large enterprise-level deals, and lead customer expansion for our networking and security solutions. You will strategize and engage with enterprise level customer IT executives creating significant impact at a great company while building your sales career. Reporting to AVP Central, Americas, 40% travel.   REQUIREMENTS A true hunter with a strong track record of consistent Enterprise sales overachievement.  Track record of navigating large, complex deals and consistently achieving and exceeding quota.  Experienced in vendor technology sales (SaaS, Security, Networking) selling enterprise solutions/services to CISO’s & CIO’s. Experience working for up-start, hyper-growth companies. Deep understanding of a channel centric go to market approach, skilled at establishing and leveraging new and existing strategic alliance partner relationships. A team player, able to work effectively cross functionally with senior management and corporate counsel.  Skilled at influencing stakeholders with compelling presentation and negotiation styles, successful at building and maintaining trusting relationships with associates and customers. Committed to driving issues and contracts to close, demonstrating persistency despite obstacles while conveying a sense of urgency.
industries: Computer & Network Security and Information Technology and Services

description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.  Job Category Sales Job Details  About Salesforce  Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. The company was founded on three disruptive ideas: a new technology model in cloud computing, a pay-as-you-go business model, and a new integrated corporate philanthropy model. These founding principles have taken our company to great heights, including being named one of Forbes’s “World’s Most Innovative Company” seven years in a row and #1 on the FORTUNE ‘100 Best Companies to Work For®’ List. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, and this level of growth equals incredible opportunities to grow a career at Salesforce. Together, with our whole Ohana (Hawaiian for "family") made up of our employees, customers, partners and communities, we are working to improve the state of the world.  About Slack Business Unit  Slack has transformed business communication. It’s the leading channel-based collaboration platform, used by millions to align their teams, unify their systems, and drive their businesses forward. Only Slack offers a secure, enterprise-grade environment that can scale with the largest companies in the world. It is a new layer of the business technology stack where people can work together more effectively, connect all their other software tools and services, and find the information they need to do their best work. Slack is where work happens.  About Role:  Drive revenue and own the full cycle sales process including prospecting new leads, navigating the C-suite and business line owners, negotiating contracts, and closing new and renewal business with customers Provide recommendations based on a customer’s business needs and usage patterns Handle inbound customer communication and organize/escalate issues appropriately including: billing, legal, security, and technical inquiries Collaborate and work with different members of the Accounts team (Technical Account Managers, Customer Success Managers, Leadership, etc.) to build strategic adoption plans for customers Educate customers on the value of Slack in a thoughtful way Serve as the voice of the customer and collect feedback to drive continuous improvement across all areas including product  You will do this by:  Partnering with internal resources in order to drive additional value and expertise Educating customers on the value of our products in a consultative way Generating pipeline that leads to closed revenue and quota attainment Selling on value and return on investment vs. technical functionality Building credibility and trust while influencing buying decisions Uncovering business initiatives and pain points to map back our solutions across multiple lines of business Creating demand by uncovering business problems and matching them to our solution Having a deep understanding of the way businesses operate, and the priorities that drive decisions from the C-level  What you should have:  5+ years of full cycle SaaS closing experience Experience selling SaaS software that can be used across multiple departments, preferably company-wide Experience engaging multiple stakeholders throughout the sales cycle including Legal, IT, Security, Finance, and Procurement Experience (and enjoy!) collaborating with internal sales teams like Solutions Engineers and Custom Success Managers Experience creating global engagement across multiple lines of business and broadening product support within an organization You are an expert storyteller, effectively developing relationships with senior managers and the C-suite You love traveling and have the ability to travel 20-30% of the time  Our investment in you:  World class enablement and on-demand training - check out Trailhead.com for a sneak peek! Sandler Sales Training Week-long product bootcamp Fast Ramp mentorship program Weekly 1:1 coaching with your leadership Clear path to promotion with accelerated leadership development programs Exposure to executive thought leaders with a passion for living our values Accommodations  If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .  Posting Statement  At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.  Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .  Salesforce welcomes all.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

About The Company  Boxed is the easiest and modern way to shop for bulk goods. As a mobile-first company, customers can shop directly from Boxed’s app on their iOS or Android mobile device, or online at www.Boxed.com. With Boxed, customers can have their household, personal care, and pantry favorites delivered conveniently to their home or office.  Our office is a dynamic, collaborative family of individuals. A technology company at core, we are a vibrant group of engineers, designers, marketers, and operations specialists with a passion for driving superior value and experience to our customers.  Boxed B2B is made up of Small-to-Medium (SMB), Enterprise, and Commercial businesses. As a Sales & Business Development Manager, you will primarily be responsible for lead generation, sales, and retention for the SMB segment. We are seeking an experienced professional with a proven track record in identifying & converting revenue opportunities, building and managing customer relationships, and executing business expansion strategies. You should be comfortable working in a fast-paced startup environment, be independently responsible for achieving business results while collaborating closely with key stakeholders to execute on the day-to-day operation.  You Will Focus On Customer Acquisition – Work closely with the Head of B2B to develop a robust sales strategy, by using data and market insights, to reach new customers across different industries. Responsible for executing on that strategy via generating sales leads, converting leads into revenue, and managing after-sale support for select strategic accounts. You will need to become well-versed in understanding B2B prospect’s needs and leveraging Boxed’s products & services to meet those needs. You will also need to be comfortable with both inbound lead conversion and outbound prospecting. Customer Retention & Re-engagement – Responsible for the ongoing management of select key accounts while working closely with Marketing, Product, Merchandising and Business Analytics to identify new, creative ways of improving customer engagement. Provide general support to the team on meeting its overall monthly KPI targets Product and Customer Feedback – Frequently funnel customer insights and feedback back to internal stakeholders to enable smarter business decisions. Ability to thoughtfully turn learnings into actionable tactics is a plus Operational Support – Support daily business operations (eg. process / manage B2B orders, project manage key initiatives, act as B2B point-of-contact to liaise with internal teams, etc) and process optimization where needed Requirements 3+ years of B2B sales or business development experience, preferably in B2B products & services Experience creating sales leads and finding innovative ways of reaching new customers Self-starter mentality; excited by a growth environment and willing to try new strategies while keeping the focus on achieving results. Willing to roll up your sleeves to get the job done and no job is too small Analytical thinking with a data-driven mentality and strong business judgment. Able to synthesize data and pull key insights Strong communication skills, both written and oral, with a keen attention to detail Embodies teamwork; significant interaction with employees at all levels Bachelor’s degree preferred Benefits & Perks Working with smart, positive people Competitive salary Stock options Unlimited vacation Full healthcare benefits Pet-friendly office
