description: Description  Amazon Advertising operates at the intersection of advertising and ecommerce and offers advertisers a rich array of innovative advertising solutions across Amazon’s mobile and desktop websites, proprietary devices and the Amazon Advertising Platform. We believe that advertising, when done well, can enhance the customer experience and generate a positive return on investment for our advertising partners.  We are looking for a highly motivated Account Manager to join our talented team to help scale our growing Advertising program. Account Managers partner with advertisers, sales and other internal Amazon businesses to drive advertiser success.  As an Account Manager you are passionate about understanding business drivers for performance, the range of Amazon products available to our advertisers, and engaging with internal and external partners to deliver on these. You play a key role on the account team, growing the business by being the customer expert, developing annual brand plans inclusive of integrated media plans and audience recommendations. You possess strong analytical ability, and will develop deep expertise in Amazon’s products and proprietary metrics to build winning campaigns and optimizing performance to derive insights and meet our advertisers’ needs. You also thrive in ambiguous situations, with the ability to be a self-starter and find solutions without guidance. This is a client-facing role that is also responsible for identifying opportunities to drive incremental revenue and long-term growth. The Account Manager is an expert in delivering consultative solutions for our partners, earning their trust by educating them on how to be successful on Amazon.  Responsibilities Become an expert on Amazon solutions and adapt recommendations based on advertiser needs Develop annual brand plans and campaign media plans Optimize campaign performance that fulfills advertiser goals In-depth data analysis to develop actionable insights and recommendations for future campaigns Consult and educate advertisers with insights and solutions to achieve greater results on Amazon Strong project management skills to impact process improvements Work cross-functionally with sales and other Amazon partners to drive revenue and increase advertiser satisfaction  Basic Qualifications Bachelor's degree required 5+ years experience in digital advertising, product marketing, consulting, business development, and/or other customer facing roles Experience with digital media/marketing strategy, data analysis and data analytics & visualization Success in optimizing products and services based on client needs Strong Proficiency in Microsoft Excel Demonstrated success working with cross-functional teams and building strong relationships internally and externally Preferred Qualifications Bachelors’ degree in Economics, Marketing, Advertising, Statistics or Business Experience in fast-paced environment Excellent organizational, interpersonal and communication (written and verbal) skills Ability to contribute to process improvement, inventing and simplifying within existing processes Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us   Company - Amazon Advertising LLC  Job ID: A1747187

description: Job description Bang Energy Performance Beverages and Sports Nutrition has been producing epic innovations for 25 years. We engage in an unrelenting pursuit to create trendsetting appearance and performance enhancing inventions. Our sports nutrition and beverage innovations are backed by 27 double-blind placebo controlled Gold Standard University studies. Likewise, our marketing and distribution has been discussed for its excellence by such prestigious news outlets as Forbes and Wells Fargo. We are hiring super creative, ultra-positive and high-energy professionals to drive our vision to serve the entire world cutting edge health promoting beverages and nutrition! We are top sellers in iconic retailers such as 7 Eleven, Publix, Walmart, and are the #1 selling beverage of all time in the world’s largest health food retailers: GNC and Vitamin Shoppe. The Regional Sales Manager (RSM) is responsible for the relationship with the distributor and owns joint business planning and market execution. Their main priorities include developing annual business plans, driving VPXinitiatives, aligning, setting and tracking Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) through a set group of Distributors. Responsibilities: Communicating strategic priorities Ensuring implementation of merchandising standards Tracking and measuring KPI execution Monitoring sales/POS progress against business plans Coaching distributors to execute with excellence Field based leadership Qualifications: Outstanding sales experience and track record in Consumer Goods industry (Beverage Preferred) Distributor and Supplier experience preferred Entrepreneurial, solution-oriented, strategic mindset Strong analytical and financial acumen to understand and manage back end financial planning systems 3+ years’ experience displaying dynamic leadership skills to manage and motivate third party sales teams preferred Excellent negotiator and influencer Clear and proven ability to develop and implement successful sales and trade marketing strategies Excellent communication skills, including presentation and training ability Must be extremely proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint Valid Driver’s License

There is only one Data Cloud. Snowflake’s founders started from scratch and designed a data platform built for the cloud that is effective, affordable, and accessible to all data users. But it didn’t stop there. They engineered Snowflake to power the Data Cloud, where thousands of organizations unlock the value of their data with near-unlimited scale, concurrency, and performance. This is our vision: a world with endless insights to tackle the challenges and opportunities of today and reveal the possibilities of tomorrow.  Over the past year, Snowflake has climbed to #2 on Forbes’ Cloud 100 List and became #1 on LinkedIn’s Hottest U.S Startups.  We are seeking an experienced Sales Development Manager to help us scale a high performing Sales Development Team contrived of the best talent, exceed pipeline goals and prepare SDRs to become the best Corporate Account Executives in the region.  YOU'RE A GREAT FIT IF YOU: Have 2+ years of leadership experience with a track record of excellence leading high performing, pipeline generation, and closing organizations in a fast-growing high technology company Are excited by attracting, recruiting, developing and retaining world-class talent early in their Sales and Management careers Feel a deep sense of ownership, accountability, pride, and passion for your work Are strategic enough to build a team, but tactical enough to execute on a day-to-day basis Have a reputation with cross-functional teams as being collaborative, innovative, accountable, and reliable Have an obsession with being data-driven, highly analytical, lead through influence, are a structured thinker Think big by working to achieve a deep understanding of predictable revenue models, mastery of sales development, and value selling practices as well as leadership philosophy and development  WHAT YOU'LL DO: Scale and manage a high-performing team of 10+ SDRs who consistently overachieve on aggressive goals and will become future AEs and managers at Snowflake Own and drive execution of Snowflake’s new business pipeline goals by understanding and analyzing top of the funnel metrics, pipeline quality, and revenue influenced across Enterprise and Majors segments Shape deep partnerships with Marketing, Sales, Sales Operations, Enablement, and Product Marketing teams to successfully collaborate on new marketing campaigns and field events, meet stretch pipeline goals, optimize your business for efficiency, accelerating ramp time to productivity, and ensure your team has a crisp understanding of Snowflake domain knowledge Attract, hire, develop, and retain world-class SDR talent Build and coach high-performing SDRs to the next high-performing Corporate Account Executives Leads through inspiration, service leadership, Snowflake values with a “Leaders East Last” and “Results-Driven’ approach  Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.  How do you want to make your impact?

Job Description:         Great Lakes territory Manager – OH, MI, WV and VA Reports to:                   Northeast Sales Director Full Time Position:      Salary and incentive aligned to Interroll goals and objectives   Work for a Market Leader and get your career Moving! Interroll a global leader in the Material Handling industry is seeking a Regional Sales Manager to work remotely in the region (MI or OH) and manage existing accounts and develop new business. The ideal candidate will have a passion for winning, problem solving, relentless prospecting and the drive to close sales constantly. You will enjoy working from a home office covering a multi-state territory. The right candidate will have experience selling mechanical or electrical industrial solutions to OEM’s, System Integrators and End Users. An understanding of warehousing equipment and 3 plus years of proven results will put you at the top of the list. You must also hold a bachelor’s degree or technical experience in either an engineering or business discipline.  The Regional Sales Manager is responsible for selling all Interroll solutions in the defined territory. The territory as defined; OH, MI, WV, VA. This may vary depending on qualifications and experience. The Northeast Region as defined geographically is Michigan east to Virginia and north to Maine.  The position entails account management as well as the development of new accounts. Presenting on a constant basis and having excellent verbal and written communication skills is a must. Use your own style to deliver and achieve >25% sales growth in an established territory with steady revenue. On offer with this exciting position is an attractive remuneration package and future growth opportunities. Interroll provides excellent training at our global center of excellence remotely or locally at our Atlanta US Headquarters. For more information visit www.interroll.us.com Other requirements Possess and display Interroll’ s Guiding Principles at all times: ·      Integrity ·      Teamwork ·      Professionalism ·      Innovation ·      Accountability  About Interroll The Interroll Group is one of the world’s leading specialists within the field of internal logistics. Headquartered in Switzerland, the exchange-listed company employs around 2,500 people at 31 enterprises around the globe. Among the company’s 23,000 customers are plant manufacturers, system integrators and equipment manufacturers. Our products are in daily use by global brands everyone knows, like Amazon, Bosch, Coca-Cola, DHL, Procter & Gamble, Red Bull, Siemens, UPS, Walmart and Yamaha (Motorcycles). On top of that, Interroll initiates global research projects for logistics efficiency and is actively supporting industry associations for standards or better use of resources. In the U.S, we have 3 Centers of Excellence or Manufacturing Units Strategically positioned: 1.     Wilmington, NC, USA; Rollers, Drum Motors, Roller Drives. 2.     Atlanta, GA, USA; Sub-Systems, Dynamic Storage (Pallet and Carton Flow), Conveyor Modules, Horizontal and Vertical Cross Belt Sorters 3.     Cañon City, CO, USA (Portec) Power Belt Curves, Spirals and Chutes  If the above sounds intriguing and you would like to learn more about Interroll or the position, please call me directly at 910-409-1692 to discuss the possibilities.  In the interim, please send me your resume at k.ferguson@interroll.com.   All the best, Ken Ferguson North East Sales Director - USA  Cell +1 (910) 409 1692 k.ferguson@interroll.com  Follow us on: YouTube · LinkedIn · Facebook

By joining our team as the new VICE PRESIDENT OF SALES, you will oversee $21 million in revenue and will be responsible for the growth, training, and development of the sales team. As a member of the senior leadership team, you’ll directly impact growth and change within the company.  Applicants please apply only via LinkedIn, do not contact our offices directly.  Our territory covers the entire commonwealth of Kentucky. This market has huge growth potential. You’ll work with their team with the goal to grow sales to $30+ million through strategy, hiring, and market penetration. Market potential exceeds $50 million without the need to expand the sales territory boundaries.  We are a family-owned and operated company, established in Lexington in 1950. We approach our business with a fresh mindset and we are looking for new and exciting ideas to continue growth in the industry.  You’ll make a difference to businesses around Kentucky by supplying them with the essential supplies they need while also helping the company become THE business solution provider for Kentucky.  The Vice President of Sales is responsible for obtaining profitable results through the sales team by developing the team, setting stretch goals, and giving direction as needed. This position is also responsible for a developing a business plan covering sales, revenue, and expense controls, meeting agreed targets, and promoting the organization’s presence throughout Kentucky.  Essential Duties & Responsibilities:  Sales Management Expertise in customer and market discussions. Prepare sales projections and monitor operational reports to project actual sales while determining profitability. Direct and coordinate Sales team in lead generation, presentations, quote preparation, pre-sale coordination and post-sale delivery activities. Oversee resource planning, reporting, territory assignments and future sales incentive plans. Develop and implement processes, tools and work standards that focus on customer satisfaction Conduct performance reviews and support on-going performance discussions while mentoring individuals and developing team camaraderie Develop and continuously improve a written training program for new and experienced sales reps. Organize a monthly sales meeting targeting certain markets or in cooperation with vendors.  Business Development Establish business development plans in coordination with marketing plans Conduct research, analysis of key geographies to identify industry trends while targeting customers Conduct competitive analysis, as needed, to identify and prioritize key customers Determine pricing schedules and discount rates with input from the sales team and executive team  Recruit and Develop Staff Anticipate vacancies in the department and be pro-active to recruit the best talent Identify training needs and prepare lesson plans Motivating and coaching staff Holding performance reviews - recognizing and praising success; addressing areas of concern as needed Annually review compensation structure and present suggestions for improvement to remain competitive in the market.  Education and/or Experience:  Required Bachelor’s degree in business or related field Career growth, progression and stability 7-10 years Sales Experience in distribution or consumable goods 5 years Sales Management experience Experience in training sales representatives Proven growth results Strong business acumen, data drive, strategic approach Superior interpersonal skills; collaborates effectively with leaders at all levels of organization Great planner with excellent organizational skills Professional demeanor and appearance Self-aware with emotional intelligence and able to coach staff in order to strengthen these attributes within the entire team Ability to quickly learn and adapt to the Distribution industry if not familiar Must live within commutable distance of Lexington, KY. Relocation assistance is available. This position will work in the office when not in the field. Initial ratio will be 80% field, 20% office. Once acclimated, this will be 30-40% field, 60-70% office.  Preferred 7 years Sales Management experience Distribution experience CRM experience ISO/Lean Certification Computer Skills:                   Microsoft Office Internal database and ERP system Travel: Travel locally and regionally (day trips with a few overnight stays)  Work Environment: Mostly office environment; some exposure to warehouse environment. Traveling in various modes of transportation.  Compensation: This position is offers a very competitive base salary, bonus potential and a company vehicle. Strong benefits are offered in the form of health, dental, vision, life insurance, retirement savings plan as well as time away from work for a great work-life balance.

Company Description  Alside, a division of Associated Materials Incorporated (“AMI”), is a federally designated essential business and recognized leader in the home improvement industry. Founded in 1947, Alside is a manufacturer and distributor of vinyl siding and accessories, vinyl windows and patio doors, and fencing and railing products for the residential and commercial remodeling and new construction markets. Alside products are distributed to licensed professional remodeling contractors and home builders through our network of over 100 Supply Centers and also through select independent distributors across the U.S. and Canada. We are proud to be a charter member of the Vinyl Siding Institute, the American Association of Architects, the National Association of Home Builders, and the National Association of the Remodeling Industry.  Job Description  SUMMARY:  Reporting to the Area Sales Manager, the Territory Sales Representative will be primarily responsible for developing target accounts and maintaining and driving new business within the Springfield, MO territory.  Sales Skills  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Leads all sales and account/planning, forecasting, reporting, management efforts for assigned accounts within territory Understands, assesses, and anticipates customers’ objectives, strategies, and requirements to identify and pursue sales opportunities Acquires new customers to maximize supply center revenue Responsible for escalated customer service issue follow-up, but not the primary contact point for issue resolution Management/Leadership Works closely with supply center and corporate resource to have them enter & fulfill orders Strong knowledge of the AMI sales process and policies (e.g., accruals, credit, expenses, rewards) Acts as a mentor for Sales Representatives Product/Market Brings core product specification knowledge, application, and value to the customer Understands necessary building codes and how they impact AMI products Reads blueprints and understands take-off capabilities for core products Sells remodeling, new construction, project work, and ISS Must be able to accurately and professionally demo all core products to small and large groups Must be able to accurately and professionally demo all core products to small and medium groups Understands the basics of negotiating correct market value pricing for the assigned territory, and seeks advice from the Area Sales Leader or Sr. Sales Manager Qualifications  EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE: Successful sales history with a minimum of 2 years of outside sales experience. Experience within the building materials industry is highly preferred. Bachelor's degree preferred Self-directed, highly organized, customer-focused, detail oriented, and competitive Working knowledge of core building material products (specifically windows & siding) for both single and multi-family applications Proven experience in new business selling, upselling, and selling Preferred experience working with builders and architects to create bigger ticket sales Additional Information  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.  Recruiters: Please note that Associated Materials, Alside and any of its affiliated companies does not seek or accept unsolicited resumes or offers of recruiting service associated with any published or unpublished employment opportunities. Any unsolicited information sent to AMI or any of its employees will be considered as unencumbered and free from any fee or charge whatsoever. Only members of our Human Resources Team have authority to engage or authorize recruiting services. Any questions regarding recruiting services of any kind must be sent to jobs at associatedmaterials dot com  #Indeed5-Alside

Position: Territory Sales Manager Ideal Location: Miami, Florida  Territory Sales Manager is entrusted with cultivating long term customer relationships and being a valuable, individual contributor to the organizations overall success and revenue expansion. This entails creating sustainable, profitable growth by increasing penetration and profitability of existing accounts within the assigned geographic territory. Responsibilities include increasing market share through prospecting, building relationships, post sales implementation and account maintenance.   The position is actively involved in the sale of clinically differentiated products in four segments: aerosol drug delivery, respiratory therapy, sleep diagnostics, and anesthesia breathe detection. The Territory Sales Manager will exceed their sales quota by delivering increased profitability, while focusing on revenue growth and increased customer satisfaction. The Territory Sales Manager will execute the company's brand strategy and tactics within the assigned customer segment, which may include members of GPO’s, large hospital systems/IDNs, HME and certain targeted alternate site healthcare facilities.  The Territory Sales Manager will influence clinical and non-clinical stakeholders within assigned institutions, to support the use of SunMed products for the treatment or diagnosis of relevant disease states. The Territory Sales Manager approaches each customer with a total account management perspective, leveraging resources appropriately, collaborating with business partners and accurately articulating the value proposition for the customer, to include key stakeholders, such as Anesthesiologists, Pulmonologists, Respiratory Therapists and Critical Care Nursing.  ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES The following includes the essential duties and responsibilities; however others may be added or changed as the need arises: Aggressively create awareness, trial and usage for specialty respiratory and airway consumables, while assisting distributor partners in properly positioning and growing the product line.  Effective selling skills, in-depth clinical and business expertise are necessary. Expand existing business through current customer base and target accounts to include GPO, IDN, individual hospital and alternate care accounts. Competency in planning, prioritizing, monitoring, and tracking all sales cycle events, while presenting the clinical benefits of our products to individuals and committees. Build brand loyalty and customer satisfaction. Promote utilization through the use of tools and programs. Track, report and analyze sales opportunities on a routine basis. Responsible for forecasting, monitoring, and posting sales activities for the respective territory.  QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS   To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform essential duties satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  Bachelor's degree or equivalent with 5 years relevant sales experience   Minimum of four years related sales experience selling medical products in a hospital or alternate care environment. Respiroatory and Anthestia product exp highly desired. Ability to travel 60% of the time Experience calling on multi-departmental hospital functional leaders at the account and IDN level is important. Must be proficient in presenting to both individuals and committees. A demonstrated track record of meeting and exceeding sales objectives using a disciplined Value-Based and Consultative Sales Process. Previous experience with team selling is preferred. Understanding the Group Purchasing Organization (GPO) and Integrated Delivery Network (IDN) landscape. Proficient in developing distributor/business partner relationships. Proficient in developing independent manufacturer’s rep groups.  Personal development is a critical aspect of the position!  REASONING ABILITY: Demonstrated business acumen and knowledge of sales processes, as well as, strong decision-making abilities. OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES: Strong organization, presentation and strategic planning skills Track record of building and maintaining long-terms customer relationships Ability to problem solve and make effective decisions Ability to travel within designated geography with up to 60% overnight travel Proven product knowledge in business area with understanding of sales process Strong business acumen and excellent negotiation, communication, influencing, business planning and sales strategy development traits are paramount. Solid process orientation and the ability to perform multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment. Outstanding time management and organizational expertise. Ability to work in a fast-paced, deadline driven environment. Proficiency with MS Office software (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook), contact management software, and the Internet  PHYSICAL DEMANDS Job requires individual to spend at least 60% of time traveling. Job requires individual to drive extensively in the territory. Job requires occasional weekend travel (tradeshows, meetings, etc.). Job requires individual to spend significant amount of time working on a personal computer.  WORK ENVIRONMENT Working environment is dynamic. Work is normally performed in a client based environment. Client based environment include hospitals, surgery centers, operating rooms, and homecare businesses.   Quality Policy At SunMed, Quality is our promise. It is our commitment to customer satisfaction and our dedication to product excellence in an evolving global healthcare market. This promise is kept through a continuously improving and effective Quality Management System and compliance to Regulatory Requirements Apply Now

OMCO Roll Forming Plus is in need of a proven Sales Management Professional to fill its National Sales Manager position. This person is a key contributor to the success of the company and having a strong background in manufacturing or industrial products is important. The National Sales Manager will lead OMCO’s effort in continuing its outstanding position as a leader in the Custom Roll Forming industry. This position is actively involved with all departments within the company and requires excellent team management skills.  Responsibilities: ·        Oversee Corporate Sales Effort to achieve annual growth objectives. ·        Develop and implement sales strategies to achieve sales goals corporate-wide and within specific target markets. ·        Establish and maintain professional relationships with key personnel at major accounts. ·        Coordinate Sales Plan with Corporate Marketing Program to maximize results. ·        Develop plans targeting specific market segments and key prospects within and outside of those markets. ·        Maximize benefits from utilizing Salesforce.com. ·        Communicate with sales team, engineering and customer service to resolve technical and commercial issues with customers. ·        Provide monthly, quarterly and annual forecasts ·        Provide additional reports as required   Requirements: ·        A minimum of 10 years successfully managing sales in an industrial manufacturing environment; metal forming industry experience is a plus. ·        Excellent communication, presentation and negotiation skills ·        Analytical skills along with a problem-solving approach ·        Strong work ethic and customer service attitude ·        Bachelor Degree in Business, Engineering or relevant field. Advanced degree preferred. ·        Skilled in the use of Microsoft Office Suite and CRM software packages. ·        Ability to travel as needed (20 % travel) This position reports to the Corporate Office in Wickliffe, OH. This is not a remote position.  Compensation: ·        Competitive Salary plus Bonus ·        Auto Allowance plus Travel Expenses (20% Travel) ·      401(k) with matching, Dental insurance, Employee assistance program, Health insurance, Life insurance, Paid time off

Sunday Riley Modern Skincare is looking for an experienced Account Executive to join our field team to build our business in the North Los Angeles market.   The Account Executive generates & increases in-store sales through relationship building, impactful store visits, training, and events. Success in this role is achieved by positive team morale, team development, strong store relationships, and consistently increasing sales performance in all assigned stores.   The ideal candidate must have strong selling skills, outstanding communication skills, best-in-class customer service, and a passion for learning. All applicants must be a team player and have cosmetics experience.   Key Job Responsibilities:  Sell and educate in stores and manage / coach a team of Retail Sales Specialists to hit and exceed sales goals for the territory  Strategize and maximize personal and team schedules to drive the business. Develop and maximize store visit call cycle for self and direct reports.  Activate corporate-approved education and event initiatives and exceed sales goals  Coach and develop direct reports Develop and build strong relationships with retail partners  Support recruiting, interviewing, and onboarding  Collaborate with Regional Sales Manager to build impactful store-by-store action plans to address store needs and support sales goals regionally  Must have a passion for skincare and the Brand  Work Location:  5-day work week, total of 40 hours. Weekends are required. Monthly travel may be required depending on territory size  It is expected that 32 hours a week will be spent in the field   Other Duties: Please note this is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.  Perks:  Competitive salary  Vacation days  Paid holidays  401k  Life Insurance Health/dental/vision benefits  Physical Demands:  The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.  While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to stand; walk; sit; apply products on clients; reach with hands and arms; climb stairs; talk or hear.   Preferred Qualification and Experience:  Minimum of 3 years of retail, sales and/or beauty industry experience, preferably in the skincare industry at the AE or AC level Memorable, positive, professional, and enthusiastic presence  Strong aptitude for product knowledge, brand messaging, training, and selling  Ability to manage multiple calendars and multi-store visits  Excellent oral, written, and presentation skills; email and phone skills essential  Ability to take strategic direction based on sales and business analysis  Basic computer skills a must- Microsoft Word, Outlook, Excel, Teams, T-Sheets scheduling app  Self-motivated, committed and goal-oriented  Energetic and passionate with an entrepreneurial, flexible spirit  Ability to travel required  Driver’s license a plus (in most cases a necessity)  Flexibility regarding work hours, i.e. weekend  Equal Opportunity Employer:  Sunday Riley actively creates a culture of inclusivity and respects that diversity in the workplace leads to a positive and stronger team. It is our policy to provide equal opportunity for all employees, contractors, and prospective employees, regardless of race, color, national origin, age, pregnancy, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, disability, genetic information, or any other criteria protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

The ideal candidate will be disciplined and have experience in the selling of designer eyewear to optical offices across a 3 state region. This candidate should be comfortable with everyday travel and be able to generate new sales leads on a regular basis. The candidate should be able to manage their own territory like it was their own company.  An experienced sales representative in the optical field is preferred. Established relationships is a plus!  Responsibilities Establish and maintain relationships with current clients Generate potential leads for future sales, cold calling Set and exceed quotas Communicate effectively Manage an established territory and be self motivated  Qualifications Bachelor's degree preferred 2- 5 years of sales experience preferred Strong work ethic and communication skills Ability to travel and make sales calls in Maine, New Hampshire and Vermont

Description  Sales Rep: ShopLocal  Are you the right sales person to help build a major new Amazon business? Amazon ShopLocal is a new selling model where local retailers can list and sell their selection on Amazon inside the local markets they serve. Launched in 2018, we are now expanding this business broadly, and it is dependent on innovation and scaling through this newly formed sales organization.  Imagine the opportunity to be part of an agile sales team that reaches a global audience, while supporting local businesses. Imagine working on a cutting-edge new sales team, where every team member is a critical voice in the decision-making process. Imagine being able to leverage the resources of Amazon within the atmosphere of a start-up. Welcome to Amazon ShopLocal, where everyone on our team has an impact on delivering a better experience to our Customers. It is still Day 1 for this exciting venture within the Amazon ecosystem of customer-centric products and we are quickly executing on the global opportunity to bring offline commerce to Amazon.com. At Amazon we work hard, have fun and make history.  Members of the ShopLocal sales team are expected to meet or exceed their goals while focusing on the customer. Individual contributors on this team have a track record of success at driving top sales results, partnering cross-functionally, and thriving in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Our sales professionals operate successfully in an ambiguous environment and maintain a desire to share best practices to continuously evolve processes throughout our organization. Strong communication and presentation skills, as well as an ability to navigate CRM tools, are essential for success in our organization.  If you thrive solving hard, diverse problems in a start-up environment, this is the role for you!  Daily Responsibilities Cultivate relationships with local sellers/decision makers in your territory Create and maintain a robust sales pipeline Analyze sales/metrics data from your territory to help evolve your sales strategy Exceed sales targets and activity metrics Ensure that our sellers receive the highest level of sales and operational customer service Contribute to an exciting and evolving sales culture and influence product improvements  Basic Qualifications  BASIC QUALIFICATIONS 5+ year sales experience Proven track record of consistent territory growth and quota obtainment Proven track record of success in a high activity sales role Ability to conduct in-person and telephone meetings with sellers Comfort with ambiguity and the ability to adjust strategies in a rapidly evolving business environment Excellent oral and written communication skills and an ability to influence others internally and externally Bachelor’s degree required  Preferred Qualifications  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Experience with retail, e-commerce, and SMB level sellers Experience working with engineering and product teams to influence product improvements Experience driving results in cross-functional organizations Ability to work in an ambiguous and deadline-driven work environment Demonstrated passion for delivering a great customer experience Field sales experience Experience with sales CRM tools such as Salesforce Amazon.com is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Women / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.   Company - Amazon.com Services LLC  Job ID: A1760437
industries: Computer Software, Information Technology and Services, and Internet

description: Summary of Position: OYO is a high growth, disruptive and technology-led business that is transforming the era of the hospitality industry. The Business Development Manager (“BDM”) is OYO’s central sales position, which has as the primary duty the making sales and obtaining orders for OYO’s proprietary suite of services. This work is performed customarily and regularly in the field, including at hotel properties.  Essential Functions: Prospecting and qualifying leads through cold calling, e-mail, and face to face meetings Frequent travel (3 - 4 days per week) within sales territory to hotel properties to meet with property owners, solicit sales and obtain orders for OYO’s proprietary suite of services Drive new revenue by analyzing key market trends and real estate developments in the BDM’s assigned territory, identifying new hotel and hospitality leads through research and relationships, and updating internal software to add quality supply to the pipeline Negotiate deals to close consistent with OYO guidelines, and in a manner that leverages internal resources to create a mutually-profitable business relationship Develop territory plans, establish rapport and form long-term relationships with property owners and other key stakeholders from initial lead generation through sale, transformation, and “go-live” date of property Other duties as assigned  Qualifications: Minimum 3 years of experience in sales or business development, preferably in the hospitality industry Ability to work, cold call, prospect, negotiate, and close deals as an individual contributor Reliable access to a motor vehicle and acceptable driving record; current, valid driver’s license appropriate for the vehicle; insurance appropriate for the vehicle Demonstrated success with structuring and negotiating complex deals, and solving business problems.  Business-savvy with a sales-oriented mindset that will help establish OYO as a key technology-driven hotel network in an ethical manner Successful track record as a self-starter; internally motivated, organized, and disciplined Bachelor’s, Associate, or other post-high school degree, or comparable work experience, preferred Intermediate to Expert proficiency with CRM systems, G Suite and Microsoft Office products including: Docs/Word, Sheets/Excel, Slides/PowerPoint, and other SaaS business tools Knowledge of local hospitality associations and pre established relationships with hotel owners is preferred

McKesson requires new employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 as defined by the CDC, subject to applicable, verified accommodation requests.  McKesson Corporation is a Fortune 8 company and is one of the largest providers of healthcare supply chain management solutions, retail pharmacy, medical & pharmaceutical supplies, healthcare technology, community oncology and specialty care in the United States with revenues of $231 billion in 2020. The company was founded in 1833 by John McKesson and Charles Olcott in New York with a focus on importing and wholesaling pharmaceutical products. United by our ICARE shared principles, McKesson's 80,000 employees work together every day to make better care possible around the globe - one product, one partner, one patient at a time.  Area Sales Manager  Area Sales Manager covering assigned region within the Post-Acute Care market segment. Preferred candidates will live in Texas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, or Kansas (Texas is preferred to provide better daily access to territory).  This high-profile position will have full P&L responsibility for a region generating over $90M in revenue. Expectations are to grow both new and existing business by directing the sales activities of 12 outside sales representatives, developing strategic business plans, establishing and monitoring sales goals, developing close relationships with key accounts, internal stakeholders and supporting teams such as Inside Sales, Gov't Sales, Clinical Support and Field Service.  Primary Responsibilities Create strategies to obtain new customers and market penetration within the SNF, ALF, Hospice and Home Health Agency space Hands on development of field reps via traveling within the sales region and visits with customers to ensure service levels are being met Provide reps with the resources they need to service and close business Hire, train and develop sales reps Performance management Achieve financial goals and other goals as assigned by the business Minimum Requirements  9+ years of professional sales experience and 1+ years of supervisory or management experience  Critical Skills Experience selling to C-suite Financial acumen Mature confidence and self-awareness (can influence others diplomatically) Demonstrated performance management skills Demonstrated sales leadership skills Proficiency with Excel, Power Point, Outlook, SFDC and Power BI Ability to travel daily within assigned region Additional Knowledge & Skills Experience in distribution sales. Demonstrated success in building and growing a new region / territory. Prior healthcare experience is preferred. Education  Bachelor's Degree in Business, Marketing or related field or equivalent experience  Physical Requirements Must have valid driver's license and acceptable driving record Large amount of computer-based work Must be authorized to work in the US. Sponsorship is not available for this position.  We take pride in our culture of connection and believe in a workplace where everyone can be their full, authentic self. We welcome and encourage veterans, individuals with disabilities and others with diverse perspectives to join our growing team. Your unique perspective and experience are valuable assets that can translate into a rewarding career path with us. Apply to join our team and help shape the future of healthcare!  McKesson is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.Qualified applicants will not be disqualified from consideration for employment based upon criminal history.  McKesson is committed to being an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers including job seekers with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation to assist with your job search or application for employment, please contact us by sending an email to McKessonTalentAcquisition@mckesson.com . Resumes or CVs submitted to this email box will not be accepted.  Current employees must apply through the internal career site.  Join us at McKesson!

description: Regional Vice President of Sales--Cogent Analytics  SUMMARY--A Primarily Remote Position, seeking Candidates in the following markets: Philadelphia, Columbia SC, Tampa, Kansas City, Lincoln NE, Syracuse  This is a FULL COMMISSION OPPORTUNITY Primarily responsible for new client origination through consistent phone prospecting and lead generation, professional pipeline management, and the remote meeting and selling of the President/CEO/Ownership Team. Secondary responsibilities include current and past client relationship management, implementation of territory management strategies, situational in-person meetings, and collaborative selling with either teammates or management. The successful Regional Vice President will proactively and intentionally manage their time to achieve new client origination goals and revenue objectives. COMPETENCIES REQUIRED •        Integrity – Operates with strong moral principles, choosing to do the right thing on behalf of those we represent. •        Discipline – Self-starting; journey to achieve excellence is motivated by habit, internal drive, and content of character above external rewards and consequences.  •        Energy – Displays vigor when attacking problems, able to improve team atmosphere, eliciting collaboration and inspired behavior. •        Oral Communication – Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations; responds well to questions; participates actively in all company meetings. •        Interpersonal – Listens to others without interrupting and holds eye contact; remains open to others’ ideas and tries new things. Respects boundaries and understands the nuance of interaction and conversation. •        Results Driven – Serious about committing and getting to results. Exemplifies this ability through sound decision-making, backed by logic, understanding contingency planning, with an attitude toward appropriate prioritization and effort. •        Perseverance – Consistent in one’s effort to achieve the mission, views obstacles and barriers as opportunities to learn and meets them with tenacity. •        Teamwork – Puts success of team above own interests; able to build morale and group commitments to goals and objectives; recognizes accomplishments of other team members. QUALIFICATIONS  To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: 1.      Consistent and intentional daily prospecting through phone calls to companies in the Cogent Analytics database. 2.      Professional pipeline management. 3.      Regular communication of activity results with management to identify high value opportunities. 4.      Punctuality with all appointments. 5.      Identify challenges and opportunities in the client organization. Create tangible and quantifiable wants or desires in the client’s business. 6.      Emotionally connect with clients and influence client behavior to effectuate change. 7.      Challenge the status quo that exists within client organizations and be professionally assertive to secure new client engagements. 8.      Embrace the sales structure provided to efficiently obtain new clients. 9.     Participate in departmental training as specified by assigned Assistant Director or Managing Director of Business Development 10.  Follow all other internal department and company procedures   OTHER REQUIREMENTS 1.      Two years of sales experience with a proven track record of delivering results. 2.      Ability to communicate in English, both written and verbal. 3.      Ability to travel onsite with clients when required. 4.      Ability to operate remotely in a home office, with the appropriate technological equipment and capabilities. 5.      Valid state issues driver’s license and current auto insurance. 6.      Advanced computer skills with Microsoft Suite, and the ability to learn CRM specifics quickly. 7.      Prior business ownership. (not required, but encouraged) 8.      MBA or other Business Degree. (not required, but encouraged)  We value the service and commitment made by our veterans and welcome them to join our company. This job description is intended to describe the general nature, complexity, and level of work to be performed by team member assigned to this position and is not to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties and/or skills required. It does not prescribe or restrict the work that may be assigned.  We are an equal opportunity employer. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type and affords equal employment opportunities to our team and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

QuaverEd, Inc., with headquarters on Music Row in Nashville, TN, is an education company committed to equipping teachers around the world with high-quality resources for an engaged, interactive, and Seriously Fun™ classroom! Quaver’s Family of Programs adds value to today’s classrooms with high-quality technology-based teaching materials for educators and students.   QuaverEd is seeking an experienced sales professional to join our dynamic sales team. The position must work out of our offices in Nashville with approximately 30-40% overnight travel (heavy during school convention seasons with no travel during winter holiday breaks). All sales travel and related conference travel and materials expenses are paid by QuaverEd. The successful sales team member at Quaver demonstrates a record of professional achievement, high energy, and the ability to interact with teachers, school counselors, district administrators, and other district-level administrative personnel. Our best sales directors are proficient at understanding the structure, decision-making process, and long sales cycle in the education market. The ideal candidate is competitive and driven to meet and exceed annual goals. He or she is a self-starter who is organized and comfortable working independently while also being a team member. A proven track record of effective project management is needed for this position.  NECESSARY SKILLS: Must have a passion for hunting for new business opportunities Ability to establish and expand relationships with key administrators and decision-makers Possess excellent in-person presentation skills for small and large groups A fast learner with a genuine enthusiasm for the education market Adept at prospecting skills such as networking and cold calling to generate leads Managing time effectively and profitably A desire for performance-driven compensation  REQUIREMENTS: Please submit a brief cover letter demonstrating why want this position 4-year degree and 5-7 years career experience, including 2 or more years of successful sales experience Self-motivation and project management skills must be demonstrated Valid Driver’s License and a good driving record. Given the nature of our business with schools, the candidate must possess a clean criminal background check.  EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree Sales experience required Education Sales background a plus   Please apply with a cover letter and 3 references through Indeed.  If you do not meet our requirements but feel confident in your abilities and/or experience, please apply anyway.   QuaverEd, Inc. offers an excellent benefits package with two weeks paid vacation to start, 12 paid holidays, 60 hours of sick leave, subsidized health care up to $7,200 per year, subsidized life insurance, a 401(k) program with no participation fees, and a collegial, supporting atmosphere.  QuaverEd, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, age, or genetic information.

Job Description  LOCATION: Seattle, Washington  Welcome to Holland America Line, a premium cruise line dedicated to explorers, foodies and music lovers who want to explore the world on perfectly sized, refreshingly spacious ships filled with one-of-a-kind experiences.  We’re looking for an amazing sales professional to fill this role, which is based in our Seattle office. You’ll be responsible for driving and expanding charter and incentive group sales efforts for Holland America Line to meet sales and revenue goals .  Here’s a summary of what Holland America Line is looking for in its BDM, Charter & Incentive Sales. Is this you?  Responsibilities Meet and exceed annual revenue targets for full-ship charters and incentive groups. Prospect and develop incremental business from new sources not currently doing business with Holland America Line. Maintain strong and effective relationships with all existing house accounts and legacy charterers. Conduct regular sales calls to existing charter and incentive accounts with a focus to drive future-year charter commitments. Issue charter and incentive group quotes, negotiate terms, and issue contracts to clients to maximize yield. Maintain effective internal communications and liaise with other departments including product marketing/revenue, inventory, itinerary planning, port operations and shore operations as needed. Develop and execute all charter and incentive-related marketing including collateral, newsletter generation and website presence. Represent Holland America Line at industry trade shows and industry functions. Assist in resolution of client conflicts/opportunities. Requirements Bachelor’s degree preferred. 5+ years of sales management experience with direct experience selling charters & incentive groups. Strong sales acumen with ability to pursue long-range deals who recognizes and pursues new opportunities Expert negotiator Exemplifies brand profile Analytical acumen to assess and negotiate strong NTR/APD Strong communication skills (verbal and written) Strong presentation skills with ability to engage and to present to senior executives Self-starter, team player and able to work independently Benefits Cruise and Travel Privileges for You and Your family Health Benefits 401(k) Employee Stock Purchase Plan Training & Professional Development Rewards & Incentives Our Culture…Stronger Together  Our highest responsibility and top priority is compliance, environmental protection and the health, safety and well-being of our guests, the people in the communities we touch and serve, and our shipboard and shoreside employees. Please visit our site to learn more about our Culture Essentials, Corporate Vision Statement and our Core Values at: https://www.hollandamerica.com/en_US/our-company/mission-values.html  Holland America is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.  Americans With Disabilities Act (ADA)  Holland America will provide reasonable accommodations with the application process, upon your request, as required to comply with applicable laws. If you have a disability and require assistance in this application process, please contact recruiting@hollandamericagroup.com  #HAL

ILT Inläsningstjänst/ ILT Education is the Nordic region’s leading edtech company, active in seven markets. With us, you can work in an international environment selling services that are suitable from preschool to adult education and support our vision “Everyone should have an equal opportunity to gain knowledge and information”. We are passionate about our products that make a difference for many children and students.  In the role as Regional Sales Manager for Polylino, a multilingual digital book solution, you will sell directly to preschools and schools and be responsible for achieving our goals by independently and proactively closing new business. You work from your home office in the United States and you report to the Director, North America.  The Polylino service was founded in Sweden (under the name Polyglutt) and is used by over 70% of Sweden’s preschools. After expanding our service to Norway, Finland, Germany, Switzerland and Austria, we are growing fast in these markets. This opportunity is part of an active international expansion.  The role: Identify new leads and build a client database in the USA Document sales activities, prepare accurate reports, forecasts and perform other tasks necessary to drive sales revenue Conduct sales presentations Work with internal departments such as the Marketing or Product teams to engage audiences and clients more deeply Meet and exceed KPIs and sales targets Possess deep knowledge of business product offering and value proposition  To be successful, we believe you: Are a dedicated sales person with a proven track record Are fluent in English Are results-oriented and are comfortable with a high level of activity A team player who is happy to share your experience and knowledge Enjoy being “on the go” with customers when needed and feel comfortable having customer meetings via Zoom, Google Meet, Microsoft Teams, etc. Are highly motivated with a genuine drive to succeed Are willing and happy to travel  We offer you: The possibility to be part of a fast growing brand in the USA, competitive salary and benefits, opportunity to sell a service that contributes to the wellbeing of all children, the possibility to work with a highly motivated team in an open atmosphere, work from home and Work-Life Balance.  How to apply: If you think you are the right candidate for us, send your CV with cover letter to: info@ilteducation.com. Interviews are ongoing, but we welcome your application! ILT Inläsningstjänst is a market-leading supplier of special educational tools in Sweden with a focus on students with reading and writing difficulties. Our goal is to offer all students an equal education and we have a unique position in the market. Read more at www.inlasningstjanst.se. Polylino is a digital picture book service, working with language development and literature in preschool. Children can develop their love of reading in over 60 languages by engaging with fun, diverse and interactive books in the app. Read more at www.polylino.com. ILT is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability or age. ILT is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

The candidate must have a significant experience in contract manufacturing sales and a solid network of product developers and buyers in the beauty industry. This position requires extensive networking and management skills. The candidate should have strong abilities to conduct innovation presentations in person and virtually.     2. Required Experience: 7-10 years of experience in Cosmetic OEM/ODM sales or project management (Marketing & Sales) 3-5 years in managerial role required Cosmetic Product Development / Project Management     3. Core Competencies/Skills: Excellent written/verbal, time management, and quantitative skills Proven ability to manage multiple projects in a dynamic environment Entrepreneurial attitude and proactive mindset Strong work ethic, high energy level, motivation and enthusiasm Demonstrated positive attitude, sees challenge as opportunities and translates them into actionable items   4. Education: Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent required Written and Spoken Korean language abilities a plus     5.Duties & Responsibilities: This position will report to the COO (based in South Korea), and will be responsible, but not limited to the following activities: Recruit and hire capable sales staff including sales support and project management team Engage in sales opportunities, establishing a strong market presence of Bonne’s OEM/ODM capabilities Propose and maintain a budget for the US office, including but not limited to maintaining managerial responsibilities for personnel, such as PTO, performance evaluations, and benefits; establishing an office space; and conducting business related responsibilities as needed Build a strong relationship and grow revenues from new and existing accounts Visit cosmetic brands(buyers) on a regularly basis, including travel if required Utilize and manage sales pipeline in the CRM system   6.Salary $80,000+ negotiable based on experience Performance based bonus Medical benefits will be considered

YORK® Solution™ and YORK® Custom Air Handling Units, by Johnson Controls, provide design flexibility that balances performance and economy without compromising quality. With a full line of standard, semi-custom and custom air handling units to choose from, we have a system perfectly aligned to any building's needs and budget. This is a remote position with preference for applicants who reside in the Northeast United States. What You Will Do  Under direction of the Director of Sales, Applied Product Sales—BSNA Channel, profitably grows the York brands of Custom Air Handling (YC) and Standard Solution (XT) products. Coordinates with BSNA channel sales leadership to set volume objectives. Develops and implements activities and strategies to continually increase top line revenue, maximize margins and increase market share.  Work with the BSNA Channel sales team to provide engineered support, selections, and equipment pricing. Develops and provides detailed engineering information to communicate design, configuration, operation, and installation requirements to consulting engineers. The Regional Sales Manager ~ AHU will also collaborate with the Channel Sales Director, Product Director, and fellow Regional Sales Manager teammates with sales responsibility for the Johnson Control, York, and Metasys brands of products through the BSNA branch channel to deploy new product offerings and ensures they are informed and trained on the products, features, value proposition, and pricing. Operates with the highest business ethics.  How You Will Do It Drive sales by providing technical sales support to customers, branches, agents, and consulting engineers, with an ability to identify relevant opportunities and act on them quickly to drive sales. Turn around jobs efficiently and accurately with an understanding of the consequences of incorrect product design. Provide pricing support, including competitive budget pricing of non-standard options, to the field sales organization for YC. Manage projects from concept to shipment and follow-up regularly to ensure projects are completed expeditiously. Continually be informed on industry trends, standards, and competition. Assist the field sales organization in providing specification and competitive analysis. Provide technical application support to the field sales organization on all aspects of YC. Assist the field sales organization in developing YC unit layouts and configurations to support the consulting engineer’s design process. Provide written specifications and produce simple sketches and dimensional footprints of YC to support consulting engineer’s design process Coordinate customer requests with factory for submittal documents, including quality AutoCAD drawings and special quotations. At times, produce AutoCAD drawing independently Assist the field sales/operations organizations in developing engineering release documents for manufacturing Awareness of how HVAC equipment, such as chillers and controls, systematically interface. Work with air handling unit component vendors during the design and pricing process. Develop technical documents to support field sales on various areas of air handling application as necessary. Determine best techniques/procedures/theories and apply them to analysis, design and/or research of air handling products. Use complex problem-solving techniques requiring regular use of ingenuity and creativity. Be proficient at extrapolating ideas into product requirements within engineering requirements, manufacturing processes and limitations. Provide occasional technical application support to the field sales organization on all aspects of standard XT Air Handling units. Additional Responsibilities Maintain updated reports and status of each project, including sales forecasting. Review and analyze engineering rules and documents as necessary. Recommend cost savings and value engineering ideas for YC. Provide application training, as required, on YC for the field sales organization. Collaborate with all other BSNA product channels to collectively drive sales. Required  What we look for: Bachelor’s degree in engineering 7+ years HVAC systems and applications experience preferably with Custom or Commercial Air Handling Units. Demonstrated analytical skills and computer skills to include: Advanced AutoCAD proficiency, Microsoft office suite. Excellent organizational skills, follow-through, and attention to detail. Ability to recognize sales opportunities. Interpersonal skills to effectively communicate with internal customers. Johnson Controls International plc. is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, genetic information, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by law. For more information, please view EEO is the Law. If you are an individual with a disability and you require an accommodation during the application process, please visit www.johnsoncontrols.com/careers.
