description: JOB TITLE: National Account Manager  SUMMARY: The National Account Manager is responsible for differentiating and selling Cuisine Solutions products, establishing its value proposition with goal of driving profitable sales for assigned sales channel.  EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Culinary Arts or related field; at least 5 years of demonstrable experience with regional and or national accounts with proven relationships in the food industry; analytical skills with deep understanding of pricing and P&L impact of sales decisions; ability to quickly assess business situation, identify and use needed resources to drive successful sales; ability to work with external and internal clients in a courteous and professional manner ; excellent analytical, organizational, interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills; proven customer acquisition, development, and retention skills; ability to successfully execute duties in a responsible and responsive manner ; possess self-management skills with a high degrees of discipline and personal accountability; ability to work independently as well as a team player.  JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:  Successful execution of Cuisine Solutions objectives in assigned sales channel. Develop sales, marketing plans and forecasts for retail brands, restaurant chains or foodservice accounts by utilizing sales and culinary expertise. Responsible for generating, developing, and expanding sales in new and existing retail brands, restaurant chains or foodservice accounts while aggressively seeking new accounts. Call on existing and prospective customers, generating sales while ensuring customer satisfaction at all times. Work closely with Chief Commercial Officer to develop sales strategies. Collaborate with R& D to develop products which meet customers' needs. Manage expense budget and control expenses effectively. Develop systems and support processes to create opportunities and improve assigned business segment. Conduct product demonstrations and create business plans based on a customer's needs and objectives with the assistance of Cuisine Solutions world-class culinary team. Educate customers on technical aspects of products. Monitor and analyze competition in addition to regular market research to keep abreast of industry trends and market conditions. Report pertinent information to management.  BENEFITS Medical, dental and vision Insurance 401(k) Life and Disability Insurance Paid Vacation & Sick leave Paid Holidays  Cuisine Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

jobTitle: APPLICATION SALES REPRESENTATIVE - HOSPITALITY GLOBAL BUSINESS UNIT (FLORIDA)
description: APPLICATION SALES REPRESENTATIVE - HOSPITALITY GLOBAL BUSINESS UNIT TERRITORY: Florida  The Application Sales Representative - Hospitality Global Business Unit is an outside Sales Executive role focused on selling both our Hospitality Property Management Solution along with our Point of Sale Solution to the Independent Hotel Market. The Independent Hotel Market is mainly made up of hotels and resorts that do not carry a large brand or flag (such as Marriott, Hilton, Hyatt, etc.).  Preferred Qualifications Join the successful North America sales team growing Oracle Hospitality’s presence in the hotel sector. We are seeking high-performance sales people with a passion for helping leading hotel brands via technology. You will raise your industry profile while selling solutions based on leading Oracle Hospitality cloud, software and hardware technology and services, enabling our hotel customers to deliver exceptional guest service and drive revenue.  The ideal candidate will have at least five years of field sales or sales management experience, ideally in hospitality software solutions. We are looking for sales professionals capable of leading successful client acquisition in competitive settings and who have a track record of achieving annual and quarterly sales targets. Strong sales candidates with deep experience in resort, hotel or restaurant operations, IT or finance are also encouraged to apply. Specific experience with Oracle Hospitality products such as Opera Property Management and Simphony Point of Sale, or experience with products from other technology suppliers in our industry, is a plus. Knowledge of the payment industry is valued. A basic understanding computer industry technology and terminology, such as Cloud, operating systems, applications, database, networking, hardware, consulting and support, is helpful in this position. A commitment to grow your knowledge is important.  Successful candidates develop strong relationships with prospective customer teams, ensuring mutual partnership throughout the relationship. You will develop solution proposals encompassing all aspects of our offering. Lead our team in the development, presentation and delivery of the value proposition. Identify and develop strategic alignment with key third party influencers. Negotiate pricing and contractual agreement to close the sale. Work with Oracle Hospitality consulting, support and partners to ensure seamless hand-off and delivery of the project. The candidate will have excellent attention to detail, a strong sense of teamwork and the ability to learn complex systems and processes quickly. You will be comfortable working in a large technology organization. You will maintain a complex daily work schedule, fulfilling commitments and obligations, and meet or exceed revenue goals. Successful candidates are goal-driven self-starters, manage well under pressure and enjoy a high volume transactional sales cycle. Demonstrable experience drafting professional, business quality correspondence is expected. Experience with sales forecasting, CRM, Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint is important as you will be using the applications daily.  Travel varies at or above 25-50% based on requirements of the sales cycle and work location.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Hospitality

description: Mazooma is a payments technology company on a mission to simplify payments. As a leading solution in both sports wagering and iGaming, our patented technology can be found on the cashier of industry-leading brands such as DraftKings, BetMGM, theScore, and PartyPoker. In August 2021, Nuvei, a global payment technology provider, acquired Mazooma, giving clients access to an even greater suite of fintech solutions.  Offering a best-in-class experience, seamless integration, state-of-the-art risk management, and secure bank connections, Mazooma creates raving fans of both merchants and consumers. We are looking for world-class people to join us in delivering leading-edge solutions to an industry experiencing exponential growth.  As a Sales Development Rep, you will be responsible for accelerating the distribution of Nuvei’s products with specific focus on the Northern America market by uncovering new opportunities and working with a business development manager to mature those opportunities.  Key Responsibilities: Follow a disciplined approach to forecasting and opportunity management via SFDC and our supporting tools and processes. Develop sales leads by using sales tools with outbound sales prospecting efforts.  Preferred Qualifications: Special consideration given to candidates who have experience in Business Development/Sales/Account Management within global enterprises with a thorough understanding of the payments industry. Significant track record of achievement and success within the targeted field of expertise. Ability to build internal and external relationships to gain and share information such as industry trends.  Minimum Qualifications: Minimum two years’ of sales high growth experience. Pipeline management. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Exceptional relationship-building skills. Fluent in English.  Benefits: A challenging job in a fast developing, international company with an open #peoplefirst culture. Friendly work environment where you can thrive and develop your skills. Career advancement possibilities. Competitive remuneration package.  Mazooma does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, color, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other reason prohibited by law in provision of employment opportunities and benefits.

Summary of Position: OYO is a high growth, disruptive and technology-led business that is transforming the era of the hospitality industry. The Business Development Manager (“BDM”) is OYO’s central sales position, which has as the primary duty the making sales and obtaining orders for OYO’s proprietary suite of services. This work is performed customarily and regularly in the field, including at hotel properties.  Essential Functions: Prospecting and qualifying leads through cold calling, e-mail, and face to face meetings Frequent travel (3 - 4 days per week) within sales territory to hotel properties to meet with property owners, solicit sales and obtain orders for OYO’s proprietary suite of services Drive new revenue by analyzing key market trends and real estate developments in the BDM’s assigned territory, identifying new hotel and hospitality leads through research and relationships, and updating internal software to add quality supply to the pipeline Negotiate deals to close consistent with OYO guidelines, and in a manner that leverages internal resources to create a mutually-profitable business relationship Develop territory plans, establish rapport and form long-term relationships with property owners and other key stakeholders from initial lead generation through sale, transformation, and “go-live” date of property Other duties as assigned  Qualifications: Minimum 3 years of experience in sales or business development, preferably in the hospitality industry Ability to work, cold call, prospect, negotiate, and close deals as an individual contributor Reliable access to a motor vehicle and acceptable driving record; current, valid driver’s license appropriate for the vehicle; insurance appropriate for the vehicle Demonstrated success with structuring and negotiating complex deals, and solving business problems.  Business-savvy with a sales-oriented mindset that will help establish OYO as a key technology-driven hotel network in an ethical manner Successful track record as a self-starter; internally motivated, organized, and disciplined Bachelor’s, Associate, or other post-high school degree, or comparable work experience, preferred Intermediate to Expert proficiency with CRM systems, G Suite and Microsoft Office products including: Docs/Word, Sheets/Excel, Slides/PowerPoint, and other SaaS business tools Knowledge of local hospitality associations and pre established relationships with hotel owners is preferred

Company Description  Alside, a division of Associated Materials (“AM”), is a federally designated essential business and recognized leader in the home improvement industry. Founded in 1947, Alside is a manufacturer and distributor of vinyl siding and accessories, vinyl windows and patio doors, and fencing and railing products for the residential and commercial remodeling and new construction markets. Alside products are distributed to licensed professional remodeling contractors and home builders through our network of over 100 Supply Centers and also through select independent distributors across the U.S. and Canada. We are proud to be a charter member of the Vinyl Siding Institute, the American Association of Architects, the National Association of Home Builders, and the National Association of the Remodeling Industry.  Job Description  SUMMARY:  Reporting to the Area Sales Manager, the individual in this role will be primarily responsible for developing target accounts and maintaining and driving new business within the Boston market.  Sales Skills  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Leads all sales and account/planning, forecasting, reporting, management efforts for assigned accounts within territory Understands, assesses, and anticipates customers’ objectives, strategies, and requirements to identify and pursue sales opportunities Acquires new customers to maximize supply center revenue Responsible for escalated customer service issue follow-up, but not the primary contact point for issue resolution Management/Leadership Works closely with supply center and corporate resource to have them enter & fulfill orders Strong knowledge of the AMI sales process and policies (e.g., accruals, credit, expenses, rewards) Acts as a mentor for Sales Representatives Product/Market Brings core product specification knowledge, application, and value to the customer Understands necessary building codes and how they impact AMI products Reads blueprints and understands take-off capabilities for core products Sells remodeling, new construction, project work, and ISS Must be able to accurately and professionally demo all core products to small and large groups Must be able to accurately and professionally demo all core products to small and medium groups Understands the basics of negotiating correct market value pricing for the assigned territory, and seeks advice from the Area Sales Leader or Sr. Sales Manager Qualifications  Education And Experience Successful sales history with a minimum of 2 years of outside sales experience. Experience within the building materials industry is highly preferred. Bachelor's degree preferred Self-directed, highly organized, customer-focused, detail oriented, and competitive Working knowledge of core building material products (specifically windows & siding) for both single and multi-family applications Proven experience in new business selling, upselling, and selling Preferred experience working with builders and architects to create bigger ticket sales Additional Information  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.  Recruiters: Please note that Associated Materials, Alside and any of its affiliated companies does not seek or accept unsolicited resumes or offers of recruiting service associated with any published or unpublished employment opportunities. Any unsolicited information sent to AMI or any of its employees will be considered as unencumbered and free from any fee or charge whatsoever. Only members of our Human Resources Team have authority to engage or authorize recruiting services. Any questions regarding recruiting services of any kind must be sent to jobs at associatedmaterials dot com

Sony Electronics, Inc. look for the risk-takers, the collaborators, the inspired and the inspirational. We want the people who are brave enough to work at the cutting edge and create solutions that will enrich and improve the lives of people across the globe. So, if you want to make the world say wow, let's talk.  Regional Sales Supervisor – Milwaukee  Description  Sony's Purpose is simple. We aim to fill the world with emotion, through the power of creativity and technology. We want to be responsible for getting hearts racing, stirring ambition, and putting a smile on the faces of our customers. That challenge, combined with our spirit of innovation, motivated us to create groundbreaking technology, entertainment, and services for people worldwide.  Our history as a global brand had been built around employees that all have a passion for touching peoples' lives, and pride in pushing beyond that status quo to produce truly extraordinary results.  Sony Electronics has an exciting full time opportunity for a Brand Representative. If you love entertainment technology, have great retail experience and love to talk to a wide variety of audiences, then we want to hear from you! This role will focus on locations in and around Milwaukee, WI.  We are seeking a highly skilled professional capable of creating a positive environment for Sony products at retail. You are someone who can build rapport with different audiences and create Sony advocacy first and foremost. You are also someone that maximizes product sales by supporting a group of retail locations with interactive installations/maintenance, product education, display installation/maintenance, and data collection as well as others as needed. You love training and educating both associates and customers. You love entertainment technology, and bringing the Sony Experience to your community.  The ideal candidate will live within or near Milwaukee, WI.  Responsibilities Developing and maintaining beneficial retail relationships. Creating and maintaining in-store advocacy for the brand. Analyzing daily/weekly sales data to plan and execute sales improvements. Educating store personnel on Sony and how to sell the Sony product line effectively. Coach and support vendor provided and third party in-store labor. Supporting retail sales through creative merchandising presentation, visual displays and in store promotions, including Point of Purchase (POP) materials. Monitoring product inventory and ensuring product is placed on the selling floor. Resetting, maintaining and installing different product displays and interactive display kiosks. Conducting consumer demonstration and directly assisting consumers as needed by answering their questions and providing solutions. Gathering, summarizing, and reporting on field and channel feedback and insights Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in a related field Proven and successful track record in sales, retail, or merchandising environment Previous experience supervising/managing a team is preferred Willingness to learn new and exciting features and technologies and the ability to simplify and teach a message to others including consumers Must be able to work weekends/nights for launch events, sales events and training events. This may include events such as CES, CEDIA, etc. and may also include training events outside store hours. Visual merchandising experience a plus Sales focused with the ability to influence others to execute your strategies Excellent communication and interpersonal skills needed with the ability to build strong collaborative relationships and engage with all levels of store and market personnel Strong decision making skills with the ability to solve problems creatively, effectively, efficiently and at times individually Willingness to take ownership in your business and learn, plan, or implement what is required to succeed Must live in a central location within the territory Able to lift 25+ lbs. Strong communication skills, both written and oral. Strong Microsoft Office skills, especially in Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook Sony Electronics is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values employees with a broad cross-cultural perspective. We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond. All applicants will receive fair and impartial treatment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, legally protected physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, status in the U.S. uniformed services, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information or on any other basis which is protected under applicable federal, state or local law.  Disability Accommodation for Applicants to Sony Electronics, Inc.  Sony Electronics, Inc. provides reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in job application procedures. For reasonable accommodation requests, please contact us by email at talenthelp@am.sony.com , or you can mail your resume to: Sony Electronics, Human Resources Department, 16535 Via Esprillo, San Diego CA 92127. Please indicate the position you are applying for.  EEO is the Law  EEO is the Law Supplement  Right to Work (English/Spanish)  E-Verify Participation (English/Spanish)

At Wiley, we welcome you for who you are, the background you bring, and embrace individuals who get excited about learning whether online or by book. Learning is for everyone, and so is our workplace. Bring your experiences, your perspectives, and your passion. It’s in our differences that we empower the way the world learns.   An opportunity has arisen for a self-motivated Account Executive to drive sales with new and key accounts for advertising and sponsorship sales within the technology/analytical/life sciences areas across North America. Primary responsibilities include prospecting for new business, managing existing account relationships and delivering marketing solutions from across the Wiley portfolio of products to support our customers in achieving their marketing goals.  How you will make an impact: Engage with technical marketing professionals to help them achieve their objectives Partner with internal cross-functional teams like project management, marketing, editorial and customer success to create experiences that delight customers at each stage of their journey Enable our customers with existing ad products and content marketing solutions  We are looking for people who: Can acquire new customers, build and maintain strong business relationships Have a knowledge of digital advertising and content marketing solutions Demonstrates ability to achieve sales targets and the delivery of profitable sales growth Has experience selling within the scientific & technical/industrial markets Has effective communication skills (verbal and written) CRM management  About Wiley: We are in one of the most dynamic periods in our history as technology, globalism and economic diversity create far-reaching changes in the world. As a learning business, Wiley makes meaningful contributions to research discovery and lifelong learning by helping organizations achieve their goals and people achieve success from education through their career. We may have been founded over two centuries ago, but our secret to success remains the same: change with the times and adapt to meet the ever-evolving needs of our customers. The company’s headquarters are located in Hoboken, New Jersey, with operations in the U.S., Europe, Asia, Australia, and Canada.  Wiley is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. We evaluate qualified applicants and treat all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or based on any individual’s status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.  When applying, please attach your resume/CV to be considered.

description: McKesson requires new employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 as defined by the CDC, subject to applicable, verified accommodation requests.  McKesson Corporation is a Fortune 8 company and is one of the largest providers of healthcare supply chain management solutions, retail pharmacy, medical & pharmaceutical supplies, healthcare technology, community oncology and specialty care in the United States with revenues of $231 billion in 2020. The company was founded in 1833 by John McKesson and Charles Olcott in New York with a focus on importing and wholesaling pharmaceutical products. United by our ICARE shared principles, McKesson's 80,000 employees work together every day to make better care possible around the globe – one product, one partner, one patient at a time.  Area Sales Manager  Area Sales Manager covering assigned region within the Post-Acute Care market segment. Preferred candidates will live in Texas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, or Kansas (Texas is preferred to provide better daily access to territory).  This high-profile position will have full P&L responsibility for a region generating over $90M in revenue. Expectations are to grow both new and existing business by directing the sales activities of 12 outside sales representatives, developing strategic business plans, establishing and monitoring sales goals, developing close relationships with key accounts, internal stakeholders and supporting teams such as Inside Sales, Gov’t Sales, Clinical Support and Field Service.  Primary Responsibilities Create strategies to obtain new customers and market penetration within the SNF, ALF, Hospice and Home Health Agency space Hands on development of field reps via traveling within the sales region and visits with customers to ensure service levels are being met Provide reps with the resources they need to service and close business Hire, train and develop sales reps Performance management Achieve financial goals and other goals as assigned by the business Minimum Requirements  9+ years of professional sales experience and 1+ years of supervisory or management experience  Critical Skills Experience selling to C-suite Financial acumen Mature confidence and self-awareness (can influence others diplomatically) Demonstrated performance management skills Demonstrated sales leadership skills Proficiency with Excel, Power Point, Outlook, SFDC and Power BI Ability to travel daily within assigned region Additional Knowledge & Skills Experience in distribution sales. Demonstrated success in building and growing a new region / territory. Prior healthcare experience is preferred. Education  Bachelor's Degree in Business, Marketing or related field or equivalent experience  Physical Requirements Must have valid driver's license and acceptable driving record Large amount of computer-based work Must be authorized to work in the US. Sponsorship is not available for this position.  We take pride in our culture of connection and believe in a workplace where everyone can be their full, authentic self. We welcome and encourage veterans, individuals with disabilities and others with diverse perspectives to join our growing team. Your unique perspective and experience are valuable assets that can translate into a rewarding career path with us. Apply to join our team and help shape the future of healthcare!  McKesson is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.Qualified applicants will not be disqualified from consideration for employment based upon criminal history.  McKesson is committed to being an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers including job seekers with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation to assist with your job search or application for employment, please contact us by sending an email to McKessonTalentAcquisition@mckesson.com . Resumes or CVs submitted to this email box will not be accepted.  Current employees must apply through the internal career site.  Join us at McKesson!

Company Description  Alside, a division of Associated Materials (“AM”), is a federally designated essential business and recognized leader in the home improvement industry. Founded in 1947, Alside is a manufacturer and distributor of vinyl siding and accessories, vinyl windows and patio doors, and fencing and railing products for the residential and commercial remodeling and new construction markets. Alside products are distributed to licensed professional remodeling contractors and home builders through our network of over 100 Supply Centers and also through select independent distributors across the U.S. and Canada. We are proud to be a charter member of the Vinyl Siding Institute, the American Association of Architects, the National Association of Home Builders, and the National Association of the Remodeling Industry.  Job Description  SUMMARY:  Reporting to the Area Sales Manager, the individual in this role will be primarily responsible for developing target accounts and maintaining and driving new business within the Lancaster, PA market.  Sales Skills  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Leads all sales and account/planning, forecasting, reporting, management efforts for assigned accounts within territory Understands, assesses, and anticipates customers’ objectives, strategies, and requirements to identify and pursue sales opportunities Acquires new customers to maximize supply center revenue Responsible for escalated customer service issue follow-up, but not the primary contact point for issue resolution Management/Leadership Works closely with supply center and corporate resource to have them enter & fulfill orders Strong knowledge of the AMI sales process and policies (e.g., accruals, credit, expenses, rewards) Acts as a mentor for Sales Representatives Product/Market Brings core product specification knowledge, application, and value to the customer Understands necessary building codes and how they impact AMI products Reads blueprints and understands take-off capabilities for core products Sells remodeling, new construction, project work, and ISS Must be able to accurately and professionally demo all core products to small and large groups Must be able to accurately and professionally demo all core products to small and medium groups Understands the basics of negotiating correct market value pricing for the assigned territory, and seeks advice from the Area Sales Leader or Sr. Sales Manager Qualifications  Education And Experience Successful sales history with a minimum of 2 years of outside sales experience. Experience within the building materials industry is highly preferred. Bachelor's degree preferred Self-directed, highly organized, customer-focused, detail oriented, and competitive Working knowledge of core building material products (specifically windows & siding) for both single and multi-family applications Proven experience in new business selling, upselling, and selling Preferred experience working with builders and architects to create bigger ticket sales Additional Information  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.  Recruiters: Please note that Associated Materials, Alside and any of its affiliated companies does not seek or accept unsolicited resumes or offers of recruiting service associated with any published or unpublished employment opportunities. Any unsolicited information sent to AMI or any of its employees will be considered as unencumbered and free from any fee or charge whatsoever. Only members of our Human Resources Team have authority to engage or authorize recruiting services. Any questions regarding recruiting services of any kind must be sent to jobs at associatedmaterials dot com  #Indeed5-Alside

REGIONAL BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT MANAGER  Growth oriented, multi-million dollar manufacturer of lighting systme for retail displays, cabinets and furniture is seeking a manager with executive sales experience. We are the leader in our industry and seeking an exceptional candidate who is able to penetrate and increase currently existing accounts and solicit new business in high potential markets. The job location is at our headquarters north of Atlanta, GA.  This is not a sales position for newcomers or sub-executive sales professionals. Candidate must have C-Level sales experience in a B2B capacity.  Please e-mail your resumé along with salary requirements in confidence to cb@heralighting.com.  Ideal Candidate Must Have 5-10 years progressive executive sales experience A sound understanding in specification, OEM and distribution sales. Experience with Fortune 500 companies a plus Bachelor degree in Business or job related field Strong presentation, communication and negotiation skills Solid analytical skills and the drive to succeed 50% travel is required Ideal Candidate Will Receive The Following Benefits Highly competitive starting salary Extraordinary commission plan Sound benefit package, including health and dental insurance, life insurance, SIMPLE IRA with company contributions, long-term disability insurance, etc. Exceptional sales and market training and continuing sales education A fast paced, fun work environment Work along side a professional team with the goal of doubling our annual sales over the next 5 - 10 years.  A fun, fast-paced, growth-oriented, multi-million dollar manufacturer of cabinet and display lighting

description: At Bosch, new ideas are a thriving tradition and have been for over 130 years. As a leading global technology and services supplier, we take advantage of our global opportunities for strong and meaningful development. Every day around the world, thousands of Bosch associates develop new products and systematically improve and innovate those already developed. Job Description The new unit Bosch Software and Digital N.America is looking for a sales & business development manager who will be responsible for new customer acquisition for software and digital transformation services in various focus domains. The role will be responsible for pipeline development, client relationship management & own the opportunity management cycle. This position involves regular travel of approximately 30- 50% of time both domestic and international and below are the key responsibilities.  Responsible for sales & business development activities for assigned Bosch solution portfolio in the NA region. Meet or exceed sales targets and assigned strategic account objectives. Responsible for acquiring new customers and relationships Establish and manage relationships with client C-level executives, with an objective to drive sales initiatives and go-to-market plan to complement and support Bosch IoT & Connected Solutions business around Product Engineering, Software Platforms, IoT solutions & IT Services. Drive Digital Transformation opportunities with customers leveraging Bosch suite of solutions and services Collaborate with diverse teams to develop a deep understanding of markets / customers, work with Bosch teams globally, and help build right set of services and business models. Prospect and qualify opportunities for consulting services Support Regional Marketing plan – Communication, Event Participation. Align actions to department and company vision, mission, strategy and objectives. Build a strong internal network and align with key players to support the delivery of projects to customers and execute deals. Work with support teams to manage operational issues such as fulfilment, partner relationships, legal, billing and other compliances related topics Perform quantitative analysis, and develop proposals, SOW, contract negotiations, MSA and closure, either in the capacity of assisting a larger team or as an individual contributor. Develop commercial and pricing strategies for quotations with strong commercial negotiation skills to secure new business Utilize strong account management skills to build effective customer partnerships, achieving high customer satisfaction Business development and cooperation in the development of specific customer strategies and initiation, implementation and tracking of customer-specific marketing measures and representation at trade fairs   This position can be located in Farmington Hills or Chicago.  Minimum Qualifications BA/BS degree in technical, life sciences or engineering field 7+ years of experience in sales, business development, account management, partnership development, or related endeavor 4+ years of experience in sales and marketing function in IT / IoT/engineering consulting services Preferred Qualifications Exceptionally self-motivated and directed, with high energy to lead activities Confident and clear communicator - defend ideas with objectivity Possess strong interpersonal skills and communication skills Extremely strong written, verbal and communication skills (including proposal writing and presentation building) Experience with various onsite and offshore development models preferred Possess the ability to identify right contacts, create opportunities for Account mining Design thinking capabilities Ability to work with ambiguities of customer requirements and vision Experience in sales and marketing role in IT / IoT / Engineering services or proven record in IoT technology familiarity Experience of collaborating with internationally distributed teams (US, India & Mexico). Demonstrated leadership, organizational and sales strategy skills. Desire to help establish a new business area with a pioneering and entrepreneurial mindset. Highly self-motivated, results oriented (drives issue resolution). Professional and positive attitude, ability to coordinate a global interdisciplinary development team.  By choice, we are committed to a diverse workforce - EOE/Protected Veteran/Disabled. BOSCH is a proud supporter of STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics) Initiatives FIRST Robotics (For Inspiration and Recognition of Science and Technology) AWIM (A World In Motion) Indefinite U.S. work authorized individuals only. Future sponsorship for work authorization is not available.

Founded in 2018, Leena AI is an autonomous conversational AI-backed employee experience platform that is powerful, flexible, and can meets the needs of any enterprise. Trusted by 1M+employees across companies like Nestle, Puma, AirAsia, Coca-Cola, Lafarge Holcim, and Abbott, we have transformed 2M conversations and 10M employee interactions.    We have been recognized by Gartner, earned ourselves several G2 badges, and onboarded over 200 customers. And we’re growing super-fast.  Need more reasons to join us? Our 180+ strong team prides itself on being self-driven, growth-oriented, and a shared belief in the power of autonomy. At Leena AI, we respect hard work, encourage every employee to add their own flavour to the role, and provide unlimited paid time off!   The Role As a Manager of Sales Development at Leena AI, you’ll get the opportunity to oversee a team in the Sales Development organization. You’ll help your team perform and exceed expectations by training, coaching, and mentoring them to drive impactful results. You’ll also partner closely with our Marketing and Sales teams to align on integrated campaigns, strategic business initiatives, improve processes, and ultimately generate qualified meetings and pipeline for the Leena AI Sales organization.  Responsibilities Build and train members of the Sales Development team to identify, contact, and create qualified opportunities Help to define performance metrics by which SDRs will be measured Coach SDRs through shadowing, role plays, process improvement, and performance reporting in recurring 1:1’s Partner with regional managers to develop campaigns that align to their regional goals based on a territory plan Leverage creative marketing and sales tactics to help the SDR team prospect and engage with multiple buyer personas to introduce Leena AI’s value Manage SDR reports and dashboards to ensure the results they deliver can be easily understood by stakeholders throughout the organization Ensure sales accepted opportunities are sourced in accordance with company targets, and that our sales organization has enough opportunities to work with to be fully productive Iterate on the sales development process, methodology, campaigns, hiring profiles, training and enablement with respect to the Leena AI core values Work closely with marketing, sales, and people ops to ensure SDR onboarding program and ongoing training is up-to-date on our current product offering Partner closely with Sales and other members of the SDR Management team to improve opportunity management and qualification processes Assist with recruiting, hiring, and onboarding new Sales Development Representatives  This is a 1099 position. Requirements 5+ years management experience in sales, sales operations, marketing, or customer service for a technical product A proven track record of delivering sales pipeline at a fast growing company with multiple sales segments with an inbound and outbound model Management experience in a high growth environment, preferably in sales development or a similar field The desire to listen and creatively solve problems A passion for customers and the desire and desire to build authentic relationships Familiarity with B2B software and the HRTech product space Experience with CRM software (HubSpot preferred but not mandatory) Experience with prospecting tools like Outreach, ZoomInfo etc. Passion and curiosity around technology Excellent spoken and written English (it’s our company language)  Benefits 5 days working with flexible working hours. Permanent WFH Health insurance One time office setup pay

Now’s our time to inspire the future of healthcare together.  Siemens Healthineers is a leading global medical technology company with over 170 years of experience and 18,000 patents. More than 48,000 dedicated colleagues in over 70 countries are driven to shape the future of healthcare. We stand with our customers around the world to support them in delivering high quality care to their patients. An estimated 5 million patients across the globe benefit every day from our innovative technologies and services in the areas of diagnostic and therapeutic imaging, laboratory diagnostics and molecular medicine, as well as digital health and enterprise services. This is what truly matters to us.  Join our team now at Siemens Healthineers as ICE Catheter Clinical Specialist  Position Overview  The Ultrasound ICE Catheter Clinical Specialist (ICS) is accountable to provide technical and clinical product support to health care providers and laboratory staff for diagnostic and therapeutic catheters and systems – with an emphasis on Structural Heart and Volume catheters. The ICS is responsible to build and maintain mutually beneficial relationships with physicians & laboratory staff in order to identify and foster interest in new products or product indications to grow and develop the company’s product and technology utilization. The ICS Actively participates in internal/external trainings, maintains optimal scanning techniques and competitive knowledge. Collaborates closely with Clinical Sales Director, National Catheter Director, and the Territory Sales Managers that all business objectives and zone sales goals are obtained  Roles And Responsibilities  Provide expert clinical product and technical assistance and training to physicians and staff on the effective use of AcuNav Volume Catheter. Use consultative selling techniques to identify potential sales opportunities within the account. Maximize customer case support capability through proper planning and scheduling techniques. Stay current on company products instructions for use, best practices and technical troubleshooting, as well as relevant scientific clinical literature and new product information. Prioritize and appropriately respond to requests in a high stress environment and maintain composure and problem-solving focus during stressful interactions. Engage in diagnostic dialogue with multiple internal and external business partners and stakeholders, and formulate solutions based on dialogue and input gained during session. Actively participates in internal/external trainings, maintains optimal scanning techniques and competitive knowledge. Collaborates closely with Volume Catheter Team, National Clinical Sales Director, National Catheter Director and Territory Sales managers that all business objectives and catheter volume sales goals are obtained.  Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience. A minimum of 3 years of experience in clinical echocardiography lab with focus on structural heart and 3D imaging. Must have and maintain certification as a Registered Cardiac Sonographer (RCS) or as a Registered Diagnostic Cardiac Sonographer (RDCS) in adult or pediatric echocardiography. Maintain clinical knowledge of healthcare industry, disease states, and therapeutic and institutional trends. Must be willing and able to travel up to 60% overnight locally, regionally, and nationally, sometimes on short notice. Position requires sitting for extended periods of time, working in a hospital laboratory setting, attending live patient cases, and wearing protective gear (i.e. lead aprons), and willing to work variable hours to meet customer needs. May be required to lift to 60 lbs. Must have a valid Driver’s License  Siemens Healthineers has recently announced the next steps in our continued commitment to prioritize colleague health, comply with customer/business partner requirements, and help preserve our business continuity. Going forward, please be aware that Siemens Healthineers requires full vaccination for COVID-19 for our U.S. employees, contractors, and business partners, where local conditions allow, who: 1) Are customer-facing (e.g., those required to visit a customer/business partner site or interact in-person with customers at any conference or meeting) OR 2) Come on-site, whether regularly or occasionally, at any Siemens Healthineers location. (Note: Accommodations may be requested for certain medical or religious reasons.)  At Siemens Healthineers, we value those who dedicate their energy and passion to a greater cause. Our people make us unique as an employer in the medtech industry. What unites and motivates our global team is the inspiration of our common purpose: To innovate for healthcare, building on our remarkable legacy of pioneering ideas that translate into even better healthcare products and services. We recognize that taking ownership of our work allows both us and the company to grow. We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment and the space to move beyond your comfort zone to grow both personally and professionally.  If you want to join us in transforming the way healthcare is delivered, visit our career site at https://jobs.siemens-info.com/jobs  Organization: Siemens Healthineers  Company: Siemens Medical Solutions USA, Inc.  Experience Level: Experienced Professional  Job Type: Full-time  Equal Employment Opportunity Statement  Siemens is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, creed, religion, national origin, citizenship status, ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability unrelated to ability, marital status, family responsibilities, pregnancy, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity, transgender, sex stereotyping, order of protection status, protected veteran or military status, or an unfavorable discharge from military service, and other categories protected by federal, state or local law.  EEO is the Law  Applicants and employees are protected under Federal law from discrimination. To learn more, Click here.  Pay Transparency Non-Discrimination Provision  Siemens follows Executive Order 11246, including the Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision. To learn more, Click here.  California Privacy Notice  California residents have the right to receive additional notices about their personal information. To learn more, click here.

description: This is an exciting opportunity to join a highly motivated, collaborative, and growing Sales Team looking to bring evaporative cooling products to the next level. Portacool, LLC is the market leader in portable evaporative cooling, with products that are proudly made in the USA at our Texas manufacturing facility. For over 30 years, the company’s consistent growth rate and continued expansion in product lines has positioned it as a global leader in the portable evaporative cooling business with distributors in 50 U.S. states and 56 countries. We are passionate about our customers and creating the best possible experience for our end users and channel partners by delivering best in class product solutions and innovative technologies.  Portacool is growing and we are seeking and individual with an entrepreneurial spirit, a self-starter that has the interpersonal skills  to develop long-term relationships with your portfolio of assigned customers and connect with key business executives and procurement teams. You will liaise between customers and cross-functional internal teams to ensure the timely and successful delivery of our solutions according to customer needs.  Responsibilities •      Operate as the lead point of contact for any and all matters specific to the customer accounts •      Build and maintain strong, long-lasting customer relationships •      Ensure the timely and successful delivery of our solutions according to customer needs and objectives •      Communicate clearly the progress of monthly/quarterly initiatives to internal and external stakeholders •      Forecast and track key account metrics •      Identify and grow opportunities within territory and collaborate with sales teams to ensure growth attainment •      Actively grow and explore new opportunities in the industrial, rental & hospitality channels through new distribution •      Knowledge of the selling product from manufacturing stage to the delivery and customer satisfaction stage. •      Develop methods and procedures to increase sales, expand markets, and promote business. •      Align with leadership to prioritize representatives' time and focus on key opportunities for significant growth opportunities. •      Listen to and resolve customer complaints regarding services, products, or personnel. •      Conduct frequent account planned visits, interacting on a recurrent basis (once per quarter at least) with key economic and clinical customers. •      Research and understand your target market and key economic conditions / issues at major accounts.  Requirements •      Proven account management or other relevant experience •      Demonstrated ability to communicate, present and influence credibly and effectively at all levels of the organization •      Experience in delivering client-focused solutions based on customer needs •      Proven ability to manage multiple projects at a time while paying strict attention to detail •      Excellent listening, negotiation and presentation skills •      Excellent verbal and written communications skills •      Excellent leadership skills and experience managing national sales relationships to achieve and exceed revenue goals •      Strong interpersonal, communication and presentation skills and ability to promote and sell concepts to representatives, agencies and customers •      Excellent organizational skills and analytical skills, including proficiency in Microsoft Office applications  Competencies ·       Customer/Client Focus. ·       Problem Solving/Analysis. ·       Time Management. ·       Communication Proficiency. ·       Teamwork Orientation. ·       Technical Capacity.  Travel This position requires up to 75% travel. Frequent travel is outside the local area and overnight.  Benefits Other than working with a great team of smart and energetic people, this position is fully remote. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package. We care about our people as they are the key to our success. We provide an open and friendly work environment where we empower people and provide opportunities to develop long-term careers.

The company The company offers a high level of transportation brokerage and truckload services.  Responsibilities Create new originations to alight with the company's holistic strategy of irregular routes. Develop, establish and maintain “strategic” customer relationships. Respond to customer RFP and submit bids timely and negotiate pricing. Ensure customers are credit worthy before accepting freight. Meet or exceed all other customer specific requirements for service. Establish and maintain relationships with 3rd party carriers to ensure quality service to customers. Engage in strategic logistics planning and coordination with customer to enhance service. Use Problem Solving skills to implement resolutions, as needed. Follow company policies and procedures. Advise CEO of any concerns or problems. Track and report all sales activities. Among others.  Qualifications 10+ years of progressive career in transportation brokerage and truckload services. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Experience managing third party carriers. Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  Preferably candidates with non-compete agreements.

JOB DESCRIPTION Antedotum is currently hiring tenured Regional Sales Managers with 3-5 years industry experience to join this fast-growing startup company. The team will be responsible for driving sales though prospecting, trade show attendance and networking. The team member will maintain and develops strategic relationships through individualized consultative selling approach, will need strong interpersonal skills and existing industry relationships, are a must.   JOB REQUIREMENTS Antedotum Regional Sales Managers are responsible for increasing sales by developing and maintaining relationships with customers and clients. Duties may include identifying prospective customers, following up on potential sales leads and maintaining relationships with existing customers. Outside Sales Representatives may also recommend marketing strategies designed for a target market. Examples of the duties and responsibilities include: Identify and establish contact with potential customers Schedule and perform product demonstrations with potential customers Develop and maintain relationships with existing customers Attend industry trade shows to identify potential sales leads and make meaningful contact with existing customers Follow industry trends to identify new opportunities for potential sales Recommend marketing strategies to target a specific region or demographic Event and trunk show(s) quarterly at top selling accounts Generate and submit sales reports to management Training account teams in person and via zoom Travel is required  JOB STATUS Full-time

description: Goldcast is a virtual events platform built to help B2B Marketers host engaging online experiences and drive pipeline and business impact through their events.  Our mission is to modernize the event marketing channel through great software products and help B2B firms connect with their customers in a meaningful way.  We launched Goldcast in general availability in December 2020 and have seen tremendous growth since then. Today, we count Github, Drift, Attentive Mobile and 40 other top enterprises as our customers and have been getting a lot of client love  The company was founded at Harvard Business School in the beginning of 2020. We are a small but fast growing fully remote team and are backed by industry-leading VCs and prominent angel investors from a unique collection of backgrounds.  Get to know us better here https://www.goldcast.io/  What You'll Do  As one of the early team members in the sales team, you'll play a key role in shaping the future of business events and helping Goldcast create a category in the world of field and event marketing.  Ultimately, success in this role means being the face of Goldcast and ensuring a great sales experience for our future supporters. This is an opportunity to have an immediate impact in a fast-growing company - Expect us to push you to find new ways to engage that make every prospect and customer interaction world-class.  Your key responsibilities include: Developing new business opportunities through dedicated prospecting Qualifying inbound leads and conduct highly personalized demos that wows the prospect Handling and overcoming any and all objections by identifying the root cause Being able to close and pull deals across the finish line Providing an exceptional and customer-centric experience that allows you to control the buying journey from beginning to end Becoming an expert in sales tech toolkit and ensuring that we track all the key sales metrics from start to finish Partnering with Customer Success and ensuring that the deal is handed off with all relevant details Being a thought partner to the product team by communicating all relevant customer requirements  Who You Are You have a proven track record of closing experience at B2B tech companies (ideally a minimum of 4 years) and a strong orientation to building pipeline and sales process discipline. About Us: Octopart is apart of Altium Inc. Octopart is the search engine for electronic components and industrial products. We live at the center of electronic design and our people are the heart of Octopart. Our team’s passion and dedication powers everything we do. No, really. That might sound like typical corporate jargon, but we genuinely love what we do here at Octopart and we think you will, too.  Octopart’s mission is to equip the rapidly growing population of electrical engineers, buyers, and makers with everything they need to make decisions about electronic parts. From a sophisticated search algorithm that helps them quickly find the right part, to comprehensive data that gives them confidence in selecting a part for their project, Octopart endeavors to save people time so that they can focus on designing the technology that powers our daily lives.  The Opportunity: We’re excited to bring on board an Account Manager who will nurture and develop new and existing accounts and will act as the voice of the customer serving as the bridge between Octopart and its many partners. You’ll work alongside Sales, Marketing, Product, Design, and Data teams to help improve our products and services in a programmatic and evidence-based way. You will penetrate each account and match Octopart’s value proposition with the needs of each account.   What You’ll Do: Build a deep understanding of Octopart’s products, value proposition, organization, and position in the electronic components market.  Develop customer relationships, where you are seen as the trusted advisor Optimize existing business while prospecting within other departments, BU’s and geographies to build other relationships for mutual benefit Provide consistent and data-driven solutions to existing and prospective customers that result in increased retention, improved customer experience, and win-win opportunities between Octopart and its partners.  Identify opportunities to “go deep” within existing accounts by building rapport with additional stakeholders, collecting feedback systematically, and mapping any changes in our existing stakeholders’ organizations, needs, and pain points.  Gather, analyze and present key program metrics that will enable Octopart to objectively assess and quantify account performance; allowing us to pivot appropriately, invest resources thoughtfully, and execute against actions based on program findings.  Contribute to Octopart’s account management “playbook” by gathering and operationalizing key learnings and recommendations that will ultimately improve our program experience and services.  Develop and deliver proposals and manage pricing and objections Heavy use of CRM including tracking programs, meetings, scheduling calls, and capturing key information to ensure data integrity Weekly customer planning Continuous improvement: update job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities, reading professional publications, maintaining personal networks, and participating in professional organizations    Expected Outcomes: Establish a deep understanding of the Octopart product offerings, internal processes, unique value proposition, pricing strategy, product features and competitive landscape.  You will have a deep understanding of each of your customers value propositions, and strategies. Your customers will be aware of all the current Octopart/Altium products and services.  You will create weekly and monthly sales plans to touch each customer on a regular cadence to ensure customer satisfaction You will take share and displace the competition in each account All customers will want to sponsor/participate in our newsletters, campaigns (banner, topline, retargeting, and x-reference), and Altium thought leadership programs You will solicit comprehensive datasets from each of your partners, including, geography, new currency, non-stocks, exclusive brands, and NPI programs.  Component Mfgs will want to use the Octopart API to power their distributor inventory, and use our CAD services to help enhance their libraries You will meet or exceed your KPI, revenue, and average CPC targets Octopart will meet or exceed its revenue goals You will be a subject matter expert and trusted advisor in the electronics industry  Who You Are: Analytical. You’re a data-driven account executive. You pride yourself in your ability to leverage large sums of digital performance data to drive account growth and improvement. For you, it’s all about using analytics to tell a story. Enthusiastic. Exhibits passion, excitement and a can-do attitude Organized.. You’re used to navigating cross-functionally in either a scaling, high-growth company or a large-scale enterprise across several departmental layers. You have experience working with business teams to craft evidence-based action plans that align strongly with organizational priorities.  Team Player. While action-oriented, you never do things for expediency’s sake. You continue to go above and beyond to support your teammates; always fostering a collaborative and inclusive environment.  Communicative. You’re someone who speaks and writes clearly and articulately without being overly verbose. You share and seek feedback internally and externally.   Resourceful.. You’ve always been able to do “more with less”. You’re able to exceed expectations, even when priorities or budgets shift.  Ambiguity. You’re not afraid of the “fork in the road”. Your keen ability to create synergy in a rapidly evolving environment is what sets you apart from the rest.  Proactive. Rather than being reactive, you obsess about getting ahead of your customers’ needs. You go the extra mile, ensuring that decisions are supported by insight and a deep understanding of partners and stakeholders.   At Octopart, we don’t just accept differences — we celebrate them, we support them, and we thrive on them for the benefit of our employees, our customers, and our community. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. If you’re good at what you do, come as you are. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. Octopart is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

We’re looking for a Regional Sales Manager, Northwest to assist in developing and executing the business plan to grow share of our portfolio of well-known domestic (California) and import (Chile and Argentina) wines. This includes calling on key accounts and managing our distribution network throughout the assigned states.  This is a virtual, home office based role with the ideal candidate located in or near the Greater Seattle, Washington area with secondary preference to Portland, Oregon and the surrounding area. Travel will be approximately 30% to 40% throughout the region.  DISTRIBUTOR MANAGEMENT CUSTOMER-FIRST APPROACH AND ACCOUNT MANAGEMENT RETAIL EXECUTION AND MARKET INTELLIGENCE INTERNAL BUSINESS MANAGEMENT  Requirements: Bachelor degree in business, marketing or finance preferred with a minimum five years practical sales and wholesaler management experience, or equivalent education/experience combination. Successful wine/alcohol beverage sales management experience including both on and off premise sales Knowledge of products, wine industry, competitive markets, brands and customers’ issues and typical needs  Fetzer Vineyards is an award-winning purveyor of multi-origin wines and spirits, selling in over 50 countries worldwide. Founded by Barney Fetzer in Mendocino County, CA, in 1968, and part of global powerhouse Viña Concha y Toro, Fetzer Vineyards today remains driven by excellence, innovation and longstanding commitments to the environment and responsible business practices. With a focus on crafting wines made from sustainable, organic and Biodynamic® grapes, Fetzer Vineyards is a Top-12 U.S. marketer of wines, the nation’s primary importer of South American wines, and the United States’ largest Certified B Corporation winery—a testament to the company’s dedication to the transformational goals of regenerative business.  In addition to its flagship Fetzer label, the Fetzer Vineyards portfolio features Bonterra Organic Vineyards, the 2016 Wine Enthusiast American Winery of the Year; 1000 Stories, California’s original Bourbon barrel-aged wine; Casillero del Diablo, the #1 Chilean wine brand (750ml) in the U.S.; and Trivento Reserve, the #3 selling Malbec in the U.S. The Origins Collection—an esteemed portfolio of super-premium to super-luxury offerings centered on terroir-driven wines from Chile, Argentina and the U.S.—showcases South American icons Don Melchor and Trivento Eolo Malbec, alongside Bonterra’s single-vineyard, biodynamically farmed wines and the award-winning craft whiskies of Kentucky Peerless Distilling Co.

description: Description  AWS is seeking a world class professional to manage our global customer relationship with one of the largest companies in the world.  Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.  Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.  Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.  The Global Account Manager will be responsible for providing global business leadership and management of this global account. You will build and maintain key relationships, develop and manage opportunities, monitor deployment projects and engage virtual resources. You will define a CXO relationship within the account, including engaging with AWS senior leadership team for executive sponsorships, coordinating executive business reviews, and maintaining customer satisfaction.  Responsibilities  The Global Account Manager is responsible for teaming with the customer’s IT Organization to build strategic relationships across the account, articulating a clear vision and generating enthusiasm, while impacting all business groups. The rep is responsible for selling at the most strategic level within the account and implementing a broad for earning customer acceptance and service implementation. The rep will work with all appropriate AWS resources (Executives, Solution Architects, Business Development, Marketing, Partners, Support, Service teams and Professional Services) to support customer interests. This includes dotted line responsibility for downstream and technical resources that may be geographically distributed.  Development of formal case studies and other forms of references highlighting activity and workloads running on AWS is core to the role.   Basic Qualifications  A bachelor's degree in business or technology or equivalent work experience.  The candidate must have a minimum of 12+ years experience working at a technology company as the lead account and relationship manager of a large global organization.   Preferred Qualifications  Experience as the primary account manager of a global federated enterprise working with multiple business units and influencing governance and policy is a plus.  A BA or BS degree in computer science, engineering, business, marketing, or related field (MBA preferred) and a minimum of 12+ years of enterprise selling experience in large global accounts.  Other experiences to include: experience in large complex negotiations with a successful track record; ability to navigate across AWS and the customer in a trusted advisor/consultative approach; and, establishing credibility quickly with senior level executives across the organizations.  Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication, analytical and presentation skills are required. Candidate must possess demonstrated decision making, problem solving, and negotiating skills.  A strong understanding of AWS and/or technology as a service (Iaas,SaaS,PaaS) would be preferred but not required.  Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.   Company - Amazon Web Services, Inc.  Job ID: A1737153

description: Business Development  District Sales Manager Tampa, FL, USA Req #8256 Tuesday, September 21, 2021 Coca-Cola Beverages Florida, LLC (Coke Florida) is a family-owned independent Coca-Cola bottler that is the third largest privately-held and the sixth largest independent Coca-Cola bottler in the United States. Coke Florida's exclusive territory covers over 18 million consumers across 47 Florida counties, and includes the major metropolitan markets of Jacksonville, Miami, Orlando and Tampa. Coke Florida sells, markets, manufactures and distributes over 600 products of The Coca-Cola Company and other partner companies including Monster Beverage Corporation and BODYARMOR. In 2017, Coke Florida generated over $1.2 billion in revenue and the company currently has approximately 4,800 employees. As one of the first US greenfield independent Coca-Cola bottlers in nearly sixty years, Coke Florida is at an exciting stage in its transformational journey to become a leading-edge beverage company, the best bottler in the Coca-Cola System, and one of the best companies to work for in Florida. The  **District Sales Manager**  leads the execution of sales initiatives and will have full responsibility for sales execution in all local, regional, and national assigned accounts. **Role Responsibilities** + The Business Development District Sales Manager will have full responsibility for new customer acquisitions within their territory + Coach and develop the team of direct reports while ensuring a culture of learning and development exists throughout the selling organization + Responsible for the execution of all sales priorities and initiatives + Responsible for identifying and developing core talent + Responsible for relationships with new accounts and successful handoff to Sales area leadership in operations. + Responsible for account qualification to deliver GP, Revenue, and volume to support capital investment + Assist in collaborative development with new customers on a yearly or multiyear price/package plan that generates desired results for both Customer and the Coke Florida system. + Collaborate with Business Partners (PGM, Marketing, Finance), working as the CPA liaison, to develop programming that will accelerate incremental business and exceed program objectives for local/regional customers. + Provide a feedback loop to the department team and Director of Sales on marketplace conditions (includes competition, channel plans, pricing, architecture) + Provide inspirational leadership and ensure execution of all engagement initiatives (e.g., Town Halls) to drive strong employee engagement **Role Requirements** + Bachelor's degree + 3-5 years in consumer goods industry + Experience in developing successful annual business plans and price/package for retail customers + Strategic Selling, Conceptual Selling, Account Management + Customer Profitability Analysis and Development of RFA + Food Service on Premise (FSOP), Alternative Route-To-Market (ARTM), Direct Store Delivery (DSD) and/or Beverage category experience preferred + Strong negotiation skills + Change agent who thrives in a fast pace, ever changing environment + Intermediate computer and database application skills preferred + Valid driver's license and driving record within MVR policy guidelines. + Periodic bending, kneeling, pulling, and/or lifting of 50+ pounds and climbing Coca-Cola Beverages Florida is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. **Other details** + Job Family Sales + Job Function Sales + Pay Type Salary Apply Now + Tampa, FL, USA

Assist in developing the bid strategy for new opportunities  ●       Work with existing account locations and opportunities to determine potential expansion projects  ●       Understand territory planning, including outlining current situation, accounts, prospects, competitors and vendors  ●       Have an entrepreneurial approach to revenue growth, customer service and profitability  ●       Be a data-driven and detail-oriented analytical thinker that continuously evaluates and methodically and creatively optimizes strategy based on metrics and results  ●       Develop a deep understanding of the product & marketplace with the ability to translate that into highly effective sales strategy and consistent revenue growth while continually working to stabilize margins  ●       Communicate with operations management staff to understand waste streams and challenges with certain products/vendors to communicate with vendors about issues and also make informed decisions about new incoming product streams.  ●       Call on prospective opportunities and maintain call log activity  ●       Proactively manage sales pipeline and maintain clean, current data in the CRM system with weekly reporting  ●       Perform additional responsibilities as needed. We are a global business with an extensive network of both owned and franchised stores across EMEIA, Asia Pacific and Americas. We are digital pioneers, and innovative technology underpins every aspect of our business, from product design to distribution and marketing. We believe that modern luxury means being socially and environmentally responsible; this mindset is core to our business and key to our long-term success. Alside products are distributed to licensed professional remodeling contractors and home builders through our network of over 100 Supply Centers and also through select independent distributors across the U.S. and Canada. We are proud to be a charter member of the Vinyl Siding Institute, the American Association of Architects, the National Association of Home Builders, and the National Association of the Remodeling Industry.  Job Description  SUMMARY:  Reporting to the Area Sales Manager, the individual in this role will be primarily responsible for developing target accounts and maintaining and driving new business within the Elk Grove Village, IL market.  Sales Skills  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Leads all sales and account/planning, forecasting, reporting, management efforts for assigned accounts within territory Understands, assesses, and anticipates customers’ objectives, strategies, and requirements to identify and pursue sales opportunities Acquires new customers to maximize supply center revenue Responsible for escalated customer service issue follow-up, but not the primary contact point for issue resolution Management/Leadership Works closely with supply center and corporate resource to have them enter & fulfill orders Strong knowledge of the AMI sales process and policies (e.g., accruals, credit, expenses, rewards) Acts as a mentor for Sales Representatives Product/Market Brings core product specification knowledge, application, and value to the customer Understands necessary building codes and how they impact AMI products Reads blueprints and understands take-off capabilities for core products Sells remodeling, new construction, project work, and ISS Must be able to accurately and professionally demo all core products to small and large groups Must be able to accurately and professionally demo all core products to small and medium groups Understands the basics of negotiating correct market value pricing for the assigned territory, and seeks advice from the Area Sales Leader or Sr. Sales Manager Qualifications  Education And Experience Successful sales history with a minimum of 2 years of outside sales experience. Experience within the building materials industry is highly preferred. Bachelor's degree preferred Self-directed, highly organized, customer-focused, detail oriented, and competitive Working knowledge of core building material products (specifically windows & siding) for both single and multi-family applications Proven experience in new business selling, upselling, and selling Preferred experience working with builders and architects to create bigger ticket sales Additional Information  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
