jobTitle: Sales Account Manager – Retail Sports Channel
description: The successful candidate will be an integral part of the company’s retail channel focused on the Sport’s Market. In this role, the primary objective will be to have full account management to achieve the target sales and revenue plans and forge strong relationships with existing customers and establish/develop new account relationships within the sports channel. Additionally, the Account Executive plays an integral role in executing the successful launch of new products and collections including account training and education, promotional strategy, and events. The candidate will be responsible for partnering and collaborating with internal and external brand partners.  Responsibilities:  Responsible for managing the wholesale selling of eyewear within the sports channel Manage and maintain account relationships with existing account base Collaborate on go-to-market strategy for new business development and expansion Travel domestically to meet with regional customer, attend sporting good trade shows and events to grow new client network and brand outreach Understand customers’ market timelines and proactively provide them with all information and materials required to support their businesses Partner with supervisor to create and implement business plans by account to achieve sales and brand goals for the sporting goods channel Make recommendations for product life cycle and monitor inventory models and deliveries Communicate qualitative and quantitative selling results to brand, product, and design teams Forge relationships and collaborate with internal departments: Planning, Brand Management, Finance, Customer Service, Product Development Support Retail Sales Managers in brand deployment across full account network(includes department stores, ecommerce, specialty etc.) Partner with brand manager and adidas Sports Marketing division to promote eyewear for professional athletes, NCAA Universities, Golf Management pro shops Develop Team sport collections in collaboration with brand Sports marketing, Product Development, and Brand teams Monitor competitors’ activities and performance, along with implementing strategies and tactics to compete (i.e. pricing, design, offer a strong point of view) Provide weekly business updates through analysis from customers’ sales and inventory data Provide weekly wholesale forecast vs budget (share reasons for opportunities and risks) Monitor and track customer’s POs in collaboration with customer service to ensure timely deliveries  Qualifications: 5 years of wholesale experience Education, 4-year undergraduate degree or equivalent Demonstrated knowledge and experience within the specialty athletic channel a strong plus Experience prospecting, acquiring, maintaining and growing sales accounts Self-starter, able to work independently with a proactive approach Highly organized, detail-oriented and time management skills essential Excellent presentation skills, ability to share information with different levels of the organization Strong verbal and written communication skills must be able to effectively communicate with external and internal customers Strong analytical and organizational skills with a strong knowledge of retail math Demonstrates the ability to Multi-Task and Prioritize Must be proficient on MS Office (word, excel, power-point, etc.) Ability to work with ambiguity; can effectively cope with change, shift gears comfortably, decide and act without having the total picture, and handle risk and uncertainty. Travel required as necessary

description: Company Summary GameDay brings us together. From tailgater, nose-bleeders and luxury boxers. To grill masters, corn-holers, even bandwagon jumpers. Together, we’ll roll with the hard fought victories. Together, we’ll overcome the painful defeats, too. Although we bleed different colors, together we celebrate the spirit of the game.  GameDay is not just a spirit brand, it’s a LIFESTYLE Brand that gives Fans and Consumers an opportunity to do deeper with their passion and Fandom and brings them closer to the action in a way that no other brand can!  What Colors do you Bleed?    Position Summary The role is responsible for the planning, communication and execution of GameDay Sprits on and off premise objectives with our distributor partners and the trade in an assigned territory (New York Metro). The Manager will ensure we are achieving our fair share of business, growth and awareness in this important channel of business through regular interaction with Distributor Partners, account calls, and activation opportunities.    Distributor/Customer Facing (90% of time)   Distributor Management (25%): •      Sales leadership with distributors and markets in sales territory •      Helps facilitate the relationship with distributor in their respective territories (Division Managers, Area Manager, District Managers, Sales Reps) •      Accountable for participating in the planning and building of Sales Programming throughout the Market •      Owns Market Level Volume and KPIs and should be collaborating with Distributor partners on achieving both •      Owns performance management TBR preparation and challenges distributors and internal team to create solutions to close gaps in plan •      Analysis/insights of monthly performance with action plans to drive enhanced performance (Facts/So What/Insights/Actions) •      Ensures proper facilitation of key trade promotions and tasting events and/or activation throughout the market. •      Facilitator of General Sales Meetings, Tactical Business Reviews •      Collaborate and plan with distributor on any regional/national accounts that impact the Market •      Builder of pertinent local incentives to drive market level execution (On/Off)    Market Execution (65%): •      Managing the alignment of execution with distributor counterparts alongside GameDay •      Leads execution of key ON/OFF National Account programming for market •      Participant in key buyer meetings in collaboration with National Accounts team •      For large regional accounts, participant in key buyer meetings and business review •      Participant in key survey periods around periods to win (i.e. Easter, 4th of July, Thanksgiving, and Winter holidays) •      Participant and Owner of key blitz or focus periods to elevate distributor focus and drive distribution of our portfolio •      Field Execution of key sponsorships and trade promotions •      Field Execution of Consumer activations, promo events, Staff trainings, etc..    Communication/Feedback loop (10% of time) •      Participant on weekly/bi-weekly team calls – both internal as well as with our distributor •      Participation in key marketing/trade/commercial planning feedback •      Provide feedback to marketing based on best-in-class execution and key competitive items or promotions •      Timely follow up and communication with Key Account/Buyers based on in market work •      Monthly cadence of feedback to GameDay Leadership on market progress •      Financial Management: Ensure proper and responsible spending of T&E with weekly report submission   Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree required; preferably with Sales/Marketing Concentration Minimum 1 year in service background (restaurant, hotel etc..) preferred Familiarity with the market and key accounts preferred High Energy and Passionate about competing and Winning in the market Strong Relationship Building Capabilities Ability in customer management within specific territory Keen understanding of the three-tier distribution system and compliance laws Excellent communication skills articulate with strong public speaking ability / experience and excellent writing skills. Ability to persuade and influence. Microsoft Office Skills   Physical Requirements/Work Environment Must be able to move up to 55 lbs Use hands to handle or feel; reach with hands and arms Climb or balance stairs/ladders Must have close vision, distant vision, and ability to adjust focus, peripheral vision Must be able to stand for extended periods of time Must have a valid driver's license and be able to drive a car and travel via plan/train as needed. Must be at least 21 years of age. Must be able to sit and/or stand for long periods of time and work on a computer for extended periods. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Company Description  Alside, a division of Associated Materials Incorporated (“AMI”), is a federally designated essential business and recognized leader in the home improvement industry. Founded in 1947, Alside is a manufacturer and distributor of vinyl siding and accessories, vinyl windows and patio doors, and fencing and railing products for the residential and commercial remodeling and new construction markets. Alside products are distributed to licensed professional remodeling contractors and home builders through our network of over 100 Supply Centers and also through select independent distributors across the U.S. and Canada. We are proud to be a charter member of the Vinyl Siding Institute, the American Association of Architects, the National Association of Home Builders, and the National Association of the Remodeling Industry.  Job Description  SUMMARY:  Reporting to the Area Sales Manager, the individual in this role will be primarily responsible for developing target accounts and maintaining and driving new business within the Lorton, VA market.  Sales Skills  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Leads all sales and account/planning, forecasting, reporting, management efforts for assigned accounts within territory Understands, assesses, and anticipates customers’ objectives, strategies, and requirements to identify and pursue sales opportunities Acquires new customers to maximize supply center revenue Responsible for escalated customer service issue follow-up, but not the primary contact point for issue resolution Management/Leadership Works closely with supply center and corporate resource to have them enter & fulfill orders Strong knowledge of the AMI sales process and policies (e.g., accruals, credit, expenses, rewards) Acts as a mentor for Sales Representatives Product/Market Brings core product specification knowledge, application, and value to the customer Understands necessary building codes and how they impact AMI products Reads blueprints and understands take-off capabilities for core products Sells remodeling, new construction, project work, and ISS Must be able to accurately and professionally demo all core products to small and large groups Must be able to accurately and professionally demo all core products to small and medium groups Understands the basics of negotiating correct market value pricing for the assigned territory, and seeks advice from the Area Sales Leader or Sr. Sales Manager Qualifications  Education And Experience Successful sales history with a minimum of 2 years of outside sales experience. Experience within the building materials industry is highly preferred. Bachelor's degree preferred Self-directed, highly organized, customer-focused, detail oriented, and competitive Working knowledge of core building material products (specifically windows & siding) for both single and multi-family applications Proven experience in new business selling, upselling, and selling Preferred experience working with builders and architects to create bigger ticket sales Additional Information  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.  Recruiters: Please note that Associated Materials, Alside and any of its affiliated companies does not seek or accept unsolicited resumes or offers of recruiting service associated with any published or unpublished employment opportunities. Any unsolicited information sent to AMI or any of its employees will be considered as unencumbered and free from any fee or charge whatsoever. Only members of our Human Resources Team have authority to engage or authorize recruiting services. Any questions regarding recruiting services of any kind must be sent to jobs at associatedmaterials dot com  #Indeed5-Alside

jobTitle: Director Of Sales And Business Development
description: NORD Gear Corporation is one of the world’s leading manufacturers of drive technology for mechanical and electrical solutions. With our continued growth and expansion, we are currently recruiting for a highly motivated District Sales Manager to join our sales team!  Position:         Director of Sales and Business Development Location:        Southwest Region Hours:             1st Shift Reports to:     VP of Sales  Summary: The Director of Sales and Business Development will be responsible for the sales management and development of the District Sales Managers in the region, which results in profitable sales growth.   Description: Development and implementation of strategies to insure annual regional revenue growth in line with corporate objectives is met. Preparation of annual business and sales plans and implementation of those plans for the respective region. Direct involvement in key and target accounts. Manage the sales activities and time management of the District Sales Managers. Ensure the team is utilizing CRM per our standard work guidelines. Coach and develop District Sales Managers to achieve their highest potential. Provide recommendations of national sales plans, distributor plans, and policies relating to the sales force and customers. Implement sales plans, distributor plans, and policies relating to sales force and customers. Create a work environment that is clean, safe, and environmentally friendly. Manage processes and controls to ensure that all policies are implemented and enforced. Maintain a high level of ethics in customer dealings and to protect the interests of the company in any commercial dealings and transactions entered into within the region. Provide regular and consistent feedback to the Vice President of Sales regarding progress on key accounts, target account, territory sales activities, and customer concerns. Demonstrate strong leadership skills to assist the company in achieving its goals. Provide input into the creation of the overall company strategy and identify ways to provide strategic advantages for NORD Gear in the marketplace.   Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree Required / Engineering Bachelor’s Degree Preferred Minimum of 5 years of outside sales experience required, 10 years preferred 5 years of experience in Power Transmission Gear Reducer market required Minimum of 3 years sales management preferred Strong understanding of the industrial sales process, sales, interpersonal skills, the gearing / VFD industry and key competitors is required. Ability to forge relationships at all levels of key and target accounts. Basic understanding of human resource and management practices is required. The ability to travel without restriction. The ability to relocate within the region.   NORD Gear offers a competitive benefit package including: Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance. Company Paid Short Term and Long Term Disablity. Company Paid Life Insurance. Flex Spending and Health Savings Accounts. Paid Vacation. Paid Personal and Sick Time. Paid Holidays. 401k with Employer Match. Tuition Reimbursement.  This is a remote work opportunity!

Job Description  The MySQL Global Business Unit is looking for a qualified Sales Representative to sell MySQL Database Service (MDS) and HeatWave (HW) deployed on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) across highly diverse and expansive geography within our North American territory.  Ideal candidates will have a proven track record of success selling cloud services. Be able to comprehend and articulate core cloud principles (storage, networking, security, DR, etc.), to customers, prospects, and internal stakeholders. Demonstrate the ability to communicate the Oracle Cloud Value Proposition including the technical strategy of Gen 2. Understanding of cloud business drivers and how to position OCI's competitive advantage. Be intellectually curious and have a passion for MySQL, Cloud Services, as well as being able to quickly uncover customer business pains  Qualified candidates should live and work in the Oracle Austin, TX Office. Have 2-3 years of experience successfully selling cloud services to organizations ranging from SMBs through Fortune 100.  Job Requirements: 50%+ of weekly time spent prospecting for net new business Regularly forecast, manage and close 50-60 workloads (10% through active consumers) in a fiscal year utilizing Oracle Sales Cloud Identify, utilize, and collaborate with key internal stakeholders in assigned territory (Tech Managers, Tech SCs, Key Partners, MySQL SCs, etc.,) Identify and maneuver across key customer stakeholders to evangelize MDS/HW to developers and Cloud Decision Makers Willingness to operate as part of a large account team; sometimes not driving the opportunity; can't be a "lone cowboy” Ability to quickly and effectively use key ORCL Sales Tools including Territory Intelligence, Market Intelligence, Eloqua, Datafox/ZoomInfo, Sales Cloud, and LinkedIn Document territory plan including target companies, existing users, marketing plans, etc., Ability to quickly develop, execute, and routinely modify a 30, 60, 90-day territory plan Ability to build and present a quarterly business review to management Ability to deliver an effective Infomentis or Account Planning discussion Understanding of how to run a discovery call. The minimum requirement is the ability to position an effective 3 minute "elevator pitch" focused on ORCL Cloud + MDS/HW  Qualifications: BS or BA degree or applicable experience preferred Proven ability to manage complex sales cycle, with a track record of successful revenue attainment Demonstrated knowledge of direct software / IT sales (3 years+) Excellent communication/negotiating/closing skills with customers/prospects Aggressive, strong organizational skills and a self-starter    Sells a subset of products or services directly or via partners to small-and-medium sized accounts. The role is a combination of a Field Sales Rep and Inside Sales Rep.  Works to achieve maximum sales profitability, growth, and account penetration within an assigned territory. Territory may be a combination of geographic, product, industry and other customer / market dimensions. Sells to the territory directly or via partners. The territory that this rep covers does not have an Inside Sales Rep or Field Rep. Utilizes inbound and/or outbound techniques to identify, qualify and close new opportunities. Manages accounts throughout the entire sales process, and collaborates with team members in business development, consulting and support to uncover all customer needs. Responsible for understanding Oracle's product offerings and competitive issues to develop solution proposals encompassing all aspects of the application. Travels to customer sites to identify/develop sales opportunities. Participates in the development, presentation, and sales of a value proposition. Onsite customer presentation with C-levels to negotiate and close strategic and complex deals. Liaises with customer contacts for the purpose of managing the customer relationship, identifying new opportunities and maximizing sales.  Duties and tasks are varied and complex utilizing independent judgment. Fully competent in own area of expertise. May have a project lead role. Highly developed selling, customer relations, and negotiation skills. Successful sales track record. Oracle knowledge and/or knowledge of Oracle's competitors. interaction with C-level players. Team player. Ability to penetrate accounts and meet with stakeholders within accounts. Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal skills. Presentation skills. Travels to customer as needed. 5+ years relevant sales experience. BS/BA degree or equivalent preferred.    Email of Internal Contact: michael.gonzalez@oracle.com  Apply on our site: https://eeho.fa.us2.oraclecloud.com/hcmUI/CandidateExperience/en/sites/CX_1/job/103525/?utm_medium=jobshare

Mimeo is looking for a Manager of Sales Development to come join a well performing, fast growing team with a top notch tech stack, Sales ops support and a win as a team culture.   The Manager, Sales Development is someone who is looking to grow within Mimeo. The position is designed to be a coach, teacher, and mentor of a team of Sales Development Reps (SDRs) on how to successfully engage prospects and create qualified opportunities for the sales team.   Department Sales Development (Mimeo) Employment Type Full Time Location New York, NY Reporting To Michael McNary  Key Responsibilities Training, Coaching and Mentoring of your team Conduct regular team meetings - designed to train the team on key skills Conduct weekly 1:1’s with each team member to coach and develop them Train new hires on key skills required to be successful in the SDR role Manage a team of 8-10 Sales Development Reps to meet and exceed 100% of quota Regularly review metrics and expectations with team - beyond just 1:1’s Hold team accountability for required activity and results Track, Manage and Report on Key Performance Indicators Closely monitor key activity and effectiveness metrics to drive targeted coaching Proficiently create and develop new reporting to identify trends and real-time analysis of team performance and opportunity. Quickly, openly and directly communicate any visible gaps in metrics that could negatively affect ability to meet objectives Interviewing and Hiring New Team Members  Conduct mock sales calls to assess candidate viability Conduct in person interviews and make hiring decisions Collaborate with Sales Development, Marketing, Sales, and Customer Success Constantly look for ‘system’ problems that are getting in the way of your team’s success and find solutions to fix them Meet regularly to share feedback with the other key pieces of the revenue team Skills Knowledge and Expertise Required 1+ years of experience managing SDRs\BDRs  1+ Years of successful experience as a Sales/Business Development Representative Experience closing business is a strong plus Experience and expertise using Salesforce Bachelor's Degree Required Proven track record of personal and professional success Strong and clear communicator Proven track record of hiring and ramping SDRs to quota Proven and demonstrated experience successfully coaching sales people Exceptional Listening Skills and Empathy Demonstrates ownership and accountability This position is New York based, but we are open to remote candidates with a proven track record of successfully hiring and managing a team of SDRs remotely.  Benefits Mimeo’s values of Act Like an Owner, Drive Customer Success, and Enjoy the Ride, are at the core of who we are and the decisions we make. As our employees are the most important aspect of our organization we make it a point to provide competitive benefits.   Some of our Benefits are:  Excellent medical, dental, and vision coverage for you and your family  Competitive salary  Flexible PTO  Internal career advancement opportunities About Mimeo Mimeo.com is the innovator of online managed content distribution and printing. Our global footprint and cloud based platform provide customers the simplest way to create, manage, and distribute content they rely on to do business.  The minds, makers, and innovators at Mimeo are dedicated to giving back our customers what matters most – their time. Mimeo provides the easiest, fastest, and most reliable way to manage and distribute their content. We bring our customers’ content to life through print and digital formats to over 140 countries around the world.

This position is remote.  IntelePeer delivers an omnichannel communication platform as a service (CPaaS) built for the enterprise. We believe that business communications are meant for more than just simple interactions they should enable businesses to deliver truly delightful experiences  IntelePeer is seeking a qualified Sales Development Manager to help keep our revenue engine running through their skill and through leadership of a team of driven sales developers. Our ideal Sales Development Manager has in-depth knowledge of and experience with prospecting, exceling at lead generation, relationship building and partnering on all Demand Generation initiatives. We’re seeking a quick learner with strong communication skills, and someone with a track record of success who can inspire the same in others. The role demands a day-to-day leader with a sharp mind and the ability to coach, advise, motivate, or replace sales representatives to create and maintain a high-performance sales team.  REPORTS TO: SVP, Account Management  POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES  Train and develop the skills of the Sales Development team Nurture and grow a sales pipeline through Sales Development team activities and leveraging ABM outreach Partner with Marketing to develop effective outreach strategy for messaging and all outbound communications Establish KPI metrics for team that will measure success Work closely with Enterprise and Mid-Market Leadership teams to identify key company accounts to develop Analyze Outreach cadences with an eye towards continual improvement and up-to-date messaging, by buyer persona and by industry Other duties as assigned  REQUIREMENTS  3+ years in Sales Development Manager\Leadership role Experience managing and improving Sales Development KPIs Proven track record of success as an SDR manager Proficient in MS Word, MS Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint Excellent interpersonal, negotiation, and presentation skills. Familiarity with Salesforce or other CRM tools Experience with facilitating trainings and meetings 10% - 25 % travel is required.  Competencies  Oversee the sales team to ensure company quotas and standards are met by holding daily check-ins with team to set objectives for the day and monitor progress regularly Onboarding new sales developers Structured coaching of team members Ensuring that the right team-spirit is in place Plan and execute weekly local huddles where sales training is repeated and customer pain, product features, objection handling etc. will be discussed. Identify knowledge gaps within the team and develop a plan to fulfill them  Why You’ll Love It Here  Generous paid time off Internet and cell phone usage reimbursement. Gym membership. LinkedIn Learning, plus other upskilling opportunities Competitive medical, dental & vision coverage 401K Company-paid life insurance Company-paid short-term and long-term disability Legal coverage and other supplemental options Free snacks, fun events (virtual and in-person when we can again) A value-based culture where growth opportunities are endless  Compensation  Compensation varies based on location the services are being performed. For individuals who would perform this work in Colorado, the starting pay range for a candidate selected for this position is generally within the range of $90,000 - 100,000 for annual base salary. On Target Earnings: $180,000. Employees are eligible for additional discretionary bonuses and commissions pursuant to the Company’s commission plan. The successful candidate’s actual pay will also be based on qualifications and experience, so the actual starting pay may be above or below this range.  Vaccination Requirement  COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement: IntelePeer requires anyone working onsite or visiting IntelePeer’s offices to confirm they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless a medical or religious accommodation is timely requested and approved. Please reach out if you have questions or concerns about this policy and how it may apply to your candidacy for a role with IntelePeer.   For California residents only: Please refer to the link below for IntelePeer’s Applicant CCPA Privacy Notice. https://www.intelepeer.com/intelepeer-applicant-ccpa-privacy-notice-2020-05-21/  Any requests to exercise your rights as a data subject under GDPR should be submitted to infosec@intelepeer.com for prompt processing. Please refer to our Privacy Policy (at www.intelepeer.com/privacy/intelepeer-privacy-policy) for any questions on how IntelePeer complies with GDPR.

description: Sales Trainer Sales training is essential to an organization’s success, and it’s a powerful tool for developing the full potential of every sales rep. The success of a program is due in large part to the individual delivering it—and the approach they take.  All applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis. Location: Remote Storable is a distributed-first company, but is only registered for employment in a certain number of states. In order to be considered, you must permanently reside in the following states to be eligible for employment: Texas, Colorado, North Carolina, Tennessee, Florida, Illinois, Indiana, Kansas, Missouri, Pennsylvania, Georgia, Arizona, Alabama, Mississippi Louisiana, South Carolina, Oklahoma, Wyoming, Nebraska, Wisconsin, Virginia  About Us: At Storable, we believe storage operators should have one partner they can trust to help you get the results they need for their business. That’s why we’ve built the industry’s first fully integrated platform that offers facility management software, facility websites, marketing programs and services, payments, and deeply integrated tenant insurance capabilities all in one solution.  We leverage our platform in combination with our over 25 years of storage industry expertise to help our thousands of storage customers achieve their tenant experience and operational efficiency objectives every  single day.   What you will do everyday: Coach and develop our sales and CS reps Own all new hire Sales and CS training Review and improve our current sales process / training methodology - make strategic recommendations that help us drive to world class sales process and results  Leverage current call monitoring system that quantifies and calibrates call skill performance and identifies opportunities for improvement  Create, update, maintain, and report on rep coaching logs Work with Sales Leadership, Revenue Operations & Learning & Development to identify areas of opportunity, metrics, and behaviors to coach and monitor Assist sales management with driving adoption of processes and key metrics  Operational Activities & Responsibilities  Directly engage front-line sales team members to teach, mentor, coach and drive the sales process Engage and assist sales reps on active opportunities as needed Work with Learning & Development to prepare and organise digital and or physical job aids or other materials required to facilitate the learning process Facilitate the collection, sharing, and archiving of sales best practices Post training follow up and reinforcement Conduct regular recurring coaching sessions with their assigned reps Coach and assist reps with the activities and action items in their assigned coaching plans Monitor and evaluate sales calls with sales team members regularly  What you need to bring to the table: Strong background in sales and sales process training (at least 2-4 years of professional training experience) Sales Leadership experience is preferable Must be humble - the focus must remain on the participants and their development. Intellectually curious and facilitates authentic discussions Altruistic - motivated by having a positive impact on team members career Always looking for ways to improve their craft World class communicator - ability to communicate complex ideas that are easily absorbed by participants A great balance of strategic mindset with incredible hands on presence  A difference maker who loves helping a team to win  Benefits and Perks: Generous health coverage for you and your family, including short- and long-term disability coverage, 401(k) and HSA matching, company-provided life insurance, and more. Engage remotely! Since March of 2020, we transitioned to a fully remote environment and we run regular contests, trivia games and remote happy hours. Instant-Access & Flexible vacation. We trust you, so we have a ‘take what you need’ vacation policy. No waiting to use it or need for accruals. Do More, Be More – Company rewards and recognition that add up and can be redeemed for once-in-a-lifetime Bucketlist experiences! Get active in the community by joining one of our many quarterly offsite volunteer and community service events. Fun company events, including Halloween costume contests, ugly sweater competitions, baseball game outings, ice cream socials, food trucks, and more.  Storable is committed to providing equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, Storable will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

Company Description  Alside, a division of Associated Materials Incorporated (“AMI”), is a federally designated essential business and recognized leader in the home improvement industry. Founded in 1947, Alside is a manufacturer and distributor of vinyl siding and accessories, vinyl windows and patio doors, and fencing and railing products for the residential and commercial remodeling and new construction markets. Alside products are distributed to licensed professional remodeling contractors and home builders through our network of over 100 Supply Centers and also through select independent distributors across the U.S. and Canada. We are proud to be a charter member of the Vinyl Siding Institute, the American Association of Architects, the National Association of Home Builders, and the National Association of the Remodeling Industry.  Job Description  The individual in this role will be primarily responsible for: Achieving the annual Top-Line revenue goal for his/her assigned sales territory. Managing an assigned book of B2B business to include making daily in-market sales calls on assigned accounts, gaining share-of-wallet with assigned accounts, and maintaining long-term retention of assigned accounts within the sales territory. Driving new account acquisition & business conversion by managing a specific list of prospect accounts and a defined list of targeted accounts. Becoming a subject matter expert on core Alside manufactured window, door, siding, and metal products. Demonstration of Alside products (small-medium groups) to Single Family Home Builders, Remodeling Contractors & Dealers, Architects and/or Multi-Family General Contractors to include features, benefits, and competitive advantages. Preparation of customer proposals and price quotes. Weekly reporting and accountability of his/her sales activities and sales forecasts in the Portland, OR market. REPORTS TO: Area Sales Manager  Sales Skills  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Ability to follow the Sales Process from beginning to end. Understands, assesses, and anticipates customers’ objectives, strategies, and requirements to identify and pursue sales opportunities Ability to overcome objections and find solutions. Ability to problem solve and work with multiple stakeholders in complex selling scenarios. Exceptional time management, task prioritization, organization, and follow-up Responsible for escalated customer service, issue follow-up, and as necessary delegation to correct primary contact point for issue resolution. Conducts annual sales and account/planning, forecasting, reporting, management efforts for the assigned accounts within his / her sales territory Acquires new customers to maximize supply center revenue Management/Leadership Works closely with supply center personnel and corporate resources for fulfillment of orders. Strong knowledge of the AMI sales process and policies (e.g., accruals, credit, expenses, rewards) Product / Market Sells B2B remodeling, new construction, project work, and Installed Sales (turn-key contracts) Understands necessary building codes and how they impact AMI products Reads blueprints and understands take-off capabilities for core products Brings core product specification knowledge, application, and value to the customer Must be able to accurately and professionally demo all core products to small and large groups Understands the basics of negotiating correct market value pricing for the assigned territory, and seeks advice from the Area Sales Manager or Sr. Sales Manager Qualifications  Education And Experience Successful sales history with a minimum of 2 years of outside sales experience. Experience within the building materials industry is highly preferred. Bachelor's degree preferred Self-directed, highly organized, customer-focused, detail oriented, and competitive Working knowledge of core building material products (specifically windows & siding) for both single and multi-family applications Proven experience in new business selling, upselling, and selling Preferred experience working with builders and architects to create bigger ticket sales Additional Information  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Warby Parker is seeking a service-oriented Sales Manager to support a team of exceptional Retail Advisors in creating the best possible glasses-shopping experiences. As a Sales Manager, you'll engage with customers, have a hand in process ideation and improvement, and participate in various special projects along the way. Through these responsibilities, you'll directly impact the success of our company while seeing our strategic operations in action and learning from our super talented business and Retail leaders. Ready to play an integral part in shaping and driving Warby Parker Retail? Read on!  What You'll Do Communicate Warby Parker's values and brand philosophy to customers Own troubleshooting for our point-of-sale system Oversee the store's inventory management procedures Develop new processes that improve Warby Parker’s ability to serve customers and optimize their shopping experiences Manage and implement daily zoning schedules Open and close the store Lead meetings at the beginning of shifts and at the end of the day, plus roundtables and other meetings as needed Direct a team of 8–10 team members, consistently demonstrating what great service looks like Help conduct team members' biannual performance reviews with the Store Leader and Associate Store Leader Assist with new hire on-boarding and ongoing training Treat all of our customers with respect and cultivate an inclusive, service-minded work culture Who You Are Steeped in Retail experience, with 1+ year in a management position Equipped with exceptional interpersonal skills Backed by managerial experience in sales or operations at a complex, customer-focused retailer A self-starter with an entrepreneurial spirit Eager to learn new skills An upbeat and empathetic team player Driven to do what it takes to be a top performer time and time again—and help your teammates reach their targets along the way Able to bring a positive, fun energy to the workplace, even when working long hours Not on the Office of Inspector General’s List of Excluded Individuals/Entities (LEIE) Some benefits of working at Warby Parker for Full-Time Employees: Health, vision, and dental insurance Life and AD&D Insurance Flexible vacation policy Paid Holidays Retirement savings plan with a company match Parental leave (non-birthing parents included) Short-term disability Employee Assistance Program (EAP) Bereavement Support Optical Education Reimbursement Free eyewear And more (just ask!) About Us  Warby Parker was founded with a mission: to inspire and impact the world with vision, purpose, and style.  We’re constantly asking ourselves how we can do more and make a greater impact—and that starts by reimagining everything that a company and industry can be. We want to demonstrate that a business can scale, be profitable, and do good in the world—without charging a premium for it. And we’ve learned that it takes creativity, empathy, and innovation to achieve that goal.  Since the day we launched in 2010, we’ve pioneered ideas, designed products, and developed technologies that help people see. We offer everything our customers need for happier eyes at a price that leaves them with money in their pockets, from designer-quality glasses and contacts to eye exams and vision tests.  Ultimately, we believe in vision for all, which is why for every pair of glasses or sunglasses we sell, a pair of glasses is distributed to someone in need through our Buy a Pair, Give a Pair program. Over eight million pairs of glasses have been distributed in over 50 countries; that means eight million people now have the glasses they need to learn, work, and achieve better economic outcomes.  At Warby Parker, you can look forward to company outings and events, volunteering and learning opportunities, and just great company filled with curious, kind folks. Dreaming up and sharing ideas aren’t responsibilities reserved for certain teams or leaders; the challenge (a really fun one) of innovation is on all of our shoulders. Teammates can also connect around common interests, backgrounds, and identities, no matter their home base, through our various employee resource groups. (We’re happy to say that the Human Rights Campaign has named us a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ+ employees!) That sense of community and belonging keeps us excited to walk through the door every day, wherever that door may be.  We're driven to continue building a workplace, based on inclusive behaviors and equitable systems, where all employees can bring their authentic selves, feel engaged, and share their perspectives as a valued member of Team Warby. Transparency is what we’re all about, and our annual Impact Report and Racial Equity Strategy lay out how we’re sticking to these values.

TITLE: BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT REPRESENTATIVE SALARY: $55,000-60,000 base (Y1 OTE $90k, Y3 $150k) BENEFITS: Health & Dental Insurance, 401k, Generous Holiday & Generous Vacation package LOCATION: New York Office START: October 25th  ***Promotion to Account Executive typically 6 months***  GDS Group is a global award-winning virtual event platform and project intelligence organization dedicated to helping the world’s largest enterprises, including Google, Microsoft, Oracle, IBM, AWS, HPE, and SAP to name a few, meet the challenges posed by a fast-moving, digitally disruptive business environment.  Our market-leading virtual event platform brings qualified senior executives from purchaser and tech provider communities together to find solutions to real-world business challenges.  BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT REPRESENTATIVE: This role is in great demand in the NYC office. Many qualified new starters begin in the SDR role, which allows you to progress into a fully trained and successful SAE.  Using your exceptional research skills, you will actively build new sales leads and business opportunities for our most senior Sales Account Executives through strategic outbound calls, personal value-add emails, Zoominfo, and LinkedIn Sales Navigator. You will be able to quickly research and understand a solution provider's product, see opportunities and strategize an approach to build interest, securing meetings with key decision-makers.   When speaking with SVP and C-Level executives it’s vital to have researched who they are and what they are trying to achieve within their given market. You will be expected to develop a deep understanding of our products and the industry verticals and horizontals GDS Group operates across, researching your markets to understand the issues driving each industry.  You will: Conduct extensive market research and use a variety of lead generating techniques to identify new leads within your market Initiate conversations with C-Suite and SVPs of solution providers (SMEs to enterprise) across the world Set up meetings for the business development team by means of proactive outbound outreach Prepare meeting material for the Senior SAE  Master the Value Selling methodology Document information in Salesforce  What You’ll Need Experience in a targeted B2B sales role Demonstrated loyalty and achievement in your employment history – promotions, President's Club, Winner's Circle, etc. Stellar communication skills – both written and verbal. Self-motivated, proactive, and results-oriented professional style with a strong ability to work independently in a fast-paced work environment  With a marketing-leading platform, 70%+ growth projected for 2021, a super sales training program, and a rewarding commission scheme, we are perfectly positioned to offer swift career path progression and exciting earning potential to those who show a commitment to obtaining and evolving the right skill sets.  Please take a look at our testimonial video: https://gdsglobalmedia.s3.amazonaws.com/videos/sponsor_journey_highlights.mp4  * It’s well known that firms with greater gender diversity among senior leadership perform better. GDS Group is proud to be in that category! Research shows that while men apply for sales jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other underrepresented individuals tend to only apply when they check every box. So, if you think you have what it takes but don't necessarily meet every single point listed below, please apply - you could be exactly whom we are looking for!  ** To help promote and ensure the safety of all of our employees, customers, and business partners we require employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of vaccination, which will be kept confidential. If you are not vaccinated, or partially vaccinated currently, but willing to become fully vaccinated, we invite you to still apply.  GDS Inc. is committed to providing a safe and inclusive work environment for all and we recognize that some individuals may have a sincerely held religious belief as it pertains to the practice of immunization or a medical condition that may prevent them from becoming vaccinated. Individuals who cannot be fully vaccinated due to a sincerely held religious belief or medical condition may request an accommodation in accordance with the Company’s Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccine Policy. We request that you refrain from discussing religious beliefs or medical conditions during the interview process. If you believe you need accommodation, please submit your request to accomodations@gdsgroup.com. All requests for accommodation will remain confidential and reviewed by selected GDS senior leaders. We cannot guarantee that all requests for accommodation will be granted.

description: **this is a remote position, but you need to be located in New England**  Gradient AI:    Gradient AI is a fast-growing startup, bringing state-of-the-art Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) solutions to the trillion-dollar insurance industry.  Founded in 2018, we have recently raised $20M from top Insurtech investors to continue fueling our growth.  Our software-as-a-service platform provides bias-free, data-driven insights, enabling insurance companies to profitably run their business and expand their offerings to underserved people and markets.   About the Role:  We are searching for an Enterprise Sales Executive to join our team and sell our SaaS based claims and underwriting solutions to the insurance industry. This person will understand our customer’s business objectives, the technical components of our solutions, and utilize a deliberate sales methodology in achieving sales objectives.   Key Responsibilities: Build your own book of business with a strong pipeline of prospective customers through direct prospecting, relationships, and referrals Lead all aspects of the consultative sales process including new business development, client research, objection handling, demoing, closing, and follow up Craft compelling statements of work and pricing proposals   Master our value proposition today and as the competitive landscape evolves  Hit, achieve, and exceed monthly and annual sales targets   Qualifications:   7+ years of enterprise SaaS sales experience Solid track record building your own book of business from the ground up; someone who loves to hunt! Strong negotiation and presentation skills; experience running technical demos & ability to demonstrate ROI through the use of technology Prior experience selling into C-level executives Ability to work in a self-driven manner within a fast-paced, collaborative environment  What We Offer:  A fun, team-oriented startup culture Generous stock options - we all get to own a piece of what we’re building Unlimited vacation days Flexible schedule that supports working from home Full benefits package including medical, dental, vision, 401k, and more Ample opportunities to learn and take on new responsibilities  We are an equal opportunity employer.

You will be part of the Global Sales organization where you will be responsible for all direct sales activities in your territory, including new customer account leads and opportunities as well as upselling in assigned targeted accounts. You will work closely with a business development representative to establish the criteria for lead generation and you will actively qualify marketing leads in your territory.  Finally, you will manage your opportunities by providing more in depth qualification, handling customers objections, and building relationships with your customers during the sales cycle. We are recruiting talent for Central US, East Coast, West Coast and the Toronto region.  Learn more about working for ValGenesis, the de facto standard for paperless validation in Life Sciences:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tASq7Ld0JsQ  Your Responsibilities include but are not limited to: Assist in lead generation activities and grow the pipeline of new customer leads. Qualify marketing leads thru effective customer contact and manage all sales leads. Establish relationships with key customer stakeholders and understand their pain points. Manage the entire sales cycle from early identification to contract close. Understand and communicate ValGenesis unique value propositions to your customers. Further qualify customers for more in-depth discussions about ValGenesis products. Coordinate with pre-sales, all demonstration activities including handling objections. Manage and update all customer information in the CRM system. Provide updates on pipeline and forecast of closed business during territory reviews. Assist in negotiation of business terms and final contract closure activities. Establish your presence in Life Sciences Industry events and regional activities. Develop a sustainable growth plan for all revenue sources in your territory.  The required Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience you will bring to ValGenesis… Bachelor Degree or equivalent in Engineering, Computer Science, or Business Admin. 5+ Years Selling Enterprise Software solutions, or complex applications, -OR- Life Sciences background or experience with regulatory, quality, or other systems Proven track record of success in managing client relationships Highly motivated professional with excellent communication and interpersonal skills Able to work independently in a fast-paced environment Travel as required and allowed; expect in the range of 40% - 60%  About Us: ValGenesis is the #1 fast-growing global software technology company leveraging digital technology, in helping Global Life Science companies achieve higher levels of efficiency and productivity in the Validation life efforts.  We are proud to partner with 30 of the top 50 global Pharmaceutical and Biotech companies.  Through our SaaS platform and flagship product, Validation Lifecycle Management System (VLMS) is the 1st enterprise software solution to manage the corporate validation lifecycle process 100% electronically.  As a first mover in the industry, ValGenesis is pioneering innovation and helping the healthcare industry create significant savings in both cost and time. VLMS is the system of record and standard for all types of validation processes for several global regulated Life Science companies.  ValGenesis is the de facto standard for paperless Validation across the Life Science industry.  ValGenesis provides competitive base salary, commission, equity, benefit stipend, paid Company Holidays, and PTO (paid time off). We are searching for talent that is driven to execute results to help us accomplish our goals, while remaining committed to customer success, collaborating cross-functionally, openly communicating, and operating with the highest integrity and responsibility.  ValGenesis is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, age, national origin, religion, marital status, sexual orientation, ancestry, color, gender identity / expression, family / medical care leave, genetic information, medical condition, physical / mental disability, political affiliation, status as a protected veteran, status as a person with a disability, or other characteristics protected by laws or regulations.

The Strategic Account Manager is responsible to lead, develop and implement strategic selling strategies that result in profitable growth by leading the sales development efforts for the Hospitality Sales Channel. Strong business development skills required with responsibilities for developing strategic customer relationships; lead all sales development efforts for assigned accounts and design influencers in the hospitality industry; manage activity and growth strategy for outside Independent Rep Groups; develop and execute market strategy and assuring timeliness in pursuit of new customer contacts. Utilizes defined sales objectives, strategies, promotional programs, and achieving sales quotas. Gathers new product ideas and evaluates their potential. Provides management with information used to evaluate local, regional and national opportunities.  Key Duties & Responsibilities: 1. Establish & maintain hospitality industry contacts with existing and targeted customers that lead to sales by: Meeting with existing top customers and establishing new relationships with targeted customers across the USA. StCommunicating our value proposition and build brand awareness at the corporate level with targeted hospitality customers. Research customer needs and develop application of products, services in an effective manner. Maintaining up-to-date understanding of industry trends, government regulations and technical developments that effect target markets. Work with operations & sales staff to establish an effective communication path with customers. Resolving problems with product and service solutions. As required, attend various hospitality trade shows.  2. Responsible for growth & development of the outside Independent Rep Groups (IRG’s) to ensure territory and customer success by:  Developing communication plan with the IRG’s for regular customer and project updates. Identify any gaps in assigned IRG territories and develop & execute plan for growth. Maintain weekly project log & follow up with our customers to ensure project success. Work with Inside Sales/Customer Service on most effective communication plan and follow up with our customers.  3.  Develop and participate in sales presentations by:  Developing sales proposals for customers on technical products & services. Developing technical presentations & workshops. Participates in making presentations to End Users, Designers and OEM.  4.  Participate in sales forecasting and planning in an effective manner by:  Producing regular reports & strategic plans for Manger’s approval. Maintaining an up-to-date awareness of strategic plans and procedures to coordinate customer plans. Monitoring, analyzing, & communicating monthly sales data to contribute to product/service planning.  5.  Develop and maintain communications in a cooperative and professional manner with all levels of staff and customers:  Recommending new technical products & product modifications or terminations. Working with other staff to identify future customer needs. Gathering, analyzing and sharing customer technical information & feedback. Determine customer satisfaction with products and services. Communicate openly, honestly, and constructively. Treating all employees and customers with dignity, respect and courtesy. Taking responsibility for and making every effort to resolve communication, trust and respect concerns and problems.    Knowledge & Skills History with Hospitality End User Customers, Industry Design Influencers, and Furniture OEM. Minimum 5 years of sales experience utilizing custom solutions approach. Strong communication skills.  Education, Certificates or Experience Four-year college degree  Dekko is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

At Reily Foods Company we've got a passion for flavor and have been providing iconic foods and beverages that create meals and memories for over 120 years! Our products consist of New England Coffee, Luzianne Iced Tea, Swan's Down Cake Flour, and Carroll Shelby Chili (to name a few) and can be found in retail locations around the country.   LET'S GET BREWING!   Reporting to our Sr. Director of Sales, the Regional Sales Manager will develop strategies to capitalize business opportunities, ensure profitable performance of categories, and exceed sales objectives for regional key accounts.   If you have significant experience with Delhaize and Ingles, Food City, MDI we want to speak with you!   BLENDING TO PERFECTION.  The crucial step to this position's success.    Ensures profitable growth in sales and revenue through strategic planning, execution and broker management  Accountable for all selling aspects including developing and driving sales plan, trade fund planning and deduction management, DSMP and forecasting  Manages the Regional Account business with the goal of gaining new distribution and promotional activity through direct interaction with the sales team, buyers and brokers  Develops and maintains strong business relationships with customers and brokers by fully understanding their objectives, strategies and plans for development  Effectively manages and controls trade fund budget; leverages AR7 Management software and customer shopper data to proactively improve in store execution and close gaps to plan  P&L responsibility for accounts  Prepares and analyzes sales and statistical reports relating to pricing, DSMP, new items, forecasting and expenses for all product categories  Proactively partners with Marketing and New Product Development to launch new products into the market while maintaining proper assortment and distribution  Analyzes business trends using syndicated data to develop and implement category strategies that grow profit and volume including category direction, new product development recommendations, trade marketing needs, pricing and distribution strategies  Schedules travel and participates in sales meetings and trade shows  Other duties as assigned    THE SIMPLE INGREDIENTS.  Ideal candidates will meet the following requirements.    BA/BS in Professional Selling and Sales, Marketing or related Business field  5+ years of food/beverage CPG sales experience selling to major grocery retailers such as Delhaize, Ingles, MDI, Food City, Laurel Foods and J Winkler and Sons  Broker management experience is a must  Passionate leader with experience managing both existing relationships and developing new partnerships within Food Retail Sales  Proactive, self-starter with the demonstrated success consistently achieving sales volume, distribution and profitability goals, regardless of obstacles or circumstances  Strong sense of urgency, responsive and flexible with a strong commitment to customer satisfaction  Energetic and optimistic disposition with the ability to positively influence others  Confident and decisive decision maker; resourceful and innovative problem solver with ability to identify alternative solutions and select the best option  Sound financial acumen  Proficient in MS Office Programs; advanced Excel skills   Willingness and ability to travel 50% of the time throughout designated territory to meet with customers    TASTE THE FLAVOR!  Join our family culture and help us to continue to build our iconic brands.  Competitive salary, annual bonus, company vehicle.  Benefits include health insurance, 401k, LTD, paid vacation and holidays!   Reily Foods Company is an equal opportunity employer, Minorities/Females/Disability/Protected Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity.

About Apollo  Founded in 2015, Apollo.io is a lead intelligence and sales engagement platform trusted by nearly 9,000 paying customers, from rapidly growing startups to some of the largest global enterprises. Our community-based approach to crowdsourcing data gives users maximum coverage while ensuring data accuracy. Our advanced algorithms and unique data acquisition methods help over 500,000 sales professionals enrich and analyze prospects' data to increase quality conversations and opportunities.  We have notable investors: Y Combinator and Nexus Venture Partners. We recently completed a Series B financing to fuel our next growth phase. Apollo has also reached and maintained profitability for the last 18 months. Our growth and customer feedback set us apart from competitors. Apollo had over one million sign-ups for its platform in the past year, and the number of weekly active users increased by over 400%. We are a top-ranking G2 Crowd vendor in the Sales Intelligence, Lead Intelligence, Marketing Account Intelligence, and Sales Engagement categories. Our highest scores are in the B2B data space for accuracy and ROI based on customer reviews.  Working at Apollo  We are a remote-first inclusive organization focused on operational excellence. Our way of working ensures clear expectations and an environment to do your best work with ample reward.  The Role  This role supports the Sales and Account management teams by creating and managing world-class processes. As part of the Revenue Operations team driving you will drive effectiveness and productivity in daily operations. Taking ownership and creating excellence are critical values for this role.  Responsibilities include sales activity and performance reporting, account and territory assignments, driving sales process improvement, increasing sales activity, and effective administrative processes for the sales team.  Qualifications And Experience Required To Apply For This Role Salesforce Administration Certification 2+ years of Salesforce management experience Product-led company experience Early-stage, high-growth company experience Previous experience designing, testing, and improving sales processes Pipeline management and reporting  What You'll Love About Apollo  Besides the great compensation package and culture that thrives in openness and excellence, we invest tremendous effort into developing our remote employees' careers. The team embraces that we have a sole purpose: to help customers maximize their full revenue potential on the Apollo platform. This mindset opens us up to a lot of creative approaches to making customers successful at scale. You’ll be a significant part of a lean, remote team, empowered to really own your role as a proactive educator. We’re very collaborative at Apollo, so you’ll be able to lean on your teammates, even in adjacent departments, to help you achieve lofty goals. You’ll be supported and encouraged to experiment and take educated risks that lead to big wins. And, you’ll have a whole team remotely by your side to help you do it!
