description: Responsibilities The Regional Sales Manager is an individual contributor position with overall responsibility of the development and management of machine sales and market share growth either from direct sales or indirect sales via dealers or affiliate Liebherr companies, in their dedicated region (area).  Essential Job Duties Responsible for building and managing the assigned sales territory. Identifies, develops, and coordinates effective business relationships with customers and dealers to ensure maximum market share within the assigned territory. Meets with key clients, assisting dealer sales representatives with maintaining relationships and negotiating and closing deals. Acts as a liaison between sales department and other LUS departments as needed.  Data Maintains LUS Mining database of Liebherr and competitive mining machines (100T & larger OHT, D9, D10, D11 class DOZ, 100T and Larger HEX and wheel loaders) for assigned mines. (Del Year, Frame Hours, Repl Date, Operating/Parked, Phys Avail). Utilizes industry related data to develop in territory strategy and assess customer base  Quoting Supports development of sales strategy for the assigned territory while ensuring alignment with LUS-Mining’s overall strategy. Create and Deliver sales presentations to Prospective prospects Leads Quote and delivery process.  Reporting Maintains frequent and timely assessments and reports on market conditions; potential and current dealers and competitors; provide frequent and accurate forecasts. Must provide timely input/updates for call reports, lost sale reports and other similar reports as required by company reporting procedures. Actively updates CRM opportunities Provides Monthly Sales Reports to track activity within respective region.  Core  Competencies Customer Focus: Is attentive and responsive to the needs of internal and/or external customers. Builds and maintains customer satisfaction.  Competencies Job Skills: Applies the required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities (KSA) in the performance of essential job duties: Mining Knowledge: Knowledge of surface mining methods and basic machine technology, operations and applications. Specialty Application Knowledge: Knowledge of specialty HEX applications such as demolition, waste handling, recycling, and dredging. Engages customer, gathers information and negotiates contracts for LUS Mining to be able to obtain profitable orders in providing products and services to the market, which satisfy customer’s needs but also improves the image of Liebherr Mining Equipment Co.’s (LME) equipment, facilitates new equipment sales and ensures growth in the area. Supports development of sales strategy for the area while ensuring alignment with Liebherr’s overall mining & specialty equipment strategy. Identifies, develops, and coordinates effective business relationships with dealers and alternative distribution channels to ensure maximum market penetration Provides guidance and support in the development, implementation and maintenance of profitable service contracts. Develops and manages major account customers. Coordinates and conducts sales presentations including participation of other MIN factory representatives. Liaises with LEC/LWT/LME Sales support departments in preparation of quotations and tender documents. Coordinates the submission offers to customers and follows up. Represents Company at trade association meetings and/or industry events to promote products. Demonstrates cost consciousness.  Requirements A Bachelor’s degree, and or a minimum of 5 years of prior technical sales experience, or the equivalent combination of education and related experience.   Our Offer An interesting and ambitious role in a successful international company. We offer a secure work environment with a comprehensive benefits package that includes major medical, dental and vision insurance, 401K plan with company match, paid vacation and personal days and competitive salary.  Have we awoken your interest? Then we look forward to receiving your online application. If you have any questions, please contact Beatrice Bushee at: beatrice.bushee@liebherr.com. Liebherr is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military/veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. Liebherr - One Passion. Many Opportunities. The company In line with its international growth, Liebherr’s venture into the United States began in 1970. Within a couple of years, the company expanded and completed its production facilities in Newport News, Virginia, for its product line of hydraulic excavators. It was later converted into Liebherr’s manufacturing facility for mining trucks and remains home to Liebherr Mining Equipment Newport News, Co. In addition to its production facility, Liebherr markets a wide variety of products and technologies through its companies located across the United States. The companies are Liebherr-Aerospace Saline, Inc., Liebherr Gear Technology, Inc., Liebherr Automation Systems, Co., and Liebherr USA, Co., the umbrella company for 12 product segments that are positioned across the United States.  Location Liebherr USA Co. 5800 South Douglas Highway 82718 Gillette, WY United States (US)  Contact Beatrice Bushee beatrice.bushee@liebherr.com Rachel.Swicegood@liebherr.com

We are looking to employ a hard-working and sales-driven district sales manager to manage the sales operations within an assigned district and ensure that company sales goals are achieved. Essential Duties and Responsibilities Position will cover Washington, Oregon, Arkansas, California, Nevada, and Hawaii. Develops and implements strategic sales plans for Dealers and Distributors. Directs sales forecasting activities and sets performance goals accordingly. Reviews market analyses to determine customer needs, price schedules, and discount rates Directs staffing, training, and performance evaluations to develop and control sales program for Dealers and Distributors. Directs channel development activity and coordinates sales distribution by establishing sales territories, quotas, and goals. Advises Dealers, Distributors, and clients concerning sales and advertising techniques. Assigns sales territory to Dealers and Distributors. Analyzes sales statistics to formulate policy and assist Dealers and Distributors in promoting sales. Directs product simplification and standardization to eliminate unprofitable items from sales line. Represents company at trade association meetings to promote product. Delivers sales presentations to key clients in coordination with sales representatives. Meets with key clients, assisting sales representative with maintaining relationships and negotiating and closing deals. Coordinates liaison between sales department and other sales related units. Analyzes and controls expenditures of his/her territory to conform to budgetary requirements. Assists other departments within organization to prepare manuals and technical publications. Prepares periodic sales report showing sales volume, potential sales, and areas of proposed client base expansion. Assists with product research and new product development. Monitors and evaluates the activities and products of the competition. Recommends or approves budget, expenditures, and appropriations for research and development work. Supervisory Responsibilities:                           Manage Dealers and Distributor’s supervisors who direct their employees in the areas of sales and project management. Responsible for the overall direction, coordination, and evaluation of these units. Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include interviewing, prospective Dealers and Distributors, and training their employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; as well as addressing complaints and resolving problems.  Education and/or Experience: Four year college degree is preferred. Five years’ experience in Construction Sales and Project Management is required.                         Computer Skills:  Microsoft word and Excel                             Other Qualifications: STRONG Construction Project Manager Background   MUST have ability to read and interpret blue prints and project specifications. Perform material take offs, pricing and direct bidding to General Contractors and Construction.  Project manages from order entry through installation of final product.

WHO WE ARE  We are LARQ. LARQ was started with a simple vision where innovative technology can be combined with inspirational design to help people access pristine drinking water easily and sustainably. Our products look as good as they make you feel.  We are confident these are the most beautiful hydration products in the world. We make it easy to choose a healthier and sustainable choice, anytime and anywhere. And we are just getting started.  Drink brilliantly.  WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR  LARQ is looking for a Senior Key Account Manager to join our growing team. In this role, you will be responsible for management and growth of relationships with our high-profile national retail accounts in North America. You will lead the B2B retail and sales efforts in across retail, corporate, and boutique channels. You will also take a creative approach to identifying opportunities for growth. As a fast-paced and entrepreneurial company, we are looking for nontraditional, action-oriented individuals who are hoping to make an impact on the world through the work that they do. We want someone who's driven to do great work and put in the extra effort to get there.  WHAT YOU’LL DO  ●     Lead the execution of a B2B sales channel strategy (retail key account, distribution, corporate, boutique, etc.) in North America, achieving revenue & profitability goals across sales channels by expanding retail footprint, deepening relationships, driving sell-through growth, strategic planning, optimizing trade marketing and exploring new channels for LARQ; ●     Responsible for ensuring brand image is properly executed, both digitally and visually at retail, working with the marketing team to develop quality POSM materials and implementing VM standards and marketing guidelines, as well as provide training to store staff; ●     Drive business development for LARQ in North America across existing and new accounts by attending trade shows, leveraging existing networks, and, most importantly, hustling; ●     Work cross-functionally with Operations, Logistics, Finance, Accounting, etc. to ensure efficient back-office support and compliance. Work to forecast sales to ensure proper planning; ●     Manage, track and resolve all customer compliance issues such as freight claims, charge-backs, shipping violations, RTV etc.; ●     Demonstrate a clear understanding of the market segment including competitive positioning and consumer trends; ●     Manage and cultivate a sales associate as part of the North America sales team.  WHO YOU ARE  ●     Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent combination of education and experience ●     5-8 years of sales & account management experience ideally with exposure to retail marketing ●     Must have experience working with major National Accounts such as Nordstrom’s, Bloomingdales, William & Sonoma, Target, Best Buy or similar organizations ●     Proven ability to build strong business partnerships and develop collaborative relationships with accounts as well as cross-functional partners ●     Excellent written and verbal communication skills and impeccable attention to detail ●     Demonstrate understanding of retail math, KPI’s, along with strong planning and forecasting skills ●     High energy & enthusiasm with an eagerness to learn and an ambition to do more ●     Someone with a healthy disrespect for the “impossible” or “the never been done” and a willingness to get your hands dirty  SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS  ●     Travel required – approximately 15-20% ●     Willing and able to work additional hours as needed, including occasional weekends ●     Passion for sustainability as well as the mission of LARQ  A cover letter is recommended when applying for consideration.

Job Purpose We are currently looking for an exceptional instructional design professional who specializes in facilitation, design, and certification. This individual must have experience delivering high-quality, engaging and effective learning content to Sales/Partnerships teams and must be an exceptional facilitator. In addition, the successful candidate will be someone who holds our organization to high standards for sales performance. A successful candidate will be dynamic, passionate, self-motivated and ready to make a big impact as we scale the team. This position will require a quick learner who values continuous improvement with a “whatever-it-takes” mentality and can thrive in a fast-paced environment. In short, this individual must be an expert at instructional design and all things MX.   What you’ll get to do…  Develop and deliver sales-specific training (in-person and elearning) for employees within the Sales/Partnerships teams in the following areas: financial services industry, MX product suite, sales methodology/acumen, technical, system tools/processes, legal, security and pricing Design practice exercises, including best practices for Sales-specific teams Track and monitor participant progress--including all modalities--to provide perpetual clarity into learners’ progress Track and facilitate certification process, including Q&A sessions, review, demos and role-play Identify struggling learners and provide additional 1-1 practice with feedback as necessary to reinforce skills taught during training sessions and focus on the successful application of the learning to their role  Manage all activities surrounding trainings to ensure successful engagement from Sales/Partnerships team member participants from preparation, execution and follow-up Manage the adoption and engagement with the MX’s sales and coaching software to enable team members to be self-sufficient learners driving efficiencies in their role Work with sales leadership to identify gaps in training delivery and implement creative solutions that promote overall sales growth and performance  You’ll do it using your…  4+ years instructional design experience Required 2+ years experience in sales training and coaching that demonstrates an ability to facilitate effective training content with a commitment to delivering results that directly impact the Sales team’s ability to hit revenue targets Banking or financial services industry experience an advantage Experience with The Challenger Sale methodology an advantage Exceptional written, verbal and presentation skills Ability to communicate complex information and process in a streamlined, easy-to-understand fashion Solid time-management and prioritization skills with the ability to balance workload and actively takes initiative to complete projects and drive ideas that benefit the team Strong financial and business acumen with a willingness and capability to learn new software tools and applications quickly and efficiently Intellectual curiosity with a vested interest in continuous learning about and improving, both the company and one’s self You’ll fit in by…  Thinking like an owner (having a “founder’s mindset”) Collaborating well with members of the Sales/Partnerships, Product, Engineering, Security, Legal and Finance and MXCS teams Bringing and sharing your passion every day Being resourceful and creative Communicating with honesty, candor and respect (objectivity in discourse and trust)  You’ll love it because…  You will have the opportunity to work in a successful, fast moving, mission-driven company This is an incredibly impactful role in the organization You will have autonomy and growth opportunities You will collaborate with other creative and enthusiastic team members You will be rewarded and recognized for your high-caliber work MX also offers competitive benefits and many perks including free meals and unlimited PTO We are building something very special here at MX and this is an incredibly exciting time to participate in a meaningful way where you can see the direct impact of your contribution  Videos to watch…  People of MX | Jun Mataguchi - https://youtu.be/G1tSn8FC9CU  People of MX | Sue Dumbauld - https://youtu.be/EZf5AAHlHMk

Financing Sales Representative Location: Western half of the US. Near an Oracle office preferred, but telecommuting / remote from within the region is acceptable.  Oracle Financing Division (OFD) works closely with customers and Oracle technology sales executives to develop and present the financial case and transaction structure for customer investment in Oracle technologies. Sales representatives are responsible for: Developing financial models and presentations and negotiating financial and legal contracts for end-user payment transactions Training Oracle technology sales personnel to identify opportunities for accelerating and growing sales through OFD engagement Participating with sales personnel in forecast reviews Advising customers of acquisition payment and deal structure options, and preparing proposals and contracts for payment solutions Obtaining credit approvals, providing financial and transaction analysis to assist credit underwriting Generating and negotiating payment contracts (within OFD business practices) Obtaining customer signatures and assisting the Oracle contract review and signing process.  Preferred Qualifications: Strong presentation skills and proven ability to sell to at the executive level. Complex contract negotiation experience. Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. MBA is a plus.   If you are a Colorado resident, Please Contact us or Email us at oracle-salary-inquiries_us@oracle.com to receive compensation and benefits information for this role. Please include this Job ID: 125106 in the subject line of the email.  About Us Innovation starts with inclusion at Oracle. We are committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can be themselves and do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued, that we are inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. That’s why we need people with diverse backgrounds, beliefs, and abilities to help us create the future, and are proud to be an affirmative-action equal opportunity employer.  Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.

description: Every moment of every day, people all over the world turn to Panasonic to make their lives simpler, more enjoyable, more productive and more secure. Since our founding almost a century ago, we’ve been committed to improving peoples’ lives and making the world a better place–one customer, one business, one innovative leap at a time. Come join our journey.  Click here to learn more about how Panasonic is creating a better life, a better world.  Watch this video to see how our employees are shaping the technologies that move us.  What You Will Get To Do Lead, coach, train and motivate team by working alongside direct reports in the field calling on top vertical end users and laptop, handheld/tablet reseller accounts with ultimate goal of developing sales pipeline and revenue with mobility service and solutions. Establish vision, create business plans for new solutions within the vertical, set strategic direction and ensure adjustments to plan as necessary throughout fiscal year to ensure achievement of goals. Provides timely, accurate & complete reports to management on progress and state of team activities Engages and leverages effective relationships with internal resources and industry partners to create opportunities and drive further adoption of Panasonic Solutions and Services in the marketplace Oversee and manage team training programs from initiation through delivery, assuring the right internal resources, technical or business are aligned to support the team’s success Responsible for managing a team tasked with driving incremental Professional Services and Solutions revenue across all Mobility Verticals in the US sales territory for laptop, handheld and tablet product segments. Will manage a National Territory supporting the channel and all customers within our three key business sectors. (Federal, Public Sector and Enterprise) What You’ll Bring  Education & Experience: Bachelor’s degree in business management, Information Technology, or a related discipline. 10 years of successful services sales engagement experience in the technology market with an IT Service company, manufacturer, reseller, or ISV Strong leadership skills. Previous experience managing a remote team in a channel environment Seasoned experienced sales professional with an understanding of warranty, deployment, and integrated solutions for the rugged handheld/tablet market Has a solid understanding of business, financials, markets and the needs of ISVs, resellers, and customers. Ability to articulate the partner ecosystem value proposition and align it with Panasonic’s business objectives. Strong communicative, interpersonal, and negotiating skills required. Strong written and verbal skills required to effectively communicate with all levels up to the CIO level, PSCNA HQ Operations, Customers, Resellers, Sales, and other internal shared services resources Key Competencies  Sales Management Establishes guidelines and expected levels of performance for direct reports and is dedicated to communicating, reinforcing, measuring, enforcing, and acting where necessary to ensure the highest level of employee performance. Provides accountabilities and objectives for each direct report that clearly outlines performance expectations. Updates and communicates enhancements to accountabilities and objectives as required. Regularly accompanies direct reports on account visits with the purpose of providing support, leadership, and education. Provides immediate feedback to direct reports as required relative to their performance. Provides annual training opportunities to all direct reports in an effort to enhance individual skill levels and performance. Regularly monitors the progress of each direct report, effectively and promptly communicates opportunities for improvement and assists direct reports in creating their individual territory or go to market plans. Delegates authority to encourage personal growth and identifies and develops future management from their team Business Management Responsible for achievement of team business plan through execution of plan and control of expenditures. Responsible for owning the Pro-Services/Solutions sales ecosystem, and working with the channel, product management, Operations, and the entire Mobility sales teams to generate year over year growth in the mobility services/solutions space Responsible for education, support, and training on all Pro-Service /Solutions products to mobility sales team and channel network. Responsible for managing a strong working alliance with our National Service Centers, Engineering and Factory Production Partners. Must be the “go to expert” at Panasonic for communicating the value of Panasonic Services and Solutions as it relates to all mobility markets Meets with product team and supervisor to discuss partnerships, products and services needed for expansion of sales revenue Position requires a high level of Excel and PowerPoint due to all the business analytics and presentations required of the job. Always on the lookout for potential solutions Panasonic can create to make our organization more powerful in the specific vertical market. Must understand and be proficient in current CRM tools, and be able to teach and coach entire team on its usage. 75% travel
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: About Pinterest  Millions of people across the world come to Pinterest to find new ideas every day. It’s where they get inspiration, dream about new possibilities and plan for what matters most. Our mission is to help those people find their inspiration and create a life they love. In your role, you’ll be challenged to take on work that upholds this mission and pushes Pinterest forward. You’ll grow as a person and leader in your field, all the while helping Pinners make their lives better in the positive corner of the internet.  Great brands help make those inspirations a reality and we're looking for a self-driven Account Manager to help our most strategic partners, successfully grow their business through Pinterest. You'll work directly with advertisers as a trusted consultant to their business. Your strategic advice & coaching is core to the value we bring as a platform. If this sounds like fun, we’d love to hear from you!  What You’ll Do Retain, grow and diversify the value delivered to our partners ultimately growing Pinterest revenue as a result. Build and maintain strong relationships with partners’ teams (executive, operational, creative, measurement and agency), resulting in trusted advisorship Advocate internally for the solutions required to drive business outcomes for these advertisers, working across internal teams such as Measurement & Insights, Product Marketing, Creative Strategy, etc. Gain a deep understanding of our partners’ business goals and turn data into compelling stories and actionable insights to help them succeed Specifically own the “how” conversation with advertisers to advise on media strategies across targeting, bidding models, creative, measurement, etc. What We’re Looking For Digital advertising sales experience, managing high value relationships, driving strategic learning agendas and owning client communication Track record of compelling data-backed storytelling and recommendations Expert in managing forecasts and achieving goals Strong communication skills in person, on the phone, and through email A team player who’s able to work in a fast-paced environment with technical and non-technical teams
industries: Internet, Computer Software, and Information Technology and Services

description: Wana Brands is the #1 infused edibles company in North America with operations in 12 states and Canada, and growing! The role will support non-Colorado states in developing and executing sales support and marketing strategies, meeting quarterly goals, and providing guidance and training to teams. The role will also be the main point of contact for partners’ sales teams. month travel to work with partners’ sales teams in field (40% travel)Monitor competitor product launches and pricing in all marketsAttend all meetings with partners Manage Budtender training materials for each market and customize where necessaryLiaise with Wana Field Marketing Reps of each market to manage sales sideTrain Partner sales teams on Wana products both in person and remotelyBuild out market dashboards in Salesforce for sales (dispensaries, skus, pricing, competitive landscape etc)Build relationships with key retailers in partner statesSupport all markets for trainingFocus and support all new product launches in all marketsEvaluate opportunities for growth within each market and make recommendations for key initiativesUnderstand and monitor individual competitor pricing and promotional strategiesRepresent Wana at industry events and conferences in partner markets  Job Requirements:Passion for Wana Brands and knowledge of the industryStrong ability to model and train teams on consultative selling methods.Experience and knowledge of selling premium quality grade products and managing broad portfolio of productsAbility to clearly explain technical aspects of Wana products in a sales and training capacityPersuasive sales ability, including ability to effectively position Wana products against competitorsAbility to develop constructive and cooperative working person.Persistence, positive attitude and desire to hustle and build market shareExcellent verbal and written communication skillsStrong desire to provide exceptional customer serviceAbility to build relationships and rapportFlexible schedule and ability to work some weekends and eveningsTravel Expectation 40%Proof of Covid-vaccination requiredPreferred Education and ExperiencePrior cannabis sales Some weekend and night work will be expected.Travel includes both local and out-of-the-area travel with some overnight travel expected. Travel is up to 40% of work time.COVID RequirementsAll Wana Brands employees are required to be fully vaccinated.Wana Benefits:Salary from $80,000/yr +bonusHealth, vision, dental insurance offered to all full-time employeesLife InsurancePTO and holiday payProduct discountsPet InsuranceFree RTD EcoPassWana Brands is an equal opportunity employer. Keycraft USA is in search of an experienced salesperson to manage our rapidly growing Key Account and Mass Market business units. This is a remote position so the ideal candidate is a self-motivated professional that has prior experience calling on chain store retailers within the toy space. This position reports to the USA General Manager.  Key Duties & Responsibilities Plan, execute and oversee all sales activity related to existing Key and Mass accounts Create and implement strategy to open new accounts Develop, in partnership with both the American and UK based team, a product strategy plan for each retailer Develop and maintain monthly sales budgets for each account Inventory forecasting and program replenishment plans for assigned accounts Participate in weekly (morning) video calls with the USA and UK teams. Create sales presentations Lead in-person and video customer sales appointments Communicating retailer routing guide requirements to appropriate stakeholders  Qualifications & Skills 5+ years of sales experience calling on chain store retailers Ability to work independently and highly self-motivated Experience with sales and inventory forecasting based on retailer POS Firm understanding and aptitude to learn retailer web portal requirements Proficient in Microsoft office Some travel required

Mazooma is a payments technology company on a mission to simplify payments. As a leading solution in both sports wagering and iGaming, our patented technology can be found on the cashier of industry-leading brands such as DraftKings, BetMGM, theScore, and PartyPoker. In August 2021, Nuvei, a global payment technology provider, acquired Mazooma, giving clients access to an even greater suite of fintech solutions.  Offering a best-in-class experience, seamless integration, state-of-the-art risk management, and secure bank connections, Mazooma creates raving fans of both merchants and consumers. We are looking for world-class people to join us in delivering leading-edge solutions to an industry experiencing exponential growth.  As a Sales Development Rep, you will be responsible for accelerating the distribution of Nuvei’s products with specific focus on the Northern America market by uncovering new opportunities and working with a business development manager to mature those opportunities.  Key Responsibilities: Follow a disciplined approach to forecasting and opportunity management via SFDC and our supporting tools and processes. Develop sales leads by using sales tools with outbound sales prospecting efforts.  Preferred Qualifications: Special consideration given to candidates who have experience in Business Development/Sales/Account Management within global enterprises with a thorough understanding of the payments industry. Significant track record of achievement and success within the targeted field of expertise. Ability to build internal and external relationships to gain and share information such as industry trends.  Minimum Qualifications: Minimum two years’ of sales high growth experience. Pipeline management. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Exceptional relationship-building skills. Fluent in English.  Benefits: A challenging job in a fast developing, international company with an open #peoplefirst culture. Friendly work environment where you can thrive and develop your skills. Career advancement possibilities. Competitive remuneration package.  Mazooma does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, color, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other reason prohibited by law in provision of employment opportunities and benefits.

Territory Sales / Industrial Automation (Remote Opportunity)  Allied Automation Inc., an industrial automation technology distributor, is hiring a Territory Sales Representative for Northern IN.  OPPORTUNITY: As our Territory Sales Representative, you will interface with Plant Managers, Operations Manager, and CEO’s in manufacturing. You will identify and convert new potential customers and deepen relationships with existing customers. Success in this position requires solid acumen with technical solutions, problem solving, and a strong drive to generate new business. You will support existing customers and drive new efforts for FESTO, Mitsubishi, Universal Robots, and other key manufacturers we represent. You will develop and support sales strategies and objectives to expand market share. Reporting directly to the Vice President of Sales, you will join a team of sales professionals dedicated to driving successful relationships and solutions.  KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES: Drive new and existing business efforts. Monitor progress toward goals to reach objectives. Initiate and develop contact with key and target customers. Consult on applications with customers in the primary product areas. Consistently use PC based software to document sales opportunities. Follow up on sales leads and schedules customer visits. Assist at trade shows and other marketing events. Manage internal and external information through software systems.  SUCCESS FACTORS: 3+ years of experience in manufacturing or industrial sales preferred. Bachelor’s degree and technical sales experience required. Proven success at building rapport and productive customer relationships through effective communication at all levels (e.g. maintenance staff to C-level) Extensive experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Proven sales experience and a good track record for exceeding sales targets. Self-sufficiency with web-based CRM products. Able to travel up to 50% within territory. High energy, confident, and assertive with a strong work ethic.  COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS: Allied Automation will reward your sales talents with a base salary of $110-120K, plus a commission incentive program based on experience. Total first year compensation expected to be $110-130K+. You will also receive a competitive benefit package that includes, health, dental and disability insurance, and a 401(k)retirement plan.   COMPANY: Allied Automation, Inc., is a well-established family owned, full service, high technology distributor located on the northeast side of Indianapolis. Founded in 1981, Allied has been committed to cutting edge automation solutions. We are the trusted leader for some of the most advanced solutions available, in partnership with world-class brands like FESTO, Mitsubishi and others we continue to serve in the manufacturing community. Allied Automation continues to thrive with double-digit growth.  APPLY NOW: If you are a proven sales producer, we encourage you to apply online.  To learn more about Allied Automation, visit: www.allied-automation.com  Donna Wells, HR Consultant Safari Solutions search39@safarisolutions.com   Business Development / manufacturing / industrial / sales / account manager / manufacturing automation solutions / account executive / technical account manager / regional account manager outside sales / sales rep / District sales / Territory Sales / sales engineer / sales manager / mechanical engineer / electrical engineer / robotics / industrial / automation / Purdue / Rose-Holman / Notre Dame / Fort Wayne / Huntington / South Bend / Muncie / Granger / Plymouth / Wabash

description: TITLE: Manager, Inside Sales  DEPARTMENT: Ticket Sales  REPORTS TO: Director, Premium, Membership Sales, and Suite Sales  SUPERVISES: Representative, Inside Sales (14 Direct Reports)  STATUS: Full-time, Exempt  Job Summary  The Manager, Inside Sales is primarily responsible for overseeing the Inside Sales team, assisting with new Membership sales strategy, overseeing the Padres inbound call center, and contributing to the overall ticket sales and service strategy. This role works with the Sales team, as well as the Director, to meet all sales goals.  Duties & Responsibilities Train and lead a team of 14 Inside Sales Representatives. Provide in the moment training and reinforce sales techniques daily. Implement strategies to effectively track individual and department sales efforts. Work with Director, Premium, Membership Sales, and Suite Sales to establish weekly, monthly, and annual goals. Prepare a weekly status report for the VP and Director. Develops, oversees, and/or manages the department’s operating budget in a cost-effective manner, including (but not limited to): employee salaries, sales forecasting, commission plans, and general expenses. Oversees the sale of new Season Ticket Memberships from the Inside Sales Team. Assists in developing new ticket and sales strategies. Plans and makes sales calls to all potential customers on an as-needed basis. Assists in developing marketing strategies and new ideas to stimulate all sales components and achieve annual sales goals. Coordinates sales and customer events with other departments as appropriate. Assists in developing Membership sales materials. Recommends changes in Club policies as appropriate to enhance overall Club operation and increase ticket sales. Manages the Inside Sales team (e.g., performance appraisals, employee development, hiring, terminations, etc.) to insure a well-trained, efficient team that represents the Club in a positive and professional manner that continually builds on the Club’s image in the community. Collaborates with other departments within the organization to strategically create positive publicity for the Club. Represents the Club in a positive and professional manner at all times. Other duties as assigned. JOB REQUIREMENTS: Must meet the following minimum requirements: Minimum of a 4-year bachelor’s degree or educational equivalent in sales, or other closely related field. MS or MBA a plus. Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in ticket sales. Proven track record of results in a sales environment. Proficient to advanced computer skills in Microsoft Office including Word, Excel, and Outlook. Experience in Ticketmaster and Microsoft CRM a plus. General knowledge of office skills, use of office equipment (copier, laser printers, fax machine, telephones, computers). Excellent understanding and demonstrated success in building, motivating, and leading teams. Strong personnel management, collaboration, communication, time management and organizational skills. Proven ability to multi-task and manage projects on strict deadlines. Excellent written and verbal skills. Proven ability to correctly use punctuation and grammar. Fluently bilingual in English/Spanish a plus. Possesses a high degree of discretion, integrity, professionalism, and accountability. Consistent, punctual, and regular attendance. Professional image and demeanor. Strong ability to work with others in a collaborative, respectful manner. Able to work flexible hours including evenings, weekends, holidays, and extended hours as needed. Able to travel as needed. Minimum physical requirements: able to travel to and gain access to various areas of the ballpark for prolonged periods of time during games and events; able to lift and transport up to 25 pounds. As a condition of employment, the job candidate(s) must provide proof of current COVID vaccination and successfully complete a post-offer, pre-employment background check and drug screening. The San Diego Padres is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
industries: Nonprofit Organization Management, Entertainment, and Hospitality

description: Healthcare is going through an unprecedented transformation towards digital care and Medallion provides critical administrative infrastructure to make that possible. Our platform enables organizations to license their providers in new states, verify existing credentials, and get in-network with insurance payers. In less than a year, we’ve launched our platform, built an all-star team, powered dozens of great companies, and served thousands of healthcare providers across the industry!  About The Role  As Medallion’s first BDR Manager, your scope will span from long term business strategy and planning to immediate operational improvements for top of the funnel operations. You will have the opportunity to drive revenue by setting a strategic plan through implementing new processes while also building relationships with departmental leads. This role will report directly to the Vice President of Sales/Partnerships.  Responsibilities: Hire, coach, and manage a team of Business Development Representatives Develop the sales, product, and industry skills of each team member Motivate team members through creative incentives Regularly report on Team/Individual Results Lead by example, player coach mindset Identify and make recommendations for improvement in the areas of process, efficiency, and productivity  Requirements High level of interest in healthcare 3+ years in software/healthcare space as both an BDR and AE. Comfortable in a face-paced environment Desire to be in a goal-oriented, quota-carrying role Strong interpersonal skills Strong verbal and written communication skills Proven track record of success as a BDR Manager Experience managing and improving BDR KPI’s

description: Top Medical Sales Opportunity: Physician office and clinic call point (Infectious disease, UTI, Urology , OB/GYN, Respiratory, Gastro, SARS, COVID, wound care). Industry leader in molecular diagnostic testing for infectious disease. Company is well known and recognized for its growth. Over 20 years experience in the diagnsotic space, well funded and strong leadership.    Company is expanding nationwide with 20 openings. Launching new molecular tests. Start at $65k-$75k base salary, 401k, full benefits, car allowance, all expenses paid, 10% on all monthly revenue to average $200k plus. (Their compeitors pay around 4%) 80% of their company is making $200k PLUS. Top reps are $300k plus.

Location: Preferably New York, Washington or Miami  Type: Full-time  Experience: Mid-Senior level  Position taking: Immediately  Salary: According to background and experience  This is an exciting opportunity for an applicant with an outstanding track record in selling high-technology products to US broadcasters and Video Professionals.  Working under the leadership of one of our Sales Directors, responsibilities will include: Managing the complete sales cycle, from lead generation to deal closures Traveling extensively across across the USA (up to 50-75%) to make presentations to prospective key accounts and close deals Defining and applying the business strategy for your area jointly with the Sales Director Extending our network and ensuring coordination among master distributor, integrators and resellers Representing AVIWEST at major domestic and international Broadcast exhibitions linked to your area Monitoring leads and projects following internal processes using the company’s CRM Sharing customer feedback with the marketing and R&D teams The applicant will have an excellent understanding of IP networks and a background in broadcast, as well as a proven record of sales experience in the broadcast and/or security markets.

There are 2 actors on a network, people and machines. Just as usernames and passwords are used by people to access machines, keys and certificates are used by machines to identify and access each other. Venafi is the inventor of the technology that secures and protects keys and certificates, the most important assets of our Global 5000 customers. We are Warriors!  Are you passionate about making a positive impact and protecting the world from cybercriminals? If so, you may be a natural Venafi Warrior!  How You’ll Be Protecting The World  Due to our rapid growth, we are seeking a highly experienced SDR to join our energetic and collaborative Sales Development team to generate qualified prospects for our sales team.  Success in the SDR role requires a hunter-mentality with significant time spent on the phone, primarily performing independent prospecting into large named accounts, as well as following up on leads generated from marketing programs. You will work cross-functionally and very closely with marketing and field sales teams to generate demand and pipeline for the Venafi solution. This role requires a smart, energetic, naturally curious, and results-driven individual who has the desire and ability to become familiar with a wide range of concepts, market trends, and effective demand generation techniques within the Machine Identify Management space.  The SDR role can be a great career path for those who wish to progress to a quota-carrying field sales role. Equally, however, for those who do not wish to move into an external field role, the SDR role will always be a very rewarding, challenging and highly important internal role delivering qualified prospects, helping build the business pipeline and providing invaluable support to your Sales team.  Compensation is a competitive base salary (based on experience) plus performance-based monthly commission.  Responsibilities Include Following our ABM Go To Market approach - Research target/named accounts prior to first contact to understand the prospect’s needs and educate the prospects on the benefits of the Venafi platform Be responsible for educating prospects on the Venafi story and nurture them until they are qualified and ready to talk/meet with an Account Executive Set appointments for the sales team when a prospect fulfils the qualified stage criteria Ensure successful follow-through of sales cycle by continually maintaining accurate activity and lead qualification information within Salesforce.com Work closely with marketing to support successful outbound campaigns Drive attendance for webinars and set pre-scheduled meetings for conferences/events Occasional event support to engage with prospects face-to-face Collaborate with sales and marketing team members on strategic sales approach Make and achieve a set number of calls, emails, LinkedIn requests to prospects on a daily basis The Ideal Venafi Warrior Will Be Armed With University degree and minimum 5 years’ work experience with prior success in sales development for B2B IT security software company. Experience in field sales would be an asset Extensive experience in outbound cold-calling, targeting multiple levels of contacts including executive management (major part of the role) Excellent lead follow-up skills responding to and qualifying leads from marketing generated campaigns and incoming phone and web inquiries Superior pre-call planning, opportunity qualification and objection handling skills Aptitude to manage numerous requests and time demands concurrently, while achieving your objectives and goals Knowledge and experience of the SFDC CRM system and modern selling tools (i.e. Connectandsell, ConnectLeader, Outreach, SalesLoft, Gong, etc.). Being totally at ease in using and continually updating CRM systems as a matter of course, and understanding the importance of managing and ensuring client data is accurate and up to date Fully fledged team player who can work independently as well as part of a team in a fast-paced environment Fearlessness/resilience – willing to call new people daily to educate and explain the Venafi value proposition as it relates to each individual you speak with Drive, passion and competitiveness with strong desire to over-achieve set goals Extremely self-motivated and independent with a diligent work ethic High level of integrity and strong commitment to building a successful company The courage to challenge the status quo when logic and reason require it 100% reliable and detailed-oriented - a drive to execute flawlessly Excellent references from prior employers, verifying targets and quota achievement While you are busy protecting the world, we’ve got you covered!  In addition to fostering a work environment with a strong work from anywhere ethic, Venafi offers a benefit package that is in the top 1%. We provide access to private medical and dental insurance for both team members and their families. We offer four weeks of PTO (Paid Time Off), eight holidays, as well as a floating holiday and a “pick your own community service day.” We also offer a pensions scheme with company contributions, 4x salary employer paid life insurance and parental leave.  More About Venafi  Venafi is the undisputed heavyweight champion in Machine Identity Management. Why? Because we created the category and are light years ahead of anyone that would consider competing! Gartner has recognized Venafi as number one in our space and as it turns out, one is NOT the loneliest number!  Venafi is the inventor of the technology that secures and protects keys and certificates. Venafi protects machine identity types by orchestrating cryptographic keys and digital certificates for SSL/TLS, IoT, mobile, and SSH. Many of the largest organizations in the world use Venafi.  Billions of dollars have been spent protecting usernames and passwords and almost nothing protecting keys and certificates—organizations are just now realizing that protecting keys and certificates is as important as protecting usernames and passwords. The bad guys know this and are using stolen or forged keys and certificates to attack networks and steal data. In fact, Gartner says 50% of network attacks will use certificates.  Come help us protect the world!

SaaS, health & welfare benefits, healthcare capital equipment, healthcare IT, health and welfare benefits outsourcing, human resources IT benefits software Embraces and thrives in a culture of transparency, accountability and trust Self-starter with ability to work independently, prioritize work and coordinate multiple tasks within tight time constraints Ability to navigate the strategic levels of customer organizations, identify key decision-makers, build relationships with senior executives and schedule meetings with key stakeholders Ability to establish strong team relationships in a matrix organization Ability to perform in a dynamic and fast-paced environment Possess account knowledge, executive-level customer contacts and industry relationships inside the employer market space Command of social media for the benefit of lead generation, gaining access to executives and networking with key stakeholders Strong aptitude with business software tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook etc) Strong business acumen Demonstrated ability to successfully negotiate complex contract Demonstrated ability to accurately forecast monthly, quarterly, and annual revenue Where permitted by applicable law, candidates must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by date of hire to be considered, if not currently employed by Accolade, Inc. The Company will provide reasonable accommodations to qualified employees with disabilities or for a sincerely held religious belief.  Please note that a request for exemption due to a personal preference not to receive a vaccine is not protected by law. All requests for exemptions from this mandate shall be directed to the Company recruiter who shall route the request to the Company’s human resources department.  Additional Information  What Is Important To Us  Creating an enduring company that is hyper-focused on our culture and making a meaningful impact in the lives of our employees, members and customers. The secret to our success is:  We Find Joy And Purpose In Serving Others  Making a difference in our members’ and customers’ lives is what we do. Even when it’s hard, we do the right thing for the right reasons.  We are strong individually and together, we’re powerful  Trusting in our colleagues and embracing their different backgrounds and experiences enable us to solve tough problems in creative ways, having fun along the way. The Company TaskHuman is an early-stage start-up on a mission to make personal well-being and professional growth revolutionarily accessible to every employee, everywhere in the world. The Opportunity Today’s current working environment is changing rapidly and employees are experiencing an unparalleled level of physical and emotional stress.  But with hybrid or fully remote working environments suddenly the new normal, traditional talent development and wellness offerings are being challenged and in many cases falling short.  TaskHuman is focused on partnering with employers to improve engagement and reduce unplanned attrition by providing unlimited support for the most comprehensive set of personal well-being and productivity disciplines.     To meet the employer marketplace demand for this kind of specialized employee benefit, TaskHuman is actively looking for experienced sales professionals to be a part of our growth and success.  Our account executives enjoy competitive base salaries, uncapped commission plans, fully paid employee health benefits, a 100% remote but connected daily working environment and access to our extensive provider network of coaches which is like having a personal life coach, work mentor and personal concierge at your fingertips.   We are open to employees from any US based location and have the technology tools in place to support our employees today and as we grow. HR executive sponsors and decision makers Proven ability to land net-new sales Entrepreneurial spirit and authentic love of human interactions Ability to self direct your daily/weekly/monthly tasks and collaborate in an early-state, startup environment Results-driven mentality with ability to bounce back from disappointments and challenges Being a creative story teller and client partner who is description: Company Overview  CodaMetrix is a well-capitalized, high-growth company focused on solving some of the more interesting yet challenging problems in clinical and healthcare administrative areas. The company was formed by the Massachusetts General Physicians Organization (MGPO) to commercialize and build upon internally developed, and highly utilized AI-driven solutions. CodaMetrix is led by proven entrepreneurs, technology, and healthcare veterans, whose vision is to create a highly desirable atmosphere for technical talent to flourish and develop innovative, significant, reliable, and broadly utilized solutions.  As a high-growth company, our team and responsibilities are constantly evolving. We therefore prioritize creative thinking, strategic problem solving and an enthusiasm for creating innovative, high-quality products for our customers. Together, we are motivated to achieve our mission of reducing the burden in healthcare administration. Candidates eager to develop and expand their skills, learn from highly technical team members and think differently will thrive at CodaMetrix.  Job Description  The Head of Sales is a key member of the Sales/Business Development team who reports to the Chief Executive Officer. They will be responsible for maintaining and improving existing client relations as well as establishing new accounts.  The Head of Sales has a range of responsibilities including increasing profitable sales, partnering with Sales/Business Development team members on program success and meeting or exceeding expected sales targets.  Responsibilities Create, manage and maintain a sales pipeline and forecasts to achieve sales goals Execute the sales process from initial outreach through contract negotiations Responsible for the operational analysis of current clients, pricing and projects Handle all prospect communications and resolve related issues, or escalate the issues to the appropriate person with proposed solutions Evaluate and communicate product needs for client accounts Once sales close, create a thoughtful hand-off plan for the Analytics & Customer Engagement and Engineering teams Generate presentations and reports that outline account health and status Prepare and coordinate proposals and related sales documentation Monitor individual sales activity and performance in relation to recurring sales goals Plan, schedule, organize and control daily tasks to yield maximum sales results Partner with Sales Support on executing campaigns that drive qualified leads  Requirements 4+ years of sales experience Experience selling healthcare IT solutions for healthcare providers Experience meeting and exceeding sales team revenue goals Heavy Salesforce experience Superior communication, presentation and negotiation skills Superb problem solving skills and flexible attitude Strong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple projects at the same time Ability to develop and maintain client relationships Ability to efficiently learn and advocate for CodaMetrix’s product and mission  Beneficial Experience Understanding of complex machine learning and artificial intelligence technologies Experience working at a fast-paced startup  Location Raleigh, NC, Boston, MA, or remote  EEO Statement  Our company, as well as our products, are made better because we embrace diverse skills, perspectives and ideas.  CodaMetrix is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.  Employee Benefits  Learn more about how we take care of our team. Insurance: We cover 80% of the cost of medical and dental insurance and offer vision insurance. Retirement: CMX offers a 401(k) plan that eligible employees can contribute to one month after their first day. Life: We offer employer-paid life insurance and short-term and long-term disability insurance. Flexibility: We have an unlimited PTO policy so you can take the time you need to relax and rejuvenate. Learning: All new hires complete our 7-week Fellowship program to learn about each of our departments. Development: We provide annual performance evaluations and outline a clear path for promotions. Top Medical Sales Opportunity: Physician office and clinic call point (Women's health, Infectious disease, UTI, Urology , OB/GYN, Sexually Transmitted Disease, Respiratory, Gastro, SARS, COVID).   Start-up lab company that has been in business 1 year and having amazing success... expanding their sales force and hiring 20-30 new positions. Company founders have been in the diagnostic business for 20 plus years both with 2 different big lab companies. Company is well invested and has well known, influential Board of Directors.  This is their Territory Manager position... $70k base salary, full benefits, car allowance, mileage paid, all expenses paid and uncapped commissions to make $200k-$300k plus. They have a profit sharing commission structure where you get 12% of all revenue in your territory! Promotions to Leadership positions as they contiune to grow!

jobTitle: New Business Development Sales Specialist - San Jose, CA
description: Auto req ID: 248996BR  Job Description  We are PepsiCo Sales. We are game changers, mountain movers and history makers. We are a diverse group, spread among 200 countries and united by a shared set of values and goals.  That’s why we Win with Purpose. Together, we blaze new trails, succeed, celebrate and never settle for second best. At PepsiCo, we’re committed to performing well as individuals and in teams, to strengthen the company as a whole.  Are you hungry to be a part of the World’s largest portfolio of billion dollar food and beverage brands? Then now is the time to explore the opportunities of PepsiCo: what makes you unique makes us better.  PepsiCo Food service is a division of PepsiCo that brings the company’s entire portfolio of food and beverage brands to market in out-of-home consumption channels to meet consumer needs at work, at play, and on the go. This role will cover the territory between San Jose and Milpitas** Food service, also known on premise selling, will service existing accounts and use superior cold-calling selling skills to generate new business for Restaurants and Bars. Build and maintain strategic partnerships with customers and drive customer satisfaction through superior service and execution Acquire new Food Service accounts via leads, cold-calling and other strategic selling solutions Analyze Customer information using Datassential to identify and expand business opportunities Coordinate placement of new equipment and ensure flawless execution of logistics Successful candidates will drive volume, revenue and paint the town Pepsi Blue Qualifications/Requirements Previous fact-based selling experience Food Service or consumer packaged goods experience Spanish fluency is strongly preferred Must be willing and able to lift 40 lbs. periodically This position is limited to persons with indefinite right to work in the United States Must have a valid driver's license Safe driving record strongly preferred Relocation Eligible: Not Eligible for Relocation  Job Type: Regular  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.  PepsiCo is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Female / Minority / Disability / Protected Veteran / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity  Our Company will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, and all other applicable laws, including but not limited to, San Francisco Police Code Sections 4901 - 4919, commonly referred to as the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance; and Chapter XVII, Article 9 of the Los Angeles Municipal Code, commonly referred to as the Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance. Job description About InhabitIQ InhabitIQ operates a unique collective of tech-forward companies serving the residential, commercial and vacation rental industries. Our brands’ strategic partnerships deliver transformative software solutions and services across our brands. We believe that property and vacation rental managers should have the opportunity to choose the platforms that best support their business goals and that they should be able to benefit from strategic partnerships across our ecosystem.  About Western Reporting We’re passionate about building a world-class sales team, as we believe talented people are the key to delivering a great customer experience at every turn. Our team is dedicated to cultivating personal and professional development by creating a culture of feedback, transparency, innovation, passion, learning and winning. Our business is dependent on happy clients who understand and participate in the Inhabit IQ (IIQ) vision.  Job Description We are seeking an individual to join our sales group who is ready to hit the ground running and be part of a growing team leading the way to new advanced leasing solutions.  Functions and Responsibilities Generate, build and grow relationships between IIQ and rental properties Work with decision makers and influencers in the multifamily market by traveling throughout your territory, becoming their frontend leasing solution expert by building personal relationships and consistently and competitively securing new business/partnerships. Remain in close contact with other Sales team members, Account Managers and collaborating across additional IIQ brands and their teams throughout the country. Address prospects/client challenges by presenting, demonstrating, and persuasively communicating the value of the solution. Be a positive representative of the company and its brands in the marketplace  Minimum Qualifications 5+ years of outside sales experience Familiarity with the Multifamily industry and can build additional relationships within those circles Proven success in outside sales as a true hunter, hitting and exceeding your goals Detail-oriented, competitive, have a “can-do” attitude and consistently take the initiative to make things better for your clients and your team Possess a comprehensive understanding of e-commerce and practices and can speak to the why behind implementing various frontend software strategies across several channels Experience with Sales CRMs such as Salesforce, NetSuite, HubSpot, etc., and the ability to learn our proprietary tools and technologies  Education Requirements: Bachelor’s degree preferred  Type: Full Time  Location: Remote, anywhere within the United States  EOE, including disabilities/veterans Job Type: Full-time Pay: $95,000.00 per year
