description: Bulls Eye Recruiting is doing an executive search for a company out of Omaha, NE. Our client is a small company whose work reaches around the globe. The company designs and manufactures air-inflated costumes and inflatable scenic elements. They have a special focus on premiere live entertainment venues, but work with customers in nearly every imaginable industry. Our client is a company built around innovation and creating the best possible version of our clients’ vision.  MISSION:  To create the world’s best inflatable solutions.  PEOPLE:  Our client employees do whatever it takes to deliver successful solutions to our clients. It is not unusual that we find ourselves working on a project brought to us because “everyone else said that it was impossible.” They are creative, versatile, and hard working. When clients visit them from places like Hong Kong, Shanghai, and Hungary – they fly over all of their other options on their way to us. These clients are committed to sourcing the best possible products, and the more committed and informed they are – the more likely they are to end up in Nebraska for their inflatables. Of course our team includes fantastically talented technical artisans - designing and building truly awesome inflatables that consistently impress highly demanding clients (in addition to tens of millions of guests, crowds, live and TV audiences), but all employees share a special attention to detail, and a sense of duty to the successful completion of the project – and this is what makes the company what it is.  CUSTOMERS:  Very few businesses have as diverse of a client base as our client, and fewer still manage this feat with a workforce of less than 25 people. The company has clients in 78 countries around the globe. We have a standout reputation in professional live entertainment – all but two teams in the NBA are clients, we are the go-to inflatable collaborator for the two largest global amusement park groups, we are the only official parade partner of the Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade, we have partnered on entertainment with the Olympics, the NBA finals, the World Series, and NFL victory parades, we have worked on Broadway, and with leading traveling children’s entertainment shows.  Our client is not limited to professional live entertainment. Our products are used by many consumer brands, all branches of the US Military, hundreds of public safety departments throughout the country, high schools, non-profits, NASA, labor unions, retail stores, software companies, and the USDA (to name just a few). Our customers/partners in these “normal” markets tend to be unique, pioneering leaders within their industries. When the phone rings, we have no idea what line of business or what part of the world the caller might be hailing from – but we generally know that we’re about to engage with a creative and motivated individual, looking for us to create something entirely new, or to use our products in an innovative way. We have worked very closely and well outside of a traditional vendor capacity with clients on projects such as: fire safety educational training with the Phoenix Fire Department, Autism research with the University of Nebraska Medical Center, and the design of integrated national promotions with Frito Lay.  ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITY:  Oversee all aspects of the company’s sales for all industries except professional live entertainment Establish and oversee all sales and marketing efforts, including: Tradeshows and in-person sales Direct contact phone/email/mail campaigns Proposing new business lines with existing clients Online and Social Media efforts Trade groups and other avenues for establishing new business Explore opportunities for expanded product lines Pursue strategic partnerships for referral networks, sponsorships, etc. Engage directly in sales efforts where necessary  While this is an individual contributor role today, the role will move into a leadership role. At that point you will directly manage company’s salespeople, including:  Coordinating and directing salespeople efforts Establishing performance metrics and collaborating to increase targeted performance Hiring of additional staff  Partner with company owner on live entertainment sales: -Discuss and coordinate marketing/sales efforts  EXPECTED OUTCOME:  We expect a substantial re-focusing of the company’s sales efforts in the first 6 months. We would like to see these changes yield a 50% increase in non-live entertainment revenue for this hire’s 2nd year on board. We fully expect that these efforts will be disruptive; however they must respect the company’s mission and ethics.  OPPORTUNITY:   This position is significant leadership at a globally-leading niche firm which is nimble enough to adapt and pursue a wide range of opportunities in a wider range of markets – at a company with a strong foundation to support transformative growth.
industries: Consumer Services and Marketing and Advertising

description: Medical Sales : Territory Manager  We are a market leading, growth-focused, medical device company looking for a qualified Sales professional (Territory Manager) for direct sales to Hospitals and Clinics.   Jobs based in Minneapolis. Medical Sales experience is NOT required (training provided). Minimum sales experience : Two years as outside Sales Rep/Territory Manager.   Medspira offers above average employee benefits and a motivating work atmosphere. Light travel schedule (15%). Strong potential for growth. Fixed Salary + Commission (15% commission rate resulting in $3,500 commission per sale).

Description About us Innovation is fuelled by the power of possibilities. A few years ago, it was virtually impossible to innovate because building software needed a degree, it was simply too expensive, too complex, too risky and ultimately too inefficient. That’s why only 16% of projects were ever done on budget and 78% failed. We're changing that. We’re flipping software development on its head and kicking out the notion that you need to be an expert or do boot camps to learn how to make your app. Builder.ai’s platform lets you order the perfect software app for whatever problem you’re trying to solve. Our AI powered assembly line brings together Lego-like reusable features and experts from around the world to bring world-class ideas to life – ANYONE’s world-class ideas. Building software needs to be like ordering pizza – pick what you want, get recommendations for the features you need and simply wait till it's cooked and ready for you.  Our human-assisted AI platform helps anyone build, run & scale tailor-made software. Everyone from the bakery in Riyadh and nursery in London, to large fortune 100 companies like the BBC or Pepsi.  Life at Builder It’s a place where everything moves at lightning pace and most definitely not for the faint hearted. We celebrate diversity, push everyone to do more with less and yet provide a culture that allows everyone to experiment, push boundaries and learn by doing. Every Builder runs to our core value system of HEARTT (Heart, Entrepreneurship, Accountability, Respect, Trust & Transparency) and we’re always looking for team players, with a point of view, a sense of humility and a let’s-get-stuff-done attitude. Our scale up is at the intersection of a quirky startup where designers and machine learning specialists work on problems together to savvy commercial teams working with finance folks to invent new business models. #WhatWouldYouBuild.  About the role As a Sales Development Representative (SDR) you will have the opportunity to impact the bottom line and create new business opportunities for Builder. You’ll be finding and qualifying high potential leads, and will pass them to the senior sales team to take forward. Your role determines the success and pace of growth of the entire company – developing the pipeline of future paying customers.  This role is perfect for someone who has early experience in driving top of the funnel leads and qualifying opportunities that turn into potential sales.  What you'll do Inbound and Outbound lead generation activities to support the sales teams Identify target industries and organisations by working closely with the sales & marketing teams Gain a deep understanding of these target industries and organisations –what are their challenges and goals? Prospect into target organisations using a range of outbound sales tools, campaigns, events and referrals Achieve your monthly goal of qualified opportunities for the sales team Maintain CRM meticulously and ensure that all information is conveyed to the sales team Gain a deep understanding of Builder’s USPs and communicate these effectively Create excellent templates for emails and phone calls, and constantly test & iterate to improve them Requirements You’ve 1-3 years of experience in lead generation in the technology space and are consistently in the top quartile of performers Keen interest in a career in a high performing sales culture Exceptional communication skills, both on the phone and in writing Ability to build rapport with potential customers quickly, You’re extremely driven, and love hitting targets Fantastic organisational and time management skills You’re a team player Demonstrable commercial experience, particularly in telesales - would be beneficial  And after all of this… You can write your own path at Builder.ai! Whether you would like to be a key player on the SDR team or join our rockstar Sales team… You decide your future, we give you the building blocks to create your journey. Benefits  Awesome Health and wellness benefits Performance-based bonuses Employee friendly policies Generous vacation and time off benefits, including paid holidays Generally flexible working hours Apply for this job

Upper Midwest (MN, ND, NE, SD)  SUMMARY: Working with a regional team, the Territory Sales Manager is responsible for growing our pet food brands and brand awareness throughout the region. Successful team player, growth within established account base and developing accounts within territory. Central location (Minneapolis/St. Paul, MN or Omaha, NE) preferred. Approximately 50-60% overnight travel.  Competitive salary and commissions; medical, dental, vision; 401k with company match; vacation and holidays; travel/equipment/expenses paid.  KEY PERFORMANCE MEASURES Meet and exceed sales goals and objectives Offer great support to our retailers and customers Develop and execute innovative/creative strategies Professional representation of our company and brands Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities Effective selling skills, pet food sales experience preferred Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, effective presentation skills Positive attitude and team player Computer/mobile technology proficient Valid driver’s license, presentable transportation and insurance Nunn Milling Company, an affiliated company to Midwestern Pet Foods, Inc., was founded in 1926 in Evansville, Indiana, as a miller of flour and corn meal. In the 1940s the company began using the basic ingredients from its milling operations to produce dog and cat food. As a result of increasing sales of the pet food, Midwestern Pet Foods, Inc. was founded in 1982. Today, Midwestern Pet Foods, Inc. owns and operates four state-of-the-art, high capacity dry pet food production and packing facilities. Company headquarters is located in Evansville, Indiana, with plants in Monmouth, Illinois, Chickasha, Oklahoma and Waverly, New York. Midwestern Pet Foods, Inc. employs approximately 320 employees. Nunn Milling has a facility in Evansville as well and employees about 10 employees.
industries: Food & Beverages, Food Production, and Consumer Goods

description: Company Description  Accolade at a glance…  Accolade provides personalized health and benefits solutions designed to empower every person to live their healthiest life. We help millions of people and their employers navigate the complexities of the healthcare system with empathy, expertise and through exceptional service while supporting them in lowering the cost of care and improving health outcomes. Accolade blends technology-enabled health and benefits solutions, specialized support from Accolade Health Assistants and Clinicians and access to expert medical opinion services for high-cost treatment decisions. We consistently receive consumer satisfaction ratings over 90 percent and have been recognized by Inc. Magazine as a Top Place to Work 2020 and Business Intelligence for Excellence in Customer Service 2020. Please visit us on LinkedIn, Twitter, Instagram and Facebook and at accolade.com.  Job Description  Role overview  The Director, Sales is responsible for the development and management of a designated region. This will include leading, directing and managing activities of Sales Representatives within a specific geographical area as well as leading his/her team to the achievement of established business objectives.  Location - Open to multiple locations/ Open to this position being remote  A day in the life… Lead, manage and develop the skill sets and overall performance of the sales representatives in his or her Regional Business. Hire, train, develop and coach new and existing sales representatives. Develop and implement approved business plans to contribute to overall sales success. Achieve organizational objectives through effective leadership and forecasting of opportunities. Effectively identify/monitor multiple local market conditions and build strong customer relationships. Monitor all field activities to make certain all are within compliance guidelines. Other accountabilities will involve: Ensure appropriate delivery of marketing and sales tactics in Region. Collaborate on development of goals and objectives at all levels and build appropriate measures to ensure achievement. Minimize turnover through retention initiatives and ongoing leadership actions Provide frequent and ongoing performance feedback to all direct reports and foster a team oriented and supportive working environment. Establish performance expectations and oversee activity of direct reports, including adherence to policies. Oversee performance management process for all team members and ensure fair, timely resolution of disciplinary issues. Foster an environment that rewards accomplishment and encourages the advancement and retention of productive employees. Qualifications  What we are looking for… BA in a business or technical related area of study Minimum 8-10 years of successful sales leadership experience, Healthcare leadership is a plus. Experience selling complex, multi-stakeholder solutions. SaaS, health & welfare benefits, healthcare IT, health and welfare benefits outsourcing, human resources IT benefits software, health plan or TPA experience. Proven and established relationships with Executives (VP, C Level). You should be a “hunter” with proven experience in running long, complex B2B sales cycle processes for large companies and proven track record of closing large complex deals. Working knowledge of the advocacy space Where permitted by applicable law, candidates must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by date of hire to be considered, if not currently employed by Accolade, Inc. The Company will provide reasonable accommodations to qualified employees with disabilities or for a sincerely held religious belief.  Please note that a request for exemption due to a personal preference not to receive a vaccine is not protected by law. All requests for exemptions from this mandate shall be directed to the Company recruiter who shall route the request to the Company’s human resources department.  Additional Information  What Is Important To Us...  Creating an enduring company that is hyper-focused on our culture and making a meaningful impact in the lives of our employees, members and customers. The secret to our success is:  We Find Joy And Purpose In Serving Others  Making a difference in our members’ and customers’ lives is what we do. Even when it’s hard, we do the right thing for the right reasons.  We are strong individually and together, we’re powerful  Trusting in our colleagues and embracing their different backgrounds and experiences enable us to solve tough problems in creative ways, having fun along the way.  We roll up our sleeves and get stuff done  Results motivate us. And we aren't afraid of the hard work or tough decisions needed to get us there.  We’re boldly and relentlessly reinventing healthcare  We're curious and act big - not afraid to knock down barriers or take calculated risks to change the world, one person at a time.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Hospital & Health Care

description: Lakeland, FL, USA ? Plant City, FL, USA Req #8307 Thursday, September 30, 2021 Coca-Cola Beverages Florida, LLC (Coke Florida) is a family-owned independent Coca-Cola bottler that is the third largest privately-held and the sixth largest independent Coca-Cola bottler in the United States. Coke Florida's exclusive territory covers over 18 million consumers across 47 Florida counties, and includes the major metropolitan markets of Jacksonville, Miami, Orlando and Tampa. Coke Florida sells, markets, manufactures and distributes over 600 products of The Coca-Cola Company and other partner companies including Monster Beverage Corporation and BODYARMOR. In 2017, Coke Florida generated over $1.2 billion in revenue and the company currently has approximately 4,800 employees. As one of the first US greenfield independent Coca-Cola bottlers in nearly sixty years, Coke Florida is at an exciting stage in its transformational journey to become a leading-edge beverage company, the best bottler in the Coca-Cola System, and one of the best companies to work for in Florida. The  **District Sales Manager**  leads the execution of sales initiatives, and will have full responsibility for sales execution in all local, regional and national assigned accounts. This role will focus on the Lakeland, Plant City and Mulberry areas. **Role Responsibilities** + Responsible for the execution of all sales priorities and initiatives + Understand P&L and manage budgets + Responsible for identifying and developing core talent, including stewardship of the People Development Forum at the Account Manager level + Coach and develop the team of direct reports while ensuring a culture of learning and development exists throughout the selling organization + Responsible for relationships with accounts serving as the connection point with Sales area leadership in operations + Regular interaction with store level and local chain leaders + Accountable for selling in and adherence to calendar marketing agreements + Provide feedback to the national customer teams + Execute and fulfill all channel, package and pricing plans provided by the Commercial Leadership COE + Provide a feedback loop to the department team and Director of Sales on marketplace conditions (includes competition, channel plans, pricing, architecture) + Represent Company in local government/community forums, as needed, on issues that impact our business **Role Requirements** + High school diploma or GED, Bachelor's degree preferred + 2+ years experience in consumer products/direct store delivery sales + Experience managing people/budgets preferred + Intermediate computer and database application skills preferred + Valid driver's license and driving record within MVR policy guidelines + Periodic bending, kneeling, pulling, and/or lifting of 50+ pounds and climbing This job description is not an exhaustive list of all functions that the employee may be required to perform, and the employee may be required to perform additional functions. Coke Florida reserves the right to revise the job description at any time. Employment with Coke Florida is at-will. The employee must be able to perform the essential functions of the position satisfactorily and, if requested, reasonable accommodations may be made to enable employees with disabilities to perform essential functions of their job, absent undue hardship. Coca-Cola Beverages Florida is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. **Other details** + Job Family Sales + Job Function Sales + Pay Type Salary Apply Now + Lakeland, FL, USA + Plant City, FL, USA

jobTitle: Sales Account Executive - Travel and Logistics
description: Established in 1996, Nagarro began as a dream of a few friends who wanted to create a company with a difference – a company that focused on “strategic differentiation via technology” initiatives rather than routine IT operations. Today we are more than 6500 experts across more than 20 countries. At Nagarro, you can look forward to a work culture that is dynamic and non-hierarchical. You will be given opportunities to add value to challenging and complex assignments while collaborating with world-class technologists. The versatile environment here helps foster fresh perspectives and enables you to deliver high-quality code. There will be ample opportunities provided for skill up-gradation to accelerate your professional and personal development.  Position: Sales Account Executive (Travel and Logistics) Location: Remote + Travel  Job Description: Nagarro is looking for an energetic team player to join our rapidly growing organization. The Sales Account Executive will successfully seek out and close new opportunities, build a strong sales pipeline, and achieve company growth targets. Candidates should demonstrate a track record of uncovering opportunities through active prospecting and networking, have excellent consultative selling skills, and thrive in a collaborative team selling environment. Nagarro has a unique company culture that is highly entrepreneurial, customer-centric, agile, non-hierarchical, and global. Ideal candidates should be self-starters driven to succeed and eager to impact the organization positively. This is an exciting role with an opportunity to be a key part of our continued growth and expansion.  Responsibilities: Seek out and close new opportunities, build a strong sales pipeline and achieve company sales targets. Uncover opportunities through active prospecting and networking. Develop relationships with C-level and other senior executives through a consultative sales approach. Lead RFI/RFP responses from both a proposal and a sales presentation standpoint. Communicate the value proposition of Nagarro. Provide regular reports on sales activities, results, and forecasts. Work collaboratively with a diverse team of colleagues in the US, Europe, and Asia.  Qualifications: 10+ years of full-cycle software sales experience with a track record of over-achieving quota (Top 15% of the company). 4-year college degree required / advanced degree is a plus. Excellent verbal/written communication skills, as well as outstanding presentation skills. IT background with a strong track record of selling large scale infrastructure or application development projects Prior enterprise sales methodology training is preferred. Process-driven, meticulously organized, and self-motivated. Lead Travel and Logistics Sales in US Define strategy for customer acquisition. Leverage organization skills and capabilities to create unique solutions for customer. Participate in industry forums and events to develop networks and demonstrate organizational capability.  Disclaimer: Nagarro is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All qualified applicants will be afforded equal employment opportunities without discrimination based on race, creed, color, national origin, sex, age, disability or marital status.

description: Bryer is seeking a highly motivated and talented individual with excellent communication skills to immediately fill a regional sales manager position.  Bryer’s Oregon territory covers SW Washington, all of Oregon as well as Hawaii. Ideally this position would be filled by a Portland/Salem/Vancouver based individual travelling within the territory promoting Bryer to contractor accounts, architects, and related customers. Mazooma is a payments technology company on a mission to simplify payments. As a leading solution in both sports wagering and iGaming, our patented technology can be found on the cashier of industry-leading brands such as DraftKings, BetMGM, theScore, and PartyPoker. In August 2021, Nuvei, a global payment technology provider, acquired Mazooma, giving clients access to an even greater suite of fintech solutions.  Offering a best-in-class experience, seamless integration, state-of-the-art risk management, and secure bank connections, Mazooma creates raving fans of both merchants and consumers. We are looking for world-class people to join us in delivering leading-edge solutions to an industry experiencing exponential growth.  As a Sales Development Rep, you will be responsible for accelerating the distribution of Nuvei’s products with specific focus on the Northern America market by uncovering new opportunities and working with a business development manager to mature those opportunities.  Key Responsibilities: Follow a disciplined approach to forecasting and opportunity management via SFDC and our supporting tools and processes. Develop sales leads by using sales tools with outbound sales prospecting efforts.  Preferred Qualifications: Special consideration given to candidates who have experience in Business Development/Sales/Account Management within global enterprises with a thorough understanding of the payments industry. Significant track record of achievement and success within the targeted field of expertise. Ability to build internal and external relationships to gain and share information such as industry trends.  Minimum Qualifications: Minimum two years’ of sales high growth experience. Pipeline management. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Exceptional relationship-building skills. Fluent in English.  Benefits: A challenging job in a fast developing, international company with an open #peoplefirst culture. Friendly work environment where you can thrive and develop your skills. Career advancement possibilities. Competitive remuneration package.  Mazooma does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, color, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other reason prohibited by law in provision of employment opportunities and benefits.

jobTitle: Sales and Marketing Manager, Gastroenterology/Urology Division
description: MITEC Medical safeguards patients welfare through the distribution of last generation invasive and non-invasive medical devices, improving medical procedures and treatments in the Caribbean region. We are hiring a hard-working winner, confident, competitive and results-oriented Sales Manager.  Create, direct, and lead the development and execution of the territory-specific sales strategies for MITEC Medical’s product Divisions of Urology and Gastroenterology. Lead the formation of the Strategic Plan through Market Opportunity Assessment and Customer Segmentation. Determine and implement the appropriate sales models, by geographical region, city or account, to maximize revenue and profit. Prepare the year business plan by Divisions. Work closely with Leadership, cross-functional teams and and Sales Representatives to drive a high level execution of all sales/marketing strategies and programs Perform constant update to account profiles in our CRM system. Assume accountability for all aspects of the Division, to establish and maintain a market leadership position for the individual product lines; to conduct training, education, awareness and the relevant market assessment. Participate actively in medical events where MITEC is sponsor Provide Clinical Training to customers, Doctors, Nurses etc. as well as Technical Support during implants or surgeries. (this is performed after being certified in the managed Divisions) Plan clinical follow up to local Patients for implanted devices. Coordinate all the tasks, pre-call plans and follow up on his/her team. Works with business partners to get support for physician trainings, proctorships and preceptorships. Complete administrative responsibilities such as: weekly, monthly metrics report and quarterly forecast reports. Complete necessary training modules on time Carry out duties in compliance with established business policies.  What You Need Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business or related discipline required 4+ years of experience required in Sales with direct product (medical devices) management experience or healthcare sales preferred Strong interpersonal and relationship management skills Ability to work collaboratively and independently in a cross-functional and team oriented environment Strong oral and written skills (both in groups and one-on-on interaction) Strong analytical skills and ability to deliver results with multiple projects Be coachable Travel national and internationally Open to learn and ability to lead consistently through change and foster a healthy team culture. This position could be performed from Orlando/Miami (Florida), Dominican Republic or Venezuela.

Your Role Sales Engineers function as Solution Consultants and a core part of Innovaccers Growth Strategy team. You will work closely with the Growth Strategy Directors and the front end sales team to decide on the deal strategy and ensure we are putting our best foot forward in every customer interaction. The primary focus of the Sales Engineer will be demonstrating Innovaccer’s end to end offerings to our customers including providing deep dives on our technology.  The candidate should possess exceptional knowledge of healthcare data, a nuanced understanding of different data sources (including EHRs, patient management systems, payer data, ancillary data, etc), common value-based care workflows for quality, risk and reporting, possess exemplary presentation skills, and embody strong team values. The role is varied and will include leading technical discussions, configuring demos, handling security/compliance requests and driving expert-style conversations to a successful conclusion. In addition, the candidate will assess, document and monitor sales requests into the Product Management and Engineering functions at Innovaccer. The candidate will develop exceptional knowledge of the capability of the Innovaccer product suite and will be capable of communicating the details to potential prospects and existing clients. Sales Engineers will also be engaged in strategic projects (e.g. entering a new market) and building pitch packs for client meetings. A successful candidate will love working with cutting edge technology, and a wide variety of healthcare organizations. Sales Engineers are among the most hotly demanded members of the Innovaccer team, asked to jump in on everything from sales to marketing to product design to investor discussions. Confidence and executive presence are essential since our Sales Engineers are often presenting in front of the CXO of customers and Innovaccer.  A Day in the Life at Innovaccer There’s no such thing as a typical day for sales engineers at Innovaccer-- and that’s part of the fun! Sales engineers have varied responsibilities in the company and are always in demand. Subject matter expertise: support our sales teams in on-site and remote meetings with your industry and Innovaccer product knowledge, including qualification, discovery, demonstration, and solution design. Prioritize opportunities and coordinate regional sales team to drive opportunities to a successful conclusion Share your knowledge and expertise with the team by leading occasional internal training sessions Spearhead the creation and delivery of critical sales artifacts to support our fast-paced sales cycle, including statements of work, RFPs, solution designs, pitch decks and solution strategy documents. Collect and manage product and engineering requests from the Sales Team and liaise with our Product and Engineering teams to improve the platform including compiling key features that are being requested or are in demand based on sales calls or proposals. Learn the details of existing clients to understand how they use the platform and benefits they have received from the platform for reference stories or anecdotes in prospect conversations. Present solutions to executive-level clients and engage in problem-solving discussions in meetings Embrace ambiguity and Problem-solving. Be prepared to drive structure in ambiguous situations and problem-solve to drive impact.  What You Need 5+ years of experience in healthcare or healthcare IT 50% travel availability High comfort level with presenting to senior executives, via video call and in-person Experience with cloud platforms Experience working with sales and marketing teams Bachelor’s degree in a related field or technical certifications are preferred A desire to work in a fast-paced environment where rapid execution and agility to meet changing customer needs

description: Individual Contributor Sales Role  Location: Orange County, California  Are you a money-motivated, self-starter who loves to crush your quota and exceed expectations? Do you love working in the fun, collaborating, the fast pace of a start-up environment? Are you looking to join a company where you have a voice in how we expand and grow? Then this might be the position you’ve been looking for!  Come join us!  MedTrainer is the market leader for the healthcare SMB market when it comes to learning management, compliance management, and provider credentialing for the healthcare industry. It’s an exciting time to work at MedTrainer, you can learn more about our company, and our products and services at www.medtrainer.com. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE).  Your Opportunity We are seeking a motivated and innovative high-touch salesperson with a track record of developing new business. This position will manage a region/territory of the United States covering some of our largest Channel Partners. Our ideal candidate will work well with our relationship-driven team and take charge of developing territory sales plans that maximize sales promotion and incentive programs to drive results and inspire productivity and teamwork.  Responsibilities You will work with management to develop and execute a strategic and comprehensive business plan with your Channel Partners up to and including identifying core performers from your Channel Partners representatives and mapping the benefits of MedTrainer’s solutions to the business requirements of our target market.  Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:  ● Schedule and conduct meetings with existing and new channel account through telephone calls targeted email campaigns, and corporate marketing programs, as directed by Sales ManagementCollaborate with key referral sources and clients, with the goal of education, consultation, and securing referrals to end-user sales. ● Develop sales skills and maintain a comprehensive understanding of the MedTrainer platform to optimize sales results; remain up to date with new product initiatives, services, industry trends, and other relevant information of interest to customers. ● Manage channel partner sales team pipeline by stimulating partner sales reps, managers, and directors ● Effective tracking of all sales prospects with timely follow up ● Proactively identify and address opportunities to improve the sales process ● Possible travel to area territory, expos and trade shows. ● Report back to management and leadership on data-driven KPIs  Your Qualifications ● 3-5 years of successful sales experience inside sales experience; ● A proven track record of over-quota achievement ● Ability to operate in an entrepreneurial environment ● Knowledge and experience working with channel partners and distributor sales representatives is helpful but not a requirement ● BA/BS or equivalent experience ● Experience with software such as Salesforce, Slack, Excel, PowerPoint, and Word

Company Description  Alside, a division of Associated Materials Incorporated (“AMI”), is a federally designated essential business and recognized leader in the home improvement industry. Founded in 1947, Alside is a manufacturer and distributor of vinyl siding and accessories, vinyl windows and patio doors, and fencing and railing products for the residential and commercial remodeling and new construction markets. Alside products are distributed to licensed professional remodeling contractors and home builders through our network of over 100 Supply Centers and also through select independent distributors across the U.S. and Canada. We are proud to be a charter member of the Vinyl Siding Institute, the American Association of Architects, the National Association of Home Builders, and the National Association of the Remodeling Industry.  Job Description  SUMMARY:  Reporting to the Area Sales Manager, the individual in this role will be primarily responsible for developing target accounts and maintaining and driving new business within the Rock Island, IL market.  Sales Skills  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Leads all sales and account/planning, forecasting, reporting, management efforts for assigned accounts within territory Understands, assesses, and anticipates customers’ objectives, strategies, and requirements to identify and pursue sales opportunities Acquires new customers to maximize supply center revenue Responsible for escalated customer service issue follow-up, but not the primary contact point for issue resolution Management/Leadership Works closely with supply center and corporate resource to have them enter & fulfill orders Strong knowledge of the AMI sales process and policies (e.g., accruals, credit, expenses, rewards) Acts as a mentor for Sales Representatives Product/Market Brings core product specification knowledge, application, and value to the customer Understands necessary building codes and how they impact AMI products Reads blueprints and understands take-off capabilities for core products Sells remodeling, new construction, project work, and ISS Must be able to accurately and professionally demo all core products to small and large groups Must be able to accurately and professionally demo all core products to small and medium groups Understands the basics of negotiating correct market value pricing for the assigned territory, and seeks advice from the Area Sales Leader or Sr. Sales Manager Qualifications  Education And Experience Successful sales history with a minimum of 2 years of outside sales experience. Experience within the building materials industry is highly preferred. Bachelor's degree preferred Self-directed, highly organized, customer-focused, detail oriented, and competitive Working knowledge of core building material products (specifically windows & siding) for both single and multi-family applications Proven experience in new business selling, upselling, and selling Preferred experience working with builders and architects to create bigger ticket sales Additional Information  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.  Recruiters: Please note that Associated Materials, Alside and any of its affiliated companies does not seek or accept unsolicited resumes or offers of recruiting service associated with any published or unpublished employment opportunities. Any unsolicited information sent to AMI or any of its employees will be considered as unencumbered and free from any fee or charge whatsoever. Only members of our Human Resources Team have authority to engage or authorize recruiting services. Any questions regarding recruiting services of any kind must be sent to jobs at associatedmaterials dot com  #Indeed5-Alside

NOTE: This is a field based role. Must be located in the state of Illinois, Indiana or Missouri for consideration.  At Freshworks, we are creating a global workplace that enables everyone to find their true potential, purpose, and passion irrespective of their background, gender, race, sexual orientation, religion and ethnicity. We are committed to providing equal opportunity for all and believe that diversity in the workplace creates a more vibrant, richer work environment that advances the goals of our employees, communities and the business.  Freshworks provides intelligent customer engagement software for businesses of all sizes, making it easy for teams to win customers for life. More than 50,000 businesses trust Freshworks, including our employee engagement, customer engagement and CRM solutions, to better support employees so businesses can increase customer satisfaction and lifetime value. Our products are ready to go, easy to use, and offer a quick return on investment.  Freshworks has received numerous accolades that include ranking #10 on the prestigious Forbes’ Cloud 100 and #22 on the Battery Ventures/Glassdoor Best Places to Work lists.  Headquartered in San Mateo, California, Freshworks has a dedicated global team operating from 13 locations to serve our customers throughout the world. Freshworks is backed by leading investors including Accel, CapitalG, Sequoia Capital and Tiger Global Management.  Your Responsibilities:  Generate new business opportunities to fuel our growth Create and prioritize strategic target account lists within a defined territory Research and build new and existing accounts (i.e. adding contacts, sending emails, strategic calling) Conduct high level conversations with senior executives in prospect accounts Evangelize Freshworks with passion and energy Achieve monthly quotas of closed business Initiate, develop and maintain executive level relationships and drive sales activities with key customers Understand target customers business needs, develop proposals and accurately articulate Freshworks' value proposition at the executive level Close complex transactions and be willing to get into the trenches with the team  Preferred Experience and Skills:  4+ years outbound quota carrying SaaS sales experience CRM/ITSM experience highly preferred Proven track record of consistent quota attainment by month/quarter/year Team player, strong collaborator Consistent success with sales quota attainment BDR/SDR previous prospecting experience is a plus! Excellent written/verbal communication skills Ability to understand customer needs and meet that need with a successful product sale Strong time management and organizational skills Bachelor's degree  🌟 Summary of Freshworks Benefits: 🌟 Freshworks offers multiple options for dental, medical, vision, disability and life insurances unlimited time off + paid off, commuter benefits, work from home spending, and wellness benefits are also offered. Freshworks also offers adoption and parental leave benefits

jobTitle: Applications Sales Representative - Marketing Cloud - Retail/CPG
description: It is an amazing time to be part of the Oracle Marketing Cloud | Majors | Retail/CPG sales team!  Oracle Marketing is the most comprehensive, integrated marketing solution available to launch cross-channel marketing programs and unify all prospect and customer marketing signals in a single view. This solution helps generate a higher return on digital marketing investments, create customer loyalty through superior campaign performance, and unlock real-time performance decisions during critical campaign cycles. Sells a subset of product or services directly or via partners to a large number of awesome named accounts in the retail/CPG Vertical.   Primary job duty is to sell business Oracle Marketing Cloud applications software/solutions and related services to prospective and existing customers. Manage sales through forecasting, account resource allocation, account strategy, and planning. Develop solution proposals encompassing all aspects of the application. Participate in the development, presentation and sales of a value proposition. Negotiate pricing and contractual agreement to close the sale. Identify and develop strategic alignment with key third party influencers.  Job duties are varied and complex, needing independent judgment. May have project lead role. 5 years field sales experience with focus on large strategic accounts including applications sales experience - preferably to marketing exec leadership (CMO, VP Marketing). Highly developed selling, customer relations and negotiation skills. Successful sales track record. Oracle knowledge and/or knowledge of Oracle*s competitors. Interaction with C level players. Team player. Ability to penetrate accounts and meet with stakeholders within accounts. Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal skills. Presentation skills. Travel may be needed. Bachelor degree or equivalent.

To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.  Job Category Sales Job Details  Slack is on a mission to make your working life simpler, more pleasant and more productive. We are looking for a Sales Manager to join our fast growing Sales organization and manage a team of Manager, Small-Medium Account Executives.  Our culture is the north star that guides how we work together and with our customers. Are you looking to build something greater than yourself? Do you want to work alongside some of the most talented and dynamic people in the industry? If so, Slack just might be the place for you!  You are driven, curious, intelligent and deeply passionate about your craft. You will build and run a diverse team of talented individuals looking for mentorship and help growing their careers. In addition, you will remove barriers to Customer adoption of Slack and collaborate with the broader Leadership Team. This is a fast paced role that requires strong leadership, priority management and interpersonal skills.  Our ideal candidate is a team-player who has a proven track record of excelling in sales and taking initiative above and beyond the call of duty.  Responsibilities:  Mentor and manage a team of Manager, Small-Medium Account Executives that have fun winning together Build a new regional team to help our SMB organization expand Own ongoing growth and development; recruiting, hiring, training and mentoring reps Use regular pipeline coaching and management sessions to assist rep skill development Support AE in customer and prospect meetings and help define a strong business case Help AE strategize with Solution Engineering, Customer Success and other cross-functional teams to drive success and maximize resource allocation Hone execution by listening to calls with customers and convert them to coaching opportunities Conduct regular pipeline and big-deal-reviews to mentor Account Executives on strategies and learn where they can be shared with others Report on sales activity and lead a regular revenue forecast for your leadership team Achieve key performance metrics and goals Work with your team and leadership to discuss, plan and implement improvements  Requirements:  1+ years of Account Executive management experience 5+ years of Sales experience preferably within an Enterprise SaaS organization Solid understanding of Enterprise SaaS applications and collaboration technology Consistent track record of achieving personal and team goals Excellent mentor, writing, discovery and presentation skills History of thriving in a rapidly-changing environment Passion for increasing customer happiness and deepening customer relationships Comfortable and willing to be a hands-on contributor Ideal candidate will have previous sales management experience Bachelors degree required  Slack is a layer of the business technology stack that brings together people, data, and applications – a single place where people can effectively work together, find important information, and access hundreds of thousands of critical applications and services to do their best work. From global Fortune 100 companies to corner markets, businesses and teams of all kinds use Slack to bring the right people together with all the right information. Slack is headquartered in San Francisco, CA and has offices around the world. For more information on how Slack makes teams better connected, visit slack.com.  Ensuring a diverse and inclusive work environment where we learn from each other is core to Slacks values. We encourage people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and a cheerful and encouraging place to work.  Come do the best work of your life here at Slack!  Accommodations  If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .  Posting Statement  At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.  Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .  Salesforce welcomes all.

description: Currently, StaffBright has a great Sales Manager / Business Development Manager opportunity in the Metro Detroit area. We are seeking individuals with 5+ years of automotive sales experience.  What You Will Be Doing  You will set up and grow a new sales office for US and Canada for function-critical components for electric powertrains and power distribution and will therefore take over responsibility for market entry, business development, and establishing and managing customer relationships Determine target market segments and build market reputation for products and innovations Establish contacts and relationships to tier-1 suppliers and OEMs in automotive and power industry Generate leads for prototype and series developments in the US and Canadian market Maintain interface to business units in Europe and be first contact for both customers and internal groups Identify ongoing trends, developments, pain points and technological innovations in the market Develop know-how on competition, price points, and market dynamics in US/Canada  What We Need From You  5+ years of experience in automotive sales or related industries Entrepreneurial mindset and genuine interest to generate business in an innovative, fast-paced and challenging environment Enthusiasm, reliability, and results-driven with a positive team-player attitude - must have hunter mentality! Strong work ethic and excellent communication, interpersonal and organizational skills  All-Star Skillset  Bachelor degree in engineering or business preferred Technological and/or engineering know-how on electric powertrains is a big plus!  The Perks  Lots of opportunity for growth as this is a new initiative in the US/Canada - chance to be on the ground floor of a rapidly growing electrification market! High visibility internally with top Directors and Executives Great opportunity to grow a portfolio and customer base that will result in high financial reward! Full medical, vision, dental, 401K match with 100% vesting on day 1, and tuition reimbursement   StaffBright - Who We Are   StaffBright matches professionals to rewarding Finance, IT, Engineering, and Sales and Marketing opportunities with industry-leading organizations helping accelerate careers, while delivering excellent results for our client companies. At StaffBright, we work closely with our clients, recruiters, and candidates to ensure that talent needs are fulfilled quickly, and with the right individual. StaffBright is proud to be a recipient of Best of Staffing in 2020!

Overview  Responsible for retaining and generating revenue in assigned geographical area. Responsible for building strategic and tactical sales plans to drive revenue and promote the Champion Teamwear brand. Coordinates with Sales Support resources and Territory Sales Representatives to leverage strengths across the team and further Champion product penetration in assigned district. Internal sales position with some ravel required for face-to-face customer meetings, clinics, competitions, trade shows and other required events.  Responsibilities Meets or exceeds individual revenue goals. Services existing accounts, obtains orders, and establishes new accounts by planning and organizing daily work schedule. Develops strategic and tactical sales plans for assigned district to drive revenue growth. Establishes sales pipeline potential and a customer interaction plan to generate sales from the pipeline. Develops and meets sales appointment and customer touch point plans for the various customer types within assigned district. Develops efficient customer meeting schedules and fulfills customer appointment and interaction commitments. Provides complete and timely follow-up on all potential prospects and leads. Records sales plans and activities in the Champion Customer Relationship Management tool. Sells products and customer solutions aligned with Champion pricing strategy, coordinating with management if price requirements for specific deals are not aligned with pricing. Aggressively solicits new referrals from existing accounts. Attends coaches’ clinics, competitions and other customer events within the assigned district to drive sales and support the Champion Teamwear brand. Conducts appointments and customer interactions in a professional manner which represents Champion’s values and brand image. Identifies new products, trends, and sales techniques and shares this information with the other sales reps and managers. Builds and maintains a positive working relationship with customers through 100% customer satisfaction. Adjusts content of sales presentations as needed for specific customers and sales calls. Focuses sales efforts by studying existing and potential volume of customer targets. Keeps management informed by submitting activity and results reports, such as daily call reports, weekly work plans, and monthly and annual territory analyses. Monitors competition by gathering current marketplace information on pricing, products, new products, delivery schedules, merchandising techniques, etc. Recommends changes in products, service, and policy by evaluating results and competitive developments. Coordinates with Sales Support resources for order entry and customer follow up. Coordinates with Sales Support to resolve customer complaints by investigating problems; developing solutions; preparing reports; making recommendations to management. Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies. Leads by example in teaching our corporate culture on such items as respect for others, teamwork, positive attitude, and work ethic. Provides training and assistance to new team members as needed. Completes position specific training plan, and engages in continuous development utilizing a developmental plan. Upholds Champion’s Vision, Mission, and Values by “Making it Personal” during every interaction and process with all departments and team members. Performs other work duties, as assigned. Qualifications  Minimum Education and Experience Required: College degree preferred and/or equivalent experience. 2-3 years of related sales experience preferred. Superior interpersonal skills. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Proficient with MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook). Ability to work independently on assigned tasks as well as to accept direction on given assignments. Ability to coordinate with Territory Reprentatives assigned to district for different product lines. Ability to work effectively with Sales Support resources to de-load routine tasks and stay focused on revenue retention and creation Ability to effectively multi-task and adapt to fast paced environment. Background in sport, cheer, dance, or gymnastics is a plus. To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States and should not require now, or in the future, sponsorship for employment visa status  EOE/AA: Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disabled  Only applicants requiring reasonable accommodation for any part of the application and hiring process should contact us directly:  Telephone: 877.999.5553  Email: HBI_TA@hanes.com

description: Upper Midwest (MN, ND, NE, SD)  SUMMARY: Working with a regional team, the Territory Sales Manager is responsible for growing our pet food brands and brand awareness throughout the region. Successful team player, growth within established account base and developing accounts within territory. Central location (Minneapolis/St. Paul, MN or Omaha, NE) preferred. Approximately 50-60% overnight travel.  Competitive salary and commissions; medical, dental, vision; 401k with company match; vacation and holidays; travel/equipment/expenses paid.  KEY PERFORMANCE MEASURES Meet and exceed sales goals and objectives Offer great support to our retailers and customers Develop and execute innovative/creative strategies Professional representation of our company and brands Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities Effective selling skills, pet food sales experience preferred Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, effective presentation skills Positive attitude and team player Computer/mobile technology proficient Valid driver’s license, presentable transportation and insurance Nunn Milling Company, an affiliated company to Midwestern Pet Foods, Inc., was founded in 1926 in Evansville, Indiana, as a miller of flour and corn meal. In the 1940s the company began using the basic ingredients from its milling operations to produce dog and cat food. As a result of increasing sales of the pet food, Midwestern Pet Foods, Inc. was founded in 1982. Today, Midwestern Pet Foods, Inc. owns and operates four state-of-the-art, high capacity dry pet food production and packing facilities. Company headquarters is located in Evansville, Indiana, with plants in Monmouth, Illinois, Chickasha, Oklahoma and Waverly, New York. Midwestern Pet Foods, Inc. employs approximately 320 employees. Nunn Milling has a facility in Evansville as well and employees about 10 employees.

description: NextPath Career Partners is currently seeking a Sales Executive to join our client’s team. This is a direct hire position with remote flexibility.  Responsibilities Expand customer base for your target accounts/region Develop and execute a sales plan to hit or exceed quota Strategize and execute an outreach and lead gen plan with the SDR team for your accounts/region Generate 25% of your pipeline (Marketing will generate the other 75%) Market and sell with current partners, including Microsoft, and expand our partner ecosystem in your assigned accounts/region when and where necessary Partner with prospects to understand their business needs and objectives to effectively communicate our unique value proposition through demos and presentations Establish a sales forecasting cadence to report on pipeline and ensure Salesforce is updated weekly with our KPI’s Reporting on forces that shift market needs and strategic direction of accounts Requirements 5+ years of experience selling enterprise collaboration and communication software to senior executives in large and distributed organizations Proven ability to effectively manage a long and complex sales cycle and align to the buying and procurement process Natural collaborator who operates with integrity Coachable and open to learning with a focus on continuous improvement A self-starter who takes initiative and has a sense of urgency Amazing communication and presentation skills (both oral and written) with the ability to translate technical concepts into business value Demonstrated creativity in finding ways around sales barriers and ability to convert opponents into champions Ability to articulate differentiators and position company against competitors Strategic and adaptive thinker who can understand client’s business & processes and adapt your selling techniques accordingly Nextpath Career Partners  NextPath is a candidate centric recruiting firm focused on your career goals to help you find your next path! Our team of professional recruiters have over 80 years of combined experience to help you navigate a job change. Our clients span local and national with roles in sales, creative, marketing, and staffing on a direct, contract-to-perm, and contract (project) basis.  If the position above doesn’t appear to fit we do have a host of clients with roles that could be a match and not every position will be posted. Feel free to reach out to find a better match by emailing your resume to apply@nextpathcp.com for a recruiter to engage.  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer  View all open jobs: http://www.nextpathcp.com

description: RiverLink is looking for an experienced Director of Sales Operations to join a growing company that has their North American headquarters just outside of Minneapolis. This individual needs to have 7 years of experience in marketing or sales. Strong experience leading teams is a requirement.  One needs to be able to communicate across multiple different departments including Supply Chain, Finance, Operations, Sales and Marketing.  In this role you would be helping with the development of the 24-month demand plan and also participating in the planning cycle of the business.   A large component of this role will be in helping to develop and execute the sales strategy. Description  Amazon Care is looking for a Senior Account Executive to join an exciting and rapidly growing team responsible for bringing Amazon Care to new enterprise customers. The Senior Account Executive is responsible for prospecting directly into Enterprise benefit buyers and also building and growing relationships with consultants and brokers on a local, regional and national scope. This role works closely with product, marketing and clinical teams to deliver ROI for our customers. We are an entrepreneurial team of doers that work passionately to apply cutting-edge advances in technology, solve real-world problems to create a frictionless healthcare experience. The ideal candidate has the ability to build and convey compelling value for the benefit buyer at large organizations and work backwards to deliver on their health and productivity goals. You should be a self-starter who is not afraid to ‘get hands dirty’ with demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically about business, product, and technical challenges. Above all, you will care deeply about the customer and delight in creating simple and elegant solutions that solve our customers’ biggest challenges.  Amazon Care is re-imagining healthcare and building it around employee and employer needs to make healthcare easy and accessible for all. Amazon Care is Amazon’s virtual-first primary and urgent care service that helps people get quality medical advice and medical care whenever it is needed.  About Us  Inclusive Team Culture  Here at Amazon, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.  Work/Life Balance  Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.  Mentorship & Career Growth  Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign opportunities based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded contributor.  Responsibilities include Build sales opportunities with benefit buyers through inbound lead generation as well as self-generated outbound prospecting Develop and execute against a set of activity and sales goals with a passion to deliver healthcare innovation Provide feedback from benefit buyers and other enterprise customers about customer expectations and product needs Collaborate with leadership to develop and execute strategic plans for your assigned geography  Basic Qualifications 8+ years of professional experience in large enterprise business solution sales or business development, selling : 1/ healthcare services directly to employee benefit buyers or through broker-consultants in any industry or 2/ selling b2b services to enterprise clients within the Healthcare sector 5+ years experience with prospecting, identifying, pursuing, and closing new opportunities BA/BS degree or equivalent experience Preferred Qualifications Completed MBA or advanced Business Degree Experience working in healthcare sales including point solution organizations Thrives in early-stage, start-up environments Energized by being an industry pioneer and innovator Proven success in building relationships using a consultative, solutions-focused approach Passion for prospecting, qualifying and negotiating net-new opportunities System and analytics skills include: 1/ Microsoft Excel for business cases analyses 2/ SFDC for customer opportunity management and account planning and 3/ Collaboration hardware and software for virtual customer-facing meetings Strong business writing and verbal presentation skills including story telling in both formats Familiar with Healthcare economics, total cost of care, value-based care, and reimbursement methodologies Ability to think and act independently within a fast-paced, dynamic and multi-task driven environment Professional traits that are not unique to this position, but necessary for Amazon leaders: Exhibits excellent business judgment Mentors sales team members Sets the bar for high team standards Thinks strategically, but stays on top of tactical execution Drives innovation for their team and broader organization Thinks big and has convictions Is action and results-oriented and self-reliant Is analytical and structured Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, visit US Disability Accommodations: https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.   Company - Amazon.com Services LLC  Job ID: A1748339

description: Description  Location: US Remote  SalesIntel is looking for a motivated, talented and authentic Business Development Representative to join our growing team. As part of the SalesIntel SDR team you are a collaborative individual who contributes to the sales and marketing teams, works in a dynamic environment, provides messaging and product feedback to the marketing and product teams and works proactively to drive their personal and SalesIntel’s overall sales performance. We hope you will consider being a part of a fast growing and trustworthy organization that truly cares about its employees.  Who we are  SalesIntel is the top revenue intelligence platform on the market. Our combination of automation and researchers allows us to reach 95% data accuracy for all our published contact data, while continuing to scale up our number of contacts. We currently have more than 6.2 million human-verified contacts, another 77 million machine verified contacts, and the highest number of direct dial contacts in the industry. We guarantee our accuracy with our well trained research team that re-verifies every direct dial number, email, and contact every 90 days. With the most comprehensive contact and company data and our excellent customer service, SalesIntel has the best B2B data available.  What you’ll do Interact with prospects via channels such as telephone, email and social media with a high attention to detail Researching companies, identify key players, generate interest and develop accounts to stimulate opportunities Transform leads into qualified opportunities by partnering with marketing and sales to create and execute on program and outbound lead generation campaigns Track all relevant qualification and lead management activity using Salesforce Report on lead qualification(s) and call activity Have thorough knowledge of SalesIntel product and offerings to effectively communicate value propositions, handle objections and competitive questions Be informed about the B2B Data and Sales Intelligence industry Consistently achieve qualifies opportunity quotas to ensure territory revenue objectives Collaborate and communicate with the marketing team  Qualifications 2-3 years of proven excellence in business development, inside sales and/or sales Experience in B2B sales is preferred but not required Experience using Salesforce or comparable CRM strongly desired Experience using Outreach, strong plus Strong understanding of SDR and lead development best practices and procedures Proven ability to perform successfully given low oversight and limited process 100% reliable and detail-oriented. Strong consultative selling skills Positive can-do attitude and tireless work ethic Driven and self-sufficient Adaptable to the startup environment with the hustle attitude, dynamic/diverse environment, potential for broadened responsibilities and, of course, work hard play hard attitude  We Offer Comprehensive compensation plan including base salary plus commission Full benefit package including medical, dental, vision, 401K, and paid time off Robust training and sales methodology processes Work hard, play hard attitude Diverse work environment Stock Options  Powered by JazzHR  MQhmg90dxm

New Business Sales  Zeren is partnering with a leading, global provider of software solutions for Enterprise Architecture, Business Process Analysis, Application Portfolio Management, and IT Governance, to hire a member of their New Business Sales team.  As a member of the New Business team, your primary focus will be to engage in the acquisition of new client names and introduction of new customers to the portfolio. You will be managing all aspects of B2B Enterprise sales with an emphasis on searching for and closing new logo sales.  Job Description  Follow up with North America sales opportunities owned by you daily. Searching for and engaging with suitable, targeted prospects. Controlling the sales process by guiding prospects with a clear structure through all phases. Attend regular sales meetings and maintain an accurate forecast and pipeline for management reporting. Run onsite sessions to demonstrate products and solutions to potential customers. Building tailored “Proof of Concept” evaluations for potential customers, and be able to present that back to the client. Work closely and collaboratively with Customer Account Managers, Finance, Marketing, and Development Teams. Assisting the product development team in scoping new value-add accelerators/solutions for the product range.  Key Skills  5-10 years of direct sales experience (SaaS software industry) as a Senior Enterprise Account Executive ideally with Enterprise Architecture experience (coming from a start-up / scale – up is a plus). Self- starter with motivation to meet tight deadlines and to perform individually whilst working as a part of a global team. Driven to succeed and with a consistent track record of sales success. Ability to absorb technical information and communication this clearly to audience. Be innovative and develop new ideas and techniques to enable our client’s software to remain a market leader in Enterprise Architecture. Proficient in Microsoft stack including MS Visio and all Office 365 applications.

Location: Preferably New York, Washington or Miami  Type: Full-time  Experience: Mid-Senior level  Position taking: Immediately  Salary: According to background and experience  This is an exciting opportunity for an applicant with an outstanding track record in selling high-technology products to US broadcasters and Video Professionals.  Working under the leadership of one of our Sales Directors, responsibilities will include: Managing the complete sales cycle, from lead generation to deal closures Traveling extensively across across the USA (up to 50-75%) to make presentations to prospective key accounts and close deals Defining and applying the business strategy for your area jointly with the Sales Director Extending our network and ensuring coordination among master distributor, integrators and resellers Representing AVIWEST at major domestic and international Broadcast exhibitions linked to your area Monitoring leads and projects following internal processes using the company’s CRM Sharing customer feedback with the marketing and R&D teams The applicant will have an excellent understanding of IP networks and a background in broadcast, as well as a proven record of sales experience in the broadcast and/or security markets.

jobTitle: Sr. Territory Business Manager/Territory Business Manager, Multiple Sclerosis, North Carolina
description: Company Description  Much like the periodic table of elements documents the building blocks of the universe around us, the Biogen Elements give shape to our company’s culture. They include fundamentals like a pioneering spirit, strong ethics, personal accountability, inclusivity, agility, and an unwavering customer focus. Because we have a unified approach to our individual jobs, because we are one Biogen.  Job Description  In this field based, specialty sales representative position you will be called upon to sell our Neurology products with key stakeholders in the Multiple Sclerosis community: including Neurologists, allied health professionals, and local MS chapters.  The Sr. Territory Business Manager is responsible for developing and executing on sales plans for their assigned territory.  In this role, you will convey complex clinical and reimbursement information to customers and key stakeholders regarding Biogen products. You must be able to utilize exemplary interpersonal skills and directed probing to uncover and address the customer's educational needs. This position works closely with cross functional peers to help ensure customers are appropriately educated about available Biogen support services, as needed. This role covers a large geography with a possible expectation of 2-3 overnights a week. Qualifications 5+ years B2B and/or pharma, specialty, hospital, med device/capital equipment, and/or biotech sales required. A breadth of experiences across these disciplines is highly desirable. Proven track record of success as demonstrated by consistent high ranking over 3+ years, achievement awards, etc. Proven ability to drive results in a challenging and ambiguous market; launch, business development and co-promotion experiences are an advantage Tenacious, and motivated outside-the-box thinker who excels in a collaborative team setting. Customer and patient focused and able to uncover obstacles, and strategically drive for results with limited direction and in ambiguity Must have the desire and capabilities to help us achieve new levels of success as we look to the future Driving is an essential duty of this job; candidates must have a valid driver’s license to be considered Education: BS/BA preferred, MBA a plus  Additional Information  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
