description: Kwalu is seeking Business Development Managers for Healthcare & Higher Education Furniture sales in CA, CO, MN, NJ, NY, ND, SD and PA to join our team! The ideal candidate will be adept in Healthcare & Higher Education Furniture Sales and Customer Relationship Management. The primary responsibility of the Business Development Manager is to develop, manage and grow Kwalu’s product awareness, acceptance, and furniture sales to the Healthcare and Higher Education market segment, including pipeline build, develop strategy and analyze business opportunities. Essential Job Duties - Includes but not limited to:  Introduce new products, programs, promotions, and specification tools to the Healthcare and Higher Education market; reinforce the value proposition of our furniture and its advantage in the market. Manage the sales development of Kwalu products within the core geography by maintaining a constant awareness of markets and pursues profitable opportunities focused on organizational growth.  Commitment to continual learning and knowledge of Kwalu Products, the proper application and specification requirements along with fabrication and installation process to ensure proper use and overall customer satisfaction Acts as a facilitator and provides recommendations to senior management with key sales information as it relates to markets and regions. Coordinate regular field sales activities including prospecting and lead generation. Identify, qualify, and close opportunities with existing and new clients and customers.  Interact regularly with buying influences to specify our products for future sales on projects, then ultimately close those sales and convert into revenue. Proactively develop, track and aggressively grow top line furniture sales and margins across higher education and healthcare market segments. Continually build a proactive pipeline of new and existing clients and accounts. Conduct technical product presentations with a high degree of knowledge and professional delivery to address issues, needs, trends, technical attributes, and provide solution offerings.  What’s in it for the Business Development Manager - Healthcare & Education? Join a flexible, friendly fast-paced work environment Enjoy a competitive compensation and benefit package Join an organization that on the cutting edge of technology.  Qualifications/Requirements: Must possess 5 years of Sales/or Business Development experience, within the Healthcare and Higher Education furniture marketplace. Strong Knowledge of the Healthcare and Higher Education Environment and experience selling furniture within the Healthcare and Higher Education Vertical. Excellent written and oral communication skills, presentation skills, and computer skills. Ability to successfully build alliances and influence key decision makers. Demonstrated effective negotiation and closing techniques; must be a closer!  Bachelor's Degree required.  Kwalu, LLC. Provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetic information, sexual orientation gender identity, veteran status, pregnancy, or other protected categories consistent with applicable law.  COVID 19 Vaccination required for customer facing employees. Highly recommended for all other positions at Kwalu.

Aware boasts a suite of enterprise-grade SaaS products for leading collaboration technologies like Microsoft Teams, Yammer, Workplace by Facebook and others. Our Aware Risk Management platform offers a solution to remove common enterprise ‘red tape’ (think: legal, compliance, information security, culture protection) in order to successfully deploy collaboration technology. With Aware Spotlight, organizations receive real-time qualitative insights regarding the behavior of employees on the collaboration platform—including community health, benchmarking metrics and qualitative trends.  With the successful launch of Aware’s full suite of enterprise collaboration tools and continued pipeline growth, we are adding to our high performing Sales Development team to continue to push Aware, and our Account Executives, to the next level of success. The Sales Development Representative has a primary responsibility to support and scale this vital part of the business. In this role, you partner with the existing Sales Development team, Revenue Operations, Marketing, Sales and Customer Success to deploy a high growth business model in Sales Development tactics and strategy.  Responsibilities: Schedule phone and in-person meetings with decision makers Meet or exceed sales qualified lead quotas Create urgency around a timeline that is optimal for both Aware and the prospective enterprise  Maintain accurate and timely call notes, contacts and opportunities in SalesForce CRM Identify, contact and qualify prospects; building a strong pipeline of qualified sales opportunities for the Account Executives Help foster an inspiring team environment and a culture that promotes collaboration  Monitor individual performance and report on metrics Participate in daily training on industry updates, business development strategy and leadership Listen to team members’ feedback and resolve any issues or conflicts   Qualifications: Demonstrated success in a high volume, sales-oriented role  Ability to build rapport and credibility with a tight knit team Demonstrated ability to overcome objections Strong computer and organizational skills Excellent communication and leadership skills Organizational and time-management skills Strong decision-making skills Prior experience utilizing Salesforce.com  Thrive in a fast-paced, startup environment Personable demeanor and a winning attitude Previous sales and meeting setting experience

The Gig  As a Sales Development Executive, you are responsible for generating new business opportunities and working closely with our Territory Account Executives to schedule meetings and product demonstrations through outbound prospecting. This position is fundamental to our Sales department and presents an opportunity to learn what it takes to generate a sales pipeline at Tock  All Squarespace and Tock employees are working remotely at this time. We are closely monitoring the status of COVID-19 as we continue our work to build a return-to-work plan that ensures a safe return to our offices and provides flexibility for our employees.  You’ll Get To… Work closely with Territory Account Executives to develop market strategies Prospect, qualify, generate, and follow up on leads to set meetings and product demonstrations for Territory Account Executives Create opportunities via cold calls, email, and social outreach through researching restaurant and following hospitality industry news to add new leads to pre-existing pipeline Provide organized and accurate weekly/monthly pipeline and activity reports to management team using Salesforce Fielding in-bound leads with a large emphasis on outbound prospecting Cultivate a high level of company knowledge and insight into the hospitality industry trends to help create strategies for business development Who We’re Looking For 1-2 years of inside sales prospecting experience Excellent written and verbal communication skills Strong work ethic and high level of professionalism Must be a quick learner with the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment Competitiveness to achieve and exceed monthly quotas Bachelor’s Degree Benefits & Perks Full benefits (medical, dental, and vision insurance) 401k + employer match Flexible vacation & paid time off Paid parental leave Commuter benefit in the form of pretax (US) Tock’s Growth Awarded Fast Company's "Most Innovative Companies" for 2021 Awarded Built In’s “2021 Best Places to Work” Awarded America’s Hottest Brands of 2020 by AdAge Won Chicago Tribune's "Game Changer" Award for industry innovation Reached a global customer base of 30 countries operating in 200+ cities Processed over $1 billion in prepaid reservations Named one of 2019's 50 Startups to Watch Featured in: New York Times, Bloomberg, GQ, Vice, Wired, Food & Wine, Eater, Skift Table, Chicago Tribune, Crain's Chicago Business, New York Post, and more About Tock  Tock is the all-in-one system for reservations, takeout, delivery, and events. We are changing the way restaurants, wineries, and culinary event organizers run their business and how guests explore, discover, and book at these places all around the globe.  About Squarespace  Squarespace is a leading all-in-one website building and ecommerce platform that enables millions to build a brand and transact with their customers in an impactful and beautiful online presence. Our suite of products enables anyone at any stage of their journey to manage their projects and businesses through websites, domains, ecommerce, marketing tools, and scheduling, along with tools for managing a social media presence with Unfold and hospitality business management via Tock. Squarespace democratizes access to best-in-class design, helping our customers in approximately 200 countries and territories maintain consistent branding across all digital touchpoints to stand out online. Our team of more than 1,400 is headquartered in downtown New York City, with offices in Dublin, Ireland, Portland, Oregon, Los Angeles, California and Chicago, Illinois. For more information, visit www.squarespace.com.  Our Commitment  Not only do we embrace and celebrate the diversity of our customer base, but we also strive for the same in our employees. At Tock, we are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, national origin, gender, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or parental status, disability, veteran status, or other class protected by applicable law. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

description: My name is Rick Alexander, an Account Executive with Management Recruiters of Davidson. My client is looking for a Field Sales Representative in a Remote location. Please read through this description below and contact me if you are interested in discussing it further. Also, if you might know of someone who would be interested in this position, please let me know.     Field Sales Representative   Job Description:  The Field Sales Representative will manage assigned accounts to market, position, and sell fluoropolymer resins. This position will take direction from the business manager and work with the Technical Support and Business Operations groups to ensure the growth and profitability of the business.   Functions:  Develops and meets annual sales budget from existing, targeted, and prospective assigned accounts through direct, written, and verbal sales contact. Maintains relationships with customers through planned sales calls, telephone, and written contact. Maintains strategic account profiles in CRM and communicate key issues, short and long-term sales strategies, and opportunities to maximize the sales volume and margin in the assigned territory Negotiates short- and long-term contracts to secure business by establishing pricing, terms, volumes, grades purchased, release quantities, packaging, shipping details, and creates and implements rebate programs to protect market share. Work with outside agencies and inside sales and marketing groups to develop sales and marketing programs. These can include webinars, lunch, and learn presentations, email blasts, technical presentations at conferences, industry magazines, and website articles, and videos   Requirements:  5-10 years of sales experience with coating raw materials or coatings.  2-5 years of technical service experience with coating raw materials manufacturer Familiarity with industrial and architectural coatings and markets. 2-5 years of R&D and formulation experience in the coatings industry, including work with urethanes and polysiloxanes. Experience with PPG, Sherwin Williams, Akzo Nobel, Carboline, Tnemec, Arkema, Dow, Evonik, Axalta, BASF, Hentzen, APV Engineered Coatings, Covestro, Allnex, Lubrizol, Polynt, Univar, Clariant, Huntsman, Eastman Chemical

Founded in 2018, Leena AI is an autonomous conversational AI-backed employee experience platform that is powerful, flexible, and can meets the needs of any enterprise. Trusted by 1M+employees across companies like Nestle, Puma, AirAsia, Coca-Cola, Lafarge Holcim, and Abbott, we have transformed 2M conversations and 10M employee interactions.  We have been recognized by Gartner, earned ourselves several G2 badges, and onboarded over 200 customers. And we’re growing super-fast.  Need more reasons to join us? Our 180+ strong team prides itself on being self-driven, growth-oriented, and a shared belief in the power of autonomy. At Leena AI, we respect hard work, encourage every employee to add their own flavour to the role, and provide unlimited paid time off!  The Role  As a Manager of Sales Development at Leena AI, you’ll get the opportunity to oversee a team in the Sales Development organization. You’ll help your team perform and exceed expectations by training, coaching, and mentoring them to drive impactful results. You’ll also partner closely with our Marketing and Sales teams to align on integrated campaigns, strategic business initiatives, improve processes, and ultimately generate qualified meetings and pipeline for the Leena AI Sales organization.  Responsibilities Build and train members of the Sales Development team to identify, contact, and create qualified opportunities Help to define performance metrics by which SDRs will be measured Coach SDRs through shadowing, role plays, process improvement, and performance reporting in recurring 1:1’s Partner with regional managers to develop campaigns that align to their regional goals based on a territory plan Leverage creative marketing and sales tactics to help the SDR team prospect and engage with multiple buyer personas to introduce Leena AI’s value Manage SDR reports and dashboards to ensure the results they deliver can be easily understood by stakeholders throughout the organization Ensure sales accepted opportunities are sourced in accordance with company targets, and that our sales organization has enough opportunities to work with to be fully productive Iterate on the sales development process, methodology, campaigns, hiring profiles, training and enablement with respect to the Leena AI core values Work closely with marketing, sales, and people ops to ensure SDR onboarding program and ongoing training is up-to-date on our current product offering Partner closely with Sales and other members of the SDR Management team to improve opportunity management and qualification processes Assist with recruiting, hiring, and onboarding new Sales Development Representatives  This is a 1099 position.  Requirements 5+ years management experience in sales, sales operations, marketing, or customer service for a technical product A proven track record of delivering sales pipeline at a fast growing company with multiple sales segments with an inbound and outbound model Management experience in a high growth environment, preferably in sales development or a similar field The desire to listen and creatively solve problems A passion for customers and the desire and desire to build authentic relationships Familiarity with B2B software and the HRTech product space Experience with CRM software (HubSpot preferred but not mandatory) Experience with prospecting tools like Outreach, ZoomInfo etc. Passion and curiosity around technology Excellent spoken and written English (it’s our company language)  Benefits 5 days working with flexible working hours. Permanent WFH Health insurance One time office setup pay

Why you should want to work here  At Freshly Picked, we live to support moms. We do this by creating camaraderie, providing delightful work experiences, and innovating high-end baby products.  We have a world-class e-commerce audience, one of the largest social media followings in the baby category, and we are developing new strategies to become the global leader in direct-to-consumer baby products. If you love a fast-paced environment, fast growth, and the potential to have a huge impact within a company, then you are going to LOVE Freshly Picked!  As a company, we are hungry for growth, supportive, humble, honest, and light-hearted. These values are reflected in everything we do. Additionally, we strive to be results-focused in our decisions and priorities.  What We Need  Freshly Picked is a retail engine! We need the right person to direct and coordinate our 400+ retail accounts and big box stores. The Account Manager is responsible for curating interesting product assortments, negotiating and developing vendor partnerships and delivering great products our customers will love. Our ideal candidate is driven, detail oriented, comfortable working in teams and passionate about the retail industry. They are organized and adept at delegating and time management skills.  Top 3 Skills: Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (primarily Excel and Word) and G Suite Clear and effective written, verbal communication and strong interpersonal skills Time Management & Organization Skills The Account Manager will: Serve as the lead point of contact for all customer account management matters Build and maintain strong, long-lasting client relationships Negotiate contracts and close agreements to maximize profits Ensure the timely and successful delivery of our solutions according to customer needs and objectives Develop new business with existing clients and/or identify areas of improvement to meet sales quotas Forecast and track key account metrics (e.g. quarterly sales results and annual forecasts) Prepare reports on account status Collaborate with product team to identify growth opportunities Assist with challenging client requests or issue escalations as needed Travel multiple times throughout the year to retail/fashion trade shows and meetings Logistics stuff  We offer competitive salaries, health and dental benefits, a 401(k) program, unlimited PTO, and a fun, food-filled startup work environment.  If this sounds like your dream job, let’s talk! Please submit your application to this posting ASAP. description: Our client is a mid-stage cloud technology startup, currently backed by an award-winning private equity firm with $12b in assets under management. We have been exclusively retained to help them double the size of their sales team. This is a remote role, candidates can be anyplace, USA.  The company offers a unique and cutting edge technology aimed at helping plaintiff firms with an all-in-one platform to run and grow a practice. In addition, an offering to bridge litigation funding is in late stage development.  We are seeking professionals who have recent & successful track records in cloud or SaaS sales to a legal vertical. Ideal candidates are coming from small to mid-sized environments, and who can appreciate a company in hyper growth mode, and some of the challenges associated.  About us: We are a team of passionate professionals with a fanatical belief in product superiority, value proposition and ability to dominate the market. Our sales team is responsible for all new business development in a high-velocity prospect funnel and is supported by a team of sales development representatives. The sales team identifies prospects, conducts sales demos, negotiates contracts and sets the proper expectations for handoff to our Customer Success team.   Our team also participates in events, forums and expos nationwide to showcase our platform. You must be a passionate new business hunter and be comfortable being part of cohesive team.   Target candidate profile:  This is an enterprise SaaS sales opportunity, and given our focus on civil litigation law firms, you must be comfortable dealing with small and mid-sized businesses and decision makers inside the legal community. You must be aware of technology trends and advancements in cloud technologies, web and mobile technologies. 2-4 years of sales experience in SaaS/Web/Software/Technology or similar field, strong preference for legal software experience.     Howard-Sloan's recruiters are experts at helping the most passive opportunity seekers with career guidance. All inquires kept in strict confidence.

description: Sales Account Manager AMERICA (West/Midwest Region)  Avebe           For over 100 years we at Avebe have been working hard to get the most out of the potato. And we will continue to do so. Avebe is a cooperative of some 2,300 arable farmers in the Netherlands and Germany. Each year, the starch potatoes of those members are processed into high-grade ingredients based on potato starch and protein; they add value to food products but also to industrial applications worldwide. Avebe works continuously on developing new opportunities and applications based on starch potatoes and is focused on sustainable continuity. The company has 1,300 employees, production sites in the Netherlands, Germany and Sweden and sales offices in the United States, Europe, Asia and the Middle East. The Head Office is in Veendam, the Netherlands.  Department As a member of the Commerce organization this role is focused on the development of customer relationship and sales of Avebe’s portfolio of specialty & innovative product solutions to the targeted or identified food industry segment. This role acts as the key interface between external customers and Avebe. As such the Sales Account Manager is responsible for accurately communicating the needs and demand of our customers to appropriate internal departments for action.  Activities & Responsibilities        The specialty nature of Avebe products asks for a scientifically-grounded individual who enjoys working with companies across a wide variety of product lines (dairy, meats, bakery, sauces, soups, confections). For this position you must be able to make a significant impact on company growth and on customer satisfaction. The Sales Account Manager is responsible for the execution of Sales & Marketing activities across an assigned territory and/or account base to maximize sales volume & value. Sales efforts require a balance between growth/maintenance of base business accounts and development of new accounts.  Main tasks and responsibilities Opportunity identification: identify issues faced by the customer which, if solved by our products, would significantly enhance the customer’s business success. Network development: travel and meet with key customer contacts at base and new accounts to maintain/grow sales; attend plant trials; Travel could be around 40-60%. Lead identification & qualification: use of phone contacts, business information systems, market research, store checks, and trade shows to generate leads for potential new accounts. R&D and customer service partnerships: develop excellent relationships with key internal departments in order to manage customer expectations in real-time. Strategic planning: work with other sales colleagues, R&D, and company management to develop strategic plans and ongoing sales metrics appropriate for the region and/or accounts, and for the company’s long-term financial strength.  Education & Experiences   Bachelor or Master’s degree in food science, food technology or other related discipline, MBA is preferred. Knowledge of the food ingredient market; 5 to 10 years’ relevant sales experiences in the food-ingredients industry, with value-added products, services and innovation; Sales leadership; principal ownership, developing strategies with management, tactics and value propositions. Focused on growth and opportunities. Skilled in negotiation. Demonstrated ability to manage ongoing projects from start to finish. Demonstrated ability to work as a member of a team, at all organizational levels, also able to work independently. Well networked within the Food & Beverage community; Comfortable working and travelling in an international business to business environment; The company offers competitive salaries with full benefits, along with a bonus program.  Competencies ·       Customer orientation; ·       Entrepreneurship; ·       Conceptual thinking; ·       Innovative; ·       Cross-functional way-of-working; ·       Result-driven.  More information?            For further information please contact Joseph Lombardi, Regional Sales Manager by phone: +14013638857 or email: joseph.lombardi@avebe.com. Are you the one we are looking for? An assessment or social media check can be part of the procedure.

Change the future with us! Discover Echo is a revolutionary company that has redesigned microscopy for the life sciences landscape. Our unique hybrid microscopes are used around the world by educators, scientists, and researchers for cutting-edge applications. Our growth potential is enormous.  We are an award-winning, fast-growing company dedicated to improving microscopy. Our unique product allows us to sell on value and need rather than solely on price. Our simplified sales process means we can spend more time doing what we love (selling), and less time on administrative tasks and support. Our unique marketing approach gives us a significant advantage. Top candidates will have familiarity with fluorescence microscopy and live-cell imaging.  Discover-Echo offers an early employment opportunity at a rapidly growing company. You will have the opportunity to make an impact on the community and make your performance matter. We are seeking top-performing life science sales professionals based in the greater Ohio/Michigan area. We are looking for an energetic top-tier fast learner with a good sales track record.  As an equal opportunity employer, we do more than accept difference. We celebrate diversity, we support employees from a wide range of backgrounds, and we benefit from the added creativity and richness that these differences bring to our offices and community. We pride ourselves on being a collaborative environment where everyone’s talents and opinions contribute to the greater good and are always recognized.  Responsibilities: Execute successful product demonstrations Work with our large distribution network to effectively target customers and close deals quickly Build effective relationships with distribution reps and key customers Get our products in the hands of researchers and scientists Grow our presence at government accounts, universities, biotechs, hospitals and pharmaceutical companies  Qualifications Exceptional at delivering results on target Have previous microscopy experience Possess exceptional presentation and verbal communication skills to explain and demonstrate sophisticated technical products Familiarity with key academic research and biotech accounts within the region A fast learner (and a good listener) who understands the needs of today’s life science researchers Have an affinity for life sciences and closing deals -- it’s about passion as much as the job Experience in research, biotech, and pharmaceutical is a plus Experience in selling through large distribution partners is a plus Overnight travel is expected to be roughly 25-50% depending on home base location Ability to lift between 50-60lbs

Position Summary  The Sales Development Rep (SDR) is responsible for supporting the sales team through qualifying leads and managing activities to serve our customers and make our sales team better. This position requires someone who is comfortable and confident communicating to business leaders on the phone and through email. The ideal candidate is driven by a “never enough” mentality meaning they are eager to talk to as many people as possible to see where customer needs can be met and deals can be uncovered. The SDR is comfortable handling a high amount of sales activities per day as they are the engine for the sales team, responsible for scheduling qualified meetings for our sales reps. If you love being curious about and talking to a lot of people, this role could be the perfect fit for you!  Responsibilities Respond, engage and qualify inbound leads and inquiries (phone, email, chat, webinar, etc.) Responsible for developing prospects leading to qualified appointments for Sales Executives Nurture new marketing leads by educating and developing prospects until they are ready to speak with a Sales Executive Drive attendance for webinars and live Q&As Identify prospects using targeted lists within our CRMs (Infusionsoft and PipeDrive, soon to be HubSpot) Ensure successful follow through of the sales cycle by maintaining accurate activity and lead qualification information in our CRM Clearly communicate the benefits of different StoryBrand and Business Made Simple products Perform other duties as assigned  Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities You have experienced business development success through effective use of core sales tools like HubSpot, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, and Zoom Your are a resourceful self-starter that is eager to talk to as many people as possible to see where customer needs can be met and deals can be uncovered You have a proven track record of owning your goals and consistently surpassing them You are proficient in both written and verbal communication You can manage multiple deals/projects at once and to you it's not overwhelming, it's invigorating You use technology and automation to sell efficiently and effectively You build rapport with staff, contractors, customers, and prospects You work well independently while also being able to collaborate with other teams and leaders You enjoy a fast-paced, growth stage work environment  Experience  2+ years of experience in sales, sales administration, or customer service  Position Details Full-time salary + benefits 40+ hours Primarily works remote, though is Nashville based for when in-person meetings need to happen Our private co-working space is available for use but is optional if you'd prefer to work at home  StoryBrand and Business Made Simple Core Values  Our core identity as a staff is that we are RELENTLESS. To live out this identity, these are the core values we exude: Advocate-Minded — Do you obsess over the success of your customers and always think of ways to help them win? Relentlessly Optimistic — Does your positive outlook allow you to achieve audacious goals and persevere through challenges? Ruthlessly Efficient — Do you constantly look for ways to improve processes, save time, and save money?  We believe everybody deserves a chance to prosper in both their professional and personal lives. But in order to succeed, people need help. We help by creating online courses that develop their professional career. If you are advocate-minded, relentlessly optimistic, and ruthlessly efficient, join our mission!  At StoryBrand and Business Made Simple, we believe everyone's story should be heard and understood without regard for race, religion, color, age, sex, orientation, identity, or disability. Which is why we are passionate about creating an inclusive workplace that promotes and values diversity and reflects the communities we strive to serve. Many of the greatest stories and ideas come from a diverse mix of people, so we are working to build a culture where diversity is the norm, not a program.  Powered by JazzHR  aGTSIQTUbR

description: Recognized as one of Forbe's 2020 World's Best Employers and named to Fast Company magazine's list of 2021 Most Innovative Companies, is seeking to hire a Specialty Development Executive to help identify and shape opportunities for our continued growth across our Specialty Medicine segment.  This is a unique opportunity to join the Esoteric Business team of a leading global life sciences company that advances patient health and powers clear, confident decisions through its diagnostics and drug development offerings. We developed 100 new tests in 2020 with the same output of first in class, best in class diagnostics planned for 2021.  As a Specialty Development Executive, you will function as an outside sales representative primarily focused on growing and retaining business in the defined, assigned territory, within the specialty segments namely Ambulatory Surgery Centers, Dermatology, Endocrinology, Gastroenterology, Infectious Disease, Medical Drug Monitoring, Neurology, Rheumatology, and Urology.  We are seeking a competitive and collaborative individual with a high degree of communication and business acumen skills who enjoys growing and working with a seasoned, high performing team across a wide variety of high growth therapeutic areas including cancer, Alzheimer's disease, autoimmune disorders, kidney and liver diseases, diabetes, and other conditions.  Essential duties & responsibilities: Maintain and organize an annual book of business, while meeting and exceeding sales growth goals in the assigned territory. Achieve long and short-term sales objectives by providing specialty solutions Serve as a subject matter expert and champion of our expansive list of testing solutions for customers and prospective clients. Create effective customer relationships. Make in person visits to clients on a regular basis to provide ongoing customer support, education on focus products and market updates for current customer base using sales analytics and insights Act as a liaison between the client and us. Collaborate, communicate and actively contribute to new business opportunities with our Clinical Sales counterparts Keep current with the competition's products, service offerings and activity Stay updated of new products, clinical guidelines, new developments in the industry & research trends Use market data, sales analytics and insights to make sales decisions and spot new business opportunities. Provide updates to senior leadership on key strategic initiatives and new business opportunities Establish and maintain effective working relationships with all company support departments internally. Effectively manage travel logistics to maximize sales productivity Attend local and national professional trade shows and events as requested Update all relevant customer account information into CRM Data Management Systems  Requirements: Bachelor's degree is preferred Previous sales experience or account management is required; preferably 3 years A strong degree of comfort in both inpatient and outpatient settings Experience with a wide range of hospitals and hospital systems- DOD, academic, urban, rural, VA, etc. (preferably within the given market) highly preferred Successful experience in the AP or clinical specialties space preferred Strong technical competency and business acumen capabilities
jobFunction: Sales, Business Development, and Customer Service

jobTitle: Division Sales Manager (IL, WI, MN, IA, MO, NE)
description: We're proud to say Oliver Winery has been recognized by the Indiana Chamber of Commerce as a Gold COVID Stops Here workplace for achieving a 90% vaccination rate. #covidstopshere  Oliver Winery, the 29th ranked winery in the US, is seeking a Division Sales Manager to represent the winery in Illinois, Wisconsin, Minnesota, Iowa, Missouri, and Nebraska. Our high-quality wines and innovative approach to winemaking continues to attract new fans across the country. As our company continues to grow nationally, the Division Sales Manager will be responsible for the successful implementation of strategic sales for the Oliver Winery portfolio through wholesale distributors in their territory. The ideal candidate will live in Northern Indiana or Northern Illinois and will be able to maintain a flexible travel schedule.  JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:  Planning and Management: Masters knowledge of Oliver Winery products, brand standards, expectations, as well as knowledge of competitive products within territory. Develops understanding of seasonal and programming plans undertaken to meet goals. Master distributor and Winery reporting systems for sales/depletions, state spending, and planning activities. With support of supervisor, participates in building market plans to achieve brand goals and meet company's financial objectives. Participates in regular business reviews with regional chain accounts and wholesalers to evaluate distribution, sales, and program status. Learns to identify market gap opportunities for improvement and implement corrective actions. Develops distributor relationships to gain appropriate share of mind. Learns organization structures and decision-making chains of command for distributor locations within territory. Analyzes promotional budget spending and manages to plan. Evaluates programming results in order to improve future programming. With supervisor, evaluates accruals and year end projections.  Selling and Sales Plan Execution: Masters skillset for productive market visits and work withs, including evaluation of retailer landscape, pertinent geographies/population centers, distributor locations, and state laws within territories. Also exhibits collaborative and additive salesmanship skills to contribute to Winery/distributor partnership. Implements market-level plans, including new product launches, promotions (distribution and displays), and shelf/merchandising standards in market, to achieve brand goals and meet company's financial objectives. Supports distributors within territory - participates in work withs, general sales meetings, training sessions, and trade shows. Implements market specific pricing and promotions (distribution, displays, and new products), tracks progress, and communicates results. Manages distributor's inventory vs sales. Manages execution of POS materials to plan. Develops relationships with key accounts, regional chains and independent buying groups with and through distributor sales personnel to expand distribution and develop new sales opportunities. Manages the implementation of shelf schematics and merchandising of products according to company brand standards. Monitors and reports competitive activity. Devises plans with supervisor to respond to this activity. Supports local and out-of-state tasting events in effort to enhance Oliver's brand awareness.  Investigates and resolves service issues.  Communication and Administration: Reports market activities, accomplishments, and opportunities to management. Maintains accurate records regarding distributor contacts, organizational structure and competitive brand alignments. Communicates effectively and constructively with wholesalers in order to maximize performance to plan. Progressively masters presentation building skills for effective sales meetings with distributors and retailers. Masters the preparation of pricing, business, and market reviews in order to maximize impact with our brands in your territory. Completes business plans, market re-caps, competitive pricing reports monthly.   Additional duties, as assigned by Management.   QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor's degree. 5-7 years' experience on the supplier and distribution side of alcoholic beverage sales industry. Experience with Microsoft Office Suite. Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal skills. Public speaking and customer service experience. Leadership in providing guidance for distributor staff and volunteers.  Professional demeanor and situational awareness. A strong interest in wine and winemaking. Due to the nature of our business, must be at least 21 years of age.  SUCCESS FACTORS/JOB COMPETENCIES: Ability to maintain a flexible travel schedule. Resourceful when the environment, people, and supplies are anomalous. Communicates and works with customers and employees at all levels (Oliver executives and those from outside companies, fellow managers, customers, and part time event staff). Accepts direction, has a willingness to be coached, and constructive criticism from others. Seeks new knowledge and experiences to enhance value as an Oliver Winery employee. Interacts well with customers and vendors, as well as fellow employees and winery managers. Knowledge of and appreciation for wine. Takes ownership of responsibilities, including meeting deadlines for reports & filings. Ability to communicate in a persuasive and constructive manner that leads to positive change.  Members of our Sales team also possess the ability to: Effectively engage customers, vendors, and distributors to build strong relationships. Actively seek out and apply knowledge of beverage industry to further the Oliver Winery brand. Execute assigned tasks at a high level, with attention to detail and thoughtful prioritization of effort. Make responsible business and financial decisions, operating within the context of sales plan and budget parameters.  In addition, all successful winery employees are able to: Use your attitude and effort to contribute to a positive work environment.  Be thoughtfully engaged and do your best work. Every day. Model the winery values: Respect People, Expect Quality, Think Differently, Get Stuff Done.  PHYSICAL DEMANDS/WORK ENVIRONMENT: The Division Sales Manager position requires the ability to stand, walk, lift and bend for up to 8 hours a day. It may also require the ability to lift and carry up to 40 pounds as well as the ability to sit and work at a computer for up to 8 hours a day. There may be visual or ergonomic strain due to computer use. It also requires extended periods of concentration and focus.  Typical Schedule: Position is full-time with benefits. Schedule is primarily Monday-Friday. Travel, evening work, and some occasional weekend work will be required.  Core Values of Oliver Winery: Respect People. Respect others in your interactions with fellow staff, customers, suppliers, and all you meet in conducting winery business. Listen as much as you talk. Be respectful, friendly, and dependable. Expect Quality. Quality matters. Expect the best from yourself and fellow staff. Do your job with pride and attention to detail. Think Differently. Be curious and creative. Seek out ways to improve our products, our brand, our service, and our facility. Get Stuff Done. Make smart decisions and deliver results. See solutions, not roadblocks. Execute great ideas with urgency.  Employee Benefits & Perks: Comprehensive health, vision, dental, and supplemental benefit packages. Generous PTO and Paid Holidays. Employer 401(k) matching program of up to 6% of annual compensation. Paid training and meetings. Opportunities for professional development. Access to our award-winning Live Well wellness program featuring fitness reimbursements, charitable giving matches, and education on topics including financial health, physical wellbeing, and more. Generous employee discount on wine, food and merchandise.  We strongly encourage uploading a Cover Letter/Letter of Interest with your resume.  For more information about working at Oliver Winery, check us out on Glassdoor! This document is confidential and contains proprietary information and intellectual property of Oliver Winery, Inc. Disclosure, copying, distribution or use of this document and the information contained therein is strictly prohibited.  © 2021 OLIVER WINERY & VINEYARDS, BLOOMINGTON, IN 47404 | OLIVER IS A REGISTERED TRADEMARK OF OLIVER WINE COMPANY, INC.

jobTitle: Partner Manager, Mid-Market Sales - Key Accounts
description: About Pinterest  Millions of people across the world come to Pinterest to find new ideas every day. It’s where they get inspiration, dream about new possibilities and plan for what matters most. Our mission is to help those people find their inspiration and create a life they love. In your role, you’ll be challenged to take on work that upholds this mission and pushes Pinterest forward. You’ll grow as a person and leader in your field, all the while helping Pinners make their lives better in the positive corner of the internet.  Great brands help make those inspirations a reality and we’re looking for a self-driven Partner Manager to help our most strategic partners, successfully grow their business through Pinterest. You'll collaborate on major initiatives and see them through to success, while being the primary contact for our partners at the highest level.  What You’ll Do Retain, grow and diversify the value delivered to our fastest-growing partners, ultimately growing Pinterest revenue as a result Advocate internally for the solutions required to drive business outcomes for these advertisers, working across internal teams such as Measurement & Insights, Product Marketing, Creative Strategy, etc. Gain a deep understanding of our partners’ business goals and turn data into compelling stories and actionable insights to help them succeed Track, analyze, and communicate key quantitative metrics and business trends internally and to partners Specifically own the “why” Pinterest conversation with advertisers to influence the way they think about the platform’s role in their overarching media mix What We’re Looking For 8+ years of experience in marketing/advertising/digital, with specific acumen across search, data and measurement Established industry relationships and experience working with executive level business and marketing leaders within client organizations Proven track record of exceeding revenue goals Ability to translate partner value across various levels, such as executive, operational, creative, media, and analytics teams Strong team player and ability to succeed in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment while maintaining high levels of operational rigor, digital acumen, and business excellence
industries: Internet, Computer Software, and Information Technology and Services

description: Company Description  Square builds common business tools in unconventional ways so more people can start, run, and grow their businesses. When Square started, it was difficult and expensive (or just plain impossible) for some businesses to take credit cards. Square made credit card payments possible for all by turning a mobile phone into a credit card reader. Since then Square has been building an entire business toolkit of both hardware and software products including Square Capital, Square Terminal, Square Payroll, and more. We’re working to find new and better ways to help businesses succeed on their own terms—and we’re looking for people like you to help shape tomorrow at Square.  Job Description  Square is looking for a data-driven person with experience launching and scaling Sales teams in new markets to join our Sales Go-to-Market (GTM) Strategy team. Square's Sales team are master storytellers that promote revenue growth for Square by understanding our sellers' needs and onboarding them onto our outstanding ecosystem to grow their businesses. Sales GTM Strategy determines how we go to market and looks for growth levers for our business.  You will build the strategy for Sales teams in new markets and work with other teams to set new Sales teams up for success by defining new lead sources, conducting analysis on our customer profile, and building tracking and reporting on important metrics. You will also help identify opportunities for growth with product teams and develop an optimized team structure. You are comfortable with experimentation to ensure the team is iterating and achieving our goals. You will be in a role that is a hybrid of traditional jobs in analytics, strategy and planning, project management, and financial analysis. You will report to the Sales GTM Strategy lead and partner with senior sales leadership and other teams to identify opportunities and promote growth.  You Will Also Develop a strategy for launching and scaling Sales teams in new markets Analyze data and find insights to guide strategic decisions and enhance Sales' ability to go-to-market, such as new market launches, customer segmentation definition, and lead generation programs Independently identify growth opportunities, lead discussions to advocate for resourcing the project, lead the project, and implement tracking infrastructure and visualization to report on results Manage relationships with Partnerships, Product, Marketing, Finance, Data Science, and more to promote Sales growth and profitability Direct data analysts to create reporting and sources of truth You Have  Qualifications 5+ years of strong analytical and problem-solving experience (top-tier management consulting, corporate strategy, sales/business operations, GTM strategy, or similar) Experience launching GTM teams (Sales preferred) or products in new markets Experience working with and motivating teams in a growing environment You have excellent written and verbal communication skills, proven ability to communicate and manage relationships with senior executives, and can work effectively with all levels You are an entrepreneurial, strategic thinker and are excited to dive into tough problems and build new processes / deliverables from scratch; you develop frameworks to support strategic decisions and are accomplished at detailed execution Highly quantitative with demonstrated ability conducting complex data analysis to build actionable insights through a combination of SQL (strong proficiency preferred), Excel/Google Sheets (can perform complex functions), and Looker (or similar data visualization tool) Additional Information  We’re working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace. Square is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.  We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible.  Additionally, we consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment on our team, and always assess candidates on an individualized basis.  Perks  We want you to be well and thrive. Our global benefits package includes: Healthcare coverage Retirement Plans Employee Stock Purchase Program Wellness perks Paid parental leave Paid time off Learning and Development resources Square, Inc. (NYSE: SQ) builds tools to empower businesses and individuals to participate in the economy. Sellers use Square to reach buyers online and in person, manage their business, and access financing. Individuals use Cash App to spend, send, store, and invest money. And TIDAL is a global music and entertainment platform that expands Square's purpose of economic empowerment to artists. Square, Inc. has offices in the United States, Canada, Japan, Australia, Ireland, Spain, Norway, and the UK.

description: Company Overview:  H2O.ai is the open-source leader in AI with a mission to democratize AI for everyone. H2O.ai is transforming the use of AI with software with its category-creating visionary open-source machine learning platform, H2O. More than 18,000 companies use open- source H2O in mission-critical use cases for Finance, Insurance, Healthcare, Retail, Telco, Sales and Marketing. H2O Driverless AI uses "AI to do AI" in order to provide an easier, faster and cost-effective means of implementing data science.  H2O.ai partners with leading technology companies such as NVIDIA, IBM, AWS, Intel, Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud Platform and is proud of its growing customer base which includes Capital One, Progressive Insurance, Comcast, Walgreens and MarketAxess. For more information and to learn more about how H2O.ai is driving an AI Transformation, visit www.h2o.ai.  Job Summary:  Are you a top performer at your current or previous company? H2O.ai is looking for exceptional candidates join our Federal BDR team. As an H2O.ai Business Development Representative you will be finding, engaging, and qualifying prospects to drive continued sales growth. We invest heavily in our BDRs and CAEs so we can promote them into more senior roles.   Responsibilities and Duties:  As a Federal -Business Development Representative, you will work closely with H2O.ai Sales & Marketing Teams to:  Professionally and persistently follow up with inbound leads and outbound cold calls, emails, and LinkedIn  Identify target prospects and perform analysis through a variety of online research methods  Set up introductory calls with target influencers and decision makers; your job is to make sure a majority of these calls become qualified opportunities for our Account Executives  Develop creative tactics and strategies to reach prospects  Understand the latest industry trends  Dedication to continuous learning  Record and track activity in Salesforce.com    Qualifications and Skills:  Proven industry-related inside sales experience   Previous experience in cold calling sales pitches and prospect research  Track record of over-achieving quota  must be experienced in making a minimum of 50 calls per day  Experience working with Zoom, Salesforce.com, Outreach.io, ZoomInfo or similar tools  Excellent verbal and written communications skills  Strong listening and presentation skills  Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively  Comfortable with ambiguity  Fluent in Spanish and Portuguese  BA/BS degree or equivalent Benefits/Perks:   Flexible work hours and time off.  Competitive salary with uncapped commission and accelerators above quota  Medical, dental, vision  401k Retirement

jobTitle: Manager of Sales Development North America
description: Manager of Sales Development North America  Location: Boston or across the East Coast  Opus are working with a super-hot cyber security client who are experiencing explosive growth and with $100M+ in funding, they are investing heavily in expanding their SDR team across North America.  As such they are looking for a Manager of Sales Development to help them scale their team and play an integral part in helping take their success to the next level.  This is a key strategic position for the company and in this role you will have responsibility for ongoing hiring, mentoring and development of the SDRs across North America. It is truly an excellent opportunity to work with one of their top performing teams and help shape the future of the company!   Responsibilities:  Responsible for the ongoing managing, hiring, mentoring and development of SDR & BDRs across North America & help scale them out further! Consistently achieve qualified opportunity quotas, as set for the entire team, to ensure territory revenue. Create policies methodologies and work processes for the team. Ultimately, help build a world-class SDR team!   Essentials:   ·        Circa 1-3 years sales experience in a similar SDR management role ·        Experience in cyber security/SaaS/B2B ·        Consistent track record of 100% + quota achievement as an SDR manager ·        Proven track record of managing and scaling an SDR team  Why should you be interested?  Highly unique and exciting opportunity to work with one of the fastest growing cyber security start-ups in the world and really build something! Unrivalled progression and earning potential Heavily invested - they have raised over $100M in funding which is fuelling their huge expansion YoY success - Over the past three years, they have seen the numbers of enterprise customers and their revenue experience explosive revenue growth! They also have top tier investors who are backing a soon to be Cyber Security Unicorn!  If you are looking to join a HYPER GROWTH cyber security start up and enhance your career, this is the role for you! These opportunities do not come about every day so please get in touch ASAP!  sam.channon@opusrs.com/ +44(0)161 249 7244.

description: Description  Amazon Care is looking for a Senior Leader to manage an exciting and rapidly growing team of Account Managers responsible for all aspects of Employer or Insurance Carrier Benefit lifecycle management for existing customers. The role is responsible for but not limited to: 1/ building and growing relationships with benefit buyers 2/ developing joint account plans 3/ creating execution plans to exceed customer KPIs 4/ conducting regular business reviews 5/ capturing voice of the customer to drive continuous improvement and 6/ managing the operating rhythm of the business to meet and exceed results. We are an entrepreneurial team of doers that work passionately to apply cutting-edge advances in technology, solve real-world problems to create a frictionless healthcare experience. The ideal candidate has the ability to build and convey compelling value for the benefit buyer at large organizations. You should be a self-starter with demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically about business, product, and technical challenges. You are a player-coach who is not afraid to ‘get hands dirty’. Above all, you will care deeply about the customer and delight in creating simple and elegant solutions that solve our customers’ biggest challenges.  Amazon Care is reimagining healthcare and building it around employee and employer needs to make healthcare easy and accessible for all. Amazon Care is Amazon’s virtual-first primary and urgent care service that helps people get quality medical advice and medical care whenever it is needed.  About Us  Inclusive Team Culture  Here at Amazon, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.  Work/Life Balance  Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.  Mentorship & Career Growth  Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign opportunities based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded contributor.  Responsibilities Include Recruit, Hire and Retain top-talent Account Managers with bar raising Customer Obsession skills Develop and manage relationships by engaging with customers and their business partners Accelerate customer adoption and customer satisfaction Develop and execute against a set of activity and sales goals with a passion to take on challenges Provide feedback from benefit buyers and other enterprise customers about customer expectations and product needs Collaborate with leadership to develop and execute strategic plans for your assigned geography Build long-lasting professional relationships with employee benefit buyers.  Basic Qualifications 12+ years of professional experience as the account and relationship manager of a large enterprise business customer or insurance carrier 7+ years experience in direct people management responsible for achieving successful outcomes for multiple customers and driving best-in-class customer satisfaction 7+ years experience in large, complex customer negotiations with a successful track record for multi-year renewal and retention BA/BS degree or equivalent experience Preferred Qualifications Completed MBA or advanced Business Degree Experience in B2B2C business models; background and/or familiarity with D2C marketing a plus Thrives in early-stage, start-up environments Energized by being an industry pioneer and innovator Experience coaching teams for engaging, presenting, negotiating and executing enrollment activation campaigns System and analytics skills include: 1/ Microsoft Excel for business cases analyses 2/ SFDC for customer opportunity management and account planning and 3/ Collaboration hardware and software for virtual customer-facing meetings Strong business writing and verbal presentation skills including story telling in both formats Strong analytic skills to assemble and interpret customer activity data and total cost of care Ability to lead teams within a fast-paced, dynamic and multi-task driven environment Strong partnership and collaboration skills with internal (marketing, legal) and external (agency, broker) partners Professional traits that are not unique to this position, but necessary for Amazon leaders: Exhibits excellent business judgment Mentors and develops sales team members to exceed customer expectations Sets the bar for high team standards Thinks strategically, but stays on top of tactical execution Drives innovation for their team and broader organization Thinks big and has convictions Is action and results-oriented and self-reliant Is analytical and structured Works backwards from customer KPIs and outcomes Has the innate ability to inspire passion in others Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, visit US Disability Accommodations.   Company - Amazon.com Services LLC  Job ID: A1748349
