description: Account Executive Remote (UTC -6) #LI-Remote  Why join us? The companies that win today are those that put an understanding of their customers and prospects at the heart of their organisation; the investment in a central data team is an essential part of this journey. COVID-19 and the global switch-off of the in-person economy is accelerating these trends: interacting with and understanding your customers online is key to surviving and thriving in the new environment.  At Snowplow we are focused on powering the data journey that these central data teams are embarking on. To win in the new world, it’s essential that the data team can focus on the journey to value and mastery, and not get derailed by costly data delivery issues or burdensome organizational complexity. Snowplow helps data teams to do this, offering a data delivery platform that collects and operationalizes behavioural data, at scale.  It’s an exciting time here at Snowplow. We are actively selling in 14 countries with hundreds of customers and thousands of open-source users; Snowplow is well placed to weather the ongoing economic storm, having recently closed its Series A fundraising with MMC Ventures. The Snowplow team is delighted to announce that Gartner has recognised us as a cool vendor in Marketing and Data Analytics 2020.  The opportunity: We are seeking experienced SaaS Account Executives that take a consultative, conversational, and diagnostic approach to the sales process. The ideal candidate would be described as a Data, Analytics and Business Intelligence enthusiast with a strong understanding of and/or curiosity about the importance of leveraging data to make critical business decisions. If you are naturally curious, have a technical aptitude or possess a desire to get deeper into the technical side of the sales process, we would love to hear from you.  The environment you’ll be working in: Our company values are Transparency, Honesty, Ownership, Inclusivity, Empowerment, Customer-centricity, Growth and Technical Excellence. These aren’t just words we plucked out of thin air, we came up with them together as a company and are continually looking to find new ways to weave these into our day to day operations. From flexible hours and working locations to the way we give feedback, we’re passionate about building a company that supports both company and individual development.  What you will be doing: Generating, managing and forecasting an end-to-end sales pipelines Running the entire sales process, including web-based product demonstrations, account management, generating quotes, negotiating contracts and closing business Presenting our products to senior executives and technical data engineers in client meetings Navigating and closing out complex sales cycles with a broad range of prospective customers Be able to anticipate, manage and influence prospect objections Ensure high level of responsiveness with prospects throughout the sales process Proactively source new leads and new business opportunities, with the support of an SDR and the marketing function Build strong relationships - centered around challenging your key stakeholders - across all levels in an account Working closely with our Sales Development and Marketing teams to improve our sales process from lead sourcing to deal negotiation As an early member of the sales team you will have a unique chance to contribute to the development and growth of the team This is a quota-carrying sales position that is critical to the overall success of Snowplow  What you bring to the team: 2+ years minimum experience in a SaaS, quota-carrying sales role, ideally in data, analytics or business intelligence Consistent track record of meeting and exceeding targets Excited to not only be a sales executive but to significantly contribute to the development of the team Driven to excel in a fast-paced, autonomous and fun startup environment Passionate about data and how customers can get value out of it Ability to demonstrate a technical product and articulate how customers can achieve value Ability to convey technical principles in an easy way, and challenge customers on technical and business priorities Excellent written and verbal communication skills An understanding of the marketing technology industry and key players A history of running the complete sales cycle from qualification to close (this is not an ‘inside support’ role) A natural curiosity about data and the value it brings to business decision-making   What you’ll get in return for being awesome: A competitive package, including share options 25 days of holiday a year (plus public holidays) Freedom to work from wherever suits you best Cycle to work scheme Two fantastic company Away Weeks in a different European city each year (or when this isn’t possible, we have “Stay Away Weeks”) Mental health support including therapy sessions Work alongside a supportive and talented team with the opportunity to work on cutting edge technology and challenging problems Grow and develop in a fast-moving, collaborative organisation MacBook Pro Convenient location in central London for those who want to work there Continuous supply of Pact coffee and healthy snacks in the office when you’re here!  Snowplow is dedicated to building and supporting a brilliant, diverse and hugely inclusive team. We don't discriminate against gender, race, religion or belief, disability, age, marital status or sexual orientation. Whatever your background may be, we welcome anyone with talent, drive and emotional intelligence.

jobTitle: Regional Sales Manager, North East Territories, Swiss Dermatology Company
description: An established, stable, rapidly growing medical device company seeks District Sales Managers to lead the expansion and build out of our prescription portfolio in territories across the US. This person will grow and direct a Regional sales team that promotes prescription wound care products in women's health, oncology supportive care, wound care, and to surgical specialists. Due to the success of the products, the company is expanding its sales teams and needs experienced pharmaceutical sales management professionals to play a central role in taking the organization to the next level. These individuals will report to the head of National Sales Manager.  The company has a tremendous amount of clinical credibility and an extensive line of popular, science-based products that are directly prescribed or dispensed by doctors to their patients.  This firm is uniquely positioned for rapid growth and needs leaders that will be an ambassador internally and externally and represent the ethos and core values of the brand.  North East Territories include but are not limited to - Maine Boston Connecticut Long Island NYC UES NYC DT Detroit Cleveland Pittsburgh Columbus Cincinnati Buffalo New Jersey  Position Description (Brief Overview) Execute the regional Sales Strategy, drive corporate objectives and revenue growth Provide strong leadership for the regional sales function, set clear and unified direction for the team Expand the sales team: manage, stretch, and develop into top performing team Achieve revenue, profit, organizational, and strategic goals and objectives Enhance sales pipeline system: reporting, forecasting, performance: from lead generation to close Build relationships with Key Opinion Leaders, and Hospital Systems to deliver excellent service Establish and maintain top level contact with organization’s important internal stakeholders Oversee both Inside and Field-Based sales teams Develop annual sales business plans to drive revenue and increase market penetration Accurately forecast monthly, quarterly, and annual sales achievements Travel as necessary to visit sales team, major accounts, attend trade shows and key events Note: This is a heavy travel role; this person will be a “Field General”  Requirements  Qualifications/Requirements (Brief Overview) 10+ years sales management experience; extensive background working with prescription devices or drugs Successful experience building high performing teams of sales professional Existing relationships in women's health, oncology supportive care, medical aesthetics, and wound care, is desired Acute understanding of the competitor landscape Excellent commercial instincts, strong financial acumen and analytical skills, attention to detail Computer skills: CRM, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook Bachelor’s degree, (or industry experience in lieu of degree), Master’s degree a plus  Benefits  Key Points Industry/Product Category: women's health, oncology, wound care, dermatology, surgical Title: Regional Sales Manager Call Points: OBGyn's, Radiation Oncologists, Infusion Specialists, Surgeons*, Wound Care Specialists Scope: Regional responsibility may include inside Sales and Field-Based Sales Location: New York Compensation: Competitive with high commission aligned to performance, MBO's, and KPI's Fulltime, W2 position, benefits  The company have a range of highly marketable products and the resources to execute a successful expansion. This opportunity will see the successful candidate gain a role where they shall be part of an exciting growth story.
industries: Medical Devices, Hospital & Health Care, and Pharmaceuticals

description: New York and Upper Pennsylvania Territory.  SUMMARY: Working with a regional team, the Territory Sales Manager is responsible for growing our pet food brands and brand awareness throughout the region. Successful team player, growth within established account base and developing accounts within territory. Central location (Syracuse, NY, Rochester, NY or Binghamton, NY) preferred. Approximately 50-60% overnight travel.  Competitive salary and commissions; medical, dental, vision; 401k with company match; vacation and holidays; travel/equipment/expenses paid.  KEY PERFORMANCE MEASURES Meet and exceed sales goals and objectives Offer great support to our retailers and customers Develop and execute innovative/creative strategies Professional representation of our company and brands Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities Effective selling skills, pet food sales experience preferred Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, effective presentation skills Positive attitude and team player Computer/mobile technology proficient Valid driver’s license, presentable transportation and insurance Nunn Milling Company, an affiliated company to Midwestern Pet Foods, Inc., was founded in 1926 in Evansville, Indiana, as a miller of flour and corn meal. In the 1940s the company began using the basic ingredients from its milling operations to produce dog and cat food. As a result of increasing sales of the pet food, Midwestern Pet Foods, Inc. was founded in 1982. Today, Midwestern Pet Foods, Inc. owns and operates four state-of-the-art, high capacity dry pet food production and packing facilities. Company headquarters is located in Evansville, Indiana, with plants in Monmouth, Illinois, Chickasha, Oklahoma and Waverly, New York. Midwestern Pet Foods, Inc. employs approximately 320 employees. Nunn Milling has a facility in Evansville as well and employees about 10 employees.
industries: Food & Beverages, Food Production, and Consumer Goods

description: Sony Electronics, Inc. look for the risk-takers, the collaborators, the inspired and the inspirational. We want the people who are brave enough to work at the cutting edge and create solutions that will enrich and improve the lives of people across the globe. So, if you want to make the world say wow, let's talk.  Regional Sales Supervisor – Kentucky  Description  Sony's Purpose is simple. We aim to fill the world with emotion, through the power of creativity and technology. We want to be responsible for getting hearts racing, stirring ambition, and putting a smile on the faces of our customers. That challenge, combined with our spirit of innovation, motivated us to create groundbreaking technology, entertainment, and services for people worldwide.  Our history as a global brand had been built around employees that all have a passion for touching peoples' lives, and pride in pushing beyond that status quo to produce truly extraordinary results.  Sony Electronics has an exciting full time opportunity for a Brand Representative. If you love entertainment technology, have great retail experience and love to talk to a wide variety of audiences, then we want to hear from you! This role will focus on locations in and around the state of Kentucky  We are seeking a highly skilled professional capable of creating a positive environment for Sony products at retail. You are someone who can build rapport with different audiences and create Sony advocacy first and foremost. You are also someone that maximizes product sales by supporting a group of retail locations with interactive installations/maintenance, product education, display installation/maintenance, and data collection as well as others as needed. You love training and educating both associates and customers. You love entertainment technology, and bringing the Sony Experience to your community.  The ideal candidate will live within or near Louisville, KY  Responsibilities Developing and maintaining beneficial retail relationships. Creating and maintaining in-store advocacy for the brand. Analyzing daily/weekly sales data to plan and execute sales improvements. Educating store personnel on Sony and how to sell the Sony product line effectively. Coach and support vendor provided and third party in-store labor. Supporting retail sales through creative merchandising presentation, visual displays and in store promotions, including Point of Purchase (POP) materials. Monitoring product inventory and ensuring product is placed on the selling floor. Resetting, maintaining and installing different product displays and interactive display kiosks. Conducting consumer demonstration and directly assisting consumers as needed by answering their questions and providing solutions. Gathering, summarizing, and reporting on field and channel feedback and insights Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in a related field Proven and successful track record in sales, retail, or merchandising environment Previous experience supervising/managing a team is preferred Willingness to learn new and exciting features and technologies and the ability to simplify and teach a message to others including consumers Must be able to work weekends/nights for launch events, sales events and training events. This may include events such as CES, CEDIA, etc. and may also include training events outside store hours. Visual merchandising experience a plus Sales focused with the ability to influence others to execute your strategies Excellent communication and interpersonal skills needed with the ability to build strong collaborative relationships and engage with all levels of store and market personnel Strong decision making skills with the ability to solve problems creatively, effectively, efficiently and at times individually Willingness to take ownership in your business and learn, plan, or implement what is required to succeed Must live in a central location within the territory Able to lift 25+ lbs. Strong communication skills, both written and oral. Strong Microsoft Office skills, especially in Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook Sony Electronics is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values employees with a broad cross-cultural perspective. We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond. All applicants will receive fair and impartial treatment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, legally protected physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, status in the U.S. uniformed services, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information or on any other basis which is protected under applicable federal, state or local law.  Disability Accommodation for Applicants to Sony Electronics, Inc.  Sony Electronics, Inc. provides reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in job application procedures. For reasonable accommodation requests, please contact us by email at talenthelp@am.sony.com , or you can mail your resume to: Sony Electronics, Human Resources Department, 16535 Via Esprillo, San Diego CA 92127. Please indicate the position you are applying for.  EEO is the Law  EEO is the Law Supplement  Right to Work (English/Spanish)  E-Verify Participation (English/Spanish)

Company Description  Join the movement!  Pharmacann Inc., one of the nation’s leading cannabis companies, is changing the way people view cannabis. Be a part of the team shaping the future of this booming industry, where our people, our reputation and our standards matter. With a strong foundation and dynamic growth plan, opportunities to join our team abound in this fast-paced environment. Are you ready to join the movement?  We’re grounded and growing. Based in Chicago, Pharmacann Inc. operates and production facilities across multiple states including New York, Illinois, Massachusetts, Maryland, Ohio and Pennsylvania with licensing secured in the Midwest and on the east coast. For more information about our company, please visit pharmacann.com.  Job Description  We’re changing lives, and we’re seeking a dynamic sales manager to help us continue our rapid growth in one of the fastest growing industries. This role is responsible for driving new sales and meeting revenue targets through acquiring new accounts account management and providing sales metrics and reporting for the NY region. This is an incredible growth opportunity within the medical cannabis industry as a key member of our wholesale team selling PharmaCannis products to dispensaries throughout NY.  Duties And Responsibilities Or (Essential Functions) Manages and directs all sales efforts for wholesale accounts throughout the state. Conducts sales calls and selling efforts for wholesale accounts Develops and nurtures new accounts and key customer relationships Creates and organizes promotional events, updates sales menus and product availability databases, and executes customer orders With the marketing team, develops promotional plans, campaigns, and educational initiatives to attract the interest of and capture new customers Prepares and presents sales reports to track leads and executes follow up Stays abreast of industry, customer, and competitive trends Maintains regular communication with customers to understand their needs Builds a strong base of industry expertise Qualifications  Qualified candidates must exhibit a commitment to success and possess: A strong sales track record in driving revenue, achieving growth and building customer relationships Excellent organizational, communication, and problem-solving skills Ability to recognize and respond to changing trends and priorities Ability to work in and foster a collaborative team environment Experience with Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Word Required Experience College degree in related field At least 10 years of professional sales experience with at least 5 in a B2B sales channel Knowledge of cannabis industry helpful, but not required Ability to coordinate multiple projects and meet deadlines Ability to travel within the State regularly Successful candidates will be results oriented, driven, detail‐oriented, enthusiastic, organized and possess excellent communication skills Additional Information  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.  PharmaCann, LLC provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age disability or genetics. We value diversity, military service, and law enforcement experience. Compensation is competitive and will be commensurate with experience. Benefits are available.

description: Careers that Change Lives  The Account Manager is responsible for supporting the overall sales goals by driving ENB™ procedure utilization within new and existing accounts and sales of the superDimension™ Navigation System within the assigned territory.  A Day in the Life  Promote and sell the entire ILS portfolio of products within a defined geography Increase ENB™ procedure utilization through physician and hospital awareness meetings and programs. Sell superDimension™ Navigation Systems to new accounts within the territory Manage existing accounts and launch new hospitals with the superDimension™ Navigation System Provide procedure support to physicians, staff and supporting departments Execute Implementation Plan in new accounts, setting expectations with customers and supporting a multidisciplinary approach and lung nodule programs Collaborate with the regional manager, market development executives and clinical education specialists Deliver and support on-site and home office educational events for ph ysicians and staff Expand ILS product usage by selling system disposables (procedure kits, biopsy tools, fiducial markers, patient surfaces, etc.). Organize and execute procedural and business review meetings with hospital administration, physicians and department directors Analyze market data to identify opportunities and share with customers; discuss issues and identify action plans Sell service, extended warranties, system upgrades and second systems. Strengthen presence of superDimension™ ENB within the hospital and defend against competitive threats Manage territory travel and expense budget Effectively build a territory business plan which incorporates detailed assessment of all current and potential accounts, identifying and executing on areas of opportunity Collaborate with colleagues from other COTs to leverage relationships and drive cross-portfolio sales. Meet and exceed assigned sales quotas and objectives in all categories DEPARTMENT SPECIFIC/NON-ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:  Utilize technology and data to analyze territory, effectively target accounts and pre-call planning Maintain knowledge of the current industry / competitive landscape, healthcare economics, reimbursement, competitors and competitive products etc. Interact with Education, Product Marketing, Market Development, Customer Service, and other internal departments Resolve customer complaints in accordance with Company policy, and advises sales management promptly of any situation beyond the Sales Representative’s ability to resolve Remain current with all vendor credentialing requirements which include immunizations and hospital protocol certification Must Have: Minimum Requirements Bachelors degree required 3 year of field sales experience required with an introductory knowledge of company products and services Nice to Have  3 years of documented outside sales success in a competitive, sophisticated environment, preferably tangible products Previous medical sales job (significant procedural experience, preferably technical in nature and operating room environment) Evidence of top sales achievement with experience in multilevel account management. Excellent written, verbal skills; proficient with Windows Office Products Ability to develop and present complex business reviews/presentations Strong organizational skills About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.  Physical Job Requirements  The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. For Office Roles: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer, and communicate with peers and co-workers. Contact your manager or local HR to understand the Work Conditions and Physical requirements that may be specific to each role. (ADA-United States of America)  Additional Information Posting Date: Sep 23, 2021 Travel: No

description: Description  WOW BAO is hiring an ACCOUNT MANAGER for our team in Chicago!  At least three years of experience as an ACCOUNT MANAGER or similar relevant position required.  Innovative. Fast Pace. Growth.  Join the fastest growing Asian virtual kitchen concept in the US! Our virtual kitchen concept has launched 250+ locations in a year and on track to double in the size of the business in the next 4 months! As an account manager, you will be one of the first 5 account managers reporting directly to the Vice President of Dark Kitchens. This is a great opportunity to work with a small impactful team and an opportunity to 'own' multiple business critical projects. You will be working directly with leadership across the company to drive forward initiatives and grow sales for your book of business. Equal Opportunity Employer  Position Summary:  Dark kitchen facilities, sometimes also called ghost kitchens, are locations in which food is prepared expressly for off-premise consumption – without a dine-in component. Wow Bao has taken this concept a step further by partnering with food service and restaurant operators across the country to serve up and offer Wow Bao’s curated “greatest hits” menu specifically for delivery service, all while leveraging their existing kitchen equipment and manpower. The Account Manager will fill a key position as the liaison / main point of contact between Wow Bao and a number of dark kitchen restaurant operators.  Requirements  The Account Manager will be responsible for onboarding dark kitchen locations on the Wow Bao platform. This requires, and is not limited to, coordinating operations, supply chain, marketing, and training between Wow Bao and all new dark kitchen accounts and managing opening checklists towards go-live dates The Account Manager will be responsible for the ongoing success of their designated accounts. In this capacity, the Account Manager is expected to monitor and drive certain key performance metrics (e.g., weekly sales) at the account and unit-level and maintain a continuous line of communication with each dark kitchen account regarding sales performance, marketing strategies, inventory levels, additional training requirements, and any other operational needs The Account Manager will be the liaison between Wow Bao’s internal teams and the relevant stakeholders at each dark kitchen account Perform calmly and effectively in an extremely busy and stressful work environment Follow all rules, policies, procedures and conditions of employment, including those outlined in the Employee Handbook  Required Experience/Skills:  At least three years of experience as an Account Manager or similar relevant position required Experience in the restaurant technology sector is preferred Excellent project management skills Excellent interpersonal skills with a proven ability to create and maintain positive working relationships with enterprise as well as small customer accounts Excellent verbal and written communication skills Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite Experience with Salesforce CRM is preferred Partake in a professional and positive work environment  Benefits  Health Insurance 401(k) Retirement Plan Voluntary Life Insurance, Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability Paid Time Off Paid Sick Leave Employee Restaurant Discounts and Employee Meals Pre-Tax Commuter Benefits Employee Discount Programs Training, Development and Advancement Opportunities Employee Assistance Program We foster a culture of CARE Growth & transfer opportunities; we love it when people grow at Wow Bao! Benefits eligibility varies based on things like position, hours worked, and length of service, and all benefits are subject to change, some of the benefits you might expect are listed above.

State Sales Manager Looking for the following 3 states: Arizona, Colorado & Florida Reports to: Vice President, Sales Apply online at: admin@sipbevco.com with salary requirements  As a Sales Manager, your main objective is to establish and grow sales in your assigned geography, create lasting and mutually beneficial partnerships with accounts and our distributors, and represent the integrity, values, and brand of the Insólito tequila & Spirits Innovation Partners. The position includes direct sales responsibility for key on and off-premise accounts, securing new business in existing and new accounts, and working closely with the distributor network in the assigned area to maintain/develop all accounts. You will serve as the voice of the brand across the assigned geography, executing marketing “pull” tactics, merchandising key accounts, and hosting both trade and consumer-focused events.  Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities: Specifically, the responsibilities of the position include, but are not limited to, the following activities: Assist VP with distributor management relationships including work withs at street level, Manager meetings, as well as GSMs across the state. Assist VP and distributor in establishing market-specific goals by benchmarking with like brands, KPIs and annual plan and objectives for the assigned region. Identify existing and new opportunities with on & off-premise accounts in your assigned region. Call on key accounts to secure new distribution, make timely presentations, and introduce new promotions. Execute on and off-premise promotions and periodic special events such as tequila dinners that generate brand awareness and consumer sampling. Develop and maintain strong, positive relationships with account staff and distributor sales personnel. Train accounts as well as distributors on our products and promotes the story of the Insólito tequila. Travel to and utilize the assets of the distillery to engrain brand and product knowledge in our commercial partners. Participate in market blitzes, ride-with, and general sales meetings to hold distributor partners accountable for the execution and achievement of the sales plan. Complete necessary administrative reporting and communications on a timely basis daily and weekly. Maintain all sales goals and personal budgets outlined to you and your territory. Pick up and deliver product and merchandise/POS from the distributor for events, as well as staffing and sampling at events as necessary.  Late night and weekend account visits and event attendance as directed. Other duties as periodically assigned by the VP.  Desired Qualifications: Prior experience in distributor management and sales in the alcoholic beverage industry required. Strong relationships and understanding of local and regional chains in the assigned region preferred. Strong oral communication skills: ability to talk to others to convey information effectively; strong written communication skills. Customer Service –Going above and beyond what the customer expects  Trade knowledge - Understanding the retail and on-premise buyer mindset - experience buying or bartending is a plus. Knowledge of, and passion for tequila and spirits  Excellent time management skills; ability to be proactive and take initiative. Excellent organization and coordination skills- ability to manage priorities and routine functions effectively and efficiently. Teamwork – Ability to flex scope of responsibility and do whatever needs to be done, regardless of the job description Transparency – Ability to communicate with teammates and freely exchange ideas and thoughts, without ego or pretense Proficiency with personal computers/laptops and associated programs (Windows, Microsoft Office suite of programs). Business Acumen -Ability to collect, assess, and interpret relevant information and make sound decisions. BS or BA from an accredited university is desired but not mandatory.  Job Requirements: It is required for the position that you must have a reliable car that is registered and insured, a valid driver's license, the ability to drive to and from accounts continuously, the ability to work nights and weekends, and at times more than 40 hours a week, ability to lift up to 50 pounds and that you must currently reside in the assigned territory.  Sales Specific Offerings: As part of our onboarding process, all new sales representatives will have a full-immersion learning training. In addition to a base-salary, our sales representatives participate in our unique sales incentive program which works to maintain our culture of results-focused personal management, and continuous learning & development. We offer mileage and other job-related transportation expense reimbursements, a monthly budget toward account visits and sampling, and a culture of work-life balance.   About INSÓLITO | SIP (Spirits Innovation Partners) is a full-service beverage development & branding firm specializing in areas of super-premium spirits development, branding, marketing, production management and sales. SIP has partnered with the country band Midland to create the Super Premium Tequila brand named INSÓLITO.  INSÓLITO, meaning, rare, uncommon and extraordinary, launched at the beginning of 2020 in Texas. We launched our online shop in March and currently ship to 45 states. We plan to expand to more markets in 2021.  Please submit your resume to admin@sipbevco.com today for immediate consideration, and we look forward to speaking with our qualified candidates soon!  Salary: DOE

jobTitle: Associate Director of Strategic Sales and Business Development
description: At AllCells, our mission is to provide researchers with the highest quality hematology and immunology cell-based Research and GMP compliant Clinical Grade Products, which enable our clients in the Cell & Gene Therapy industry to advance cutting-edge research through autologous and allogeneic cellular therapy.   AllCells is looking for an Associate Director - Strategic Sales and Business Development will manage a unified National Sales Team focusing on a diverse portfolio of critical raw materials. You will utilize and improve existing sales processes, and grow market share in the cell and gene therapy market. This position is responsible for all aspects of the business development function, and will be nimble enough to develop new sales strategies, qualifying the right targets, having detailed scientific discussions with prospects and customers. This role will be focused on generating new business in the US within the CGT space.  Job Responsibilities: Further enhance sales process and planning improvement to drive greater individual and team proficiency. Focus on territory analysis, prioritization and strategic planning.  Map product offerings and services to customer requirements developing a sustainable pipeline. Routinely present North American strategy and progress to CRO and Executive Leadership Team to include revenue forecast, pipeline opportunities, industry trends & growth potential, and resource requirements. Motivate a multi-disciplinary matriced NA account team to implement specific initiatives delivering revenue results across multiple customer sites and key targets. Creation of regional specific business plans, territory planning, forecasts and delivering on objectives. Territory analysis, prioritization and strategic planning to ensure a sustainable pipeline.. Manage higher level negotiations including major bids and account wide contracts. Ensure profitable growth by directing the active pursuit of sales leads, and account management and growth. Develop an effective compensation plan that is competitive and motivates the team Maintain prospects, funnel health/management and customer communication records in corporate CRM system NetSuite and Hubspot. Apply rigor and consistency to all aspects of selling tools, resources and processes Monitor and report regional market trends and identify new market potential in designated territories. Participate in scientific conferences, tradeshows and related field support activities, as required Develop sound and professional customer relationships, customer intimacy is a must, as well as partnership with KOLs and strategic alliances Effectively communicate goals, competitive activity, issues, and accomplishments to Chief Revenue Officer.  Job Requirements: B.S. Degree in Biochemistry, Chemistry, Biology, Molecular Biology, or other related field. Masters degree preferred.  8 years of successful field business development experience in the Life Sciences field. Requires understanding of the business segment and economic drivers as well as analytical ability to understand trends and dissect industry data 5 plus years experience of successfully leading/managing a sales team  Effective people management skills with the ability to coach, motivate, and build a cohesive team, while holding them accountable for performance Possess the ability to adapt to evolving sales responsibilities and corporate work environment Commercial excellence is a must: solid presentation skills, successful sales skills training experience, and demonstrated experience of achieving or exceeding sales targets Great critical thinking skills and the ability to work cross functionally with other teams Strong leadership skills with the ability to lead by example due to your excellent business acumen, and previous sales experience in life sciences Experience in cell and gene therapy a plus Exceptional customer relations and interpersonal skills.  What AllCells Offers AllCells offers a competitive salary and benefits package. For our full-time employees, we offer medical, dental, vision, and life insurance. We also offer long/short term disability, 401K, , FSA, generous time paid time off program, 12 holidays, and a bonus program. We are located in Alameda, CA and easily accessible from BART and the Ferry.

Definiti is a premier provider of customizable solutions across the full spectrum of retirement plan design, implementation, administration and actuarial services.  Definiti’s Regional Sales Consultant (“RSC”) is a key player in our growing business of retirement plan services and consulting. Our sales team is responsible for the distribution of retirement services including traditional DC/DB TPA services, 3(16) services, pension outsourcing, and full-scope retirement consulting. The RSC works across all plan size markets in partnership with all channels of financial intermediaries including (but not limited to) banks, wire house broker-dealers, regional broker-dealers, registered investment advisors, consultants, Certified Public Accountants, law firms, employee benefit firms, and more.  Definiti is actively searching to fill this exciting role and multiple territories are under consideration at this time. The organization’s focus is finding the most qualified and talented candidates.  This is a relationship-driven sales position that focuses on developing a network of advisors, consultants, platform wholesalers, DCIO partners, and other retirement -focused professionals. While managing the assigned territory of targeted relationships, Definiti’s RSCs  develop and manage their region’s pipeline, maintain an awareness of industry-specific trends and data to analyze challenges, success and opportunities, while also managing their budget.  The right candidate will become a Definiti advocate, representing the Company and its services at conferences and in business development opportunities. At least 5 years of relevant experience in the retirement plan industry with proven success in the distribution of retirement-focused administrative and recordkeeping services is required. Time management, collaboration in a team environment and demonstrated experience in the development of strategic business plans in support of sales growth are strong attributes Definiti is in search of for this role. Prior domain expertise in the retirement services market, understanding of platforms/solutions/distribution & service models, key competitors, utilization of CRM platforms, and fostering centers of influence are necessary for success in this role. A bachelor’s degree and overnight travel are required, and retirement specific credentials are preferred.  Definiti offers a business casual environment, competitive salary and a generous benefits package. We also place a strong emphasis on career development and continuing education. For more about Definiti, visit us at www.definiti-llc.com.

Who we are:  At UST, we help the world’s best organizations grow and succeed through transformation. Bringing together the right talent, tools, and ideas, we work with our clients to co-create lasting change. Together, with over 26,000 employees in 25 countries, we build for boundless impact—touching billions of lives in the process.  Moonraft Innovation Labs, a UST Company, is on the path towards transforming the digital and customer experience space and is looking for an Alliance Manager to be a part of the team that is driving this change by leveraging our amazing partner ecosystem in the USA. Visit us at UST.com  and Moonraft      You Are:    An energetic Sales Hunter that thrives on going after new business and helping to grow a company   The Opportunity:   Build and maintain a healthy sales pipeline for new business Proactively develop strategic deals by leveraging personal and professional networks Help strategize with prospects on their digital roadmap and ideation by showcasing the value-add of Moonraft Eloquently articulating our views on digital business philosophies, keeping clients up to date on industry context Own the business development ‘funnel’ including inbound, outbound, and long-tail opportunity management Create and nurture strong relationships across our partner network and our key technology partners Lead the development of detailed proposals, estimates, and statements of work for web development projects, UX Design engagements, and other digital initiatives Understand all Customer Experience Management disciplines enough to have solution discussions with clients Provide our internal teams with insight into the client’s strategic business initiatives to ensure our work is consistent with the client’s goals Look for opportunities to grow existing accounts and provide value to clients    What you need:   Bachelor’s degree or relevant experience At least 5 years experience working for any Agency/Digital Firm, Onshore/Offshore sales with a minimum of $5M annual quota.  At least 5 years experience selling similar Service Offerings – Design Services, Customer Experience Consulting, MarTech platform implementations Demonstrated success selling deals in the $5 to $10M range Demonstrated consecutive quarterly and yearly quota achievement in complex selling environments utilizing a solution selling model Demonstrated understanding of CMS platforms, UX/Design processes, Web Development processes, Analytics & Reporting, eCommerce, SEO, Marketing Automation and/or other Internet Technologies A knack for successfully formulating and driving long-term strategic account plans, strategies, and roadmaps Excellent written and oral communications, paired with outstanding presentation skills and a high degree of emotional intelligence Excellent leadership skills, problem-resolution abilities, and good judgment Highly skilled in negotiating, experienced at agreeing and closing profitable programs of work    What we believe:  We’re proud to embrace the same values that have shaped UST since the beginning. Since day one, we’ve been building enduring relationships and a culture of integrity. And today, it's those same values that are inspiring us to encourage innovation from everyone to champion diversity and inclusion and to place people at the center of everything we do.    Humility:  We will listen, learn, be empathetic and help selflessly in our interactions with everyone.  Humanity:  Through business, we will better the lives of those less fortunate than ourselves.  Integrity:  We honor our commitments and act with responsibility in all our relationships.    Equal Employment Opportunity Statement     UST is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that no one should be discriminated against because of their differences, such as age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, religion, or sexual orientation.     All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.    UST reserves the right to periodically redefine your roles and responsibilities based on the requirements of the organization and/or your performance.   • To support and promote the values of UST.  • Comply with all Company policies and procedures

Company Description  Accolade at a glance  Accolade provides personalized health and benefits solutions designed to empower every person to live their healthiest life. We help millions of people and their employers navigate the complexities of the healthcare system with empathy, expertise and through exceptional service while supporting them in lowering the cost of care and improving health outcomes. Accolade blends technology-enabled health and benefits solutions, specialized support from Accolade Health Assistants® and Clinicians and access to expert medical opinion services for high-cost treatment decisions. We consistently receive consumer satisfaction ratings over 90 percent and have been recognized by Inc. Magazine as a Top Place to Work 2020 and Business Intelligence for Excellence in Customer Service 2020. Please visit us on LinkedIn, Twitter, Instagram and Facebook and at accolade.com.  Job Description  Our Mid-Market team is expanding!  The Regional Sales Executive, Mid-Market is responsible for meeting or exceeding the annual bookings quota for the assigned territory.  This role must be based within and will cover the following territory:  Minneapolis, Wisconsin, Michigan, Illinois, Iowa, Missouri, Arkansas, Louisiana and Texas.  A day in the life… Consistently identifies opportunities, develops sales strategy and closes new business in the assigned middle market segment Identifies, develops and retains new business relationships Effectively presents Accolade’s offerings to qualified prospects Effectively leverages Accolade executives, the pre-sales team and services staff to support customer presentations Develops and executes strategies to generate cost effective sales leads Develops a pipeline of new sales opportunities in alignment with objectives that are established annually Develops and maintains an effective sales and market penetration plan for assigned territory Leverages the sales milestone process to ensure accuracy with monthly, quarterly and annual forecasts Documents all sales contacts, activities and sales process steps in Accolade’s sales tools and systems Solicits product and market feedback from customers, prospects and partners. Communicates this feedback to sales leadership, marketing and the product development team (feature requests, market trends, competition intelligence, new opportunities) Complies with all corporate policies and completes all administrative tasks on time Qualifications  What we are looking for… Minimum 8-10 years of strategic selling experience BA in a business or technical related area of study Experience selling complex, multi-stakeholder solutions. SaaS, health & welfare benefits, healthcare capital equipment, healthcare IT, health and welfare benefits outsourcing, human resources IT benefits software Embraces and thrives in a culture of transparency, accountability and trust Self-starter with ability to work independently, prioritize work and coordinate multiple tasks within tight time constraints Ability to navigate the strategic levels of customer organizations, identify key decision-makers, build relationships with senior executives and schedule meetings with key stakeholders Ability to establish strong team relationships in a matrix organization Ability to perform in a dynamic and fast-paced environment Possess account knowledge, executive-level customer contacts and industry relationships inside the employer market space Command of social media for the benefit of lead generation, gaining access to executives and networking with key stakeholders Strong aptitude with business software tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook etc) Strong business acumen Demonstrated ability to successfully negotiate complex contract Demonstrated ability to accurately forecast monthly, quarterly, and annual revenue Where permitted by applicable law, candidates must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by date of hire to be considered, if not currently employed by Accolade, Inc. The Company will provide reasonable accommodations to qualified employees with disabilities or for a sincerely held religious belief.  Please note that a request for exemption due to a personal preference not to receive a vaccine is not protected by law. All requests for exemptions from this mandate shall be directed to the Company recruiter who shall route the request to the Company’s human resources department.  Additional Information  What Is Important To Us  Creating an enduring company that is hyper-focused on our culture and making a meaningful impact in the lives of our employees, members and customers. The secret to our success is:  We Find Joy And Purpose In Serving Others  Making a difference in our members’ and customers’ lives is what we do. Even when it’s hard, we do the right thing for the right reasons.  We are strong individually and together, we’re powerful  Trusting in our colleagues and embracing their different backgrounds and experiences enable us to solve tough problems in creative ways, having fun along the way.  We roll up our sleeves and get stuff done  Results motivate us. And we aren't afraid of the hard work or tough decisions needed to get us there.  We’re boldly and relentlessly reinventing healthcare We're curious and act big -- not afraid to knock down barriers or take calculated risks to change the world, one person at a time.  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Hospital & Health Care

description: The Sales Executive is responsible for identifying opportunities and creating sales strategies to secure targeted revenue and market penetration goals for ZeOmega’s new products that are part of the HealthUnity & CareIntel platforms. The primary function is to execute, design, develop, and deploy a sales strategy in collaboration with the VP of Business Development that will increase revenue and gain net new customers.  What will be my duties and responsibilities in this job? Identifying opportunities to sell solutions into net new and existing customers Work with partners to create a commercial focus and achieve agreed KPIs Conducting sales presentations Collaborating with generalists to coordinate efforts in identifying leads Maintaining deep understanding of solution set Meet and/or exceed all assigned quotas and all performance benchmarks Create & maintain a strategic sales plan for the existing customer base and new Hospital market segments consistent with the ZeOmega Strategic plan Develop and enhance relationships internally and externally to drive adoption of the new products and identifying, forecasting and planning to exceed assigned revenue targets  What are the requirements needed for this position? jobTitle: Startup Inside Sales AE | CX / CS
description: **This company is a Staffer.cc partner and you will be introduced to the hiring manager once we receive your application and resume.**  Website:  Location: Remote  Current Target Locations: NW, SW, MW, NE  Territory: Determined by location  Quota: Commensurate with Experience  The Company:  Our mission at Shelf is to enable all employees to instantly know more. Shelf is a highly awarded, innovative knowledge automation platform that revolutionizes how organizations curate and distribute company knowledge! With our powerful MerlinAI, Shelf helps organizations move from their difficult to use, legacy knowledge base to knowledge automation delivering answers on demand to employees with questions, to front-line staff interacting with prospects or customers, and to self-service interactions via your website. With many pre-built integrations, SDKs and APIs, Shelf’s open knowledge infrastructure is extensible and integrates seamlessly with enterprise applications to improve the customer experience and employee productivity.  We are experiencing rapid growth and quickly need to expand the sales team globally to keep up with market demand. This is an incredible opportunity for an elite sales professional to join a rapidly expanding sales organization growing revenue at over 300% per year. We have successfully acquired dozens of large enterprises including Fortune 100 customers and always deliver a great customer experience. Check out our user reviews and feedback .  The Role:  As an Enterprise Account Executive, you know what it takes to navigate through enterprise organizations and engage C-Suite executives. You are an expert at challenging legacy approaches and can be a trusted advisor to help the customer see a better vision of the future to shape their ideal solution. This is a great opportunity to join a growth stage technology start-up and help build the foundation of our sales culture and process. To date, we have been primarily executing founder led selling strategies and going to market with key industry partners. We have just completed a very large Series B round of funding to fuel our growth and accelerate our momentum across the US and Europe.  We aren’t your typical sales organization that simply views you as a number or a cog in a machine. We understand the immense value an elite salesperson can bring to the customer experience. In turn, we want the people that aren’t afraid of challenges and push themselves to deliver performance above expectations. We are looking for interesting human beings who enjoy building the future. We want intellectually curious, motivated people who have a growth mindset and get energized each day to seize a massive opportunity. If this sounds like you, come and join us!  We’re looking for someone who has: The ability to communicate effectively in writing and has a fluid conversational style. You are action oriented and focused on driving results. You embrace challenges and can collaborate with a team to develop solutions. The ideal candidate has a demonstrable track record of success, selling software as a service technology to enterprise customers. Experience using Salesforce as your CRM to keep track of your pipeline, notes and activities. Experience with an enterprise Forecasting Methodology, preferably MEDDPICC. Experience negotiating and closing deals with an annual contract value of $100,000+. Experience selling technology solutions that leverage SDKs and APIs. Preferred experience working with enterprises on digital transformation initiatives. Bonus points for selling knowledge management solutions and/or contact center software.  You will: Own your territory and develop a strategy to achieve your sales targets. Drive revenue and own the full cycle sales process, navigating the C-suite and business line owners, negotiating contracts, and closing new business. Strategically use your network to prospect and develop new business in your assigned territory. Have access to cutting edge sales technology like 6Sense, Gong, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, Zoom to perfect your process and help you engage with the right prospects. Work closely with our solutions consulting team to demonstrate Shelf capabilities and to develop appropriate solutions for our customers. Work closely with our marketing partners to ensure we have compelling content that helps you differentiate Shelf and win business against your competitors. Work closely with sales leadership to ensure we have the right product roadmap to win business and are building solutions that will add value to your customers.  What Shelf Offers: Company Stock Options Unlimited PTO Stipend for your personal computer equipment. Choose your own equipment.  Managed by Staffer.cc  Powered by JazzHR  6GEgpddsDL

jobTitle: Senior Sales Rep, Cardiac Surgery - Houston, San Antonio, Rio Grande Valley
description: Bring your sales talents to a leader in medical technology and healthcare solutions. Rooted in our long history of mission-driven innovation, our medical technologies open doors. We support your growth with the training, mentorship, and guidance you need to own your future success. Join us for a career in sales that changes lives.  CAREERS THAT CHANGE LIVES - POSITION DESCRIPTION:  To gain market shares in the Heart Valve, Cardiac Ablation and Revascularization businesses (Surgical Based Therapies) in an assigned territory. Sales Representative will be responsible for achieving quarterly revenue and unit goals in their territory.  A DAY IN THE LIFE: POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES: Conduct sales calls to promote and sell Medtronic Cardiac Surgical Therapies to existing and competitive customers based on a strategic plan Develop, implement, and effectively follow through with a quarterly strategic sales plan to achieve sales goals and objectives Create a detailed forecast with customer commitments as a measure of success Identify, qualify, and close new and existing customers consistent with established sales plans and key accounts Maximize revenue potential by targeting specific customers to gain sales leads and develop business opportunities to drive growth Develop and maintain a high-level of expertise in Cardiac Surgical Therapies products Provide feedback and information on competitive activity, changes in markets, distribution and pricing Identify and communicate to other departments (i.e. R&D, Operations, and Marketing) suggestions for new products and/or modifications to existing products or applications based upon customer needs and requirements Coordinate customer activities at all assigned meetings Train and educate customers on the safe and effective use of Medtronic products Complete all administrative reporting accurately; in a timely manner and in the requested format (i.e. expense reports, account profiles and analysis, daily planners, weekly activity, competitive updates, and inventory log) Manage time, assets and resources in a cost effective manner; manage territory budget in accordance with the strategic territory plan and within the guidelines of the Regional Manager Maintain adequate inventory (trunk stock) and assist in the reallocation and delivery of product Maintain knowledge of current industry trends and all Medtronic products. Keep updated on the products and strategies of competitive companies Participate in sales training as required MUST HAVE - BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:  IN ORDER TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THIS POSITION, THE FOLLOWING BASIC QUALIFICATIONS MUST BE EVIDENT ON YOUR RESUME Bachelor's degree AND 5 years of sales experience with at least 2 years of healthcare sales experience OR Currently or previously a Sr Rep level in another Medtronic Field business NICE TO HAVE - DESIRED/PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: Preference will be given to local qualified candidates and candidates with Medtronic experience Experience selling to surgeons Experience selling in the Cardiac operating room Track record of success in high pressure, selling environment Excellent written and verbal communication skills Outstanding selling and negotiation skills Demonstrated ability to effectively forecast for results Ability to successfully plan and mange accounts Ability to develop and successfully follow through with a strategic plan If the candidate has10 years medical industry sales experience (selling physician preference products) in hospital environment with 8 years selling to interventional cardiology or cardiac surgeons, then the position may be filled at the Principal level PHYSICAL JOB REQUIREMENTS: The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Frequent required travel to customer clinics, hospitals and offsite meetings. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. Work And Travel Requirements Available/willing to work/travel weekends and evenings This position requires on-call time Continuous verbal and written communication Ability to transport product/equipment from car to hospital Sitting, standing and/or walking for up to eight plus hours per day Environmental exposures include eye protection, infectious disease and radiation Ability to travel extensively with ease (approx. 10% of time) Must be able to drive approximately 80% of the time within assigned territory Must have a valid driver's license and active vehicle insurance policy. In addition, your driving record will be reviewed and will be considered as part of your application About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We can accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations – but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.  It is the policy of Medtronic to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, Medtronic will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.  This employer participates in the federal E-Verify program to confirm the identity and employment authorization of all newly hired employees. For further information about the E-Verify program, please click here: http://www.uscis.gov/e-verify/employees  The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this classification. Additional Information Posting Date: Sep 17, 2021 Travel: No

description: Position: Account Executive – Strategic Sales Reporting to: Director of Enterprise Sales (Location: Remote, San Francisco Bay Area, Austin)  About Stem Stem provides solutions that address the challenges of today’s dynamic energy market. By combining advanced energy storage solutions with Athena™, a world-class artificial intelligence (AI)-powered analytics platform, Stem enables customers and partners to optimize energy use by automatically switching between battery power, onsite generation and grid power. Stem’s solutions help enterprise customers benefit from a clean, adaptive energy infrastructure and achieve a wide variety of goals, including expense reduction, resilience, sustainability, environmental and corporate responsibility and innovation. Stem also offers full support for solar partners interested in adding storage to standalone, community or commercial solar projects – both behind and in front of the meter.  Stem’s culture embodies diversity & inclusion beyond the traditional facets of gender, ethnicity, age, disabilities, and sexual orientation to include experience, personality, communication, workstyles, and more. At our core, Stem is at the momentous intersection of clean energy and software technology where diverse ideas, experiences, and professional skills converge to make the inclusive culture we have today. Together, we are turning old school thoughts about software and energy into progressive, collaborative, and innovative solutions. By joining our team, you will be collaborating with data scientists, energy experts, skilled salespeople, thought-leading executives and more from a range of backgrounds. This intersection of ideas, beliefs, and skills is what makes us unique enough to lead the world’s largest network of digitally connected energy storage systems.  What we are looking for: Stem’s Enterprise Sales team works within an ecosystem of strategic “named” accounts that include industrials, MUSH, and other large corporate entities. Our goal is to identify microgrid, resiliency and solar+storage opportunities that exist in this ecosystem and drive them from discovery to booked sales. You will identify and maintain a primary relationship at the executive level for your accounts. Key to success will be maintaining your forecast, managing an accurate pipeline and mid-stage opportunity development. You will also direct relevant lead generation efforts for your accounts.  As an Account Executive you will report to the Director of Enterprise Sales.   Responsibilities: Exceed sales targets by executing on named strategic accounts in the industrial, MUSH and commercial sectors. Be able to articulate and deliver Stem’s differentiated storage offering including the full economic, strategic, and environmental value represented by our project Create sustainable long-term customer relationships within your named account ecosystem. Manage a complex sales life cycle over the course of a 6 to 12 month sales cycle Accurately forecast close dates and balance activity between “closing” and “mid-stage development” Become an expert on storage solutions, key markets, policies, participants, stakeholders and competitors Coordinate with Finance, Pricing Team, Supply Chain and Legal departments to structure and drive opportunities to successful closure Attend and present at select trade shows and conferences Make ethical decisions while maintaining integrity on behalf of the best interest of Stem at all times.  Requirements: Bachelor’s degree, MBA a plus Minimum of 5 to 7 years successful experience in selling complex, capital intensive purchases in the industrial, MUSH and commercial verticals. Preferred experience selling distributed generation projects and energy market knowledge Experience coordinated responses to large, public sector RFPs a plus. Proven track record of exceeding sales targets, outpacing peers and correctly forecasting close dates Experience projects with differing financed deal structures and expertise in explaining the financial analytical benefits: ex: NPV, IRR, Cash Flows, etc. Demonstrated ability to lead a deal team - positive attitude, strong ability to communicate across departments and drive to “get the deal done.” A strong understanding of buying habits and governance in the MUSH and corporate space Demonstrated ability to build a pipeline and prospect new leads A demonstrated ability to partner with all levels of the organization to maximize the effectiveness of sales support A self-starter who needs limited supervision Experience with a formal sales methodology (Challenger Sales a plus) Experience with Salesforce.com a plus  Job Location Remote; San Francisco, CA; Austin, TX   Stem, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, pregnancy, religion, national origin, ethnicity, citizenship, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, disability, genetic information, military status, protected veteran status or any other factor protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.

Description  Are you eager to make a huge impact on Amazon's ability to drive business development? Are you an energetic sales team leader ready to drive your own team, tasked with convincing vendors to join Amazon’s platform and helping them get ready to sell as fast as possible? Then this is the position for you.  Sales of products by third-party Sellers on our websites represent more than one-third of units sold, and the New Seller Success business is growing faster than our Retail business. We are a business development organization; we drive growth for over $2B through seller recruitment and product adoption. We are successful by focusing on aggressive growth for our Sellers’ businesses.  The Ideal Candidate Will Be a Self-starter With a Passion For Product, a High Level Of Flexibility And Commitment, And Must Be Able To  The successful Sales Manager is an effective listener, communicator, problem-solver and people leader. He or she constantly balances the needs and requirements of both Amazon.com and strategic sellers, and is comfortable engaging some of Amazon’s most important partners and sellers, as well as internal cross-functional teams with high visibility. Set goals and strategic direction for the team ensuring alignment with broader business goals and vision. Conduct deep dive analysis on issues affecting Seller business performance and provide the Voice of the Seller as an input into product development and process improvement. Analyze trends, diagnose root cause of performance and create actionable plans for operational improvements. Become a thought leader in defining success criteria and understand business needs of large Sellers in an ever-changing business environment. Partner with external teams including Category Management, Merchant Technology, and SSR teams to align programs and initiatives to drive growth in existing seller base. Successfully manage and develop a team of Account Representatives.   Basic Qualifications Bachelor's Degree or equivalent 5+ years professional experience Experience using analysis, reporting, modeling, and forecasting to gather data for the purpose of making business decisions Demonstrated ability to think and react in a high-energy, fast-paced and ambiguous environment Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects-prioritization and strategic planning Experience managing small teams and driving successful results Preferred Qualifications MBA Experience using analytical, sales, and productivity tools including Oracle Business Intelligence, SalesForce, Microsoft Office Suites, Microsoft OneNote, and Microsoft SharePoint. Proven ability to manage large and complicated projects with experience leading cross-functional projects and teams. Open to Seattle, WA or Arlington, VA. Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, visit US Disability Accommodations.   Company - Amazon.com Services LLC  Job ID: A1742794

description: Title: Area Sales Manager Location: Northeast U.S.  If building relationships and delivering extraordinary value and service is what you’re all about, we’d love to talk to you! We are looking for an experienced Area Sales Manager that is motivated by driving results, growing a territory and providing legendary service to our partners. In this role you will be responsible for managing a geographic region of new and existing partners that provide commercial equipment across several industry verticals. You will be responsible for creating and maintaining strong relationships and growing the sales volume in your assigned territory.  clicklease is a FinTech company focused on disrupting the $1+ trillion financial services industry. Our proprietary technology and machine-learning algorithms are changing the face and pace of commercial equipment finance. Our mission is to provide simple, fast and innovative financing solutions to underserved entrepreneurs and their Main Street businesses. You will be connecting our industry-disrupting program with equipment vendors who provide equipment to business owners.   Specific Responsibilities Include: ·       Establish or re-establish relationships with partners in your designated territory – including potential partners Communicate and articulate the company’s value proposition with the goal of meeting and exceeding sales goals Communicate effectively with internal team members to ensure successful onboarding of new relationships and the success of new accounts. Deliver presentations, demonstrations, and trainings to groups of people as needed (both virtually and in-person). Develop strategies and programs to promote increased sales for existing vendors which will result in additional financing volume for clicklease. Effectively use available resources to better understand the Partners industry and business. Keep management informed about geographic and market opportunities. Diligently use CRM (Salesforce.com) to capture relevant data and keep comprehensive and accurate notes. Travel for in-person meetings – up to 75%  The ideal candidate will possess the qualities below: Engaging and personable; able to partner with client and stakeholders to develop influential relationships. Exceptional communication and follow-up skills. Ability to work effectively in a sales team environment, build effective working relationships with key stakeholders and work independently with limited supervision. Thinks Critically - ability to understand our business and its evolving needs. Strong time management and organizational experience. Flexible - readily adjusts strategy and tactics to meet evolving needs of our partners. Drives for Results - highly productive while maintaining a calm, fun loving, and always professional demeanor. Retail or wholesale industry experience preferred. Equipment finance a plus. description: An established, stable, rapidly growing medical device company seeks District Sales Managers to lead the expansion and build out of our prescription portfolio in territories across the US. This person will grow and direct a Regional sales team that promotes prescription wound care products in women's health, oncology supportive care, wound care, and to surgical specialists. Due to the success of the products, the company is expanding its sales teams and needs experienced pharmaceutical sales management professionals to play a central role in taking the organization to the next level. These individuals will report to the head of National Sales Manager.  The company has a tremendous amount of clinical credibility and an extensive line of popular, science-based products that are directly prescribed or dispensed by doctors to their patients.  This firm is uniquely positioned for rapid growth and needs leaders that will be an ambassador internally and externally and represent the ethos and core values of the brand.  North East Territories include but are not limited to - Maine Boston Connecticut Long Island NYC UES NYC DT Detroit Cleveland Pittsburgh Columbus Cincinnati Buffalo New Jersey  Position Description (Brief Overview) Execute the regional Sales Strategy, drive corporate objectives and revenue growth Provide strong leadership for the regional sales function, set clear and unified direction for the team Expand the sales team: manage, stretch, and develop into top performing team Achieve revenue, profit, organizational, and strategic goals and objectives Enhance sales pipeline system: reporting, forecasting, performance: from lead generation to close Build relationships with Key Opinion Leaders, and Hospital Systems to deliver excellent service Establish and maintain top level contact with organization’s important internal stakeholders Oversee both Inside and Field-Based sales teams Develop annual sales business plans to drive revenue and increase market penetration Accurately forecast monthly, quarterly, and annual sales achievements Travel as necessary to visit sales team, major accounts, attend trade shows and key events Note: This is a heavy travel role; this person will be a “Field General”  Requirements  Qualifications/Requirements (Brief Overview) 10+ years sales management experience; extensive background working with prescription devices or drugs Successful experience building high performing teams of sales professional Existing relationships in women's health, oncology supportive care, medical aesthetics, and wound care, is desired Acute understanding of the competitor landscape Excellent commercial instincts, strong financial acumen and analytical skills, attention to detail Computer skills: CRM, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook Bachelor’s degree, (or industry experience in lieu of degree), Master’s degree a plus  Benefits  Key Points Industry/Product Category: women's health, oncology, wound care, dermatology, surgical Title: Regional Sales Manager Call Points: OBGyn's, Radiation Oncologists, Infusion Specialists, Surgeons*, Wound Care Specialists Scope: Regional responsibility may include inside Sales and Field-Based Sales Location: New York Compensation: Competitive with high commission aligned to performance, MBO's, and KPI's Fulltime, W2 position, benefits  The company have a range of highly marketable products and the resources to execute a successful expansion. This opportunity will see the successful candidate gain a role where they shall be part of an exciting growth story.
