Moog Inc. is a worldwide designer, manufacturer and integrator of precision motion control products and systems. Moog’s high-performance systems control military and commercial aircraft, satellites and space vehicles, launch vehicles, missiles, industrial machinery, wind energy, marine applications, and medical equipment.  World-class solutions. Design flexibility. Global depth and support. All delivered by experts who understand our customers’ vision and are committed to helping them achieve it.  Moog’s Space and Defense Group is looking for a Regional Sales Manager to further the sales and business development initiatives within the group’s Power and Data Sector throughout the Military/Aerospace markets in Mountain & South Central US regions. The individual selected will manage the complex technical sale of a portfolio of motion control, power and data solutions through direct account management and facilitative engagement with a network of territory channel partners. If you are leader and share the same passion that Moog does then this may be the right opportunity for you!  As a Regional Sales Manager, you will… Create and maintain an environment that promotes teamwork, responsiveness, efficiency and positive engagement between our customers, sales channels and operations. Support the development and execution of strategic initiatives to increase sales and promote customer intimacy within the assigned territory. Become proficient in the complex technical sale of our product portfolio of motion control, power and data solutions within targeted markets. Identify market and industry trends or gaps that may adjust the business strategy developmental road maps. Collaborate across the Moog organization in support of common customers, markets and pursuits. Work with sales executives to create staff budgets as well as support the operations in the establishment and achievement of key performance sales metrics. Manage the channel partners within your region through the mutual establishment of annual goals and objectives while collaborating with the operations to provide the developmental support needed to successfully reach these targets. Minimum Qualifications To Be Considered… Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering and a minimum of 10 years relevant sales and/or engineering experience in the sale or product development of complex technical OEM equipment with a motion technology, fiber optic or electronic corporation. Strong communicator with facilitative leadership skills who is willing to travel to build effective internal and external relationships required to achieve sales growth. Exposure and awareness of the DoD budget and acquisition process via selling into the Military/Aerospace markets is strongly preferred. This job requires access to US export-controlled information. What’s in it for you? Flexible Planned Vacation - no minimum or maximum number of days off Outstanding Health Benefits Generous 401K company contribution and match At Moog we work in an environment where people trust, respect and encourage one another. We believe in our people, and it shows in everything we do. We invite you to become part of our continued success.  EEOE/AA Minority/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Female/Disability/Veteran
industries: Aviation & Aerospace, Defense & Space, and Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing

description: The ideal candidate will prospect and close sales leads to help generate revenue for the company. They will also be responsible for developing, implementing, and evaluating the sales strategy. They will have strong management and coaching skills to support the learning and development of the sales team.   Responsibilities Support the learning and development of the sales team Coordinate with sales representatives to generate and meet with prospective leads Track and report all sales activities Develop and execute sales strategy through market analysis  Qualifications Experience managing sales teams Experience generate and maintaining relationships with sales leads Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Under Armour has one mission: to make you better. We have a commitment to innovation that lies at the heart of everything we do, not just for our athletes but also for our teammates. As a global organization, our teams around the world push boundaries and think beyond what is expected. Together our teammates are unified by our values and are grounded in our vision to inspire you with performance solutions you never knew you needed but can’t imagine living without.  Position Summary  The Account Service Manager will manage and supervise the Account Services Associates in their assigned account group. With these supervisory duties, this Manager will also exhibit outstanding account service for Under Armour Accounts and ensure that all Account Services Associates respond to internal and external customer inquiries and process product orders received by email or phone from retailers by performing the following duties.  Essential Duties & Responsibilities Trains, coaches, motivates and manages a team of Account Services Associates Develop and advance Teammates by creating both team and individualized goals and evaluating their progress and performance Recognize areas in need of operational improvement. Suggest ideas for the development of new procedures and changes in existing processes to increase productivity Will be an Account subject matter expert and is responsible for being the main point of contact for Account Services Associates’ issues, questions, concerns etc. Provides support to any retailers, Sales Reps and UA Sales Managers that need additional attention on certain issues. Work cross functionally with them to problem solve and implement any changes that need to be made. Works with the DH operations team with regards to weekly trucking schedules, LTL and small parcel shipments. Will also work cross functionally with DH operations and compliance about packing efficiencies, customer VAS requests and any other special requests. Collaborates with Business Analysts to ensure monthly, quarterly and yearly calls are being met. Compiles projects and reporting to be given to upper management in a clear, accurate and timely manner Analyzes and reports on all related KPI’s such as Scouting Report execution, Past Cancels, Unconfirmed Demand, Open Contracts, and Incomplete Orders etc. to analyze Service performance. Identifies areas for improvements and communicate cross functionally as needed. Analyzes and reports on fill rate issues, customer orders, inventory and returns to interpret specific territory needs and improvements and communicates cross functionally as needed. Will work with Sales Operations and Production Teams cross functionally to accomplish this Communicates with the DH, IT, Sales, EDI and Production Teams to ensure effectiveness of all order entries submitted by Account Services Associates Responsible for managing the returns process from issuing returns to closing returns. Suggests ideas for the development/improvements of procedures, reports and processes. Works cross functionally to improve current reporting and streamline communication between departments Leads and Performs testing of any new IT upgrades (SAP, B2B, WM, BW), new processes, new applications and/or scenarios. Interviewing & hiring for Account Service Associates and manages the new hire training schedule. Completing half time huddles & end of year reviews for the Account Services team. Conducts and leads team huddles to clearly communicate all account or business changes and updates affecting the Team. Ability to travel to the accounts if necessary Supervisory Responsibilities Supervises a team of Account Services Associates Conducts and leads team huddles to clearly communicate all account or business changes and updates affecting the Team Manages new hire training schedules and assists with training all new hires to equip them with the necessary knowledge and resources needed to efficiently and successfully perform tasks. Maintains up to date training logs for new hires. Conducts interviews to help determine potential new hires and make new hire decisions Manages and approves payroll and paid time off Education And / Or Experience Bachelor's degree (B. A.) from four-year College or university and one to two years related experience and/or training. 2+ years of experience within Customer Service - a customer service subject matter expert on all Accounts. Other Requirements  Computer Skills To perform this job successfully, candidate needs to be proficient in SAP, BW, Cisco, B2B, ADP, EDI. Extensive knowledge in Microsoft Office Software: Excel, Word, Outlook. etc. required Competencies To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies : Analytical - Collects and provides data; Uses intuition and experience to complement data. Problem Solving - Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; Gathers and analyzes information skillfully; Develops alternative solutions; Works well in group problem solving situations. Technical Skills - Strives to continuously build knowledge and skills; Shares expertise with others. Customer Service - Manages difficult or emotional customer situations; Responds promptly to customer needs; Solicits customer feedback to improve service ; Responds to requests for service and assistance; Meets commitments. Oral Communication - Listens and gets clarification; Responds well to questions; Participates in meetings. Written Communication - Writes clearly and informatively; Varies writing style to meet needs; Presents numerical data effectively; Able to read and interpret written information. Teamwork - Balances team and individual responsibilities; Gives and welcomes feedback; Contributes to building a positive team spirit; Puts success of team above own interests; Able to build morale and group commitments to goals and objectives; Supports everyone's efforts to succeed. Leadership - Exhibits confidence in self and others; Accepts feedback from others. Quality Management - Looks for ways to improve and promote quality; Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness. Organizational Support - Follows policies and procedures; Completes administrative tasks correctly and on time; Supports organization's goals and values. Adaptability - Adapts to changes in the work environment; Able to deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected events. Dependability - Follows instructions, responds to management direction; Takes responsibility for own actions; Keeps commitments. At Under Armour, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Under Armour believes that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success as a global company, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Consumer Goods, and Retail

description: HENKEL IS FOR THOSE WHO STEP UP. DO YOU?  At Henkel, you can make a difference and craft your career. That’s why you own your projects and take full responsibility from an early stage. Our unique brands in markets around the world open up countless opportunities to follow your convictions and explore new paths. If you have an entrepreneurial mindset that allows you to always think out of the box - take the chance and shape the digital future together with us.  YOUR ROLE The Territory Sales rep is a remote position and will be responsible for the sales/service of industrial adhesives used in the paper converting, tapes and labels and flexible film industries. Manage existing Henkel business and grow territory sales by promoting Henkel’s products and services to the current customer base as well as potential customers. Geographic West/Northwest sales territory to include the states, (all or a portion depending on candidate’s location and experience level): WA, OR, CA (Central and Northern), and UT, Implement territory management and growth plans that are commensurate with the overall strategic directives of the business. Work to establish a complete target list, documenting growth potential by application and location. Prioritize, direct & execute sales programs for the assigned market areas. Effectively communicate progress and needs to the management team. Become competent with and utilize Henkel’s Customer Relationship Management (CRM) tools to manage the sales and customer management processes. Your Skills BA/BS Degree in chemical engineering, chemistry, business or related discipline required. 3+ years of sales experience in a B2B manufacturing environment. Experience in industrial adhesives, paper converting, tapes and labels, flexible film or related industries is preferred, but not required. Exhibited knowledge of applicable products and applications including product chemistries, application, manufacturing, and equipment a plus. Proven Experience creating and maintaining accounts based on excellent customer relationships Excellent planning, organization, customer focus, results, and relationship building skills. Henkel is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, and other legally protected characteristics.  Henkel does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firms or employment agencies. Unsolicited referrals and resumes are considered Henkel property and therefore, Henkel will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited referral. At Henkel’s request only, preferred vendors may be invited to refer talent for specific open positions. In these cases, a fully-executed agreement with Henkel must be in place and current.  All employees applying for an internal position must have a discussion with his/her manager about their interest in a job posting opportunity. The discussion will not preclude the employee from interviewing if their skills meet the job requirements.

Bettinardi Golf makes the finest putters in golf, in our own state-of-the-art manufacturing facility in Tinley Park, Illinois. Our putters are used by some of the best golfers in the world, amateur standouts, all the way down to your average weekend warrior. IN addition to putters, Robert and Sam Bettinardi continue to innovate with wedges, and other life-style milled accessories.  We are looking for a Regional Off-Course Sales Manager to create long-term, trusting relationships with our customers. The Sales Manager role is to oversee a portfolio of assigned customers specifically big box retailers, off course retailers, and corporate customers. Your role will be to develop new business from existing clients, service the big box/corporate account landscape, and actively seek new sales opportunities. This position is located at our headquarters in Tinley Park, Illinois and will require travel 40-50% of the time. A qualified candidate will have experience in the sales side of the golf business, lead generation, and account penetration, as well as a passion for the golf industry.  Responsibilities Include Successfully manage clientele on a sales prospect Responsible for maintained relationships with current accounts on a regular and consistent basis Grow relationships within territory through networking Track and Reports all sales activities within Salesforce Develop and execute sales strategy through market analysis Actively prospect for new business Coordinate with local technical representatives to coordinate and present demo/product days Efficiently book personal travel accommodations and schedule meetings Proactively use email and phone calls to stay in touch with clients, businesses, and Bettinardi leadership and team Proficient in Microsoft Office and Salesforce Qualifications Associates or Bachelor Degree required 3-5 years of golf sales experience Proficient in Microsoft Office and Salesforce Extensive Golf Knowledge Detail-oriented, organized, and ability to manage multiple priorities Excellent written and verbal communication skills High level of Professionalism Bettinardi Golf makes the finest putters in golf, in our own state-of-the-art manufacturing facility in Tinley Park, Illinois. Our putters are used by some of the best golfers in the world, amateur standouts, all the way down to your average weekend warrior. In addition to putters, Robert and Sam Bettinardi continue to innovate with wedges, and other lifestyle milled accessories.
industries: Packaging and Containers, Automotive, and Machinery

description: The Watergate Hotel is expanding our Sales Team!!  The Hotel  Step inside a legendary revival at The Watergate Hotel, a luxurious urban resort located along the banks of the Potomac River. Here modern design blends with a storied past to redefine luxury. A place where travel and business are occasions worth celebrating, attention to every detail is the standard, and intrigue can be found just beyond every curve.  Location  The Watergate Hotel is centrally located in Washington, D.C., a city of political power, prestige, and elegance is culturally rich with theaters, museums, architectural splendors and unforgettable national memorials. The Watergate Hotel is situated within walking distance of the best the city has to offer.  Strategic Intent  Manage accounts of 10 guestrooms or more per night to achieve guest satisfaction and to solicit past and new business to ensure all revenue goals are achieved or exceeded.  Organizational Structure  REPORTS TO: Director of Sales  General Duties And Responsibilities Move throughout property to conduct site inspections.Maximize revenue by selling all facets of the hotel, both orally and in written form to previous, current and potential clients. Interview, hire, train, recommend performance evaluations, resolve problems, provide open communication and recommend discipline and/or termination when appropriate. Handle account details so that all pertinent aspects of solicitation and closing are complete and documented.Coordinate various departments' participation in servicing accounts. Develop and conduct persuasive verbal sales presentations to prospective clients. Travel locally to conduct outside calls, promote the hotel and review competition. Prepare information for, meet with and entertain clients as deemed appropriate by potential business from that account. Represent hotel at trade shows.Set up exhibits involving bending, stooping, lifting and reaching overhead. Communicate both verbally and in writing to provide clear direction to staff. Comply with attendance rules and be available to work on a regular basis. Perform any other job related duties as assigned.  Experience And Requirements Minimum of 1+ years direct luxury hotel group sales management experience is required. Prior sales experience with key accounts within the luxury hotel segment will be strongly favored. Bachelor's degree in related field is required. Computer proficiency is required; must possess experience with Microsoft Outlook, Excel, Power Point, Word, and Delphi. Must be familiar with booking software and travel industry software. Excellent communication skills with fluency in English (both verbal and written). Must possess exceptionally strong and demonstrated presentation skills. Superior negotiation skills are required; must be able to persuade and influence key decision makers in the marketplace. Must be able to work a flexible schedule that will accommodate the achievement of all business goals and directives.
industries: Restaurants, Leisure, Travel & Tourism, and Hospitality

description: SafetyChain Software is looking for a driven, experienced and successful enterprise sales professional to join our SaaS Sales Team. Reporting to the Chief Revenue Officer, this role works closely with our business development reps and marketing team to identify, qualify and close business with leading personal care and food manufacturers in North America.  Ideal candidate is looking to utilize their prior production performance, quality and compliance experience to help production plants and distribution facilities in the Personal Care and Food & Beverage industry maximize the value of their electronic data records and online compliance programs.  The primary role for this position is to engage our buyers to build relationships. Experience in helping sell compliance, safety or quality systems is highly desired. As well, prior experience with OEE, Statistical Process Control and Quality is desired.  (Remote position preferably based in or around: Charlotte, Chicago, Austin, Nashville, Los Angeles, San Diego, Atlanta)   Who we are: SafetyChain is a fast growing, award-winning B2B SaaS software company focused on the food and beverage industry in North America. Our industry leading cloud-based solution is a Plant Management Platform that helps food and personal care companies improve productivity, profitability and compliance. We have a fast-paced team that work out of our two offices in Novato, CA and Evanston, IL and remotely, serving our customers in over 1,500 locations across the country. We operate with the fun and flexibility of a start-up combined with the stability of a more mature software company (8+ years). We believe in help and hustle and that doing both makes for a great place to work.  We strive to ensure we have an open and trusting culture, where every team member has a voice, feels valued, and where there are open lines of communication from the Sr. leadership throughout the organization.   What You Will Do: We are seeking a Regional Sales Manager who can initiate conversations with executives and program owners at leading personal care and food & beverage companies. Reporting to the Chief Revenue Office, the Regional Sales Manager will focus on new business with personal care manufacturers in the United States. Ideally, you will be located in Novato or Chicago, but for the right candidate other locations will be considered.  You are expected to build your own profitable pipeline through direct outreach to qualified prospects. We also support our RSMs with a strong marketing and business development team to collaboratively set qualified meetings.   Key Responsibilities Growing a profitable pipeline of opportunities through: Timely and relevant follow-up on inbound interest Account-based outbound and social selling supported by our sales development team with leading-edge tools Delivering on quota numbers aligned with company strategy and ambitious growth targets Negotiating commercial terms with win-win outcomes Using your direct experience of software in manufacturing environments to relate with prospective buyers This is an individual contributor role.   Our Ideal Candidate We hire sales executives who know how to build relationships in a longer, complex sales cycle, close deals and beat quota. This is not a transactional sale and we are not seeking a lone wolf. You must have a track record of evangelizing, building value by asking great questions and understanding a customer’s business challenges. If your teammates and customers are your greatest champions, this is the right job for you. Qualifications we’re looking for include: Successful track record in field sales carrying annual quota of $1M or more for 2+ years with a SaaS company Past experience teaching and leading groups Experience Leading and Managing sales teams 4+ years work for or with personal care and food & beverage companies Ability to walk a plant and help customers identify additional ways to leverage our software to improve customers overall ROI Direct experience with Performance and Compliance Programs including ISO, SQF, FSSC, etc. Experience with Statistical Process Control (SPC) and OEE. Experience with safety, quality and compliance systems. Skilled in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, and Visio). Professional presentation skills Self-starter with strong motivation to succeed. Committed to customer satisfaction and a passion for customer success. Ability to work through teams and independently, at multiple organizational levels. Ability to multi-task, prioritize and manage multiple projects. Extremely detail-oriented. Creative, consultative, and a strong communicator. Eagerness to learn new skills, grow professionally, and take on new challenges. Ability to travel to customer sites (30%).  Personal Attributes We Value Initiative: the ability to get started and work independently when necessary, to come up with ideas and carry them out. Process Driven: you are highly structured, disciplined and organized in creating and executing operational processes to ensure a consistent, repeatable outcome. Inquisitiveness: a desire to expand your knowledge base and explore concepts and ideas that are new and unfamiliar. Integrity: Ability to offer and solicit honest feedback and always have the best interests of the team and the customers in mind. Patience: the ability to adapt to changing situations while remaining calm, collected, and committed. Team Interactions: Seeks opportunities to collaborate and to help others. Self-improvement: Ability to identify mistakes and quickly adjust approach when confronted with new information or perspective. Work independently and as a team player in a team environment. Awesome attitude, great energy & relentless work ethic  Things that make the job awesome Competitive salary & commission plan ($200k OTE) Opportunity for stock options Health benefits Vacation Flex Schedule Work from Home Flexibility Fast growing tech company with big opportunity Great team and Culture

Modern Hire is a leader in the interview technology and assessment space and used by over 700 clients globally and almost half of the Fortune 100. As a Business Development Representative with Modern Hire you will be the liaison between our sales organization and our buyers. The Business Development Representative holds an important role at the top of the funnel for our sales organization.  In this role, you will generate qualified leads for the commercial team via cold calling, prospecting, lead follow up and account research. You will also work closely with the marketing team to help meet Modern Hire's aggressive growth goals while generating new business opportunities.  Day-to-day you'll:  Research accounts, identify key players, generate interest and develop accounts to stimulate business development Schedule discovery calls with qualified prospects Follow up on campaigns and provide detailed feedback on the success of each campaign to Sales and Marketing Managers Conduct high-level discovery and educational conversations with Senior Executives (C-Level, VP/Director, Manager) Work with account executives to generate opportunity pipeline of qualified prospects Stay up to date on industry trends and competition Record and document all calls and communication in Salesforce Learn and leverage additional marketing and sales technology stack such as LinkedIn Sales Navigator, OutReach, Marketo and ZoomInfo Utilize social media for sales opportunities and leads Report on weekly results both qualitative and quantitative Increase pipeline through demand generation and targeted campaigns Learn and maintain in-depth knowledge of Modern Hire product suite Collaborate with leadership on account strategy  If you can answer "yes" to the following, then we want you to apply!  Do you have at least one (1) year of sales experience including Lead Generation? Do you have demonstrated ability to meet and/or exceed determined sales and activity quotas? Do you have a proven track record of building strong relationships? Are you able to project a high level of professionalism, attention to detail and business acumen? Are you articulate and well spoken with excellent written and verbal communication skills? Are you able to understand prospect and market challenges? Do you have the confidence to ask questions? Are you intellectually curious with the ability to uncover business challenges? Are you resilient and adaptable? Are you able to engage and inspire others? Are you proficient in MS Office products? (Excel, Word, MS Outlook, MS PowerPoint) Do you have experience with Salesforce or another CRM Software? (preferred) Do you have experience with other sales tools such as OutReach, ZoomInfo, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, etc.? (preferred)    Modern Hire provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, citizenship status, gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, sexual orientation, transgender status, marital status, religion, creed, age, physical or mental disability, results of genetic testing, genetic information, past, present or prospective service in the military, or any other characteristic or activity protected under federal, state, or local law. Equal employment opportunity applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including but not limited to hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leave of absence, compensation, and training.

The sky is truly the limit in this expansion role! Looking for a true hunter that enjoys the thrill of the chase!  Benefits: Base + Uncapped Commission! Year 1 OTE ~$225K+! Clear Path to Growth and Promotion within ~12+ Months! Supportive Culture with Strong Leadership! Full Benefits + Expensed Travel + Car Allowance!  Requirements & Skills: 4-5+ Years of Experience Selling into Vascular Surgeons True Hunter with Track Record of Success!  If interested, please email your resume to lbrown@pursuitsalessolutions.com

description: H2O.ai is the open-source leader in AI with a mission to democratize AI for everyone. H2O.ai is transforming the use of AI with software with its category-creating visionary open-source machine learning platform, H2O. More than 18,000 companies use open-source H2O in mission-critical use cases for Finance, Insurance, Healthcare, Retail, Telco, Sales and Marketing. H2O Driverless AI uses "AI to do AI" in order to provide an easier, faster and cost-effective means of implementing data science. H2O.ai partners with leading technology companies such as NVIDIA, IBM, AWS, Intel, Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud Platform and is proud of its growing customer base which includes Capital One, Progressive Insurance, Comcast, Walgreens and MarketAxess. For more information and to learn more about how H2O.ai is driving an AI Transformation, visit .A  Are you a top performer at your current or previous company? Are you a self-starter that can talk to anyone? If so, read on.  H2O.ai is looking for exceptional candidates join our North America BDR team. This role will cover our Midwest region. As an H2O.ai Business Development Representative (BDR) you will be finding, engaging, and qualifying prospects to drive continued sales growth.  This role is based in the Midwest - US.  What You Will Do: Professionally and persistently follow up with inbound leads and outbound cold calls, emails, and LinkedIn Identify target prospects and perform analysis through a variety of online research methods Set up introductory calls with target influencers and decision makers; your job is to make sure a majority of these calls become qualified opportunities for our Account Executives Develop creative tactics and strategies to reach prospects Understand the latest industry trends Dedication to continuous learning Record and track activity in Salesforce.com  What You Bring: Proven industry-related inside sales experience Previous experience in cold calling sales pitches and prospect research Track record of over-achieving quota Experience working with Zoom, Salesforce.com, Outreach.io, ZoomInfo or similar tools Comfort-level with making a minimum of 50 targeted calls per day Excellent verbal and written communications skills Strong listening and presentation skills Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage ambiguity Effective time-management skills Able to effectively work remotely BA/BS degree or equivalent  Powered by JazzHR  XZPExdaIXN

description: Description  Amazon Advertising operates at the intersection of eCommerce and advertising, offering a rich array of advertising solutions. We partner with advertisers to reach Amazon customers on Amazon.com, across our other owned and operated sites, on other high quality sites across the web, and on millions of devices. If you’re interested in joining a rapidly growing organization working to build a unique, world-class advertising group with a relentless focus on the customer, you’ve come to the right place.  We’re looking for a results oriented Senior Account Manager who is passionate about partnering with our advertisers, educating them and helping to solve ambiguous business problems, mitigating risks before they become roadblocks. As a Senior Account Manager, you manage and deliver against complex advertiser goals and problems to drive revenue and achieve revenue targets. You nurture customer relationships and create revenue opportunities from the advertisers you own. You’ll not only dive deep into data to understand trends, but also communicate the “why” behind results and make actionable recommendations to internal and external stakeholders. Additionally, you’ll be able to leverage Amazon’s proprietary data to provide strategic and personalized recommendations, influencing both your internal team and your external customer to facilitate them reaching their business goals. This role is highly collaborative, working with Creative, Senior Sales, Product, and Retail partners and will drive process improvement to gain efficiency and foster collaboration. The Senior Account Manager’s strategic digital expertise and influence is considered critical to unlocking greater value and impact for our advertisers.  Responsibilities Become a knowledgeable partner and leader on Amazon Advertising solutions Deliver the highest level of sales and customer service to our clients. Retain and grow revenue from existing advertisers. Drive deals to closure in a new business environment. Develop annual media strategies for growth based on overall advertiser goals and objectives Develop campaign strategies and audience engagement recommendations Evaluate success metrics and drive campaign performance using data Perform in-depth data analysis to form and deliver actionable recommendations for both short- and long-term advertising strategy Educate advertisers on performance metrics, insights, and how to drive greater results Work cross-functionally with Senior Sales and other Amazon partners to drive incremental revenue and increase advertiser satisfaction  Basic Qualifications Bachelors’ degree in Economics, Marketing, Advertising, Statistics, Engineering or Business; MBA is a plus 5+ years relevant experience in a client facing role including but not limited to digital marketing, analytics etc. Preferred Qualifications Experience in Omni-channel marketing, display, over-the-top (OTT), or search marketing Adept at solving problems that span business and technology Influence process improvement that scales broadly; inventing and simplifying within existing processes Excellent organizational, relationship-building, and communication (written and verbal) skills Programmatic strategy and implementation experience Proven track record of delivering results (including revenue targets) and significantly contributing to advertiser revenue growth Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.   Company - Amazon Advertising LLC  Job ID: A1762879
industries: Computer Software, Information Technology and Services, and Internet

description: All over the world, in industries ranging from Utilities to Facilities Management, Chemicals, Manufacturing, Transportation, Oil & Gas and more, the company is helping it’s clients to reduce risk, improve safety performance, streamline processes, and most importantly–help our clients save lives.  Our proprietary SaaS platform helps clients identify and mitigate risk within their supply chains by simplifying the complex and time-consuming processes inherent with contractor management. Nature and Scope of Position The SaaS Regional Sales Manager owns the primary relationship with prospective clients before and during their buyer journey. Once a prospect is converted to a client, the Field Sales Manager owns and services the client relationship for the first year of the client’s term with company. After the first year, the relationship will be turned over to the Account Management Team for further support and expansion. Essential Duties and Responsibilities New Client Acquisition. The primary goal of the SaaS Sales Manager is to win new client relationships for Company. The SaaS Sales Manager will engage in a variety of sales activities including: Targeted prospecting with their assigned Sales Development Representative. Trade Show attendance Networking Conducting on-line Overview, Presentations and Product Demonstrations Traveling to client sites within the SaaS SM’s assigned territory and key accounts to conduct in-person meetings. Supporting New Clients through the initial launch phase and first year with company and maximizing revenue and client success within the first year. Weekly participation in 1 on 1’s and Field Sales Forecast call. Additional Responsibilities. May be required to attend additional trainings, meetings, and seminars. Performs other duties as assigned. Key Performance Metrics Potential candidates for the position must meet the following performance metrics: Minimum of 2 to 3 customer facing meetings each week Rolling 12-month pipeline of 3x Plan Consistent client “mailings” target quarterly (to be provided by your direct supervisor) Minimum Qualifications Excellent organizational skills.  Significant travel, meeting coordination, RFP/RFI/RFQ Response Coordination are required Superior Communication. Candidate must demonstrate superior interpersonal communication, and written communication skills. Strong Public Speaking. Candidate must have the demonstrated ability to speak in front of a group, keeping an audience’s attention while communicating complex subject matter. The speaker must appear comfortable and poised. Self-Motivated. Candidate must have the ability to set and meet goals with little or no supervision from senior management. Technical Understanding. Candidate must understand and be able to effectively communicate how SaaS model software works on a functional level, including basic ability to demonstrate product capability and overall solution to the client Ethical. Candidate must understand and demonstrate company’s core values of honesty and integrity. Candidate must be able to make decisions and communicate client recommendations with the company’s and the clients best interest at hand. Other Desired Traits: Excellent time management skills Technically sound in computer skills. Familiarity with CRM applications / SalesForce.com Problem analysis and problem-solving Attention to detail and accuracy Adaptability and Flexibility Education and Experience Potential candidates for the position must meet the following requirements: At least 5 years of field sales or account management experience, 10 years of experience preferred. Experience in selling safety-related products or services, working with contractors, working in procurement, or working in an industry that company has current customers is considered a plus.

Location: US  Prepare to spice up your day… and your career! We are looking for an individual who enjoys working in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment, likes a good challenge and is passionate about the restaurant industry. If you’ve got the appetite for a new job as a National Account Manager for McIlhenny Company, makers of TABASCO® Brand products, then we want to hear from you.  Your main focus will be to develop and maintain solid relationships within the top 200 restaurant chain accounts while providing best-in-class customer service. Reporting to the Director of Foodservice, you’ll be on the front line navigating the customer’s requests and working hand-in-hand with the whole foodservice team in order to profitably deliver results.   In this job, you’ll do things like: •   Build and maintain relationships with highly recognized restaurant chain accounts  •   Focus on the needs of the restaurant chain account and partner with the broker network when necessary •   Grow the foodservice business with restaurant chain accounts by driving the corporate strategy while supporting customer requests •   Drive the decision-making process by considering all options available to provide best-in-class customer service •   Show off masterful communication skills as you meticulously manage multiple projects and quickly respond to customers’ needs •   Closely monitor and analyze P&Ls to identify trends and build strategies for growth with full understanding of the impact of sales decisions •   Partner with internal team members from departments such as operations, finance, marketing, quality assurance, and legal to provide solutions •   Oversee and maintain the current ingredient business through the broker network  Must-haves to apply for this job: •   Bachelor’s Degree •   Minimum of 7+ years of sales experience with restaurant chain accounts •   Relationships with top 200 restaurant chain account  •   Experience with pricing strategy and revenue management  What will give you an edge: •   MBA or additional management and business development experience •   Experience identifying opportunities for and selling-in branded foodservice solutions/promotions  •   Ability to leverage trends and data •   Strong communication skills (written and verbal), interpersonal skills, decision making skills and strong analytical skills •   Excellent project management and organization skills •   Experience working with cross functional partners such as Finance, Purchasing, Logistics, Operations, and Marketing  The world-famous TABASCO® Brand products are made by McIlhenny Company, founded in 1868 on Avery Island, Louisiana. To this day, the company is still family-owned and operated on that very same site. Over 150 years later, TABASCO® Sauce is made much the same way, with three quality ingredients - distilled vinegar, red peppers, and salt - and loved by millions of people around the globe. We’ve come a long way from our beginnings in 1868. Our company size and culture allows self-starters to learn and grow in all kinds of ways.  Click “apply” so we can get to know you!  To be considered for the position, candidates must meet the minimum qualifications as outlined in the job ad.  Equal Opportunity Employer

The Regional Sales Manager is responsible for leading the successful sales operations and team of Territory Sales Managers within assigned geographic region (South Central), ensuring customer service excellence, the achievement of region goals, and contribution to overall profitability of the Company.  NOTE: This role can be located in Houston/Dallas/Austin  Primary Responsibilities: Builds, develops, and guides a high performance sales team in order to achieve organizational revenue expectations Advises sales team members on daily sales activities and strategies to maximize their impact Interfaces with Operational peers to ensure customer service excellence and the overall profitability of the company Develops annual sales goals/quotas which support achievement of the budget; monitors achievement of those goals and implements alternative strategies as necessary Meets overall budgeted sales and profit margin by soliciting, evaluating, selling, and confirming key business Interfaces with management peers within manufacturer partner organizations to maximize partnership success Delivers sales presentations to key clients and designs and proposes programs to meet client’s needs Stays abreast of competition, new developments, and sales methods and techniques within the industry Fosters strong internal and external partnerships to achieve company goals and provide service excellence  Key Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Sales, Marketing, Business Administration or related field Minimum 3 years previous work experience managing sales and marketing initiatives required Previous experience in the healthcare industry preferred, supervisory experience preferred Extensive travel required  Skills Required: Proven leadership skills Outstanding analytical and problem solving skills Excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills Proven relationship building and collaboration skills Proficient in Microsoft Office and CRM  Benefits: Competitive base salary Monthly and quarterly commission and bonus opportunities Monthly car allowance Comprehensive benefits package Generous PTO allowance Dynamic corporate culture  Powered by JazzHR  1aKL2hqsKp

description: Company Description  Club Automation is the leading club management software for health & athletic clubs and medical wellness centers. Club Automation’s comprehensive web-based solution currently serves over 400 enterprise-grade facilities nationwide. Increase revenue, reduce cost, and engage customers with our sophisticated, intuitive system backed by a team of industry experts.  Job Description  Job Summary:  The Account Executive find leads, close sales, support existing clients, formulate sales strategies, and communicate product value to clients. The Account Executive will primarily work with smaller accounts and focus much of their time on additional product sales.  The Account Executive reports to the Senior Territory Manager.  Essential Duties/Responsibilities Achieve sale quota monthly Stay current on company offerings and industry trends. Maintain a database of contact information. Build long-lasting, mutually beneficial relationships with external contacts and internal departments to create a better customer experience. Handle complaints and negotiations. Making cold calls or reaching out to prospects. Presenting and demonstrating the value of products and services to prospective buyers Compiling and analyzing data to find trends. 50% Travel Required Qualifications  Required Skills/Abilities: Strong interpersonal and communication skills Strong computer and multi-tasking skills Ability to work independently; take initiative; and demonstrate team accountability Ability to self-direct in order to handle and prioritize requests Proficient organizational/time management skills and attention to detail Create, build, and maintain relationships and rapport with clients Strong work ethic and ability to execute critical imperatives Database management skills Required Education And Experience High School Diploma or equivalent One (1) to Two (2) years of sales experience Experience using a CRM software, such as Salesforce Experience with Solutions Selling Preferred Education And Experience Bachelor’s degree Three (3) years of sales experience Additional Information  Our company, with a culture of collaboration, action, and entrepreneurship, has a well-deserved reputation of providing “career-defining” opportunities for team members willing to pursue them.  With a high value placed on taking care of our customers and our team members, we have frequently been recognized locally and nationally as best workplaces.  Some Of Our Favorites Include  We truly care for our team members, and this is reflected through our offices, benefits, and great perks. Flexible paid time off Affordable health insurance options Monthly fitness reimbursement 401(k) matching Casual work environment Plenty of free food and caffeine All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

description: Company Description  Accolade at a glance  Accolade provides personalized health and benefits solutions designed to empower every person to live their healthiest life. We help millions of people and their employers navigate the complexities of the healthcare system with empathy, expertise and through exceptional service while supporting them in lowering the cost of care and improving health outcomes. Accolade blends technology-enabled health and benefits solutions, specialized support from Accolade Health Assistants® and Clinicians and access to expert medical opinion services for high-cost treatment decisions. We consistently receive consumer satisfaction ratings over 90 percent and have been recognized by Inc. Magazine as a Top Place to Work 2020 and Business Intelligence for Excellence in Customer Service 2020. Please visit us on LinkedIn, Twitter, Instagram and Facebook and at accolade.com.  Job Description  Our Mid-Market team is expanding!  The Regional Sales Executive, Mid-Market is responsible for meeting or exceeding the annual bookings quota for the assigned territory.  This role must be based within and will cover the following territory:  Minneapolis, Wisconsin, Michigan, Illinois, Iowa, Missouri, Arkansas, Louisiana and Texas.  A day in the life… Consistently identifies opportunities, develops sales strategy and closes new business in the assigned middle market segment Identifies, develops and retains new business relationships Effectively presents Accolade’s offerings to qualified prospects Effectively leverages Accolade executives, the pre-sales team and services staff to support customer presentations Develops and executes strategies to generate cost effective sales leads Develops a pipeline of new sales opportunities in alignment with objectives that are established annually Develops and maintains an effective sales and market penetration plan for assigned territory Leverages the sales milestone process to ensure accuracy with monthly, quarterly and annual forecasts Documents all sales contacts, activities and sales process steps in Accolade’s sales tools and systems Solicits product and market feedback from customers, prospects and partners. Communicates this feedback to sales leadership, marketing and the product development team (feature requests, market trends, competition intelligence, new opportunities) Complies with all corporate policies and completes all administrative tasks on time Qualifications  What we are looking for… Minimum 8-10 years of strategic selling experience BA in a business or technical related area of study Experience selling complex, multi-stakeholder solutions. SaaS, health & welfare benefits, healthcare capital equipment, healthcare IT, health and welfare benefits outsourcing, human resources IT benefits software Embraces and thrives in a culture of transparency, accountability and trust Self-starter with ability to work independently, prioritize work and coordinate multiple tasks within tight time constraints Ability to navigate the strategic levels of customer organizations, identify key decision-makers, build relationships with senior executives and schedule meetings with key stakeholders Ability to establish strong team relationships in a matrix organization Ability to perform in a dynamic and fast-paced environment Possess account knowledge, executive-level customer contacts and industry relationships inside the employer market space Command of social media for the benefit of lead generation, gaining access to executives and networking with key stakeholders Strong aptitude with business software tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook etc) Strong business acumen Demonstrated ability to successfully negotiate complex contract Demonstrated ability to accurately forecast monthly, quarterly, and annual revenue Where permitted by applicable law, candidates must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by date of hire to be considered, if not currently employed by Accolade, Inc. description: Responsibilities: Hunting to Identify new business opportunities within National Sales Territory focused on the Mid Market and non-named National Account target market segments (up to 500 – 999 employees) Through direct calling, email and other contact efforts you will identify, qualify, and generate these new business opportunities by working directly with Key Decision Makers Compliment prospecting and selling efforts through field work such as building walks, lobby events, property management relationships, and customer face to face meetings Leverage consultative and relationship building selling techniques you will identify current and future connectivity solutions Help Cogent customers and prospects by positioning our services for new business Achieve monthly revenue goals by selling into the nation's largest commercial and retail buildings; office parks and professional campuses Qualifications: 2-5 years of solid, sales experience, preferably B2B and in the technology field Previous sales experience (recent experience strongly preferred) with a track record of success is required You must be able to demonstrate your ability to identify, qualify and generate new business through extensive prospecting and research Strong oral and written communication is required Ability to work in a fast paced, team environment with revenue deadlines Working knowledge of computer applications such as Microsoft Office and Salesforce are a plus A college degree is preferred but not required

Full-Time  Overview  We’re SmileDirectClub, and we believe everyone deserves a smile they’ll love. We also believe that you deserve a job you’ll love. Good thing you found us, and we found you. At SmileDirectClub, we’re all about empowering transformation. We want people to become more confident in how they look, how they feel, and how they think. So we’re spreading smiles and positivity all over the country.  It’s no small task. That’s why we’re looking for energetic, passionate, and confident team members who can help turn frowns, into life-changing grins. Are you up for it?  We are looking for a Regional Sales Manager (RSM) to join the SDC Partner Network team reporting to the National Sales Director . The Regional Sales Manager is responsible for achieving organizational sales objectives through effective leadership in the assigned area. The regional manager will lead, coach, and develop a highly talented cross functional team that excels in supporting the build-out of SDC Partner Network.  Responsibilities  Provide leadership and direction while meeting sales goals and managing the sales activities and development of sales representatives. Develop and implement strategic business plans to meet Regional, area and Company goals. Implement and uphold all company compliance policies and procedures for self and region. Create revenue budgets to reflect individual territory growth targets Develop and communicate the overall strategy. Work with field sales team to develop supporting tactics Establish performance metrics and communicate progress regularly Recruit and select qualified candidates to fill open sales positions within the Region. Build a strong regional team through evaluation of the activities and effectiveness of sales representatives on a consistent basis, providing guidance, coaching and support to increase competence. Develop and implement an effective territory business plan Travel with team members, bring business discussions to prospects and customers, provide a positive learning experience by example Set expectations, define goals, and stimulate desire to win as a team. Champion company vision and align team culture Actively support team efforts in all aspects of the business to create a stronger SDC presence in the market Qualifications  Previous successful related experience, including 7+ plus years of related industry experience, which includes a successful track record in customer relationship and account management in the appropriate industry segment Previous successful sales management experience Proven selling and customer relationship and territory management skills with the ability to navigate a sales process, maintaining existing relationships, and building in-roads into new/competitive accounts Demonstrated ability to recruit and retain diverse talent Proven success in coaching, mentoring and developing sales teams Strong analytical and reasoning skills and ability to leverage data to take corrective action Professional presence that influences desired results with both external and internal stakeholders Ability to effectively manage broad geography that includes hundreds of accounts Proven effective verbal, computer, written and presentation/communication skills Ability to quickly adapt and respond to job, environmental, and industry changes Demonstrated ability of critical and agile thinking Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, CRM Proficiency in using virtual tools such as Zoom and Microsoft Teams to execute account training and management. Benefits Of Joining The Club  Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance 401K with match PTO Aligner and Whitening Benefit Collaborative work environment and positive culture Company Profile  SmileDirectClub was founded on a simple belief: everyone deserves a smile they love. The Company is the first digital brand for straightening your smile, created after the realization that recent trends in 3D printing and telehealth could bring about disruptive change to the invisible aligner market by matching licensed professionals, a quality clear-aligner product, and customers together. By leveraging proprietary, cutting-edge technology, SmileDirectClub, LLC-affiliated dentists are providing greater access of care to consumers who couldn't otherwise afford orthodontic treatment to get a better smile. description: BlackLine, a rapidly growing financial software company, is looking for a Sales Executive. The ideal candidate would have prior experience selling enterprise software solutions to CFOs and Controllers of large corporations with annual revenue greater than $750M.  BlackLine is an employer of choice and offers robust compensation, great benefits and promotes a healthy work-life balance. It's fun to work in a company where people truly believe in what they're doing!    At Blackline, we're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business of enterprise applications.  Since being founded in 2001, BlackLine has become a leading provider of cloud software that automates and controls the entire financial close process. Our vision is to modernize the finance and accounting function to enable greater operational effectiveness and agility, and we are committed to delivering innovative solutions and services to empower accounting and finance leaders around the world to achieve Modern Finance.   Work, Play and Grow at BlackLine!  Make Your Mark: BlackLine empowers our team members to be change agents and is always seeking new and innovative ways to solve problems. We are experiencing explosive growth and looking for passionate and talented people to join our team. BlackLine, a rapidly growing financial software company, is looking for a Sales Executive. The ideal candidate would have prior experience selling enterprise software solutions to CFOs and Controllers of large corporations with annual revenue greater than $750M.  BlackLine is an employer of choice and offers robust compensation, great benefits, and promotes a healthy work-life balance. Your Impact: Prospect daily for new logo business and also within the assigned install base accounts Assist in establishing effective sales strategies and tactics that result in new business generation and expanding current business within assigned territory. Schedule and complete weekly activities which include cold calling, phone prospecting, and face-to-face meetings. Document daily activity in SalesForce to track performance. Update sales business plans on a monthly basis to optimize sales results Work closely with other departments and support staff to assist with coordination of RFPs, demos, legal contracts, implementation of software, and ensure client satisfaction. Achieve annual sales targets and average monthly revenue quotas on a consistent basis.  What You’ll Bring: 5+ years of experience selling enterprise, finance/accounting, and/or SaaS solutions People-oriented professional with strong relationship building skills and a proven track record of growing a territory Ability to be a knowledgeable adviser to clients and prospects with a well-developed consultative selling style Proven history of meeting quota consistently Excellent verbal and written communication skills Demonstrated success in understanding the Value-Based sales cycle (Discovery to Close) Strong negotiation skills Must be able to travel up to 50% of the time Adhere to the highest standards of integrity and professionalism We’re Even More Excited If You Have: A strong background in selling into the CFO’s organization and Accounting/Finance departments Experience selling SaaS software to large corporations Bachelor’s degree Thrive At BlackLine Because You Are Joining: A technology-based company with a sense of adventure and a vision for the future. Every door at BlackLine is open. Just bring your brains, your problem-solving skills, and be part of a winning team at the world's most trusted name in Finance Automation! A culture that is kind, open, and accepting. It’s a place where people can embrace what makes them unique, and the mix of cultural backgrounds and varying interests cultivates diverse thoughts and perspectives. A company that believes in providing the best possible service to its clients and that starts with offering amazing perks to its employees. These perks include 100% coverage for healthcare, vision, and dental, 401(k) matching, ESPP, food, drinks, games, and so much more! A culture where BlackLiners’ continued growth and learning is empowered. BlackLine offers a wide variety of professional development seminars and inclusive affinity groups to celebrate and support our diversity. BlackLine is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, race, age, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, ancestry, color, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, medical condition, genetic information, or any other protected class or category recognized by applicable equal employment opportunity or other similar laws.
