McKesson requires new employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 as defined by the CDC, subject to applicable, verified accommodation requests.  McKesson Corp is a Fortune 7 company and is one of the largest providers of medicines, pharmaceutical supplies and health information technology (IT) products and services in the United States with revenues of $208.4 billion in 2018. The company was founded in 1833 by John McKesson and Charles Olcott in New York with a focus on importing and wholesaling pharmaceutical products. United by our ICARE values, McKesson's 78,000 employees work together every day to make better care possible for patients around the globe.  Current Need  We are seeking a Primary Care Area Sales Manager to join our team in Texas. The ideal candidate will reside in the Dallas/Ft. Worth area.  Position Description  The Area Sales Manager (ASM) is accountable for leading a team of field sales account executives and achieving all financial objectives. The ASM is responsible for setting direction in alignment with business initiatives; for attracting and selecting talent; onboarding new employees to decrease time to productivity; driving performance through their team members by setting direction, providing feedback, and creating a trust-based, inclusive work environment; developing employees through coaching and feedback; rewarding and recognizing employees via ongoing recognition and core pay for-performance practices. Results are primarily achieved through the work of others and typically depend on the manager's ability to: leader change, inspire their team, influence and negotiate with parts of the organization where formal authority is not held. Provides leadership and direction to employees (sales and non-sales) either through other managers or directly to employees. The role requires engagement with customer/manufacturer partners and various McKesson specialists that support a segment or specific product category including LAB, Rx, McKesson Brands, Surgery Centers and Corporate Accounts.  Key Responsibilities Achieve Gross Profit goal and related MBO targets (set annually), through all key responsibilities. Participate in monthly check in with RVPs. Review performance to plan, MBO’s, company initiatives, key customer trends & personnel matters Adjust local tactics based on RVP guidance to enhance performance against goals. Create & execute local strategies to drive growth & team performance ASMs will embody our Enterprise culture and bring it to life with their teams. Model ICARE and ILEAD behaviors Communicate key corporate and BU messages to team Reward/recognize AEs as appropriate Promote team building Drive performance and development activities including but not limited to: leading through change, performance management of your team, self directed continuing education and training to increase sales & negotiations skills, keeping informed of industry trends and current events within McKesson. Effectively communicate to & motivate your team during team meetings, 1:1s, via email, etc. Ensure they understand McKesson’s strategy, local tactics and are armed to overachieve. Nurture and grow the sales competencies and capabilities of your sales teams through effective observation during ride-a-longs, coaching & co-selling. Hiring activities with a lens to improve team diversity. Tailor strategies & tactics for growth supporting priorities - Create, document & update annual strategic & tactical plans that balance local market realities with broader McKesson initiatives to ensure financial plan achievement. Grow existing portfolio including key customers through sales efforts focused on product penetration/ wallet share growth. ASMs will focus on top customers & model best practices for their AEs. Lead/own bi-annual business reviews with your market’s top 10 customers by revenue (or 1 per AE at a minimum) Conduct penetration activities targeted against top 20 customers by revenue in your local market Retention: Coach AE’s & get involved on behalf of customers to ensure account retention & growth. ASMs will ensure field adoption of selling McKesson’s specialized offerings that require specialist help. Work collaboratively with McKesson Sales Specialists to develop & adjust strategic sales plans targeting best opportunities, co-author related team communications and inspection of results. Utilize data & analytics to inform sales opportunity selection. Ensure Specialists can both initiate & support sales opportunities from beginning to end. ASMs will drive field adoption of available sales technologies to set direction, ensure understanding of opportunities & productivity, minimize waste and improve results. Minimum Requirements 9 years professional / sales experience 1-year leading people directly or indirectly Critical Skills Must have a valid driver's license and acceptable driving record Prior healthcare experience is preferred. Experience selling to C-suite Financial acumen (compare quarterly trends, year to year growth, margin erosion, etc.) Mature confidence and self-awareness (can influence others diplomatically) Superior communication skills Ability to make difficult decisions and have difficult conversations Demonstrated performance management skills Demonstrated sales leadership skills Proficiency with Excel, Power Point, Outlook, and CRM tools Experience in distribution sales Demonstrated success in building and growing a new region / territory Education 4-year degree in business or related field or equivalent experience Travel Ability to travel daily with some overnights within assigned territory up to 80% of the time. Physical Requirements General office demands Ability to travel by car for extended periods Must be authorized to work in the US. Sponsorship is not available for this position  We take pride in our culture of connection and believe in a workplace where everyone can be their full, authentic self. We welcome and encourage veterans, individuals with disabilities and others with diverse perspectives to join our growing team. Your unique perspective and experience are valuable assets that can translate into a rewarding career path with us. Apply to join our team and help shape the future of healthcare!  McKesson is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.Qualified applicants will not be disqualified from consideration for employment based upon criminal history.  McKesson is committed to being an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers including job seekers with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation to assist with your job search or application for employment, please contact us by sending an email to McKessonTalentAcquisition@mckesson.com . Resumes or CVs submitted to this email box will not be accepted.  Current employees must apply through the internal career site.  Join us at McKesson!

At Gladly, we're working hard to reimagine customer service so that customers can communicate across any channel and brands can connect in a more meaningful way. We're looking for someone who can build relationships with key executives within top consumer brands to help drive a more empathetic, personalized customer experience.  We believe exceptional customer service is about putting people at the center, not cases or tickets.  We are looking for someone to help us find the right people within top brands to grow our business. Partnering with our Enterprise and SMB/Mid Market sales teams, the ideal candidate is someone who is creative, humble, and hungry, collaborates well, and is detail-oriented. Having domain experience and a focus on metrics is ideal. This role offers the opportunity to be a part of an early-stage sales organization from the beginning as well as grow your career into a strategic seller with a supportive team that wants to help you thrive!  Backed by Greylock Partners, NEA, GGV, and JetBlue Technology Ventures, we are a different kind of start-up, one that puts people and culture first. Our seasoned team strikes the right balance of experience and innovation.  This remote position reports to our Sales Development Manager and supports teams throughout the U.S.  Responsibilities Develop creative outreach methods to actively engage new and existing leads by phone, email, and chat to attract new customers Generate first meetings and new business opportunities with hustle and creativity Work closely with Account Executives to develop strategies to target prospects and secure meetings Achieve monthly quotas of sales qualified opportunities for assigned territory Effectively use sales tools to run accounts through every step of the sales cycle Create and prioritize target account and contact lists  Preferred Experience: Strong work ethic and time management skills - You are proactive and execute with brilliant focus and a relentless spirit; A minimum of 1 year in a strategic SDR/BDR role in the SaaS/Software space Results-driven & competitive nature required Excellent written/verbal communication skills Ability to work in a fast-paced, team environment Good time management ability with strong organizational skills and attention to detail Ability to learn and understand new products and technology  At Gladly we value:  Putting people first - We built our product putting people at the heart of it all. And we’ve taken the same approach to building our company. Focusing on the customer - We treat our customers’ goals as our own, and we work hard to achieve them. Finding strengths in our differences - We believe that diversity and inclusion are foundational to our success. Bringing together a multitude of perspectives leads to amazing things happening. Being humble and hungry - We applaud initiative and value leadership—but we also believe that nobody is above emptying the dishwasher. Always learning - Everyone’s personal best is ahead of them. Seeking new ways to grow is what keeps us motivated. Owning it - We encourage everyone to seek and share feedback, take calculated risks, and learn from their mistakes. Communicating it - With an open and transparent culture, collaboration becomes a lifestyle and everyone has a voice  You can also count on: Competitive salary and stock options Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance Unlimited PTO Generous paid parental leave 401K Flexible Spending Accounts Wellness stipend  Founded in 2014 by a team of repeat entrepreneurs with multiple successful exits, Gladly is reinventing customer service. By managing customers instead of tickets, we are disrupting a $70B market and are proud to count REI, Warby Parker, Crate&Barrel, and many other innovative brands as customers. Gladly has raised over $110M from Greylock Partners, NEA, GGV Capital, Glynn Capital, and JetBlue Tech Ventures.  Gladly has made the decision to become a fully distributed company, allowing employees to live anywhere in the United States, and candidates to come from nearly any geographical region. That said, we also highly value our collaborative and creative culture and commit to meeting in real life as a company at least once per quarter when it is safe to do so.

jobTitle: Regional Sales Manager - Masoneilan Products (Gulf coast, Southeast)
description: Regional Sales Manager - Masoneilan Products  Are you passionate about being part of a successful team?  Do you like working in collaborative teams and solving critical issues?  Join our Team!  Our Turbomachinery & Process Solutions team provides industry-leading products and services that optimize the extraction, production and processing of energy. We help a diverse range of customers across the value chain to reduce operating costs and improve productivity.  Partner with the best  The BH-Masoneilan Regional Sales Manager is responsible for BH-Masoneilan sales growth for the selected region. The primary responsibilities are Channel Partner Management, regional growth strategies, customer technical presentations, and other sales duties that include communicating field issues, opportunities, and other relevant market data to factory and functional leaders.  As a Senior Channel Sales Manager you will be responsible for:  Develop robust sales opportunity pipeline for both direct and channel accounts and clearly document in CRM tools to drive operational focus and deal closure. Sales calls to key customers with regional Channel Partners and direct calls to strategic corporate accounts and major regional influence centers. Support regional Channel Partners with market analysis, strategy, and BH-Masoneilan resource allocation. Respond to all customer inquiries in a timely manner on the processing of customer orders, acknowledgements, Purchase Order amendments, and alteration notification. Clearly define and communicate problems as perceived by the customer. Manage the activities of supporting organizations to ensure that technical and business problems are resolved in the balanced interest of BH-Masoneilan and the customer. Develop and maintain a customer preference relationship toward BH products Monitor special programs and coordinate both internally and externally with the customer. Screen and analyze customer order practices looking for trends and unusual order practices to align with pricing policies. Provide liaison between Marketing, Quality, Operations, and Engineering to resolve product field issues.  Fuel your passion  To be successful in this role you will:  Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited college or university (OR High School Diploma / GED from an accredited school or institution with a minimum 10 years of experience in Sales, Customer & Product Support, Marketing and/or Services) At least 10 years of experience in application engineering, industrial sales, or customer service. Availability to travel for business up to 50% of the time.  Desired Characteristics  Master’s degree in engineering, business administration or engineering management from an accredited University or College. Experience working in diverse, virtual teams. Experience working with the application and administration of Control Valves. Proven ability to coordinate several projects simultaneously. Strong oral and written communication skills. Strong interpersonal and leadership skills. Technical Negotiation skills. Excellent presentation skills.  This position can be based in: Texas, Louisiana or Florida.  Work in a way that works for you  We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns:  Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit everything in and work when you are the most productive  Working with us  Our people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.  Working for you  Our inventions have revolutionized energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we have to push the boundaries today. We prioritize rewarding those who embrace change with a package that reflects how much we value their input. Join us, and you can expect:  Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activities Comprehensive private medical care options Safety net of life insurance and disability programs Tailored financial programs Additional elected or voluntary benefits  About Us  With operations in over 120 countries, we provide better solutions for our customers and richer opportunities for our people. As a leading partner to the energy industry, we're committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 and we're always looking for the right people to help us get there. People who are as passionate as we are about making energy safer, cleaner and more efficient.  Join Us  Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company with a global reach and exciting services and clients? Come join us and grow with a team of people who will energize and inspire you!  About Us:  With operations in over 120 countries, we provide better solutions for our customers and richer opportunities for our people. As a leading partner to the energy industry, we’re committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 and we’re always looking for the right people to help us get there. People who are as passionate as we are about making energy safer, cleaner and more efficient.  Join Us:  Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company that values innovation and progress? Join us and become part of a team of people who will challenge and inspire you! Let’s come together and take energy forward.  Baker Hughes Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  R34772

jobTitle: Regional Sales Manager, North East Territories, Swiss Dermatology Company
description: An established, stable, rapidly growing medical device company seeks District Sales Managers to lead the expansion and build out of our prescription portfolio in territories across the US. This person will grow and direct a Regional sales team that promotes prescription wound care products in women's health, oncology supportive care, wound care, and to surgical specialists. Due to the success of the products, the company is expanding its sales teams and needs experienced pharmaceutical sales management professionals to play a central role in taking the organization to the next level. These individuals will report to the head of National Sales Manager.  The company has a tremendous amount of clinical credibility and an extensive line of popular, science-based products that are directly prescribed or dispensed by doctors to their patients.  This firm is uniquely positioned for rapid growth and needs leaders that will be an ambassador internally and externally and represent the ethos and core values of the brand.  North East Territories include but are not limited to - Maine Boston Connetticut Long Island NYC UES NYC DT Detroit Cleveland Pittsburgh Columbus Cincinnati Buffalo New Jersey  Position Description (Brief Overview) Execute the regional Sales Strategy, drive corporate objectives and revenue growth Provide strong leadership for the regional sales function, set clear and unified direction for the team Expand the sales team: manage, stretch, and develop into top performing team Achieve revenue, profit, organizational, and strategic goals and objectives Enhance sales pipeline system: reporting, forecasting, performance: from lead generation to close Build relationships with Key Opinion Leaders, and Hospital Systems to deliver excellent service Establish and maintain top level contact with organization’s important internal stakeholders Oversee both Inside and Field-Based sales teams Develop annual sales business plans to drive revenue and increase market penetration Accurately forecast monthly, quarterly, and annual sales achievements Travel as necessary to visit sales team, major accounts, attend trade shows and key events Note: This is a heavy travel role; this person will be a “Field General”  Requirements  Qualifications/Requirements (Brief Overview) 10+ years sales management experience; extensive background working with prescription devices or drugs Successful experience building high performing teams of sales professional Existing relationships in women's health, oncology supportive care, medical aesthetics, and wound care, is desired Acute understanding of the competitor landscape Excellent commercial instincts, strong financial acumen and analytical skills, attention to detail Computer skills: CRM, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook Bachelor’s degree, (or industry experience in lieu of degree), Master’s degree a plus  Benefits  Key Points Industry/Product Category: women's health, oncology, wound care, dermatology, surgical Title: Regional Sales Manager Call Points: OBGyn's, Radiation Oncologists, Infusion Specialists, Surgeons*, Wound Care Specialists Scope: Regional responsibility may include inside Sales and Field-Based Sales Location: New York Compensation: Competitive with high commission aligned to performance, MBO's, and KPI's Fulltime, W2 position, benefits  The company have a range of highly marketable products and the resources to execute a successful expansion. This opportunity will see the successful candidate gain a role where they shall be part of an exciting growth story.

National Account Manager (West Region- LA or Midwest) Shorr Packaging Corporation is one of the largest independent packaging distribution firms in the nation. Our goal for over 90 years remains true to this day – to be a customer-focused, wholesale packaging company with the people, services and equipment to handle any request from boxes and materials to industrial packaging equipment repair. We identify opportunities to take cost out of packaging and put value in.  The National Account Manager will be responsible for identifying, targeting and closing national account opportunities within, but not limited to 3PL, E-Commerce, Manufacturing, Life Sciences and Integrator business segments. This position will require frequent travel to customer corporate locations as well as satellite sites throughout North America and ideally will be located in the West Coast or Midwest region of United States. Additional responsibilities include:  RESPONSIBILITIES Identifies national account opportunities outside of Shorr Packaging Close minimum of $5.0 million per year (run rate) in new to Shorr Packaging business. New accounts are identified as any account location that has not purchased from Shorr Packaging for more than twelve months. (focus on 3PL, E-Commerce, Manufacturing, Life Sciences and Integrator business segments). Maintains an active list of targeted accounts and prospects. Maintain a list of 10 plus current opportunities with activities documented. Refers to CRM to qualify that accounts are new to Shorr Packaging. Utilizes industry trade magazines, Zoom info, and referrals to identify and list potential national account status suspects. Leverages relationships with vendors and industry partners to identify additional opportunities. Builds and implements strategies to bring opportunities to a close. Engages with VP National Accounts and Branch Management to identify Account Executive (AE) to fulfill opportunity obligations in their market location. Guides assigned AE on implementation of sales strategy used to close account. Partners with Key Account Manager’s on national customer accounts transitioning after implementation  QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor's degree (B. A.) from four-year college or university or equivalent 10+ plus years sales experience and/or training within the packaging industry with a history of targeting and closing large opportunities strongly preferred Proven multi-site account management experience building relationships with C-level customers and providing solutions Experience partnering with Field Sales Professionals, internal and external customers Strong financial acumen and exceptional presentation and interpersonal skills Microsoft Office intermediate skill level with Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint  COMPANY PROFILE  Shorr Packaging has experienced significant growth and unparalleled customer service year after year. The company has provided business solutions through quality packaging systems, products, and technical service for more than 90 years. As an employee owned company since 1984, every member of the Shorr Packaging team is committed to the company's success. Today, Shorr has employee owners.in eight branch locations across the U.S. and represent premier manufacturers like 3M, Sealed Air, and Labtech.  The solution to our success is our people, both our customers and our employee owners.   Shorr Packaging Corp. is an Equal Opportunity Employer that provides employee owners with excellent compensation, 401K, employee stock (ESOP), medical, dental, life, and more.  Your opportunity to prosper professionally and financially is limitless!

Company Description  Alside, a division of Associated Materials Incorporated (“AMI”), is a federally designated essential business and recognized leader in the home improvement industry. Founded in 1947, Alside is a manufacturer and distributor of vinyl siding and accessories, vinyl windows and patio doors, and fencing and railing products for the residential and commercial remodeling and new construction markets. Alside products are distributed to licensed professional remodeling contractors and home builders through our network of over 100 Supply Centers and also through select independent distributors across the U.S. and Canada. We are proud to be a charter member of the Vinyl Siding Institute, the American Association of Architects, the National Association of Home Builders, and the National Association of the Remodeling Industry.  Job Description  SUMMARY:  Reporting to the Area Sales Manager, the individual in this role will be primarily responsible for developing target accounts and maintaining and driving new business within the Clifton, NJ market.  Sales Skills  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Leads all sales and account/planning, forecasting, reporting, management efforts for assigned accounts within territory Understands, assesses, and anticipates customers’ objectives, strategies, and requirements to identify and pursue sales opportunities Acquires new customers to maximize supply center revenue Responsible for escalated customer service issue follow-up, but not the primary contact point for issue resolution Management/Leadership Works closely with supply center and corporate resource to have them enter & fulfill orders Strong knowledge of the AMI sales process and policies (e.g., accruals, credit, expenses, rewards) Acts as a mentor for Sales Representatives Product/Market Brings core product specification knowledge, application, and value to the customer Understands necessary building codes and how they impact AMI products Reads blueprints and understands take-off capabilities for core products Sells remodeling, new construction, project work, and ISS Must be able to accurately and professionally demo all core products to small and large groups Must be able to accurately and professionally demo all core products to small and medium groups Understands the basics of negotiating correct market value pricing for the assigned territory, and seeks advice from the Area Sales Leader or Sr. Sales Manager Qualifications  Education And Experience Successful sales history with a minimum of 2 years of outside sales experience. Experience within the building materials industry is highly preferred. Bachelor's degree preferred Self-directed, highly organized, customer-focused, detail oriented, and competitive Working knowledge of core building material products (specifically windows & siding) for both single and multi-family applications Proven experience in new business selling, upselling, and selling Preferred experience working with builders and architects to create bigger ticket sales Additional Information  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.  Recruiters: Please note that Associated Materials, Alside and any of its affiliated companies does not seek or accept unsolicited resumes or offers of recruiting service associated with any published or unpublished employment opportunities. Any unsolicited information sent to AMI or any of its employees will be considered as unencumbered and free from any fee or charge whatsoever. Only members of our Human Resources Team have authority to engage or authorize recruiting services. Any questions regarding recruiting services of any kind must be sent to jobs at associatedmaterials dot com  #Indeed5-Alside

Company: Ansys Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation, helping the world's most innovative companies deliver radically better products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software, Ansys helps companies solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination.  SUMMARY The Sales Representative will increase new and existing business by adapting ANSYS engineering simulation products and solutions into customers’ engineering environments and product development processes, ultimately helping customers develop new products and improve existing products and processes. The Sales Representative will be responsible for driving sales from initial contact to close within an assigned geographical territory, and/or specified named accounts. Work will be done primarily via phone and web based meetings out of the ANSYS Canonsburg office.  RESPONSIBILITIES  Accountable to deliver quarterly and annual sales targets as well as intermediate sales forecasts Develop and manage pipeline and advance sales opportunities through sales process to close Perform online or face-to-face product sales presentations on ANSYS engineering simulation software solutions, provide quotations, negotiate deals, obtain purchase orders and contracts Conduct company / market / industry research, identify key stakeholders, understand decision processes and establish decision criteria within target companies Share relevant case studies and solution ROI metrics, and persuade key stakeholders to change / transform engineering design processes by implementing a recommended individual solution based on interpretation of target company information gained Regular and disciplined CRM usage regarding pipeline, sales forecast and opportunity / account / contact management Through continual contact with various levels and departments within customer organizations, extend and elevate relationships by working to further understand needs, barriers to simulation adoption, improvement opportunities and circumstances regarding the process of engineering product development  MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor’s degree in technical or business field Strong work ethic, and motivated to work in a high performing, results oriented environment Strong verbal and written communication skills required PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Preferred minimum of 1 year of work experience Monthly customer facing activities will be necessary to be successful in this role, which may require travel up to 25% Ability to gain and utilize the understanding of both engineering and physics applications Stay up-to-date on emerging technologies, engineering techniques and product development trends Internal drive and motivation to meet established goals related to activity levels Ability to coordinate and work will with other sales professionals  CULTURE AND VALUES Culture and values are incredibly important to Ansys. They inform us of who we are, of how we act. Values aren't posters hanging on a wall or about trite or glib slogans. They aren't about rules and regulations. They can't just be handed down the organization. They are shared beliefs – guideposts that we all follow when we're facing a challenge or a decision. Our values tell us how we live our lives; how we approach our jobs. Our values are crucial for fostering a culture of winning for our company: Customer focus Results and Accountability Innovation Transparency and Integrity Mastery Inclusiveness Sense of urgency Collaboration and Teamwork  WORKING AT ANSYS At Ansys, you will find yourself among the sharpest minds and most visionary of leaders, collectively aiming to change the world with innovative technology and remarkable solutions. With the prestigious reputation in servicing well-known, world-class companies, standards at Ansys are high, met by those willing to rise to the occasion and meet those challenges head-on. Because at Ansys, it’s about the learning, the discovery and the collaboration. It’s about the “what’s next” as much as the “mission accomplished”. It’s about the melding of disciplined intellect with strategic direction and results that have, can and will impact real people in real ways, forged within a working environment built on respect, autonomy and ethics.  At Ansys, you will find yourself among those eager to drive the world towards the next best thing with hands planted firmly on the wheel. Our team is passionate about pushing the limits of world-class simulation technology so our customers can turn their design concepts into successful, innovative products faster and at lower cost. As a measure of our success in attaining these goals, Ansys has been recognized as one of the world's most innovative companies by prestigious publications such as Bloomberg Businessweek and FORTUNE magazines.  Ansys is an S&P 500 company and a component of the NASDAQ-100.  Ansys is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.  Ansys does not accept unsolicited referrals for vacancies, and any unsolicited referral will become the property of Ansys. Upon hire, no fee will be owed to the agency, person, or entity.

At NTT we believe that by using innovative technology we can solve global challenges and create a world that is sustainable and secure. We are looking for curious people, from diverse backgrounds, that are keen to work in a fast-paced and agile environment.   At NTT we trust our employees to do the right thing, even when no one is watching, which is why we offer flexibility in the workplace. The majority of our roles are hybrid, meaning we encourage a balance of working from home and our local office. Ask our recruitment team if this is a hybrid role.  Want to be a part of our team? The Sales Specialist role is a quota-bearing sales persona and the purpose is to primarily pursue and land qualified leads identified by the Client Management team and Lead Generation Representatives. The Sales Specialist will identify new opportunities from a selection of existing accounts, and present solutions, value propositions, partner configurations, cost structures and revenue models to the client that meet their needs. The SS will work directly with clients at a variety of levels, as well as internal subject matter experts.  A substantial amount of time will be spent on engaged selling or supporting the sales process in partnership with Client Managers. Contribute to the pre-sales process by working with pre-sales architects to create the best solution design for the client.  Building and developing excellent stakeholder relationships with new and existing clients, whilst developing new business channels and territories will be a core focus of this role.  Responsibilities  Domain and industry Subject Matter Expert Maintain Subject matter expertise in a technology domain, multiple domains or solutions set Support the closure of sales based on technology domain knowledge Address the technology conceptual challenges during the sales process Maintain a high level of relevant product and service knowledge to have meaningful conversations with potential and existing clients Maintain awareness of the competitive landscape, market pricing and strategy and how to penetrate a new market Contribute to the knowledge base of NTT Ltd’s solutions and services within a practice area or service area by sharing best practices with internal teams, as well as client teams Work with relevant technology vendors and ensure deep understanding of their solutions and how it can contribute to our own solutions set  Client interaction and engagement, and understanding Uncover and understand client business goals Articulate the solution/deliverables that the client requires, as opposed to the products that they need to buy Articulate our value propositions throughout all steps in the sales process Conduct functional gap analysis and address business issues raised by clients Prepare and conduct client workshops and presentations Establish relationships with multiple client stakeholders and secure deals with clients to achieve assigned sales quotas and targets Use understanding of the client’s business and depth of knowledge on the technology-specific solution to personalise the recommended solution in line with the client’s need  Opportunity identification and closing sales Be able to spot new sales opportunities within an account and work with the sales teams to drive them to closure Pursue and land qualified leads identified by the client managers and other lead generation sources Work alongside Client Managers to support the sales process, position technology solutions and close the deal  Execute on the sales strategy Support the wider territory sales plan and execute the sales strategy, and based on that define your own plan for your solution to achieve your sales targets Develop and maintain clear account plans for appropriate clients and targets Discover, forecast and run opportunities in the medium and long-term  Defining deals Scope and document solutions to meet customer requirements Identify, assess and highlight client risks that could prove detrimental to the client’s organization and credibility  Supporting the Sales process Collaboratively work with sales teams, especially Client Managers, to successfully close the deal Partner with internal teams to ensure scope of work and proposals are tracked and managed Work closely with other in-territory counterparts and matrix teams to achieve the shared goal of growth Use NTT Ltd.’s sales methodologies and tools such as target plans, opportunity plans and account plans to drive the sales process Develop and implement an opportunity plan, to provide regular check-ins with the primary point of contact and have an established process for getting buy-in from all stakeholders  Knowledge, Skills and Attributes Required Demonstrate success in achieving and exceeding sales and financial goals Mastery in developing and encouraging meaningful customer relationships up to C-level, particularly CFO’s and CPO’s Delivery of engaging sales presentations. Proficiency in team selling approach In-depth knowledge of competitors and ability to apply competing successful sales strategies Ability to define sales strategy You will have a client centric approach, able to understand customer problems and find best fit solutions Flexible to adapt quickly to short, new missions or urgent deadlines Negotiation skills to craft solutions that are beneficial to customers, partners and NTT overall Strong business acumen Client Engagement and management Skills Sales Solution Skills You are a phenomenal teammate, you know how to drive sales teams and collaborate with them  Required experience Solid sales experience in a technology or services environment Sound understanding of IT Managed Services environment Demonstrable experience of solution-based selling with a proven track record of sales over-achievement Prior experience of selling complex solutions and services to C-Level clients Experience of resolving a wide range of issues in creative ways to meet targets and objectives Strong experience of networking with senior internal and external people in the specialist area of expertise Expert level capability and the ability to work independently with little instruction on day-to-day workload  Required Qualifications and Certifications A Degree in a Technical or Sales field are preferred but not essential Negotiation Skill methodologies such as Scotworks Solution Selling/SPIN skills Desirable: AWS Cloud Practitioner Essentials Training, MS Azure Fundamentals Training or latest equivalent are also desirable
industries: Telecommunications, Computer Networking, and Computer Software

description: HTE Automation, a Midwest leader in industrial automation, is hiring a Territory Sales Representative for Wichita, KS and surrounding counties.  OPPORTUNITY: As a Territory Sales Representative, you will manage all field sales in your territory for our entire line of robots (collaborative, traditional, mobile), automation conveyors, machine vision, PLC, HMI, VFD, servo motion, sensing and wiring solutions. This is a proactive new business development sales role targeting end users, machine builders, integrators and OEM’s. Collaborate with other individuals from our sales and marketing team on strategic opportunities where team work is necessary to earn new business. Expand our base of business at assigned or newly found accounts. Reporting directly to the Vice President of Sales, join a company that is committed to helping every employee maximize their talents and realize their aspirations.  KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES: Drive new business efforts and achieve defined quota. Monitor progress toward goals to reach objectives. Initiate and develop contact with key and target customers. Follow up with sales leads and schedule customer visits. Conduct product and solution demonstrations at customer sites. Convert customer inquiries into quotes to provide solutions. Monitor accounts and project coordination. Coordinate evaluations utilizing the Applications Engineering team. Coordinate quotes and sales collateral distribution to customers with Inside Sales. Maintain and continuously update project information for CRM. Assist at trade shows and other marketing events.  SUCCESS FACTORS: 3+ years of experience in manufacturing or technical sales preferred. Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical, Mechanical, Industrial Engineering. Proven sales experience using a defined sales process to deliver results. Track record for exceeding sales targets. Proven success at building rapport and productive customer relationships through effective communication at all levels (e.g. maintenance staff to C-level) Extensive experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Willing and open to learning new methods/processes. Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills. MS Office proficiency and sufficiency with web-based CRM tools. Able to travel up to 50% within territory. High energy, confident, and driven with a disciplined work ethic.  COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS: HTE Automation will reward your sales talents with a base salary of $80-85K, plus a commission incentive program. Total first year compensation expected to be $100K-120K+. You will also receive a competitive benefit package that includes, medical, dental, and life insurance, long-term disability, 2 weeks of vacation, holidays, a FSA Tax Sheltered Health Savings Plan, and a 401(k)retirement plan. We will provide a cell phone, fuel credit card for travel expenses, car allowance and all business expenses are reimbursed.  APPLY NOW: If you are a proven sales producer in automation solutions or material handling, we encourage you to apply online.  COMPANY: HTE Automation, based in St. Louis, MO, is the regional leader in supporting local manufacturers exceed production through-put goals. Our focus is on delivering proven, rapid ROI equipment solutions for Robots, PLC, HMI, Machine Vision, Safety, Conveyors and Parts Feeders, and advanced factory automation solutions. We help companies with advanced technology solutions to overcome persistent production problems and to meet the demands created on our customer’s plant floor. HTE Automation serves the needs of industrial manufacturers in Kansas, Missouri and Illinois.  To learn more about THE Automation Inc, visit: https://shop.hteautomation.com  Donna Wells, Senior HR Consultant Safari Solutions search19@safarisolutions.com   Business Development / manufacturing / industrial / sales / account manager / manufacturing automation solutions / account executive / Territory account manager /outside sales / sales rep / District sales / Territory Sales / sales engineer / industrial / technical sales / automation / Kansas City, MO / Wichita, KS / robotics / field sales / regional sales / material handling / Wichita State University – Allied Sciences / Electrical
industries: Industrial Automation, Mechanical or Industrial Engineering, and Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing

description: Role Partner Relationship Manager (Non-Sales)  Location Onsite in Orange, CA area OR Remote with travel  The Opportunity As a Partner Relationship Manager, you will set the bar for Operational excellence by developing and executing strategies to expand Partner Accounts effectively. This is an individual contributor and a true relationship manager role – it is not a sales role. Partner Relationship Managers own all interactions withing their Partner Portfolio and ensure Partners enjoy a high level of care an attention. The Partner RM will be expected to form a close working relationship as the primary contact for a defined group of Partners, including ISO, Agent, ISV, and Association partners.  We believe strongly in our value prop of aligning incentives with Partners, which the Partner RM will bring to life by cultivating strong relationships with key decision makers and C-level execs in the Partner Portfolio.  This is an excellent opportunity for someone who thrives in a role that values the importance of Customer Experience while contributing to a fun and high performing team.  The Company We are a full-service ISO Start-up with in-house Risk, Underwriting, and Support teams to meet client needs. Our individualized approach means our clients get tailored processing solutions, fast approvals, and access to advanced data and analytics tools. We serve eCommerce and Brick-and-Mortar clients with seamless, secure payments.  Our vision is to provide solutions that will change the way commerce happens at the point of sale and beyond. The solutions we provide to merchants, partners, and financial institutions will allow each to focus more on client experience than the act of the payment itself.  Main responsibilities ●    Build and nurture strong relationships across new and existing high-value Partners to better achieve their needs and manage all reporting of health within accounts. Partner portfolio includes Agents, ISOs, ISVs, and Associations. ●    Act as a liaison between the Underwriting and Partner team to help facilitate incoming business. ●    Act as point of contact with key Partners, answering questions and solving various issues in a timely and efficient manner. ●    Communicate with internal departments as needed (Support, Dev Team, Exec Team) to resolve partner issues and queries. ●    Demonstrate expertise in payment/merchant processing, specifically in Brick & Mortar types of merchant business. ●    Drive spend across your book of business by owning renewals, expansions, and overall growth across different types of accounts ●    Meet regularly with customers to identify opportunities for growth within our platform ●    Partner cross functionally with Sales, Support, Marketing, and Operations teams to drive efficiencies throughout the account lifecycle ●    Anticipate customers’ needs to identify growth opportunities across various types of accounts  Key skills and experience ●    At least 3 years of experience in Relationship Management, Account Management, or Customer Success at a payments company. Ideal experience involves training other Relationship Managers. ●    Experience managing de-escalations and coordinating feedback and discussions between customer\product teams ●    Ability to work and learn at a fast pace. ●    Ability to build rapport and trust with champions and your colleagues in a remote setting. ●    Organizational, project management, and time management skills a must. ●    Excellent verbal and written communication skills as well as interpersonal skills a must. ●    Experience with Start-ups a plus. ●    Passionate about joining a small team and building a company. ●    Onsite in Orange, CA area, OR ●    Remote with travel ●    Company is unable to sponsor a Visa.
industries: Banking, Financial Services, and Information Technology and Services

description: Zest AI has been perfecting AI for consumer lending decisions since 2009. Our Model Management System helps lenders make better decisions and better loans—increasing revenue, reducing risk, and automating compliance. Our mission is to make fair and transparent credit available to everyone, and our software creates some of the most inclusive risk models in the industry. Using Zest-built machine learning software, financial institutions can dramatically expand credit access to deserving people with no added risk. Learn more at Zest.ai and connect with us on Twitter @Zest_AI or our Insights blog.  Account Executive The ideal candidates will possess strong sales, interpersonal and organizational skills. They should be comfortable with multitasking and budget their resources to meet the assigned quotas for their role.   Responsibilities Build and maintain client relationships Track and record metrics throughout the sales process Meet and exceed financial goals Understand and keep up to date with industry and competitive landscape knowledge  Qualifications Bachelor's degree 2-3 years of business experience Strong written and verbal communication skills Strong organizational skills Proficiency in Microsoft Office Ability to harness financial data to inform decisions  Business Development Representative The ideal candidate will cultivate relationships with prospective clients to catalyze business development success. This individual will schedule meetings with clients to understand their needs, and they will also work closely with sales and marketing teams to uncover new leads.   Responsibilities Generate appointments through proactive outbound prospecting Work directly with sales and marketing to discover opportunities from leads Demonstrate and teach strong selling and influencing skills  Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience 5+ years of experience in a related role Strong communication and time management skills

Upper Midwest (MN, ND, NE, SD)  SUMMARY: Working with a regional team, the Territory Sales Manager is responsible for growing our pet food brands and brand awareness throughout the region. Successful team player, growth within established account base and developing accounts within territory. Central location (Minneapolis/St. Paul, MN or Omaha, NE) preferred. Approximately 50-60% overnight travel.  Competitive salary and commissions; medical, dental, vision; 401k with company match; vacation and holidays; travel/equipment/expenses paid.  KEY PERFORMANCE MEASURES Meet and exceed sales goals and objectives Offer great support to our retailers and customers Develop and execute innovative/creative strategies Professional representation of our company and brands Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities Effective selling skills, pet food sales experience preferred Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, effective presentation skills Positive attitude and team player Computer/mobile technology proficient Valid driver’s license, presentable transportation and insurance Nunn Milling Company, an affiliated company to Midwestern Pet Foods, Inc., was founded in 1926 in Evansville, Indiana, as a miller of flour and corn meal. In the 1940s the company began using the basic ingredients from its milling operations to produce dog and cat food. As a result of increasing sales of the pet food, Midwestern Pet Foods, Inc. was founded in 1982. Today, Midwestern Pet Foods, Inc. owns and operates four state-of-the-art, high capacity dry pet food production and packing facilities. Company headquarters is located in Evansville, Indiana, with plants in Monmouth, Illinois, Chickasha, Oklahoma and Waverly, New York. Midwestern Pet Foods, Inc. employs approximately 320 employees. Nunn Milling has a facility in Evansville as well and employees about 10 employees.
industries: Food & Beverages, Food Production, and Consumer Goods

description: About Lemon Perfect:  Meet the new squeeze on hydration! Lemon Perfect is a super-refreshing, great-tasting, and hydrating flavored lemon water with zero sugar and no artificial flavors or sweeteners. Lemon Perfect is widely considered by industry insiders to be one of the most scalable, exciting and innovative emerging beverage concepts in the marketplace.  Founded by Yanni Hufnagel in 2017, the Company’s mission is to democratize drinkable wellness by making Lemon Perfect accessible for anyone, anytime, anywhere.  The Lemon Perfect Company is headquartered in Atlanta, GA.  Position Summary:  Lemon Perfect is seeking a high-performing Area Sales Manager based in the Rochester or the upstate New York region who brings significant ambition, strong leadership qualities, and a desire to join a winning team. This position will report to the District Sales Manager in the Metro Atlantic Region. The main focus for this role will be growing our presence and performance within Wegmans, a northeast based chain with nationwide influence.  As an Area Sales Manager, you will play a critical role in growing Lemon Perfect sales and visibility within your territory. Key responsibilities for the role include growing our in-store business by visiting accounts to provide in-store support and build relationships under the roof of the retailer. The ideal candidate is self-driven, motivated, outgoing, competitive and hungry to be a part of an exciting, fast-paced, innovative company that is making a difference in the enhanced-water landscape.  Salary:  Commensurate with experience  Responsibilities: Foster the development, sales, and promotion of the brand and build brand loyalty both nationally and at store level. Build and maintain relationships with buyers at the store level. Manage existing accounts and gain additional placements within stores, including secondary points of purchase and cold placement. Communicate successes, competition trends, deals, product introductions and opportunities via weekly sales recaps to their District Manager Execute available monthly deals at store level to maximize brand potential and eliminate out of stock situations Identify locations that can benefit from in-store samplings/educations and facilitate with store manager/grocery manager Execute P.O.S., cooler, and secondary placement opportunities using tools provided from the District Manager Perform demos as needed. Plan out and prioritize weekly strategies to optimize field time – roughly hitting 10-15 accounts daily, closing voids, increasing shelf presence, merchandising, and taking reorders from store managers Logging field data into Shelvspace, a SaaS tool we use in the field. Ensure execution of new product launches, promotions, and secondary placements. Effective merchandising in-store with POS materials. Wearing and utilizing branded gear (shirts, sweaters, hats) and keeping cold product in your car or backpack for in-store sampling. Provide weekly recaps and updates from the field. May travel to support new openings or to support growth initiatives Approximately 95% of your time in the field visiting accounts.  Requirements Deeply passionate about the brand, inspired by what we represent, and have a desire to make an impact to bring more customers into Lemon Perfect Obsession for understanding customer behavior: lives, breathes, and dreams about how to better reach and understand our consumer Enthusiastic and comfortable working in a start-up organization (think rapid growth / ever-changing environment) 2+ years of experience in sales (if you do not have this, please still apply!) Strong planning, organizational, project management along with excellent interpersonal, written/oral communication and presentation skills Ability to take initiative and work autonomously – you can run with something from beginning to end Works well with ambiguity – can navigate in the grey and asks the right questions to get at the solution Analyze opportunities quickly and have an ability to execute company goals efficiently Resourcefulness to improvise and adapt to deal with daily challenges via creative problem solving. Clean driver’s license, reliable transportation and proof of insurance Ability to lift 50 pounds Must be able to use basic features in MS Office Suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, Powerpoint)  Benefits  Strong benefits package; equity plan participation
industries: Food & Beverages, Consumer Goods, and Retail

description: We are looking for a sales development team lead who is ready to manage their own team. This candidate is currently part of a successful B2B software sales development program and who has demonstrated their ability to lead, coach, mentor, and motivate their teammates. You should bring a proven track record of success in achieving lead generation targets and previous experience in mentoring others. You will align outbound lead generation goals, strategy, and tactics to our go-to-market initiatives in the marketing organization and collaborate closely with our sales department to maximize pipeline creation.   Core Responsibilities  Set and define the Sales Development strategy  Experiment with and refine the process over time  Hire, onboard, and develop new Sales Development Representatives  Maintain a strong focus on outcomes and impact  Develop your team’s skills for prospecting, qualifying, and Opportunity creation  Provide regular coaching, feedback, and professional development  Closely monitor metrics with the aim to increase productivity  Work closely with sales team and account executives to ensure proper alignment on account coverage, target personas, opportunity quality and SDR to AE hand-off  Articulate the business value of SensrTrx, maintain in-depth knowledge of our solution and industry trends    Requirements  Minimum 1+ years working as an SDR/BDR (startup/growth-stage experience highly preferred)  Strong professional, articulate phone presence   Excellent leadership, interpersonal, communication and conflict resolution skills  Effective presentation and listening skills  Experience working with C-Suite Executives  Understanding of workflow sequences in HubSpot  Outgoing demeanor  Self-motivated  Organized  Competitive   Ability to handle objections and rejections  Comfort working in fast-paced environments and ability to work through unknowns   Compensation Salary Commissions paid monthly Potential for equity Health insurance 401K  Salary between 35k - 60k depending on experience, 100k OTE. SensrTrx is manufacturing productivity and analytics software that provides real-time visibility on the factory floor that helps reduce downtime, improve on-time delivery, and increase profitability of manufacturing companies.  SensrTrx empowers manufacturers to start small, think big, move fast, and easily grow from a single machine at one plant to thousands of machines across the globe with manufacturing productivity and analytics software.

Are you a self-motivated and gregarious business development representative that wants to make money selling an innovative technology? Do you want to join a high energy company with an amazing culture? If you thrive in a competitive and collaborative team environment then this may be position for you!  About Us  ChowNow is unique among tech startups in the restaurant space. We power branded online ordering systems for independent restaurants across North America – via websites, Google, Instagram, and through branded iOS and Android apps – and we do it all for a reasonable monthly fee regardless of order volume. We operate this way because of our belief in being fair, sustainable, and equitable with our restaurant partners. And the same goes for our workplace.  Diversity, teamwork, and mutual respect are among our core company values. And we pride ourselves on giving our teams plenty of opportunities to make their mark. To date we’ve created over 20,000 apps for our restaurant partners – something that’s never been done before in our category. And as we expand to new markets, further spreading the word about the ChowNow difference, those opportunities to create, build, and grow will only increase. If this sounds like the kind of workplace, and the kind of mission, that appeals to you, we’d love to talk.  Learn more by checking out our reviews on Glassdoor (they’re excellent). Together we can preserve neighborhood flavor, one restaurant at a time.  About The Position  The Territory Sales Manager role is a full-time, high base salary + generous commission outside sales position based in Manhattan, NY. You will sell online ordering and marketing solutions in person within an assigned territory. Most of your time will be spent in the field or working from your home office…which provides lots of freedom and requires self-discipline. We’ll provide you with the right tools and on-going training while you grow our restaurant network and grow your career.  As a Territory Sales Manager, You'll... Execute a buyer centric sales process. This is about solving real problems, not just pitching. Become a world-class social seller and subject matter expert within online ordering and restaurant marketing. This requires building your personal brand online. Meet and exceed a fair quota for new restaurant accounts. Prospect for potential restaurant partners through Internet research, social media, cold calling, “cold walk in’s”, and real world networking. Connect with restaurant owners online, on the phone and in person. Owners are tough to catch so you’ll have to be creative and persistent. Demo ChowNow as a solution to a restaurant owner’s problems & negotiate agreements. Hand-hold restaurants during the setup process while transitioning the relationships to a ChowNow Account Manager. Within 30 Days, You'll... Progress through our Ramp Camp (ChowNow’s New Hire Onboarding Experience). Learn the suite of ChowNow products; be able to discuss the ChowNow origin story with prospective clients. Learn to navigate through salesforce (Creating Leads, Opportunities, Flipping Accounts to “Closed Won” - YESSS!) Start to master your ChowNow pitch, from your elevator pitch to close. Learn the lay of the land, begin to understand your territory at greater length and strategize on what’s your first and next move. (Start to generate leads/ opportunities out in the field). Learn the sales process from A to Z (From finding the leads, to saying hello, to asking for the close and finally making sure everything is correct in Salesforce). Start to build a relationship with your SDR. Within 60 Days, You'll... Hit/ Exceed your ramp quota. Learn to manage your calendar and travel schedule. Become a road warrior by driving activity out in the field. Start to maximize your efficiency and organization . Begin to build relationships with our partnerships (US Foods). Continue to develop your relationship with your SDR, learn how to strategize and become more efficient in the field. Within 90 Days, You'll... Hit/Exceed your ramp quota. Fully understand the sales cycle. Be on your way to become a sales guru. Build a book of relationships with our partnerships that you will use throughout your career here at ChowNow. You Should Apply If You’re an experienced, hungry sales professional with 3+ years of experience, and a proven track record of winning deals in a short sales cycle. You enjoy the entire sales process (prospecting, qualifying, positioning, closing, and supporting client onboarding). You’re genuinely curious about people, local restaurants, and food trends. You enjoy build lasting relationships that enable you to build a book of business where referrals are the norm. You practice as hard as you play. You’re a market expert, you know your competitors, you’re up to date on the latest trends, you’re coachable, and you’re willing to put in the time to master your craft to understand how your buyer makes decisions. Sales to restaurants a BIG plus. The ability to thrive while working in the field with your own home office is a HUGE plus. About Our Benefits Competitive Salary Ongoing training and growth opportunities. A "Best Place to Work" winner multiple times where we focus on creating a great employee experience. A remote first culture and monthly stipend offering flexibility to work where you want and how you want. Rock solid medical, dental, and vision plans. Mental Health Coverage - we offer several programs to support your mental health and wellness goals. 3 weeks paid vacation; paid holidays; we expect you to work hard, but still enjoy your personal life 7 weeks of baby bonding time for all new parents (within the first year of birth or adoption), 8 Weeks of Paid Pregnancy Leave. 401(k) Matching Employer-contributing student loan assistance program. Location: Preferably New York, Washington or Miami  Type: Full-time  Experience: Mid-Senior level  Position taking: Immediately  Salary: According to background and experience  This is an exciting opportunity for an applicant with an outstanding track record in selling high-technology products to US broadcasters and Video Professionals.  Working under the leadership of one of our Sales Directors, responsibilities will include: Managing the complete sales cycle, from lead generation to deal closures Traveling extensively across across the USA (up to 50-75%) to make presentations to prospective key accounts and close deals Defining and applying the business strategy for your area jointly with the Sales Director Extending our network and ensuring coordination among master distributor, integrators and resellers Representing AVIWEST at major domestic and international Broadcast exhibitions linked to your area Monitoring leads and projects following internal processes using the company’s CRM Sharing customer feedback with the marketing and R&D teams The applicant will have an excellent understanding of IP networks and a background in broadcast, as well as a proven record of sales experience in the broadcast and/or security markets.

Description  The Strategic Account Services (SAS) organization is seeking a Manager, Account Management to lead a team of Account Managers responsible for the growth and development of some of the most influential sellers in the Amazon store.  The ideal candidate thrives in an ambiguous environment where they must develop, implement, and iterate on business strategies to deliver growth and positive experience for sellers. This person has relentlessly high standards and operates as a business owner who understand key levers to achieve results through their team. They have a passion for people management and are at their best when they’re building, developing and guiding high-performing teams.  In this role, you will be responsible for all business and operational objectives of your Account Management team (6-7 direct reports). You’ll drive the creation and execution of strategies to achieve business goals and collaborate across your team to explore innovative ways to identify and optimize growth levers such as selection expansion, merchandising strategy, brand positioning, and catalog quality.  If you are interested in growing brands and businesses on Amazon, then we’re interested in talking to you!  ROLES AND RESPONSIBILTIES  Business Growth Contribute to goal setting for your team to align with organizational goals. Contribute to business strategy development and identify the correct input metrics that drive growth and improve the end customer experience, in collaboration with cross-functional teams and other Amazon programs. Possess the ability to manage and deliver against complex goals where strategy is not defined. Able to make tradeoffs between short term seller needs and longer term strategic investment. Implement and track metrics to record the success and quality of your team’s sellers. Use these metrics to guide your work and uncover hidden areas of opportunity. Relationship Management Build and cultivate strong relationships with sellers in your team’s portfolio along with internal stakeholders; be a trusted advisor and a business advocate. Monitor seller satisfaction survey results to investigate both positive and negative feedback trends. Establish improvement plans and manage expectations with Account Managers as appropriate. Process Excellence Use customer feedback, market growth trends, and analyze key metrics to contribute to strategic development of features and programs that accelerate seller’s growth and improve their experience working with Amazon. Spot areas of unnecessary process or inefficiencies and work to simplify. Identify, optimize, and scale improvements that can benefit a large set of customers, e.g. driving efficiencies through tools and processes, simplifying SOPs, etc., working across multiple organizations. Develop mechanisms to create accountability. Leadership Manage a team of Account Managers (6-7 direct reports) Act as a thought leader in defining success criteria and understand business needs of sellers in an ever-changing business environment. Contribute to strategic plans and documents for the organization. Partner with external teams including Category Management, Finance, Global Account Management, and Central Support teams to align programs and initiatives to drive growth. Manage recruiting and hiring efforts across direct team and broader organization. Coach, mentor, and develop your team.  Basic Qualifications Experience: 4+ years managing a team of 6-8. 6+ years professional experience within Account Management, Sales, Customer Success, Vendor Management, and/or Business Development Demonstrated success managing a team with a track record of developing a high performing team. Education: Bachelor's degree or equivalent. Goal Attainment: Demonstrated success in exceeding business, territory, and/or account goals using a consultative, solutions-focused approach. Relationship Development: Proven track record of building and cultivating relationships with internal and external stakeholders driving resolutions collaboratively, resolving conflicts, and ensuring follow-through with excellent verbal and written communication. Data Interpretation: Experience using data to inform, report, and forecast for the purpose of making business decisions. Planning: Track record of developing long term business, territory, and/or account strategy with a demonstrated ability to effectively manage multiple complex projects and priorities across different teams and organizations, in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. Aspiring: Demonstrated ability to overcome and work around problems that are inevitable in ambiguous and rapidly growing business. Preferred Qualifications Experience: 10+ years professional experience within Account Management, Sales, Customer Success, Vendor Management, and/or Business Development. Experience in E-Commerce, Retail, Consulting and/or B2B Education: MBA Experience and expertise communicating/influencing senior business decision makers (C-level) Effective territory/account management strategy development with multi-phase execution and delivery: planning, opportunity qualification and creation, stakeholder and executive communication, needs analysis, value engineering, services/partner engagement, opportunity management, and negotiation. Experience using analytical, account management, and productivity tools including Oracle Business Intelligence, CRM tools like SalesForce, Tableau, and Microsoft Office Suites. Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, visit US Disability Accommodations.   Company - Amazon.com Services LLC  Job ID: A1626554

description: Job Summary: Essnova is looking for a Federal Sales Professional to provide a wide range of sales, business development, capture services in our federal government/public sector business unit. Develop new business opportunities to grow our portfolio, proactively prospect potential new accounts for growth, and develop and build solid relationships with new customers to shape and expand our VAR business expansion.  Essnova is looking for a dynamic, seasoned, profession, driven, and goal-oriented ‘hunter’ who can drive our sales to the next level in the Federal marketplace. Drive and Determination are key qualities we look for in our team, so if that describes you- Essnova may be the right fit! Our objective is continual growth and dominating our market.  We are looking for someone to: Develop new business Opportunities and Partnerships drive through Stage Gate Review process (Discovery – Qualify – Pursuit) implements strategies for winning new business and retaining existing clients Identify clients and key decision-makers within prospective client’s organization Develops relationships with current and future partner and other strategic alliances so that Essnova delivers an enhanced value proposition Develops/maintains proposal schedule, plans, outlines, assignments, baselines, and storyboards. Prepares/gives sales presentations to prospective customers. Collaborates with management, Subject Matter Experts (SME), and other staff to develop a high quality, winning proposal  About Us: Essnova is the 11th fastest growing federal contractor in the United States with its CEO awarded the SBA’s 2020 Alabama Small Business Person of the Year. This means that working with Essnova requires familiarity with a fast-paced atmosphere, excellence in professionalism, versatility in skills, unquestionable ethics and integrity, and a task-oriented nature. Essnova offers highly diversified technology and professional services to the federal govt including software development, integration, and VAR/reseller services. We provide specialization in SETA Services, Geospatial Services, as well as a full spectrum of Medical and Administrative staffing services.  Location: Washington DC; Huntsville, Alabama, Atlanta, Georgia; or Huntsville/Birmingham/Montgomery, AL  Hours: Full time  Environment: Essnova is the 11th fastest growing federal contractor in the United States with its CEO awarded the SBA’s 2020 Alabama Small Business Person of the Year. This means that working with Essnova requires familiarity with a fast-paced atmosphere, excellence in professionalism, versatility in skills, unquestionable ethics and integrity, and a task-oriented nature.  About Us: Essnova offers highly diversified technology and professional services to the federal govt including SW development, integration, VAR/reseller services, with our programmatic support – we offer administrative, program and project management services. Sectors include technology, SETA, geospatial, environmental spread across multiple NAICS codes  Location: Remote, preferable in the high federal/public-sector presence areas like Washington DC, Huntsville Alabama, Atlanta Georgia, Colorado Springs, etc.  Hours: Full time  Compensation: Base + Compensation, extensive earning potential  (Base from 65K - 100K, depends hugely on your experience, rolodex, win rate)  What You Will Need: Required: 5+ years of public sector business development/sales experience with Federal & DoD agencies 3-5 large contract wins with key individual contributions Proven Ability to navigate Federal Departments and/or Agencies contracting hierarchy Proven success working in a small team/business environment. Strong relationships and contacts with OEMs and both Large and Small Contractors Understanding of Technology space including – Software Development, Cyber, Cloud and other emerging technologies Experience with GovWin, FPDS, beta.SAM and other government and business intelligence platforms Associates Degree in business administration, computer science, or other related fields  Preferred: Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science or other related fields   Response Requirements: 3-5 references required Work history for the past 10 yrs A resume demonstrating your experience and passion to be successful in this role.   We welcome you to take our culture survey to ensure mutual fit, this will help us streamline/fast-track your application process. https://take.surveys.ci/s/T3pyCnV4Q2/59960  Essnova Solutions, Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We comply with all associated and required Federal Regulations and affirm that all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.
