description: Job Title: Sales Executive  Location: Walnut Creek  Reports to: VP of Strategic Partnerships  Do you want to transform healthcare and help people all at the same time? Well, you’re not alone. In fact, you might just be our next Sales Executive.  PointCare’s mission is to make public health coverage work for the 75M Americans who can’t afford healthcare and don’t know how to access it properly. We do this by transforming how providers manage millions of patients and their coverage, and we believe that fixing problems in coverage management will increase the quality and reduce the cost of healthcare for everyone.  At PointCare we come to our Walnut Creek, CA office hyper-focused on understanding public coverage and finding ways to reduce cost in our healthcare system through transparency, data, and software.  Sales representatives are the principal point of contact between a business & it’s future customers. Your mission as a Sales Executive will be to help PointCare increase their annual revenues and visibility into the market by delivering the value proposition to potential customers across the United States.  This role will report to PointCare’s VP of Strategic Partnerships. As part of the PointCare sales team, you will heavily contribute across the entire sales and marketing journey for our new customers. You will work closely with the sales leaders to educate our market, build pipeline, and improve our already growing customer base.  If you have experience as a Salesperson and have a passion to build a spectacular customer base, we’d love to hear from you!  What You Will Be Doing Closing deals is your primary focus but also includes the following: Proactively seek new business opportunities in the market and set appointments with interested prospects via cold calls and emails Deliver all prospect presentations to deliver the value of PointCare to C-level & other decision makers Work with Marketing on Webinars and other lead facing opportunities Maintain accurate notes, contact records and activity in Salesforce to manage all opportunities Assist with conference scheduling, set-up and attend when needed Build long-term trusting relationships with prospects and customers Report to your manager on (weekly/monthly/quarterly) results  Basic Qualifications Applicable work experience Familiarity with GSuite (Slides, Sheets, and Docs) Familiarity with Salesforce Self-motivated and conversational  Preferred Qualifications Self-Starting and eager to grow with PointCare  Benefits Include Hybrid-remote work environment Generous delivery bonus plan Revenue bonus plan No employee cost for employee medical, dental, vision, life, and disability benefits 401(k) company matching contributions of up to 4% of salary Generous PTO policy  Powered by JazzHR  x681VzuInG

description: Our AAA Five Diamond Resort is recruiting a On Site National Sales Manager to join our team! Ponte Vedra Beach Resorts is looking for a seasoned Resort Sales Manager to manage accounts, solicit new group sales accounts and maintain relationships with existing accounts to meet and exceed revenue goals in rooms, food, beverage and room rental.    Candidate should have a Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing or Sales or have equivalent experience. Must have experience at a similar size and caliber hotel. Advanced knowledge of the mid-west market preferred. Duties & Functions include: The National Sales Manager is responsible for soliciting, qualifying and closing of quality group business for the resorts. As a manager you will set up client visits, conduct site tours and attend industry events on behalf of the resort. Your main responsibility is to secure business for the Ponte Vedra Inn & Club and The Lodge & Club at Ponte Vedra Beach. Previous Hospitality (Hotel/Resort) Sales Industry required. Bachelor’s Degree Preferred. Conduct outside sales calls to existing and new potential clients. Prospect new business opportunities through existing referrals and/or market data. Consistently participate in the re-booking of repeat business by having a track record of long term client relationships. Actively participate in industry related organizations. Thorough knowledge of sales techniques including closing skills as well as negotiating skills. Monitor group room blocks and pick up, relay client comments and information for the operating departments. Comfortable with hotel site inspections and client presentations. Excellent creative skills to provide innovative set-ups, menus, and function for groups. Prior experience in the field of hospitality with specific experience in sales is essential. Knowledge of sales skills, revenue management, training and motivation of peers. Knowledge of hotel features, benefits, and competing hotels within the market. Ability to execute appropriate action plans. Monitor group room blocks and pick up, relay client comments and information for the operating departments. Benefits: Medical/Dental/Vision/STD/LTD/401(k)/Vacation/Sick Days/Holidays Equal Opportunity Employer DRUG FREE WORKPLACE

Does this describe you You’re a relationship builder at your core, able to find common ground and connect with just about anyone. Your definition of success is helping others be successful—this is what gets you up in the morning! You aren’t alone wolf—you prefer to work collaboratively with colleagues to bring solutions to life and improve client success. You're known for staying up on trends and researching new ideas to keep you, the team, and clients thinking out of the box. If this describes you and your approach to working with customers, you might just be the Partner Success Manager we’re looking for! Lovingly is building a driven partner success team to support our plans for growth as we double our market share and expand into new verticals. In this role, you will work side by side with new partners after they’ve completed their onboarding to ensure ongoing success, suggest new ideas and approaches, and review business metrics for growth opportunities.  Who we are Lovingly has built a better way to buy flowers and gifts online. Our curated marketplace connects gifters to the most talented independent florists across the U.S. and Canada. Equally important are the e-commerce technologies, tools, and support we deliver to our community of florist partners. The result is an exceptional gifting experience every time. Lovingly is fully remote, with team members across North America. No matter the distance, we stay united through our people-first culture built on curiosity, positivity, and collaboration.  What you’ll do Collaborate with other Partner Success Managers, the Partner Support team, and the Onboarding team to continually improve how Lovingly supports and serves our partners. Conduct Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs) for each partner and provide consultation on opportunities to improve their business results. Provide ongoing guidance coaching to increase partner revenue and retention while reducing churn. Identify additional sales and revenue opportunities for partners, collaborating with Sales and Product teams to bring these ideas to life.  Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Communications, Technology, or related field 3-4 years of experience in a client-facing role such as Customer Success Manager or Account Manager Prior experience in a B2B company A growth mindset that enables you to thrive in an ambiguous, quickly changing, entrepreneurial environment  Nice-to-haves Prior experience in a customer/client service role in a SaaS environment Prior experience working with Salesforce or similar CRM software Fluency in Spanish  Benefits: 22 PTO days—use them however you want! 12 paid holidays Comprehensive benefits, including health, dental, and vision 401k with guaranteed 3% salary contribution Ongoing growth and development opportunities, plus a 25% tuition discount at Marist College (including online programs)

description: The business wishes to build on its enterprise success to date by targeting enterprise opportunities from both a strong pipeline of existing prospects as well identifying and developing new prospects.  We are seeking a highly experienced and successful Enterprise Sales Executive to join our team. The role represents a unique opportunity for the right candidate to make their mark in an ambitious, successful and rapidly transforming business.  Primary Responsibilities To build new relationships and secure new enterprise revenue growth in North America through a variety of methods, including own network and self-generated, marketing prospects and references To demonstrate understanding of how enterprise customers can satisfy their required business outcomes and generate ROI through the sales cycle To report/share progress and update senior team and stakeholders as to progress To engage closely with internal Red Box departments as required to support the enterprise sales cycle and to ensure customer requirements are managed appropriately To build 3x coverage of enterprise pipeline forecast and to exceed annual sales revenue target To align with channel partners where required to support joint opportunities and to leverage partner capabilities in proposing solutions to meet desired customer use cases  Qualifications, Skills & Experience ·         Educated to degree level or relevant business experience At least 5 years’ track record of technology sales success working with financial services, insurance and/or healthcare verticals Demonstrable experience of identifying and securing complex enterprise accounts Highly competent in identifying and managing multiple client stakeholders at all levels in the enterprise Strong experience of enterprise contact center telephony and applications or alternatively, strong experience of voice recording Strong attention to detail and the ability to support the progression of complex customer agreements Powerful communicator and able to convey relevant benefits and overcome objections Considerable commercial acumen  Benefits for you (from your first day) 30 paid days leave + paid day off for your birthday Healthcare Benefits Retirement Plan  We are an equal opportunities employer and believe that inclusivity is vital to our success. We support our teams to do their best work through flexible and part-time options.

description: Description  Come be a part of a rapidly expanding $25 billion dollar global business. At Amazon Business, we set out every day to innovate and disrupt the status quo. We stand at the intersection of tech and retail in the B2B space developing innovative purchasing and procurement solutions to help businesses and organizations reimagine buying. Bring your insight, imagination and a healthy disregard for the impossible. Join us in building and celebrating the value of Amazon Business to buyers and sellers of all sizes, unlocking our potential worldwide.  Would you like to lead a business team to drive customer engagement and adoption for an innovative leader in supply chain? Would you like to be a part of a rapidly growing team focused on innovating the healthcare industry?  The Amazon Business team is dedicated to developing solutions that make it easy for business customers to source, procure, and manage supply chain using Amazon. Customer Advisors are an integral component to Amazon Business as a key customer facing representative. You have the opportunity to lead a team of Customer Advisors who are healthcare organizations with annual revenues between $50MM to $10B, from prospecting to strategic account growth. There are also a myriad of surrounding business management functions that you will need to direct for the success of your team (e.g. marketing, product development, supply sourcing). The ideal candidate will have B2B sales and management experience including identifying, developing, negotiating, and closing large scale deals. Candidate should be a self-starter with a proven track record of meeting and exceeding goals.  Roles & Responsibilities  Develop a go-to-market acquisition, management plan and team within healthcare industry sub-verticals, including but not limited to: Take ownership of industry verticals within healthcare to be a leading expert with its supply chain practices, needs, and opportunities. Determine the best go-to-market approach, including direction for solution/product development and services Take lead on hiring open positions on the team. Develop and nurture Customer Advisors as they improve their skills, processes, and tools to effectively prospect, present, close, and grow adoption of Amazon Business. Participate in customer meetings to support Customer Advisors as they work with their customers. Represent the Voice of Customer by working cross-functionally with marketing, sales operations, professional services, product  Basic Qualifications 5+ years of B2B and/or Enterprise sales experience with a focus on acquiring and growing business segments. Experience in identifying, developing, negotiating, and closing large-scale purchasing contracts or software agreements. Experience in positioning and selling innovative solutions to new customers and market segments. Ability to think and act independently within a fast-paced multi-task driven environment. Ability to improve processes and structure to achieve goals Strong ability to communicate and present to internal and external senior leadership. Ability to travel for internal business presentations and customer meetings. BA/BS degree or equivalent work experience required This role can be located in Seattle WA, Boston MA, New York NY, Arlington VA, Austin TX.  Preferred Qualifications Management experience of a sales team 5+ years of sales experience selling to Acute healthcare organizations. 3+ years of sales experience selling to procurement roles. Entrepreneurial background with proven ability to deal with ambiguity, pivot quickly, adapt new process and run fast. Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. description: Digital Grid Business Unit  The Digital Grid Business Unit covers comprehensive solutions ranging from software to automation needed to construct the smart grids of today. We ensure reliable, secure, affordable energy supply in a decentralizing, decarbonizing, digitalizing and all-electrifying energy world. Electrical energy makes the world go round. No matter where power comes from or where it has to go, we make sure it makes it’s way – every step of the way!  In this global position, you will support the Siemens Digital Business Unit with a focus on the exciting Grid Edge, Meter Data Management and Grid Simulation portfolios for utility, industry and infrastructure customers.  Overview:  Our Sales Enablement Specialist will deliver the necessary tools, content, training, process, and shares best practices to support the sales force and ensure they are successful in their day-to-day activities. In this role you will create, develop, and manage global enablement materials designed to integrate sales teams and increase sales, leveraging innovative ways of delivering learning.  What part will you play?  You support the digital transformation of sales by implementing and ensuring adoption of digital tools to improve their efficiency and effectiveness You manage the implementation of a state-of-the-art sales enablement automation (SEA) platform, creating transparency of missing or out-of-date content and training sales and marketing in its use You support the continued development and use of our CRM You work to improve the portfolio knowledge, selling & tool skills of our global sales through the use of training platforms You support the integration of different digital tools (SEA, CRM, training platform, etc.) to make a seamless sales journey You track course participation and development of sales skills according to their business targets and give a regular analysis of progress to regional and headquarter management You make onboarding software sales a smooth, seamless activity that maximizes sales performance with a shortened ramp up time You train sales on the use of digital prospecting tools like LinkedIn Sales Navigator You bring sales enablement data together in a sales management dashboard to drive better decision making across the organization  What You Need To Make Real What Matters.  Bachelor’s degree in business or marketing and or other related education such as instructional design You have worked in a sales environment, sales excellence or as a frontline seller using digital tools for the past 3 + years Experience in a B2B environment in the energy industry is a plus Furthermore, you bring knowledge for creating actionable insight from data made available from digital sales tools e.g. which sales collateral, training sessions, sales presentations, references are being used by sales in which regions Proven ability to create reports that support sales management and marketing decision making You are driven to improve the competence of sales for portfolio, selling skills, and tools with demonstratable results To find your way in your international environment you bring fluent English and Spanish language skills. Other language skills such as German are welcome You have excellent communication and presentation skills The ability to travel both domestic and international 10% of the time  This can be a remote position - located anywhere in the East Coast or the Midwest  Make Real What Matters.  We provide the power to bring heat and light to our cities. That way we not only contribute, but actively drive the energy revolution for a better and greener future. For these and many other future projects, we need smart thinkers who bring skill, creativity, and dedication to the table. People like you! Experienced researchers who boldly broaden horizons. True specialists that do not lose sight of the big picture.  You will be working in a forward-thinking sales environment open to your ideas to advance software selling. With a growth mindset you can continuously develop yourself and build a global network that can open doors to further career development.  Siemens Digital Grid – Ahead of the Challenge – Ahead of the Change!  If you are looking for a career that will contribute to shaping the future of tomorrow, that will impact the sustainability of the energy industry and are interested in working side by side with the brightest minds in the industry— let’s talk!  Make your mark in our exciting world at Siemens  Organization: Smart Infrastructure  Company: Siemens Industry, Inc. description: Sparkloft Media takes pride in telling brand stories with amazingly creative and highly strategic social media campaigns. We take pride in helping our clients find authentic connections with the audiences they care most about reaching. Now we need help making sure the brand story of our agency is being told. We need a talented Marketing & Business Development Manager to take ownership of our internal marketing efforts and give our brand a voice and an audience.  Primary Job Description:  The Marketing & Business Development Manager is responsible for developing the marketing and communications strategy (incl. website, content for social channels, blog, digital marketing, paid social & paid digital etc.) for the agency as well as supporting business development efforts (research, proposals, pitches etc.).  Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Develop comprehensive strategic marketing programs for the agency as well as specific verticals / products (e.g. travel, CPG, healthcare etc.) Develop marketing and communication materials (website, digital, email, print, email, trade shows etc.) Develop relevant, compelling sales materials (e.g. pitch decks, case studies, videos etc.) Ensure social media channels are relevant and on brand Identify and qualify new business opportunities RFPs appropriate to service offerings and project manage the prospecting process Support efforts on lead generation, scope development, pitching, negotiating, closing and transitioning work to account management teams Identify relevant business trends and facilitate product development with account and creative teams to provide relevant services and solutions Identify and develop strategic partnerships with other agencies and vendors Supervisor Responsibilities:  This position has no supervisory responsibility.  Experience and other Skill Requirements: Bachelor’s degree from a four-year college or university in a related field of study or equivalent combination of education and experience 6+ years of marketing experience, preferably with an agency 4+years of business development experience in digital marketing/communications/professional services Demonstrated strategic, consultative and analytical sales approach with focus on building long-term partnerships with clients A proven record for selling complex services and solutions Proven background in digital marketing and social media marketing and advertising on platforms like Facebook, Instagram, Twitter & LinkedIn Strong influencing skills to work with account / creative teams and partners to offer the right resources and solutions to the client Knowledge of social media and new business analysis tools and techniques Solid understanding of digital marketing A proven history of building relationships and out-of-the-box campaigns with strategic partners Event planning experience A proven innovative and creative approach to marketing Expert communication skills, both written and verbal High attention to detail and ability in managing multiple projects simultaneously. Hunger and persistence in driving results; an analytic eye to evaluating return on investment Requirements for all Sparkloft Media Positions: Care more: exceptional customer service skills Curiosity: a high level of interest in constantly learning new things Problem solving: ability to identify and understand problems and willingness to solve them Sensitivity: a high level of awareness for the needs of colleagues, clients and the Sparkloft Media business Entrepreneurial spirit: a mindset that embraces critical questioning, innovation and continuous improvement A global perspective and understanding of different cultures (ideally obtained through lots of travel) The absolute willingness to occasionally work nights, weekends or holidays (social media never sleeps) Powered by JazzHR  OEWvwu2LPK
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Online Media, and Public Relations and Communications

description: About The Opportunity  Here at Grubhub we’ve been dedicated to giving diners the most convenient way to order food from their favorite restaurants (whether that’s a late night Chalupa from Taco Bell or a salad for lunch from a local restaurant the day after they enjoyed said late night Chalupa).  While we are food-obsessed, we are also customer-obsessed. We look to constantly innovate our technology so our diners’ food experience is memorable, restaurant owners get more business and individuals across the country looking for work can deliver the food from the restaurant to the diner flawlessly. We take great pride in knowing that we are a part of 22.6 million diners food ordering experience and we feature over 300,000 restaurants in 3,200 US cities across our suite of apps (Grubhub, LevelUp, Seamless, Tapingo, AllMenus and MenuPages).  Want to be a part of the biggest movement in the US that is moving eating forward? If so, we want to talk to you - and hear what’s your favorite restaurant for food delivery!  The Impact You Will Make  Responsibilities Work closely with the Senior Manager of Restaurant Sales and the Director of Restaurant Sales to lead an inside sales team Train, coach, motivate, and manage a team of Sales Executives to improve individual results Identify opportunities to improve effectiveness and efficiencies with processes, tools, product offerings, and employee development Use Salesforce.com to develop regular tracking and reporting of key performance metrics and translate these metrics into implications and recommendations Develop effective coaching strategies and content for team meetings Encourage transparency and align broader company initiatives with department goals Monitor success outcomes from each team member through the creation of recognition programs, dashboards, and leader boards Coordinate with The Restaurant Sales Management Team to ensure proper communication and alignment across teams Be a respected leader while maintaining our collaborative and dynamic team culture Develop clear expectations and instill accountability for employees across all aspects of their performance Cultivate an open sales environment while maintaining competition and self-reliance Encourage employees to contribute new ideas and solutions to problems Take on projects outside of the scope of day to day responsibilities as needed by the sales department Contribute to the sales strategy as it relates to the department as a whole Requirements  What You Bring to the Table Have a coach’s mentality: you love helping others succeed and strive at pushing your team to its fullest potential Experience in developing processes, meeting deadlines, paying attention to detail, while remaining organized Possess a analytical, data driven mindset Experience working in a metrics/data-driven environment Have a deep interest and enthusiasm to work for a rapidly evolving company Experience with working in a high activity, high volume environment Have an understanding on how to analyze metrics and using them to improve performance Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to work across multiple internal groups Basic proficiency in Microsoft Excel Bachelor’s degree Experience with Salesforce is a plus! And Of Course, Perks! Flexible PTO. It’s true, no strings attached and all the time you need to recharge. PTO. It’s true, we provide you a generous amount of time to recharge. Better Benefits. Get quality insurance, flex-spending accounts, retirement options and commuter perks. Free Food. Kitchens are stocked and free Grubhub each week. Casual Culture. Catch rays on the rooftop or get comfy on a couch and get to know your coworkers — because work, should be a place you want to be. Grubhub is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally  protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster is available here: DOL Poster . If you are applying for a job in the U.S. and need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to TalentAcquisition@grubhub.com and let us know the nature of your request and contact information. Please note that only those inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this e-mail address.  CA Privacy Notice: If you are a resident of the State of California and would like a copy of our CA privacy notice, please email privacy@grubhub.com.

description: Company Description  Accolade at a glance  Accolade provides personalized health and benefits solutions designed to empower every person to live their healthiest life. We help millions of people and their employers navigate the complexities of the healthcare system with empathy, expertise and through exceptional service while supporting them in lowering the cost of care and improving health outcomes. Accolade blends technology-enabled health and benefits solutions, specialized support from Accolade Health Assistants® and Clinicians and access to expert medical opinion services for high-cost treatment decisions. We consistently receive consumer satisfaction ratings over 90 percent and have been recognized by Inc. Magazine as a Top Place to Work 2020 and Business Intelligence for Excellence in Customer Service 2020. Please visit us on LinkedIn, Twitter, Instagram and Facebook and at accolade.com.  Job Description  Our Mid-Market team is expanding!  The Regional Sales Executive, Mid-Market is responsible for meeting or exceeding the annual bookings quota for the assigned territory.  This role must be based within and will cover the following territory:  Pennsylvania, Delaware, Maryland, Washington, D.C., Virginia, West Virginia, Ohio and Indiana.  A day in the life… Consistently identifies opportunities, develops sales strategy and closes new business in the assigned middle market segment Identifies, develops and retains new business relationships Effectively presents Accolade’s offerings to qualified prospects Effectively leverages Accolade executives, the pre-sales team and services staff to support customer presentations Develops and executes strategies to generate cost effective sales leads Develops a pipeline of new sales opportunities in alignment with objectives that are established annually Develops and maintains an effective sales and market penetration plan for assigned territory Leverages the sales milestone process to ensure accuracy with monthly, quarterly and annual forecasts Documents all sales contacts, activities and sales process steps in Accolade’s sales tools and systems Solicits product and market feedback from customers, prospects and partners. Communicates this feedback to sales leadership, marketing and the product development team (feature requests, market trends, competition intelligence, new opportunities) Complies with all corporate policies and completes all administrative tasks on time Qualifications  What we are looking for… Minimum 8-10 years of strategic selling experience BA in a business or technical related area of study Experience selling complex, multi-stakeholder solutions. SaaS, health & welfare benefits, healthcare capital equipment, healthcare IT, health and welfare benefits outsourcing, human resources IT benefits software Embraces and thrives in a culture of transparency, accountability and trust Self-starter with ability to work independently, prioritize work and coordinate multiple tasks within tight time constraints Ability to navigate the strategic levels of customer organizations, identify key decision-makers, build relationships with senior executives and schedule meetings with key stakeholders Ability to establish strong team relationships in a matrix organization Ability to perform in a dynamic and fast-paced environment Possess account knowledge, executive-level customer contacts and industry relationships inside the employer market space Command of social media for the benefit of lead generation, gaining access to executives and networking with key stakeholders Strong aptitude with business software tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook etc) Strong business acumen Demonstrated ability to successfully negotiate complex contract Demonstrated ability to accurately forecast monthly, quarterly, and annual revenue Where permitted by applicable law, candidates must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by date of hire to be considered, if not currently employed by Accolade, Inc. The Company will provide reasonable accommodations to qualified employees with disabilities or for a sincerely held religious belief.  Please note that a request for exemption due to a personal preference not to receive a vaccine is not protected by law. All requests for exemptions from this mandate shall be directed to the Company recruiter who shall route the request to the Company’s human resources department.  Additional Information  What Is Important To Us  Creating an enduring company that is hyper-focused on our culture and making a meaningful impact in the lives of our employees, members and customers. The secret to our success is:  We Find Joy And Purpose In Serving Others  Making a difference in our members’ and customers’ lives is what we do. Even when it’s hard, we do the right thing for the right reasons.  We are strong individually and together, we’re powerful  Trusting in our colleagues and embracing their different backgrounds and experiences enable us to solve tough problems in creative ways, having fun along the way.  We roll up our sleeves and get stuff done  Results motivate us. And we aren't afraid of the hard work or tough decisions needed to get us there.  We’re boldly and relentlessly reinventing healthcare We're curious and act big -- not afraid to knock down barriers or take calculated risks to change the world, one person at a time.  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Hospital & Health Care

description: NOTE: This is a field based role. Must be located in the state of Illinois, Indiana or Missouri for consideration.  At Freshworks, we are creating a global workplace that enables everyone to find their true potential, purpose, and passion irrespective of their background, gender, race, sexual orientation, religion and ethnicity. We are committed to providing equal opportunity for all and believe that diversity in the workplace creates a more vibrant, richer work environment that advances the goals of our employees, communities and the business.  Freshworks provides intelligent customer engagement software for businesses of all sizes, making it easy for teams to win customers for life. More than 50,000 businesses trust Freshworks, including our employee engagement, customer engagement and CRM solutions, to better support employees so businesses can increase customer satisfaction and lifetime value. Our products are ready to go, easy to use, and offer a quick return on investment.  Freshworks has received numerous accolades that include ranking #10 on the prestigious Forbes’ Cloud 100 and #22 on the Battery Ventures/Glassdoor Best Places to Work lists.  Headquartered in San Mateo, California, Freshworks has a dedicated global team operating from 13 locations to serve our customers throughout the world. Freshworks is backed by leading investors including Accel, CapitalG, Sequoia Capital and Tiger Global Management.  Your Responsibilities:  Generate new business opportunities to fuel our growth Create and prioritize strategic target account lists within a defined territory Research and build new and existing accounts (i.e. adding contacts, sending emails, strategic calling) Conduct high level conversations with senior executives in prospect accounts Evangelize Freshworks with passion and energy Achieve monthly quotas of closed business Initiate, develop and maintain executive level relationships and drive sales activities with key customers Understand target customers business needs, develop proposals and accurately articulate Freshworks' value proposition at the executive level Close complex transactions and be willing to get into the trenches with the team  Preferred Experience and Skills:  4+ years outbound quota carrying SaaS sales experience CRM/ITSM experience highly preferred Proven track record of consistent quota attainment by month/quarter/year Team player, strong collaborator Consistent success with sales quota attainment BDR/SDR previous prospecting experience is a plus! Excellent written/verbal communication skills Ability to understand customer needs and meet that need with a successful product sale Strong time management and organizational skills Bachelor's degree  🌟 Summary of Freshworks Benefits: 🌟 Freshworks offers multiple options for dental, medical, vision, disability and life insurances, unlimited time off + paid off, commuter benefits, work from home spending, and wellness benefits are also offered. Freshworks also offers adoption and parental leave benefits
industries: Computer Software, Information Technology and Services, and Information Services

description: A leading provider of home improvement products sold through multiple channels including retail and online through Home Centers (Home Depot, Lowe’s, and Menards), co-ops, mass merchants, two-step distributors, and internet channels needs a National Accounts Manager.  The National Accounts Manager will manage, develop, and lead the implementation of strategies and programs to grow profitability and customer satisfaction at select accounts. This is a hybrid role that requires a home office and the ability to travel up to 40% when travel opens up. The ideal location is Charlotte, NC, or Atlanta, GA. Lead all account activities, including product line reviews, business reviews, product launches, and store program execution. Establish and maintain influential relationships at all levels of the organization Meet or exceed financial objectives, operational metrics, and customer service levels. Analyze sales data to identify trends and prepare periodic reports and business plans. Deliver accurate forecasts and other metrics with a focus on early identification of opportunities and challenges. Conduct ongoing market and competitive research and use that information to support short and long-term account plans and initiatives. Provide input to the business team on products, pricing, packaging, and merchandising. Ability to negotiate price increases Manage a network of independent sales reps and business analysts Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Finance, Marketing or other related field 5+ years of successful selling hardware, building materials, plumbing, etc. into retail and online channels Experience with Menards and cooperatives (e.g., Ace, Do It Best, True Value) preferred Experience with Home Depot and Lowes preferred Experience with Amazon and Walmart would be a plus Business and financial acumen; solid understanding of account P&Ls and elements that drive profitability. Experience managing a budget and analyzing variances Microsoft skills including PowerPoint and Teams meetings Ability to travel up to 40% once the travel starts again

description: ABOUT L&T INFOTECH  LTI (NSE: LTI) is a global technology consulting and digital solutions company helping more than 300 clients succeed in a converging world. With operations in 30 countries, we go the extra mile for our clients and accelerate their digital transformation with LTI’s Mosaic platform enabling their mobile, social, analytics, IoT and cloud journeys  Social Report:  LTI Wins the 2018 Stevie® Awards for Great Employers in Two Categories  LTI Recognized as the Winner of 2018 Microsoft App Innovation Award  LTI Tops ITS Challengers List for the second consecutive year in Everest Group’s PEAK Matrix IT Service Provider of the Year 2019  Location: NY/NJ  We are seeking a motivated Business Development Director to acquire new clients, primarily in Media and Entertainment industry. The role is supported by a robust Pre-Sales, Solutions, and Delivery Team.  Key Responsibilities • Ability to drive pipeline growth and development leading to new logo acquisitions. • Achieve annual sales targets established by the Sales Leadership. • Achieve lead generation, prospecting and other sales management goals designed to build an optimal sales pipeline. • Manage the end-to-end sales process for all opportunities. This includes initial client communication, proposal, presentations, multi-day client workshops, RFP/RFI submission, negotiation and deal signing. • Demonstrate strong personal communication and presentation skills to establish interest, credibility and trust. • Adhere to all established standards and guidelines.  Who You Are:  A motivated sales executive, driven to add value through establishing strong relationships with prospective clients. You are able to push the customer’s thinking to quickly gain credibility, build a strong relationship and contribute to the success of LTI.  · Experienced sales and service professional within the Media and Entertainment Industry  · Minimum of 5 years B2B business development experience with the ability to understand market trends and attract new clients to consider adoption of new technology and IT consulting services.  · Strong executive presence, complimented by clear and convincing communication skills  · Hands-on experience with proposal creation and leading proposal presentations  · Excellent interpersonal communication skills and leadership ability.  · Extensive experience selling service-oriented solutions   We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

jobTitle: Product Sales Specialist Women's Health Ultrasound
description: Job Description Summary  In this role, the Sales Specialist – WH Ultrasound is responsible for selling Ultrasound equipment into the Women’s Health Ultrasound markets. The territory is metro New York.GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Job Description  Essential Responsibilities :    Generating proposals, preparing sales quotations, planning customer meetings, and demonstrating equipment capabilities on Women’s Health (WH U/S) Ultrasound products in assigned territory Maintaining satisfactory after-sale relationships Penetrating competitive accounts and communicating current market intelligence back to the business, along with field concerns, issues and requirements Providing leadership in market analysis and development/execution of strategies and action plans to drive WH U/S sales Prospecting for new customers and business in addition to growing and maintaining our existing customer portfolio Annual and quarterly achievement of multiple sales and revenue targets Development of long-term customer relationships coupled with the ability to identify and capitalize on opportunities that immediately satisfy customer needs  Qualifications/Requirements :    Bachelors Degree and at least one of the following core experiences: 3+ years of consultative sales experience in the medical device/med tech industry including strategic selling and negotiation, 3+ years GEHC experience in customer facing role(s), OR a graduate of the GE Commercial Leadership Program Willingness to travel 30% within your specified geographic region with occasional overnight stays depending on geography and business need Must be willing to live within the New York City market Ability to meet customer site access requirements, including COVID-19 vaccination.  Desired Characteristics :    Previous Healthcare high-end capital equipment sales experience, selling to managed care/hospital organizations Knowledge of Healthcare Information Systems, networking and IT Ability to energize, develop, and build rapport at all levels within an organization Demonstrated ability to analyze customer data and develop financially sound sales offers 5+ years of demonstrated strategic selling skills including customer presentations, price quoting, product demonstration, negotiation, closing and growing a sales territory Proven executive (CX0) relationship building skills in a hospital/healthcare environment Experience interfacing with both internal team members and external customers as a part of a solution-based sales process Knowledge of Healthcare industry trends and market place (Women’s Health knowledge preferred) Women's Health Ultrasound clinical application and/or product knowledge  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.      Additional Information  GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an  Equal Opportunity Employer . Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).  Relocation Assistance Provided: No

description: Overview  Galaxy Gaming is an innovative, customer-focused brand of omnichannel table games experts. Our team proudly represents world-famous table games and side bets, over 20 years of iGaming experience, proven-performing technology and solutions, industry-leading service levels, and much more on the horizon. Join the Galaxy! This role is responsible for selling table games products and services to grow revenue within a territory.  Responsibilities: Increase revenues for the company through direct sales Present, demonstrate, and close sales utilizing direct phone contact, email, game and product presentations via WebEx, trade shows, in-person meetings, and company showroom meetings Communicate with current and potential customers regarding products and services using phone, email, and video presentations both in person and via web presentations Build and maintain relationships with colleagues, vendors, customers, and Executive leaders to establish and maintain exceptional service for long-term success Demonstrate complete understanding of the industry, competitor games, and the competitive advantages of each Assist in game development which will require an understanding of the math, dealing procedures, security concerns, hit frequencies, pay tables, player preferences, casino, and dealer acceptance, and market viability 50% travel will be required Perform other duties as assigned  Required Knowledge/Skills/Job Qualifications: Detailed understanding of casino table gaming industry, including maximizing revenue, controlling costs, and providing new and interesting gaming options to the general public Demonstrated ability to self-motivate and a drive to succeed Positive attitude; ability to listen, ask questions, and work with a team Ability to demonstrate an understanding and appreciation for table games, including, but not limited to, mathematics, hit frequencies, house edge, dealing procedures, indicators of win, drop, and hold, and security requirements Entrepreneurial attitude and vision to create sales programs to improve sales Excellent written and verbal communication skills including telephone etiquette and interpersonal skills Strong analytical skills with a proven ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, draw valid conclusions, and devise effective solutions Must be able to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively Ability to promptly respond to common inquiries, complaints, or requests from various internal and external parties in a professional manner Requires excellent computer skills Ability to read, write, and interpret detailed, concise, and accurate documents, such as reports, policies, procedures, and correspondence Ability to maintain organization, meet deadlines and possess integrity and discretion in handling confidential information Knowledge of ancillary products such as chips, cards, layouts, dice gaming tables, and any other items needed for the operation of casino table games Ability to obtain gaming licenses in all of our approved gaming jurisdictions  Education/Experience: BA/BS degree preferred Previous casino table games operations experience required At least one to three years of outside sales experience preferred  Physical Requirements Must be able to remain in a stationary position for extended periods of time Must occasionally move about inside the office to access office machinery, etc. Constantly use hands/fingers to operate a computer and other office productivity machinery, such as a calculator, copy machine, etc. Must frequently use close, color, and depth vision Occasionally will need to reach with hands and arms, lift up to 10 pounds, climb/balance, stoop/kneel/crouch/crawl, and taste and smell Galaxy Gaming is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, and basis of disability, or any other federal, state, or local protected class. All requests for exemptions from this mandate shall be directed to the Company recruiter who shall route the request to the Company’s human resources department.  Additional Information  What is important to us...  We Find Joy And Purpose In Serving Others  Creating an enduring company that is hyper-focused on our culture and making a meaningful impact in the lives of our employees, members and customers. The secret to our success is:  Making a difference in our members’ and customers’ lives is what we do. Even when it’s hard, we do the right thing for the right reasons.  We are strong individually and together, we’re powerful  Trusting in our colleagues and embracing their different backgrounds and experiences enable us to solve tough problems in creative ways, having fun along the way.  We roll up our sleeves and get stuff done  Results motivate us. And we aren't afraid of the hard work or tough decisions needed to get us there.  We’re boldly and relentlessly reinventing healthcare  We're curious and act big -- not afraid to knock down barriers or take calculated risks to change the world, one person at a time.  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

description: Responsibilities: Collaborate with Merchants and Allocators on preseason and in season plans to align on sales and inventory strategies. Provide team with diagnosis of the business and own suggested course of action. Active role partnering with planning peers and management in creating, updating, enhancing tools and process that supports financial integrity and allows for flexibility and innovation. Actively listen, engage and respond to business partners and leadership in response to opportunities and challenges.  PRESEASON Create preseason sales, margin and inventory plans by department, class, style and color. Analyze and report on previous quarter results; identify “missed sales” and growth drivers over prior year Summarize the opportunity and risk of a product plan as it relates to trend and financial metrics: initial mark-up, average unit retail, average unit cost, net margin dollars/rate. Recommend style count, cc count and flow of goods for optimal results. Independently develop and present the financial strategy associated with growth and diminish categories in quarterly investment review meetings. Effectively communicate support for style level buys as it relates to current trend, historical findings or related categories.  IN SEASON   Provide daily and weekly updates on business as it relates to last forecast, identifying trends, and highlighting selling that exceeds or falls short of expectation. Initiate conversations with cross functional partners regarding potential risk or opportunities and suggested changes to course of action for both current and future quarters. Prepare sales, margin and inventory forecast and lead team in monthly OTB forecast meetings for current year; provide sales trend opportunity for future quarters, validate stock-to-sales relationships, maximize receipt flow to improve turn, reconcile receipts and suggest pricing strategies to drive profitability. Monitor basic style selling trends and partner with merchandising and allocation to select monthly order quantities. Generate and manage style level weekly unit sales plans in season to inform total department sales expectation by week/month/quarter and identify styles contributing to a +/- to forecast. Propose markdown and promotional strategies to maximize profitability on the life of an item or category; provide pricing and margin dollar gain/loss scenarios. Recommend and manage cross channel transfer proposals and communication.   Qualifications: Bachelors degree required. 3+ years of merchandise planning experience; a total of 4-5 years of related experience in allocation, merchandising, financial planning, strategy or business analytics. Strong analytical, financial modeling, and problem solving skills. Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills. Proven ability to build strong cross-functional partnerships and influence others. Ability to synthesize business performance into key highlights, root cause analysis and action plans. Ability to manage multiple work streams/projects with tight timelines. Strong technical aptitude, including advanced competency in Microsoft Excel and the ability to quickly master new applications and systems.  We are committed to affirmatively providing equal opportunity to all associates and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, marital status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, legally protected physical or mental disability or any other basis protected under applicable law.

Sales Director  Philadelphia, PA  Hire Talent recruits on behalf of our client, a privately held supplier of pipe, tubing, fittings, flanges, and related products in chrome-alloy steel, stainless steel, carbon steel and nickel alloy steels servicing the global energy, refining, processing, and power generation business. Our client and is one of the top material suppliers for Global Power Generation, Nuclear Power, Oil Refining, Gas and Chemical Processing and US Military building.    Position Summary Responsible for developing profitable sales growth range of steel products to the Power Generation, Hydrocarbon and Chemical Process Industries through “channels to market”. Plan and execute strategic and tactical plans to achieve assigned sales objectives. Lead the regional sales team to meet goals and objectives. Sustain and grow the sale of, and market share of, the company's products and services within their defined area of responsibility. Develop new business accounts within their region. Maintain and expand their industry and product knowledge to be relevant and beneficial to their customers and prospects. This position requires the ability to analyze current environments, create a compelling business solution complete with detailed financial analysis. Present the findings and have the ability to propose specific technology recommendations to improve current business processes. The Director must possess a high degree of creativity, organizational and process development skills and have a proven track record of presenting solutions to Senior Management.  Responsibilities Have frequent contact with both internal and external customers. Have the ability to give and receive feedback, recognize and act on customer needs, building rapport and gaining closure. Have frequent contact with other departments, vendors and customers. Possess tact, charisma, and the ability to negotiate. Interpret and apply complex material, data and instructions. Prepare, provide and convey diversified information which may be of a technical nature. Participate in the preparation of the regional and company strategic and financial plans. Lead and develop the sales team to support sales strategies and deliver exceptional, profitable sales growth and results. Identify and build relationships within the regional office to help produce future leaders Maintain and expand customer base by coaching Regional Sales Representatives; build and maintain rapport with key customers; identify new customer and market opportunities. Develop a dynamic sales team through coaching, teaching, and mentoring for improved performance. Lead execution of a successful sales cycle and selling core line of products/services. By focusing on customer needs, provide market analysis to improve product service positioning and increase effectiveness of the sales team. Proactively assume a role in developing & executing strategies to build an outstanding sales culture. Advise senior management team on sales directions, competitors and market trends. Develop strong ties with key customers and suppliers and be proactive in understanding the trends and issues likely to impact the market. Execute day-to-day sales management, using a wide variety of techniques, from traditional sales philosophy’s to highly technical consultative sales techniques. Be able to present a compelling and effective case for project management, quality programs and supply chain capability. Recommend and obtain buy-in and implement any changes needed to align the sales organization with overall strategy. Drive improvements in the sales process and organization to increase the effectiveness and efficiency of team. Conduct weekly sales team meetings to address concerns & acknowledge individual/ team accomplishments. Manage the sales forecast accurately. Track results and communicate to senior management regional results. Expected to meet or exceed assigned revenue, margin and target metric objectives within the assigned region. Create and sustain effective collaborative partnerships with all other managers and departments. Interface with Regional Operations Managers, Accounting and Purchasing to provide support and to achieve the overall company profitable growth-oriented revenue goals and objectives. Responsible for leading the company’s sales efforts in calls, presentations, demonstrations, proof of concepts, internal training, assessment services and proposals related to our products and services. This involves applying a consultative approach and ability to direct our support resources in analyzing the customer’s requirements and developing customized solutions to fit the need. Prepare accurate and timely sales reports. Work with Senior Vice President of Sales to identify and implement new opportunities within major accounts. Drive and coordinate account planning sessions based on revenue potential. Maintain a commitment to the company’s sales processes, values and business code of ethics. Assist in resolving any ongoing technical or commercial issues with the customer as appropriate and requested. Protect and increase a profitable revenue stream within current accounts.  Qualifications  Bachelor’s Degree in Industrial Engineering, CIS, Finance, Management or similar; MBA desired but not required  5-12 years leading a sales team with a strong track record in the area of technical sales with experience calling on major accounts and selling high value complex solutions. Familiarity with distribution environment preferred. 3-5 years of experience selling heavy pipe, fittings, flanges and related products to power generation, hydrocarbon, oil refining, chemical processing and / or military customers   Should be self-motivated, competitive and possess outstanding organizational and interpersonal skills with ability to assemble additional technical assistance as required Proficient and demonstrable experience in prospecting, qualifying, creating value-based demonstrations and presentations, ability to write and direct proposal preparation, experienced in objection handling and negotiating. Must be familiar with contractual language and provisions, terms and conditions Proficient computer skills (i.e. Microsoft Office Suite) with data analysis capability Strong verbal and written communication skills and excellent listening skills

Summary: We are seeking a highly motivated Sales Account Manager located in the Midwest area. This position will cover Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Kansas, Minnesota, Missouri, Nebraska, North Dakota, South Dakota, and Wisconsin.  The ideal candidate will have a career focus in Industrial Automation and Mechatronics. This position requires skills in product and account development, sales and sales management, and ability to work through the conceptual and developmental phases of automating production facilities.  Duties/Responsibilities: Builds and maintains a network of sources from which to identify new sales leads. Communicates with customers and leads to identify and understand their product or service needs; identifies and suggests products and services to meet those needs. Assists with the drafting of presentations and other documentation and materials that explain products and services to customers. Ensures customer satisfaction through ongoing communication and relationship management; resolves any issues that may arise post-sale, which may include product modifications. Maintains communication with existing and previous customers, alerting them of new products, services, and enhancements that may be of interest. Investigates other areas of potential product offering for consideration by AMC by consultation with customers to determine their needs and pain points. Maintains detailed reports of sales activities including calls, orders, sales, lost business, and any customer relationship problems. Provides periodic territory sales forecasts. Performs other duties as assigned.  Education and Experience: Preferred Bachelor’s degree in Engineering. 3 to 5 years of experience in engineering, sales, and systems integration. Preferred career focus in Industrial Automation and Mechatronics. Must specialize in automation, material handling, account and product development, sales management, customer relations, key account management, project profitability, negotiations and closing.  Required Skills/Abilities: Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Excellent sales and customer service skills with a proven ability to explain technical products to non-technical audiences. Ability to apply engineering, technology, or other related principles to product sales. Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail. Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software.  Travel: Up to 80% travel required, including international travel and overnight stays.

Open to relocation or remote work, but preference given to those willing to work on site in Mesa!  HIGHLIGHTS Grew from 3 employees to 100 employees in 3 years - hyper-growth means there are a lot of career development opportunities! Surrounded by an entrepreneurial spirited leadership team wanting to make a difference in people's lives! Gain experience and build a network in an expanding area of clinical research, including COVID vaccines and Alzheimer's trials! Genuine opportunities to develop and grow in your career - promotion potential!  THE COMPANY Our client is a clinical research organization offering an innovative approach to conducting clinical trials for the prevention and treatment of debilitating diseases. Our client’s research sites are located within physicians’ offices, medical clinics, senior living communities, and owned clinical research facilities to support research in the fields of Neurology, Family Practice, and Dermatology, with plans to include additional therapy areas in the near future. They have been recognized as one of the premier CROs that worked on the COVID vaccines.  THE ROLE On a day to day, the Business Development Manager will work along side the Business Development team acting as a sales representative and account manager. This person will source leads, network with sponsors (pharmaceutical companies), generate proposals for new clients, and provide strategic value ads to generate new business. Additionally, this person will manage 100+ accounts of pharmaceutical companies looking to use the company for clinical research support.  This is a management position so you can expect to manage a team of 2-3 sales reps as well as participate in overall strategy, project management, and timelines.  REQUIREMENTS 4+ years of sales experience 1+ year of Clinical Research experience 1+ year of Management experience Experience with cold calling, generating leads, and generating proposals Great communication skills

What You Will Be Doing:  Helping Movemedical transform healthcare by coordinating sales and marketing efforts as a proactive project manager for the Movemedical sales and marketing teams.  You:  Hungry and Humble. You are a caring, detailed, organized, and focused project manager that likes to talk to people. Keeping everyone on the same page and focused toward the end-goal comes naturally to you. You easily take complex processes and transform them into manageable tasks that make it easier for everyone to understand and get their work done. You thrive on schedules, checklists, and getting the right things done at the right time, and helping others do the same. Additionally, you love growing a business and the idea of helping people make good decisions inspires you, that is why you love supporting sales and marketing teams.  Responsibilities: Coordinate all sales meetings, demos, and projects (Setting up meetings for all sales/marketing functions) Maintain and manage CRM, LinkedIn Sales Nav, etc. (Ensure data hygiene) Planning for Demos - being very polished and ready / Assist with DEMO setup and maintenance Understanding of marketing tech-stack, processes and integrations Ad campaign, segment templates development / Run lead nurturing campaigns Work with Revenue Team to enable marketing automation Support Revenue Team as needed Marketing Reports and Data Analysis Coordinate and communicate RFP process Coordinate sales process with customers / driving to kick off scoping project Marketing Execution within funnel (non paid) - post and pre-demo, video sharing, expanding contacts Contracting process coordination and follow up  Desired Skills: Project Management / Project Leader Interpersonal Communication Skills (written and verbal) Sales Operations Support & Management Technical Aptitude RFP Management / Fulfillment  Us:  Movemedical is the enterprise logistics platform powering the world’s best medical device last-mile supply chain sales and ops teams. Our comprehensive solution tackles the industry’s thorniest challenges—head-on, digitally transforming daily operations and processes one enterprise company at a time. Our unique ability to integrate with our customers' back-end systems and make things happen based on their data gives us the power to transform the way they work. We partner to maximize visibility, control, and automation, all in one easy-to-use, purpose-built platform—improving relationships between sales reps and the surgeons they serve.  Our team has extensive expertise in engineering, business operations, user experience, project management, compliance, customer success, logistics, emerging technologies, and marketing that, via the Movemedical platform, we provide as a single service to help drive continued revenue growth, cost transformation and overall success for the orthopedic companies we serve around the world.  Our love of our customers is second only to our love for our team members. We are team-oriented and want each other to be successful; we pull together to accomplish our goals. Glassdoor gives us a 4.4/5.0 and Inc. put us on its Best Places to Work Editor's List in 2019. We are a small but growing business with a leading position in a big market. With no external funding, we are the captains of our own ship. Our proven business model and our customers' love for us drive our rapid, sustainable growth.  We are building an extraordinary company and looking for talented, humble, hungry, and strong people to join us on this journey.  Where:  Although we are originally San Diego-based, Movemedical is currently a fully distributed, yet highly functional team. We are used to working across time zones and various locations. This role can be based anywhere in the U.S. Should we ever work from a local office again, a hybrid model or 100% remote scenario will be readdressed at that time.  Movemedical is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We look forward to reviewing your credentials and getting to know more about your experience!  Powered by JazzHR  hlNDXIZIgu

jobTitle: Product Sales Specialist Women's Health Ultrasound
description: Job Description Summary  In this role, the Sales Specialist – WH Ultrasound is responsible for selling Ultrasound equipment into the Women’s Health Ultrasound markets. The territory is metro New York.GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Job Description  Essential Responsibilities :    Generating proposals, preparing sales quotations, planning customer meetings, and demonstrating equipment capabilities on Women’s Health (WH U/S) Ultrasound products in assigned territory Maintaining satisfactory after-sale relationships Penetrating competitive accounts and communicating current market intelligence back to the business, along with field concerns, issues and requirements Providing leadership in market analysis and development/execution of strategies and action plans to drive WH U/S sales Prospecting for new customers and business in addition to growing and maintaining our existing customer portfolio Annual and quarterly achievement of multiple sales and revenue targets Development of long-term customer relationships coupled with the ability to identify and capitalize on opportunities that immediately satisfy customer needs  Qualifications/Requirements :    Bachelors Degree and at least one of the following core experiences: 3+ years of consultative sales experience in the medical device/med tech industry including strategic selling and negotiation, 3+ years GEHC experience in customer facing role(s), OR a graduate of the GE Commercial Leadership Program Willingness to travel 30% within your specified geographic region with occasional overnight stays depending on geography and business need Must be willing to live within the New York City market Ability to meet customer site access requirements, including COVID-19 vaccination.  Desired Characteristics :    Previous Healthcare high-end capital equipment sales experience, selling to managed care/hospital organizations Knowledge of Healthcare Information Systems, networking and IT Ability to energize, develop, and build rapport at all levels within an organization Demonstrated ability to analyze customer data and develop financially sound sales offers 5+ years of demonstrated strategic selling skills including customer presentations, price quoting, product demonstration, negotiation, closing and growing a sales territory Proven executive (CX0) relationship building skills in a hospital/healthcare environment Experience interfacing with both internal team members and external customers as a part of a solution-based sales process Knowledge of Healthcare industry trends and market place (Women’s Health knowledge preferred) Women's Health Ultrasound clinical application and/or product knowledge  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.      Additional Information  GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an  Equal Opportunity Employer . Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).  Relocation Assistance Provided: No

description: Background:  If you are looking for a passionate, exciting, and team-oriented career opportunity with a well-established, family-owned and successful company, this job is for you!  PDQ Manufacturing, a Lancaster, PA-based commercial door hardware manufacturer, seeks a National Sales Manager who will lead our company's sales efforts.  At PDQ we manufacture architectural commercial-grade mortise locks, cylindrical locks, deadbolts, hinges, door closer, exit devices, flat goods and cloud-hosted access control including stand-alone and networked devices.  Driven by family values and an independent spirit, PDQ has set the industry standard for service, quality, and value for over 38 years.  Job Description:  Are you an experienced National Sales Manager looking for a new challenge and an opportunity to further advance your career?  If you are ambitions, high energetic person able to thrive in a fast-pacing environment while leading your team by example, we have the perfect job for you!  We are looking for a dynamic and proven National Sales Manager who is ready to take the next step and lead our highly motivated sales team in order to achieve set sales goals, targets, and revenue.  Duties & Responsibilities  Develop and implement effective sales strategies Lead sales team members to achieve sales targets Manage and oversee the daily operations of the sales department Monitor and analyze performance metrics and suggest improvements Prepare monthly, quarterly and annual sales forecasts Perform research and identify new potential customers and new market opportunities Liaise with Marketing and Product Development departments to ensure brand consistency Keep abreast a new product launches and ensure sales team members are on board  Requirements & Qualifications  Previous working experience as a National Sales Manager for 3 years Experience in the door hardware Industry and/or Electronic Access Control Industry is a plus BSc in Sales, Business Administration, or similar relevant field preferred In depth knowledge of managing a high-performance sales team Hands on experience with CRM software Outstanding communication, presentation, and leadership skills Excellent organizational and time management skills  Benefits:  401k Health Insurance Dental Insurance Vision Insurance Health Savings Plan Life and STD Insurance PTO Employee Referral Program  Job Type: Full-Time  All visitors, customers, and staff are required to have their temperature check prior to entering the facility. All common surfaces are sanitized regularly. Our mask requirements are guided by the CDC recommendations.

Talent Hawk Recruiting is assisting a client with a search for a Business Developer/Sales professional. This unique role is an exciting opportunity for a talented Business Developer to showcase their skills to make a direct impact on the company and on their own financial security! Attractive base plus commission. On target performance results in earning $100K+ your first year and strong performers have doubled that their second year.  This is an exciting time to join us as we are ramping for growth. To be a strong candidate for this position, you must have: Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience Experience managing multiple projects in a well established territory At least 3 years outside sales experience, with at least 1-2 of those years selling contract services (uniforms, coffee/break room focused sales, copiers, etc.) to businesses
