description: Dise & Company, a 30-year retained executive search firm, is pleased to represent our client, a leading manufacturer of industrial saw blades and cutting tool technologies for professionals. Family owned since 1963, products are manufactured in Northeast Ohio in one of the industry's most advanced production facilities. In addition to the manufacturing facility, there are distribution centers in California, Canada, England, Finland and India. Products are available in over 80 countries to professional contractors through a worldwide network of professional contractor and industrial supply distributors.  A cornerstone of the success of our client company is an emphasis on the needs of their customers. Their "inside-out" approach features an expert internal team paired with a dedicated global technical team. They have built a reputation of responsiveness, reliable delivery, quality products and a no-nonsense business approach. Having only the highest levels of service and support is a daily commitment.  Toward this end our client has continually invested in better research and development, better manufacturing processes, better raw materials and better warehousing facilities. The result is a wide-ranging product line that offers professional blades that work better and last longer.  The Opportunity  The Regional Sales Manager will develop a regional sales plan utilizing the available sales resources including our Territory Managers, Applied Product Specialists and Manufacturer's Reps in conjunction with the Director, Sales. This position will earn a base salary. An incentive component of compensation will be based on sales growth Significant sales growth is expected for all products offered in the current product offering as well as new products added. This individual is expected to contribute to new product ideas and make recommendations on opportunities to gain profitable sales volume. Development of appropriate relationships with key end users, key distributors, territory managers, manufacturer's reps and support personnel is a requirement of this position. Acquiring competitive market intelligence is an ongoing requirement. A large percentage of time will be spent selling company products.  Essential Functions: Should always represent the company in a professional and ethical manner. Must have the ability to sell and manage in multiple sales channels and utilize a variety of resources including: territory managers, technical support personnel, manufacturer's reps, etc. Execute the industrial team matrix distribution strategy, ensure appropriate channel representation in each category and make appropriate changes to ensure significant sales and market share growth. Help the industrial sales team identify the natural trading areas within their territories and understand the industry within these trading areas. Know the company product that matches these industries and understand the estimated value of the trading areas to the company . Understand the company value proposition to the market and ensure the field sale team, distributors and end users know and understand it. Work jointly with territory managers, manufacturer's reps and distributor sales personnel at distributor selling events (e.g., open houses, distributor functions) as well as at key end user accounts. Also provide assistance at regional/national trade shows/industry functions. Work in cooperation with manufacturer's reps and distribution to ensure appropriate coverage and harmony in the field on behalf of the company. Lead / Manage territory managers, manufacturer's reps, distributors and users and coordinate sales efforts with the tech team. Develop goals (sales-quantitative & performance-qualitative) - maximize developing Target/Partnership Program with distributors. Manage sales activities of the territory manager and the tech team related the the company. Provide direction on developing target and key customers/prospects - new business with existing customers and new business with new customers. Work with the territory managers to develop territory sales goals and corresponding regional sales goals, along with plans of activities to support these goals. Coach, mentor and provide performance evaluations for each individual territory manager and manufacturer's rep - both quantitative (sales $) as well as qualitative (activities) - provide written correspondence to under performing agencies with timelines and goals for improvement - make recommendation for change as a last resort. Provide pro-active input for customers with declining sales and steps for correction. Conduct sales meetings with field sales/customers as necessary. Provide timely follow-up to territory managers, manufacturer's reps and customers. Develop and update key customers/prospect directory of contacts/influences (database) Provide on-going sales and product application training to field sales team. Provide pricing parameters to sales team as circumstances warrant. Must comply with all Company policies regarding expenses, travel itineraries, call reports and pricing approvals. Lead the Performance Planning Management (PPM) process for your direct reports and yourself. Utilize the skills knowledge gap analysist (SKGA) process and work with direct reports to identify gaps and help close them. Drive the Commercial and Industrial Roadmap initiatives. Must have and maintain a safe driving record, a valid driver's license and required insurance coverage. Other duties as assigned.  Skills and Experience: 3-7 years of sales and management experience in any of the following sales channels: Construction, Industrial, MRO, Welding, Metalworking or Automotive. Must have experience working with sales agencies and factory sales people. Excellent communication, including very good written skills. Ability to develop and make effective sales presentations. Must be well organized and possess a strong work ethic. Ability to analyze sales activity reports and respond accordingly. Ability to work in a team environment. Strong leadership/team building skills. Must have a high energy level and be a self starter. Proficient in computer skills including Microsoft office.  Education Requirements: College degree preferred,  Location: Home base to be centralized within region of responsibility. Position requires upwards of 75%. Travel (50% overnight).  Supervises: Territory Manager's, Applied Product Specialists, Sales Technicians and manufacturer's reps in the region.  To Apply: Dise & Company will review all applications and resumes submitted via this LinkedIn posting. Appropriate candidates will be contacted by a member of the recruiting team for telephone screening. Any candidate selected for a face-to-face interview will be asked to prepare a Letter of Intent.

Siegwerk is looking for a Sales Account Manager to join our team! The ideal candidate location is within California.  We are seeking a strong technical sales candidate to join our organization as the point person for local customer accounts. The goal of the position is to impact our selling processes and provide technical support in a manner that results in increased new and sustained business.  Job Responsibilities: · Applies strategic selling tactics: assesses buying influences (e.g. economic, technical, user, coach, and their degree of influence. Works through or manages the concerns/issues of buying influences, such that the sales “window of opportunity” remains open to Siegwerk Ink. · Acts as point of contact for customer accounts in the assigned region. Coordinates these needs of the account by providing service or acquiring the resources to meet the account needs. · Assesses customers’ needs and proactively and reactively incorporates continuous improvement methods and philosophy. · Conducts need analyses through discussions, observations, and other means within existing local customer sites. Provides clear, accurate and complete information, outlining potential sales opportunities and provides input to Area/Regional Managers & VP of Sales & Marketing. · Works with and calls on top level management as well as user buyers, to develop technical response/action plans regarding issues and opportunities. · Directly communicates on-site with area customers to address technical issues and/or interacts with customers as a professional immediate technical resource · Ascertains customers’ technical objectives and strategically plans and facilitates communication of Siegwerk’s relevant technical developments to respective customers. · Organizes and conducts product trials at customers’ plants. Develops and strengthens customer relationships between Siegwerk and customers. · Plays a key role in the area of Technical Service, working closely with the Technical group to establish clear customer focus and achieve business objectives through technical means. · Troubleshoots press issues – for flexo/screen/offset products for the Narrow Web industry customers - and recommends actions/formulations to improve/correct situation. · Gathers correct information so lab resources can operate in the most efficient manner, both to correct issues and to design new products. · Provides timely reports detailing customers’ technical issues/needs including trial reports. · Completes and updates activity in a timely manner using the tools designed and used by Siegwerk for the tracking and processing of both sales and technical activity (eg, Ink Portal, Sales Force, etc) · Other duties as assigned.  Required Abilities: · Ability to influence and persuade through effective use of language and oral presentations. Ability to respond to questions from groups of organization employees, organization management and customers. · Ability to develop, maintain and strengthen effective, customer relationships. · Knowledge of printing processes common in narrow web such as Flexo, Offset or Screen to include: (a) printing station configuration and mechanical function of each component; (b) ability to recognize basic printing problems; (c) understands basic printing terminology. · Understanding of press side fluid ink handling to include: (a) viscosity importance and measuring tools; (b) water and UV mechanical handling; (c) comprehension of basic chemistry differences between water base and UV base ink systems. · Understanding of major substrates and their basic end use to include different types of paper, polyethylene, polyesters and their marketing end use. · Understand color and color theory.  Education and Experience: Bachelor’s Degree Preferred with a minimum of 2 - 5 years technical sales or technical service related experience and/or equivalent combination of education and experience.  Travel Requirements: 75% Travel in the region should be expected

Consultative Sales  About OpFocus When mid-market SaaS companies grow rapidly, their Salesforce tech stack becomes disorganized & data becomes unreliable. The experts at OpFocus partner with clients to enable them to make Salesforce their single source of truth so that they can make data-driven decisions and scale their ARR sustainably.  The Role We are in search of a high-energy, dynamic, and self-driven salesperson that demonstrates proven success with building relationships & hitting quota in a senior-level consultative sales role. Critical to success in this role is your understanding of the Salesforce platform, its capabilities, and how SaaS organizations can leverage it for operational excellence.    Compensation is base salary plus commission.  Key Components of the Role Include: Prospect, build, and maintain sales pipeline to achieve monthly quota targets Conduct business development via Salesforce regional sales teams and other partner relationships Qualify accounts and opportunities based on a target client profile Gather requirements and organize solution scoping sessions with current and potential clients Formulate and clearly articulate proposed engagements Write Proposals and Statements of Work, and review these with stakeholders & clients to gather and incorporate feedback Continuously learn about new technologies, methodologies, and SaaS best practices Attend and on occasion organize events with partners, clients, and user groups Travel up to 30% of the time (within CDC and company guidelines)  Desired Skills and Experience: 5+ years of sales, consistently meeting or exceeding quota Demonstrated ability to lead analytical discussions, uncover underlying problems, and identify and articulate prioritized solutions Knowledge of CRM solutions and trends, pertaining to sales, marketing, and/or services operations needs Excellent presentation, written, and oral communication skills (writing sample required) Experience in selling or working in professional services is preferred  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

description: “We must be alarmingly enterprising and startlingly original. We must be honest and fearless. And we must spark a revolution.” - William Randolph Hearst, 1887   At Hearst, our employees are motivated to inform, inspire and provoke while being honest, relentless, fearless and startlingly original. In order to be successful in our mission, it’s important that we maintain a culture built on continuous learning, integrity, authenticity and innovation. We believe in helping our employees tell their own stories through professional development and boundless opportunity, and in return ensure they have a deep understanding of how their contributions help tell the story of one of the most celebrated media organizations in the world.   Hearst is looking for a Recruitment Sales Account Executive who will be responsible for maximizing advertising sales potential, through the development of quality business relationships and promotion of new/existing recruitment advertising products. This position requires a heavy amount of prospecting and lead-development with local businesses.   WHAT WE OFFER: There has never been a more exciting time to join the team. Our business is growing and transforming every day. Advertisers are partnering with us to help them navigate new marketing strategies in today’s increasingly complex digital environment. Simply put, the San Antonio Express-News is a media company that uses its rich history and data to deliver the most impactful media campaigns for our customers. We leverage our substantial audience reach, coupled with best in class advertising solutions to keep our customer’s brand in front of the right people at the right time.  Why are we different? Our people! Our company is diverse and filled with smart, passionate people who want to win. We offer an upbeat and collaborative working environment and expect our people to challenge the norm. With an abundance of opportunities to learn new things and develop the skills that are vital to your success, we expect our people to move up through the organization fast!  WHAT DOES SUCCESS LOOK LIKE?  Generating new leads by making cold calls and maintaining an awareness of new businesses opening in the area.  Understanding the clients’ advertising needs and develop the ideal marketing solution for them. Delivering customized sales presentations in person, or by phone/web-demos. Achieving your individual monthly sales quota. Client-focused service delivery resulting in a pleasurable customer experience.   HERE’S WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR:  5+ years of sales experience with a proven record of successfully exceeding goals. Sales experience in the staffing industry and recruiting advertising experience preferred. Passionate about educating clients and closing deals. Exceptional communication and presentation skills. Bachelor’s degree preferred.  As part of its continued efforts to maintain a safe workplace for employees, Hearst Newspapers requires that all employees who receive a written offer of employment on or after Sept 13, 2021 be fully vaccinated (as defined by the CDC) against the coronavirus by the first day of employment as a condition of employment, to the extent permitted by applicable law. Hearst Newspapers will consider requests for reasonable accommodations due to medical, including pregnancy or a pregnancy-related condition, and/or religious reasons on an individual basis in accordance with applicable legal requirements.

Who is MicroAgility? We are a business and technology consulting firm specialized in strategy execution. We are on a mission to help our clients and consultants succeed with Agility. Our agile, passionate, and experienced consultants’ partner with organizations to solve their challenges such as operational improvements, cost reduction, and managing growth. To learn more about MicroAgility, please visit www.MicroAgility.com . MicroAgility is head quartered in Princeton, New Jersey with offices in New York City, Toronto, and Atlanta. It is founded by former Executives of big four consulting.  Why MicroAgility? We believe in cultivating an environment based on trust and understanding. Our team members like to get things done, and we like to do so by being agile. Our culture is centered around Agility; so we love to see companies thrive, and we are motivated to continue helping companies and consultants in the Texas region.  Your Role: MicroAgility is seeking a Senior Business Development Manager (BDM) with an established network of hiring managers, c-level executives and/or HR/Sourcing managers to identify and develop new business. As a BDM, you’ll be responsible for the sale of MicroAgility consulting services. You’ll have the opportunity to discover and explore opportunities for consulting, and to visit prospects and clients You will work directly with our President and founder, as well as our core team of consultants and recruiters to identify unique candidates.   Your Responsibilities: · Representing MicroAgility to prospects and clients · Develop a 6 and 12 month development strategy for the target market · Work with your existing network to introduce MicroAgility, and gather requirements · Close new business deals by placing consultants with clients · Following up on potential leads given by the east coast team · To join a growing team of agile and driven members to help people succeed with agility. · Finding opportunity for expansion  Your Experience: · 10 years of business development and/or sales in the IT consulting or staffing industry  Your Compensation: · $100,000-$110,000 yearly compensation · With a competitive commission plan  Your Skillset: · You’ve done it before: You have a proven track record of bringing in new requirements and closing deals. · Your network: You’ve built a network of hiring managers, c-level executives, and/or HR/Sourcing managers · Action and Results driven: You like to see yourself and the organization succeed, and if things aren’t going well, you immediately change your plan and approach to generate results. At MicroAgility, we are looking for people with empathy, agility, and determination to succeed. You’re more than welcome to apply, even if your experience might not match perfectly with what’s above… Because we would not be the company we are today if we didn’t value unique perspective. We welcome any new perspectives and backgrounds and look forward to an opportunity of overcoming challenges and growing with you! Join us and become unbelievably agile!

Title: Territory Manager  Company: Cutting edge technology-based medical company with exclusive distribution rights to numerous products is building a specialized national team.  Description: Our well-established Company is on the hunt for the best of the best. We specialize in a best-in-class office-based wound care treatment program. We have a strong track record of generating long-term sales due to our industry best products, customer service, and technology-based solutions.  Requirements: Bachelor's Degree in healthcare or related field.  A minimum of 5-years of experience in wound care.  Must have established book of business in wound care clinics (i.e.: private practice, home visits, nursing homes, etc.)  Must complete Company training and follow corporate guidelines.  The right candidate will have a can-do attitude and will exemplify Company integrity and compassion for patients.  Compensation: Base salary $75K, uncapped commissions total at plan compensation is $290K. Top Reps making much more!

Mission of the Function: The Partner Sales Account Manager is responsible for development, exploitation, and maximization of the account penetration and profitable growth of assigned accounts and geography for the Digital Industries (DI) portfolio of products and solutions. Digital Industries comprises of SCADA & factory automation, low voltage drives, and digital connectivity products such as industrial networking, power supplies, and RFID/IID/RTLS. He/she represents Digital Industries in all sales/strategic activities and acts as interface between the customers, distributors, solution partners and Siemens.  Dimension of the role and volume: The Partner Sales Account Manager will have a geography consisting of a combination of Enter, Expand, and Defend accounts and will be responsible for the achievement of the account business targets in the respective customer base to include business planning, review, account development and revenue generation leading to market share growth. The role is intended to be self-sufficient in terms of product, technology, and solution knowledge at an executive level and 1st level engineering discussion/conversations.  Expected Interactions: External: Customer (incl. Executive and Senior Management), Partners (e.g. Distributors, Solution Partners); Internal: All Digital Industry Business Units, Smart Infrastructure (SI) counterparts.  Role Requirements:  Technical Knowledge  Understands, communicates, and articulates, the customer value proposition for Siemens products, solutions, and technologies at all levels within a customer organization, including maintenance, operations, engineering, purchasing, and executive levels.  Opportunity Management & Account Development  Ensures assigned sales targets are achieved by collaborating with Partners, Siemens Business Units, and support teams to enter, expand, and defend assigned accounts, with KPI reporting and tracking in CRM SieSales. Identifies, develops, and drives leads and opportunities with tracking in CRM SieSales for new account development. Ensures the seamless handover to project execution and delivery teams. Coordinates/collaborates with other Siemens entities (i.e. SI EP and DI SW) to further maximize account penetration  Territory Analysis and Transparency  Owns responsibility for the implementation and ongoing management of the distribution strategy, within their assigned geography. Analyzes the market, business targets & strategy, issues, needs, processes, value chain and key business drivers and makes recommendations to ensure adequate and effective Partner coverage. Represents the partner to the Siemens DI Business Units to ensure a unified approach towards customers, while providing operational excellence. Evaluates the distribution or solution partner capabilities and potential, for account identification, penetration, management, and ongoing support.  Partner Strategic Planning & Execution  In collaboration with the Partner, creates and align all components of the Annual Business Plan with Siemens Business Unit goals. Holds quarterly reviews of the financial, strategic and operational aspects of the Partner Annual Business Plan, and works with the Siemens Business Units, support teams, etc. to ensure sales targets are achieved. Works with Partners to ensure all aspects of Partner business operations are in compliance with Siemens policies, manages resolution of potential violations and corrective actions Collaborates with other sales teams across multiple geographies as necessary to ensure seamless cooperation between Partners throughout the sales process  Relations Management  Builds/maintains sustainable relationships with the appropriate customer, distribution decision makers. Facilitates and plans relationships on executive and senior levels with the distributors, customers and Siemens management.  Escalation Management  Provides early recognition of potential risks with (major) business impact. When necessary escalates identified risks in time to appropriate DI Management.  Required Knowledge/Skills, Education, And Experience  Candidate should have 2+ years of previous experience selling technical products and solutions. 8+ years of professional experience in a sales environment. The candidate should possess technical knowledge of factory automation, motion control, drive systems, control products, and Industrial Ethernet networks. Proven track record of developing new business opportunities in a teaming environment. Must be able to demonstrate the ability to identify or uncover a customer’s specific challenge, develop relevant relationships with customer’s organization, develop a strategy, propose a technical solution, and win the opportunity. Excellent communication and collaboration skills are essential. Position requires 15% overnight travel. BS in a related discipline or equivalent combination of education and experience. BS in mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, or computer science is preferred. This position requires employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless they are granted a medical or religious exemption.  Organization: Digital Industries  Company: Siemens Industry, Inc.  Experience Level: Experienced Professional  Job Type: Full-time  Equal Employment Opportunity Statement  Siemens is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, creed, religion, national origin, citizenship status, ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability unrelated to ability, marital status, family responsibilities, pregnancy, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity, transgender, sex stereotyping, order of protection status, protected veteran or military status, or an unfavorable discharge from military service, and other categories protected by federal, state or local law. jobFunction: Sales, Business Development, and Product Management

description: The Sales Manager, New Business will have responsibility for all new business bookings. You will play a hands-on role in nurturing/closing deals as well as role in creating a scalable, repeatable sales process and methodology.   Location: REMOTE  All applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis and you must reside in the following states: CO, FL, IL, IN, KS, MO, MS, NC, OK, PA, TN, TX, VA, WI.  What you will do everyday: Drive bookings. Win new logos across multiple segments. Build a repeatable, scalable sales process and methodology.  Flesh out buyer personas, understand buyer behaviors, refine value prop, messaging, etc., culminating in the creation of a repeatable, scalable sales process to drive bookings. Help build and lead the sales team. Recruit, onboard, train, and mentor a sales organization consistent with sales model. Manage the sales team. Manage and support key sales functions including budget planning, metrics management, forecasting accuracy, customer relationships and pipeline. Ability to accurately forecast monthly, quarterly, and annual sales Participate directly in sales calls, negotiations, etc. as required. Close deals. Directly participate in closing deals with accounts. Instill process, discipline, and focus.  Instill the proper degree of sales process and discipline to support the company through its next phase of growth. Optimize the funnel. Work closely with marketing and the Sr. Director of Sales to develop a strong lead-gen engine and refine and optimize the acquisition funnel. Automate and metricize. Innovate upon current infrastructure and sales systems to further automate and metricize the sales model and sales processes.  What you need to bring to the table: At least 5 years proven sales experience, with front-line sales management experience. Sales management and leadership experience, preferably in a rapidly-growing SaaS company that has considerable success scaling revenues.  Proven experience selling in both a high velocity SMB segment and a large Enterprise market. Experience selling in both an inside/outside direct sales model is strongly preferred.  The Sales Manager will be ready to roll up your sleeves and bring a hands-on player/coach approach to sales management in order to guide the development and growth of the sales organization.  You will define success in terms of results and will be a driven, creative individual with a superior ability to execute.  Individuals with a strong DNA in coaching and developing teams and motivating them to go beyond expectations likely mesh well with the culture. Importantly, this individual will possess the interpersonal and leadership skills needed to represent the company well to its customers and partners. Experience scaling teams and exceeding targets is required. Capable of building and executing a flawless sales process and methodology; this will be equal parts strategy and tactics, and it’s important that this person be a “doer” on top of a “thinker” Build upon a culture of innovation, positivity, collaboration, and accountability The ability to travel 25%+    Benefits and Perks: Generous health coverage for you and your family, including short- and long-term disability coverage, 401(k) and HSA matching, company-provided life insurance, and more. Engage remotely! Since March of 2020, we transitioned to a fully remote environment and we run regular contests, trivia games and remote happy hours. Instant-Access & Flexible vacation. We trust you, so we have a ‘take what you need’ vacation policy. No waiting to use it or need for accruals. Do More, Be More – Company rewards and recognition that add up and can be redeemed for once-in-a-lifetime Bucketlist experiences! Get active in the community by joining one of our many quarterly offsite volunteer and community service events. Fun company events, including Halloween costume contests, ugly sweater competitions, baseball game outings, ice cream socials, food trucks, and more.  Storable is committed to providing equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, Storable will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

Beehive Cyber is a Managing General Agency offering unique insurance programs focused on Cyber Insurance and Tech E&O. We leverage insurance, technology and partnerships with Managed Service Providers to ensure our clients have the resources to secure their digital assets so they can protect their balance sheet and reputation.  Beehive Cyber’s core values include Trust, Diversity, Partner and Customer Success and Curious Learning. Our goal is to mitigate, transfer and transform cyber and privacy risk so businesses have the confidence to pursue their visions. We are also committed to devoting time and profit towards social and environmental issues in ways that create positive change.    The Vice President, Business Development (VPBD) reports directly to the President/CEO. The VPBD is responsible for sourcing, qualifying and building our Managed Service Provider Partner (MSP) Base, selling Tech E&O & Cyber Insurance to the partners themselves and leading efforts to engage with the MSP’s downstream clients.    They do this by:  Sourcing MSPs that leads to closed revenue and quota attainment by a combination of referrals, MSP peer groups, Beehive third party product and service partnerships and cold calling.  Partnering with our internal resources in order to drive additional value and expertise.   Building a point of view on how to help their MSP partners.   Accurately forecasting.   Selling on value and ROI vs price.  Building credibility and trust while influencing buying decisions.

Our client, Folding Guard, is seeking an ambitious Regional Sales Manager. You’ll be joining a fast-growing multinational leading manufacturer of Safety, Security, and Storage Products. The ideal candidate for this role will get a thrill from playing a pivotal role in Folding Guard’s continued rapid growth journey.  About the Position  As Regional Sales Manager, you be a key part of the US Sales Team and cover a 3 Mid-West State Territory. The selected individual will thrive off acquiring new business and servicing/growing existing Accounts. The Regional Sales Manager will use a consultative sales style to provide prospects and existing customers with applicable solutions and keep them up to date on new industry trends. Reporting to the VP of Sales, the Regional Sales Manager will lead revenue growth in a primarily Direct Sales Channel using a variety of methods to acquire new business. The opportunity for growth within this fast-growing environment is very evident. Folding Guard strongly promotes a culture that emphasizes team objectives and promotes cross-departmental collaboration.   Main Tasks & Responsibilities  Promotes/sells/secures orders from existing and prospective customers through a relationship-based approach. Establishes, develops, and maintains business relationships with current customers and prospective customers in their assigned territory Demonstrates products and services to existing/potential customers and assists them in selecting those best suited to their needs. Research sources for developing prospective customers and for information to determine their potential. Coordinates sales efforts with inside sales, marketing, sales management, accounting, logistics, and technical service groups. Provides details needed to complete the quote & design process, including competitive pricing information Analyze the territory/market’s potential and determine the value of existing and prospective customers’ value to the organization. Maintain up-to-date records in the CRM system. Prepare monthly reports. Visit Client and Project locations to provide onsite support Maintain Key Relationships with Clients and Business Partners   Qualifications  Your Work Experience & Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering/Business related field required Minimum of 5 years of experience working in a similar function Experience within a Manufacturing / Distribution or related environment is required Willing to travel up to 75% within assigned territory (mostly Domestic, some International) Proficient in ERP and CRM systems MS Office Suite Skills   What We Offer is More than Just a Job…. An excellent team-focused work environment with visibility for your efforts along with professional growth opportunities. An opportunity to be a part of a truly innovative and fast-growing international company. Competitive compensation package and benefits including health plan, life insurance equal to 2 times salary, dental, vision and disability insurance; 401 K Plan w/ company match; Numerous voluntary benefits opportunities, Paid Time Off; 10 holidays   Folding Guards COVID protocol Remote interview process Personal protective equipment provided or required Temperature screenings Social distancing guidelines in place Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Warehousing, and Mechanical or Industrial Engineering

jobTitle: Sales Executive - Medical Device and Pharmaceutical
description: At UL, we know why we come to work. Thousands of us around the world wake up every day with a common purpose: to make the world a safer, more secure and sustainable place. Science is in our DNA; we are endlessly curious and passionate about seeking and speaking the truth. We take delight in knowing that our work makes a meaningful contribution to society, and we are proud that our culture is centered on integrity, collaboration, inclusion and excellence. UL stands at the forefront of technological advancement, and we are continually challenged to find new ways to foster innovation and positive change. Satisfying? Yes. Exciting? Absolutely!  What you’ll learn & achieve: Emergo by UL is an industry leading consulting firm that supports medical device and in vitro diagnostic companies commercialize globally. Many leading medical device and in vitro diagnostic manufacturers rely upon our services to produce safe and effective products that meet regulatory affairs and quality assurance requirements of ministries of health globally, including the US FDA. Our work involves everything from developing regulatory strategies, supporting with execution of that strategy and maintaining compliance following ministry of health approval. We support a variety of clients from traditional medical device companies to consumer electronics companies entering the health/wellness space for the very first time.  As a member of our sales team, you will be responsible for expanding our relationship with existing accounts as well as acquiring new accounts in a specific region.  Promotes and sells a portfolio of services to existing accounts. Identifies new accounts within assigned territory to promote and sell a portfolio of services directly to new clients. Utilizes CRM to create, monitor and revise lead generation plans to ensure a substantive sales pipeline focused on new accounts. Identifies and pursues prospects through various lead generating activities, including tradeshow attendance and cold- calling. Meet with prospects to identify and qualify their needs including understanding decision makers, delivery timeframe, budget status, challenge and pain points, and competition status. Supports the development of sales presentations and presents to potential new clients following a disciplined consultative selling strategy that fully leverages the full portfolio of Emergo by UL services. Provides value propositions to clients, handles complex objections, prepares quotes or reviews quotes prepared by others, and closes sales by getting prospects’ commitment with little or no supervision. Meets or exceeds assigned sales target on a quarterly basis. Read and follow the Underwriters Laboratories Code of Conduct, and follow all physical and digital security practices. Performs other duties as directed  What makes you a great fit: University Degree (Equivalent to Bachelors degree) in a related discipline plus generally seven years of directly related experience. Ability to communicate effectively and concisely.General knowledge of company policies and sales processes. Demonstrated ability to execute projects to stated objectives. Has a general understanding of companys products and services. Significant business travel and work outside of the office required.  What you’ll experience working at UL: Mission: For UL, corporate and social responsibility isn’t new. Making the world a safer, more secure and sustainable place has been our business model for the last 125 years and is deeply engrained in everything we do. People: Ask any UL employee what they love most about working here, and you’ll almost always hear, “the people.” Going beyond what is possible is the standard at UL. We’re able to deliver the best because we employ the best. Interesting work: Every day is different for us here as we eagerly anticipate the next innovation that our customers’ create. We’re inspired to take on the challenge that will transform how people live, work and play. And as a global company, in many roles, you will get international experience working with colleagues around the world. Grow & achieve: We learn, work and grow together with targeted development, reward and recognition programs as well as our very own UL University that offers extensive training programs for employees at all stages, including a technical training track for applicable roles. Total Rewards: All employees at UL are eligible for bonus compensation. UL offers a generous 401k matching structure of up to 5% of eligible pay. Additionally, we invest an additional 4% into your retirement saving fund after your first year of continuous employment. We provide Healthcare Reimbursement Accounts and Health Savings Accounts that UL contributes to twice per year! Depending on your role, you can work with your manager on flexible working arrangements. We also provide employees with paid time off including vacation, holiday, sick and volunteer time off.  Learn More: Working at UL is an exciting journey that twists and turns daily. We thrive in the twists and revel in the turns. This is our every day. This is our normal.    Curious? To learn more about us and the work we do, visit UL.com.

New Employee Requisition for TSC Americas  Requisition Job: Regional Sales Manager (RSM), Americas – East Territory   Description of the Position and its requirements: The TSCA Regional Sales Manager (RSM) East is responsible for leading all sales activity within the Americas East territory (defined below).    Revenue attainment for TSCA East territory- includes assigned territory direct accounts, territory distribution POS and assigned territory based global accounts. Sales Management of TSC America Inc., sales representative network across the North America Eastern territories: Sales Management and revenue attainment of TSCA East territory.  Drive sales goals through  sales representatives across the New England, New York, New Jersey-Eastern Penn, Mid-Atlantic, South East and Florida/PR territories (Americas East Territory). Select, manage, motivate and collaborate with Americas East territory sales representatives to meet or exceed company revenue goals. Develop, align and execute “top ten” account penetration plans for Americas East Territory sales representative partners. Leverage collaborative account coverage approach (direct TSC, FAE, assigned rep, etc.) to penetrate and grow TSC content at top ten SAM potential accounts in each territory. Maintain and manage opportunity pipeline from prospecting through customer production orders for combined America East Territory. Collaborate with sales representatives, TSCA FAE and TSC Product Lines to develop opportunities, win AVL position, and monetize print position for Americas East Territory designed customer opportunities. Manage (approve) Americas East Territory sales representative split registrations and commissions payments. Manage interface between TSC America East Territory customer base and TSC company. Prioritize and manage Americas East Territory customer requests to support strategic account development and growth (technical support, sample support, RFQs, annual contract negotiations, etc.). Build internal company network with sales operations team, product lines, corporate planning, corporate quality and factory organizations to deliver exceptional customer service for top assigned accounts. Develop and implement strategies to promote, design-in and monetize TSC new products across the America East Territory. Collaborate with TSC America team to support America region goal achievement. Cross train with Central and West RSMs to accelerate learning, collaborate to highlight sales organization constraints, and work with rest of company to drive continuous productivity improvement. Participate in TSCA quarterly business reviews and structured channel business reviews (e.g. EDS). Active participation in TSC America weekly and TSC HQ biweekly sales reviews. TSCA representative for TSC global accounts managed out of the Americas East Territory. Global account collaboration with sales organizations in Europe, China, Japan, Korea, Taiwan and SEA/India to present a unified, interface for strategic global accounts. TSC America biweekly global account activity updates     Educational Requirements: Candidate must possess BA/BS degree or equivalent.  Qualifications: Minimum of 15 years account sales experience in the Americas semiconductor market; power semiconductor sales experience highly desired. Candidate must possess excellent networking, communication and leadership skills, with at least 7 years of sales representative management experience. Ideal candidate has broad exposure across the Americas East Territory customer base, experience managing a sales representative network, experience managing multi-national global accounts, and experience selling semiconductor products into the Americas Industrial or Automotive markets.    Reporting Structure Position reports directly in TSC America Inc., Vice President Sales    Scheduled Work Week and Additional Requirements Position is scheduled for Full-time employee; Days per week: 5, Mon through Fri, from 08:00 AM to 05:00 PM Relocation WILL NOT be included for the role. Candidate will work from their home office within the Americas East Territory. Candidate is expected to both travel (25%) and establish structured sales representative reviews via Microsoft Teams within the Americas East territory to actively manage sales representative network, develop territory accounts and promote TSC brand across the America East market distribution channel.

At Kia, we’re creating award-winning products and redefining what value means in the automotive industry. It takes a special group of individuals to do what we do, and we do it together. Our culture is fast-paced, collaborative, and innovative. Our people thrive on thinking differently and challenging the status quo. We are creating something special here, a culture of learning and opportunity, where you can help Kia achieve big things and most importantly, feel passionate and connected to your work every day.  Kia provides team members with competitive benefits including premium paid medical, dental and vision coverage for you and your dependents, 401(k) plan matching of 100% up to 6% of the salary deferral, and time off starting at 14 days per year. Kia also offers company lease and purchase programs, company-wide holiday shutdown, paid volunteer hours, and premium lifestyle amenities at our corporate campus in Irvine, California.  Status  Exempt  Summary  Maximum wholesale/retail sales of Kia vehicles to achieve annual objectives. Implement KMA sales & marketing policies, procedures and operating standards to ensure program(s) compliance.  Provide dealer assistance in the development of effective advertising/merchandising plans & sales promotion. Train dealership sales personnel in the areas of sales & product knowledge to maximize Kia retail sales and customer satisfaction. All Kia dealerships portray a consistent, high-quality image in the marketplace, properly utilizing Kia dealership identification, point-of-sale displays, and vehicle inventory displays. Dealer development actions completed, including new dealer proposals, replacements, buy/sells, terminations and ownership changes. All Kia dealerships are profitable, sufficiently capitalized and maintain adequate floor plan lines of credit to meet KMA’s operating standard. Qualified dealership management is provided to maintain average or above average market share.  Major Responsibilities  Priority  Major Responsibility  %  1st  Wholesale/allocate new Kia vehicles  35  2nd  Develop and implement action plans with dealers that will improve/assure: a. Kia retail sales performance; B. Sales satisfaction of customers; c. Adherence to Kia dealership operating standards.  35  3rd  Coordinate dealer expansion efforts by: a. Identifying market representation needs; b. Prospecting for qualified dealer candidates; c. Evaluating dealer candidate proposals; d. jobTitle: OR Sales Specialist, Patient Monitoring (San Jose/Central Valley)
description: Careers that Change Lives  The Medical Surgical Portfolio strives to enable earlier diagnosis, better treatment, faster complication-free recovery, and enhanced patient outcomes through less invasive surgical solutions.  As an Operating Room Sales Specialist with our Patient Monitoring business, you will promote the Patient Monitoring’s capital and consumable portfolio that addresses respiratory surgical complications. As a goal-driven Operating Room Sales Specialist, you are the primary person responsible for driving revenue generating sales to key hospital personnel and the end customer. Your primary responsibilities include accurately forecasting your business, owning customer relationships, understanding and targeting customer product needs, and developing and executing the sales strategy around those opportunities.  Bring your sales talents to a leader in medical technology and healthcare solutions. Rooted in our long history of mission-driven innovation, our medical technologies open doors. We support your growth with the training, mentorship, and guidance you need to own your future success. Join us for a career in sales that changes lives.  A Day in the Life Responsible for driving capital and consumable product portfolio sales that addresses respiratory surgical complications to the Operating Room area of care, as well as the C-Suite level of a hospital Lead territory opportunity development and activities that translate to accurate monthly, quarterly, and annual projections. The Operating Room Sales Specialist will maintain sole ownership of providing accurate forecasts to their Regional Business Manager each reporting period for their territory Identify, qualify, prepare, and execute effective sales strategies that maintain the existing base of business and support the close of competitive and revenue growth opportunities Probe, develop, and close all related product sales inquiries/leads with existing customers within assigned geographic territory Coordinate and collaborate with regionally aligned field sales team to drive incremental RMS revenue and achieve target sales goals Develop, negotiate, close, and manage profitable agreements Effectively utilize and update sales tools to accurately address trends in existing base of business, create call strategies, and to manage territory and strategic business plans Effectively deliver strategic messaging in a variety of settings, including trade shows, presentations, and board meetings Provide product feature and benefit application consultation, drive value messaging, as well as clinical support Lead the local team in the coordination and support of clinical evaluations and pre-sales support Conduct post-sales activities, including implementation, product education, in-servicing, and ongoing support Maintain and build customer relationships to understand, align, and support customer initiatives Maintain detailed level of knowledge of related products and applications Maintain a comprehensive understanding of related programs and value-added offerings Utilize Specialist and Clinical resources in an efficient and cost effective manner to optimize sales process Inform Regional Business Manager and local area team members of new account opportunities Complete all assigned projects and administrative duties in a timely manner Consistently maintain all Vendor Credentialing requirements Networks & ERGs  Medtronic has four Diversity Networks including a global Medtronic Women’s Network and U.S-based Networks representing Asian, African, and Hispanic/Latino descent employees. Between site-based and Network-affiliated ERGs, there are over 21,000 enrolled employees operating more than 200 ERG hubs in 65 countries  Diversity & Inclusion  We seek out and hire a diverse workforce at every level: We need fresh ideas and inclusive insights to continue to be an innovative industry leader — that’s why we make it a point to seek out, attract and develop employees who are patient-centric, passionate, and who represent the same wide variety of life experiences as our patients. To learn more about Inclusion & Diversity at Medtronic Click Here  Must Have: Minimum Requirements: Bachelor’s degree (B.A. or B.S.) from a four-year college or university (G.P.A. of 3.0 or higher preferred) Minimum of 3 years of field sales experience Nice to Have 5 years of sales experience 2+ years of documented sales success (achievement to quota) in medical capital equipment and/or consumables 1+ years in team selling environment Experience selling to the acute care hospital operating room environment Able to quickly compile contracts with supporting financial business case Proven ability to succeed in complex sales and clinical environments Strong computer expertise and business application Thorough understanding of the sales process Understanding of the medical sales arena Strong verbal and written communication; exceptional client interaction skills PHYSICAL JOB REQUIREMENTS: The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Movement of demo capital equipment Travel required in assigned region About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.  Physical Job Requirements  The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. jobTitle: Associate Sales Representative, Pain Therapies - Reno, NV
description: Careers that Change Lives  Bring your talents to an industry leader in medical technology and healthcare solutions – we’re a market leader and growing every day. You can be proud to sell medical technologies that are rooted in our long history of mission-driven innovation. Our expanding portfolio delivers measurable clinical and economic value – and opens doors. You will be empowered to shape your own career. We support your growth with the training, mentorship, and guidance you need to own your future success. Together, we can transform healthcare.  Join us for a career in sales that changes lives.  Business Description:  Our vision is to become the undisputed world leader in Neuromodulation, improving patient lives through innovative solutions. Our therapies span the care continuum; from early interventional procedures to implantable surgical technologies that relieve pain, restore function and improve lives for our patients.  We're committed to applying clinical and economic evidence and integrated technologies to our unmatched portfolio of therapies to develop healthcare solutions that increase patient access, improve the efficiency of procedures and deliver successful patient outcomes.  The Neuromodulation Operating Unit offers solutions — from early interventional procedures to implantable surgical technologies — that treat chronic pain as well as pain from spinal fractures, cancer, and severe spasticity.  Our key Pain Therapies include: Spinal Cord Stimulation , Drug infusion for chronic pain , and Drug infusion for severe Spasticity.  A Day in the Life:  At Medtronic, the Associate Sales Representative, Pain Therapies is responsible for soliciting orders, selling Medtronic Pain products assigned and representing the company in accordance with its policies and in the area assigned; for maintaining awareness of local competitive conditions and for reporting back promptly to the district manager. This position will work in tandem with a Pain Sales Representative 2 and will have territory coverage responsibility and sales responsibility.  This is a field based role.  Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned: Generate new sales: Develop leads, recruit new surgeons, qualify prospects, and make sales calls. Grow existing Pain business and develop new opportunities. Work with minimal supervision utilizing corporate resources to generate revenue and meet/exceed quota. Manage accounts in assigned territory. Implement approved marketing strategies. Aggressively seeks new customers and formulates and follow plans for such action as directed by the District Sales Manager. Respond to customer complaints in accordance with Medtronic policy and advise District Sales Manager and Medtronic promptly of any situation beyond scope of authority. Stay attentive to competitor’s product and merchandising practices and to keep the District Sales Manager informed concerning them. Maintain up-to-date customer record books and other records in accordance with District Sales Manager instructions. Identify selling opportunities and work closely with the sales representatives to increase sales in their respective accounts. Successfully complete all required product and sales related training curriculum. Prepare and submit call reports as required by District Sales Manager. Attend and participate in sales meetings, training programs, conventions, and trade shows as directed. Cooperate with all personnel on the execution of Company programs. Create and implement an annual business plan with quarterly updates. Provide service to customers per their individual needs. Respond in a timely manner to all reporting requirements and requests. Adhere to company policies and conducts all business in an ethical manner. We seek out and hire a diverse workforce at every level: We need fresh ideas and inclusive insights to continue to be an innovative industry leader —that’s why we make it a point to seek out, attract and develop employees who are patient-centric, passionate, and who represent the same wide variety of life experiences as our patients.  To learn more about Inclusion & Diversity at Medtronic Click Here  Must Have: Minimum Requirements  To be considered for this role, please ensure the minimum requirements are evident on your resume. Bachelor's Degree Nice to Have Ortho, Spine or O.R. experience Ability to sell in an environment where partnering with a surgeon is critical and ability to sell a new device or procedure Thrive in an environment of variety and rapid growth & change Excellent communication and presentation skills Accustomed to working independently with a high degree of accountability Fluency in Spanish, speaking and writing About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.  Physical Job Requirements  The physical demands described within the Day in the Life section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; and use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls. The employee is occasionally required to reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 30 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and distance vision Must be able to travel Work Environment The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet to moderate. Position involves some travel & possible spur of the moment travel. Position involves potential radiation exposure. Must have a valid driver's license and active vehicle insurance policy. In addition, your driving record will be reviewed and will be considered as part of your application. jobTitle: Regional Sales Manager - Dallas or Houston, TX
description: Company Info  Teva is a global pharmaceutical leader and the world's largest generic medicines producer, committed to improving health and increasing access to quality health solutions worldwide. Our employees are at the core of our success, with colleagues in over 80 countries delivering the world's largest medicine cabinet to 200 million people every day. We offer a uniquely diverse portfolio of products and solutions for patients and we've built a promising pipeline centered around our core therapeutic areas. We are continually developing patient-centric solutions and significantly growing both our generic and specialty medicines business through investment in research and development, marketing, business development and innovation. This is how we improve health and enable people to live better, healthier lives. Join us on our journey of growth!  Job Description  Teva is searching for a Regional Sales Manager (RSM) to join our psychiatry sales team in Dallas/Houston, TX location. This position will be part of the newly created sales team focused on the psychiatry space and responsible for the performance of a yet-to-be-approved long-acting injectable therapy for schizophrenia. The RSM will hire, onboard, and build out a regional team comprised of 8-10 sales associates. The RSM will be responsible for achieving and delivering results in a compliant and ethical manner. The RSM will possess an understanding of organizational objectives and align resources appropriately to meet those objectives. While pursuing their goals, the incumbent will uphold the culture and values of Teva in all interactions and business matters. They will analyze trends and apply knowledge to help the sales team accomplish its sales goals. Additionally, the RSM will effectively and efficiently plan and complete all business activities via aligned objectives and analytics and will maximize available resources. The RSM will build and maintain strong, mutually beneficial networks/relationships with both internal and external stakeholders. The RSM will possess impactful and influential communication and presentation skills and keep the objective in mind while moving the sales team towards a solution.  Essential Areas Of Responsibility  The following areas of responsibility are essential to the satisfactory performance of this position by any incumbent. Any nonessential functions are assumed to be included in other related duties or assignments. Identify, recruit, coach, and retain top talent for the Teva Psychiatry sales team Develop expertise and coach others on regional business focus areas, including settings of care, payer and pull through opportunities, and flawless execution of the marketing strategy Develop effective business plans to meet and exceed regional sales goals Coach/train others on different settings of care to identify key business opportunities Demonstrate a collaborative sales approach and coordinate efforts between sales leadership, other Teva sales teams, market access, sales operations, and training Adhere to all Teva compliance guidelines, operate with integrity, and ensure the sales team adheres to these policies Review weekly/monthly data reports to identify trends and make plans to address concerns Coach teams on the execution of the defined call plan for each territory representative Coach teams towards success from hire date onward, providing appropriate counseling, encouragement, and oversight to ensure effective execution of brand strategy Spend 90+ days in the field, supporting local sales representatives The ideal candidate will live in either Dallas or Houston, TX Qualifications  Any equivalent combination of education, training, and/or experience that fulfills the requirements of the position will be considered.  Education/Certification/Experience Bachelor's degree required Minimum of 1 ½ + years of pharmaceutical first line sales management or related people management required A record of successfully achieving sales goals and building, coaching, and developing effective sales teams required Experience in psychiatric therapeutic areas strongly preferred Specific experience with long-acting injectables for the treatment of schizophrenia preferred Experience successfully launching products in the psychiatric space across multiple settings of care preferred Injectable and in-office administration experience within a mental health facility preferred Skills/Knowledge/Abilities Ability to interact with customers in live and virtual environments and proficiency with technology Understanding of reimbursement coverage and pull through strategies as well as experience in all pertinent settings of business (CMHC, specialty pharmacy, private practice) Proven written and verbal communication skills Valid US driver's license and acceptable driving record required Teva Pharmaceuticals USA, Inc. requires all U.S. new hires to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 (unless an accommodation is legally required) prior to the first day of Teva employment. As required by applicable law, however, Teva will consider requests for reasonable accommodations.  Additionally, U.S. new hires for customer facing roles will be required to complete all credentialing requirements for access to their customers’ targets within 60 days of their start date. Such credentialing requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional vaccinations and medical testing. Any request for an exception to the credentialing requirements will need to be approved by the national sales leader within the first 60 days of employment.  TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS - Extensive travel throughout the assigned region, which may include air travel and weekend or overnight travel.  Function  Sales  Sub Function  Medical Representation  Already Working @TEVA?  If you are a current Teva employee, please apply using the internal career site available on "Employee Central". By doing so, your application will be treated with priority. You will also be able to see opportunities that are open exclusively to Teva employees. Use the following link to search and apply: Internal Career Site  The internal career site is available from your home network as well. If you have trouble accessing your EC account, please contact your local HR/IT partner.  Teva’s Equal Employment Opportunity Commitment  Teva Pharmaceuticals is committed to equal opportunity in employment.
