description: Description Position: Territory Sales Manager Location: Home Office located in either Austin or San Antonio Please Note:  Our client’s official title for this role is “Senior Sales Representative”. We have referred to this role as Territory Account Manager in this description for recruiting purposes, as that title better represents the scope of the job. Our client does not sponsor employment visas (e.g. H-1B visa status).  Client and Position Summary: Our client is a well-established, privately held global corporation. They are a leading manufacturer of high-performance advanced materials and integrated materials solutions spanning the Aerospace, Energy, Semiconductor, Life Sciences, and Industrial markets. Their product portfolio consists primarily of high-performance elastomers, thermoplastics, and composites capable of withstanding extreme environments (high pressure, high temperature, chemical resistivity, etc…).  This position reports to the Regional Sales Manager and is responsible for generating revenue and/or profit margin in assigned accounts and territories. Provides the technical interface between customer and company engineering, manufacturing, and program management representatives. Cultivates potential technical specifications, pricing considerations, and contract requirements. The territory the candidate hired will cover spans the Austin and San Antonio, TX area and spans our client’s entire product portfolio within all targeted market segments. The majority of current customers within this region include industry leaders within the Semiconductor market. The major customers are highly technical and very demanding, and this job requires a candidate with a strong ability to manage and set customer expectations. This is a key role for building and managing the customer contact networks, developing market share, and sustaining within multiple accounts in multiple industries. The role will require a strong proactive approach challenging the ability to build strong relationships, penetrate customer networks, understand technical and business situations, and articulate metrics for success to enable solutions selling success across multiple industries/technologies. This position comes with a competitive salary, sales incentive program, vehicle lease package, 20 days PTO, and full benefits.  Job Responsibilities Include: Prospects for and identifies new customers and new product opportunities for company products to accomplish and maintain expected sales revenue and margin targets within assigned territory. Researches customer technical specifications and requirements with current or potential technical specifications of company products. Investigates new applications or improvements to products with customers. Creates, monitors and revises lead generation plans to generate a substantive sales opportunity pipeline. Produces revenue in line with the organization's and individual targets/quotas. Perform liaison duties between customer and company regarding specifications, drawing interpretations, production schedules, quality control demands, packaging requirements, etc. Prepare reports on customer contacts, sales opportunities, and accomplishments to keep management up-to-date on any pertinent information and activities within assigned accounts to report results and evaluate/set marketing and sales strategies and plans.  Primary Position Requirement: Bachelors preferred, ideally in an engineering discipline (Mechanical Eng; Chemical Eng; Mat Sci; etc…). 7+ years career experience, with the majority, focused on consultative outside technical sales is required, preferably B2B, including a demonstrated track record of revenue growth and profitability. Strong experience selling technical solutions is required. Hunter mentality, proactive consultative sales approach to develop a territory and pursue market share growth is required. Experience selling technical engineered solutions to key companies within the Semiconductor industry is highly preferred. Early career history in a technical role (engineering, sales engineering, etc…) is preferred. Experience using Sales Navigator and Salesforce or similar CRM tools to drive productivity is required. Must be willing to travel up to 50% (mostly within the territory so home most nights) including valid driver’s license. Bilingual English / Korean a plus. Our client does not sponsor employment visas (e.g. H-1B visa status).  Please Note: Our client is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer for Minority/Female/Veteran/Individuals with a Disability. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

Why Birdeye?  15 years ago brands controlled customer experiences. But in 2021, it’s customer experiences that control brands. Customers now choose businesses based on shared experiences, not ads. So marketers now have to create and promote great experiences, and they need a platform that can do this at scale.  Birdeye is an all-in-one Experience Marketing platform for multi-location businesses. More than 60,000 businesses of all sizes use Birdeye every day to be found online and chosen through listings, reviews and referrals; be connected with leads and customers on the channels of their choice, and deliver the best customer experience with survey, ticketing and insights tools.  Founded in 2012, Birdeye is headquartered in Palo Alto, and led by alumni from Google, Amazon, Salesforce and Yahoo. Birdeye is backed by Salesforce founder Marc Benioff, Yahoo co-founder Jerry Yang, Trinity Ventures and World Innovation Lab. The company has been the highest-rated Experience Marketing platform over the last 5 years on G2.  To learn more, please visit: https://birdeye.com  What You'll Do:  Birdeye, the all-in-one Experience Marketing platform for multi-location businesses, is looking for rockstar Commercial Account Executives. This is an exciting opportunity for an entrepreneurial-minded sales executive looking to get in on the ground floor of one of Silicon Valley's hottest startups. If you possess the right energy, competitive spirit, personal drive and track record of success in Sales, this is an opportunity that you cannot afford to miss.  The market opportunity for Experience Marketing software is roughly $50B+ in the US and 2-3x that number globally. To put this opportunity in perspective - there is not a single business in the US (or globally) that could not use our software, something difficult to say about other types of point solutions. Birdeye needs winners that will help our company grow, exceed goals and expectations, and have a whole lot of fun along the way!  Responsibilities Drive sales growth by finding and closing business in our Commercial Segment defined as business with more than 50 locations nationally Close complex deals involving multiple CxO decision makers and stakeholders Working with your team to build custom presentations / demonstrations of our product for prospective clients Running effective Proof of Concept campaigns to prove Birdeye value Reporting on sales activity and metrics in our CRM Managing the full sales cycle in a team selling environment Work closely with Product and Customer care teams Manage pipeline, sales activity and have the ability to accurately forecast Work hard, play hard. We need to have fun as we succeed!  Requirements 3+ years of quota carrying software or technology sales as an individual contributor Bachelor's Degree Required Experience selling to digital marketers and marketing executives Outbound prospecting experience is a must! Have demonstrated a steep trajectory of success in previous sales roles Previous success prospecting, engaging and acquiring new business with mid-market sized companies Social Selling experience preferred Skilled in conducting presentations, online demonstrations and face to face meetings Extroverted, optimistic problem solver with a vibrant and energetic attitude You initiate action and are assertive Ability to use Google to research leads and prospects to build pipeline You are resourceful and consistent Excellent verbal and written communication Report track and manage sales activity in the CRM  Why You'll Join Us:  At Birdeye, we know that our success is tied to our customers’ success, so we are continually raising the bar for ourselves and others around us to deliver meaningful results.  We seek to innovate and to be the #1 product in our category, which means we need to drive results for our customers and to always deliver what we commit.  Our quality needs to be world-class and second to none, so we are exceptionally hands-on to get work done. We roll up our sleeves and DO.  Working at Birdeye means being part of a tight-knit family that helps you succeed and loves to celebrate with you! We find strength in diversity and inclusion, so we strive to find different points of view and expect everyone to represent their authentic self at all times.  Benefits Employer-paid benefits with multiple health plan options (HSA, PPO) Unlimited PTO 401(k) with company match Flexible work from home options available Maternity & Paternity Leave Employee Resource Groups - network with like-minded "Birds" Abundant opportunities that come with a dynamic and fast-growing organization!
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Company Description  Bosch Rexroth is one of the world’s leading providers of drive and control technologies. Regardless of the motion task that customers face anywhere in the world, they will always find a Bosch Rexroth team with the local experience and the appropriate know-how from more than 30 industries and all drive and control technologies. Our associates take on their customers’ challenges with passion and persistence until the right solution is found. This is what makes Bosch Rexroth a strong, reliable partner for Mobile Applications, Machinery Applications and Engineering and Factory Automation. As the Drive & Control Company, we develop, produce, and distribute our components and system solutions in over 80 countries. You’ll find our drive and control technology in a wide variety of applications: From excavators and tractors to CNC woodworking and metal-cutting machines. You’ll find us in automotive factories, packaging systems for the food industry, medical devices and laboratories.  Job Description  The AE Service Group is searching for a Service Sales person to join the AE Service team to support and grow the existing customer base. The Service Sales representative will have a clear understanding of the new products, the old product families, and how to apply them successfully into customer applications. The service sales representative will work closely with the customer, in coordination with the Regional Sales, Distributor Sales, and Engineering Teams in recognizing the needs of the customer, promoting solutions, and making recommendations. To be successful, service sales representative will be responsible for developing a good rapport with customers and have the ability to understand, communicate and break down technical terminology to non-technical customers.  Job Responsibilities Establish rapport with new and existing customers Evaluate the technical needs, and opportunities of the customer and make appropriate product recommendations Effectively communicate and explain complex technical information to customers in a way that is easily understandable Keep customers informed about new technologies and products Follow up with customers on existing applications and opportunities Assist the sales team in promoting technical solutions Work with the engineering team to ensure customer project requirements are met Work closely with Lohr, DE on service solution strategies Help ensure that sales targets are consistently met 50% travel Qualifications  Basic Qualifications Bachelors degree and/or five years of technical sales experience Valid drivers license Preferred Qualifications Technical / Engineering background preferred Strong Interpersonal, presentation, and communication skills Strong organizational skills and professional appearance Attention to detail Additional Information  BOSCH is a proud supporter of STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics) Initiatives FIRST Robotics (For Inspiration and Recognition of Science and Technology) AWIM (A World In Motion) By choice, we are committed to a diverse workforce - EOE/Protected Veteran/Disabled.
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Automotive, and Mechanical or Industrial Engineering

description: HIGH VISIBILITY ROLE*****GROWTH PATH* ** HIGH VISIBILITY Director of Sales ROLE with a family-owned market leading and growing construction and remodel organization in the specialty building materials industry!  The TRG Growth Practice engaged with a client to identify a Director of  Sales  - to drive company growth and market share in the South East.  Be in control of your career growth in this entrepreneurial role and have the acknowledgement from senior leadership as a result of successfully developing and executing strategy to drive market share, product mix and profitability in a marketplace critical to company growth targets.  Be the subject matter expert and have the autonomy to develop GTM, Sales Process and lead a motivated sales force  Desired Qualifications: · Proven team leadership and go to market strategy development · Working knowledge of construction process · Residential business to consumer building product sales a plus  If you are interested in this or future opportunities in your area, please send a Word-Formatted resume to ryanb@richgroupusa.com and we will contact you when opportunities arise that match your geography and experience. All inquiries are kept confidential and your information will not be shared without your prior approval. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to the individual's race, color, sex, national origin, religion, age, disability, genetic information, status as a military veteran or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Top Medical Sales Opportunity: Physician office and clinic call point (Infectious disease, UTI, Urology , OB/GYN, Respiratory, Gastro, SARS, COVID). Industry leader in molecular diagnostic testing for infectious disease. Company is well known and recognized for its growth (just relocated for the 3rd time since 2014 due to growth, currently in a 50,000 square foot space). Company is expanding nationwide with 20 openings. Launching new molecular tests.   Start at $65k-$70k base salary, 401k, full benefits, car allowance, all expenses paid, 10% on all monthly revenue to average $180k-$200k plus. (Their compeitors pay around 4%) 80% of their company is making $200k PLUS. Top reps are $300k plus. I have placed reps with company that have been there 4-6 years plus and earning an average of $250k plus. Flexibility and non-corp driven culture- work your territory like it's your own business. Untapped earning potential. Company is growing and hiring 20 reps!

Inform Diagnostics is a leading national pathology laboratory, headquartered in Irving, Texas, with additional state-of-the-art laboratories in Boston, New York City, and Phoenix. With unparalleled quality and experience, Inform Diagnostics provides reliable, high-quality diagnostic services in various subspecialties. The company is profoundly impacting patient care, one diagnosis at a time.  Sales Directors are responsible for the sales function of our Dermatology (DERM), Gastroenterology (GI) and Urology (GU) pathology services. Our Sales Directors are individual contributors who identify new business opportunities as the bulk of their day-to-day while also managing existing customer relationships within a given territory. They understand customer industry and business needs and strategically sell pathology products/services. Focus on driving revenue and client retention by building consultative relationships. Work with clients to establish a strategic account value. Successful Sales Directors follow a results-driven process while finding a balance between customer orientation and territory growth. Executes sales cycle with high level of service.  We offer competitive pay, full benefits (health, dental, vison, 401k+match, PTO, & more), mileage reimbursement and a generous uncapped sales bonus structure.  Required:  Bachelor's degree from an accredited University required. 5+ years of successful healthcare sales experience (both product and service) with experience calling on and selling to physicians and ambulatory surgery centers. 2+ years of lab experience preferred. Ability to travel 60% (and the ability to travel up to 90%) and work flexible hours when required. Positive attitude paired with strong work ethic and drive to win business. Ability to find opportunities and turn them into long-term, profitable relationships. Possess high degree of understanding the client relationship with Physicians, their needs, and how we can provide service and technology solutions for their pathology needs. Demonstrated decision making ability towards solving problems, while working under pressure and effectively communicating these solutions to coworkers and customers.  Territory: WA, OR, AK & HI  This job description reflects management’s assignment of essential functions. Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.
industries: Hospital & Health Care, Biotechnology, and Medical Practice

description: Peek is a 5-star reviewed leading software platform for the tours, activities and rentals industry (think hot air balloon rides, ziplining and cooking classes), empowering thousands of operators to automate their businesses and grow revenue by an average of 30%. More than 8 million activities lasting over 1.4 billion hours have been booked through the Peek platform.  We have won numerous awards for innovation, including being named one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies in Travel and a World Economic Forum Tech Pioneer (alongside past winners such as Google and Spotify). Peek’s CEO Ruzwana Bashir has been named one of Fortune's Most Powerful Women Entrepreneurs andFast Company's 100 Most Creative People in Business.  Peek follows a “remote-first” philosophy, with our team of over 150 Peeksters distributed across exciting locales such as San Francisco, Salt Lake City, New York, Seattle, Chile, Colombia and beyond.  PS: Peek just made the 2021 Forbes America's Best Startups Employer list!   The Role  Peek is looking for a talented, strategic, data-driven & results-oriented leader to help manage one of our Mid-Market inside sales teams. As a Mid-Market Sales Manager, you'll lead a team of full-cycle sales reps to exceed monthly, quarterly, and annual revenue quotas. You'll work directly with senior leaders to sell "Peek Professional" (www.peek.com/pro), our industry-leading SaaS platform that helps activities and rental operators generate more revenue, save time, and deliver amazing experiences for their customers. Outside of daily management duties, your responsibilities will include fostering a strong team culture, maintaining positive morale, and participating in our sales recruiting efforts. If developing people is your passion and you love adventure both inside and outside the workplace, we want to meet you!  Responsibilities Work with the current sales leadership team to foster and maintain a positive culture of learning and excellence within the sales organization Lead a team of 8-10 experienced inside sales reps to exceed performance expectations through high productivity, sales acumen, professional growth, and knowledge retention Develop and mentor team members to consistent performance through regular 1:1’s, individual coaching sessions, team training, skill development activities, goal setting/performance management, and servant leadership principles Coach your team on conducting efficient discovery meetings, Zoom demos, and crafting a solution in Peek Pro that best meets the needs of their prospects Measure, track and adjust performance against defined sales metrics/KPIs and rigorous pipeline management Manage the implementation and execution of go to market strategy in collaboration with senior leadership while continuously recommending initiatives to improve sales performance through proven change leadership techniques Work with BDR leaderships to ensure close alignment with the objectives and activities of the BDRs supporting the Mid-market Account Executives Collaborate with post-sales operations to ensure that expectations set during the sales cycle are met, and eliminate friction in the sales, implementation, and support/success cycle through standardization of policies and procedures  Profile for Success Strong sales coach and talent developer with an insatiable drive to help your team improve and exceed their goals Dynamic people leader that thrives in, and lives for, a fast-paced, data-driven environment Experienced professional that is never happy with the status quo and is constantly looking for ways to improve the workflow and productivity of their inside sales team Requirements 3+ years of relevant sales management experience. 2+ years of relevant B2B SaaS inside sales Management experience in a high activity, short/med-length sales cycle environment (<6 months) Strong project management, analytical, and communication skills. You know how to lead, coordinate, implement, and execute Well-versed in consultative sales techniques (e.g., Sandler, The Challenger Sale, M.E.T.R.I.C, Winning By Design), or other similar consultative sales methodologies. Proficient in Salesforce and other tools to assess your team’s performance and manage to specific outcomes Prior experience selling complex software or hardware into comparable brick-and-mortar businesses (e.g., restaurants, hotels, retail, etc.)  Nice to Haves Experience with sales productivity software such as Gong and Outreach Proficiency with Microsoft Excel and the Google suite (Sheets/Docs Presentations) Strong track record of successful sales results in an account executive role

We’re Fever!  Fever is the leading global entertainment discovery platform, and has revolutionised the world of entertainment since 2015, inspiring over 45 million people every month to discover the best experiences in their cities. Fever empowers event organizers to create amazing experiences, with successful examples such as the “Candlelight Concert Series” attended by over 1 million guests, the Los Angeles based “Stranger Things: The Drive-Into Experience”, or the “Mad Hatter G&T Party” in multiple cities across the world.   Fever is an international company with a team of over 350 people, currently present in more than 80 cities, with offices in New York, Los Angeles, Chicago, London, Paris, Madrid and Barcelona, and is backed by leading institutional investors, including Rakuten Capital, Accel, Fidelity and Atresmedia among others.  What do we do?  Fever’s marketplace is composed of events and experiences hosted by organizers that we provide visibility to via our marketplace and media network.  However, given that Fever and our Secret Media Network provide us with millions of data points and insights around how people consume offline entertainment, we are now able to go one step further in the value chain and create our own “Fever Originals” experiences, similar to how Netflix has begun to create their own shows. We believe there is a huge opportunity to create more of our own content, and continue to provide an amazing content offering to our users!  ABOUT THE ROLE Here’s what you’ll be doing: Create and maintain direct business relationships with the best venues, bars, restaurants and organizers in the city. Meet your sales goals whilst maintaining a high bar of quality. Expertly manage contract negotiations with potential and existing clients, ensuring sustainable economics and long lasting value for both parties. Evidence strong organizational skills to effectively balance and grow a large base of clients. Collaborate closely with our marketing team to build the Fever brand and promote the partnerships you forge. Keeping up to date with everything cool that’s happening in your city; think of yourself as the expert for new and trending experiences.  ABOUT YOU Here’s what you should bring to the table: 3+ years track record of sales success in a fast-paced, quota carrying role. Strong desire to bring on new businesses as well as grow and manage an existing book of business. Self-starter mentality with an ability to work in a demanding, dynamic start-up environment. Demonstrated data-driven approach to business and task prioritization. Excellent communication skills both written and verbal along with strong attention to detail. Comfort in working with Microsoft Office, Google docs, and a Sales CRM (Sugar CRM is preferred). Knowledge of the city’s entertainment, events, and lifestyle trends. Experience in media/ad sales a plus but not required.  BENEFITS Here’s what you can expect from us: The opportunity to help build and scale Fever in your city, just like a founder. Competitive salary and bonus structure. Numerous training and learning opportunities. 40% off on all of Fever’s plans worldwide (Restaurants, Festivals, you name it). A young, hungry and motivated team to achieve epic things with!

Are you smart, driven, curious, resourceful, and not afraid to fail, then we want to meet you! Our team of bold, innovative, and creative teammates is what makes us the top startup to work for. FreightWaves delivers news and commentary, data, analytics, risk management tools, and actionable market insights to the industry. If you are ready to join our team, it is time for you to apply!  FreightWaves is growing our stellar team of Sales Development Representatives. We are looking for entrepreneurial-minded, high energy sales professionals with a demonstrable passion for growth. FreightWaves offers a fast-paced, team-focused culture in which you will be provided the tools, technology, and resources to take your career to the next level.  As a FreightWaves SDR for our flagship SaaS platform, you are truly the ‘tip of the spear’ for driving organizational growth through identifying & nurturing strong prospects for long-term partnerships. In this role, you will be reporting directly to sales leadership hunting for new business opportunities as directed. This position is fully remote***  What you will be doing:  Clearly communicate FreightWaves’ value proposition to prospects and understanding their needs to identify if/where there is a strong mutual partnership fit. Seeking, prospecting, & qualifying new business opportunities through organic outreach Reaching out to new leads captured through external marketing campaigns Coordinate & book product demos for prospective clients & SONAR account executives Provide feedback to marketing team regarding quality of marketing-sourced leads Meet & exceed your stated daily, monthly sales & performance KPI metrics  What you bring to the table: 1-2 years of full-time sales/lead gen experience (SaaS and/or logistics sales is a plus) Proven track record of success in prospecting for new business Experience with CRM software (e.g. Salesforce) preferred Experience in being held to general sales & performance metrics preferred Bachelor’s Degree in marketing, business administration or relevant field and/or equivalent professional experience preferred Ability to work in a fast-paced, cross-functional team environment required Effective time management skills & ability to prioritize multiple tasks required Excellent verbal & written communication skills required  Our benefits: An excellent work environment, flat hierarchies, and short decision paths. Competitive salary Work from home A generous benefits package including 100% employer-paid health, dental, vision and Life insurance, STD, LTD Concierge doctor on-call Stock options 401k with up to 3.5% match Training programs and career development opportunities Student-loan reimbursement Annual life achievement bonus of $2000 for having a baby, buying a house, or getting married (max one per year) No set days off Vacation policy (our team takes time off as needed with supervisor approval) Gym Membership (or virtual membership while COVID is still a part of our daily lives) Audible or Kindle Unlimited subscription FreightWaves strives for sustainability. We offset our carbon emissions. Discount on Ford vehicles  Powered by JazzHR  JxrHibICJn

description: Title: Territory Manager  Company: Cutting edge technology-based medical company with exclusive distribution rights to numerous products is building a specialized national team.  Description: Our well-established Company is on the hunt for the best of the best. We specialize in a best-in-class office-based wound care treatment program. We have a strong track record of generating long-term sales due to our industry best products, customer service, and technology-based solutions.  Requirements: Bachelor's Degree in healthcare or related field.  A minimum of 5-years of experience in wound care.  Must have established book of business in wound care clinics (i.e.: private practice, home visits, nursing homes, etc.)  Must complete Company training and follow corporate guidelines.  The right candidate will have a can-do attitude and will exemplify Company integrity and compassion for patients.  Compensation: Base salary $75K, uncapped commissions total at plan compensation is $290K. Top Reps making much more!

Company Description  Accolade at a glance  Accolade provides personalized health and benefits solutions designed to empower every person to live their healthiest life. We help millions of people and their employers navigate the complexities of the healthcare system with empathy, expertise and through exceptional service while supporting them in lowering the cost of care and improving health outcomes. Accolade blends technology-enabled health and benefits solutions, specialized support from Accolade Health Assistants® and Clinicians and access to expert medical opinion services for high-cost treatment decisions. We consistently receive consumer satisfaction ratings over 90 percent and have been recognized by Inc. Magazine as a Top Place to Work 2020 and Business Intelligence for Excellence in Customer Service 2020. Please visit us on LinkedIn, Twitter, Instagram and Facebook and at accolade.com.  Job Description  Our Mid-Market team is expanding!  The Regional Sales Executive, Mid-Market is responsible for meeting or exceeding the annual bookings quota for the assigned territory.  This role must be based within and will cover the following territory:  Minneapolis, Wisconsin, Michigan, Illinois, Iowa, Missouri, Arkansas, Louisiana and Texas.  A day in the life… Consistently identifies opportunities, develops sales strategy and closes new business in the assigned middle market segment Identifies, develops and retains new business relationships Effectively presents Accolade’s offerings to qualified prospects Effectively leverages Accolade executives, the pre-sales team and services staff to support customer presentations Develops and executes strategies to generate cost effective sales leads Develops a pipeline of new sales opportunities in alignment with objectives that are established annually Develops and maintains an effective sales and market penetration plan for assigned territory Leverages the sales milestone process to ensure accuracy with monthly, quarterly and annual forecasts Documents all sales contacts, activities and sales process steps in Accolade’s sales tools and systems Solicits product and market feedback from customers, prospects and partners. Communicates this feedback to sales leadership, marketing and the product development team (feature requests, market trends, competition intelligence, new opportunities) Complies with all corporate policies and completes all administrative tasks on time Qualifications  What we are looking for… Minimum 8-10 years of strategic selling experience BA in a business or technical related area of study Experience selling complex, multi-stakeholder solutions. SaaS, health & welfare benefits, healthcare capital equipment, healthcare IT, health and welfare benefits outsourcing, human resources IT benefits software Embraces and thrives in a culture of transparency, accountability and trust Self-starter with ability to work independently, prioritize work and coordinate multiple tasks within tight time constraints Ability to navigate the strategic levels of customer organizations, identify key decision-makers, build relationships with senior executives and schedule meetings with key stakeholders Ability to establish strong team relationships in a matrix organization Ability to perform in a dynamic and fast-paced environment Possess account knowledge, executive-level customer contacts and industry relationships inside the employer market space Command of social media for the benefit of lead generation, gaining access to executives and networking with key stakeholders Strong aptitude with business software tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook etc) Strong business acumen Demonstrated ability to successfully negotiate complex contract Demonstrated ability to accurately forecast monthly, quarterly, and annual revenue Where permitted by applicable law, candidates must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by date of hire to be considered, if not currently employed by Accolade, Inc. The Company will provide reasonable accommodations to qualified employees with disabilities or for a sincerely held religious belief.  Please note that a request for exemption due to a personal preference not to receive a vaccine is not protected by law. All requests for exemptions from this mandate shall be directed to the Company recruiter who shall route the request to the Company’s human resources department.  Additional Information  What Is Important To Us  Creating an enduring company that is hyper-focused on our culture and making a meaningful impact in the lives of our employees, members and customers. The secret to our success is:  We Find Joy And Purpose In Serving Others  Making a difference in our members’ and customers’ lives is what we do. Even when it’s hard, we do the right thing for the right reasons.  We are strong individually and together, we’re powerful  Trusting in our colleagues and embracing their different backgrounds and experiences enable us to solve tough problems in creative ways, having fun along the way.  We roll up our sleeves and get stuff done  Results motivate us. And we aren't afraid of the hard work or tough decisions needed to get us there.  We’re boldly and relentlessly reinventing healthcare We're curious and act big -- not afraid to knock down barriers or take calculated risks to change the world, one person at a time.  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

description: Job Description: We are looking to hire a Global Sales Manager, Vision Systems. In this newly defined role, you will grow SWIR Vision’s top-line revenue and market share. You will focus on developing, winning and closing major global OEM account sales in our target vertical markets. You will also drive sales through development and management of key channel partners including system integrators, OEMs, and distributors. Working closely with our commercial accounts and applications development team, you will capture wins, manage customer pre and post-sales activities, and contribute to the company’s collective intelligence by regular and detailed reporting on market trends, channel partners activities and results, competitive positioning, customer current and future demand, and new business opportunities. This position is Remote and can be located anywhere in the USA.  Please send your updated resume to: careers@swirvisionsystems.com  Responsibilities:  Manage accounts of major customers as defined by the company’s strategy. Identify new major high revenue contributors within key target verticals and win new business.  Establish a sales plan driving penetration, design-in process, market share capture and revenue growth at the major customers. Execute on the plan, report on progress and results. Ensure completion of demand creation and opportunity closure actions. Expand SWIR Vision’s position within major customers base to increase design activity and grow revenue. Assessment, management and extension of the channel partner network on appropriate products with the objective to increase market presence and revenue through the channel business partners. Identification of enabling channel partners at top customers. On-site visits at distributor site and distributor customers. Promoting and training of SWIR Vision products during sales events of distributors. Drive design-in and revenue growth activities with channel partners through regular business and opportunities reviews. Report distribution activities to executive management team. Support of direct accounts and distributors during pre- & after-sales phase. Use of the ERP database to create and track opportunities, create quotes, sales forecasts. Maintenance of the CRM marketing database.  Desired competencies: Bachelor’s degree (or higher) in Engineering, Math or Science, and (5+) yrs. of industry sales experience or Associates degree with (10+) yrs. of industry sales experience. Commercial experience with cameras, infrared systems, machine vision systems. (Highly Preferred)   Experience in Strategic Sales, Business Development in major multi-national or key accounts sales management. Excellent oral and written communication skills, including ability to translate customers’ feedback and requirements into a system or component description. You are a self-starter with strong interpersonal skills, desire to work in a team environment. You can work on and prioritize multiple assignments with competing resources. Experience with setting up, testing, configuring industrial cameras, especially infrared cameras (Definite Plus). Track record of defining a high-tech product sales strategy and revenue growth. Ability to travel (nationally/globally) 25% - 30% (Once Safe/Post COVID) to visit customers and attend trade shows. Fluent English a must. Due to facility export control rules, only US Citizens or permanent residents will be considered.  Please send your updated resume to: careers@swirvisionsystems.com  About SWIR Vision Systems:  SWIR Vision Systems Inc. is a North Carolina based technology startup company. Born in 2018, the company have already established themselves in the infrared vision imaging market.  The company have pioneered the development and commercialization of CQD® Quantum Dot-based image sensors, enabling a new class of short wavelength infrared (SWIR) cameras featuring world-first, and award winning Acuros® Full-HD SWIR cameras.  We have introduced and sell these high value cameras into the global industrial machine vision, security, surveillance, and other markets, enabling our customers to see, and discover more.    SWIR Vision Systems Inc. does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, color, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information, gender identity or any other reason prohibited by law in provision of employment opportunities and benefits. Any resumes submitted by an outside vendor to any employee at SWIR Vision Systems Inc. via mail, e-mail, Internet, or directly to hiring managers without a valid written search agreement in place with the Talent Acquisition/HR Department will be deemed the sole property of SWIR Vision Systems. No placement fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired as a result of the referral, or through other means.

Position Summary  Making the future is everyday life at Samsung. We’re seeking innovators who are called to not just change the world, but build a better one. We enable the best technology hardware on the planet, but our best is always a prototype for something better and our people thrive with a driven mindset – better builds on better. We believe that innovation and growth are driven by an inclusive culture and a diverse workforce. We aim to create a global team where everyone belongs and has equal opportunities, inspiring our talent to be their true selves. Together, we are building a better tomorrow for our customers, partners and communities.  Role and Responsibilities    The Field Sales Manager: is responsible for driving sales and maximizing retail success. With minimal management oversight, this role will build brand awareness and advocacy with both retail sales personnel and consumers. Through training and consumer facing activities, the Field Sales Manager will be accountable for driving product awareness, sales, and improving the consumer journey within the assigned territory.     Responsible for driving sell-out of Samsung products across multiple channels within an assigned territory. Implements and executes sales strategies designed to maximizes Samsung market share in order to meet or exceed revenue objectives for the brand. Develop and deliver customer specific sales tactics, training and brand advocacy programs by creating and maintaining partnerships with retail sales personnel and store leadership. Through one-to-one and group training, utilizes full discretion to create programs intended to ensure all sales personnel are highly knowledgeable on the unique selling points of Samsung devices and are actively recommending Samsung devices to consumers.  Field Sales Managers are responsible for meeting or exceeding sales revenue and unit goals, as well as rep knowledge, rep recommendation rates and training engagements as measured by in-store mystery shops and the Market Communication System.Background/Experience•    2-5 years in territory sales with strong preference for experience working with National Retailers and/or National Carrier Operators preferred: Bachelor’s degree preferred •    Experience using sales data and insights to recommend and drive localized and customized sales programs in differing channels•    Strong background in operational excellence and merchandising execution•    Self-starter and willingness to take initiative and drive localized revenue growth programs in targeted channels while adhering to Samsung Brand expectations•    Strong experience managing competing priorities and collaborating with internal and external stakeholders.    Necessary Skills/Attributes•    Build and develop strong partnerships with respective channels in aligned territory•    Utilize sales reporting and other analytics to identify and prioritize high-opportunity store locations based on Samsung performance •    Ability to drive sell-out of Samsung products through in store activities, which includes but not limited to a variety of innovative customer-centric tactics including in-store training events, contests, small-scale incentive programs developed at your discretion per individual store, and consumer engagement events to improve sales performance within territory.•    Act as Samsung brand advocate and spokesperson for both local and national consumer events  •    Ensure Samsung’s retail brand standards are maintained by regularly inspecting all Samsung branded displays and marketing materials•    Validate, analyze and interpret a broad range of retail-related data including industry trends, competitor pricing, competitor incentives, promotional activities, and customer and RSA brand preference/sentiment.  •    Strong collaboration with peers and sales leadership to provide key on the ground insights and feedback to support the development of district and regional strategies.•    Excellent verbal and written communication to work with both channel leadership and Samsung Retail leadership    Skills and Qualifications    * Please visit Samsung membership to see Privacy Policy, which defaults according to your location. You can change Country/Language at the bottom of the page. If you are European Economic Resident, please click here .    * Samsung Electronics America, Inc. and its subsidiaries are committed to employing a diverse workforce, and  provide Equal Employment Opportunity for all individuals regardless of race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a protected veteran, genetic information, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.    Samsung Electronics America is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in our job application process. If you have a disability and require a reasonable accommodation in order to participate in the application process, please contact our Reasonable Accommodation Team (855-557-3247) or SEA_Accommodations_Ext@sea.samsung.com for assistance. This number is for accommodation requests only and is not intended for general employment inquiries.

description: Our client sells residential and light commercial Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning (HVAC) products, parts and supplies through dealers (independent companies that sell, deliver and service products to residences and businesses in their respective markets. They have an exciting opportunity for a Sales professional based in the DFW area within the South Central Region.  Job Responsibilities: As a Territory Sales Manager, selected candidate will be the residential sales expert for our customers. Responsible for the sales of the residential line of products. Your ability to build relationships and good strategies with these business partners and the ability to analyze the territory; develop, execute and monitor sales program is key to your success. Selected candidate will work closely with customers to develop sales strategies and marketing plans to grow the success of residential product in your territory. Demonstrated performance history in Sales & New Market development a must. Experience selling to a dealer network and distribution center. Wholesale and retail sales channels. Some overnight travel is required.  Job Requirements: Ability to manage multiple priorities Build strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders Exceptional communication skills Proficiency with Microsoft Office applications 2+ years of experience in Sales preferred Partner with customers to provide proactive solutions and address concerns Problem-solving aptitude Ability to work in a face paced organization Self-starter with organizational and proven leadership ability Ability to present products, services and solutions to prospective customers Ability to work well independently and in a team environment Strong conflict resolution skills Ability to read, write and converse in Spanish strongly preferred  Education AA/AS degree; Bachelor's degree preferred.

Why Birdeye?  15 years ago brands controlled customer experiences. But in 2021, it’s customer experiences that control brands. Customers now choose businesses based on shared experiences, not ads. So marketers now have to create and promote great experiences, and they need a platform that can do this at scale.  Birdeye is an all-in-one Experience Marketing platform for multi-location businesses. More than 60,000 businesses of all sizes use Birdeye every day to be found online and chosen through listings, reviews and referrals; be connected with leads and customers on the channels of their choice, and deliver the best customer experience with survey, ticketing and insights tools.  Founded in 2012, Birdeye is headquartered in Palo Alto, and led by alumni from Google, Amazon, Salesforce and Yahoo. Birdeye is backed by Salesforce founder Marc Benioff, Yahoo co-founder Jerry Yang, Trinity Ventures and World Innovation Lab. The company has been the highest-rated Experience Marketing platform over the last 5 years on G2.  To learn more, please visit: https://birdeye.com  What You'll Do:  Birdeye, the all-in-one Experience Marketing platform for multi-location businesses, is looking for rockstar Commercial Account Executives. This is an exciting opportunity for an entrepreneurial-minded sales executive looking to get in on the ground floor of one of Silicon Valley's hottest startups. If you possess the right energy, competitive spirit, personal drive and track record of success in Sales, this is an opportunity that you cannot afford to miss.  The market opportunity for Experience Marketing software is roughly $50B+ in the US and 2-3x that number globally. To put this opportunity in perspective - there is not a single business in the US (or globally) that could not use our software, something difficult to say about other types of point solutions. Birdeye needs winners that will help our company grow, exceed goals and expectations, and have a whole lot of fun along the way!  Responsibilities Drive sales growth by finding and closing business in our Commercial Segment defined as business with more than 50 locations nationally Close complex deals involving multiple CxO decision makers and stakeholders Working with your team to build custom presentations / demonstrations of our product for prospective clients Running effective Proof of Concept campaigns to prove Birdeye value Reporting on sales activity and metrics in our CRM Managing the full sales cycle in a team selling environment Work closely with Product and Customer care teams Manage pipeline, sales activity and have the ability to accurately forecast Work hard, play hard. We need to have fun as we succeed!  Requirements 3+ years of quota carrying software or technology sales as an individual contributor Bachelor's Degree Required Experience selling to digital marketers and marketing executives Outbound prospecting experience is a must! Have demonstrated a steep trajectory of success in previous sales roles Previous success prospecting, engaging and acquiring new business with mid-market sized companies Social Selling experience preferred Skilled in conducting presentations, online demonstrations and face to face meetings Extroverted, optimistic problem solver with a vibrant and energetic attitude You initiate action and are assertive Ability to use Google to research leads and prospects to build pipeline You are resourceful and consistent Excellent verbal and written communication Report track and manage sales activity in the CRM  Why You'll Join Us:  At Birdeye, we know that our success is tied to our customers’ success, so we are continually raising the bar for ourselves and others around us to deliver meaningful results.  We seek to innovate and to be the #1 product in our category, which means we need to drive results for our customers and to always deliver what we commit.  Our quality needs to be world-class and second to none, so we are exceptionally hands-on to get work done. We roll up our sleeves and DO.  Working at Birdeye means being part of a tight-knit family that helps you succeed and loves to celebrate with you! We find strength in diversity and inclusion, so we strive to find different points of view and expect everyone to represent their authentic self at all times.  Benefits Employer-paid benefits with multiple health plan options (HSA, PPO) Unlimited PTO 401(k) with company match Flexible work from home options available Maternity & Paternity Leave Employee Resource Groups - network with like-minded "Birds" Abundant opportunities that come with a dynamic and fast-growing organization!

description: Foghorn is a San Francisco based cloud consultant enjoying enormous growth. We're in an explosive space: delivering DevOps and cloud consulting services to enterprise customers running apps on AWS, GCP and Azure. We’re expecting the growth to continue. As a result, we're growing our team and seeking an experienced Enterprise Account Executive. This role features base salary plus unlimited commission potential. You'll be a key contributor in helping grow our business to the cloudosphere!  In this role you’re already well versed in Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) having helped companies embark on their transformation to the cloud. You'll prospect, present, qualify and sign new enterprise accounts to become Foghorn customers.  Responsibilities: Prospecting, lead generation, qualifying and closing new accounts Meet and exceed annual consulting sales quotas of $3mm Build portfolio of new Foghorn accounts Manage and accurately forecast deal flow Attain cloud sales certifications  Requirements: 7+ years experience selling to enterprise technology solutions to Fortune class companies BA/BS degree or equivalent experience Technical understanding of IaaS, cloud tools and services Past experience exceeding consulting revenue quotas greater than $3mm Excellent written and verbal communications skills Excellent presentation skills Experience selling solutions to CxO level customers and stakeholders  Nice to have: 3+ years selling AWS, GCP, Azure or similar IaaS/PaaS cloud platforms  Physical Demands and Work Environment: Frequently required to sit, stand, walk, talk and hear Continually required to utilize hand and finger dexterity Frequently required to travel to client locations in territory when travel is safe Occasionally required to travel to client locations outside the territory when travel is safe  If you love tech, working with customers, and building new relationships please submit your application today!  Powered by JazzHR  ZVVD9VvysH

description: HIGH VISIBILITY ROLE*****GROWTH PATH* ***Remote in Northwest***  HIGH VISIBILITY Regional Sales Manager ROLE with a family owned innovative and growing manufacturer in the specialty building materials industry!  The TRG Growth Practice engaged with a client to identify a Regional Sales Manager - to drive company growth and market share in the Northwest.  The ideal candidate should have a proven background in distribution channel sales and development specific to Contractors and Installers. Be in control of your career growth in this entrepreneurial role and have the acknowledgement from senior leadership as a result of successfully developing and executing strategy to drive market share, product mix and profitability in a marketplace critical to company growth targets. VOC experience incredibly valuable.  Desired Qualifications: · Bachelor's Degree · Distribution channel experience · Working knowledge of manufacturing and delivery processes · Commercial building product sales a plus  If you are interested in this or future opportunities in your area, please send a Word-Formatted resume to ryanb@richgroupusa.com and we will contact you when opportunities arise that match your geography and experience. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to the individual's race, color, sex, national origin, religion, age, disability, genetic information, status as a military veteran or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

We are looking for a Business Development Professional to join our team here at Snapsheet!  With your expertise, you will play the dual role of a new business generator, identifying and qualifying opportunities in the market, and a business development rep, ensuring Snapsheet’s strongest response in new business opportunities. You are highly collaborative and will partner closely with Marketing, Sales, and the broader team providing sales support. As a Business Development Rep at Snapsheet, you will drive activity across Snapsheet’s software products.  You have a track record of successfully generating new sales opportunities through self-led outbound initiatives and possess grit and creativity to find entry points within target segments. You have a knack for assessing a client’s situation and buying position and will use that expertise to focus Snapsheet’s sales professionals on qualified prospects. Your business development expertise will allow you to serve as Snapsheet’s primary point of contact for critical business development initiatives. You know how to resonate with client needs, bring a clear articulation of a value proposition and differentiators, and understand how to frame opportunity and impact.  Performing a critical role in Snapsheet’s go-to-market organization and in an environment with aggressive growth targets, you will be expected to report daily on your progress, with an openness to pivoting your strategy along the way to ensure success. You are a critical thinker and a builder who prefers an environment where you can create your path to success instead of following an already established process. You are driven and confident with a strong sales and business development background to contribute as part of a fast-moving start-up.  What you will do as a Business Development Representative at Snapsheet: Identify and qualify potential new clients for Snapsheet’s Software offerings, and provide strategic support to ensure proactive business development for all lines of business. Develop, implement and execute on strategy for targeting, engaging, and qualifying software leads. Analyze the market and build strategies for continually ensuring a robust target list and qualified lead pool. Execute targeting strategies, conducting outreach to both known and unknown targets with a defined plan for engagement, discovery, and credential building; This will be a critical component of your role in helping to build our sales pipeline Work with Sales Operations to determine strategic direction and strong qualifiers for best-fit opportunities and to drive higher opportunity conversion rates  Collaborate with Marketing to design personal outreach in alignment with marketing-led campaigns and inbound lead generation Partner with Sales to hand-off qualified leads and extend support when needed throughout the sales process to ensure competitive responses and opportunity advancement Partner with relationship owners for clients and prospects, to help ignite new business opportunities Serve as a business development resource for critical new business pursuits, taking lead on RFIs, RFPs, and high-priority proposals Establish best practices for lead identification, qualification, and business development response, all while communicating progress, results and facilitating knowledge sharing  Build a strong communication plan to keep our team informed on progress consistently Meet or exceed monthly goals, targets, and KPI’s  What you bring as a Business Development Representative at Snapsheet: BA/BS Business development experience, with preferred expertise in insurance or B2B software sales  Skilled at building approaches for targeting, with the ability to follow market events and activity in a structured way for refreshing and extending target lists Strong interpersonal skills and comfort connecting with unknown targets within the industry, with an ability to relate and conduct high-level discovery to better profile targets, identify buyer needs and assess high-level fit Excellent written communication skills, with experience preparing RFIs, RFPs, and proposals Strong Presentation skills Experience using Salesforce to manage and report activity and opportunity  Experience working in a start-up environment, newly formed business unit/venture, or the launch of a new product, demonstrating your comfort level in a newly defined space that’s rapidly evolving  Chicago preferred, but will consider remote applicants for this position.  Snapsheet is an equal opportunity employer. #BI-Remote

Moog Inc. is a worldwide designer, manufacturer and integrator of precision motion control products and systems. Moog’s high-performance systems control military and commercial aircraft, satellites and space vehicles, launch vehicles, missiles, industrial machinery, wind energy, marine applications, and medical equipment.  World-class solutions. Design flexibility. Global depth and support. All delivered by experts who understand our customers’ vision and are committed to helping them achieve it.  Moog’s Space and Defense Group is looking for a Regional Sales Manager to further the sales and business development initiatives within the group’s Power and Data Sector throughout the Military/Aerospace markets in Mountain & South Central US regions. The individual selected will manage the complex technical sale of a portfolio of motion control, power and data solutions through direct account management and facilitative engagement with a network of territory channel partners. If you are leader and share the same passion that Moog does then this may be the right opportunity for you!  As a Regional Sales Manager, you will… Create and maintain an environment that promotes teamwork, responsiveness, efficiency and positive engagement between our customers, sales channels and operations. Support the development and execution of strategic initiatives to increase sales and promote customer intimacy within the assigned territory. Become proficient in the complex technical sale of our product portfolio of motion control, power and data solutions within targeted markets. Identify market and industry trends or gaps that may adjust the business strategy developmental road maps. Collaborate across the Moog organization in support of common customers, markets and pursuits. Work with sales executives to create staff budgets as well as support the operations in the establishment and achievement of key performance sales metrics. Manage the channel partners within your region through the mutual establishment of annual goals and objectives while collaborating with the operations to provide the developmental support needed to successfully reach these targets. Minimum Qualifications To Be Considered… Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering and a minimum of 10 years relevant sales and/or engineering experience in the sale or product development of complex technical OEM equipment with a motion technology, fiber optic or electronic corporation. Strong communicator with facilitative leadership skills who is willing to travel to build effective internal and external relationships required to achieve sales growth. Exposure and awareness of the DoD budget and acquisition process via selling into the Military/Aerospace markets is strongly preferred. This job requires access to US export-controlled information. What’s in it for you? Flexible Planned Vacation - no minimum or maximum number of days off Outstanding Health Benefits Generous 401K company contribution and match At Moog we work in an environment where people trust, respect and encourage one another. We believe in our people, and it shows in everything we do. We invite you to become part of our continued success.  EEOE/AA Minority/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Female/Disability/Veteran
industries: Aviation & Aerospace, Defense & Space, and Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing

jobTitle: Regional Sales Manager, North East Territories, Swiss Dermatology Company
description: An established, stable, rapidly growing medical device company seeks District Sales Managers to lead the expansion and build out of our prescription portfolio in territories across the US. This person will grow and direct a Regional sales team that promotes prescription wound care products in women's health, oncology supportive care, wound care, and to surgical specialists. Due to the success of the products, the company is expanding its sales teams and needs experienced pharmaceutical sales management professionals to play a central role in taking the organization to the next level. These individuals will report to the head of National Sales Manager.  The company has a tremendous amount of clinical credibility and an extensive line of popular, science-based products that are directly prescribed or dispensed by doctors to their patients.  This firm is uniquely positioned for rapid growth and needs leaders that will be an ambassador internally and externally and represent the ethos and core values of the brand.  North East Territories include but are not limited to - Maine Boston Connecticut Long Island NYC UES NYC DT Detroit Cleveland Pittsburgh Columbus Cincinnati Buffalo New Jersey  Position Description (Brief Overview) Execute the regional Sales Strategy, drive corporate objectives and revenue growth Provide strong leadership for the regional sales function, set clear and unified direction for the team Expand the sales team: manage, stretch, and develop into top performing team Achieve revenue, profit, organizational, and strategic goals and objectives Enhance sales pipeline system: reporting, forecasting, performance: from lead generation to close Build relationships with Key Opinion Leaders, and Hospital Systems to deliver excellent service Establish and maintain top level contact with organization’s important internal stakeholders Oversee both Inside and Field-Based sales teams Develop annual sales business plans to drive revenue and increase market penetration Accurately forecast monthly, quarterly, and annual sales achievements Travel as necessary to visit sales team, major accounts, attend trade shows and key events Note: This is a heavy travel role; this person will be a “Field General”  Requirements  Qualifications/Requirements (Brief Overview) 10+ years sales management experience; extensive background working with prescription devices or drugs Successful experience building high performing teams of sales professional Existing relationships in women's health, oncology supportive care, medical aesthetics, and wound care, is desired Acute understanding of the competitor landscape Excellent commercial instincts, strong financial acumen and analytical skills, attention to detail Computer skills: CRM, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook Bachelor’s degree, (or industry experience in lieu of degree), Master’s degree a plus  Benefits  Key Points Industry/Product Category: women's health, oncology, wound care, dermatology, surgical Title: Regional Sales Manager Call Points: OBGyn's, Radiation Oncologists, Infusion Specialists, Surgeons*, Wound Care Specialists Scope: Regional responsibility may include inside Sales and Field-Based Sales Location: New York Compensation: Competitive with high commission aligned to performance, MBO's, and KPI's Fulltime, W2 position, benefits  The company have a range of highly marketable products and the resources to execute a successful expansion. This opportunity will see the successful candidate gain a role where they shall be part of an exciting growth story.

description: Looking to work at a fast-growing startup in the Portland Area?  Cloud Campaign is a social media marketing platform designed specifically for digital agencies. The platform is double-faceted in that it increases an agency's productivity for internal operations while strengthening the client-agency relationship.  We are looking for a high-performing Sales Leader to help us meet our customer acquisition and revenue growth targets by keeping our company competitive and innovative. You will be responsible for maximizing our sales team potential, crafting sales plans, and working collaboratively with upper management on implementing those plans.  Responsibilities Achieve growth and hit sales targets by successfully managing the sales team Be hands on with customer sales calls and negotiations Design and implement a strategic business plan that expands Cloud Campaign's customer base. Own recruiting, objectives setting, coaching, and performance monitoring of sales representatives Build and promote strong, long-lasting customer relationships by partnering with them and understanding their needs Identify emerging markets and market shifts while being fully aware of new products and competition status Design and implement an outbound sales process  Requirements Successful previous experience as a sales manager, consistently meeting or exceeding targets Outbound sales management experience Demonstrated ability to communicate, present and influence credibly and effectively at all levels of the organization Proven ability to drive the sales process from plan to close Strong business sense and industry expertise Excellent mentoring, coaching and people management skills 5+ years in relevant sales experience Leadership experience growing a team Relevant experience in SaaS/Software, Account Management/Sales/Customer Success Proficient with CRM tools Highly organized with strong attention to detail Excellent communication skills with the ability to distill complex thoughts and strategies into simple, actionable recommendations Comfortabie on video calls and interacting with clients Positive attitude and able to be consistent with the team Solid understanding of the marketing industry tech stack and competitive tool functionality  Our values include:  Balance over Burnout, Humble, Transparent, Dedicated, Community, Transparent, Integrity  This job is based in Portland, OR. Travel is not required. Position starts with a 90-day trial period  Benefits Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision) Retirement Plan (401k, IRA) Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays) Family Leave (Maternity, Paternity) Training & Development Free Food & Snacks Wellness Resources Stock Option Plan

description: We are assisting our client, Altrum, in identifying a new Manager, Sales and Account Management  About Our Client:  Altrum’s mission is to help organizations around the world celebrate achievements and inspire their people. Altrum is a key player in the deal toy and financial tombstone market as well as the recognition sector. Altrum’s success is intrinsically linked to the expertise and commitment of staff who share the same culture and values. Client focus, better every day, teamwork and support & determination are the values that are at the core of the company’s culture. Do you want to make a real difference as a people manager? If so, this is your opportunity.  With your expert relationship-building and leadership abilities, you’ll help groom this talented team to develop their skills, grow the business throughout the Americas and dominate the deal gift space.  Are you seeking an opportunity to thrive in a work environment that is flexible, fast-paced, fun and where no two days are the same? At Altrum you will:  ●       Be part of a diverse and successful team where exceptional customer service is a passion ●       Join a global leader where the mission is to celebrate people’s greatest achievements and inspire their people ●       Be part of a supportive, award-winning management team where your opinion counts ●       Be part of a leadership team that focuses on the strengths and development of their colleagues  ABOUT THE ROLE: ●       Engage in strategic planning and development of key accounts; develop a network of higher up relationships to grow sales ●       Focus on growing team metrics (i.e., new projects, closing ratio, gross profit, client satisfaction, employee engagement) ●       Leverage CRM, sales automation, and project management tools to grow projects and sales, drive analytics and gain team member adoption ●       Develop and maintain effective relationships with clients, vendors, and team members ●       Serve as point of escalation in addressing and resolving client, tactical and strategic issues; identify problems and collaborate to propose solutions ●       Collaborate with managers and team leaders in New York, London & Canada, with a focus on continuous improvement and the client experience ●       Promote continuous improvement with team members through various Lean tools ●       Liaise with key support functions, including art update, production support, and staff scheduling ●       Coordinate team member coverage ●       Conduct performance reviews; report and address behavioral-related matters ●       Coach team members to improve performance and ensure a culture that upholds Altrum’s values ●       Coordinate team member training and serve as a mentor, ensuring continued growth and development  KEY ATTRIBUTES/CHARACTERISTICS: ●       Drive, determination, and enthusiasm are part of your DNA ●       You foster a winning mentality and motivate colleagues to strive for a common goal ●       Being a team player is core to your being; you have a passion for supporting and developing your colleagues ●       You have a solid understanding of how to gauge and increase team engagement ●       You strive to serve every customer well ●       You innovate and manage change effectively; experience with Lean is a plus ●       Challenges excite you; you pride yourself on being resilient and helping others find a way forward ●       You hold a bachelor’s degree and have 6+ years of business experience (Operational, Account & Sales Management) that includes 3-4 years managing a team. Financial industry experience a plus but not essential ●       Experience with a CRM is a plus

jobTitle: Channel Sales Specialist, Life Care Solutions (LCS)
description: Job Description Summary  The LCS Channel Sales Specialist will lead, mentor and coach authorized partners to drive financial results, ensure compliance and be accountable for keeping the risk profile within the tolerant level, norms and standards while driving leads and projects to support GE Distributor business within their assigned territory.GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Job Description  Essential Responsibilities:    Own and deliver financial performance to OP targets for the USA Distributor Channel Partner portfolio and segment businesses. Identify target end user accounts and create account plans in conjunction with Channel Partner. Create and continuously develop Channel Partner specific business plans and set stretch goals and objectives. Drive incoming leads to opportunity and work collaboratively with USA Distributor product sales specialist. Continuously develop relationships and drive mindshare with the GE Distributor sales reps and authorized channel partners and its field sales team. Provide representatives with GE product knowledge and approved sales collateral to advance the sales process with the potential end user. Develop metrics to measure progress to make tools more effective for channel partners and to make the employees more efficient. Ensure data analytics drive decision making for budgeting and financial planning and analysis. Identify opportunities to improve visibility, win rate and share performance across P&L , Markets and Regions. Lead Sales Operations processes & mechanisms and coordinate their implementation with channel partners. Manage channel partner relationships on day-to-day basis and provide transactional support while managing personal funnel and activity documented in SFDC. Act as business development coach to grow the Channel Partner capability. Simplify the point of contact between GEHC and Channel Partner and proactively align internal GE resources to support Channel Partner. Schedule joint sales calls with Channel Partner & relevant GE commercial teams as opportunities to coach and maintain relationships with the customer decision makers and support the coordination of remote or in person product demonstrations with potential end user customer, channel partner sales representative and internal GE Distributor resources. Drive channel partner field activity supporting channel partners with field travel, attending meetings, and training and education. Support Installed Base Projects, initiatives as developed by segment sales and marketing leadership within assigned territory. Drive Leads to Opportunity in SFDC with coordination with segment PSSs in assigned territory, including Trade Show Lead Follow Up, 800# & Web and eCommerce Leads. Transactional support of Channel partners purchase orders and field level PSSs as needed to accomplish business financial objectives. Territory support for segment leadership in case open territories within defined territory. Support a culture of highest integrity and compliance within the authorized Channel Partner community and with the segment product sales specialists.  Required Qualifications    Bachelor's degree completion. 2+ years of small capital equipment or pharmaceutical sales experience, or 1+ years of clinical or clinical applications experience focused on Imaging equipment, or 2+ years GEHC experience in customer facing role(s) (such as Imaging Service or GEHC Inside Sales roles).  Strong business finance and GEHC USA commercial operational knowledge. Successful experience in multi-stakeholder environment. High ethics and integrity. Understanding of contracts, legal, commercial & negotiation skills. Proven coordination and influencing skills to set and drive an agenda with third parties, field sales representatives and peers within your business Customer focused mindset with proven ability to respond quickly to internal and external customer needs. Strong business coaching experience. Ability to build rapport, energize and influence people Interpersonal flexibility and tolerance.  Desired Characteristics:    Loves to build relationships and is able to empathize with and connect together our authorized partners, field sales, functional support team members and ultimately clinicians using ultrasound to positively impact the lives of their patients. Experience in Healthcare related sales or marketing with a strong record of account management success. Strong expertise in local Healthcare Legislation and regulations. Proven success in managing sales channels of multiple products in Healthcare equipment sales. Demonstrated success or ability to support sales remotely. Experience with Salesforce.com and Apptus Direct and/or indirect leadership experience. Ability to analyze business models, implement executable strategy and plans USA Imaging experience and product familiarity.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.
