description: Company Profile: Pelican Brewing Company is among the Northwest's most award winning and fastest growing craft beer brands.  Born at the beach in Pacific City in 1996, Pelican Brewing Company has been crafting beers with passion, purpose & integrity for over 20 years. Our sales team works individually and collaboratively to sell craft beer in an assigned territory and represent Pelican Brewing Company at numerous events.  Job Profile: The Pelican Brewery Sales Team is seeking a detail-oriented and self-motivated individual to join our beer sales team to pursue an engaging & purposeful career opportunity. This position will represent our brand with great pride, serving as an ambassador for the Pelican brand, building and maintaining strong relationships with our distributors and wholesalers.   As the Brewery Sales Rep for Portland, Oregon you will show off your passion and knowledge about craft beer and have fun planning and participating in various promotional events   Qualifications: ·       3+ years sales experience in craft beer or similar industry ·       Excellent communication and presentation skills - Ability to talk to others to convey information effectively; ·       Strong problem solving skills - Independent, reliable, and self-motivated with a solid work ethic. ·       Active listening – Ability to understand your retailer by listening to their needs and filling those needs ·       Inner drive - You like pursuing new accounts while maintaining strong customer service with current accounts. ·       Experience meeting and exceeding sales goals.  ·       Highly social. You enjoy working with and meeting new people. ·       Must be available to work nights and weekend and lift and/or move up to 50 pounds ·       MUST CURRENTLY RESIDE IN OR BE WILLING TO RELOCATE TO DESIGNATED TERRRITORY  Job Responsibilities & Duties: Deliver exceptional customer service with both distributors and accounts Show off your passion and knowledge about craft beer and have fun planning and participating in various promotional events such as tap takeovers and brewfests. Attend networking events, socialize with clients, frequently visit clients at their business to check in, etc. ·       Enjoy building strong relationships and taking care of each individual customer. Partner with wholesalers and distributors. ·       Meet or exceed monthly sales goals and tap into your earning potential. ·       Analyze current accounts and potential new accounts in your market. Create and implement your sales strategy. ·       Maintain a sales budget, track inventory and orders of wholesale partners ·       Understand and embrace the Pelican Brewery company philosophy and core values  What Pelican Brewery Sales Has To Offer: We care deeply about the wellbeing of our team members. Our full-time team members are eligible to receive our robust benefits package, including, but not limited to, medical (company pays 90% of premiums for employees and 25% for dependents), dental, vision, 401(k) with a match up to 4%, paid time off, and employee discounts.  Humility | Agility | Tenacity | Empathy | Entrepreneurial Spirit | Generosity | Optimism
industries: Food & Beverages, Events Services, and Marketing and Advertising

description: The Muse is a values-based job search platform used by over 70 million people annually to connect with companies and find a career that matches their values. Founded in 2011, we were named one of Fast Company’s 50 Most Innovative Companies in the World. We have a highly diverse userbase of Millennial & Gen Z jobseekers who we help connect with companies as wide-ranging as Apple, Nike and the FBI, on the strength of those companies’ values, cultures, and employee experiences. Our users come to TheMuse.com for original career advice from prominent experts, access to the best coaches, and a behind-the-scenes look at job opportunities. Smart companies work with us to attract today’s top talent, giving candidates the information they need to find the company that is right for them. Why? Because life’s too short to hate your career.  As an Account Manager, you’ll have the opportunity to help companies like Headspace and Audible amplify and improve their employer brand, putting them in a position to be more competitive in today’s war for talent. This position reports to the VP of Account Management and is based in New York City.  How you'll make an impact You’ll be a trusted partner for companies looking to attract and retain the best talent by cultivating, maintaining, and growing meaningful relationships with up to 65 Muse clients You’ll develop a deep expertise of The Muse, our employer branding solutions, and the talent industry You’ll help companies reveal their authentic brand story, recommending and delivering content solutions that bring these stories to life and give job seekers insight into their values and culture You’ll exceed monthly, quarterly, and annual revenue objectives, thinking strategically about how to increase renewals and upsell clients across the Muse platform You’ll ensure client satisfaction and long-term loyalty, manage client expectations, and solicit and act on client feedback You’ll leverage performance data to give clients the tools they need to compete for the best talent out there You’ll identify opportunities to improve our current processes, tools, reporting, and documentation You’ll work closely with our sales, editorial, marketing, and product teams to deliver exceptional customer experiences and be the true voice of the customer  Why we'll love you You have 4-5 years of experience in account management, sales, consulting, or recruiting You take a consultative approach to uncovering clients’ business challenges and act as a trusted partner to advise clients on how to best use our product You have an inexhaustible curiosity and constantly strive to discover new information—you love to learn by doing, researching, and sharing experiences You have a successful track record in exceeding both renewal and upsell revenue goals You have exceptional objection-handling skills and an ability to align client needs with our product offerings You’re known for your exemplary work ethic, grit, positive attitude, and solution oriented approach You're a creative problem solver who likes to test new ideas and work cross-functionally with other teams to brainstorm and independently drive new projects to completion You build meaningful and lasting relationships with clients and colleagues alike You can tell us the stories about how you turned an angry customer into one that loved you again You fight to the death to save a client from not renewing You’re a pro at crafting great emails and dialing the phone doesn’t scare you  Why you'll love us You’ll work at a tech company founded by two badass women—Our founders believe transparency is important so they really try to share as much as they can about changes to The Muse strategy, board meetings, and when they are wrestling with big company-wide decisions The Muse actually has—and sticks to—a “no assholes” policy, so you can come to work everyday knowing you will always be surrounded by good people who genuinely care about you We invest in growing our people—personally and professionally We offer unlimited vacation—and we mean it!  At The Muse, we believe that great ideas come from anywhere. We support a collaborative environment and value open participation from individuals with different ideas, experiences, and perspectives. We believe having a diverse team makes The Muse a more interesting and innovative place to work, and we strive every day to make The Muse a welcoming and inclusive place for all.

About Grow Therapy  At Grow, we believe America’s mental healthcare system is broken. Most mental health providers won’t accept insurance because of the significant administrative burden. Meanwhile, patients struggle to find quality care that is both affordable and convenient. We partner with mental health providers to build and grow their own in-network private practices, thereby improving access to quality care.  We're a team of entrepreneurs, builders, and go-getters who will not settle for the status quo. Our founding team comes from Harvard Medical School, Google, Stripe, and Blackstone, with support from CoFound Partners and SignalFire. We’re excited to expand the team in our hyper-growth stage as we expand accessibility throughout the country.  Sales Manager (Provider Growth)  Description  As the founding Sales Manager at Grow Therapy, you’ll play a huge role in building the Provider Growth team who will expand our provider network, directly impacting thousands of therapists across the United States.  You’ll recruit, train, and lead a distributed team of 10+ Sales Associates, all of whom care deeply about helping our providers achieve their dreams in private practice. You’ll also be responsible for optimizing conversion on existing inbound channels, working with our Growth Marketing team on new channels, and managing provider communications through our CRM.  After just a few months, you’ll be our resident expert in provider recruitment, remote team engagement, and inbound funnel optimization. You’ll see your impact through provider signups, conversion by market, and inbound NPS. Most importantly, you’ll know that you’ve been part of making providers’ lives better….and through that, making mental healthcare more accessible to all.  What You'll Do Recruit and standup the training and sales methodology for the Provider Growth Team Manage and coach a remote team of 10+ Sales Associates Proactively identify and evaluate opportunities for new channels for engaging and onboarding providers. Manage our CRM and provider communications from first touch to signing (and beyond!) Analyze data and present metrics-driven insights from providers to the larger org  Requirements Mission-driven and passionate about making a difference for mental health providers Prior experience managing a high-performing sales team(s) at a startup or fast growing small business. Committed coach who is enthusiastic about training, mentoring, and inspiring a high velocity sales organization Thoughtful and diplomatic communicator and relationship builder. Process driven and committed to operational excellence (attention to detail, tech-savviness).  Bonus (great to have but not required): Venture-backed startup experience in sales management Experience working in healthcare or with mental health providers Experience developing and managing both outbound and inbound channels  Benefits Wellness: Our dedication to mental health guides our culture. This means unlimited PTO, winter break, lunch on us, mental health mornings, team meditation, and more! Health plans: Comprehensive health, mental, vision, and dental insurance. We also provide all employees with a wellness stipend Flexibility: Flexible working (hybrid of in-person & remote), relaxed dress code, office pets highly encouraged Learning: Mental health workshops, learning stipend, and dedicated learning days Ownership: As a small team, you’ll have unbounded leadership opportunities and the chance to transform the mental healthcare landscape from day one Compensation: Competitive salary and equity compensation
industries: Internet, Health, Wellness and Fitness, and Hospital & Health Care

description: Summary Quartzy is seeking an Account Executive to deliver amazing lab productivity and purchasing solutions to small- and medium-sized R&D organizations.   About You You’re the type of person who is motivated by building relationships. It’s easy for you to communicate with others - by both listening and empathizing as well as getting your point across in a clear and concise manner. You’re naturally curious, and don’t stop asking questions until you fully understand the situation. While you are competitive by nature, you like working in a team environment and are motivated by the success of those around you. You should be accustomed to handling your own pipeline and meeting demanding quotas. The role will report to the Director of Sales and will help strategically shape the sales team at Quartzy.   Why Quartzy Quartzy is the world’s #1 lab management platform. Every day, hundreds of thousands of scientists from all over the world improve the efficiency of their research by using Quartzy. Our software combines lab resource management and eCommerce, producing unique value in this large market, returning time to researchers who can focus on their next discoveries. Our customer range from companies working on COVID testing and therapies, to wine makers, to food and ag companies. We are humbled every day to serve them.   What You'll Do Work in a geographic territory to add new users and customers to the Quartzy platform, specifically small and medium-size biotechnology and pharmaceutical companies Effectively build, manage, and report on your pipeline, using tools like SalesForce, Yesware, Looker and others Own the sales process from lead qualification to outreach to close Communicate and educate across customer organizations, including to finance, IT, scientists, and lab manager  What We're Looking For Proven track record of success in B2B/SaaS technology in either a sales and account executive role A tech savvy person who is experienced working with a variety of different technology (we use Salesforce, Yesware, LinkedIn Navigator, ZoomInfo and other sales automation/enablement tools) 2+ years sales, preferably B2B SaaS sales  Fantastic written and verbal communication Proven track record of sales achievement, especially in a quota-carrying environment Interested (or a background) in life science would be helpful Prior experience working / selling remotely, a plus  What We Offer Great Insurance -  we cover 100% of employee premium cost and 50% for partner/family Great Culture - participate in our fun events like ActiviTuesday, Wellness Wednesdays, happy hours & speaker series Remote Team -  we’re 100% distributed so you can live anywhere in the US!  Transparency -  Weekly all company stand ups, monthly town halls, quarterly state of the start ups and anytime access to co-founders Generous Time Off - take the time you need, when you need it  Great Gear - We’ll set you up for success with the latest tech and help you outfit your home office. And, a free Spotify premium account!

Job Description:  DataRobot is looking for a talented and hungry Corporate Sales Representative. This is an incredible opportunity to build a SaaS sales career with a tech unicorn valued at over $6B. We are well-positioned to emerge as the dominant vendor in the Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning space and are undergoing tremendous growth as we move toward an eventual IPO. We’ve garnered some of the top sales leadership and GTM talent on the planet with a lineage of scaling start-ups to massive exits and countless examples of meteoric career growth.  Responsibilities  The successful candidate will play a fundamental role in achieving our ambitious customer acquisition and revenue growth objectives. You will consult and partner with senior executives at large and mid-sized companies to solve complex business challenges. You must be comfortable self-sourcing new sales opportunities, developing new interest and meetings in your assigned market (Pipeline Generation), engaging with senior executives, qualifying prospects and closing sales. You will be expected to:  Meet or exceed assigned sales goals and work effectively as a sales team member; promote camaraderie, share best practices, provide assistance, be a positive influence Leverage Leading Indicators and Data in your business to ensure you are tracking above your quota goals Collaborate and leverage an ecosystem of resources including pre sales, post sales, channel partners, customer success and leadership to promote DataRobot and drive incremental new business Conduct Proof of Value technical validation engagements with customers to validate our technology and tie the technology back to customer value Stay current with industry trends, show dedication to continuous learning on all fronts Provide feedback to peers and internal teams to aid in the development and improvement of sales materials Maintain full use and adoption of the sales tech stack, including Salesforce.com, Outreach.io, GSuite, Zoominfo, LinkedIn Navigator, etc.  Key Characteristics  You’ll know you’re a good fit if you have the following traits:  Coachable, curious, life-long learner who constantly seeks development Intelligent persistence, diligently pursuing every lead Customer-centric, putting the customer’s success before all else Detailed-oriented, organized, with strong time-management, the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously in a fast paced, deadline and data-driven environment Excellent verbal and communications skills Sense of urgency with the ability to thrive in a metrics-driven culture Self-starter with solid problem-solving skills  Experience & Skills  1 to 3 years of sales experience in a business to business environment; Knowledge of or experience with using value-selling/consultative methodologies, playbooks, and processes (examples include MEDDIC, SPIN, Sandler, SNAP, Miller Heiman, Challenger, Gap Selling, etc.) Strong experience and success in outbound sales and prospecting roles Interest and excitement for the machine learning/predictive analytics space Ability to deliver compelling presentations and demonstrations to individuals and large groups  At DataRobot, we value diverse backgrounds and understand that the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can discourage really awesome people from applying. We believe “Growth happens outside of your comfort zone.”, so if you’re smart, curious, and emotionally intelligent, please don’t hesitate to apply — we’d love to hear from you.  DataRobot is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. DataRobot is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and mental disabilities. Please see the United States Department of Labor’s EEO poster and EEO poster supplement for additional information.  All applicant data submitted is handled in accordance with our Applicant Privacy Policy .

description: Job Summary:  This posting is a talent pool for upcoming roles within Consumer Products, Games & Publishing.  From toys to apparel, books to games, and much more, Disney Consumer Products, Games and Publishing (CPGP) brings our company’s products, through stories and characters, to markets worldwide. With a portfolio of renowned franchises including Disney, Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, 20CS and National Geographic, our efforts to deliver innovative and experiential products, designed to entertain and inspire, is industry leading and category shaping.  This Sales Manager plays a pivotal position within the Disney Publishing Group. Our business, managed through distributors and via direct relationships with accounts, is significant and diverse. It includes the independent bookstores, Mass Channels, Special Markets, Amazon and all retail & wholesale accounts where books are sold. Within Disney Publishing Group, the Sales Managers works daily on our business through including editorial, publicity, marketing and operations involvement. Excellent communication skills both written and verbal are a cornerstone of the skill set for success in this position.  Responsibilities:  Accountable for revenue and profitability targets for assigned accounts Make specific title recommendations reflective of Disney, Marvel, Lucas, Hyperion, and National Geographic key initiatives and the accounts needs to maximize sales Develop annual plans for revenue targets, and provide accurate forecasting on a monthly basis in order to help achieve annual sales goals Oversee multiple annual presentations for the buyer teams, inclusive of editorial and marketing across imprints Partner with editorial and art teams to develop products and programs to drive additional sales Work with internal publicity department and accounts events department to secure author appearances Manage co-op advertising budget for designated accounts Knowledge and enthusiasm for publishing product lines to be able to provide account base feedback on titles, cover art, pricing, promotional plans, trends and other relevant information Develop and maintain a close working relationship with assigned retailers and their distribution network Identify and communicate industry trends, rising authors and ideas from sales accounts Reports & analyzes account level orders and sales forecast for all titles, including seasonal, promotional and advertising trends Provide written reports and account recaps as needed including feedback on titles, promotional plans, cover art and other pertinent information Sales conferences and focus meetings; weekly business update meeting; interaction with the editorial, marketing, publicity and operations groups within Disney across the country. Provide catalog input, Edelweiss, and Onyx feed approval. Manage embargoed title information and approve title information flow to distributors & accounts. Experience with managing promotional budgets  Basic Qualifications:  Minimum of five years’ experience in publishing preferably in sales management Strong working knowledge of PowerPoint and strong Excel skills, including forecasting analytics Ability to prioritize, stay focused and keep a professional demeanor Strong understanding of retail sales and retail marketing strategies, brand and property positioning Flexible/adaptable and able to collaborate, communicate, influence and persuade at all levels of an organization Capable of working independently and managing a variety of initiatives/issues simultaneously, within a fast-paced environment Strong analytical skills and understanding of business concepts  Preferred Education  Bachelor’s degree  Additional Information:  Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits.  CPGPJobs  860813BR

description: Company Description  Accolade at a glance  Accolade provides personalized health and benefits solutions designed to empower every person to live their healthiest life. We help millions of people and their employers navigate the complexities of the healthcare system with empathy, expertise and through exceptional service while supporting them in lowering the cost of care and improving health outcomes. Accolade blends technology-enabled health and benefits solutions, specialized support from Accolade Health Assistants® and Clinicians and access to expert medical opinion services for high-cost treatment decisions. We consistently receive consumer satisfaction ratings over 90 percent and have been recognized by Inc. Magazine as a Top Place to Work 2020 and Business Intelligence for Excellence in Customer Service 2020. Please visit us on LinkedIn, Twitter, Instagram and Facebook and at accolade.com.  Job Description  The Regional Sales Executive, Mid-Market is responsible for meeting or exceeding the annual bookings quota for the assigned territory.  Our team is growing! This role must be based within and will cover the following territory:  Georgia, North Carolina, South Carolina, Florida, Alabama, Mississippi, Tennessee, Virginia, West Virginia, Ohio and Indiana.  A day in the life… Consistently identifies opportunities, develops sales strategy and closes new business in the assigned middle market segment Identifies, develops and retains new business relationships Effectively presents Accolade’s offerings to qualified prospects Effectively leverages Accolade executives, the pre-sales team and services staff to support customer presentations Develops and executes strategies to generate cost effective sales leads Develops a pipeline of new sales opportunities in alignment with objectives that are established annually Develops and maintains an effective sales and market penetration plan for assigned territory Leverages the sales milestone process to ensure accuracy with monthly, quarterly and annual forecasts Documents all sales contacts, activities and sales process steps in Accolade’s sales tools and systems Solicits product and market feedback from customers, prospects and partners. Communicates this feedback to sales leadership, marketing and the product development team (feature requests, market trends, competition intelligence, new opportunities) Complies with all corporate policies and completes all administrative tasks on time Qualifications  What we are looking for… Minimum 10-15 years of strategic selling experience BA in a business or technical related area of study Experience selling complex, multi-stakeholder solutions. SaaS, health & welfare benefits, healthcare capital equipment, healthcare IT, health and welfare benefits outsourcing, human resources IT benefits software Embraces and thrives in a culture of transparency, accountability and trust Self-starter with ability to work independently, prioritize work and coordinate multiple tasks within tight time constraints Ability to navigate the strategic levels of customer organizations, identify key decision-makers, build relationships with senior executives and schedule meetings with key stakeholders Ability to establish strong team relationships in a matrix organization Ability to perform in a dynamic and fast-paced environment Possess account knowledge, executive-level customer contacts and industry relationships inside the employer market space Command of social media for the benefit of lead generation, gaining access to executives and networking with key stakeholders Strong aptitude with business software tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook etc) Strong business acumen Demonstrated ability to successfully negotiate complex contract Demonstrated ability to accurately forecast monthly, quarterly, and annual revenue Where permitted by applicable law, candidates must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by date of hire to be considered, if not currently employed by Accolade, Inc. The Company will provide reasonable accommodations to qualified employees with disabilities or for a sincerely held religious belief.  Please note that a request for exemption due to a personal preference not to receive a vaccine is not protected by law. All requests for exemptions from this mandate shall be directed to the Company recruiter who shall route the request to the Company’s human resources department.  Additional Information  What Is Important To Us  Creating an enduring company that is hyper-focused on our culture and making a meaningful impact in the lives of our employees, members and customers. The secret to our success is:  We Find Joy And Purpose In Serving Others  Making a difference in our members’ and customers’ lives is what we do. Even when it’s hard, we do the right thing for the right reasons.  We are strong individually and together, we’re powerful  Trusting in our colleagues and embracing their different backgrounds and experiences enable us to solve tough problems in creative ways, having fun along the way.  We roll up our sleeves and get stuff done  Results motivate us. And we aren't afraid of the hard work or tough decisions needed to get us there.  We’re boldly and relentlessly reinventing healthcare We're curious and act big -- not afraid to knock down barriers or take calculated risks to change the world, one person at a time.  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

description: These are the professionals who help us build our business in the national accounts, middle markets, small group markets, distribution channel, group insurance and specialty products areas.  Their goal is to meet customer needs and help them make better decisions and about their health care and health care spending.  Meets growth sales production, retention and profitability objectives for assigned book of business. Develops and executes a comprehensive strategic plan which results in increased sales and maximized profitability by maintaining and expanding penetration of existing products and cross-selling other Aetna products. Updates external constituents on Aetna capabilities to create business opportunities and/or enhance the perception and understanding of Aetna capabilities.Delivers organized, polished presentations of solutions, with benefits tied to the constituent’s business needs. Identifies and capitalizes on emerging trends in the marketplace by participating in community and industry events as an Aetna representative. Builds and maintains productive relationships with plan sponsors and brokers/consultants. Reaches senior levels within a customer/consultant organization and tailors message to effectively engage senior executives. Shares relevant industry and competitive data within and across business units and segments to support the development of new product initiatives. Mentors and supports service team, peers, and sales team.  Required Qualifications  Senior level account management with large book of business. Must be able to work onsite 5 days a week  COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement  CVS Health requires its Colleagues in certain positions to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (including any booster shots if required), where allowable under the law, unless they are approved for a reasonable accommodation based on disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or religious belief that prevents them from being vaccinated.  If you are vaccinated, you are required to have received at least one COVID-19 shot prior to your first day of employment and to provide proof of your vaccination status within the first 30 days of your employment. For the two COVID-19 shot regimen, you will be required to provide proof of your second COVID-19 shot within the first 60 days of your employment. Failure to provide timely proof of your COVID-19 vaccination status will result in the termination of your employment with CVS Health. If you are unable to be fully vaccinated due to disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or religious belief, you will be required to apply for a reasonable accommodation within the first 30 days of your employment in order to remain employed with CVS Health. As a part of this process, you will be required to provide information or documentation about the reason you cannot be vaccinated. If your request for an accommodation is not approved, then your employment may be terminated.  Preferred Qualifications  7-9 years industry experience with complex national sales and/or client management. College degree or equivalent experience.  Education  Licensure as required. College degree or equivalent experience.

description: Description  Want to join a Different and Day One Program building international ecommerce that helps NA merchants business grow in Emerging Country? Amazon Global Selling (AGS) is seeking a dynamic and motivated Global Sales Account Representative who loves problem solving and hands-on building new business from ground helping NA seller expand their business into Emerging Country including MENA, South East Asia (Singapore) and LATAN (Brazil).  Amazon’s vision is to offer the earth’s largest product selection and lowest prices for our customers. Currently, AGS exists in 10 countries, exceeds 40% of total Amazon unit sales, and continues to grow. Each year, tens of thousands of businesses join the marketplace and offer millions of new products to worldwide customer.  What You Can Expect And Core Responsibilities Responsible for Seller recruitment including identifying high value seller and business opportunity, developing strategy to approach and lockdown key Seller to invest into the program. Strong outbound sales, cold calling and pipeline management is crucial to deliver launch and selection target. Manage account success during overall life cycle of launched Seller. You and your Seller are a team and the goal is to do whatever it takes to help this partnership success delivering revenue target. You have to be creative taking below but not limit to the items including implementing, tracking, and analyzing Seller performance metrics to make recommendations and identify areas of opportunity. Develop yourself to become an expert of this super complex global ecommerce industry and help improve the process, feature and product with various internal and external stakeholders including product, marketing, logistic and carrier, payment and legal. Won't take "No" easily but have ability to deep dive using data to influence others. Interface with multiple internal stakeholders at all levels and cross-functional teams to assist in creating compelling Amazon solutions that meet and exceed customer and Seller requirements You have to move quick enough in this fast paced business and be creative building solution out of the box in order to make this Day One business success. No SOP is waiting there because we need entrepreneur like You to build this together. If you want to work as part of a tightly-knit, entrepreneurial team to grow something Big and are excited having a positive impact at another side of the earth, we can’t wait to have you on our team!   Basic Qualifications 3+ years of relevant business and sales experience BA/BS degree or equivalent experience Experience prospecting, outreaching or cold-calling customer Experience with pipeline management utilizing Salesforce.com or other CRM tools Preferred Qualifications Experience with outbound sales, cold calling and pipeline management Successfully navigate through fast-paced environment dealing with ambiguity like startup. Enjoy learn from doing and build from scratch. Can identify insight quickly and setup SOP and mechanism instead of requiring detail guidance to follow Proven record of driving end to end sales and account management with all the issues of your customer. Enjoy hangs-on solving customer pain point effectively instead of waiting for others B2C sales experience recruiting and managing numbers of customers (B2B sales who manages less than 10 key accounts is not working in this case) Online sales, international trading, or retail experience in NA, Emerging Country, MENA, South East Asia (Singapore) or LATAN (Brazil). Experience using tools such as Excel and SQL to analyze data and make business decisions Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.   Company - Amazon.com Services LLC  Job ID: A1737310

description: How we do what we do:  At Barrette Outdoor Living we are committed to providing quality products that enhance people's lives. Our people share a passion for our business, and work with skill, teamwork, and integrity to deliver on our promise to provide superior products. We offer competitive and comprehensive benefits packages. Enjoy benefits like medical, wellness, paid time off, and much more!  As a company, we share a passion for our work and for our employees. We value our employees and empower them to be their best. We are collaborative, we like to work together and we care about what we do and, most importantly, who we do it with. We are BOL!  The purpose of the role:  Barrette Outdoor Living is looking for a high energy Territory Sales Manager who is responsible for sales growth and increasing market share throughout the Central Region in close proximity to St. Louis or Kansas City. Determine priority and effort given to each account based on sales potential and sales maintenance. The manager will grow and maintain Pro, Installed, Commercial and SOS sales programs within territory by keeping customers informed about available products, prices, services and new product introductions. The manager will also monitor competitive activity, trends within territory, keep records and prepare reports on sales activities. The position requires excellent communication skills and an ability to teach, train, motivate and present the assigned product lines and program. Must be self-motivated and possess a passion for the business.  Responsibilities:  Assists with the development of the annual sales plan for the defined territory to include the RDI Collection, Barrette Decking and Barrette Railing brands. Monitors individual sales budget performance and makes adjustments in strategy and territory sales activity in order to reach and exceed established sales budget and other company sales and marketing initiatives. Works within the established sales operation expense budget to grow sales while keeping expenditures at or under budget.   Assists with monitoring of the annual sales and production forecast by tracking and communicating large project work and spikes as well as drops in sales volume of specific products or categories within the territory. Travels the territory extensively visiting key customers, targeting new opportunities and supporting the company’s distribution partners by capturing dealer market share and assisting distributors in reaching their established sales budgets. Implements marketing programs within the territory such as Barrette2Builder (B2B) with distribution partners, dealers and the contractor base. Works jointly with the Field Support Managers to schedule and conduct successful and productive Truck & Trailer events within the territory. Provides call reporting and other administrative duties as requested by the Director of Sales. Supports a culture of positive and constructive motivation to encourage and motivate other employees and distributor sales reps to perform to expectations. Monitors competitive products, manufacturers, pricing, sales and marketing activities within the territory and communicates findings. Establishes and maintains relationships with distribution partners, strategic dealers, builders and key contractors within the territory. Represents Company at key trade shows and industry events. Recommends product positioning, packaging and pricing strategy to produce the highest possible long-term market share. Works cross functionally with other BOL Business Units, as requested, to maximize opportunities with channel partners, products, sales teams and services.  If that sounds like you....here's what we need in terms of education and experience: Bachelor's Degree or relevant retail work experience 5 plus years in building products industry Previous experience managing distributor/dealer accounts Proficiency in MS Office suite. Ability to manage and report travel expenses Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to travel as required

Sales Executive, Medical Payer Would you like the opportunity to take ownership for delivering growth? Do you enjoy building successful relationships with customers to develop opportunities?  About our Team Our Clinical Solutions Team uses our industry-leading intellectual property and content to create products for healthcare professionals. Our products and tools aid in disease management, medication error reductions, workflow improvements, effective patient management and economic analysis and cost control. Our flagship platform for clinically focused searches and deep reference information products serves as the best combined solution for Payers.  About the Role As a Sales Executive, you will be responsible for new and existing sales of our ClinicalKey product for the Medical Payer market. You will be a trusted advisor to our customers through building relationships with key stakeholders and individuals. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to assess opportunities and execute successful strategies for sales growth.  Responsibilities Building and maintaining a pipeline of qualified opportunities to effectively move through the selling process to achieve growth targets Developing accurate forecasts and reports of new business opportunities and sales by updating and managing data in our Salesforce system Establishing intelligence about our competitors products, strategy and sales approach to understand the market direction and needs of current and new customers Owning the opportunity development process by collaborating with internal stakeholders and cross-functional teams to develop potential revenue opportunities within accounts Developing effective, collaborative relationships with key contacts and decision makers to ensure a successful sales outcome Performing engaging product demonstrations remotely through Zoom or other technology-based applications to build customer interest and gain feedback  Requirements Have a proven background in successful healthcare sales or technology solution selling and expertise with the Payer domain Demonstrate experience in complex solution-sales approach with a “consultative selling” to the C-Suite and decision makers Demonstrate excellent written and verbal, communication and presentation skills including communicating complex technical content to a range of audiences Have impressive organizational skills to be able to identify develop and manage opportunities in a large territory Show knowledge of regional or national Health Plan groups, collaboration networks and key opinion leaders Be able to travel overnight when required (post-Covid)  Work in a way that works for you We promote a healthy work/life balance across the organization. With an average length of service of 9 years, we are confident that we offer an appealing working prospect for our people. With numerous wellbeing initiatives, family leave and tuition reimbursement, we will help you meet your immediate responsibilities and long-term goals.  Working remotely from home or any other work location Working flexible hours - flexing the times you work in the day  Working with us We are an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to help you succeed. Here, you will find an inclusive, agile, collaborative, innovative and fun environment, where everyone has a part to play. Regardless of the team you join, we promote a diverse environment with co-workers who are passionate about what they do, and how they do it.  Working for you At Elsevier, we know that your wellbeing and happiness are key to a long and successful career. These are some of the benefits we are delighted to offer:  Competitive Salary and generous commission plan based on performance, which is uncapped Comprehensive, multi-carrier health plan benefits Disability insurance Dependent Care and Commuter Spending Accounts Life and Accident Insurance Retirement Benefits (Salary Investment Plan/Employer Stock Purchase Plan) Modern Family Benefits, including adoption and surrogacy  About Us A global leader in information and analytics, we help researchers and healthcare professionals advance science and improve health outcomes for the benefit of society. Building on our publishing heritage, we combine quality information and vast data sets with analytics to support visionary science and research, health education and interactive learning, as well as exceptional healthcare and clinical practice. At Elsevier, your work contributes to the world’s grand challenges and a more sustainable future. We harness innovative technologies to support science and healthcare to partner for a better world.  Join Us Are you ready to help us progress science and health? Our technology leads to innovation, so join a forward-thinking digital business that is tackling world-scale challenges and align your ambitions with our passion for driving global knowledge-sharing.
industries: Hospital & Health Care, Information Technology and Services, and Information Services

description: Would you like to work for a fast-growing company providing an award-winning, unique, and innovative service that supports patients participating in clinical trials? Clincierge® is recruiting for a Sales Account Manager to join its passionate and collaborative team of professional experts.  The Sales Account Manager is responsible for discovering and generating new clients and prospects to maintain a robust sales pipeline. They will create and grow a portfolio of business by acquiring new clients at CROs and sponsors, as well as being assigned a select number of large accounts for ongoing account management.    Reporting to the Director of Sales & Marketing, this role requires cultivating and maintaining high levels of customer satisfaction and engagement. . Clincierge is a remote-first organization, so this role can be located anywhere in the USA.  Responsibilities (Sales):  Develops and initiates plans for acquiring new business Meets with perspective clients, assesses needs, makes presentations, and generates interest in Clincierge services Leads client interactions, responds promptly and thoroughly to client communication, proactively communicates with internal operations to meet client needs Generates budget proposals based and manages budget through negotiation and contract Maintains accurate records of all sales activities in Vision, SharePoint, CRM and other relevant internal systems Reviews reports and analyzes sales efforts with department to determine effectiveness of sales efforts and re-evaluate strategies on an ongoing basis.    Responsibilities (Account Management): Develops client relationship and has primary oversight of managing the long-term relationship   Ensures NDI generation/delivery/payment prior to FPI  Acts as bridge/liaison from Sales process through KOM and beyond   Ensures timelines and deliverables are documented accurately and consistently Attends all check-ins/status update meetings until study/program is fully operationalized and patient support is routine and seamless  Attends all account-level or program-level governance meetings for senior oversight  Primary point of escalation for account-level issues    Identifies and communicates potential roadblocks or problem areas to senior management; provides and implements proactive remediation plans  Identifies pipeline and additional product/service opportunities to build the value of the account  Requirements: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required; Master’s preferred Minimum of 8-10 years’ in direct sales in the hospitality/travel, or healthcare related business in an outside sales capacity A proven record of acquiring sales and meeting quotas in a business-to-business service environment Exposure to marketing plans and understanding of their role in the sales process Experience in making energetic and engaging presentations to decision-makers Active membership in industry associations preferred, but not required  Perks of Working at Clincierge: Competitive salary and bonus structure  401(k) employer contribution Employer-paid medical, dental & vision insurance options Paid Time Off, Sick Leave benefits Tuition Reimbursement Program Professional Development Remote-first organization

Primarily inside sales in DFW Metroplex area; family lives in New Orleans - open to occasional travel; position does not have to be limited to residential new home sales specialties.  Excited to explore new opportunities!

We are seeking a Regional Sales Director who will partner with Global-e to ensure the immediate enterprise growth of the North America client portfolio. This candidate will be responsible for providing prospective clients with strategic growth insights based on data in order to exceed revenue targets set forth by management.  Responsibilities: Responsible for the international eCommerce sales growth for the North America region Work with senior executives at leading retailers to strategically build, launch and execute on global growth initiatives   Researches, locates, defines and targets enterprise business prospects Manages and maintains a pipeline of target accounts while implementing enterprise sales strategies to meet financial objectives Builds relationships and identifies the prospects’ needs for the products or services Utilizes a consultative selling approach to emphasize product features based on analysis of customers’ needs and on technical knowledge of product capabilities Contacts prospective customers by cold calling, networking and customer appointments Participates in customer interactions, demos, and calls virtually or in person to deliver sales presentations, pitches and commercials to grow the North America customer base Negotiates pricing strategy, contracts and volume with enterprise executive audiences Secures major new businesses and leverages partnerships both internally and externally Positions market information such as current trends, sales techniques, and application of products in various markets Tracks activity, prepares and maintains records for sales leads and account status within the customer relationship management system to document interactions Manages and responds to RFPs and RFIs of targeted and new accounts Develops relationships with partnership counterparts to garnish lead generation opportunities Coordinates and attends events and outreach, tracking marketing campaigns and evaluating sales success Job Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree preferred, MBA an advantage 5+ years’ experience with a minimum of (3) years selling to large brands at the “C” level required Strong business and financial acumen with strong analytical skills Creative and able to adapt quickly to change Strong written and verbal communication skills Proven track record of exceeding expectations and sales targets Demonstrated ability to communicate, present and influence credibly and effectively at all levels of the organization, including executive and C-level Must have excellent listening, communication, and presentation skills Must be a self-starter and self-motivated to accomplish sales goals and objectives Must have very good organizational and time management skills to help maximize selling time and strong self-confidence to assist in developing relationships in a highly competitive environment Must be proficient in Microsoft Office (Powerpoint, Excel, Word) 50% travel required

About Grow Therapy       At Grow, we believe America's mental healthcare system is broken. Most mental health providers won't accept insurance because of the significant administrative burden. Meanwhile, patients struggle to find quality care that is both affordable and convenient. We partner with mental health providers to build and grow their own in-network private practices, thereby improving access to quality care.   We're a team of entrepreneurs, builders, and go-getters who will not settle for the status quo. Our founding team comes from Harvard Medical School, Google, Stripe, and Blackstone, with support from CoFound Partners and SignalFire. We're excited to expand the team in our hyper-growth stage as we expand accessibility throughout the country.       Sales Manager (Provider Growth)   Description   As the founding Sales Manager at Grow Therapy, you'll play a huge role in building the Provider Growth team who will expand our provider network, directly impacting thousands of therapists across the United States.   You'll recruit, train, and lead a distributed team of 10+ Sales Associates, all of whom care deeply about helping our providers achieve their dreams in private practice. You'll also be responsible for optimizing conversion on existing inbound channels, working with our Growth Marketing team on new channels, and managing provider communications through our CRM.   After just a few months, you'll be our resident expert in provider recruitment, remote team engagement, and inbound funnel optimization. You'll see your impact through provider signups, conversion by market, and inbound NPS. Most importantly, you'll know that you've been part of making providers' lives better....and through that, making mental healthcare more accessible to all.       What You'll Do   Recruit and standup the training and sales methodology for the Provider Growth Team Manage and coach a remote team of 10+ Sales Associates Proactively identify and evaluate opportunities for new channels for engaging and onboarding providers. Manage our CRM and provider communications from first touch to signing (and beyond!) Analyze data and present metrics-driven insights from providers to the larger org  Requirements:  Mission-driven and passionate about making a difference for mental health providers Prior experience managing a high-performing sales team(s) at a startup or fast growing small business. Committed coach who is enthusiastic about training, mentoring, and inspiring a high velocity sales organization Thoughtful and diplomatic communicator and relationship builder. Process driven and committed to operational excellence (attention to detail, tech-savviness). Bonus (great to have but not required):   Venture-backed startup experience in sales management  Experience working in healthcare or with mental health providers Experience developing and managing both outbound and inbound channels  Benefits:  Wellness: Our dedication to mental health guides our culture. This means unlimited PTO, winter break, lunch on us, mental health mornings, team meditation, and more! Health plans: Comprehensive health, mental, vision, and dental insurance. We also provide all employees with a wellness stipend• Flexibility: Flexible working (hybrid of in-person & remote), relaxed dress code, office pets highly encouraged Learning: Mental health workshops, learning stipend, and dedicated learning days Ownership: As a small team, you'll have unbounded leadership opportunities and the chance to transform the mental healthcare landscape from day one Compensation: Competitive salary and equity compensation

The Sales Development Manager is responsible for driving the results of the SDR team by coaching, coordinating, measuring, problem-solving, and leading. The Sales Development Manager contributes to the strategies and executes plans while upholding the standards to ensure that opportunity creation and pipeline goals are met or exceeded. This role requires a self-starting, proactive, results-oriented sales management professional. As the Sales Development Manager, you will help create and implement a strategy to support all global sales efforts as well as coach prospecting methods, using a combination of phone, email, social media, and direct mail to help build our sales pipeline by connecting with prospective customers. The ideal candidate will have a mindset of ‘raising the bar and will be able to digest and analyze data, and know-how to energize, motivate, and grow a team.   We’re looking to add an experienced SDR Manager (12+ months) with a background in payments and SaaS that focuses on coaching based on individual needs. You must have proven your ability to inspire, encourage, and collaborate with your team. You must be efficient in working with a sophisticated technology stack (Salesforce, Outreach or SalesLoft, ZoomInfo, HubSpot, LinkedIn Navigator). You must be able to work in a fast-paced environment and handle change management well. As a part of the SDR Leadership team, you must take extreme ownership of your work, continuously strive for improvement, and can succeed without all the answers.  This position is located in Waltham, MA.  Timeline of Position:   Month 3: Conduct weekly 1:1 meetings with your direct reports Coach and mentor Sales Development Representatives to optimum performance Understand reporting in Salesforce and all other systems, use data to coach SDRs on specific behaviors Report team performance metrics to the Director of Sales  Month 6: Bring your thinking, strategy, and ideas to the team to advance our unique culture and vision for the future Present ideas to maximize workflow in the SDR org Contribute to ideas, content, and delivery of onboarding and ongoing training for SDR org  1 year: Identify problems and proactively create comprehensive plans of action to present to senior management Ensure company and department policies and procedures are adhered to and recommend updates when needed Organize and deploy team resources in accordance with department and company strategies Work with the Director of Sales to identify a plan of continued career growth   Responsibilities: Hire, train, manage, and mentor a small team of global sales development representatives with the intent to grow the team 2-3X over the next 12 months. Meet or exceed quota! You’ll be implementing creative strategy, providing ad hoc training sessions, and will lead by example to make sure you and your team hit goals Manage performance metrics for team members and work with them to hone their sales skillset Work closely with Sales, Marketing, and Product to design competitive training sessions to ensure the team is fully prepared to meet goals Build prospecting sequences, write email copy, and create call scripts Ensure optimum sales processes and tools are in place to achieve goals Provide management with appropriate sales activity reports in a timely manner  Requirements: You’ve managed a team of successful sales development representatives in the past and are looking for your next big challenge! Experience in Sales Development management in the payment technology space is preferred 2+ years of experience in technology sales – Payment Experience is Required Strong motivator creating fun team-building exercises and experiences to develop a team culture and drive performance Results-oriented professional with self-confidence, perseverance, a sense of urgency, and exceptional attention to detail Strong written and verbal communication skills Strategic thinker, organized, adept problem solver, and detail-oriented Strong project management skills are required Innovative with an ability to sell ideas internally to improve processes throughout the organization Experience with Salesforce, Salesforce High-Velocity Sales, Outreach.io, SalesLoft, and ZoomInfo or similar technologies required Bachelor’s Degree or comparable experience

description: Are you looking for a sales role that will enable you to hone your craft at a fast growing digital agency in an exploding segment of the market? Are you competitive and self-motivated with previous sales and marketing experience? Our high-producing team is poised for explosive growth and we’re looking for an enthusiastic sales professional to help us achieve our goals.  We're building a different kind of work environment at SmartBug Media – one where you can deliver great results, have a great time with people you respect, and still embrace the things that matter in life. We focus on development and growth.  Position Overview:  SmartBug's Sales Executives report to the Director of Sales, and are responsible for executing our inbound sales methodology, properly forecasting sales numbers for new accounts, and achieving quotas each month across our six core lines of business: inbound marketing, paid media, website design, sales enablement, revenue operations and public relations.  The Day-to-Day: Showcase your expertise in inbound marketing and inbound sales. Close new business consistently at or above quota level. Manage all aspects of the sales funnel, from qualification to close. Employ (and contribute to the evolution of) SmartBug’s existing inbound sales process. Participate in the development and execution of your tiered, target account list and partner with marketing and fellow sales executives to build effective programs to penetrate accounts Conduct needs assessments calls with sales qualified leads, leveraging your business acumen from past experience consulting on and selling demand generation and/or sales enablement strategies in the SaaS, manufacturing, healthcare, and/or professional services verticals, among others. Respond to sales inquiries via email and phone as assigned. Engage in intelligent, prescriptive, and educational-based outreach to expose good fit clients to SmartBug’s offerings Leverage HubSpot’s entire Sales Hub, demonstrating inbound selling methodology through each sales interaction Maintain pristine CRM records and accurate pipeline forecasting Monitor performance against key performance indicators and implement improvement strategies, as required. Contribute as a sales and marketing thought leader as an author for SmartBug’s own blog and by engaging regularly throughout targeted social media and community-based platforms Become a true evangelist of SmartBug’s employee advocacy program Share your inbound sales knowledge by contributing to the SmartBug blog and webinar series. Rock the future customer experience by demonstrating your inbound expertise to identify pains and architect solutions that are best for the customer’s business needs. Other responsibilities as assigned Have fun and make some great friends!  Experience and Education Requirements: Authorization to work in the U.S. without employer sponsorship is required Experience running a consultative sales process in a marketing agency environment in which the agency delivered inbound marketing, website design and development, and/or sales enablement services. Working knowledge of CRM best practices and sales enablement tools. Superior communication skills, whether on video conference, phone calls, in-person, or written communication. The ability to assess business problems and prescribe solutions as they relate to sales and marketing initiatives for our clients. An innate hunger and the self-discipline to grow, as well as a willingness to help others succeed. Alignment with our values Inbound marketing, inbound sales, HubSpot marketing, and HubSpot sales certifications preferred. Experience working in a fast-paced, startup-like environment. Experience selling marketing, paid media, web, integrations, PR, and/or sales services. Experience purchasing marketing services and/or managing agency relationships as a client, preferred. Experience working remotely preferred  Interview Process: Application submission Video application submission Phone screen with HR Series of 2-3 video calls with hiring team Reference checking  Our Extensive Employee Benefits Program Includes: Generous compensation package with performance incentives Health insurance with company contribution Paid maternity and paternity leave Paid time off 401(k) with employer matching Flexible spend plan Company-funded short-term disability and life insurance Long-term disability Annual leadership conference, SmartBugapalooza Training budget The flexibility of working remotely  About SmartBug Media™  SmartBug Media™ is a fully remote globally recognized Intelligent Inbound™ marketing agency that assists businesses in growing revenue through content marketing, sales enablement, web development, marketing automation, and PR. For over 10 years, SmartBug™ has helped businesses increase qualified leads, close customers, and enhance the reach and loyalty of their brands. We are a 90+ person remote company that believes you shouldn’t have to compromise work/life balance in order to deliver great work, and we believe that you can do this from anywhere. SmartBug has been named to the Inc. 5000 4 times, Adweek 100 the last two years, and has won numerous Comparably awards for its culture and leadership. SmartBug is HubSpot’s highest-rated partner in the world.  Powered by JazzHR  Ttjs6D0QQN

description: Style Crest, Inc. has been an innovative distributor and manufacturer of quality products for the manufactured housing industry for over 50 years. Our products include heating and cooling units, entry steps, foundation covers, door and windows, and a wide assortment of plumbing and electrical parts designed to accommodate the unique needs of manufactured homes.  We are looking for a motivated sales person who lives in the Fort Myers, Florida area to join our outside sales team. As a Territory Sales Manager, you will sell multiple product lines to a variety of manufactured housing customers including retailers, distributors and contractors.  Key Responsibilities Identifies and converts prospects to new customers. Establishes positive relationships with current customer base to maintain and grow the business. Calls and visits regularly customers and prospects to generate sales growth and develop customer relationships. Develops a strategic plan for growing the territory and forecasts sales by customer and product category. Meets or exceeds these goals. Educates prospects and customers on the value added features and benefits of our products and our customer service commitment. Communicates timely to sales management opportunities, successes and concerns within the territory. Makes recommendations and adjustments to overcome any barriers. Acts as the liaison between the customer and Style Crest. Follows up and responds timely to customer requests to ensure we provide excellent customer service. Attends trade shows and conventions and represents Style Crest in a professional manner. Required Knowledge, Skills And Experience 5 years of successful selling experience in a related industry. Experience selling HVAC products and knowledge of the manufactured housing industry is preferred. Prior building materials distribution experience is a plus. Proven ability to establish relationships with customers and close prospects that result in sales growth. Ability to strategically plan and execute on sales forecasts and business plan goals. Understands market trends and the implications of those trends. Proficient knowledge of Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint. Prior experience using CRM is preferred. Strong reasoning and decision making skills. The ability to handle multiple issues and details at one time. Excellent selling, presentation and communication skills. Must be willing to travel 3 nights a week on a regular basis. Must live within the territory. If you are interested in joining the Style Crest Team, please apply online to submit your resume. Style Crest offers competitive compensation programs and excellent benefits. We are an equal opportunity employer! Learn more about Style Crest at www.stylecrestinc.com.  Style Crest, Inc. has been setting the standard in the housing industry for quality and performance for 50 years. We sell, distribute, manufacture and install a full range of building products and services that offer enduring quality and performance leading to customer satisfaction.  Our associates ensure consistent quality and performance with their skill, attitude and teamwork allowing us to serve the residential and manufactured housing industry better than anyone. This is a family of over 600 dedicated associates working toward a common goal where the customer is at the center of every decision we make.

Company Description  Accolade at a glance  Accolade provides personalized health and benefits solutions designed to empower every person to live their healthiest life. We help millions of people and their employers navigate the complexities of the healthcare system with empathy, expertise and through exceptional service while supporting them in lowering the cost of care and improving health outcomes. Accolade blends technology-enabled health and benefits solutions, specialized support from Accolade Health Assistants® and Clinicians and access to expert medical opinion services for high-cost treatment decisions. We consistently receive consumer satisfaction ratings over 90 percent and have been recognized by Inc. Magazine as a Top Place to Work 2020 and Business Intelligence for Excellence in Customer Service 2020. Please visit us on LinkedIn, Twitter, Instagram and Facebook and at accolade.com.  Job Description  Our Mid-Market team is expanding!  The Regional Sales Executive, Mid-Market is responsible for meeting or exceeding the annual bookings quota for the assigned territory.  This role must be based within and will cover the following territory:  Pennsylvania, Delaware, Maryland, Washington, D.C., Virginia, West Virginia, Ohio and Indiana.  A day in the life… Consistently identifies opportunities, develops sales strategy and closes new business in the assigned middle market segment Identifies, develops and retains new business relationships Effectively presents Accolade’s offerings to qualified prospects Effectively leverages Accolade executives, the pre-sales team and services staff to support customer presentations Develops and executes strategies to generate cost effective sales leads Develops a pipeline of new sales opportunities in alignment with objectives that are established annually Develops and maintains an effective sales and market penetration plan for assigned territory Leverages the sales milestone process to ensure accuracy with monthly, quarterly and annual forecasts Documents all sales contacts, activities and sales process steps in Accolade’s sales tools and systems Solicits product and market feedback from customers, prospects and partners. Communicates this feedback to sales leadership, marketing and the product development team (feature requests, market trends, competition intelligence, new opportunities) Complies with all corporate policies and completes all administrative tasks on time Qualifications  What we are looking for… Minimum 8-10 years of strategic selling experience BA in a business or technical related area of study Experience selling complex, multi-stakeholder solutions. SaaS, health & welfare benefits, healthcare capital equipment, healthcare IT, health and welfare benefits outsourcing, human resources IT benefits software Embraces and thrives in a culture of transparency, accountability and trust Self-starter with ability to work independently, prioritize work and coordinate multiple tasks within tight time constraints Ability to navigate the strategic levels of customer organizations, identify key decision-makers, build relationships with senior executives and schedule meetings with key stakeholders Ability to establish strong team relationships in a matrix organization Ability to perform in a dynamic and fast-paced environment Possess account knowledge, executive-level customer contacts and industry relationships inside the employer market space Command of social media for the benefit of lead generation, gaining access to executives and networking with key stakeholders Strong aptitude with business software tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook etc) Strong business acumen Demonstrated ability to successfully negotiate complex contract Demonstrated ability to accurately forecast monthly, quarterly, and annual revenue Where permitted by applicable law, candidates must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by date of hire to be considered, if not currently employed by Accolade, Inc. The Company will provide reasonable accommodations to qualified employees with disabilities or for a sincerely held religious belief.  Please note that a request for exemption due to a personal preference not to receive a vaccine is not protected by law. All requests for exemptions from this mandate shall be directed to the Company recruiter who shall route the request to the Company’s human resources department.  Additional Information  What Is Important To Us  Creating an enduring company that is hyper-focused on our culture and making a meaningful impact in the lives of our employees, members and customers. The secret to our success is:  We Find Joy And Purpose In Serving Others  Making a difference in our members’ and customers’ lives is what we do. Even when it’s hard, we do the right thing for the right reasons.  We are strong individually and together, we’re powerful  Trusting in our colleagues and embracing their different backgrounds and experiences enable us to solve tough problems in creative ways, having fun along the way.  We roll up our sleeves and get stuff done  Results motivate us. And we aren't afraid of the hard work or tough decisions needed to get us there.  We’re boldly and relentlessly reinventing healthcare We're curious and act big -- not afraid to knock down barriers or take calculated risks to change the world, one person at a time.  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

description: Our Company  Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.  We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!  The Mid-Market Named Account Manager, sells Adobe Creative Cloud and Document Cloud via telephone or electronic means to customers in assigned accounts. May generate prospective customers through cold calling and may qualify and follow up with sales leads. Sales can be made through multichannel, inbound and/or outbound sales activities. Requires application of in-depth technical knowledge of products.  Responsible for selling prospective customers on Adobe’s creative, document and stock photo subscription offering through the VIP teams and enterprise license programs. This will include deal development and deal qualification, articulating value proposition to mid-level and top executives, establishing and gaining buy in around pricing, and closing the deal. Deal sizes will generally range from $5K and up depending on the customer. This is a fast growing, dynamic market with exceptional sales potential. Adobe is leading the way forward in the market and seeks a motivated SaaS sales professional to join the team.  What You'll Do Constantly fill the pipeline with new deals Deal development & qualification, lead generation as well as contract negotiations for closure on deals. Includes cold calling as well as cultivation of existing leads and working with partner ecosystem. Articulating the Document Cloud and Creative Cloud value proposition to director-level and above decision-makers. Help customers migrate to Enterprise version of software from older perpetual licensing and Teams licensing. Grow the customer’s use of Adobe’s products and annual spend with Adobe. Accurately forecast and manage pipeline on a monthly and quarterly basis. Keep accurate and up to date records of all deals in CRM system. What You Need To Succeed Minimum of 5 years inside sales experience, preferably in enterprise software. BS/BA Degree required. Proven success in penetrating new markets and closing new business. Consistent over-achievement of quota. Technically adept, self-motivated, and driven by results. Ability to accurately forecast based upon realistic opportunity assessments. Ability to create and develop relationships with the partner ecosystem. Ensure 100% customer satisfaction with all respective customers. Maintain professional internal and external relationships that meet our core values and align with our culture. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Prior experience with MS Office Suite as well as CRM solutions such as Salesforce.com.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Information Technology and Services, and Computer Software

description: Overview: The Sales Executive position is responsible to support, acquire, and grow revenue through direct customers and channel partners in United States and abroad. The ideal candidate will have a good understanding of Software, Remote Connectivity (VPN), Security and Semiconductors Manufacturing.  Responsibilities: Prospect and sell to new customers and existing installed base (Hunting). Manage existing large accounts promoting good business relationship with customers (Farming). Create Quotes and Manage PO’s and deliveries. Provide subject matter expert support to as a sales overlay assisting direct or indirect sales teams in the entire sales process. Collaborate with business partners to build a successful network. Maintain all sales activities by using company CRM (Salesforce) platform for assigned territory. Prepare Telit’s services offering, including demonstrating deep familiarity with company's product, infrastructure, security and integration capabilities. Effectively communicate and present to multiple levels and functions within an organization to demonstrate Telit’s unique value proposition. Build relationships within targeted accounts at all levels in order to understand customer requirements and build a compelling value proposition based on Telit’s services offerings. Develop innovative ways to address customer objections and leads customer to close. Handle negotiations in later stage sales efforts through targeted customer visits to key decision makers, RFP response development, and the coordination of third-party solution providers. Meet and exceed sales targets; achieve maximum sales by developing strong and meaningful customer relationships within senior executive team at targeted accounts. Provide regular reports in a timely manner, including weekly activity report, monthly sales forecast, visit reports, market maps and other reports as required. Responsible for selling products and services to highly sensitive and important accounts.
