Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree Preferred. 3 - 5 years Sales experience as Account Executive or Technical Pre-Sales. Direct sales experience preferred. Work well individually as well as with a team. Solid experience in handling large and complex accounts and working directly with clients at the senior management level. Ability to anticipate, identify and resolver customer communication problems. Excellent communication oral and written and ability to effectively communicate with diverse backgrounds and levels of the organization. Excellent attention to details and able to work independently with minimal supervision. Requires regular travel within territory 40% -60% of the time.  Compensation and Benefits: •          Competitive Pay (Base and Bonus) •          Matching 401(k) plan. •          Medical, Dental, Life insurance coverages. •          Short Term Disability and Long-Term Disability insurance. •          Voluntary Cancer, Critical Illness, and Accident insurance. •          Paid vacation – Holidays and PTO  Location: Remote Home office/ West or Central USA Region

This position is responsible for identifying, progressing, and closing Cloud opportunities across a portfolio of Enterprise, Accounts.  A Cloud Sales Executive works to identify, progress and close Oracle IaaS, PaaS, Autonomous Products and Engineered Systems opportunities in our most strategic accounts. Responsible for the account plan to drive goal attainment in assigned territory. Coordinates with the other members of the sales team (employees and partners) to support cloud sales and business development strategies.  Learns the customer’s business and critical strategic imperatives and becomes a trusted advisor to key customer decision makers.  Also is able to call on both IT, positioning our Cloud differentiators, and to LOB to map PaaS solutions like AI, Machine Learning, IOT, High Performance Computing, and Blockchain to solve modern business problems.  Follows all companies' methodologies and processes related to sales opportunity pursuit. Ensures that the company's sales programs are known and executed in assigned territory, including personal follow-up and engagement in selected opportunities. Achieves or exceeds quarterly and annual sales goals for both cloud solutions.   Sales Portfolio: Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) - A comprehensive set of integrated, subscription-based infrastructure services that enable businesses to run any workload in an enterprise-grade Generation 2 cloud managed, hosted, and supported by Oracle. Platform as a Service (PaaS)/ Autonomous Products – These solutions help enterprise IT and key LOB stakeholders rapidly build and deploy rich applications and/or extend 3rd party and Oracle Cloud SaaS apps.  Requirements:  Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. Work is non-routine and involves problem solving skills during sales engagements. Preference for experience with 8+ years of enterprise cloud sales with ideally a Bachelor of Science or Bachelor of Arts degree. Oil/Gas or Utilities, Manufacturing or Energy vertical industry cloud sales experience is a huge plus! Knowledge of cloud infrastructure and platform services (Experience Selling IaaS and PaaS)

KUALITATEM is a global Consulting, Audit, and Assurance company specializing in Software Quality Assurance, Information Security, Technology Process Optimization & Cloud Infrastructure. Kualitatem is an ISO 9001:2015 and ISO 27001:2013 certified company.  Job Title - Senior Account Sales Manager  Required Experience - 5-6 Years  Department - Sales & Marketing  Location - North America (Remote Option Available)  Reporting - CMO  Job Description  Role and Responsibilities  Holds and exhibit advanced level knowledge of software industry life cycle  Bring knowledge of enterprise negotiations and offer insight into sales process  Market Research, Lead Generation, Qualification, Deal Closure  Researching and generating new leads through personal outreach, cold calls and emails  Executing 40+ outbound calls/day or equivalent talk time  Running discovery calls with prospects to understand business needs and qualify opportunities  Actively manage your sales pipeline of outbound and inbound leads  Identifying and creating new qualified sales opportunities from leads (Size, Budget, Timelines, Needs)  Seamlessly transition qualified leads to senior sales teams & close smaller more transactional deals by owning the sales cycle from start to finish  Effectively plan your daily and weekly call schedule to ensure all inbound leads are promptly followed up  Tight management of sales pipeline to ensure accurate revenue forecasting  Timely reporting to the senior leadership team  Key Skills  Exceptional Communication Skills And Ability To Relate To Others  Positive attitude and highly motivated to reach/exceed quota  An inquisitive nature and a passion for understanding what makes a prospect’s business successful and/or unsuccessful  Highly coachable, eager to learn and grow their career  Willingness to work closely with others in a collaborative manner  At least five year of sales experience in IT sector  Must have a college education with a graduate degree.

Who Are We? We build products and relationships that last a lifetime! No really, that’s what we do. We are a successful family business with a long-term record of steady growth, and we are determined to accelerate our trajectory. Our diverse team members who speak 22 languages are passionate about their company and their co-workers. Check out our website at www.strong-hold.com. We seek a Government Sales Manager who is both a proven sales leader and has extensive experiences and working knowledge in the government space. Our Engineered Solutions (custom products) have supported our government partners extensively over the years and our Government Sales Manager will continue that channel expansion. We Are Not: Fancy - as manufacturers we believe beautiful facilities aren’t required to make quality products or retain the best team. High Tech - we incorporate technology into our products and processes where appropriate, but it doesn’t drive us. Transactional - we have long term relationships with our team members and most valuable customers. Satisfied - we celebrate achievement, then set our sights on new goals. What we’re looking for: You’ve successfully worked as a salesperson with Federal government clients, including the DOD, for 7+ years. You already possess a strong network of Government buyers, distributors, and contractors. You are familiar with the various types of Federal Government contracts, and you understand how the Federal Government makes it buying decisions. You have a proven record of consistently achieving sales goals. You are an independent and self-starting leader who will: Promote and sell Strong Hold Products into Federal Government market, specifically the DOD Combine strong interpersonal and communication skills, technical abilities, and market knowledge to create a customer-focused vision for the business. Analyze and determine the market potential and requirements within the Federal Government market, and the most optimal way to achieve growth and results Produce quarterly sales plans that target specific customers. Plans should include specific tactics and revenue goals for each opportunity. Travel to potential Government sites/customers to present products, review opportunities and develop new business. Be responsible for the identification of potential product development ideas as well as managing identifying and promoting new products that may be suitable within these markets.  Next Steps: We’re going to do our best to make sure you’re a good fit before we waste your time with a face-to-face interview. Yep, that means some online assessments and remote interviewing tools. Sound familiar? Then why haven’t you applied yet? Contact hr@strong-hold.com to apply or for more information.

Antenna is an integrated marketing and public relations firm with offices in New York, Chicago, San Francisco and New Jersey. We work with many innovative and socially responsible companies to help build their brands and grow their businesses. If you’re looking for a creative and collaborative environment that allows your voice to be heard and challenges you to grow, this position is for you.  Antenna is looking for a Marketing & Sales Manager to join our growing business development team. Working closely with the SVP of Strategy & Business Development and ecosystem leaders, the Marketing & Sales Manager will develop, coordinate, execute and manage internal marketing programs and support sales and proposal operations. Working closely with the executive team and subject-matter experts, s/he will play an important role in advancing key business growth objectives. This position will ideally be based out of our New York office but we’re open to other locations for the perfect candidate.  MARKETING RESPONSIBILITIES  (50%, 20-25 hours/week) Oversee the agency’s integrated marketing and thought leadership activities and content calendar, including the creation of content marketing pieces (i.e. blog posts, newsletters, eBooks, social media posts, contributed articles, speaking abstracts, award nominations, etc.) that are accurate, compelling and consistent with the agency’s messaging and value proposition.  Work closely with Antenna’s subject matter experts to gather information and ensure marketing programs are correctly represented and communicated to various audiences and stakeholders. Identify relevant industry events for Antenna to participate in and when relevant secure event media partnerships to increase brand awareness at events. Coordinate hosted events (virtual and eventually in-person) with industry and media influencers, including securing event speakers and partners, managing the event promotion, registrations and any staffing requirements, vendor coordination, venues, budgets, etc. Identify high-value speaking and award opportunities Analyze/measure the ROI from marketing activities and propose new creative ideas to improve marketing performance.  SALES RESPONSIBILITIES (50%, 20-25 hours/week) Coordinate and produce  accurate, engaging and compelling proposal content that showcases our firm’s differentiators and aligns with our business strategy for proposal responses. Facilitate the distribution, tracking and management of inquiries pertaining to RFPs. Collaborates with the team and other areas to ensure timely delivery of well-written, high-quality RFPs. Work closely with Antenna’s subject matter experts to outline and gather information and ensure programs and services are correctly represented and communicated to various audiences and stakeholders. Organize sales processes and sales/marketing collateral, maintains inventory of communications materials (i.e. proposal templates, capabilities presentations, case studies, work samples, etc.) and evaluates content relevance and use in proposals. Includes preparation of external presentations to prospects, partners, customers and others. As needed, collaborate with our design team to create compelling slides, graphics, charts, and tables for sales/marketing collateral. Work with the business development team to coordinate outbound campaigns (targeted outreach within specific markets and surrounding events); assist with coordinating market research, sales outreach, CRM data management and inbound sales appointments and follow-up.  Qualifications/ Requirements Highly motivated and intelligent self-starter with exceptional organization and project management skills. Experience/interest in Real Estate and/or Healthcare  Aptitude to competently manage multiple and diverse projects and use independent judgment on when and how to respond to shifting priorities and the unexpected. Excellent writing, editing, proofreading and oral communications skills with proven ability to analyze, organize and use complex information for multiple audiences across multiple mediums. Exercise good judgment and take initiative to complete projects in a timely manner, often under tight deadlines. Demonstrate excellent interpersonal skills, effective teamwork and service mentality. Understanding of marketing/sales processes and supporting communications materials (such as RFP responses, sales presentations, blogs, etc.). Ability to distill industry/subject matter-specific language into consumer-friendly language. Demonstrated ability to build relationships, both internal and external, to help achieve business outcomes. Proficiency with GSuite products, CRM tools, and social media platforms required. (Our sales/marketing team uses HubSpot, Asana, GSuite, ZoomInfo and WordPress) Experience in agency environments is a plus. Experience or familiarity with marketing/sales data/analytics tools, account-based sales/marketing methodology and/or Adobe Creative Suite is a plus.  Antenna Group is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, supportive and respectful environment.
industries: Marketing and Advertising and Public Relations and Communications

description: The Business Development Manager will be responsible for identifying and establishing new business relationships with customers and partners to drive company revenue. Relying on the extensive sales and payment industry experience, the Business Development Manager will work with ISV’s, prospects, merchants, system integrators and OEM clients to identify sales opportunities and partnerships that will drive the use of ID TECH products and technologies into key market segments. The Business Development Manager will possess partnership management, sales, and business development skills, as well as the technical depth to understand the needs of our partners and customers and then drive alignment with the Company’s objectives. The Business Development Manager will have direct revenue responsibility and geographical focus on the North American Region.  Responsibilities Delivers results by achieving or exceeding assigned sales targeted revenue daily, weekly, monthly and quarterly. Identifies, engages, and manages relationships with prospects to drive adoption of the Company’s products and solutions. Drives new design wins of the Company’s products for use in each of our market segments (retail, unattended, kiosk, POS, gaming, OEM, mobile payments & etc.). Proactive in prospecting and securing business from new customers Collaborates with engineering and product management teams to help define the right customer and partner solutions based on the Company’s technology. Be an industry expert on payment trends, EMV, P2PE, and how they create opportunities for the Company’s products and technologies. Responsible for contract negotiations, closing the sale for contract accounts. Responsible for establishing and executing to business development plan to drive incremental revenue for the company across all product lines Coordinates and assists in leading sales meetings to include site selection and agenda preparation. Keeps customers informed of new products, services and other general information of interest. Checks on competitive activity and develops new methods of attaining current and new customers. Performs other job-related duties and responsibilities as may be assigned from time to time.  **Must have 5+ years sales experience in payment industry.**

SUMMARY: This position is designed to achieve maximum sales potential throughout the Mid- South region by meeting or exceeding assigned sales goals and budgeted expenses. Market will initially include the states of GA, SC, TN, AL, MS. This position must uphold the integrity of the company by following its guidelines and meeting its expectations, goals, and mission. In working towards this, the sales manager will access company resources, tools and products and apply them to maximizing sales potential measured by the region.  Essential Duties And Responsibilities Achieve budgeted sales goals for the region. Setting and communicating monthly depletion targets and programming calendars with wholesalers. Maximize sales potential measured by budget and by percentage of wines sold in that region. Set goals, oversee activities, review performance and provide direction for one district manager in the territory. With distributor, increase market demand and acceptance through targeting and opening of new accounts, increasing sales to existing accounts, and development of account bases and working on top accounts in each market. Be alert to distributor trends in the market. Become an active member of the wine community through frequent and positive interaction with the rest of the industry and key wholesaler personnel. Work with the Southeast Director of Sales to develop and implement specific strategies in each market. Recommend and implement decisions based on results of analysis that enhance the equity of the brand based on results of analysis. Recommend and substantiate budgeting needs, sales tactics and strategies. Recommend and substantiate budgeting needs, sales tactics and strategies, appropriate size of account base, pricing, on/off mix, etc. Proficient with all mechanics of DWC allocations, shipping, computer software, and philosophy. Create and manage monthly regional operational and sales budget. Coach & develop District Manager(s) in the region. Qualification Requirements BA in Business or related field Minimum 4 years of sales experience in wine industry Excellent communication skills, both written and oral Good math skills Good computer skills Ability to travel up to 60% of the time

We’re transforming the software industry. With more than 50,000 customers across the world, we’re achieving that goal. But we know we can’t do any of that without our team.  Ready to help us re-imagine the industry during a time of substantial growth and ambitious plans? Come and see why we’re consistently recognized by Gartner, Forrester, and IDC as a category leader in the marketplace.   Flexera delivers Technology Value Optimization solutions that enable some of the largest companies in the world to inform their IT so they can transform their IT. From on-prem to the cloud, companies can get the IT asset data needed to rightsize, reallocate spend, reduce risk and maximize ROI.  The Role As a Territory Account Manager, you will meet/exceed assigned revenue goals working with a virtual team of Systems Engineers, Business Development, Channels, Marketing, and other members of your Flexera ecosystem, including Solution and Channel Partners. You will follow up on leads, perform deep discovery, use product demos for qualified customers and lead the technical validation process. You know how to work "smarter" not harder and drive standard methodologies to ensure success to win as a team. In addition, you will also successfully:  Responsibilities: Be responsible for the business by building and developing account relationships through personalized contact, understanding of account’s needs, and ability to effectively communicate the value of Flexera’s solutions Lead sales campaigns and motions that build customer value and enable multi-year, multi-solution transactions Accurately forecast opportunities based upon realistic assessments and consistently deliver against that forecast Support Channel Partners to create net new customer opportunities and upgrade/expansion opportunities in customer accounts  Requirements: 2+ years of experience in selling enterprise IT software solutions (asset management, cloud management, data analytics, security software, enterprise applications, business processing outsourcing, risk management software or networking performance) or 3-5 years in outside B2B sales or technology/business consulting Utilize a defined Sales Methodology (re: MEDDPICC, MEDDIC, Sandler, SPIN) for business needs/business pain understanding Successful experience running the entire sales cycle - direct responsibility for your own quota or have created new revenue streams with accounts Strong reputation of exceeding sales quota (top 20% in your sales organization) You have successfully owned and led the end-to-end sales process (this is not an overlay or team quota) Consultative sales experience targeting relevant companies/businesses to drive cost savings and efficiencies throughout their IT organization Successful in finding and uncovering opportunities with net new and existing accounts, via creative prospecting tactics and hunting activities Consistent track record of using a repeatable sales process for successful deal Finding, Engaging, Running & Closing Highly motivated and professional, with excellent verbal communication, presentation, and social skills A rational, logical, and analytical thinker You have shown strong technical aptitude and are passionate about technology sales CRM system (Salesforce.com); experience working with Word, Excel, Powerpoint Excellent listening skills with the attested ability to prioritize and complete multiple tasks to meet deadlines Self-starter able to work independently but also a giving member of a team Willingness and desire to learn new things and ways to be more efficient and effective Excellent conflict resolution skills Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent experience

jobTitle: National Accounts Sales Mgr On Premise
description: A National Account Sales Manager ONP is responsible building a trusted advisor relationship, adopting best-in-industry practices, and aligning key On Premise National Account needs with Andrews' strategic priorities. The On Premise National Account Sales Manager will drive results by ensuring resources are optimized and focused on profit driven activities while supporting company goals and strategies. This position is part of the On Premise Sales team.  WORK TASKS  Role  A National Account Sales Manager ONP can be expected to perform the following tasks in this role as a routine part of their job Directs the implementation activities of the On Premise National Account/Chain Managers to ensure chain programming is efficiently and effectively executed. Inspects the accounts to make sure standards are met and provides real time coaching in the market to the Andrews team. Develops sales and marketing plans that meet the Retailer's and Andrews' strategic initiative priorities. Documents and communicates On Premise National Account mandates and operations to ensure compliance and understanding. Negotiates with On Premise National Accounts' buyers to sell in new products and increase distribution of Andrews' brands and new packages. Develops and delivers detailed, professional sales presentations to assigned On Premise National Accounts' buyers and leadership and to the sales teams during weekly sales meetings as requested by the sales leaders. Acts as liaison between Andrews and On Premise National Accounts' management to troubleshoot and problem solve as needed; develops and implements solutions to prevent reoccurrence. Collaborates with Marketing Services to develop and administer a mobile communication plan for On Premise National Accounts' programs to sales teams. This list is not all inclusive of other tasks and subtasks that may be necessary in performing this role, but rather an overview of the role's primary work tasks.  Capabilities  A National Account Sales Manager ONP has a greater opportunity to succeed if they can develop and master the following job related capabilities and KSAs:  KNOWLEDGE Andrews Portfolio and DISC Beer and Distribution Industry Brewing Process Category Management/Space Management Competitive Portfolios DFW Market Insight Merchandising Literacy Model Market Concepts National Accounts Business and Data P2EP process Pricing Management Quality Standards Selling Principles Supplier Expertise TABC Guidelines Skills & Abilities Ability to Build Trust Ability to Influence Others Ability to Solve Problems and Develop Potential Solutions Analytical Thinking and Problem Solving Skills Coaching, Training and Mentoring Skills Communication and Interpersonal Skills Negotiation Skills Presentation and Facilitation Skills Strategic Thinking Skills Technical Aptitude/Computer/iPad Skills Time Management and Prioritization Skills Qualifications  The National Account Sales Manager ONP is to produce a deliverable or outcomes measured by a specific metric in order to achieve success:  Required One to Three Years On Premise National Account/Chain Management Experience Previous Beer/Beverage Industry and Distribution Business Experience Strong Relationship Building and Communication Skills Strong Financial and Business Acumen Preferred Bachelor's Degree in Sales, Marketing, Business or Other Related Field Previous Coaching/Team Management Experience Physical Requirements & Essential Skills Ability to maintain a sustained posture in a seated position for prolonged periods of time and operate computer equipment. Ability to bend, stoop, and twist is required for filing and general office duties. Requires intermittent periods during which continuous physical exertion is required, such as standing, walking, stooping, climbing, lifting material or equipment, some of which maybe heavy or awkward. Exerts up to 55 lbs of force occasionally and/or negligible amount frequently to move office-related items or materials. Ability to use a personal computer for tasks such as communicating via email, preparing reports and other forms of documentation using company and industry software. Ability to speak, hear, and see is required to communicate with employees, and to operate computers and office machinery. Hand-eye coordination and fine manipulation skills are necessary to operate computers and various office equipment. Continual hand/wrist motion is required to operate computers and office machinery. Driving may be required during the workday. Must tolerate working in an environment with inside/outside ambient/extreme temperatures. Ability to perform job functions in compliance with company policies and procedures, including safety policies and best practices. Must be able to maintain a current/valid Texas driver's license. Must maintain regular and punctual attendance. Please note -we ask all candidates to create an account in order to apply for a position with us. Please click "Apply" then "Create Account" to create a new account, or sign in if you are a returning applicant.

Freshworks provides intelligent customer engagement software for businesses of all sizes, making it easy for teams to win customers for life. More than 50,000 businesses trust Freshworks, including our employee engagement, customer engagement and CRM solutions, to better support employees so businesses can increase customer satisfaction and lifetime value. Headquartered in San Mateo, California, Freshworks has a dedicated global team operating from 13 locations to serve our customers throughout the world. Freshworks is backed by leading investors including Accel, CapitalG, Sequoia Capital and Tiger Global Management.  The Senior Channel Account Executive role will be responsible for enabling and managing the GSI partnerships within our North America channel organization. This is a quota quarrying sales role. This role reports into the Manager, North America Channels, and will interface with the North American Freshworks sales and pre-sales teams and the India-based Partner organization to ensure business and technical goals are aligned to partner offerings. The role will need to develop required partner relationships, create a robust engagement cadence and drive indirect and influence revenue outcomes.  Your Role and Responsibilities: Lead GTM with big GSI partners Manage all aspects of partnerships, including owning partner relations, ensuring partner success, exploring new partnership opportunities and executing marketing and sales campaigns Represent partners internally and Freshworks externally at senior levels  Our Perfect Match: 5+ years of sales/ channel sales experience Track record of managing and developing direct or indirect pipeline and exceed sales quota Bachelor’s degree required Ability to think strategically and manage complex projects and partnerships Detail-oriented with strong project management and organizational skills, but comfortable with ambiguity and adept at solving problems creatively Passion for technology and for pushing new concepts, products and services Global mindset, flexible work style and comfort with ambiguity A strong bias toward collaboration and ability to work effectively in a cross-functional & dispersed team A sense of humor  Comfortable in a fast-paced, global team  Summary of Freshworks Benefits: Multiple options for dental, medical, vision, disability and life insurances, equity options, flexible time off + paid vacation, commuter benefits, work from home spending, and wellness benefits are also offered. Freshworks also offers adoption and parental leave benefits.  At Freshworks, we are creating a global workplace that enables everyone to find their true potential, purpose, and passion irrespective of their background, gender, race, sexual orientation, religion and ethnicity. We are committed to providing equal opportunity for all and believe that diversity in the workplace creates a more vibrant, richer work environment that advances the goals of our employees, communities and the business.

description: Bodhala is the leading legal spend management platform founded to provide in-house counsel and their legal operations teams with spend optimization solutions and real-time market intelligence. Bodhala’s platform applies data science, machine-learning, and AI to help companies find the right lawyer, at the right firm, for the right price. Founded by attorneys, the company serves customers across the Fortune 500 and critical services economy industries. Bodhala was recently named One to Watch in Legal Technology by the Financial Times and Legal Tech Innovation of 2020 by Legal Tech Breakthrough Awards.  Now part of the Onit family (www.onit.com) and headquartered in New York City, we’re looking for a Sales Development Team Lead who is inspired by what we’re doing and eager to join us at this exciting stage in our growth. In this role, you will partner with the sales and marketing teams to create new sales opportunities via outbound phone, email and LinkedIn prospecting as well as follow up and qualify inbound leads. You will also lead the small, but growing SDR team and are comfortable in a player/coach role to start. Our ideal candidates will have a history of success in a sales-first organization, and be motivated to advance their career in a fast-paced, innovative and rapidly growing company  Overall, your role will involve: Leading the entire new business prospecting team in a player / coach role to start. Meeting or exceeding quarterly and annual activity and pipeline creation targets both individually and for your team. Constantly working to improve our prospecting efficiency and processes. Working collaboratively with our Account Executives to build and execute on territory plans. Partnering with your Marketing colleagues across the Onit family in the timely follow-up of leads, the transition to opportunities process and provide timely feedback. Mastering of the Bodhala platform and value proposition. Rigorous and diligent use of our sales and prospecting tools (salesforce, GONG, Salesloft, Zoominfo, LinkedIn) to manage and grow your pipeline.  What You Offer Bodhala: You are energized by the hunt for new opportunities and are eager to talk to new prospects. You’re a trusted advisor who can build strong relationships with customers and colleagues. You have demonstrated success in high-volume, yet strategic prospecting and pipeline creation and have a history of meeting your activity and pipeline goals. You have a natural intellectual curiosity, a willingness to try new things and a personal commitment to continuous learning and improvement. You’re adaptable and accountable. You understand that growth - stage companies are constantly evolving and you always do what you say you’re going to do. You’re driven by competition but never at the expense of your team. You seek out opportunities to collaborate.  What We Offer You: Highly competitive base salary and a generous commission structure. The opportunity to progress from a player / coach to a full-time leadership position. Best-in-class health, dental and vision coverage, a 401K match program, a generous parental leave policy, fitness subsidies and more. A commitment to constant learning and career growth. We're mission-driven and motivated by success, but we’re friendly, collaborative and supportive of each other. A large and growing market to prospect into. The ability to work remotely from anywhere in the US.  We value inclusiveness and diversity and are an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability status. We encourage all suitable candidates to apply.

The CRM Manager will leverage their client relations and analytical expertise in driving HQ CRM strategies on the local level. Ensuring the effective application of Corporate CRM contact strategies and activities; customer database policy; customer data analysis and market analysis; continuously cooperating and providing regular support to key stakeholders: HQ CRM, Regional Director, Marketing & Communication Local, Retail/Commercial and Local Stores.  Responsibilities will include - Customer Database • Guarantee the proper Data Collection Process and the DB Management • Guarantee the proper privacy management • Guarantee the proper CRM systems and tools management • Ensure proper data maintenance and cleansing in the system • Develop and execute all components of Customer Loyalty program and measure effectiveness  Analytics and Reporting • Provide Regional HQ and CRM HQ with valuable analytics to support business planning • Develop quarterly and annual CRM reviews to share critical campaign effectiveness with key stakeholders • Provide HQ CRM with valuable insights on reporting evidences • Get aligned with periodical updates coming from HQ on CRM reporting • Engage stores in regular use of CRM reporting available at store level • Discuss reporting and CRM performance with the stores   CRM Intelligence • Collect data and information with respect to CRM practices out of Valentino (wholesale and competitive landscape)  Contact Strategy & Retail Marketing Plan Develop and manage HQ CRM guidelines and activities at the local level in alignment with HQ CRM. Collect, develop, and manage local ideas/needs to be shared with the HQ CRM Department. Loyalty program initiatives. Institutional and event gifting. In store tools and CRM updates. In partnership with HQ – develop and execute data-driven, omni-touch point CRM strategies to drive sales & loyalty. Define key client segments for improved targeting and CRM program effectiveness. Manage budget related to CRM activities and measure ROI of each initiative. Ensure regular upload of retail marketing campaigns into the CRM system, according to HQ CRM guidelines.   Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree Min 7 years direct experience in client, VIC, client relations management Experience in luxury retail highly preferred Excellent Organizational and Follow up and time management skills Demonstrates confidence and ability to develop relationships Clear and concise communication skills – verbal and written Strong time management and follow through skills Prioritizes tasks effectively; Superior attention to detail under strict deadlines Must have experience with Business Intelligence software (Tableau, Sales Force) Proficient computer skills (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint)

description: ADP is hiring a Sales Representative, Mid-Sized Accounts. Are you ready to control your financial future with unlimited upside earnings potential?  Do you want a lasting career with a company that offers autonomy to run a book of business, flexibility to make your own schedule, and gives you work-life balance?  Are you looking for continuous learning and the opportunity to invest in yourself?  If so, then this may be just the opportunity you've been searching for. Read on and decide for yourself.  In this role, you will sell human resources technology within a designated geographic territory to cultivate new business opportunities and drive strategic discussions around Human Capital Management (HCM) initiatives for companies with 50 – 999 employees. You will manage complete sales cycles, sell ADP's suite of solutions (40+ products and services) to executives, and accurately forecast your sales pipeline. ADP is here to support you and your goals with continuous sales training and the latest technology to set you up for success as you manage your book of business. You'll spend most of your time doing what you do best – selling in the field. But that's not all. You'll also document and manage multiple sales cycles, sticking with the process through implementation until your new business is up and running on the solutions you sell. As you see more and more deals cross the finish line, you'll reap the rewards with industry-leading compensation, benefits, luxurious incentive trips, and awards. As you strive to grow your career, leaders will back your desire to pursue advancement and provide continual sales training. A little about ADP: We are a global leader in human resources technology, offering the latest AI and machine learning-enhanced payroll, tax, human resources, benefits, and much more. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating an inclusive, down-to-earth culture that welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition as a global Best Places to Work and a recipient of many prestigious awards for diversity, equity, and inclusion, including a DiversityInc® Top 50 Company, Best CEO and company for women, LGBTQ+, multicultural talent, and more. As part of our deep DEI commitment, our CEO has joined the OneTen coalition to create one million jobs for Black Americans over the next ten years. Learn more about DEI at ADP on our YouTube channel: http://adp.careers/DEI_Videos  Ready to #MakeYourMark? Apply now! To learn more about Sales at ADP, visit https://jobs.adp.com/teams-roles/sales/  What you'll do: Responsibilities Grow Our Business While Growing Yours. You will work independently and collaboratively as part of various teams within your assigned geography to close sales, win business, and reach sales goals. Turn Prospects into Loyal Clients and Raving Fans. You will implement a sales strategy targeted to decision-makers and business owners to build a network and capture new business. Deepen Relationships Across the ADP Family. In addition to selling cloud-based human resources solutions, you will strategically cultivate additional business within existing accounts. But it's not all business; you will make life-long friendships here. Collaborate Daily. You will serve as a trusted advisor, partner, and ADP ambassador to your clients, internal partners, and overall network while demonstrating grace under pressure and the highest ethical standards.  TO SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE: Required Qualifications ·      Proven Winner. You have an impressive track record of closing sales, winning clients, and managing a territory. Positive Self-Starter. You have an upbeat, persistent style and the ability to cold call, manage your time well, and can present your ideas in a clear professional manner on paper, in-person, and over the phone. Confidently Fearless. You embrace opportunities, take risks, and challenge the status quo. Entrepreneurial Spirit. You're a natural leader, resourceful, thrive under pressure, and bounce back quickly. Trusted Advisor. You build relationships, live integrity, and deliver on promises…every time.  A college degree is great but not required. What's more important is having the skills to do the job. If you don't have a college degree, other acceptable experience could include: Two+ years of quota-carrying, outside business-to-business sales experience Three+ years of relevant experience in HCM, technology, business equipment, uniform, or software sales Prior military experience that focused on teamwork, resilience, negotiation, trust-building, and a "never lose" mentality earned as part of the military to build relationships, impact businesses for the better, and achieve success.  Bonus points for these: Preferred Qualifications ·      Ability to successfully build a network and effectively use social media for sales  YOU'LL LOVE WORKING HERE BECAUSE YOU CAN: ·      Be yourself in a culture that values equity, inclusion, and belonging and creates a safe space for diverse perspectives and insights. ·      Belong by joining one of nine Business Resource Groups where you can connect globally with networks and allies who share common interests and experiences. ·      Grow your career in an agile, fast-paced environment means plenty of opportunities to progress. ·      Continuously learn. Ongoing training, development, and mentorship opportunities for even the most insatiable learner. ·      Be your healthiest. Best-in-class benefits start on Day 1 because healthy associates are happy ones. ·      Balance work and life. Resources and flexibility to more easily integrate your work and your life. ·      Focus on your mental health and well-being. We're here to provide exceptional service to our clients, and none of that happens without each of us taking care of ourselves and being there for one another. ·      Join a company committed to giving back and generating a lasting, positive impact upon the communities in which we work and live.  ·      Get paid to pay it forward. Company-paid time off for volunteering for causes you care about.   What are you waiting for? Apply today!  Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP: ADP affirms that inequality is detrimental to our associates, our clients, and the communities we serve. Our goal is to impact lasting change through our actions. Together, we unite for equality and equity. ADP is committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic, including race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, or protected veteran status and will not discriminate against anyone on the basis of a disability. We support an inclusive workplace where associates excel based on personal merit, qualifications, experience, ability, and job performance.  Ethics at ADP: ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. Click https://jobs.adp.com/life-at-adp/ to learn more about ADP's culture and our full set of values.

What we're looking for  We’re building a team of Field Sales Managers across the Country to join our growing Sales Enablement Team. In this role, you will directly impact the success of JUST Egg through driving sales growth, building market share and increasing brand awareness across your region.  You will be responsible for maintaining deep local knowledge of our distribution, developing collaborative and effective relationships with customers, brokers and distributors and identifying market specific growth opportunities and executing a sales strategy to capitalize on them.  Ideal candidates will be mission-aligned and proactive self-starters with a minimum of 2 years of experience in Foodservice sales and local management of brokers and distributors in your respective region.  What You'll Do Utilize your field sales experience in the Foodservice channel to rapidly expand distribution and sales of JUST Egg within your region; Develop new business across your Region by identifying target operator accounts, introducing them to JUST Egg, performing product tastings as appropriate, supporting custom menu ideations and executing collaborative launch plans.. Build long-term relationships with key regional and local chain accounts, brokers, and distributors; Collaborate with the Sales Enablement Director, your peers, our Distribution partner (Michael Foods) to implement the Foodservice sales strategy for the region across multiple categories; Create and manage the sales forecast for your region; Review sales reporting from brokers, ensuring accuracy and providing monthly summaries to internal and external stakeholders; Facilitate product training for broker and distributor teams and solicit feedback from trainings/meetings in order to incorporate changes that improve the quality and relevance of each training session and associated selling materials; Make weekly sales calls on target accounts within your region and participate in sales calls as a brand ambassador alongside brokers and distributors; Develop a deep understanding of our product, mission and how we sell to effectively partner with broker and distributor teams and ensure they have the resources and support to rapidly increase our presence in the Foodservice channel;  What You'll Bring 2+ years of Foodservice sales at a company with high-brand awareness in respective geographic region; experience selling an innovative or plant-based product highly preferred; Excitement and passion for our mission and products; Clear, demonstrable understanding of go-to-market strategies within the greater Foodservice channel Local knowledge and proven experience working with distributors and brokers across your Region; Proven ability to develop and foster collaborative relationships with stakeholders across the business as well as external stakeholders such as customers, brokers and distributors; Effective time management and ability to work successfully in a remote work environment; Self-motivated and driven by your why, which aligns to our mission; Entrepreneurial spirit, you're comfortable with the inherent ambiguity in building a new role and you are energized by the process of building something impactful and lasting from the ground up; Ability to think strategically about your region as the expert in the market and ensure resources are leveraged to solidify success and generate positive ROI; Ability to pass a standard background check.  The perks Competitive pay and exceptional benefits 100% paid for medical, dental, and vision benefits (80% for dependents) as well as life, disability and a whole lot more Equity in our company Flexible PTO This is an opportunity to be a part of building a regional sales team from the ground up. This team and every Regional Manager on it will have a measurable impact on the success of our business. You will join a group of deeply experienced and effective sales leaders who think big, work collaboratively and move quickly. We're on a mission to do everything we possibly can, every single day, to increase the probability, that in our lifetime, there is a fair, honest and just food system in every community. We're proud of the impact we've had so far, but this is just the start.  Additional Information And Requirements This is a full-time regular 100% remote position, ideally based in Atlanta, GA reporting to our Headquarters in San Francisco, California. This role requires flexible and regular travel within your respective region. 75% of time will be traveling in local regions. Have a car to use in the performance of your duties; Valid driver’s license and meet Company’s Vehicle Policy which includes a good driving history. In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify their identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire.  Eat Just, Inc. and its subsidiaries participate in E-Verify and will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), with information from each new employees Form I-9 to confirm work authorization.  Who we are  Eat Just is a food technology company with a mission to build a healthier, safer and more sustainable food system in our lifetimes. The company's expertise, from functionalizing plant proteins to culturing animal cells, is powered by a world-class team of scientists and chefs spanning more than a dozen research disciplines. Eat Just created Americas fastest-growing egg brand, which is made entirely of plants, and the worlds first-to-market meat made from animal cells instead of slaughtered livestock. The company has been recognized as one of Fast Company's Most Innovative Companies, Entrepreneurs 100 Brilliant Companies, CNBCs Disruptor 50 and a World Economic Forum Technology Pioneer. JUST Egg has been named among Popular Sciences 100 Greatest Innovations and Fast Company's World Changing Ideas and the history-making debut of GOOD Meat was heralded as one of 2020's top scientific breakthroughs by The Guardian, Vox and WIRED.  For more information on JUST Egg, visit  For more information on GOOD Meat, visit

description: Roonyx is a fast-growing company that develops web and mobile software applications to customers worldwide. We are looking for a Senior Sales Manager for the US sales department. The key responsibilities are: Develop sales opportunities for driving revenue. Build long term relationships with key customers. Coordinate sales process between customers and internal team. Stay ahead of market trends. Required skills: B2B experience in a sales position in the IT industry. Fluent in English. Strong communication skills. Passion for closing sales deals. Result-driven and self-motivated. Problem solving attitude. We offer: 12 am to 9 pm flexible work schedule. Official employment. Fixed salary + bonuses based on the monthly results. Career opportunity growth. Family-like atmosphere. Work in the professional team of young and ambitious people. Ability to work remotely.

You will educate and skillfully guide customers through the Peloton buying experience while ensuring the highest level of quality, customer care, and integrity. You will also assist in educating SDRs and Seasonal AE’s with sales methodology and training. If escalations or issues occur the Inside Sales Supervisor will act as manager on duty during their respective shift. As an Inside Sales Supervisor, you will focus on achieving and exceeding sales goals which result from inbound lead generation and an existing customer database. You will educate and skillfully guide customers through the Peloton buying experience while ensuring the highest level of quality, customer care, and integrity. You will also assist in educating SDRs and Seasonal AE’s with sales methodology and training. If escalations or issues occur the Inside Sales Supervisor will act as manager on duty during their respective shift.  Responsibilities Continually assist in the development of team members across all areas of specialization and the sales experience while fostering a high level of engagement Coach team members on development plans and provide feedback on the coaching process for future enrollees Contribute to the development and facilitation of new hire training as well as assisting with onboarding Utilize KPI reporting to identify opportunities of team members and coach them towards achieving and exceeding team sales goals through excellent customer service and product knowledge Executes the Inside Sales methodology through meaningful customer interactions Develop and facilitate a mentorship program Lead team meetings to ensure team understanding of company initiatives as well as the team’s performance against KPI’s Come prepared to meetings with manager with areas of struggle, openness to accept feedback, and improve on leadership abilities Assist in Sales Technology adoption and usage across the team and serve as a subject matter expert Provide feedback on your team’s lead list by effectively utilizing Peloton CRM system (Salesforce) to track and monitor lead activity, lead dashboards and reports, call lists, and lead integrity to influence lead conversion Serve as product expert by providing up-to-date product information Achieve monthly, quarterly and annual team sales goals Actively monitor inbound sales phone calls Ensure all messages in the Supervisor channel are replied to in 2 mins or less. Reply to emails from the supervisor inbox on your scheduled day within 24 hours. Expedite resolution of advanced Member issues, reduce first reply time and full resolution time, actively monitor and address all escalations as needed. Help attract and maintain top talent by interviewing and hiring new Agents; oversee their development through evaluation and coaching to ensure continued growth and deeper skill sets Follow and assist with enforcement of all policies and procedures, including ROE, Chat & Call Engagement, Cadences, time keeping. Work with Inside Sales Leadership to create and execute a variable schedule strategy for the department which includes daily maintenance of individual rep time sheets. Working weekends/evenings is required Experience/Attributes Required Solid history of meeting and exceeding sales goals 1-2 year management experience of sales/revenue-generating team Self-motivated and driven individual - not satisfied with the status quo Positive and energetic phone skills, excellent listening skills and strong writing skills Time and sales pipeline management Proficiency with MS applications (Word, Excel, etc), Apple Products and CRM (Salesforce experience a plus) Strong strategic sales and coaching skills with the ability to assist/train to sales policies and processes Proactive, never fail attitude/ ability to work and motivate yourself independently while also working collaboratively and non-competitively with teammates Experience with lead qualification, objection handling, and closing new leads No previous performance management plan or written violation of policy in the last 6 six months About Peloton  Peloton uses technology + design to connect the world through fitness, empowering people to be the best version of themselves anywhere, anytime. We have reinvented the fitness industry by developing a first-of-its-kind subscription platform. Seamlessly combining hardware, software, and streaming technology, we create digital fitness and wellness content and products that Members love. In 2020 Peloton committed to becoming an antiracist organization with the launch of the Peloton Pledge. Learn more, here.  “Together We Go Far” means that we are greater than the sum of our parts, stronger collectively when each one of us is at our best. In order to be the best version of Peloton, we are deeply committed to building a diverse workforce and inclusive culture where all of our team members can be the best version of themselves. This work has no endpoint; it is the constant work of running an organization that strives to reach its full potential. As a first step in our commitment, we announced the Peloton Pledge to invest $100 million over the next four years to fight racial injustice and inequity in our world, and to promote health and wellbeing for all, from the inside out.  Peloton is an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive environment for all of our applicants. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. If you would like to request any accommodations from application through to interview, please email: applicantaccommodations@onepeloton.com  Please be aware that fictitious job openings, consulting engagements, solicitations, or employment offers may be circulated on the Internet in an attempt to obtain privileged information, or to induce you to pay a fee for services related to recruitment or training. Peloton does NOT charge any application, processing, or training fee at any stage of the recruitment or hiring process. All genuine job openings will be posted here on our careers page and all communications from the Peloton recruiting team and/or hiring managers will be from an @onepeloton.com email address.  If you have any doubts about the authenticity of an email, letter or telephone communication purportedly from, for, or on behalf of Peloton, please email applicantaccommodations@onepeloton.com before taking any further action in relation to the correspondence.  Peloton does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Agencies should not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Peloton employees or any other organization location. Peloton is not responsible for any agency fees related to unsolicited resumes.

We’re transforming the software industry. With more than 50,000 customers across the world, we’re achieving that goal. But we know we can’t do any of that without our team.  Ready to help us re-imagine the industry during a time of substantial growth and ambitious plans? Come and see why we’re consistently recognized by Gartner, Forrester, and IDC as a category leader in the marketplace.   Flexera delivers Technology Value Optimization solutions that enable some of the largest companies in the world to inform their IT so they can transform their IT. From on-prem to the cloud, companies can get the IT asset data needed to rightsize, reallocate spend, reduce risk and maximize ROI.  The Role As a Territory Account Manager, you will meet/exceed assigned revenue goals working with a virtual team of Systems Engineers, Business Development, Channels, Marketing, and other members of your Flexera ecosystem, including Solution and Channel Partners. You will follow up on leads, perform deep discovery, use product demos for qualified customers and lead the technical validation process. You know how to work "smarter" not harder and drive standard methodologies to ensure success to win as a team. In addition, you will also successfully:  Responsibilities: Be responsible for the business by building and developing account relationships through personalized contact, understanding of account’s needs, and ability to effectively communicate the value of Flexera’s solutions Lead sales campaigns and motions that build customer value and enable multi-year, multi-solution transactions Accurately forecast opportunities based upon realistic assessments and consistently deliver against that forecast Support Channel Partners to create net new customer opportunities and upgrade/expansion opportunities in customer accounts  Requirements: 2+ years of experience in selling enterprise IT software solutions (asset management, cloud management, data analytics, security software, enterprise applications, business processing outsourcing, risk management software or networking performance) or 3-5 years in outside B2B sales or technology/business consulting Utilize a defined Sales Methodology (re: MEDDPICC, MEDDIC, Sandler, SPIN) for business needs/business pain understanding Successful experience running the entire sales cycle - direct responsibility for your own quota or have created new revenue streams with accounts Strong reputation of exceeding sales quota (top 20% in your sales organization) You have successfully owned and led the end-to-end sales process (this is not an overlay or team quota) Consultative sales experience targeting relevant companies/businesses to drive cost savings and efficiencies throughout their IT organization Successful in finding and uncovering opportunities with net new and existing accounts, via creative prospecting tactics and hunting activities Consistent track record of using a repeatable sales process for successful deal Finding, Engaging, Running & Closing Highly motivated and professional, with excellent verbal communication, presentation, and social skills A rational, logical, and analytical thinker You have shown strong technical aptitude and are passionate about technology sales CRM system (Salesforce.com); experience working with Word, Excel, Powerpoint Excellent listening skills with the attested ability to prioritize and complete multiple tasks to meet deadlines Self-starter able to work independently but also a giving member of a team Willingness and desire to learn new things and ways to be more efficient and effective Excellent conflict resolution skills Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent experience

description: About Pinterest  Millions of people across the world come to Pinterest to find new ideas every day. It’s where they get inspiration, dream about new possibilities and plan for what matters most. Our mission is to help those people find their inspiration and create a life they love. In your role, you’ll be challenged to take on work that upholds this mission and pushes Pinterest forward. You’ll grow as a person and leader in your field, all the while helping Pinners make their lives better in the positive corner of the internet.  Great brands help make those inspirations a reality and we're looking for a self-driven Account Manager to help our most strategic partners, successfully grow their business through Pinterest. You'll work directly with advertisers as a trusted consultant to their business. Your strategic advice & coaching is core to the value we bring as a platform. If this sounds like fun, we’d love to hear from you!  What You’ll Do Retain, grow and diversify the value delivered to our partners ultimately growing Pinterest revenue as a result. Build and maintain strong relationships with partners’ teams (executive, operational, creative, measurement and agency), resulting in trusted advisorship Advocate internally for the solutions required to drive business outcomes for these advertisers, working across internal teams such as Measurement & Insights, Product Marketing, Creative Strategy, etc. Gain a deep understanding of our partners’ business goals and turn data into compelling stories and actionable insights to help them succeed Specifically own the “how” conversation with advertisers to advise on media strategies across targeting, bidding models, creative, measurement, etc. What We’re Looking For Digital advertising sales experience, managing high value relationships, driving strategic learning agendas and owning client communication Track record of compelling data-backed storytelling and recommendations Expert in managing forecasts and achieving goals Strong communication skills in person, on the phone, and through email A team player who’s able to work in a fast-paced environment with technical and non-technical teams

description: About Huckleberry Huckleberry is rebuilding small business insurance from the ground up. In a multi-trillion dollar industry where paper forms and fax machines still predominate, and customers are wasting countless hours navigating byzantine processes, we provide small business owners with the capability to manage all of their insurance needs through a single, elegant interface. Our team is rethinking every aspect of the experience, from pricing, to underwriting to claims. We're backed by Tribe Capital, Uncork Capital, Crosslink Capital, e.ventures, Postmates CEO Bastian Lehman, Apartment List CEO John Kobs, and several others.  The Role Huckleberry is looking for a Sales Manager to lead our growing team of Client Advisors. This role is a critical member of Sales Leadership at Huckleberry, and will be responsible for coaching and motivating team members to best serve our customers and drive the profitability and growth of our business. The best person for the role will have a passion for developing talent through constructive, actionable feedback. In addition to leading the sales team, this person will contribute strategic ideas for process improvement and a best in class customer experience as our business evolves and grows.  Please note this role is: Full Time On-site/in office Reports to VP of Revenue  Responsibilities Work with the VP of Revenue to set daily, weekly, and monthly targets for the sales team.  Drive execution of key sales metrics through coaching and motivating team members.  Identify and recommend solutions to issues related to lead conversion, team capacity, and service levels.  Regularly communicate sales performance cross functionally.  Lead onboarding, training, and continued education/development of new and existing sales team members.  Leverage team and company values to reward and continuously develop team members.   Requirements Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience 3+ years of progressive sales experience, 1+ years in a sales management/leadership role Strong verbal and written communication skills Ability to train others in skill areas such as persuasion, negotiation, customer service, objection handling, etc.  Exemplary leadership capabilities - demonstrated experience giving constructive feedback, navigating tough conversations, and supporting the development of individual contributors  Strategic thinker with the ability to zoom out and zoom in to solve problems at various levels Data driven decision maker  Passion for building a best in class sales team and creating an amazing customer experience  Why you’ll love working at Huckleberry:  Comprehensive medical, dental and vision insurance with 95% of premiums paid for by Huckleberry Flexible Spending Account and 401k Commuter benefits Paid maternity and paternity leave Company-sponsored happy hours and outings

description: ADP is hiring a Sales Representative, Mid-Sized Accounts. Are you ready to control your financial future with unlimited upside earnings potential?  Do you want a lasting career with a company that offers autonomy to run a book of business, flexibility to make your own schedule, and gives you work-life balance?  Are you looking for continuous learning and the opportunity to invest in yourself?  If so, then this may be just the opportunity you've been searching for. Read on and decide for yourself.  In this role, you will sell human resources technology within a designated geographic territory to cultivate new business opportunities and drive strategic discussions around Human Capital Management (HCM) initiatives for companies with 50 – 999 employees. You will manage complete sales cycles, sell ADP's suite of solutions (40+ products and services) to executives, and accurately forecast your sales pipeline. ADP is here to support you and your goals with continuous sales training and the latest technology to set you up for success as you manage your book of business. You'll spend most of your time doing what you do best – selling in the field. But that's not all. You'll also document and manage multiple sales cycles, sticking with the process through implementation until your new business is up and running on the solutions you sell. As you see more and more deals cross the finish line, you'll reap the rewards with industry-leading compensation, benefits, luxurious incentive trips, and awards. As you strive to grow your career, leaders will back your desire to pursue advancement and provide continual sales training. A little about ADP: We are a global leader in human resources technology, offering the latest AI and machine learning-enhanced payroll, tax, human resources, benefits, and much more. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating an inclusive, down-to-earth culture that welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition as a global Best Places to Work and a recipient of many prestigious awards for diversity, equity, and inclusion, including a DiversityInc® Top 50 Company, Best CEO and company for women, LGBTQ+, multicultural talent, and more. As part of our deep DEI commitment, our CEO has joined the OneTen coalition to create one million jobs for Black Americans over the next ten years. Learn more about DEI at ADP on our YouTube channel: http://adp.careers/DEI_Videos  Ready to #MakeYourMark? Apply now! To learn more about Sales at ADP, visit https://jobs.adp.com/teams-roles/sales/  What you'll do: Responsibilities Grow Our Business While Growing Yours. You will work independently and collaboratively as part of various teams within your assigned geography to close sales, win business, and reach sales goals. Turn Prospects into Loyal Clients and Raving Fans. You will implement a sales strategy targeted to decision-makers and business owners to build a network and capture new business. Deepen Relationships Across the ADP Family. In addition to selling cloud-based human resources solutions, you will strategically cultivate additional business within existing accounts. But it's not all business; you will make life-long friendships here. Collaborate Daily. You will serve as a trusted advisor, partner, and ADP ambassador to your clients, internal partners, and overall network while demonstrating grace under pressure and the highest ethical standards.  TO SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE: Required Qualifications ·      Proven Winner. You have an impressive track record of closing sales, winning clients, and managing a territory. Positive Self-Starter. You have an upbeat, persistent style and the ability to cold call, manage your time well, and can present your ideas in a clear professional manner on paper, in-person, and over the phone. Confidently Fearless. You embrace opportunities, take risks, and challenge the status quo. Entrepreneurial Spirit. You're a natural leader, resourceful, thrive under pressure, and bounce back quickly. Trusted Advisor. You build relationships, live integrity, and deliver on promises…every time.  A college degree is great but not required. What's more important is having the skills to do the job. If you don't have a college degree, other acceptable experience could include: Two+ years of quota-carrying, outside business-to-business sales experience Three+ years of relevant experience in HCM, technology, business equipment, uniform, or software sales Prior military experience that focused on teamwork, resilience, negotiation, trust-building, and a "never lose" mentality earned as part of the military to build relationships, impact businesses for the better, and achieve success.  Bonus points for these: Preferred Qualifications ·      Ability to successfully build a network and effectively use social media for sales  YOU'LL LOVE WORKING HERE BECAUSE YOU CAN: ·      Be yourself in a culture that values equity, inclusion, and belonging and creates a safe space for diverse perspectives and insights. ·      Belong by joining one of nine Business Resource Groups where you can connect globally with networks and allies who share common interests and experiences. ·      Grow your career in an agile, fast-paced environment means plenty of opportunities to progress. ·      Continuously learn. Ongoing training, development, and mentorship opportunities for even the most insatiable learner. ·      Be your healthiest. Best-in-class benefits start on Day 1 because healthy associates are happy ones. ·      Balance work and life. Resources and flexibility to more easily integrate your work and your life. ·      Focus on your mental health and well-being. We're here to provide exceptional service to our clients, and none of that happens without each of us taking care of ourselves and being there for one another. ·      Join a company committed to giving back and generating a lasting, positive impact upon the communities in which we work and live.  ·      Get paid to pay it forward. Company-paid time off for volunteering for causes you care about.   What are you waiting for? Apply today!  Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP: ADP affirms that inequality is detrimental to our associates, our clients, and the communities we serve. Our goal is to impact lasting change through our actions. Together, we unite for equality and equity. ADP is committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic, including race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, or protected veteran status and will not discriminate against anyone on the basis of a disability. We support an inclusive workplace where associates excel based on personal merit, qualifications, experience, ability, and job performance.  Ethics at ADP: ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. Click https://jobs.adp.com/life-at-adp/ to learn more about ADP's culture and our full set of values.

Company Description  Medable's mission is to get effective therapies to patients faster. We provide an end-to-end, cloud-based platform with a flexible suite of tools that allows patients, healthcare providers, clinical research organizations and pharmaceutical sponsors to work together as a team in clinical trials. Our solutions enable more efficient clinical research, more effective healthcare delivery, and more accurate precision and predictive medicine. Our target audiences are patients, providers, principal investigators, and innovators who work in healthcare and life sciences.  Our vision is to accelerate the path to human discovery and medical cures. We are passionate about driving innovation and empowering consumers. We are proactive, collaborative, self-motivated learners, committed, bold and tenacious. We are dedicated to making this world a healthier place.  Job Description Proactively monitors and strives to maintain high levels of quality, accuracy, and process consistency in the sales organization’s planning efforts. As needed, coordinates planning activities with other functions and stakeholders within the firm Develops operational planning including quota/ target assignment, account assignment, territory creation, and headcount planning Assist with the annual budget, quarterly forecast, and long-term strategic planning processes for the Company Coordinates sales forecasting, planning, and budgeting processes used within the sales organization Builds and refines detailed financial models that forecast and analyze functional costs in order to fully understand sources of variance and, ultimately, improve forecast accuracy Partners with the Commercial Leadership Team for cost management with an emphasis in headcount management. Prepares monthly and quarterly management reporting Develops key performance metrics to measure the activities that have the most significant impact on sales productivity Analyzes financial results, distill/synthesize key trends, assess current and future business risk Works closely with Accounting team in monthly close process to ensure timeliness and accuracy of Commercial-related accounting entries Work with Financial, Planning & Analysis team to develop compelling compensation plans to drive the desired behavior from the Commercial Team Participates in new Commercial and FP&A initiatives, including ad hoc analysis and process improvement Proactively identifies opportunities for sales process improvement Works closely with sales management to inspect sales process quality, identify and prioritize opportunities for improvement; assist with understanding process bottlenecks and inconsistencies and facilitate continuous process improvement Implements enabling technologies, including CRM, to field sales team and monitors the assigned sales organization’s compliance with required standards for maintaining CRM data Provides assistance and input in the development and administration of sales training and incentive compensation programs. Develops and implements Commercial Training programs to ensure a highly functioning Commercial organization Other duties as assigned Qualifications  Required Qualifications: Strong financial and operational planning skills Microsoft Office/G-Suite with advanced skills Excellent communication skills (written and verbal) with experience developing and delivering presentations Ability to multitask effectively, working in team environments or independently Flexibility and adaptability to shifting priorities - we are a startup and growing fast Knowledge of sales quota, territories, coverage model, and commissions Knowledge of Sales and applicable key metrics – ARR, MRR, CAC, Churn, LTV, Pipeline Experience with financial systems- NetSuite, Salesforce, Adaptive insights, etc. SaaS experience strongly preferred 5-7+ years of relevant work experience in Commercial/Finance, preferably in high-growth companies in the Clinical Trials or Technology sectors Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting or a related field Additional Information  Travel: As required  Medable, Inc provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.  This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
