description: Careers that Change Lives  To grow Medtronic’s Cardiac Diagnostics business through sales of the Reveal LINQ™ Mobile Cardiac Telemetry System to Electrophysiologists, Implanting Cardiologists and targeted General Cardiologists. Additionally, focus on market development to referring physicians with a primary focus on disease states such as cryptogenic stroke, syncope and atrial fibrillation.  Collaborate effectively with the CRDM and CVG field teams to implement the Diagnostics strategies and ensure flawless execution with our customers.  We seek candidates who will exceed our customer expectations by striving without reserve for the greatest possible reliability and quality in our products, processes and systems and ensure patients are best served.  A Day in the Life Conduct sales calls to promote and sell Medtronic’s Diagnostic products and services to existing and competitive customers Partner with the CRDM and CVG sales teams for coordination and the execution of plans to fully leverage our diagnostics and monitoring capabilities Fully support and execute the Diagnostics launch and sales strategies. Work closely with CRDM to optimize the customer experience and ensure a “low service” model is achieved Implement quarterly sales strategies and achieve revenue, implant and prescription goals Call on referral physicians to include Neurologists and Cardiologists to promote our Diagnostics tools and expand access to appropriate patients who could benefit Capitalize on all field tools to include salesforce.com to best manage territory business and account planning Provide ongoing field intelligence and be “current” on competitive activity, changes in markets, distribution, and pricing, as well as provide input on customer experience. Cost-effectively manage time and assets, including travel and expense budget Effectively utilize sales collateral, educational programs and other marketing tools to best educate our physicians on the benefits of LINQ. Maintain high level knowledge of diverse the CRDM and CVG portfolio Train and educate both existing and competitive customers on our Diagnostic tools Maintain expert level of Diagnostics product knowledge Advise customers on a continuing basis regarding performance of our products and communicate relevant clinical information Must Have: Minimum Requirements  IN ORDER TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THIS POSITION, THE FOLLOWING BASIC QUALIFICATIONS MUST BE EVIDENT ON YOUR RESUME Bachelor's degree 5 years medical industry sales experience (selling physician preference products) in hospital environment with 3 years selling implantable CRM products Nice to Have  Preference will be given to local qualified candidates and candidates with Medtronic experience 5+ years medical sales experience in hospital environment selling to interventional cardiologists/electrophysiologists/cardiothoracic surgeons Experience selling and servicing diagnostic and/or monitoring devices Ability to teach and educate medical personnel, peers and technical support personnel Computer literacy Available/willing to work/travel weekends and evenings Physical Job Requirements The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer, and communicate with peers and co-workers. Must have a valid driver's license and active vehicle insurance policy. In addition, your driving record will be reviewed and will be considered as part of your application Ability to travel extensively with ease (approx. 10% of time) Must be able to drive approximately 80% of the time within assigned territory Environmental exposure to infectious disease and radiation About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.  Additional Information Posting Date: Oct 5, 2021 Travel: No
industries: Medical Devices, Hospital & Health Care, and Pharmaceuticals

description: Interlocken Resort  The Four-Diamond, award-winning Omni Interlocken Resort welcomes you to a retreat into modern luxury. Nestled against the backdrop of the Rocky Mountains, this year-round Colorado resort near Denver offers a wealth of on-site amenities. With its stunning panoramic views of the mountains or valley, unmatched luxuries and the essence of snow-capped mountain tranquility, the Omni Interlocken Resort is sure to sweep you off your feet.  The Omni Interlocken Resort’s associates enjoy a dynamic and exciting work environment, comprehensive training and mentoring, along with the pride that comes from working for a company with a reputation for exceptional service. We embody a culture of respect, gratitude and empowerment day in and day out. If you are a friendly, motivated person, with a passion to serve others, the Omni Interlocken Resort may be your perfect match.  Typically with a minimum of 5 years of selling experience, this individual will market the Hotel’s services locally and nationally to complex large market hotel accounts; to build guest relationships and business opportunities for the Hotel by interacting with current, future, and prospective guests; to develop a network of guest opportunities for future Hotel business and to interact with prospective guests and negotiate guest contracts for Hotel rooms, F&B services, meeting services, catering services, events, and convention services, in coordination with Catering, Sales, Conference Services, and Reservation Sales Departments; to maximize revenues for the Hotel; to maintain positive and productive interdepartmental communications; and to effectively control and minimize all marketing expenses while exceeding overall budgeted revenues and occupancy.  Salary Range for this Position (based on experience) $60,000-$70,000 Full Time Associates at Omni Interlocken Resort are entitled to elect the following benefits Medical, Dental, Vision and other healthcare benefits, Paid Maternity Leave, 401k and Paid Time Off Accrual. Omni Interlocken Resort reserves the right to pay more or less than listed compensation scale based on factors not related to sex or race. Plan and maintain regular communications with, and actively solicit additional business from, Hotel key accounts Communicate and/or meet with parties interested in the Hotel’s services and assess the parties’ needs and whether the requested services would be a profitable or best use of the Hotel’s rooms and space consistent with client needs and budgets Prepare guest proposals with various options available for Hotels services and products (rooms, events, F&B, convention or meeting space, pricing, dates, locations) that are consistent with the goal of high guest satisfaction and with other Hotel bookings and profitability standards Negotiate, prepare, and review terms of contracts for Hotel services in compliance with Hotel billing and rate guidelines and under supervision of Director of Sales Meet or exceed targets for prospecting of sales opportunities and targets for revenue streams, as determined by Hotel management Execute and manage internal processes necessary to reserve and confirm the negotiated contract services, including blocking of guest rooms, meeting space, and catering requirements Assist Director of Sales to stimulate productivity of all sales staff through guidance, development, and support Assist the Director of Sales in developing and implementing the budgeting and forecasting process for the Hotel Promote high visibility of Hotel through active involvement in industry associations and trade shows Provide mentorship and professional development to lower level and less experienced sales employees Support and promote all Corporate programs to increase customer awareness of Omni Hotels and ensure that the customer receives the appropriate benefits of each program Maintain high quality guest offerings, in coordination with Convention Services Department, and contribute to the protection and cleanliness of the owner's physical assets Maintain a record of prompt and regular attendance at assigned work location and for work assignments, as scheduled by Hotel managers Interact and communicate positively and professionally with guests, prospective guests, key accounts, coworkers, and visitors to the Hotel Use computer and electronic devices and related software properly and effectively to communicate, including email, and to prepare reports and analyses of sales activity Plan, prioritize, and implement sales strategies and sales plans, to manage multiple tasks and deadlines, and to work in a fast-paced environment Complete assigned tasks and projects in a timely manner and as directed by Hotel management Contribute to and support the maintenance of a safe working environment, including COVID protections for guests and coworkers, and perform all work in compliance with Hotel safety standards and all legal requirements Comply with Hotel and Corporate policies and procedures and all applicable legal and regulatory requirements Attend and contribute to regular meetings of sales team and Hotel leadership, including daily meetings or interactions with Director of Sales regarding occupancy, business forecasts, and future availability of Hotel rooms and services Perform in work environment with extensive use of phone and email communications and extended periods at a desk or work station Local and interstate travel necessary to develop guest relationships and Hotel brand, including trade shows, client meetings, and team travel, often at discretion of Sales Manager to determine best use of Hotel resources for developing business Work schedule is generally weekday business hours, with approval of Hotel management, and with additional evening or weekend guest relationship-building meetings or activities at discretion of Sales Manager Additional marketing or guest service assignments as directed by Hotel Management Occasional lifting, standing, bending in order to assist guests or operations teams with unexpected changes to setups for events, meetings, and banquets. Regular walking throughout Hotel to interact with other departments, for meetings and oversight of events, and for property tours Minimum of 5 years hotel sales experience or equivalent. Experience selling and servicing large group events. High School Diploma or Equivalent. College degree preferred. Certified Meeting Planner preferred. Knowledge of the operations of the hotel industry. Dynamic, enthusiastic, creative leader who thrives under pressure and is able to perform multiple functions and troubleshoot when needed. Command of the English language both written and verbal, with the ability to demonstrate warmth and empathy when engaging with others. Must have proven selling, negotiating and presentation skills. Requires knowledge of advanced sales techniques. Highly developed customer service skills with strong attention to detail. Proficient computer skills including but not limited to Microsoft Word, Power Point, Excel, and Outlook. Delphi experience preferred. The ability to delegate, effectively train and coach Must be able to work a flexible schedule including nights, weekends and holidays. jobTitle: Sales Manager - Agriculture and Food - North America
description: The Regional Sales Manager, Agriculture and Food will lead a team focused on the Company's agriculture, food and feed segments. The position will have responsibility to drive market expansion and growth. The successful candidate must be a strategic thought leader who enjoys working in a highly collaborative environment while driving change. The Sales Manager will bring experience and a deep understanding of the Agricultural or Agrochemical industry and will have a proven track record of having helped a business significantly grow.  Principle Duties & Responsibilities Responsible for budget development and delivering against financial metrics for Agriculture and Food. Work with the marketing department to develop the regional commercial strategy. Execute against sales plan that expands customer base and extends regional business in line with the Agriculture and Food strategy. Identify and maximize growth and market share opportunities for both existing products and innovations. Meet with potential clients and grow long-lasting relationships by understanding their needs. Track, analyze, and communicate key quantitative metrics and business trends as they relate to partner relationships. Recruit salespeople, set objectives, train and coach, and monitor performance ensuring assigned tasks and responsibilities are fulfilled. Identify knowledge gaps within the team and develop mitigation plan. Ensure company sales targets are met and new company cultural standards are established by holding weekly team check-ins to monitor progress.  Education & Experience A relevant undergraduate degree required. Masters or MBA preferred. Prior experience and understanding of the Agrochemical industry.  Knowledge, Skills & Abilities Analytical and creative, with proven good judgment. Strong negotiation skills. High energy with the highest levels of personal and professional integrity. Willingness and ability to travel up to 60% with some overnight stays. Key competencies of business acumen, collaboration, strategic thinking, program and process management, change management, managing diverse and complex relationships.  Notice All applicants offered positions by Nouryon will be required to provide proof of their fully vaccinated COVID-19 status prior to beginning employment, subject to any exceptions made by Nouryon for religious or disability-related reasons.  About Nouryon Industries worldwide rely on our essential chemistry in the manufacture of everyday products such as paper, plastics, building materials, and personal care items. Building on the dedication of our employees and our shared commitment to safety, sustainability, and open innovation, we have established a world-class business and built strong partnerships with our customers.
industries: Chemicals and Mechanical or Industrial Engineering

description: POSITION TITLE: National Sales Managers - Trade Shows & Events  LOCATION: Washington, DC ( will consider remote work situation)  TRAVEL: Required  SALARIED POSITION  Job Summary  The National Sales Manager position requires an individual that is a self-starter who is driven to succeed in a focused, direct sales environment. This position requires a goal-setter able to demonstrate consistent measurable and effective sales activities, moving prospects to leads and ultimately to clients. This candidate will have effective communications and strong relationship-building skills. As a National Sales Manager, you will be required to multi-task, be well organized, prepared, and accountable. As an effective National Sales Manager, you will be required to maintain a winning attitude and a commitment to retaining and growing a portfolio of accounts through a disciplined and regimented sales effort.  The position reports to the Vice President of National Sales in connection with National Sales targets. You will be engaged by the Executive Vice President and other various senior management team members from time to time.  Essential Duties And Responsibilities Develop a deep understanding of Fern’s philosophy, overall product/service offering, and partner network to communicate to our prospects accurately. Identify, qualify, and solicit new and repeat clients per company goals and objectives. Build industry relationships that lead to sales referrals and introductions. Develop professional relationships that result in the long-term retention of clients. Perform timely and effective solicitation and follow-up through face-to- face, written, or verbal communications. Plan and conduct appointments (phone, online, face to face, etc.) to understand prospective clients' needs and challenges. Develop and present proposals to prospective clients using professional communication skills and presentation materials created by you and supplied by the company. Develop and maintain an understanding of internal costs (labor, materials, equipment, etc.) associated with producing events to create accurately priced client proposals. Participate in company sales activities to sustain your understanding of the company's directives and resources. Participate in industry activities to seek qualified sales leads, promote the company brand. Repeatedly provide complete and accurate account updates via Salesforce. Represent the organizationally professionally at all times and respond quickly to all client and co-worker requests. Perform regular budgeting, scheduling, and sales projections associated with account assignments to management. Specific New Business Development Duties And Responsibilities Your sales targets will consist of business renewals (previous customers you or Fern have served) and new business (customers not previously served by Fern), consisting of events held throughout the United States. You will be responsible for discovering sales leads through industry research, relationships with CVBs, Convention Centers, Major Hotels, and online resources. Utilizing data and resources relative to sales opportunities, you will be required to qualify these leads, introduce Fern, secure face-to-face meetings. The objective is to establish a professional relationship, understand clients' needs, form successful sales strategies that close new business. To be successful at contracting new and repeat clients (your historical clients and Ferns), it will be vital that you build a relationship with each client leading up to the opportunity to submit proposals so that the client will favor our company. Consistently demonstrate the capacity to develop a sales strategy that is unique to each prospect. Maintain a high level of proficiency in composing and presenting proposals and presentations. Sales goals are expected to be achieved, demonstrate a genuine and dedicated effort leading to you meeting or exceeding these goals. This position requires individuals who are experts in new business development and are proven closers. Ideal Candidates’ Qualifications And Experience Bachelor’s degree required. Experience in trade shows or related industry preferred. Five plus years experience in direct sales and a verifiable track record of success. Strong client relationship skills and a high degree of comfort at networking events. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, along with presentation experience. Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Salesforce (or other CRM). As one of the largest service contractors in North America, Fern is best known for its personalized approach to service. Our experienced team is dedicated to first understanding our client’s objectives, specific to each event, and the broader goals of the client organization. This attitude toward understanding, and then serving, extends to how we engage and serve exhibitors, sponsors, and other event participants. As a result of our personalized approach to service, we deliver the event experience and results that are the most important to each client and participant.

Andrew Davidson & Co., Inc. is one of the leading providers of sophisticated financial analytics and consulting. We are thought leaders in policy and modeling, as well as leading providers of financial software products that solve complex investment risk and valuation problems for mortgages and other assets. Our culture is based on intellectual curiosity, mutual respect, and, above all else, integrity. We strive to offer all employees the chance to grow. As our company continues to grow, we are looking to fill several positions.  Our analytics are used by some of the world’s largest and leading institutional, fixed income investors. These include banks, guarantors, credit unions, insurance companies, reinsurers, regulators, broker-dealers, hedge funds and money management firms  You are experienced and entrepreneurial. Your mission is to grow and expand the distribution of our models, applications and advisory services. Working within our consulting-based sales approach, you’ll leverage market and product knowledge with a creative approach to finding solutions. As the Business Development Associate, you’ll identify growth opportunities within our core market sectors: Depository Institutions, Mortgage Banking, Insurance Companies and Asset Management. More specifically, you will: Develop and foster new relationships with potential clients in our core market sectors, while also leveraging and building on existing ones. Provide market intelligence to product managers, senior management, and the rest of the firmregarding market developments, regulatory and accounting initiatives, and analytical trends that can be used to help drive the product development queue and raise the overall level of market knowledge at the firm. Effectively manage the sales cycle including initial contact and presentations, utilization of internal product and market experts, trial management and contract negotiation. Work with Product Managers to determine the distribution channels for the core market sectors that will maximize revenue to the firm. Identify and secure speaking opportunities for the firm at key industry conferences and events that target core market sectors. Effectively plan and devise strategies to grow revenue and increase awareness of the firm’s products and services.  QUALIFICATIONS You’ve earned a bachelor’s degree in finance, economics or marketing. You have 3-5 years selling financial based software or analytics targeted to one or more of our core market segments. You have excellent written, communication and presentation skills, with an eye for details. Time management and organization are among the keys to your success. You are a self-starter who is internally and personally motivated to succeed, but are also a team player.   At AD&Co, we have a flat organization (no managers) and a generous and fun corporate culture. Every employee is equal and everyone has a voice.We are an equal opportunity employer.We are committed to diversity in all its forms. We offer a generous vacation policy, excellent health benefits, profit sharing, 401K, and ESOP that gives you ownership in the company, plus much more. (Other perks include beautiful, spacious offices, a well-stocked café, lunch meetings, social outings and seminars, and a commitment to learning. For more information on what it’s like to work at AD&Co, visit our website at Join Our Team | Andrew Davidson & Co., Inc. (ad-co.com)

Job Title:            Area Sales Manager Reporting to:    National Sales Director Company:         Confidence Products Location:           Greater Los Angeles  Confidence Overview This is a unique opportunity to be a critical team member at an exciting beverage start up that is poised to create an entirely new category. Confidence is a revolutionary new beverage whose unique blend of adaptogens, and vitamins is formulated to give our consumers the Confidence they need to meet the biggest challenges their day has to offer. In our increasingly comparative and competitive world Confidence helps people be their best and most authentic selves.  Your role: Area Sales Manager Confidence is looking for Area Sales Managers to lead Confidence’s DSD distributor sales and marketing efforts in target regions of Los Angeles. This is a hybrid role with both sales and marketing responsibilities. Confidence is an early stage emerging beverage in the better for you RTD functional beverage space. There will be significant opportunities for professional growth as the business scales.  Key Responsibilities Grow and oversee network of retail sales points, increasing sales within designated territory  Build and maintain long-term trusting relationships with store associates, store managers, grocery managers, key stake holders and distributors  Represent Confidence at sampling and marketing events  Assist with selling in of trade solutions, sampling activations and shelf placement  Schedule will be flexible with days and hours of the position different from week to week  Exhibits exceptional skills in customer service, time management, self-confidence, flexibility, creativity, accountability and communication  Experience Sales experience in various channels including Grocery, Mass, Natural & On-Premise Distributor experience a must Sales experience in various channels including Grocery, Mass, Natural & On-Premise 2-3 years beverage sales experience College degree preferred but not required  Characteristics Creative problem solver- constantly curious and looking for new ways to succeed  Excellent organizational skills  Persuasive and diplomatic communicator with strong negotiation skills  High degree of independence  Carry the bag mentality  Exceptional integrity  Clean driving record  Desire to work in a fact paced start up environment  Desire to make the world a better place, helping Gen Z live their best fullest lives  *All applicants send your resumes to Oliver@confidencedrink.com

Job Summary  The Regional Sales Manager position is responsible for all aspects of the sales function relative to the Grocery channel with National Deep Discounters, East Coast Natural Channel and Ecommerce. This position is responsible for maintaining an existing customer base of retailers, as well as identifying and growing new accounts. This role will support customers both with a broker and direct + works closely with internal cross-functional stakeholders - Sales Finance, Shopper Marketing, Supply Chain, Customer Service. To be successful in this role, the incumbent will need to be able to quickly identify white space distribution opportunities and deploy strategic selling stories to secure that business.  Responsibilities/Duties Maintain strong relationships through systemic contact with existing customer base of wholesalers, distributors, and retailers. Seek out and generate new accounts to grow sales volumes and profits. Oversee Sales Operating Plan to meet or exceed targeted sales numbers. Partner with Shopper Marketing to create best “Go to Market” strategies for in-store execution Communicate effectively across functions (Supply Chain, Finance, Marketing, etc.) Partner with innovation and marketing teams on new product development with the goal of increasing sales. Manage administrative duties such as reporting, monitoring trade spending, forecasting, budgeting, travel and expenses. Participate in industry specific associations, trade shows, and customer events. Work Experience/Knowledge 5+ years sales experience in the consumer-packaged goods or food and beverage industry Proven track record of success growing sales and developing new customers Experience with Aldi, Lidl and Amazon preferred Natural Foods experience is a plus Experience with Broker managed accounts is a plus Dairy experience is a plus Skills / Other Personal Attributes Required Negotiation skills, conflict resolution, and the ability to influence Strong organizational and self-structure skills required Ability to be effective in a results driven, entrepreneurial, fast-paced work environment Excellent oral and written communication skills Analytical and decision-making ability Ability to be self-sufficient and take initiative for new opportunities Proficient in Microsoft Office Category management/Strategic selling story creation skills a plus Formal Education Bachelor’s degree is required Working Conditions This is a home-based position that with location flexibility, with preference for the Central US Travel 30 - 40%. The ability to lift, carry or otherwise move objects of up to 10 pounds is necessary. Normally works a regular schedule of hours, however hours may vary depending on the project or assignment.
industries: Food & Beverages, Food Production, and Consumer Goods

description: The Account Manager is responsible for the sale of HARTMANN products to healthcare facilities within the assigned territory, focusing on seeking new business opportunities and maximizing current business relationships. The role will cover Oklahoma and Arkansas from a home base centrally located in the region.  Summary of Job Functions Achieve or exceed the annual territory sales target established by the company through strategic planning, relationship building, account targeting, extensive product knowledge and exceptional customer service. Maximize sales profits and increase market share for the assigned region by growing existing customer relationships and establishing new customer relationships. Develop and maintain territory plans outlining how sales targets will be met on an ongoing basis. Effectively communicate appropriate technical, disease state, and product information to customers to drive demand for HARTMANN products. Create and cultivate relationships and build rapport with key customers, decision makers and clinicians. Deliver sales presentations to key customers and customer groups in hospitals, wound care centers, home care and nursing homes. Conduct product demonstrations and in-services for identified customer groups to educate end users on the clinical benefits of Hartmann products. Provide feedback to Sales leadership on market trends, competitive threats, unmet needs, and opportunities to deliver greater value to customers. Demonstrate effective organizational skills, utilizing the CRM system to manage appointments, customers, prospects and sales pipeline.  Desired Skills and Experience Bachelor’s degree from a 4-year college or university 3+ years B2B medical product sales with a strong preference for experience in wound care.  Abilities Required Engaging and capable speaker, presenter and educator with strong presence and excellent interpersonal and communications skills. Ability to build strong relationships with specialists and peers; establish credibility with customers and other key stakeholders; diplomatic, tactful, and empathetic. Customer-focused; understands and delivers excellent information, expertise, support and service. Track record of developing and achieving sales objectives individually and collaboratively. Strong organizational skills with the ability to organize and prioritize multiple tasks. Self-Motivated with energy and passion to pursue goals, with a track record of execution and results. Willing to travel 70% with several overnights per month; maintain a valid driver’s license and clean driving record.

Our Client  The company is the largest producer for non-GMO pea protein and pea starch in the world with annual sales of $600 million. The products include vermicelli, pea protein, pea starch, dietary fiber, mushroom, etc.  We are looking a high-performing Protein Powder Sales Manager to help us meet our customer acquisition and revenue growth targets by keeping our company competitive and innovative. You will be responsible for maximizing our sales team potential, crafting sales plans and justifying those to plans to the upper management.  Job Title: Sales Manager, Plant-based Protein Powder  Responsibilities:  Achieve growth and hit sales targets by successfully managing the sales team Design and implement a strategic business plan that expands company’s customer base and ensure it’s strong presence Own recruiting, objectives setting, coaching and performance monitoring of sales representatives Build and promote strong, long-lasting customer relationships by partnering with them and understanding their needs Present sales, revenue and expenses reports and realistic forecasts to the management team Identify emerging markets and market shifts while being fully aware of new products and competition status  Requirements  3-5 years experience in protein powder sales and marketing Previous working experience in PURIS, Roquette, AGT, Ingredion, Batory Foods is a plus BS/MS degree in business administration or a related field Successful previous experience as a sales representative or sales manager, Consistently meeting or exceeding targets Committed to continuous education through workshops, seminars and conferences Demonstrated ability to communicate, present and influence credibly and effectively at all levels of the organization Proven ability to drive the sales process from plan to close Strong business sense and industry expertise Excellent mentoring, coaching and people management skills

Warby Parker is seeking a service-oriented Sales Manager to support a team of exceptional Retail Advisors in creating the best possible glasses-shopping experiences. As a Sales Manager, you'll engage with customers, have a hand in process ideation and improvement, and participate in various special projects along the way. Through these responsibilities, you'll directly impact the success of our company while seeing our strategic operations in action and learning from our super talented business and Retail leaders. Ready to play an integral part in shaping and driving Warby Parker Retail? Read on!  What You'll Do Communicate Warby Parker's values and brand philosophy to customers Own troubleshooting for our point-of-sale system Oversee the store's inventory management procedures Develop new processes that improve Warby Parker’s ability to serve customers and optimize their shopping experiences Manage and implement daily zoning schedules Open and close the store Lead meetings at the beginning of shifts and at the end of the day, plus roundtables and other meetings as needed Direct a team of 8–10 team members, consistently demonstrating what great service looks like Help conduct team members' biannual performance reviews with the Store Leader and Associate Store Leader Assist with new hire on-boarding and ongoing training Treat all of our customers with respect and cultivate an inclusive, service-minded work culture Who You Are Steeped in Retail experience, with 1+ year in a management position Equipped with exceptional interpersonal skills Backed by managerial experience in sales or operations at a complex, customer-focused retailer A self-starter with an entrepreneurial spirit Eager to learn new skills An upbeat and empathetic team player Driven to do what it takes to be a top performer time and time again—and help your teammates reach their targets along the way Able to bring a positive, fun energy to the workplace, even when working long hours Not on the Office of Inspector General’s List of Excluded Individuals/Entities (LEIE) Some benefits of working at Warby Parker for Full-Time Employees: Health, vision, and dental insurance Life and AD&D Insurance Flexible vacation policy Paid Holidays Retirement savings plan with a company match Parental leave (non-birthing parents included) Short-term disability Employee Assistance Program (EAP) Bereavement Support Optical Education Reimbursement Free eyewear And more (just ask!) About Us  Warby Parker was founded with a mission: to inspire and impact the world with vision, purpose, and style.  We’re constantly asking ourselves how we can do more and make a greater impact—and that starts by reimagining everything that a company and industry can be. We want to demonstrate that a business can scale, be profitable, and do good in the world—without charging a premium for it. And we’ve learned that it takes creativity, empathy, and innovation to achieve that goal.  Since the day we launched in 2010, we’ve pioneered ideas, designed products, and developed technologies that help people see. We offer everything our customers need for happier eyes at a price that leaves them with money in their pockets, from designer-quality glasses and contacts to eye exams and vision tests.  Ultimately, we believe in vision for all, which is why for every pair of glasses or sunglasses we sell, a pair of glasses is distributed to someone in need through our Buy a Pair, Give a Pair program. Over eight million pairs of glasses have been distributed in over 50 countries; that means eight million people now have the glasses they need to learn, work, and achieve better economic outcomes.  At Warby Parker, you can look forward to company outings and events, volunteering and learning opportunities, and just great company filled with curious, kind folks. Dreaming up and sharing ideas aren’t responsibilities reserved for certain teams or leaders; the challenge (a really fun one) of innovation is on all of our shoulders. Teammates can also connect around common interests, backgrounds, and identities, no matter their home base, through our various employee resource groups. (We’re happy to say that the Human Rights Campaign has named us a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ+ employees!) That sense of community and belonging keeps us excited to walk through the door every day, wherever that door may be.  We're driven to continue building a workplace, based on inclusive behaviors and equitable systems, where all employees can bring their authentic selves, feel engaged, and share their perspectives as a valued member of Team Warby. Transparency is what we’re all about, and our annual Impact Report and Racial Equity Strategy lay out how we’re sticking to these values.

Company Description  Accolade at a glance  Accolade provides personalized health and benefits solutions designed to empower every person to live their healthiest life. We help millions of people and their employers navigate the complexities of the healthcare system with empathy, expertise and through exceptional service while supporting them in lowering the cost of care and improving health outcomes. Accolade blends technology-enabled health and benefits solutions, specialized support from Accolade Health Assistants® and Clinicians and access to expert medical opinion services for high-cost treatment decisions. We consistently receive consumer satisfaction ratings over 90 percent and have been recognized by Inc. Magazine as a Top Place to Work 2020 and Business Intelligence for Excellence in Customer Service 2020. Please visit us on LinkedIn, Twitter, Instagram and Facebook and at accolade.com.  Job Description  Our Mid-Market team is expanding!  The Regional Sales Executive, Mid-Market is responsible for meeting or exceeding the annual bookings quota for the assigned territory.  This role must be based within and will cover the following territory:  Pennsylvania, Delaware, Maryland, Washington, D.C., Virginia, West Virginia, Ohio and Indiana.  A day in the life… Consistently identifies opportunities, develops sales strategy and closes new business in the assigned middle market segment Identifies, develops and retains new business relationships Effectively presents Accolade’s offerings to qualified prospects Effectively leverages Accolade executives, the pre-sales team and services staff to support customer presentations Develops and executes strategies to generate cost effective sales leads Develops a pipeline of new sales opportunities in alignment with objectives that are established annually Develops and maintains an effective sales and market penetration plan for assigned territory Leverages the sales milestone process to ensure accuracy with monthly, quarterly and annual forecasts Documents all sales contacts, activities and sales process steps in Accolade’s sales tools and systems Solicits product and market feedback from customers, prospects and partners. Communicates this feedback to sales leadership, marketing and the product development team (feature requests, market trends, competition intelligence, new opportunities) Complies with all corporate policies and completes all administrative tasks on time Qualifications  What we are looking for… Minimum 8-10 years of strategic selling experience BA in a business or technical related area of study Experience selling complex, multi-stakeholder solutions. SaaS, health & welfare benefits, healthcare capital equipment, healthcare IT, health and welfare benefits outsourcing, human resources IT benefits software Embraces and thrives in a culture of transparency, accountability and trust Self-starter with ability to work independently, prioritize work and coordinate multiple tasks within tight time constraints Ability to navigate the strategic levels of customer organizations, identify key decision-makers, build relationships with senior executives and schedule meetings with key stakeholders Ability to establish strong team relationships in a matrix organization Ability to perform in a dynamic and fast-paced environment Possess account knowledge, executive-level customer contacts and industry relationships inside the employer market space Command of social media for the benefit of lead generation, gaining access to executives and networking with key stakeholders Strong aptitude with business software tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook etc) Strong business acumen Demonstrated ability to successfully negotiate complex contract Demonstrated ability to accurately forecast monthly, quarterly, and annual revenue Where permitted by applicable law, candidates must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by date of hire to be considered, if not currently employed by Accolade, Inc. The Company will provide reasonable accommodations to qualified employees with disabilities or for a sincerely held religious belief.  Please note that a request for exemption due to a personal preference not to receive a vaccine is not protected by law. All requests for exemptions from this mandate shall be directed to the Company recruiter who shall route the request to the Company’s human resources department.  Additional Information  What Is Important To Us  Creating an enduring company that is hyper-focused on our culture and making a meaningful impact in the lives of our employees, members and customers. The secret to our success is:  We Find Joy And Purpose In Serving Others  Making a difference in our members’ and customers’ lives is what we do. Even when it’s hard, we do the right thing for the right reasons.  We are strong individually and together, we’re powerful  Trusting in our colleagues and embracing their different backgrounds and experiences enable us to solve tough problems in creative ways, having fun along the way.  We roll up our sleeves and get stuff done  Results motivate us. And we aren't afraid of the hard work or tough decisions needed to get us there.  We’re boldly and relentlessly reinventing healthcare We're curious and act big -- not afraid to knock down barriers or take calculated risks to change the world, one person at a time.  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Hospital & Health Care

description: American Express is the leading payment card issuer for small businesses in the United States and supports business owners with products and services to assist them in running and growing their businesses. Global Commercial Services (GCS) is a core operating group of American Express, the Global leader in the Corporate Payments Solutions space, and subsequently continues to be an exciting and fast-growing business!  GCS partners with small businesses and corporate clients to help them manage business expenses and make large purchases through proprietary payment solutions and expense management tools. GCS is committed to service and innovation and offers our commercial card members a wide range of differentiated solutions.  US Acquisition and Client Group (USACG) is the phone-based account management and sales teams for the US Small and Medium Enterprises (SME) segment in GCS. USACG has over 500 colleagues located in Phoenix, AZ, Sunrise, FL, and New York, NY as well as approximately 100 vendor agents in AZ and WI, who engage to acquire new customers, provide early tenure treatment, and retain and grow >1 million US Small, Medium, and Large Enterprise commercial clients, delivering >$300B in customer billings each year.  The Commercial Acquisition Group is an organization with 275+ colleagues within USACG that is responsible for the acquisition and development of our highest potential and highest spending small business customers. The successful incumbent will have experience leading sales teams in a leadership role and will ensure sales targets, production and compliance metrics are achieved across the team through continuous coaching and development.  We are seeking an experienced leader who possesses self-confidence, a positive attitude, a high level of business acumen, strong executive presence, and a willingness to coach a team of professionals towards long term consistent success. The primary focus of this role is to lead a team of eight to ten inside sales representatives. The successful Sr. Manager of this specialized commercial tele sales team will guarantee compliant sales targets production and compliance metrics are achieved across their team through continuous mentorship and development. The ability to identify, communicate and execute successful sales strategies and share standard methodologies across the team and broader organization is critical.  Job Responsibilities Mentor team members to uncover the needs of prospective customers and recommend our products Provide one-on-one mentoring in a positive way with personal accountability Analyze prospect data, develop appropriate strategies, and prioritize selling activities Analyze individual colleague and team results and provide appropriate feedback Build positive relationships across the organization, and cross functional partners, engaging with them daily Adhere to Blue Box Values, GCS Sales Practices and Standard Operating Procedures, and American Express Leadership Behaviors Be a champion of and for compliance within USACG and GCS 3 years of formal leadership experience. Strong relationship and leadership skills with both internal business partners and external customers. Solid thought-leadership to provide creative and innovative solutions to clients’ business needs. Proven ability to develop and strengthen relationships at senior levels of client organizations. Adept at managing strategic partner relationships within and outside the organization. Track record that demonstrates an outstanding ability to acquire new business or grow existing business relationships. Broad and deep background and experience with Small and Middle Enterprise customers. Strong analytical and decision-making skills. Ability to articulate and deliver the American Express value proposition. A strong will to win and entrepreneurial mentality. A positive, tenacious attitude and growth mindset. A consistent record of compliantly driving sales results. Strong digital literacy (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Internet) Experience mentoring outbound tele sales teams is preferred B2B work experience and experience using Salesforce is preferred Educational Requirement Bachelor's Degree in sales, marketing or equivalent field preferred Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.  Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.  American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.

jobTitle: Regional Sales Manager - Away From Home
description: Who We Are  batches, packaging, and delivering direct to more than 15,000 stores and partners to ensure freshness, and perfecting the craft of drink making in our 250+ coffee bars, we continuously build on our deep expertise and heritage to deliver great coffee. Now, in the midst of an exciting period of growth, Peet’s is focused on sharing our passion – in offices, on campus, in grocery or specialty stores - anywhere coffee lovers live, work, or play.  The Regional Sales Manager reports to Sr. Director Sales , Away from Home  By leveraging relationships with existing specialty distributors, securing new accounts, and through collaboration with wholesale team members, the Regional Sales Manageris responsible to grow revenue and volume in the assigned territory each year. We anticipate this territory to cover the East Coast and so the ideal candidate would live in this geographic territory.  Revenue growth activities include: calling directly on end-user clients, developing relationships with operators and distributors, sales proposals and presentations, and through promotion of Peet’s and Mighty Leaf Tea at trade shows. Other activities include creating and executing relevant customer marketing and distributor programs which support growth strategies. The Regional Sales Manager works closely with Finance and Operations to deliver new business goals. Accounts can include: Business Offices, College & University Campuses, Healthcare Facilities, Foodservice Operators and Hospitality clients.  What You Will Do Delivering on new business goals each month by winning new end user business in key sectors including Business Offices, College & University Campuses, Healthcare Facilities and Hospitality clients Develop consistent and continuous new business pipeline through relationship building, prospecting tools, research and sharing the Peet’s programs to relevant audiences Own select key account relationships with existing accounts with large growth potential Develop customer specific sales presentations, respond to requests for proposals (RFPs) and work cross functionally with finance and operations and marketing to support strategic new business opportunities. Maintain detailed files in Salesforce for each account including sales data, rebate data, contact person(s), pricing, and profitability objectives. Display an excellent knowledge of all products, pricing, services, and sales aids: including promotions and availability. Know where and how to access additional information as requested and be able to explain the reason behind company procedures, programs, and services. Develop creative account specific strategies in collaboration with other Sales Managers to deliver growth Attend and exhibit at industry and distributor trade shows. Work collaboratively with other Peet’s channels and functions (e.g., Foodservice, Marketing, Grocery and others) to help achieve the company’s cross-channel initiatives. Communicate with Customer Service and roasting plant personnel to ensure efficient fulfillment of orders. Ensure on-going communication with Home Office/Operations about account activity. Implement and contribute to promotional programs and tactical sales plans to exceed growth goals. Stay abreast of competitive climate and industry trends through applicable trade organizations and industry journals. 80% of time divided between sales calls, meetings, and developing new business 20% of the time home office paperwork, phone calls, and follow-up communication. Ability to lead virtual sales presentations but also to travel to accounts via car, train, subway, taxi and air. Who You Are Five+ years related outside sales experience selling to Wholesale and Foodservice channels Consultative sales skills Strong initiative, motivation, and self-management skills Excellent written and oral communication skills Superb customer service skills Strong Word, Excel and PowerPoint computer skills Strong negotiation skills with customer-oriented attitude Willingness to travel regularly throughout territory and occasionally nationally as necessary Specialty coffee and tea experience, and coffee operations experience a plus

Our mission is to Profoundly change the standard of care by creating a tomorrow where clinicians can confidently ablate tissue with precision; a tomorrow where patients have access to safe and effective treatment options, so they can quickly return to their daily lives. Changing the standard of care is part of our fabric. We are a group of energetic, problem-solvers focused on innovation, and looking to change the world. We are changing the paradigm for treating diseases such as prostate cancer by using real-time MR Imaging, thermal ultrasound and close-loop temperature feedback control, to gently ablate the diseased tissue with minimal side effects.  If you share our values and want to work in a collaborative results focused culture and want to make a Profound impact in healthcare and your career, here is your chance. Proven ability to take on a large geography and 75% travel. Problem solving and the ability to be coached and directed by other teammates will allow collaboration. Critical Thinking/Problem Solving. Oral/Written Communications. Strong Interpersonal Skills Teamwork/Collaboration. Leadership. Professionalism/Work Ethic  We thank you for your interest in Profound Medical. Must demonstrate ability to understand our products and mechanical concepts and to successfully communicate them to customers and sales channel partners; Knowledge of the Fire industry and experience in wildland firefighting is an asset;  SKILLS & COMPETENCIES Highly professional and positive attitude and ability to deliver customer-focused service; Strategic thinking, strong listening skills and patience to work with customers and understand their needs; Energetic and able to adapt to a fast-paced environment where priorities change quickly, and multi-tasking is a must;  Professional communication skills through email and phone calls; Natural curiosity and passion for excellence, improvement and problem solving; Innovative, creative and decisive; A positive attitude and professional appearance along with the ability to thrive in a small company environment and build strong relationships with coworkers, customers and partners; Must be persistent, action-oriented, results-driven and self-motivated; Ability to manage several projects simultaneously, delivering high quality work; Excellent people skills, including experience working with a variety of cross functional and international stakeholders; Diplomacy and tact in interpersonal relationships; Excellent time management and direct selling skills; Problem-solving and analytical skills to interpret sales performance and market trend information; Proven leadership and ability to drive and motivate sales teams; Excellent oral and written communication skills; Effective channel management; Familiarity and expertise with CRM software;

jobTitle: Channel Sales Specialist, Life Care Solutions (LCS)
description: Job Description Summary  The LCS Channel Sales Specialist will lead, mentor and coach authorized partners to drive financial results, ensure compliance and be accountable for keeping the risk profile within the tolerant level, norms and standards while driving leads and projects to support GE Distributor business within their assigned territory.GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Job Description  Essential Responsibilities:    Own and deliver financial performance to OP targets for the USA Distributor Channel Partner portfolio and segment businesses. Identify target end user accounts and create account plans in conjunction with Channel Partner. Create and continuously develop Channel Partner specific business plans and set stretch goals and objectives. Drive incoming leads to opportunity and work collaboratively with USA Distributor product sales specialist. Continuously develop relationships and drive mindshare with the GE Distributor sales reps and authorized channel partners and its field sales team. Provide representatives with GE product knowledge and approved sales collateral to advance the sales process with the potential end user. Develop metrics to measure progress to make tools more effective for channel partners and to make the employees more efficient. Ensure data analytics drive decision making for budgeting and financial planning and analysis. Identify opportunities to improve visibility, win rate and share performance across P&L , Markets and Regions. Lead Sales Operations processes & mechanisms and coordinate their implementation with channel partners. Manage channel partner relationships on day-to-day basis and provide transactional support while managing personal funnel and activity documented in SFDC. Act as business development coach to grow the Channel Partner capability. Simplify the point of contact between GEHC and Channel Partner and proactively align internal GE resources to support Channel Partner. Schedule joint sales calls with Channel Partner & relevant GE commercial teams as opportunities to coach and maintain relationships with the customer decision makers and support the coordination of remote or in person product demonstrations with potential end user customer, channel partner sales representative and internal GE Distributor resources. Drive channel partner field activity supporting channel partners with field travel, attending meetings, and training and education. Support Installed Base Projects, initiatives as developed by segment sales and marketing leadership within assigned territory. Drive Leads to Opportunity in SFDC with coordination with segment PSSs in assigned territory, including Trade Show Lead Follow Up, 800# & Web and eCommerce Leads. Transactional support of Channel partners purchase orders and field level PSSs as needed to accomplish business financial objectives. Territory support for segment leadership in case open territories within defined territory. Support a culture of highest integrity and compliance within the authorized Channel Partner community and with the segment product sales specialists.  Required Qualifications    Bachelor's degree completion. 2+ years of small capital equipment or pharmaceutical sales experience, or 1+ years of clinical or clinical applications experience focused on Imaging equipment, or 2+ years GEHC experience in customer facing role(s) (such as Imaging Service or GEHC Inside Sales roles).  Strong business finance and GEHC USA commercial operational knowledge. Successful experience in multi-stakeholder environment. High ethics and integrity. Understanding of contracts, legal, commercial & negotiation skills. Proven coordination and influencing skills to set and drive an agenda with third parties, field sales representatives and peers within your business Customer focused mindset with proven ability to respond quickly to internal and external customer needs. Strong business coaching experience. Ability to build rapport, energize and influence people Interpersonal flexibility and tolerance.  Desired Characteristics:    Loves to build relationships and is able to empathize with and connect together our authorized partners, field sales, functional support team members and ultimately clinicians using ultrasound to positively impact the lives of their patients. Experience in Healthcare related sales or marketing with a strong record of account management success. Strong expertise in local Healthcare Legislation and regulations. Proven success in managing sales channels of multiple products in Healthcare equipment sales. Demonstrated success or ability to support sales remotely. Experience with Salesforce.com and Apptus Direct and/or indirect leadership experience. Ability to analyze business models, implement executable strategy and plans USA Imaging experience and product familiarity.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.  Additional Information  GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an  Equal Opportunity Employer . Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).  Relocation Assistance Provided: No

description: Shortlister is building out a sales team to meet the expanding needs of its vendor partners. We’re looking for talented sales members interested in getting in on the ground floor of a growing startup. The Strategic Sales Executive will report to the Executive Vice President. Our ideal candidate will share our mission of helping vendors & service providers promote their services to employer, broker/consultant and health plan buyers. This is a remote opportunity, but the ideal candidate will be located in Chicago, IL. Experience selling to digital marketing teams, specifically Intent data, is preferred.   Responsibilities: Primary focus will be sharing the value of Intent data with our vendor & service provider partners so they can identify in-market buyers and prioritize sales/marketing outreach to those organizations Prospect, nurture, and close net new business opportunities Present an overview of Shortlister’s Vendor Marketing Suite via phone and web conference to vendors & service providers that sell their health & benefits solutions to employers, benefits brokers/consultants and health plans Manage the volume and velocity of your pipeline to achieve or exceed quota Engage with the Marketing & Sales leadership of vendors & service providers to have them promote their products and services with Shortlister  Requirements: 3-5 years of sales experience in a closing role A successful track record of sales performance (meeting or exceeding sales quotas) “Hunter” sales mentality with an ability to make a large volume of outreach to prospects - sales targets will be plentiful, so a successful candidate will need to efficiently cover a lot of ground Ability to clearly introduce a concept that may be unfamiliar to a prospect (ex: the value of Intent data or digital marketing/advertising like Pay Per Click and Pay Per Lead) Ability to simplify solutions for prospects to quickly understand and make an informed decision to buy  Preferred Skills: Experience selling to: digital marketing teams, selling to service providers in the health & welfare, benefits, human resources or healthcare markets Familiarity with Intent data (1st party and 3rd party) Familiarity with HubSpot and LinkedIn sales & marketing tools Familiarity with GoToMeeting  Why Shortlister? A technology platform used by consultants and employers in the benefits space to easily research the vendor market, evaluate & select vendor options and then manage existing vendor relationships. Made up of a small, expert team that prides itself on creating a collaborative and supportive environment Opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a start up and see your contributions make a direct and meaningful impact on the success of the business Flexible work environment Top notch benefits including medical, dental, vision, parental leave, and more Invests in personal and professional growth of employees    Shortlister’s goal is to attract and retain diverse talent and provide an inclusive environment for all where everyone’s voice is heard and all employees feel accepted. Shortlister is an equal opportunity employer and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin or ancestry, ethnicity, sex (including pregnancy), gender (including gender nonconformity and status as a transgender or transsexual individual), age, physical or mental disability, citizenship, past, current or prospective service in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected under applicable federal, state, or local law.    Shortlister matches corporate (B2B) buyers with the “shortlist” of vendors that meet their goals, budget and demographics. Employers, Consultants and Health Plans benefit from Shortlister’s real-time market insights, vendor data and RFP capabilities, while vendor partners benefit by receiving targeted leads and RFP activity.

The Key Account Manager will be responsible for developing and executing a comprehensive account/territory strategy to achieve specific targets. They will oversee the creation of opportunities and articulation of the value prop for TeleSign solutions within their defined territory. The position reports to the VP, Americas Sales.  Essential Functions Consultative solution-sell the suite of TeleSign services by mapping business challenges with technology solutions Close net new business with named accounts, including some of the largest companies in the world Identify key decision-makers, approvers, and influencers and develop strategies to increase deal confidence Drive incremental revenue inside named accounts by uncovering net new use cases, growing adoption of current opportunities, and upselling and cross-selling additional services Lead generation, qualification, and opportunity management to contract closure Partner with SDR’s (chartered with driving lead/opportunity generation in the Strategic Account Director’s accounts), Customer Success (engaged for customer deployment), Solution Engineering, and HQ Sales Operations team Work closely with the Global Carrier Business Development team to develop and close market-making opportunities Develop long-term strategic relationships with key accounts Create and manage a robust pipeline  Essential Requirements 5+ years in demonstrated Enterprise sales experience with a proven track record of consistently exceeding annual team quotas and performance targets The ideal candidate will have an understanding and/or experience of information security, SaaS models, identity and authentication, and B2B2C sales models Experience in selling into the financial services industry – Banking, Fintech, Payment, and Lending companies Experience navigating complex sales cycles Strong written and verbal skills Strong collaboration and communication within departments with the like-minded goal of achievement Self-motivated and entrepreneurial Attention to detail Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent  Why TeleSign TeleSign connects and protects online experiences with sophisticated customer identity and engagement solutions. Through APIs that deliver user verification, data insights, and communications we solve today’s unique customer challenges by bridging businesses to the complex world of global telecommunications.   Our global team consists of the best and the brightest in the industry and we treat them as such. We provide a variety of excellent benefits ranging from the standard: 401(k) matching, free lunches, generous PTO, and flexible schedules to the not so standard: quarterly performance bonuses, in-house massages, our state of the art office with panoramic views of the marina and hills, and so much more! ;)     TeleSign is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We believe our differences help us create a better workplace, a better product, and a better community. TeleSign also participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S.  TeleSign is an Affirmative Action Employer and as part of the commitment to AAP, it will seek to ensure affirmative action to provide equality of opportunity in all aspects of employment, and that all personnel activities, such as the recruitment selection, training, compensation, benefits, discipline, promotion, transfer, layoff, and termination processes remain free of illegal discrimination and harassment based on protected characteristics.  TeleSign does not accept unsolicited resumes from individual recruiters or third-party recruiting agencies in response to job postings. No fee will be paid to third parties who submit unsolicited candidates directly to our hiring managers or HR team.

description: The Market Development Representative position is a key role is responsible for executing regional market and business development strategies to acquire targeted organizations across multiple industries.   We are looking for a motivated and well-spoken Market Development Representative (MDR) . The Market Development Representative will be responsible for developing new leads, communicating with target customers, understanding their needs, and ensuring a smooth sales handover process to respective business development leaders. You should be able to identify sales opportunities and meet targets of qualified lead generation.  To be successful as a Market Development Representative you should be able to build a strong target database, instant rapport with the individuals and respond to their queries and clarifications effectively. A top Market Development Representative should also be curious, learner and a good listener.   Responsibilities:  Execute the outbound lead generation program towards a portfolio of target organizations Take services and offerings to target organizations via telephone, email and other digital channels, often cold calling leads to gauge the interest of prospects and create opportunities Achieve lead generation targets by selling a range of solutions using outbound calling, consultative and influencing selling techniques to create results for our prospects  Maintain good business relationships with customers and prospects to conduct needs analysis, relay information and provide knowledge relevant to their business challenges Work closely with business development leaders, offering specialists and alliance partners to plan and execute target prospecting and GTM strategies to acquire new opportunities Manage all interactions, touch point discussions, and follow up actions efficiently and effectively Direct qualified leads and meetings to specific business development leader with high efficiency and prioritization Follow up on the leads and meetings with the business development team to ensure they are processed timely and lead to pipeline creation Create and maintain a database of current and potential customers Set appointments for business development leaders with prospective clients Proactively research and develop new business opportunities in the market Report to the business development leaders on (weekly/monthly/quarterly) sales results Stay up to date with services and offerings, including capabilities and high level pricing, and on industry trends A Market Development Representative will play a fundamental role in achieving our ambitious customer acquisition and revenue growth objectives. You must be comfortable making dozens of calls per day, working with channel partners, generating interest, qualifying prospects and closing deals with business development leaders If you aspire to become a business development / sales leader in near future then this is the right fit for you       Preferred Qualifications: 2 years of proven inside sales, sales development, market development experience Track record of over-achieving quota University degree or equivalent Previous experience in an outbound call center or a related sales position preferred Proficiency in Microsoft Office and tools such as Zoominfo, Linkedin Sales Navigator, Outreach, Salesforce Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written Good organizational skills and the ability to multitask Excellent phone and cold calling skills Exceptional customer service skills Good listener, collaborative, curious and keen to learn

Description  Amazon Advertising operates at the intersection of advertising and eCommerce, and offers advertisers a rich array of media solutions across Amazon’s mobile and desktop websites, proprietary devices including kindle and Fire TV, and the Amazon Programmatic Demand Side Platform. We are looking for a highly motivated Account Manager who is passionate about helping our advertisers make effective, analytically driven marketing decisions. If you’re interested in joining a rapidly growing organization working to build a unique, world-class advertising group with a relentless focus on the customer, you’ve come to the right place.  We’re looking for a highly motivated Senior Account Manager who is passionate about partnering with our advertisers, educating them and helping to solve ambiguous business problems, mitigating risks before they become roadblocks. As a Senior Account Manager, you are responsible for managing complex advertiser relationships and initiatives where you define the strategy and you set the standard for Account Management best practices. You’ll not only dive deep into data to understand trends, but also communicate the “why” behind results and make actionable recommendations to internal and external stakeholders. Additionally, you’ll be able to leverage Amazon’s proprietary data to provide strategic and personalized recommendations, influencing both your internal team and your external customer to facilitate them reaching their business goals. This role is highly collaborative, working with Creative, Sales, Product, and Retail partners and will drive process improvement to gain efficiency and foster collaboration. The Senior Account Manager’s strategic digital expertise and influence is considered critical to unlocking greater value and impact for our advertisers.  Responsibilities Become a knowledgeable partner and leader on Amazon Advertising solutions Develop annual media strategies for growth based on overall advertiser goals and objectives Develop campaign strategies and audience engagement recommendations Evaluate success metrics and drive campaign performance using data Perform in-depth data analysis to form and deliver actionable recommendations for both short- and long-term advertising strategy Educate advertisers on performance metrics, insights, and how to drive greater results on Amazon Work cross-functionally with sales and other Amazon partners to drive incremental revenue and increase advertiser satisfaction  Basic Qualifications  6+ years experience in digital advertising, product marketing, consulting, business development, and/or other customer facing roles 6+ years experience with digital media/marketing strategy, data analysis and data analytics & visualization Media planning & brand planning capabilities Success in optimizing products and services based on client needs Strong Proficiency in Microsoft Excel Demonstrated success working with cross-functional teams and building strong relationships internally and externally Preferred Qualifications Bachelors’ degree in Economics, Marketing, Advertising, Statistics, Engineering or Business; MBA is a plus Experience in digital marketing or online retail Experience in Omni-channel marketing, display, over-the-top (OTT), or search marketing Adept at solving problems that span business and technology Influence process improvement that scales broadly; inventing and simplifying within existing processes Excellent organizational, relationship-building, and communication (written and verbal) skills Programmatic strategy and implementation experience Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us .   Company - Amazon Advertising LLC  Job ID: A1746815
