Lead the local team through the sales process to win respiratory deals. Developing in-depth knowledge of the sales territory, product lines, markets, sales processes or customer groups. Uses prior experience and acquired commercial expertise to execute policy/strategy.  Qualifications  Respiratory Technologist (RT) with sales experience or Clinical Sales Experience or Bachelors degree with knowledge of the respiratory market Live and travel up to 70% in the West Coast territory. Ability to meet customer site access requirements, including COVID-19 vaccination.  Desired Characteristics  Ability to work in teams and collaborate and lead through influence with the local teams. Ability to articulate to leadership and global the customer needs. Ability to measure and manage towards an operating plan.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.    Additional Information  GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an  Equal Opportunity Employer . Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).  Relocation Assistance Provided: No

jobTitle: Pfizer Connect Area Business Manager (Sales Manager)
description: Role Summary  All over the world, Pfizer colleagues have the opportunity to grow and develop a career that offers both individual and company success; be part of an ownership culture that values diversity and where all colleagues are energized and engaged; and the ability to impact the health and lives of millions of people. Pfizer, a global leader in the biopharmaceutical industry, is continuously seeking top talent who are inspired by our purpose to innovate to bring therapies to patients that significantly improve their lives.  The Pfizer Connect Area Business Manager (PC-ABM) reports into the Pfizer Connect National Business Director and works with U.S. customer facing and HQ teams across the organization. The PC-ABM is responsible to deliver against sales and customer experience objectives for an assigned list of HCP customers via outbound virtual approaches. They are accountable for the supervision, development and leadership of 10-12 Pfizer Connect Health & Science Representatives (PCHRs) at the Pfizer Connect Center, sales performance of the business portfolio of products, development of superior virtual excellence capabilities across the team and business knowledge of the area landscape to assess key stakeholders and future trends within the business marketplace.  This position will require regular in-person coaching and observation of PCHRs at the designated Pfizer Connect Center and frequent customer contact as well as the development of a strong, effective partnership with marketing and channel (e.g., KAMs) colleagues. The PC-ABM will ensure compliant execution by team members, driving understanding of relevant policies and guidance and advancing a culture of integrity.  The PC-ABM will partner seamlessly with Pfizer Connect leadership to deliver the optimal customer experience, advance capabilities and performance of colleagues at the Pfizer Connect Center as well as with BU leadership on the achievement of sales and engagement metrics.  Responsible for supervising operations of the assigned virtual area to include hiring, coaching, representative development, performance management, and the review of key "priority" accounts within the medical community, managing 10-12 sales representatives.  Effectively plan and operationalize a strategy to achieve assigned business and customer experience objectives, collaborating with Pfizer Connect and BU partners, including but not limited to Management Teams, Channel Partners, and other cross-functional partners.  BU Area Ownership / Alignment Develops and implements strategic plans for the assigned virtual area and overall responsibility for budgets in alignment with BU Regional Business Director and Pfizer Connect National Business Director’s expectations to achieve the business potential of the area Proactively analyzes data to identify market trends Collaborates, identifies, & motivates key account development and opportunities that impacts regional / national business Builds relationships with customers (including KOLs) and key stakeholders (including members of the Region Management Teams, Channel Partners, and other cross-functional partners) and utilizes content appropriately for engagement Effectively plan and conduct plan of action and other meetings with BU Area Business Teams, Channel Partners, and other cross-functional partners Collaborates effectively in an integrated account team and champions the value of cross-functional collaboration to deliver on customer needs Leads cross functional partnerships where, for example, the Pfizer Connect ABM partners with their in-field counterpart to coordinate a program for an office / HCP to meet defined needs in a compliant manner Maintains enhanced product and or portfolio, disease state, and market knowledge in order to respond accurately to all questions regarding products, policies, and business-related issues from customers & reps Team Leadership Ensures actions of self and team are fully compliant; has complete understanding of all relevant compliance laws, policies and processes Implements and upholds required Standards with promotional colleagues Ensures appropriate integration with the BU teams for themselves and for the PCHR’s (i.e. with the BU ABM and Region) Applies situational leadership skills and employs multiple and interactive methods of coaching (e.g., virtual ‘ride a longs’, utilization of chat function while shadowing, F2F coaching) to build rep capabilities Builds strong team culture, colleague engagement and morale Promotes a feedback culture and continuous improvement mindset in team to assess quality of customer experience (e.g., uses virtual pulse surveys, team barometers, customer feedback) Set team goals and hold team members accountable for consistent adherence (e.g., time management, technical knowledge, communication, compliance, use of technology) Maintains visibility into individual call planning for direct reports Virtual Excellence / Customer Experience / Pfizer Connect Leadership Works with Pfizer Connect National Business Director and peers to continuously improve performance and execution of promotional skills, product knowledge, and capabilities needed for individuals and teams Uses metrics to continuously monitor and improve the customer experience provided by representatives on his/her team while sharing best practices and learnings with other Pfizer Connect Leaders Builds a diverse, capable pipeline of talent for future Health & Science Sales roles in the BUs Able to expertly operate digital and virtual tools / platforms and trains the team to master all available digital / virtual content Demonstrates advanced virtual communication skills (e.g., empathy, listening, asking probing questions) Models systematic approach to virtual engagement (e.g., clear agenda, next steps/follow ups) Demonstrates remote collaboration skills to seamlessly connect with other BU CFCs and uses digital tools (e.g., digital triage app) Leverages insights and time management from new analytics tools (e.g., Fit-for-Role Profile) Basic Qualifications Bachelor's Degree required 10+ years of required; less with advanced degree At least 3-5 years spent in a position with demonstrated leadership across peer and customer groups. 2+ years of experience in a business or professional setting utilizing computers, software or applications for day-to-day business processes Strong organizational and analytical skills and ability to analyze and draw appropriate conclusions using sales data/call reporting software/applications This position may require travel as needed to develop internal and external relationships. Preferred Qualifications MBA or relevant graduate degree preferred Previous pharmaceutical, biotech, or medical marketing/sales experience preferred Experience working with key thought leaders or high influence customers in large group practices, hospitals, or managed care organizations preferred 2+ years of prior experience with virtual selling strongly preferred Prior management experience including developing, coaching and managing for performance Prior experience discussing negotiated contract terms and options with customers Demonstrated experience facilitating meetings or small group events Non-standard Work Schedule, Travel Or Environment Requirements  Some domestic travel may be required  Other Job Details: Last Date to Apply for Job: Accepting Applications on a rolling basis Additional Location Information: Selected Candidates must be located onsite in Tampa or Lake Forest; this is not a remote/virtual role. Eligible for Employee Referral Bonus Hire Date: February 2022 Pfizer requires all U.S. new hires to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 prior to the first date of employment. As required by applicable law, Pfizer will consider requests for Reasonable Accommodations.  Sunshine Act  Pfizer reports payments and other transfers of value to health care providers as required by federal and state transparency laws and implementing regulations. These laws and regulations require Pfizer to provide government agencies with information such as a health care provider’s name, address and the type of payments or other value received, generally for public disclosure. Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Pfizer intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. If you have questions regarding this matter, please do not hesitate to contact your Talent Acquisition representative.  EEO & Employment Eligibility  Pfizer is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. Pfizer also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act and IRCA. Pfizer is an E-Verify employer.  Sales

Job Description: The Sales Executive plays a key role in driving revenue at CIC Plus. In this position, you will be a trusted advisor to prospective clients and partners using your CIC Plus service expertise and consulting skills to solve their business challenges. You will increase sales performance by working to identify opportunities, develop relationships, present solutions, and establish partnerships with the Fortune 1000 marketplace. The Sales Executive will ensure client expectations are aligned with the CIC Plus offering through close collaboration with CIC Plus internal stakeholders. The Sales Executive also will help represent CIC Plus at trade shows and partner events. The successful candidate must have proven success in a sales capacity within the HCM marketplace. They must have proven strategic, analytical, and consultative sales skills. The candidate should also be a broad-based business thinker who can collaborate effectively with peers as well as all levels of functional and business leadership.   Key Responsibilities: Increase sales performance by partnering with Sales, Business Development and Alliances to present CIC Plus strategies and business solutions. Strong functional and technical knowledge of the HCM marketplace. Strong functional and technical knowledge of the employee life cycle. Build trust and rapport with multiple stakeholders within a complex selling environment. Communicate effectively with a sharp focus on the client and their objectives. Highly organized with the ability to work independently. Highly adept in presentation and demonstration skills. Facilitate business and functional discussions with user groups and senior functional directors. Participate in conferences events and other marketing activities to promote awareness of CIC Plus and our products. Lead discovery sessions to understand client’s business/functional requirements. Collaborate with CIC Plus stakeholders to configure and align solution to client needs. Support RFP response process. Strategic use of competitive knowledge and intelligence. Ability to work and perform under pressure. Develop technical competence and functional expertise across CIC Plus offerings. Ability to learn technology quickly through instruction and self-training. Manage and maintain CIC Plus demonstration environment.  Requirements: 3 years’ B2B sales experience including business equipment, services, or software. 3 years’ experience selling to Fortune 1000 3 years’ experience selling to the HR, payroll, and benefits community. Proven track record exceeding sales quotas Goal oriented and ambitious with capacity and drive to reach and exceed quotas. Demonstrated cold calling sales ability with assertive, positive, and persistent style. Experience working with and leveraging partner networks. Proven client service and relationship building skills. Ability to effectively communicate through all mediums (verbal, listening, written) Aptitude for acquiring sales skills and product knowledge. Organized, with effective time management skills. Ability to work independently and with a team. General business acumen Mature and self-confident Capacity to work under pressure Strong work ethic Committed to building a career path.

Sales Manager Summary: CRG recently launched a direct hire search for a Sales Manager to join our client’s team. Our client is a locally owned and operated Restaurant Delivery Service (RDS) with 25 years of service and a regional presence across 8 cities in North Carolina. The Sales Manager will be responsible for owning the entire business unit focused on sales development and restaurant client relationships, by overseeing and expanding a sales team with the overall goal of growing the company’s footprint.  Reporting directly to the CEO/COO, the Sales Manager is an instrumental part of the leadership team with high visibility. If being a part of a small but driven leadership team going toe-to-toe with multi-billion-dollar companies excites you, then this is the role for you! Benefits/Compensation: $80,000 - $100,000 (dependent on experience) Equity – Up to 2% Healthcare Stipend – Up to $300/month Unlimited Vacation – Employees are required to take 5 consecutive days off at least once per year Simple IRA Location: Remote - within 1 hour of the Triangle in North Carolina (1 weekly meeting required in Chapel Hill) Responsibilities: 80% Leading the Sales Team / 15% Strategy and Market Positioning / 5% Selling Provide input on our value proposition to potential restaurants Onboard and train/retrain the sales team of 3 to onboard restaurants in line with the company’s strategy Build the sales training program for new employees Lead weekly sales team meetings and provide 1-on-1 support to the sales representatives Meet with restaurant owners to understand their concerns and identify opportunities for additional value Work to keep the pipeline of sales talent fresh to continue to grow and onboard quality candidates if needed Understand industry-specific trends and landscapes by analyzing competitors’ offerings and implementing best practices Convey the Company’s value proposition to the social media manager to successfully design advertisements for new restaurants Make strategic partnerships with regional and national restaurants Think holistically about the systems, strategy, and relationships built by considering the restaurant as much as the Company’s gross margin and P&L Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree in business, economics, entrepreneurship, or similar field At least 10 years experience in outside sales as part of a high-performing team or fast-growing company Experience selling to restaurants is a plus Sales leadership experience Strong knowledge of Pipedrive or other CRM software Excellent communication and presentation skills Proven ability to drive the sales process from start to finish Category Code: JN011, JN029

As Bodega Taqueria y Tequila continues to expand its footprint in South Florida we are looking for experienced Sales & Marketing Managers to join our growing team in West Palm Beach. Join a growing brand and an incredible team!  As a Sales & Marketing Manager you will be responsible for the corporate sales and events for one of the Bodega Taqueria y Tequilas, fulfilling all client needs from initial inquiry to execution. You will also be responsible for prospecting, developing strong relationships with customers, overseeing guest activations, marketing events, and branded off site events, as well as being the on-site contact for marketing events.  Responsibilities SALES  Responsible for the organization of private events from a finalized contract through execution. This includes calendaring team, group catering orders, secondary site visits/tastings with client and vendors, detailing BEOs and Event Menus, proactive communication between client, vendors & operations team.  Manage Marketing & Sales Events Calendar on Outlook and Triple Seat. Calendar events must be sent out when an event is made definite.   Facilitate all BEO communication. Maintain communication with chef and managers to inform them of updates and keep correspondence in triple seat.  Attend weekly operations meetings & coordinate effectively with team to ensure all event procedures are being implemented, followed and communicated in preparation for day of event.   Responsible for the execution of every event and must be on site for its entirety.   Manage personal networking calendar on a monthly basis to target new business initiatives  Weekly Reports to be sent out to management and ownership detailing activity for the week, definite, tentative and prospecting events.  Goals will be established and reviewed on a quarterly and annual basis.   MARKETING  Marketing event responsibilities will include building concierge packages, sourcing & purchasing of special events swag, calendar of marketing events & coordination, coordinating local gyms & workspaces marketing happy hours, coordinating local resident building happy hours, and hotel guest activations. All printed items necessary for events will be executed by the Sales & Marketing Manager.  Responsible for communicating to team any website updates related to events as well as signage needed for venue closed during buyouts.   Managing all guest lists for events and optimizing email address collection. Work closely with the Social Media Manager to promote and amplify all branded events and specials, as well as assist in gathering any necessary assets prior to event to promote on social channels. Act as liaison between operations, brand partner, and marketing team to ensure all deliverables are on site for any offsite event. Responsible for working with Graphic Designer to create any necessary branded collateral for events (menus, drink tickets etc.).   Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Business 3+ years' of sales and marketing experience required Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to multi-task Strong verbal, written, and organizational skills

The Account Manager is responsible for the sale of HARTMANN products to healthcare facilities within the assigned territory, focusing on seeking new business opportunities and maximizing current business relationships. The role will cover Oklahoma and Arkansas from a home base centrally located in the region.  Summary of Job Functions Achieve or exceed the annual territory sales target established by the company through strategic planning, relationship building, account targeting, extensive product knowledge and exceptional customer service. Maximize sales profits and increase market share for the assigned region by growing existing customer relationships and establishing new customer relationships. Develop and maintain territory plans outlining how sales targets will be met on an ongoing basis. Effectively communicate appropriate technical, disease state, and product information to customers to drive demand for HARTMANN products. Create and cultivate relationships and build rapport with key customers, decision makers and clinicians. Deliver sales presentations to key customers and customer groups in hospitals, wound care centers, home care and nursing homes. Conduct product demonstrations and in-services for identified customer groups to educate end users on the clinical benefits of Hartmann products. Provide feedback to Sales leadership on market trends, competitive threats, unmet needs, and opportunities to deliver greater value to customers. Demonstrate effective organizational skills, utilizing the CRM system to manage appointments, customers, prospects and sales pipeline.  Desired Skills and Experience Bachelor’s degree from a 4-year college or university 3+ years B2B medical product sales with a strong preference for experience in wound care.  Abilities Required Engaging and capable speaker, presenter and educator with strong presence and excellent interpersonal and communications skills. Ability to build strong relationships with specialists and peers; establish credibility with customers and other key stakeholders; diplomatic, tactful, and empathetic. Customer-focused; understands and delivers excellent information, expertise, support and service. Track record of developing and achieving sales objectives individually and collaboratively. Strong organizational skills with the ability to organize and prioritize multiple tasks. Self-Motivated with energy and passion to pursue goals, with a track record of execution and results. Willing to travel 70% with several overnights per month; maintain a valid driver’s license and clean driving record.

Oliveri Millworks is looking for an experienced Sales Manager for the Miami/ Caribbean region.  The ideal candidate will prospect and close sales leads to help generate revenue for the company. They will also be responsible for developing, implementing, and evaluating the sales strategy.  Responsibilities Connect with local architects, builders, and designers Develop and execute sales strategy through market analysis  Qualifications Experience managing sales teams Experience selling Windows & Doors Experience generate and maintaining relationships with sales leads Excellent written and verbal communication skills Experience with Microsoft Office (Outlook, Excel, Word, etc) Must be local to the Miami/ South Florida area and willing to travel to Caribbean as required.

jobTitle: IVD Inside Sales and Marketing, Remote
description: IVD Remote Inside Sales, Marketing This is a new position created from growth for this work from home role.  RESPONSIBILITIES: We are looking for an experienced Inside Sales Representative to provide excellent customer service to potential and existing customers. You will be responsible for researching, qualifying, and identifying leads. This role will focus on inbound and outbound calls and emails, marketing, and video presentations and tracking those leads to sales. You will take full responsibility for the are numerous inbound leads, request for materials, and marketing data. You will follow up, schedule, and perform video product demos, and track conversion of those leads to customers. The ideal candidate will have strong Inside Sales, Customer Service, and some marketing experience. You must be comfortable on the phone to perform phone and video (Zoom) sales. You must be able to quickly learn the product, it’s all hands-on deck in this small growing company to identify gaps in marketing materials and create or direct development of material for presentations and email distribution. If you have a great attitude, know how to position yourself, can identify and create leads, and are interested inside sales and marketing with unlimited growth opportunity, please apply.  KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, & EXPERIENCE Must have Inside Sales Experience Preference will be given to those candidates with experience with IVD. In vitro diagnostics products such as Flu, IVD, Antigen, Covid), medical device, or similar are strongly preferred to quickly articulate the advantages, selling points, talking points, and market comparisons on product differences. Additional experience, that will be highly considered is prior experience in Inside Sales and Account Management of medical institutions, Physicians staff and offices, Hotels, Labs, or similar. IVD experience is strong preferred but not required. Experience in product demonstrations by video is a plus You must have excellent time management and calendaring Experience with Google Analytics and SEO optimization is preferred. Beneficial: Prior experience with tools such as Hubspot, Marketo, or similar could be beneficial in leading future marketing strategies but is not required.

About Us  KiwiCo is an innovative eCommerce company that sparks kids’ creativity and curiosity through offline and online materials and inspiration. We offer kids a delightful, engaging way to explore, create, and learn. We offer a subscription service that delivers curated hands-on projects to kids. We take great pride and ownership in the products we build and in the community of parents and kids we serve. Our offices are located in Mountain View, within walking distance from the Caltrain station. Currently, we are working remotely. As guidelines permit, we will move to our plan of hybrid, remote/in-office work.  Role And Responsibilities  KiwiCo is looking for an ambitious and self-motivated Account Manager to help drive medium to large Educational account sales across the full range of the KiwiCo product portfolio. The Account Manager will be primarily responsible for refining and executing a sales process to convert inbound inquiries and leads into orders and/or nurturing and growing sales from existing account relationships. Primary responsibilities will include: Helping to build and refine the inbound sale process that provides a great experience for potential and existing customers Testing sales collateral in-market and continuously adding and improving to the portfolio of sales tools over time Advising and guiding potential customers to the right products and solutions based on their unique needs Delivering accurate quotes and pricing within company guidelines and approvals Closing and processing sales and following up to ensure customer needs are met Working with finance to set up and service accounts including tax forms, vendor approvals, purchase orders and invoicing Conducting relationship calls with existing large accounts to drive retention and increase sales penetration within larger organizations Collaborating with business unit partners to align and execute an overall marketing strategy Collaborating with customer care to efficiently manage order processing and on-going customer service needs Delivering weekly/monthly internal sales and pipeline reports to management The Account Manager will be compensated with a base salary and incentives tied to converted inbound leads and/or retention and growth of existing large accounts.  Job Requirements  Successful Account Manager candidates will have the following skills and qualifications: Bachelor’s degree 3+ years in a sales, customer success, or sales development role Experience with CRM or customer management tools (Salesforce, Oracle/NetSuite or similar) Proactive and self-motivated with a high bias for action and drive to crush targets Demonstrated ability to develop trusted business relationships quickly and grow them over time Passionate about customer empathy - ability to listen to and understand customer needs and creatively address them with solutions that exceed customer expectations Effective and engaging written and verbal communication skills with both external customers and internal partners Excellent organizational and time management skills -- detail oriented and meticulous about documenting and following up on customer interactions Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively with internal partners Ability to thrive in a fast paced environment -- start up experience a plus Experience working in the Education sector a plus If you’re passionate about delivering innovative, delightful, and enriching products and experiences for kids, we’d love to hear from you.  Diversity  KiwiCo is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Individuals seeking employment at KiwiCo are considered without regard to race, ethnicity, color, age, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, physical or mental disability, marital status, veteran or military status, or any other legally protected category.

description: What's Volley? We're the first clean tequila seltzer mixing the realest ingredients into pure, canned delight. Volley has been mentioned in over 300 press hits over the past year along with being recognized as a finalist as the 'Best New Spirit Products of 2020' by BevNet, Seltzerland Winner of 'Best Canned Cocktail', and 'Brand of Promise' by Tequila Aficionado.  When founders Chris & Camila realized what's actually in most spiked seltzers, they decided to make their own with only three things. Organic juice. Sparkling water. Premium 100% blue agave tequila from the highlands of Jalisco. That’s it.  We are on a mission to bring good, clean fun to consumers across the US and beyond and looking for top talent to join the journey.  What are we looking for in candidates? We're looking for individuals that are motivated by being a part of something bigger than themselves. We need high energy individuals that thrive in team environments (even remote ones!) that are not afraid to roll up their sleeves and get to work. This is a startup culture in a growth company where the sky is the limit. We reward productivity and value creativity. If you have a track record of success and ready to join something new, we look forward to hearing from you.  Job Description: Responsible for territory sales development & management in New York State  Direct distributor selling activities to achieve sales, distribution and merchandising goals Monitor market pricing to ensure price consistency with brand targets Responsible for educating distributor sales staff on products and brand Management of on & off premise market activity within territories Meet with distributor sales representatives to educate and inspire sales within territory Execute product seminars at accounts and with distributor sales team Stay informed and knowledgeable of customer and consumer trends Provide feedback on effectiveness of marketing and sales initiatives Develop rapport with key retail accounts in region to ensure proper brand distribution, promotion, and shelf management are taking place Manage all T&E expenses and local budgets for market Work with compliance team to stay informed and knowledgeable of all laws, regulations, and policies that govern the market and keep management informed of all information pertaining to changes

Ashling Partners is at the forefront of the hyperautomation revolution! We help clients improve productivity and employee engagement by leveraging intelligent process automation, RPA, Process Intelligence, data capture/OCR and Machine Learning technologies. Our team leverages lean agile principles to make automation gains sustainable and a driving force for digital innovation. As an Territory Sales Executive for Ashling Partners, you will be the focal point in the South Central Region for intelligent automation solutions, where you are the designated expert.  Founded by business process improvement & technology industry veterans, Ashling Partners values meaningful work for our employees while driving real value for our clients in a sustainable and continuous manner. We will always value progress over perfection. While doing so, we strive to continually build a positive, appreciative, and fun culture for our organization. Find us on the INC Best Workplace list for 2021!    Our rapidly growing organization is taking the world by storm, quickly becoming THE global boutique in intelligent automation.  We are looking for life-long learners and servant-leaders who are passionate about innovation and the future of work.  If this sounds like a place for you, we would love to meet you!   What You Will Do: Be the focal point in the defined geography for intelligent automation solutions, where you are the designated expert. Participate in account planning and sales strategy focusing on new customer acquisition and existing customer expansion. Define and articulate differentiators and value for deriving business outcomes through intelligent automation. Must have the ability to understand customer needs and relay our model to meet customers’ business outcome objectives. Actively seek out and participate in both formal and informal training opportunities to continuously develop technical skills and a deeper understanding of the fast-changing intelligent automation landscape. Provide solution gap and development feedback to internal stakeholders. Understand business models, organization, and go to market strategy, leverage where appropriate Shares industry knowledge of customers based on their key drivers internally for new and existing customers Keep sales and customer relationship management data up to date  What You Will Bring: Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in a technical field such as engineering Demonstrated, proven track record of success. Preference will be given to those that have demonstrated sales success in a prior position. Understanding of the SaaS procurement lifecycle, fixed-bid/milestone-based solution sales with a strong focus on business outcomes. Record of accomplishment; a proven drive to exceed. Ability to be a quick learner, and a drive to be a continual learner. Passion for Intelligent Automation and understanding technical capabilities such as Robotic Process Automation, OCR Machine Learning, Process Mining, and more. Desire to achieve a high income and the willingness to put forth the effort to do so. Understands the value of service and the cost of ownership Consistent work effort Willing to be part of a high-trust culture Be able to pay attention to details and perfect the customer experience Lifelong learner mindset Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Strong communication and management skills Understanding of Agile SDLC  Why Ashling Partners: At Ashling Partners we strive to provide meaningful work in a positive, appreciative and fun culture for our own team. All firm members are referred to as “Ohana,” the Hawaiian word for family, with regards to extended family beyond relatives. The concept emphasizes that extended families are bound together by a common belief, attitude or purpose and members must cooperate and remember one another. Lifelong Learning - In the intelligent automation space change happens fast, in order to support that change, Ashling has developed a culture that enables lifelong learners to continuously develop their skill sets Consistently Innovate with Cutting Edge Technology – We offer a continuous model for performance improvement and the opportunity to work with best of breed automation technology stacks Provide Servant-Based Leadership – We believe the leader’s role is to serve the organization, not the other way around Practice Stewardship – We work together as peers, regardless of a person’s formal role or authority in the organization Be Entrepreneurial in Management – We empower people to bring ideas and challenge them with the responsibility to make them successful Offer Open-Book Finance – We give everyone the opportunity to see the books, how we are being measured and what our score is, so they can feel empowered to impact success Provide the Best Service – We may not be the cheapest, but we will deliver the best value to our clients Make Data-Driven Decisions – We are a data-driven organization internally and externally Be a fun place to work - We provide a positive, appreciative and fun culture  What Sets Us Apart: Quarterly book allotment (any book of your choice, no cap!) Uncapped training allotment Unlimited holidays Unlimited PTO! Immediate 401K contributions

description: Strategic Account Manager  The Strategic Account Manager is responsible for driving revenue growth by building and managing large Strategic accounts, long-term client relationships, and developing key business relationships. The role requires a strong focus on new business development, in addition to, up-selling and cross-selling to existing clients and securing contract renewals with a focus on IoT, Healthcare, or Telco industry. This will be achieved through sound account planning, prospecting to identify high-quality clients, qualifying and developing assigned accounts, understanding the client business environment, educating clients on Applause's product offerings, and identifying ways the company can assist clients in solving its application development testing challenges.  Primary Responsibilities:  Develops and executes sales plans and coordinates sales efforts to achieve new customer revenue and existing customer up-sell revenue targets for Fortune 100 accounts Meets or exceeds defined sales quota through strategic account planning, networking, and use of company resources. Strong preference for experience selling technology/ managed services into IoT, Healthcare or Telecommunication Actively participates in regional marketing events for lead generation (industry trade shows, professional associations, etc…) Account Management – Builds client relationships: maximizes Applause’s revenue and profitability potential by up-selling to existing clients, driving renewal revenue and ensuring client satisfaction; Involvement in kickoff meetings, major milestone meetings, and opportunistic participation where senior client decision-makers are present. Sales Leadership – Strategic sales approach, creates value for clients and adds to the company’s capabilities and reputation; Maintains a thorough understanding of Applause’s product offerings and tailoring its presentation to meet the needs of different types of organizations. Assists clients in developing the business case and value proposition for proposed solutions when necessary Collaborates with Client Services Team and Executive Leadership Team in executing the company’s sales process including proposal development. Tracks and maintains all prospect and client activity in Salesforce.com. People Development – Contributes to the growth, development, and positive experience of the sales team.  Qualifications:  BA/BS Degree or equivalent business experience. 8+years of Professional or Managed services and/or solution sales experience.  Proven track record of successful customer engagements across a spectrum of enterprise-class verticals.  Demonstrated success selling to Fortune 100 A strong foundation for strategic and tactical selling of a solution sale. Excellent presentation and negotiation skills. Motivated to advance growth in an entrepreneurial, rapidly growing company environment  Company Description:  Applause ensures digital quality for websites, mobile apps, IoT products and in-store interactions in a way no other approach can – via its technology platform and managed global community of over 600,000 on-demand digital experience experts. Only real people on real devices in real locations can provide the real issues and feedback that brands need to deliver great digital customer experiences. Thousands of companies of every size – including Google, FOX, Nike, BMW, PayPal, and Slack – rely on Applause to dramatically decrease the time and cost of delivering great digital experiences for their customers. Learn more at www.applause.com.  Applause is a place where everyone belongs and where we believe everyone deserves the exceptional. Since our founding, we have continued to celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment. We have a global workforce that, like our crowd, embraces diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and abilities. Our employees bring their true self to Applause. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, religion, national origin, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, veteran status, genetic information, disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. If you are qualified to perform the essential functions of this role, but believe you require a reasonable accommodation to do so, please email adaaccommodations@applause.com.  Please be sure to include the role you are applying for and the nature of the reasonable accommodation you are seeking in your email.

description: About the Position: Optibus is a global SaaS company that provides innovative solutions for public transit planning and scheduling. Optibus is looking for a talented and motivated Account Manager to join our North American Team. As an Account Manager, you will work alongside Regional and Customer Success leadership to manage the commercial business of some of our largest clients. You will navigate some of our most complicated accounts and develop meaningful relationships at senior levels. You will identify opportunities to grow our business with accounts and fuel our post-sales growth engine. You will be working in a challenging, energetic and rewarding work environment with opportunities for professional and personal growth and promotion.  Requirements: • Strong written and verbal communication • Ability to work directly with senior managers at established clients, understand their pain points and translate them into software solutions • Experience cross-/up-selling SaaS solutions to both large and small accounts • Strong team player with ability to work in an international environment • Self-motivated, self-starter, creative thinker • 5+ years of successful software account management or sales experience, preferably with B2B or B2G SaaS companies • Exceptional presentation skills • Consistent track record of developing long-lasting commercial relationships • Adept at working with contracts, amendments, and Requests for Proposals • Technically adept; experienced with web/cloud technologies  Advantages • Public transportation background and networking • Experience working with government procurement departments  About the company: Optibus is passionate about the future of mass transportation – we want more people to use it, and we believe it should take center stage as the world of mobility changes around us. Our vision is to be the technology engine behind better and more efficient means of mass transit, making it the first choice for passengers and cities alike. Our technology is at the center of making this happen, with a unique combination of AI and optimization algorithms, since better scheduling and operations make for better mass transit service, for all. We’re a well-funded startup whose product is deployed at more than 450 cities worldwide, and we are quickly becoming a leader in the space – and our culture reflects this: we like fun and super smart people, and we’re pretty serious about making mass transportation radically better. We have offices open in the US, UK, Brazil and Israel. Optibus.com is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire talented individuals, regardless of gender, race, ethnicity, ancestry, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, cultural background, religious beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

Regional Sales Manager Location: Dallas, TX – Territory covering West Texas, Oklahoma, Arkansas, etc. Salary: $80,000-$100,000 + commission  The Regional Sales Manager is a key member of the organization responsible for sales growth in an assign territory. This individual contributor role requires a hunter mentality that will impact the company’s growth.  Primary Responsibilities: Develop region to increase market penetration of products and meet annual sales goals. Establish and develop customer relationships to grow the sales pipeline and convert opportunities to orders. Identify customer needs and demonstrate the value of products. Work with customers to collect the technical inputs necessary for quotations, performance simulations, application engineering, and manufacturing. Prepare commercial documents including quotations, terms and conditions, and sales contracts. Oversee product installation, assist Engineering with field issues, and train customers on the products. Bookings and Sales Forecasting for assigned territory. Other duties as assigned by manager.  Qualifications: Minimum 3 years relevant sales experience, preferably working with gas compression in the Oil & Gas industry. Proven track record for developing and managing sales opportunities. Progressive responsibility with sales and planning activities. Strong selling and negotiation skills. Established end-user contacts operating gas compression in the upstream, midstream, and pipeline segments. Self-starter with an entrepreneurial spirit and strong analytical and creative problem-solving skills. Must have excellent oral and written communications skills, be well organized and accurate, and have the ability to work on multiple tasks simultaneously. Proficient in PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook, and Word, and have strong computer skills. Strong customer service skills and the ability to interact professionally with peers, leadership, and customers. Open to 75% + travel  Education/Training: Bachelor’s degree in engineering or business is desired.

Job Title: Sales Executive   About the Company Well-funded FinTech startup, working exclusively within the cannabis industry. We build unique solutions, leveraging cryptocurrency and blockchain technology, to create new and better financial services and transaction methods. Additionally, we build, iterate, and maintain cannabis dispensary point of sale systems used all across the country. Our home base is just outside Seattle (Kirkland, Washington).  Top Reasons to Work with Us ●    Our target markets are growing at 25X over the next three years. ●    Being part of this new industry, customers need our innovative solutions making us uniquely positioned to capitalize on a one-in-a-lifetime market opportunity. ●    We have an undeniable positive impact on our customer’s business, providing tremendous value and solving critical pain points. ●    We offer a fun, dynamic workplace staffed by passionate individuals who are committed to achieving something special. ●    Your contributions will be visible and be impactful! ●    Proactivity and risk-taking are encouraged and rewarded. ●    Medical, Dental and Vision coverage ●    You can bring your dog to work!  Role Responsibilities ·      Implementing and executing the go-to-market sales strategy for our Software as a Service products that include both a point of sale system as well as a payment processing platform ·      Owning our sales metrics – delivering on KPIs ·      Executing the sales process: Cold calling, warm calling, lead follow up, channel partner support and management, technology/software presentations and demonstrations, gaining agreement, good CRM hygiene, etc. ·      Communicating and collaborating with our founding team, working directly w/ our Chief Revenue Officer to build a robust funnel of opportunity, delivering accurate forecasts and meeting monthly and quarterly objectives ·      Being the voice of the customer, and providing unique insights about the customers in our target markets and what’s most important to them, so that we can continue to deliver unique and meaningful value.    What’s Needed For This Position  ●     At Least 3 Years of relevant sales experience delivering results for a software or technology company (preferably SaaS and startup experience) ·      Ability to work remotely and independently ·      Solution selling experience ·      Superior listening and communication skills ·      Ambition and the aspiration to capitalize on a unique opportunity ·      You are comfortable being uncomfortable and willing to dive in to solve problems – i.e. – you get the startup life! ·      A willingness to “figure it out” and “make it happen” What’s In It for You ●    You get to work in a fast growing industry currently experiencing insane amounts of growth (opportunity to expand significantly) ●    You get to make a huge difference ●    Stock options, benefits (medical, dental, vision, 401k), expense reimbursement ●    High earning potential  Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Your Right to Work – In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

Division: Sales  Patient Coverage Area: Salida, Colorado  Compensation Range: $55,000-60,000k  Are you in search of a new career opportunity where you are the connection? If so, now is the time to choose Encompass Health as your employer. The Home Health & Hospice division of Encompass Health is hiring!  As a national leader across home health, hospice, and inpatient rehabilitation hospitals, Encompass Health is consistently ranked as a top best-place-to-work in the communities we serve. Our philosophy of delivering a better way to care exemplifies our commitment to quality, compassionate care for our patients, all while fostering a unique culture that is compassionate and collaborative. Encompass Health’s enterprising model of the continuum of care for post-acute services sets the standards for excellence. This is evident throughout all of our care settings and office locations, as we maintain a workplace that is stable, ethical, and supportive. At Encompass Health, we continually invest in employees to assist in them achieving personal goals and make meaningful, measurable differences in the lives of their patients. Subject To Employee Eligibility, Some Benefits, Tools, And Resources Include  Ever-mindful of the need for employees to care for themselves and their families, Encompass Health offers benefits that encourage lifestyle choices that keep you healthy and happy. Generous time off with pay for full-time employees Continuing education opportunities Scholarship program for employees and their children Matching 401(k) plan for all employees Comprehensive insurance plans for medical, dental, and vision coverage for full-time employees Supplemental insurance policies for life, disability, as well as critical illness, hospital indemnity and accident insurance plans for full-time employees Flexible spending account plans for full-time employees Minimum essential coverage health insurance plan for all employees Electronic medical records & mobile devices for all clinicians Incentivized bonus plan Responsibilities  Encompass Health - Home Health & Hospice is searching for an experienced account executive to join our team as an Area Sales Manager. We offer a structured, fast paced environment with exceptional benefits.  Responsibilities Include Represent Encompass in activities involving professional relationships with physicians, hospitals, public health agencies, nurses' associations, state and county medical societies to apprise them of the availability of services. Implement programs and protocols that provide improved home health care and hospice services. Serve as a public awareness representative for Encompass. Responsible for public education relative to home health care and hospice services available through the agency and methodologies for obtaining such services. Responsible for meeting and/or exceeding referral and admission goals as set by Division Manager. Qualifications  Previous home health or hospice sales experience is preferred, but talent and demonstrated sales performance is equally important. Must have a college degree, or at least one year of sales or business experience, or be a licensed nurse. Ability to develop and support referral source relationships. Ability to thrive in a fast paced environment. Must be comfortable with making cold calls. Ability to execute presentations to physicians with confidence and composure. Exceptional and consistent customer service skills. Impeccable verbal and written communication skills.

jobTitle: Product Sales Specialist Anesthesia & Respiratory Care (San Diego)
description: Job Description Summary  As a Product Sales Specialist, you will be responsible for selling solutions for Anesthesia and Respiratory Care to new customers and maintaining relationships with existing accounts in the San Diego territory.GE Healthcare is a place with big impact. We unlock opportunities for our people, our customers, and their patients, turning big ideas into realities that advance global healthcare Job Description  Responsibilities:  Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with healthcare stakeholders within the hospital, (PACU, OR, ICU) to identify qualified leads, grow market share and increase revenue, and reduce customer attrition. Deliver on quarterly & annual orders and revenue sales targets; maximize profit margin on equipment and service contract sales. Leverage product knowledge in our supplies and accessories portfolio to drive funnel growth for the region. Demonstrate expertise in customers’ installed base and develop sales proposals that map with their annual budget process. Collaborate with the account community team to support co-developed negotiation strategies. Reduce cycle time by leveraging Salesforce.com (CRM tool) to track customer and account activity, to map visibility and drive market share, and to prioritize sales funnel.  Qualifications:  Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience and at least one of the following core experiences: 4+ years of consultative sales experience in healthcare capital sales industry including strategic selling and negotiation, 3+ years GEHC experience in customer facing role(s), OR a graduate of the GE Commercial Leadership Program Demonstrated experience presenting complex information both verbally and written to decision makers Must live in the territory and be willing to travel within the territory.  Ability to meet customer site access requirements, including COVID-19 vaccination.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.  GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an  Equal Opportunity Employer . Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).
