description: THG Hosting is an integral part of THG Ingenuity, an end-to-end digital commerce ecosystem built for seamless ecommerce and customer engagement at every touchpoint. THG Ingenuity is the technology platform built to power global ecommerce giant, The Hut Group (THG) and the +110 THG brands. Also enveloped in the THG Ingenuity platform are THG Commerce, THG Global Solutions, THG Studios, and THG Language Connect. Whether a company is looking for B2B conversions and transactions or B2C partnerships, THG Ingenuity has the platform, technology, and services to guide a business from start to finish.  THG Hosting store and serve data from 50+ different locations around the world and provide the foundation for some of the world's leading brands. Our global footprint is composed of an enterprise-grade network designed to facilitate billions of transactions and is completely optimized to deliver content safely and reliably. If you are like us and love cutting edge technology and would like to work with a vibrant, fast-paced team - we want to hear from you!       Key Responsibilities   Develop initiatives to increase new deal lead flow and ways to position THG Hosting within defined target segments and customers across The US. Manage and develop a sales team, recruiting where necessary Adjust to industry trends in order to identify areas of opportunity to increase new revenue for THG Attend industry events and be the face of THG Hosting Develop a clearly defined strategy to penetrate a specific area of opportunity for THG Work closely with Global Head of Sales Development to execute SDR team KPIs. Update and maintain lead and customer information in the company database Primary focus identifying and winning new logos  Requirements:  Degree preferred or related field sales experience across tech/hosting 3+ years of experience in Sales/Business Development role (Essential) Self-motivated and comfortable working independently. Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment Ability to adapt to a dynamic environment and think "outside the box" to creatively solve problems Excellent interpersonal communication and strong presentation skills  Benefits:  Competitive Salary Commission Structure 401k Medical, Dental & Vision cover THG Staff Discounts

Exciting New Business Development Opportunity! Are you an enthusiastic, committed, and dynamic salesperson looking for an exciting opportunity with a fast-growing multinational brand? If so, we just may be the perfect fit. At Sekura Global we are looking for two results-driven New Business Development individuals to drive our high growth strategy.  We are seeking strong candidates that may be based in any major US metropolitan area with close access to the airport. This position offers a generous base and bonus program.  About us: Sekura Global is an expert provider of innovative loss prevention solutions specializing in security tags. We partner with large retailers to save loss and save time. We work closely with our customers to develop discreet, easy to use products that offer a high level of security, protection, and peace of mind. We have offices and warehouses in North America, the UK, Germany, and Australia, with our headquarters based in the UK. We pride ourselves on being responsive and nimble, taking a dynamic approach to combatting retail crime worldwide.  About you: We are looking for an experienced consultative salesperson selling to large retail end users, who is target driven and resilient. The core responsibility of this role is to uncover new sales opportunities and secure new business through meaningful cold calling/emailing, and innovative networking strategies. With a focus on targeted profile customers, largest retailers with a high street presence, you will identify business opportunities, arrange initial meetings, manage quotations, and initial orders, and onboard the customer before handoff to account management.  The ideal candidate will have: 4 years’ corporate sales experience into large retailers as business development manager, sales representative, or similar role   Hunter mentality with a proven track record in building a customer base and increasing sales Strong skills around customer outreach, prospect qualification, persuasive communication, fact-finding, presentation, negotiation, and closing the sale Possess excellent interpersonal skills, having the ability to develop and maintain strong relationships Accountability, accepting responsibility for actions The self-motivation required to reach the goal or perform a task with little supervision or direction Solid time management and planning skills Proficiency in MS Office and CRM software Knowledge of the loss prevention industry, a plus.  BSc/BA in business administration, marketing, or relevant field a plus Ability to travel nationally (limited international travel may be required)  You will have core values of going the extra mile, being customer focused and results driven, as well as a self-motivated team player who is passionate and committed to going above and beyond targets. Does this sound like you? Apply today.

United States, Remote  A superb, wide-ranging Channel Sales Manager role with Flowable, a leading provider of open-source Intelligent Business Automation solutions.  Flowable is a digital platform for business process and case management solutions that – based on our open source engines – connects companies with their customers and automates systems. Our Enterprise and open source products are already being used successfully by many companies around the world. From locations in Europe, North America, Asia and our headquarters in Switzerland, we help global companies with their digital transformation. With over 20 years of experience in the latest technologies and open source development, our strength lies in the permanent further development of our software. Our more than 400 specialists use their digitization expertise to work with our technology partners to implement individual solutions for our customers in the banking, insurance, pharmaceutical and industrial sectors. Learn more about us at http://flowable.com  As a Channel Sales Manager based remotely in the United States, reporting to our Head of Sales & Account Management, you will be responsible for supporting our partners in defining their sales strategy, building successful long-term relationships and achieving your personal sales quota.  What you’ll be doing:  Relationship management – Building business relationships with assigned channel or OEM partners, acting as their first point of contact, providing product training and maintaining high partner satisfaction ratings. Sales support – Preparing business plans together with the assigned partners and supporting them in defining their sales strategy. Assisting with Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs), joint account mapping and pipeline review. Responsibility for hitting sales quotas for partner business. Collaboration -Working cross-functionally with Sales, Product, Engineering, Support, Marketing and other teams to resolve partner business issues and work towards their stated goals.  What you bring:  Do you have a strong interpersonal skills and enjoy building relationships? Are you ambitious with the ability to multi-task?  In addition to strong time management and organisational skills you’ll also bring:  3+ years experience in Channel Sales or Partner Sales within a Software Product Business. Ability to assess, plan, and actively manage a territory to achieve maximum revenue and efficiency. Excellent time management and communication skills. Professional communication skills and the ability to be diplomatic in difficult or stressful situations. Strong phone and interpersonal communication skills. Experience and knowledge of BPM software would be beneficial.  What you can expect:  You will enjoy flexible working-hours, training, and home-office possibilities. However, we think these are the most interesting advantages of working at Flowable.  Career growth – Flowable is a young company where you will be given the room to develop yourself and learn new things intensively while the company grows. Our company culture – We are a dynamic business with an international culture and flat hierarchy. Contribution to Flowable – You will play a vital part in helping shape the continued growth of of a progressive, future-orientated business.  If this describes you and your aspirations, please click on the APPLY button to embark on a new and successful adventure!

Field Sales Manager Coravin, Inc. – Headquarters: Bedford, MA (Greater Boston Area) Job Location: New York City, Boston, Chicago, or San Francisco (remote)   The Position  Reporting to the Senior Director B2B Sales, Coravin’s Field Sales Manager will achieve sales volume and distribution objectives of the company by managing and coaching a team of On-Premise Sales Representatives to make their standards of performance goals through proper planning, organization, training, and execution. You will work in tandem with the Senior Director of Sales, Trade Marketing Manager, Inside Sales Representative, and Coravin Brand Ambassador.     Responsibilities  Lead, develop, and manage a team of On-Premise Sales Representatives; evaluate performance against established developmental goals Pre-plans prior to the beginning of each sales period by holding a one on one meeting with each representative, strategizing on how best to achieve goals and objectives, and when applicable, helping representatives define target accounts. Conducts effective one on one weekly sales meetings with Restaurant Account Managers by communicating sales objectives and programs, identifying opportunities, reviewing performance against goals, and guiding team members on how to close gaps. Addresses any skill deficiencies of Restaurant Account Manager by developing customized coaching plans, tracking progress, and recording improvement against them. Demonstrates strong customer orientation by maintaining relationships with key accounts, identifying account opportunities, performing customer business reviews, developing opening orders with new accounts, and resolving customer complaints. Participates in the associate interview and selection process by working with human resources to source candidates, schedule interviews, conduct interviews, and manage the onboarding process. Establish KPI’s for success and corresponding reporting to be shared up to leadership. Resolves customer issues by following appropriate administrative processes and company policies and escalating issues to management as appropriate. Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed. Develop territory sales plans to achieve goals and objectives taking into consideration unique customer segments Coach each sales consultant on the effectiveness of their Sales pre-plan including agenda, visit notes, opportunities, to align with the territory sales plan Coach each sales consultant on how to build an effective pipeline of opportunities in CRM to achieve their Objectives; increase product knowledge, resolving workload issues, encourage satisfaction, and cultivate career growth Analyze and manage team expenditures to conform to budgetary requirements Perform other job-related duties as assigned Identify and attend industry events, associations, and clubs supporting restaurants and hotels to gain access to owners/proprietors, beverage/wine directors, and Sommeliers.   Key Candidate Characteristics The successful candidate will have a leadership style that includes the following characteristics:  Highest ethical standards. Highly motivated, self-directed, action-oriented, with exemplary decision-making skills. Proven ability to lead, own, and drive customer programs in B2B channels. Tenacious, with a strong constitution, ability to hold their ground with conviction in their decisions. Fearless confidence with fact and data-based belief in their ideas, and the ability to manage up and fight for what is needed to succeed. Solution-oriented, actively watching the market and competition to generate new ideas and stay a step ahead of the curve. People enabler, empowering others through your actions, providing educational tools and a game plan that encourages autonomous follow-up. Non-acceptance of the status-quo. Continuous improvement mindset, always looking to one-up your best work. Strong project management skills and ability to quickly react to changing priorities and deadlines. Outstanding verbal and written communication skills. Ability to anticipate challenges before they arise and propose appropriate solutions. High energy, grit, results-oriented, and determined to do all that is necessary to assist in the success of the company—Have a “nothing is beneath me” attitude.  Data and insights-driven, using the information to justify actions and investments. Attention to detail with an orientation towards repeatable and efficient processes.  Minimum Requirements Bachelor’s Degree with emphasis on business management, sales, or marketing fields A minimum of 5 years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. 3+ years in early-stage/start-up environment a plus An understanding of wine and spirits is required. Must be a results-oriented professional with excellent verbal/written communication skills using diplomacy and discretion as well as strong customer service skills. Ability to multi-task, work independently and/or within a team, pay attention to detail and meet deadlines Proficiency in Microsoft Office: Word, Excel, and PowerPoint Expected to spend 85% of the time in the trade, with 15% office time   The Company  Coravin, Inc. is the first and only global wine technology company transforming the way people enjoy wine. Through our innovations, we empower amateur and professional wine lovers alike to develop their mastery of tasting, serving, drinking, storing, and marketing wine. We design and market the award-winning Coravin Wine Preservation System, which enables wine lovers to pour any wine, in any amount, without wasting a drop.  With availability in over 60 countries and driven by a group of passionate executives with deep consumer product experience, Coravin is changing the way the world enjoys wine. Our retail footprint is growing rapidly with national availability with Bloomingdale’s, Neiman Marcus, Sur La Table, Bed Bath & Beyond, Best Buy, Williams Sonoma, and more. Coravin is also powering some of the world’s best wine-by-the-glass programs at premium restaurants around the world.  Coravin is quickly building buzz and momentum – This year, we’ve been featured in hundreds of articles, everywhere from Mashable, BBC, and USA Today to Good Morning America and Today Show. The world is talking about the future of wine preservation – find out what they are saying! See www.coravin.com for more information   Equal Opportunity Employer  Coravin is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Coravin is devoted to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Coravin are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, medical condition, ancestry, age, veteran status or any other status protected under federal, state or local law. Coravin will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of the previously stated characteristics. Coravin is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

jobTitle: B2B Sales and Marketing Business Communications Partner
description: B2B Sales & Marketing Business Communications Partner (Experienced Level Professional)Michelin, the Worldwide leader in Tires, is hiring! - - - - - - - - - - - - MISSION: Define the strategy and the (non-commercial) internal communication plan for B2B marketing and sales, ensure that the strategy and plan are effectively deployed and that the related risks are carefully managed, so as to contribute to the development of employee engagement, as well as to the achievement of the B2B and the Region’s objectives. This position supports the VP of B2B Sales and the VP of B2B Marketing.  KEY EXPECTED ACHIEVEMENTS Strategy & Communication plan: devising and managing a communication strategy and/or plan serving the Group and/or specific entity’s objectives.  • Oversees and facilitates the design of strategic communication plans, and their alignment with Group orientations. • Adapts the Group strategy for Communication to the current situation and challenges. • Counsels management on their communication actions to effectively deploy the plan. • Collaborates with other entities to propose communication strategies that positively impact the business. • Partners with short-term and long-term customer business teams to develop and execute innovative communication plans and channels. • Establishes communication key performance indicators and relevant metrics and monitors and analyzes results.  Employee Engagement Communication: defining and/or implementing policies, methods and tools conducive to communication with internal audiences. • Creates effective communication plans that promote employee engagement. • Develops comprehensive communication and consultation strategies to support change initiatives. • Gives meaning to the activity to nurture a positive climate and employees' sense of pride. • Counsels management teams on their communication skills to engage their teams. • Identifies gaps or support needed to help individuals and teams to improve their communication. • Prepares communication and stakeholder engagement plans for change initiatives.  Crisis Communication: defining and implementing communication policies, methods, and tools to anticipate and manage crisis situations. • Applies crisis principles to distinguish types and severity of crisis. • Uses advanced crisis communication tools to manage risks in highly complex crises situations. • Identifies risks that cross brand boundaries, requiring mitigation strategies to preserve the reputation of related brands. • Produces and manages the content development with speed of execution. • Supports the spokesperson during times of crisis to deliver key messaging in line with organizational standards. • Recommends notification and monitoring systems used to gather pertinent information.  Event Management: planning, coordinating and managing events e.g. product launches, sales conferences, and corporate events. • Plans, coordinates and manages a complex event, in close collaboration with the project team, events team and the sponsor. • Ensures that all messages are interpreted as intended by the team. • Plans and develops programs, agendas, and services in line with the sponsor's requirements. Requirements  4 Year Degree in Journalism, Communications, Public Relations, Marketing, or related field. Master's Degree a plus. Min. 5 years related work experience, 7-9 years preferred. French speaking a plus.  Moving Forward Together: Apply Today! ADP is hiring a Sales Representative, Mid-Sized Accounts. Are you ready to control your financial future with unlimited upside earnings potential?  Do you want a lasting career with a company that offers autonomy to run a book of business, flexibility to make your own schedule, and gives you work-life balance?  Are you looking for continuous learning and the opportunity to invest in yourself?  If so, then this may be just the opportunity you've been searching for. Read on and decide for yourself.  In this role, you will sell human resources technology within a designated geographic territory to cultivate new business opportunities and drive strategic discussions around Human Capital Management (HCM) initiatives for companies with 50 – 999 employees. You will manage complete sales cycles, sell ADP's suite of solutions (40+ products and services) to executives, and accurately forecast your sales pipeline. ADP is here to support you and your goals with continuous sales training and the latest technology to set you up for success as you manage your book of business. You'll spend most of your time doing what you do best – selling in the field. But that's not all. You'll also document and manage multiple sales cycles, sticking with the process through implementation until your new business is up and running on the solutions you sell. As you see more and more deals cross the finish line, you'll reap the rewards with industry-leading compensation, benefits, luxurious incentive trips, and awards. As you strive to grow your career, leaders will back your desire to pursue advancement and provide continual sales training. A little about ADP: We are a global leader in human resources technology, offering the latest AI and machine learning-enhanced payroll, tax, human resources, benefits, and much more. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating an inclusive, down-to-earth culture that welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition as a global Best Places to Work and a recipient of many prestigious awards for diversity, equity, and inclusion, including a DiversityInc® Top 50 Company, Best CEO and company for women, LGBTQ+, multicultural talent, and more. As part of our deep DEI commitment, our CEO has joined the OneTen coalition to create one million jobs for Black Americans over the next ten years. Learn more about DEI at ADP on our YouTube channel: http://adp.careers/DEI_Videos  Ready to #MakeYourMark? Apply now! To learn more about Sales at ADP, visit https://jobs.adp.com/teams-roles/sales/  What you'll do: Responsibilities Grow Our Business While Growing Yours. You will work independently and collaboratively as part of various teams within your assigned geography to close sales, win business, and reach sales goals. Turn Prospects into Loyal Clients and Raving Fans. You will implement a sales strategy targeted to decision-makers and business owners to build a network and capture new business. Deepen Relationships Across the ADP Family. In addition to selling cloud-based human resources solutions, you will strategically cultivate additional business within existing accounts. But it's not all business; you will make life-long friendships here. Collaborate Daily. You will serve as a trusted advisor, partner, and ADP ambassador to your clients, internal partners, and overall network while demonstrating grace under pressure and the highest ethical standards.  TO SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE: Required Qualifications ·       Proven Winner. You have an impressive track record of closing sales, winning clients, and managing a territory. Positive Self-Starter. You have an upbeat, persistent style and the ability to cold call, manage your time well, and can present your ideas in a clear professional manner on paper, in-person, and over the phone. Confidently Fearless. You embrace opportunities, take risks, and challenge the status quo. Entrepreneurial Spirit. You're a natural leader, resourceful, thrive under pressure, and bounce back quickly. Trusted Advisor. You build relationships, live integrity, and deliver on promises…every time.  A college degree is great but not required. What's more important is having the skills to do the job. If you don't have a college degree, other acceptable experience could include: Two+ years of quota-carrying, outside business-to-business sales experience Three+ years of relevant experience in HCM, technology, business equipment, uniform, or software sales Prior military experience that focused on teamwork, resilience, negotiation, trust-building, and a "never lose" mentality earned as part of the military to build relationships, impact businesses for the better, and achieve success.  Bonus points for these: Preferred Qualifications ·       Ability to successfully build a network and effectively use social media for sales  YOU'LL LOVE WORKING HERE BECAUSE YOU CAN: ·       Be yourself in a culture that values equity, inclusion, and belonging and creates a safe space for diverse perspectives and insights. ·       Belong by joining one of nine Business Resource Groups where you can connect globally with networks and allies who share common interests and experiences. ·       Grow your career in an agile, fast-paced environment means plenty of opportunities to progress. ·       Continuously learn. Ongoing training, development, and mentorship opportunities for even the most insatiable learner. ·       Be your healthiest. Best-in-class benefits start on Day 1 because healthy associates are happy ones. ·       Balance work and life. Resources and flexibility to more easily integrate your work and your life. ·       Focus on your mental health and well-being. We're here to provide exceptional service to our clients, and none of that happens without each of us taking care of ourselves and being there for one another. ·       Join a company committed to giving back and generating a lasting, positive impact upon the communities in which we work and live.  ·       Get paid to pay it forward. Company-paid time off for volunteering for causes you care about.   What are you waiting for? Apply today!

Mayflower Medicinals, Inc (MMI) is part of a larger, well-capitalized network of companies brought together to support best-in-class licensed cannabis cultivators, processors and dispensaries throughout the United States. We are a patient first focused organization providing top quality medical cannabis in a compassionate, warm environment. We aim to be an employer of choice and as such offer a robust compensation package including competitive salary, full medical benefits, and employee discounts!  Summary  The Wholesale Sales Manager reports directly to the Director of Wholesale Operations and is responsible for all daily tasks in their assigned area. The Wholesale Manager is responsible for managing wholesale accounts, executing wholesale transactions, and driving revenue growth and profitability. This position is also responsible for building effective and lasting wholesale partnerships to develop the market for company brands.  Key Responsibilities  The Wholesale Manager is responsible for the following: Building a sales pipeline. Creating implementation plans to support execution of company initiatives to achieve both operational excellence and business results. Establishing a predictable and reliable cadence with wholesale customers, internal management and other internal departments to ensure team development, growth, performance, awareness and transparency to progress, inhibitors and successes Actively reporting on progress of wholesale program Collaborating on and own development and communication of pricing programs. Identifying opportunities to optimize selling opportunities within assigned territories. Working closely with marketing to optimize promotion and product awareness. Utilizing financial tools and analyze financial reports to identify and address trends and issues in the company’s performance. Working collaboratively across the organization to develop and drive the company’s wholesale strategy. Providing day-to-day assistance with the wholesale team and execution of corresponding wholesale plans, including entering sales orders, generating inventory pick lists, aggregating COAs (test results), and other day-to-day tasks as needed. Maintaining organized records of all documentation related to wholesale transactions Interacting with peers and operational leadership to develop and implement improvement programs. 20% travel is required Other duties, responsibilities and activities may change to be assigned at any time without notice.  Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree preferred, or relevant combination of education and experience. 3-4 years of sales experience preferred. Proficiency with CRM, ERP, Inventory Tracking software systems and Microsoft Office tools. Excellent presentation skills and strong written and verbal communication skills required. Demonstrated network connections in the domain and relationships with players serving it a strong preference. Demonstrated results in managing complex sales, sales programs and portfolios of initiatives through excellent influence skills. Demonstrated ability and proven track record in the driving process, efficiency and growth improvements/results. Big picture thinker, strategic, but able to distill functions and business interactions into the tactical/detailed process and work flow in order to drive improvement and efficiency gains. Effectively demonstrate analytical skills, change management and financial acumen. An effective and persuasive communicator with outstanding presence, presentation and negotiation skills that constantly strives for simplicity and clarity. Team player. Able to travel, as needed, including weekends where necessary to drive sales.  Physical and Environmental Requirements:  The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. jobTitle: Sales Enablement Business Partner (Alliances and Channels)
description: There is only one Data Cloud. Snowflake’s founders started from scratch and designed a data platform built for the cloud that is effective, affordable, and accessible to all data users. But it didn’t stop there. They engineered Snowflake to power the Data Cloud, where thousands of organizations unlock the value of their data with near-unlimited scale, concurrency, and performance. This is our vision: a world with endless insights to tackle the challenges and opportunities of today and reveal the possibilities of tomorrow.  Snowflake, the company that delivers the Data Cloud to Mobilize the World’s Data, is actively seeking a Sales Enablement Business Partner to support the Alliances and Channels segment.In this role, which reports to the Director of Sales Best Practices and Enablement, you will be a key contributor to the vision and realization of our overall Alliances Enablement Strategy and a strategic conduit between alliances and the sales organization.  YOUR PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES WILL BE TO: Collaborate with leadership on an annual enablement plan that aligns with the Alliances strategy and goals; and lead communication, associated change management and overall execution of the plan. Establish yourself with the Alliances leadership as a key member of their extended leadership team. Collaborate with leadership on best practices and playbooks. Define and deliver corresponding enablement needed for successful implementation and adoption. Collaborate with the Global Sales Onboarding team to shape and continuously refine the onboarding program so it is relevant for Partner Alliance Managers. Ensure Partner programs and customers are represented to the field in a relevant and an effective manner. Build strong partnerships and align with internal and cross functional SMEs on enablement content creation and delivery. Manage the intake process and prioritize enablement requests based on expected business impact. Demonstrate discipline to build, work and strategically revise the plan versus reacting and responding to ad-hoc requests. Collaborate with your Sales Enablement peers on common needs across the business to create greater scale, and share content and other enablement artifacts to reduce unnecessary work. Take a hands-on approach in building, implementing and managing critical enablement programs that ensure the organization is well-equipped with the content, training and resources to meet and exceed quotas.  QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS: A minimum of 12 years of related experience with a focus in enterprise software, sales and alliance enablement. Bachelor’s degree Strong business, technical and sales acumen. Understanding of complex sales cycles, processes and methodologies. Experienced in designing, building and delivering enablement programs. Ability to lead through influence. Ability to establish executive sponsorship and secure support from a diverse group of internal stakeholders and cross functional partners to successfully deliver programs. Ability to manage competing priorities across multiple projects, while meeting deadlines and producing quality deliverables. Highly organized with excellent communication skills (including presentation skills). Experience working in a fast-changing environment that requires strategic thinking, resourcefulness, agility, results-oriented decision making and commitment to excellence. Direct enterprise software sales experience, as an Account Executive or Partner Alliance Manager, strongly preferred.  Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.  How do you want to make your impact?

Acquia empowers the world’s most ambitious brands to create digital customer experiences that matter. With open source Drupal at its core, the Acquia Digital Experience Platform (DXP) enables marketers, developers, and IT operations teams at thousands of global organizations to rapidly compose and deploy digital products and services that engage customers, enhance conversions, and help businesses stand out.  Headquartered in the U.S., Acquia has been named a top software company by The Software Report, rated a leader by the analyst community, and named a top place to work by the Boston Globe and the Boston Business Journal. We are Acquia. We are building for the future and we want you to be a part of it!  As the Mid-Market Account Executive, you will... Identify new business opportunities, manage, and close deals in Acquia’s Middle Market account and prospect base Engage with senior level executives within these organizations Develop positive relationships and identify prospect needs at all decision-making levels Stay current on competitor offerings and be able to identify their strengths and vulnerabilities Turn client feedback into meaningful strategies to drive new business and address competitive risks Influence client decisions and advocate for client needs to broker win-win solutions Work closely with various functional teams including Product Development, Account Management and Project Management teams to ensure seamless implementation and effective ongoing account growth Handle full-life cycle sales in an individual contributor environment Collaborate efficiently across internal teams and nurture an atmosphere of trust and open communication Engage with our channel partners and various subject matter specialists to drive sales opportunities. Travel to client meetings as needed Work cross-functionally with demand generation and marketing teams to cultivate pipeline  You’ll enjoy this role if you are/have… Intellectual agility and an entrepreneurial attitude; demonstrates drive, initiative, energy and sense of urgency in acquiring and serving clients Ability to learn and absorb new products quickly and rapidly adapt to changing business and customer demands Smart, results-oriented, upbeat, and has regularly out-performed his or her peers Looking for aggressive career growth Passion, drive, and creativity  What you’ll need to be successful... Bachelor’s Degree Strong sales/client origination experience, preferably with CMS experience Experience negotiating large strategic deals including all phases of client development: prospecting, proposal development, negotiation and ongoing relationship management Experience and the know-how to work in a start-up, fast paced technology environment Strong understanding of the SaaS business model for solutions delivery Confident presentation skills, and must have 'presence' in front of the C-suite customer with the communications skills to articulate a value proposition to a wide range of organizational and functional levels  Acquia is an equal opportunity (EEO) employer. We hire without regard to age, color, disability, gender (including gender identity), marital status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable law. Interested residents of Colorado may contact NA-recruiting@acquia.com as it relates to regulation C.R.S. § 8-5-201.

jobTitle: Sr. Territory Business Manager, Cardiovascular Sales at Client
description: Selected opportunity for you: Senior Cardiovascular Retail Territory Business Managers  Company: Bristol Myers Squibb  Industry: Pharmaceuticals  Location: Multiple Locations: South Boston, MA, Lafayette, IN, Omaha/Lincoln, NE  At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.  We are hiring Senior Cardiovascular Retail Territory Business Managers to for several regions across the United States.  What you'll do in the role: Sales candidates must be able to understand and apply knowledge of pertinent health care industry trends, sales trends, market dynamics, competitors, applicable laws and regulations, and health care payer environment, and analyze each of these factors in the development of actionable business plans and in daily execution of sales calls, within compliance guidelines. Develop and implement territory plans that identify and prioritize activities and resources to accomplish short and long-term sales and business goals. An accountable self-starter who can develop deep customer insights, build and maintain strong professional relationships with physicians (primary care and specialists), pharmacists, nurses, office staff and other health care providers in the patient care continuum. Appropriately leverage resources and apply sound account management skills and perseverance to secure customer access and maximize selling time. Utilize deep understanding of disease states, BMS products, and as appropriate, relevant competitor products to tailor interactions with specific customers. Excellent communication skills- verbal and written- including the ability to present to groups. Collaborate across the Cardiovascular sales organization, CV Institutional Territory Business Manager, cross functional teams and where appropriate alliance partners. Work within matrix team to identify opportunities and develop appropriate tactics and strategies. Drive market share growth and maximize sales performance within the indicated use and approved patient types. Possess a high level of ethics and integrity. Adhere to all applicable laws, regulations, and BMS policies.  What you'll bring to the role: Bachelor's degree required. 3+ years sales experience required. Pharma/healthcare sales experience preferred and/or cardiovascular clinical experience is preferred. Experience as full time Institutional Cardiovascular sales representative, cardiovascular clinic experience, clinical lab experience, or prior account management experience working with medical groups is preferred. Demonstrated success in medical profession is advantageous. A strong customer focus and strategic skills to identify and prioritize business opportunities is required. Proven track record in delivering results and developing innovative approaches in evolving markets. Previous new product or concept launch experience desired. Ability to learn, apply, and grow disease state knowledge is required. Ability to effectively communicate technical and scientific product and disease information to a variety of customers in multiple settings. Technical aptitude to learn and apply new technologies to manage a territory is required. Ability to demonstrate ethics and integrity at all times Must reside within a 50-mile radius of the territory epicenter or within the territory geography  As this position requires operation of a BMS-provided vehicle, offers of employment are contingent upon the requirements of “Qualified Driver,” as determined by BMS in its sole discretion, including: 1) at least 21 years of age; 2) a driver’s license in good standing issued by your state of residence; and, 3) a driving risk level deemed acceptable by BMS.  Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.  Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of comprehensive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.

The ideal candidate will help drive revenue growth by building a strong pipeline of sales leads and helping create the market strategy. You will be responsible for establishing a strong relationship with new prospects as well as maintaining a strong relationship with existing accounts. Your effective communication and interpersonal skills will help you succeed as a Senior Account Executive. This is an opportunity to join a growing and profitable business with a diverse and established team of sales professionals. The Regional Sales Manager will plan, direct, and execute the established sales plan to achieve maximum sales volume and market share in their respective territories. This position will also be responsible for managing, leading and working with our independent sales representatives, distributors, OEM’s and end users. The position will report to the Director of Sales and Marketing and ideally will live within the West Coast Territory.  The position requires connecting with people quickly in an outgoing, friendly manner. The successful candidate will have a sense of urgency, combined with getting work done in complete, accurate detail, with the ability to drive results. The candidate must have the ability to sell ideas to others, with the ability to train, teach, and motivate the sales representatives in their assigned territory. The successful candidate must also be able to work in a team environment and interact with all facets of the organization to make decisions that benefit the organization as a whole.   Duties and Responsibilities Sales / Management Skills Direct, coordinate and manage all sales activities in the territory. Achieve maximum sales volume and market share within profitability thresholds. Coordinate with all support sales groups within the company. Analyze sales data to determine sales strategy for the territory. Identify new product/feature opportunities offering competitive advantages and refine the marketing specifications (feature content, cost targets, etc.). Identify and develop (with Product Development Manager and Marketing Manager) appropriate sales tools, collaterals and other brand enhancing material/activities. Be able to read, negotiate and drive customer contracts to acceptable resolution, with the help of appropriate management and legal resources. Promote and execute corporate sales and marketing plans as determined by the company. Interpersonal Skills Interact with all facets of the organization to achieve departmental and overall organizational goals. Coordinate multiple resources to successfully drive and close sales on new and existing accounts. Resolve problems with customers and sales representatives as they arise. Budgets and Reporting Establish high levels of quality, accuracy, and process consistency in planning, and forecasting.  Assign sales force/rep quotas and provide direction and assistance to the sales representatives to meet those quotas.  Education, Training and Trends Institute programs for the continual training and improvement of all sales representatives. Stay abreast of customer, market and technology trends as they relate to current and future business opportunities. Assign sales force/rep quotas and provide direction and assistance to the sales representatives to meet those quotas.  Education, Training and Trends Institute programs for the continual training and improvement of all sales representatives. Stay abreast of customer, market and technology trends as they relate to current and future business opportunities. Participate in appropriate associations to further strengthen relationships in the industry. Understand and reinforce the Thermal Care mission statement and values to internal and external customers;  Requirements Qualifications and Work Experience Bachelor’s Degree in business or technical discipline and/or ten (10)+ years of direct work experience without formal education is required.  Minimum of 5 years of applicable industrial sales/marketing experience selling capital equipment. Experience managing a group of independent sales representative organizations a definite plus. Excellent interpersonal and leaderships skills Technical aptitude Exceptional verbal and writing skills Excellent organizational skills with attention to detail Solid working knowledge of other functional areas within a manufacturing organization (manufacturing, engineering, finance, etc.) Proficiency with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.) Ideal Candidate would reside on the West Coast.

description: Zulay Kitchen is a fast-growing E-Commerce company specializing in high quality Home & Kitchen products.  www.zulaykitchen.com  We are looking for an experienced Wholesale Sales Associate for finding and closing new buyers as well as maintaining relationship with our current buyers. This is a full time position in our Clearwater, FL office (this is NOT a remote position).  Specifically looking for someone who has experience selling to top-tier retailers (Burlington, Walmart, Ross, TJmaxx), as well as other department stores, boutiques, casinos, etc. The position is for an in-house sales rep to join our team and focus on selling our brands to new retailers. You must have your own contacts with buyers and retailers and be experienced in wholesale Home & Kitchen product business.  Maintaining sales support and updates to customers. Driving in new sales by contacting and closing new accounts. Effective verbal and written communication skills including ability to hard sell and close deals. Ability to work effectively both independently and collaboratively. Strong time management skills. Prospect for new accounts.  Requirement: Experience in Wholesale Sales and understanding of product features, product trends and general industry terms, must work well under pressure to meet deadlines & expectation, positive attitude and team player.  Job Type: Full-time Pay: Up to $45,000.00 per year Base Pay. Supplemental Pay: Lucrative Commission Pay.

SolarLeadFactory has helped well over 1 million homeowners looking to buy solar. We have helped hundreds of solar installers grow their businesses - and aim to help hundreds more.  Don't be fooled by our name: we're more than just a 'lead-gen company'. We’re extremely passionate about what we do, and our business is built on a proprietary software platform allowing us to deliver a best-in-class product and innovate constantly. We have in-house developers, digital marketing experts, and data scientists relentlessly driving the product forward.  Our mission: to unlock consumer demand for solar power.  About You: You’re looking for a way to make a huge positive difference in the world & help the companies on the front lines of the solar revolution!   You want to be part of a small but driven team making a big impact on one of the most pressing issues of our time. You share some of our core values including “Work that Matters”, “Make Learning the Key Metric”, “Always be Testing Something,” and “Master your Craft”.  Make no mistake, this will NOT be a ‘coasting & chillin’ type job. However, the success you earn will be rewarding mentally and financially. Sales is a tester and builder of character - and ultimately about delivering solutions to one of the most important problems in an industry that is absolutely critical.  Do you want to learn? To grow? To make a difference?   Critical Skills: Solar experience is not required, but an interest in solar is Ambition to WIN Problem-solving & the ability to find solutions Excellent verbal & written skills Ability to connect with and influence decision-makers Fluidity with numbers  Experience in selling to marketing departments a plus Massive amount of (renewable) Energy, Initiative, Commitment & Perseverance Do-er, creator, “make it happen-er”  Your Mission: We are looking for someone with confidence, commitment & energy to help solar installers grow their business.   If you’re passionate about solutions selling and helping customers get more of what they need (sales) and have an interest in solar energy this might be a great fit!  You will cultivate relationships with the marketing departments and leadership teams of solar installers around the country. Along the way you’ll discover their specific needs, develop solutions to their problems and overcome obstacles to generate success.  We strive not to build the biggest sales organization, but the best. This is about getting really good at sales & helping people to the fullest extent that we can.  You will be joining The Demand Team, we own the core value of “Results”, yet approach each day with humility and the commitment to help our clients succeed. Here is a sampling of the activities that you will be tasked with Mastering:  Creative and candid outreach. We are not in a massive industry and you will be focusing on the top installers in the country.  Diligent Discovery process and samurai techniques like anti-goals to help unlock the true needs and ultimately the path to success. Closing deals and working with Customer Success to ensure accurate and optimal campaign setup. Long term nurture, re-discovery, and growth mapping to achieve what everyone desires: Quality, Consistency & Volume.  What you get out of this: Competitive base + growth oriented commission Results driven organization Remote location - work from anywhere in a North American time zone Your input matters! We look for the BEST. Period. Work in an amazing industry. Your friends & family will say “woah, that’s cool!” Fast-growing, fun-loving company. Get on the rocketship now!  We are shaking up our industry and working day in and day out to get solar on everyone’s roof. Come shape your future & the future of the world.  If you’re game to make a big difference and reap the rewards, come join us!

description: Company Description  Leapgen is a global digital transformation company shaping the Now of Work. We partner with enterprise leaders to better design and deliver workforce services and architect HR technology solutions that meet the expectations of workers and the needs of the business. Our areas of focus include HR Technology, HR Operations and Service Delivery, and Workforce Experience. Leapgen is founded on the core values of Love, Energy, Audacity and Proof. That means we: LOVE what we do, which ENERGIZES us and our clients to do AUDACIOUS things, and PROVE our success - early and often! We’re smart, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. We’re passionate about improving workforce experience and positioning HR to better serve people while acting as a strategic partner to the business. We think differently: transformation is constant, disruption should be healthy and strategic, and people and business are meant to be agile. As such, we encourage and expect our people to be innovative, to do different things. We challenge ourselves to stretch, adapt, learn and improve...constantly. Our customers will tell you we feel like a valued extension of their team because we are.  Job Description  Leapgen is seeking an Account Executive to join our growing company. We are looking for a competitive and trustworthy Sales Professional to help us build our business. You will be responsible for both discovering and pursuing new sales prospects and maintaining customer satisfaction and uncovering business opportunities with current clients. In this role, you will be a part of our ‘grow’ team, we are growth-focused and execution-oriented. The goal is to meet and surpass the company’s expectations to drive rapid and sustainable growth. As a sales executive, you will generate sales with both new and existing clients. The ideal candidate will have the drive, motivation and ability to build and maintain quality relationships! Conduct market research to identify prospects and evaluate customer needs in areas, such as digital workforce experience, HR transformation, shared services, and change management consulting services. Actively seek new contacts and sales opportunities by cold-calling, networking, social media connections, and through our vendor-partner relationships. Partner with our consulting services and solution provider practices teams to drive opportunities and relationships forward. Set-up meetings with potential clients, listen for areas of opportunity and formulate innovative solutions to help solve business problems. Prepare and deliver engaging presentations outlining the services offered by Leapgen. Participate on behalf of the company in marketing events, conferences and networking activities. Build and maintain strong relationships with customers, and key internal and external stakeholders. Build and maintain strong relationships with partners in the industry. Build, review and communicate proposals, negotiate pricing and close deals. Stay current on leading practices and innovative technologies that support digital workforce transformation. Work collaboratively with marketing, business development, solution provider practice, and services teams to delight our customers and ensure best possible experience and overall satisfaction. Qualifications  Your Knowledge, Experience, And Abilities Proven experience as a sales professional Self-motivated, results-driven, and a passion for sales Demonstrated ability to influence (providing options with pros, cons) on key decisions during the sales process Strong communication skills (both written and verbal), including the ability to deliver compelling presentations to prospects and existing customers Proven "hunter” track record of consistently over-performing quota and ranking in the top-tier of the sales force Proven track record with C-level professionals Experience in Consulting Services, HR, and/or HR Technology highly desired Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, management, HR, or related field Additional Information  Location and Travel: Remote (continental US) Travel - as needed as pandemic recedes How to get started: If you’re excited by the idea of seeing yourself in this role at Leapgen, please apply with your CV and a cover letter that best expresses your interest and unique qualifications. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.  Here Are a Few Ways We Put This Into Action  Leapgen makes an oath to protect people in the workplace. We are committed to reducing conscious and unconscious bias and fostering a judgement-free workplace that celebrates diversity. We want you to shine through a great interview experience. When we reach out to schedule a conversation, we’ll ask whether you require any accommodation to make that so. We don’t seek culture fit; rather, we seek and welcome diverse ideas and perspectives that can enhance our culture, showcase new perspectives, and challenge our thinking. You can be you here.

description: What we are looking for:  The Business Development Representative (BDR) will drive demand for XRHealth in a variety of ways including; qualifying and converting inbound leads from marketing and referrals by making follow up calls and emails and setting appointments. This person needs to be comfortable engaging with prospective patients.  Role Responsibilities: Receive pre-determined groups of prospects back from sales for further nurturing using both the telephone and email Process and qualify all inbound leads Educate the patient about the patient journey and next steps, including guidance on the company’s product and it’s components Provide accurate weekly forecasts on the volume of opportunities created Track and manage prospecting, qualification and nurture activities in Salesforce Role KPIs: Number of appointments set Patients converted to initial evaluation from leads Role Requirements: Bachelor’s degree preferred 1+ year in patient facing, healthcare, or insurance industry experience strongly preferred; experience in a sales role Comfortable making a high volume of calls on a daily basis Salesforce Experience preferred This person will be expected to work from our Brookline, MA office Preferred Competencies: Strong verbal and written communication Active listening to assess prospect needs and opportunities Ability to articulate a reasonable premise for every call Ability to perform prospect and account research to prepare for calls; uses social media tools to monitor targeted accounts and identify trigger events for follow up Ability to interpret data to personalize outbound communications Discipline to maintain high call volumes (:40 or more outbound calls per day) Natural curiosity to interface with others and ask questions; not easily intimidated by lack of knowledge or the seniority of the prospect Exhibits empathy for other's problems and challenges Competitive and motivated; self-starter who takes initiative to achieve goals Team player who is coachable and has an eagerness to learn Powered by JazzHR  floF0IaaNC

The N2 Company is looking for an experienced sales leader to join our team as our new Director of Corporate Sales.  Our ideal candidate will also have experience with both print advertising and selling digital tactics and strategies.   N2 is a growing company based in Wilmington, North Carolina, though most of our team members are currently working from the comfort and safety of their homes and many will continue to have the opportunity to do so indefinitely. Our team designs, prints, and ships more than 800 monthly publications across the country. Our mission is to help small businesses win every day. The Director of Corporate Sales will be responsible for driving sales for N2’s corporate-owned publications – that is, those run by W-2 team members instead of our franchisees.  Interviews for this opening will be conducted over the phone and via video calls. This role has the option to be fully remote or be located at our headquarters in Wilmington once our Home Office safely reopens.    Think you’ve got the attitude AND the aptitude to join our team for this exciting full-time role? Keep reading and then apply today via the link below!  In a Typical Day, You Would:  Work with company leadership in a metrics-driven environment to help reach monthly, quarterly, and annual sales goals.   Devise long-term strategic plans focused on how to drive sales moving forward.  Help develop and cultivate a newly formed W-2 corporate sales team.  Guide the W-2 corporate sales team in their duties and help team members hone their skills and improve their performance.   To Land This Gig, You Need To:  Have 5+ years experience managing a sales team of at least 50-100 salespeople in a large corporate environment.   Have experience managing sales of $40 million to $60+ million.   Have experience working with Small to Mid Sized Businesses.  Have experience with Print Advertising.  Have experience selling Digital Tactics and Strategies.  Have experience building a sales team from the ground up.  Demonstrate leadership skills to oversee teams in multiple markets and different time zones.   Demonstrate skills in media sales.  Be well-versed in recruitment marketing.   Have a proven track record in driving revenue growth.   Have strong, demonstrated experience in a metrics-driven environment.  Be a results-driven individual with exceptional analytical skills.   Some Things We Bring to the Table Are:  Full health care package.   401(k) with company match.   Generous paid time off, including Holiday Break.   Access to a licensed nutritionist.   $7K toward purchase of first home.    Financial planning services.  Employee Assistance Program services.    And while your skill set is important to us, your attitude is just as significant. Our team is made up of emotionally healthy people who genuinely enjoy working together in positions they are passionate about. We do this in a drama-free work culture based on trust, respect, and humility. We promote based on consistent, quality performance and we intentionally nurture our team members’ professional development because we promote from within every chance we get. Our culture is more important to us than our product, though we take a tremendous amount of pride in both. As we like to say, brilliant jerks need not apply!  Think you’d like to interview for this opportunity? Apply now at n2co.com/opportunities !  N2 is proud to provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all team members and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws. N2 complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.   #N2-G-LI    #W2N2
