jobTitle: Sr. Territory Business Manager/Territory Business Manager, Multiple Sclerosis, Mississippi Valley Region
description: Company Description  Much like the periodic table of elements documents the building blocks of the universe around us, the Biogen Elements give shape to our company’s culture. They include fundamentals like a pioneering spirit, strong ethics, personal accountability, inclusivity, agility, and an unwavering customer focus. Because we have a unified approach to our individual jobs, because we are one Biogen.  Job Description  In this field based, specialty sales representative position you will be called upon to sell our Neurology products with key stakeholders in the Multiple Sclerosis community: including Neurologists, allied health professionals, and local MS chapters.  The Sr. Territory Business Manager is responsible for developing and executing on sales plans for their assigned territory.  In this role, you will convey complex clinical and reimbursement information to customers and key stakeholders regarding Biogen products. You must be able to utilize exemplary interpersonal skills and directed probing to uncover and address the customer's educational needs. This position works closely with cross functional peers to help ensure customers are appropriately educated about available Biogen support services, as needed. This role will cover 7 states: AL, MS, TN, LA, TX, FL, AL. Travel expectation is a minimum of 80%, approximately 2-3 overnights a week. Qualifications 5+ years B2B and/or pharma, specialty, hospital, med device/capital equipment, and/or biotech sales required. A breadth of experiences across these disciplines is highly desirable. Proven track record of success as demonstrated by consistent high ranking over 3+ years, achievement awards, etc. Proven ability to drive results in a challenging and ambiguous market; launch, business development and co-promotion experiences are an advantage Tenacious, and motivated outside-the-box thinker who excels in a collaborative team setting. Customer and patient focused and able to uncover obstacles, and strategically drive for results with limited direction and in ambiguity Must have the desire and capabilities to help us achieve new levels of success as we look to the future Driving is an essential duty of this job; candidates must have a valid driver’s license to be considered Education: BS/BA preferred, MBA a plus  Additional Information  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

The ideal candidate is at a manager level: worked with consumer brands, sold a B2B technology or logistics product and is a motivated, well-organized individual who has a deep understanding of prospecting and developing strong relationships with customers.   Responsibilities We want this person to take over some of the existing functions that the cofounders do today: Interfacing with customers Walking the customers through the value proposition Identifying and composing the pitch Refining the contract negotiation and commercial terms List of cold calls and reaching out to those brands Create decks that can actually work with the specific client as well Needs to be strategic because they’re going to learn a ton from the first 20 customers, and they’re the ones who are going to be interfacing with them Reporting to cofounders in the first 6-9 months Needs to identify and understand what value proposition resonates most with the customer Needs to explore the market for our SaaS Platform- so strategy is more important than scaling (volume/BD) for now. Needs to understand FULLY what the value of being a customer is. Needs to be mid-tier and understand both levels and be ready to rise to the top once the go to market functions are ready to expand Not ready to build out full sales team quite yet, commission structure isn’t there yet Has to understand and investigate “how much is each customer worth” so they have to have the ability to dive deep into the financials to investigate/project the value of each customer Need 5/6/7 brands by the first half of next year Report back on the market, create sales decks, help create the business model with cofounders Iterate on the deck Find out what the customer cares about    Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Business 3+ years' of sales experience Excellent written and verbal communication skills

At Talkwalker, our Sales team is responsible to attract, nurture and close business opportunities generated from both inbound, outbound and partner activities. They are responsible to connect with prospective clients to introduce them to Talkwalker and demonstrate the value of our analytics platform throughout the Marketing, Communications and Insights departments.  Key Responsibilities: Effectively communicate Talkwalker’s vision to potential prospects in a well organized, thoughtful approach to Enterprise prospects Generate new business opportunities through outbound prospecting via phone calls, emails, and LinkedIn with support from our world class marketing team Work in tandem with Account Executives to help them identify and develop opportunities within their defined territories Manage pipeline and outreach via CRM and Sales Automation tools Bring a positive attitude to our team on a daily basis   Qualifications: 3+ years of sales or SDR experience, SaaS experience preferred A verifiable history of exceeding personal targets Excellent verbal and written communication skills A sense of accountability and commitment to attain goals The ability to perform day to day tasks with minimal supervision  Strong work ethic

companyName: Talent Acquisitions Group LLC - Executive Search Firm
description: Title: Regional Sales Manager (OEM) Department: OEM Sales Position Reports to: Director of OEM Sales Territory: East Coast / Globally Products: VFD’s / Soft Starters / Complete Systems Location: Remote  IDEAL CANDIDATE: The ideal candidate will have 5+ yrs Industrial Business Development experience selling Industrial Control Package Solutions for applied motor applications directly to OEM manufacturers.   Compensation: ·      Very Competitive Salary + Bonus ·      Full Benefits - Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Disability, 401K Matching ·      Outstanding company culture, valued benefits, and vertical career mobility  Overview: The OEM Regional Sales Manager is responsible for executing strategic and tactical selling and demand generation strategies that accomplish overall company objectives and support attainment of sales, order and price quality financial targets. This position is responsible for managing overall existing customer account coverage and identifying and developing new potential OEM's customer targets.  Primary Responsibilities: Establish and successfully deploy sales and business development strategies and tactics to accomplish successful and profitable growth of Company products in assigned territory, attaining financial objectives established by business leadership Maintain high engagement with customers to ensure excellent service is being provided. Ensure high post-sales satisfaction, facilitating positive long-term relationships and high potential for repeat business with accounts Responsible for successful existing customer and new target account coverage and relationship development through implementation of defined Company strategic initiatives and programs, Manufacturer’s and Channel Programs to ensure strong customer engagement and satisfaction levels Fully leverages company Customer Relationship Management tools to maximize sales and sales management efficiencies in support attaining defined customer engagement KPIs Implement demand generation and product promotional programs to establish and sustain increased demand for Company products Maintain commitment to personal competency and skills development to attain greater specific selling, negotiations and customer engagement acumen Drive culture of partnership with internal functions to support attainment of NPS, margin and market share objectives Monitors and documents customer, industry, competitor, and market trends and changing requirements to help direct future strategic, commercial and product roadmap development Coordinates / provides product and solution training and education to key customers to highlight product unique advantages in support of addressing customer needs Established Success Measures Sales volume in accordance with annual operating plan targets Order (booking) volume targets Price quality targets in support of overall business profitability objectives Customer net promoter improvement targets Quarterly opportunity project / target account pipeline target levels Customer facing activity targets Opportunity update and maintenance frequency  Position Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Business, Marketing, or related area Minimum of three years of experience in sales, marketing, and/or product marketing in a related industry selling technology-based products, including demonstrated success in strategic and solution selling approaches Demonstrated ability to influence, negotiate and understand large project and repeat business opportunities involving technical requirements as well as commercial and legal terms Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables. Ability to read, analyze, and interpret common technical journals, financial reports, and legal documents Ability to effectively present information to top management, customers, channel partners, and other employees of the organization Ability to work independently and consistently meet deadlines Requires strong commitment to customer service and teamwork Ability to travel 50% or more, depending on customer needs. This includes both air travel and car travel, typically within specified territory, as well as travel to Pittsburgh (headquarters) as needed. Ability to conduct customer visits in person and participate in plant tours. These tours typically involve walking through industrial manufacturing environments where this position may be in the presence of mechanical, electrical, and powered industrial equipment. These tours typically require standing, walking, and balancing for extended time periods (hours at a time). Ability to effectively present information to top management, customers, channel partners, and other employees of the organization. This may include standing and/or walking for extended time periods (hours at a time).  Additional Desired Skills: Demonstrated applications and/or commercial experience with Low Voltage and Medium Voltage Drives, Soft Starters and Full Voltage Controls Experience with Microsoft Sales CRM or related system

About The Role  The Account Associate - Outdoors role is a great opportunity to hone your relationship management skills. This role will help our team manage all Outdoors brand and distributor partners and deepen our relationships.  The role will be critical to growing our highest-value brand relationships and ensuring new partnerships are successful.  Responsibilities: Work with our Category Management and Business Development teams to manage relationships with key partners via email, phone, video, and face-to-face meetings. Act as air traffic control between partner teams and Curated functions. This may involve: Inventory planning: organizing and managing brand purchase order deadlines and MAP calendars, creating purchase orders, and creating SKUs Inventory operations: coordinating shipping confirmations Product/engineering: ensuring drop-ship feeds are compatible with our systems Content: requesting and collecting brand photography/videography assets Merchandising: collecting product attributes Marketing: coordinating co-op marketing programs Fulfillment: streamlining all customer support / warranty requests to the brand Experts: creating brand-training programs to ensure that our experts are up-to-date on the latest and greatest outdoor gear Build processes and standardize best practices for success Analyze and report on partner success, track partner KPIs Train partners on new Curated features or products Strategize creative ways to strengthen relationships Act as an enthusiastic ambassador of Curated’s mission  Qualifications Experience: the account associate should have at least 1 year of experience in sales, operations, account management, management consulting, finance, or other similar functions Passion: we care a lot about our business, our experts, and the outdoor industry. The account associate should be able to get brand partners fired up about working with us and our experts. Creativity: the account associate should be able to think of creative ways to improve our relationship and help our partners succeed on our platform. Analytical thinking: the account associate will own reporting on partner success. This will involve pulling reports from our BI tool (Looker), so the account associate should be comfortable with data. Extreme detail-orientation: the account associate will be communicating with and juggling many brands at once.  Why you’ll love working at Curated:  A fantastic team: We’re a group of ~80 industry veterans with experience at LinkedIn, Facebook, Google, McKinsey, Bain, and more. We’re extremely technical (our entire website, including checkout and our chat function, are entirely proprietary. No Shopify or Intercom here!).  Inspiring experts: Everything we do is to make our experts successful. When our experts are successful, our customers have an amazing experience and get products they love. Our experts are students, firefighters, teachers, stay-at-home moms, golf pros, authors, retired restaurant managers, and more.  A delightful product: When an expert and a customer click, the end result is magical.  Our commitment to diversity and inclusion  Curated is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We encourage candidates of all backgrounds to apply, as we strive to build a marketplace that serves every demographic with the highest level of quality and respect. We’re committed to growing and empowering a more equitable, diverse, and inclusive community within both the outdoor and the tech industries.  Powered by JazzHR  46lzrIafWx

description: Established in 1898, Potter Electric Signal Company has earned a reputation worldwide as an elite provider of Fire and Sprinkler Alarm products. The Potter brand name and our logo have become synonymous with quality products and service. Products identified by our logo assure the purchaser they are receiving the highest level of protection available in the industry.  Potter Electric Signal Company's People Vision is to provide employment opportunities to those individuals who are performance driven, dedicated to meeting the needs of the business, take pride in their work, team players, and are enthusiastic and passionate about their job.  As the Southern California Regional Sales Manager for Potter’s Fire & Security division, you will be responsible for increasing Potter’s market share in both the wholesale distribution and engineered systems sales channels with a wide range of fire alarm, fire sprinkler, emergency communications, and security products, software, and services. This position will support and help grow our existing account base, as well as prospect, qualify and onboard new customers. Key emphasis will be on supporting the following activities:  What You Will Do: Significantly grow the sales revenues in the Southern California territory. Maximize sales efforts by effectively managing your time and territory. Create and maintain a territory sales plan to meet annual KPI’s and other financial goals. Perform market analysis to determine customer needs and propose high impact activities. Work very closely with customers to implement new products and required training. Represent company at trade association meetings/shows to promote products and services. Deliver sales presentations to customers and other stakeholders. Manager core travel and entertainment budget on a weekly, monthly, and yearly schedule. Capable of time and territory management to be effective in calling on customer base.  What You Need: Be a goal oriented, driven, and enthusiastic self-starter. A minimum of 5 years of direct fire alarm or related industry sales or technical experience. Strong business acumen and analytical skills. Strong listening skills with the ability to quickly identify customer needs. Ability to travel up to 75% of the time. Occasionally non-standard work hours are required for meetings and other industry events. Able to understand and effectively communicate technical information to channel stakeholders including sales, management, installation, service, engineering staff as well as to local fire officials. Professional verbal, written, and presentation skills. Ability to empathize with the target audience and tailor communications to that audience. Strong software skills MS Office, Salesforce, and Potter developed software products. Valid Driver’s License and Reliable Transportation. The ability to work remotely on the road and in a home office environment.  Potter Electric Signal is an equal opportunity employer and, as such, affirms in policy and practice its commitment to recruit, hire, train, and promote, in all job classifications, without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, gender, age, national origin, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, citizenship, eligible veteran status, disability, or any other status protected by law.

Company Description  Alside, a division of Associated Materials Incorporated (“AMI”), is a federally designated essential business and recognized leader in the home improvement industry. Founded in 1947, Alside is a manufacturer and distributor of vinyl siding and accessories, vinyl windows and patio doors, and fencing and railing products for the residential and commercial remodeling and new construction markets. Alside products are distributed to licensed professional remodeling contractors and home builders through our network of over 100 Supply Centers and also through select independent distributors across the U.S. and Canada. We are proud to be a charter member of the Vinyl Siding Institute, the American Association of Architects, the National Association of Home Builders, and the National Association of the Remodeling Industry.  Job Description  SUMMARY:  Reporting to the Area Sales Manager, the individual in this role will be primarily responsible for developing target accounts and maintaining and driving new business within the Long Island construction markets.  Sales Skills  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Leads all sales and account/planning, forecasting, reporting, management efforts for assigned accounts within territory Understands, assesses, and anticipates customers’ objectives, strategies, and requirements to identify and pursue sales opportunities Acquires new customers to maximize supply center revenue Responsible for escalated customer service issue follow-up, but not the primary contact point for issue resolution Management/Leadership Works closely with supply center and corporate resource to have them enter & fulfill orders Strong knowledge of the AMI sales process and policies (e.g., accruals, credit, expenses, rewards) Acts as a mentor for Sales Representatives Product/Market Brings core product specification knowledge, application, and value to the customer Understands necessary building codes and how they impact AMI products Reads blueprints and understands take-off capabilities for core products Sells remodeling, new construction, project work, and ISS Must be able to accurately and professionally demo all core products to small and large groups Must be able to accurately and professionally demo all core products to small and medium groups Understands the basics of negotiating correct market value pricing for the assigned territory, and seeks advice from the Area Sales Leader or Sr. Sales Manager Qualifications  Education And Experience Successful sales history with 2 + years of outside sales experience. Experience within the building materials industry is highly preferred. Bachelor's degree preferred Self-directed, highly organized, customer-focused, detail oriented, and competitive Working knowledge of core building material products (specifically windows & siding) for both single and multi-family applications Proven experience in new business selling, upselling, and selling Preferred experience working with builders and architects to create bigger ticket sales Additional Information  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.  Recruiters: Please note that Associated Materials, Alside and any of its affiliated companies does not seek or accept unsolicited resumes or offers of recruiting service associated with any published or unpublished employment opportunities. Any unsolicited information sent to AMI or any of its employees will be considered as unencumbered and free from any fee or charge whatsoever. Only members of our Human Resources Team have authority to engage or authorize recruiting services. Any questions regarding recruiting services of any kind must be sent to jobs at associatedmaterials dot com  #Indeed5-Alside

We are seeking a talented individual to join our organization as an Business Development Manager on our sales team. As a Business Development Manager at the Bump Club & Beyond, you will be responsible for managing our sales programs along with the strategic planning initiatives.  What You’ll Do: Drive revenue growth through endemic and non-endemic BCB programs Identify new revenue opportunities and strategies to pursue new opportunities and clients Prospect for and generate new client leads to build on current client database Work with account management and content teams to ensure success of client sponsored programs and identify opportunities to increase and exceed client expectations and deliverables Monitor competitors, retailers and industry to gather information on pricing, products, launches, new innovations, new services, etc.  What You’ll Bring: 3-5 years of Sales and/or Account Management Experience (required) Strong sales presentation and development skills Self-Starter Strong written communication and verbal communication skills Well-organized, detail-oriented, and able to handle a fast-paced work environment Proficient in Microsoft Office: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook & Web browsers Customer service oriented Problem solving and navigating ambiguous situations   About The Bump Club & Beyond: Bump Club and Beyond is the premier parenting resource, influencer and community working with retailers and brands to reach and engage parents with authentic programming and content. Its community of more than 4 million parents rely on Bump Club and Beyond for product recommendations and expert parenting advice. Its unique access to parents and future parents affords brands and retailers the opportunity to connect directly with these primary household purchasers.

HENKEL IS FOR THOSE WHO STEP UP. DO YOU?  At Henkel, you can make a difference and craft your career. That’s why you own your projects and take full responsibility from an early stage. Our unique brands in markets around the world open up countless opportunities to follow your convictions and explore new paths. If you have an entrepreneurial mindset that allows you to always think out of the box - take the chance and shape the digital future together with us.  YOUR ROLE Leads, coaches and mentors sales team members and ensures their respective education and development Executes sales strategy and develops action plans for area of responsibility in line with strategic priorities Coordinates execution of customer roadmap and ensures closure of CRM (e.g. ACE) projects Builds and maintains solid relationships with customers in the assigned territory Delivers sales targets and forecasts (KP OSG and PC % and / or GP% targets) in sales area Ensures efficient geographical coverage and cross-selling opportunities to achieve full business potential (sales and profit) Actively manages implementation of price strategy in the region Your Skills Bachelors Degree required. BS in Engineering or Science preferred, MBA in Business preferred 5-7 years of sales management experience Experience in adhesives or material science preferred Demonstrate excellent competencies in all attributes of being a professional sales manager Henkel is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, and other legally protected characteristics.  Henkel does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firms or employment agencies. Unsolicited referrals and resumes are considered Henkel property and therefore, Henkel will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited referral. At Henkel’s request only, preferred vendors may be invited to refer talent for specific open positions. In these cases, a fully-executed agreement with Henkel must be in place and current.  All employees applying for an internal position must have a discussion with his/her manager about their interest in a job posting opportunity. The discussion will not preclude the employee from interviewing if their skills meet the job requirements.

jobTitle: ICE Clinical Sales Specialist - Metro NY
description: Now’s our time to inspire the future of healthcare together.  Siemens Healthineers is a leading global medical technology company with over 170 years of experience and 18,000 patents. More than 48,000 dedicated colleagues in over 70 countries are driven to shape the future of healthcare. We stand with our customers around the world to support them in delivering high quality care to their patients. An estimated 5 million patients across the globe benefit every day from our innovative technologies and services in the areas of diagnostic and therapeutic imaging, laboratory diagnostics and molecular medicine, as well as digital health and enterprise services. This is what truly matters to us.  Join our team now at Siemens Healthineers as ICE Catheter Clinical Specialist  Position Overview  The Ultrasound ICE Catheter Clinical Specialist (ICS) is accountable to provide technical and clinical product support to health care providers and laboratory staff for diagnostic and therapeutic catheters and systems – with an emphasis on Structural Heart and Volume catheters. The ICS is responsible to build and maintain mutually beneficial relationships with physicians & laboratory staff in order to identify and foster interest in new products or product indications to grow and develop the company’s product and technology utilization. The ICS Actively participates in internal/external trainings, maintains optimal scanning techniques and competitive knowledge. Collaborates closely with Clinical Sales Director, National Catheter Director, and the Territory Sales Managers that all business objectives and zone sales goals are obtained  Roles And Responsibilities  Provide expert clinical product and technical assistance and training to physicians and staff on the effective use of AcuNav Volume Catheter. Use consultative selling techniques to identify potential sales opportunities within the account. Maximize customer case support capability through proper planning and scheduling techniques. Stay current on company products instructions for use, best practices and technical troubleshooting, as well as relevant scientific clinical literature and new product information. Prioritize and appropriately respond to requests in a high stress environment and maintain composure and problem-solving focus during stressful interactions. Engage in diagnostic dialogue with multiple internal and external business partners and stakeholders, and formulate solutions based on dialogue and input gained during session. Actively participates in internal/external trainings, maintains optimal scanning techniques and competitive knowledge. Collaborates closely with Volume Catheter Team, National Clinical Sales Director, National Catheter Director and Territory Sales managers that all business objectives and catheter volume sales goals are obtained.  Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience. A minimum of 3 years of experience in clinical echocardiography lab with focus on structural heart and 3D imaging. Must have and maintain certification as a Registered Cardiac Sonographer (RCS) or as a Registered Diagnostic Cardiac Sonographer (RDCS) in adult or pediatric echocardiography. Maintain clinical knowledge of healthcare industry, disease states, and therapeutic and institutional trends. Must be willing and able to travel up to 60% overnight locally, regionally, and nationally, sometimes on short notice. Position requires sitting for extended periods of time, working in a hospital laboratory setting, attending live patient cases, and wearing protective gear (i.e. lead aprons), and willing to work variable hours to meet customer needs. May be required to lift to 60 lbs. Must have a valid Driver’s License  Siemens Healthineers has recently announced the next steps in our continued commitment to prioritize colleague health, comply with customer/business partner requirements, and help preserve our business continuity. Going forward, please be aware that Siemens Healthineers requires full vaccination for COVID-19 for our U.S. employees, contractors, and business partners, where local conditions allow, who: 1) Are customer-facing (e.g., those required to visit a customer/business partner site or interact in-person with customers at any conference or meeting) OR 2) Come on-site, whether regularly or occasionally, at any Siemens Healthineers location. (Note: Accommodations may be requested for certain medical or religious reasons.)  At Siemens Healthineers, we value those who dedicate their energy and passion to a greater cause. Our people make us unique as an employer in the medtech industry. What unites and motivates our global team is the inspiration of our common purpose: To innovate for healthcare, building on our remarkable legacy of pioneering ideas that translate into even better healthcare products and services. We recognize that taking ownership of our work allows both us and the company to grow. We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment and the space to move beyond your comfort zone to grow both personally and professionally.  If you want to join us in transforming the way healthcare is delivered, visit our career site at https://jobs.siemens-info.com/jobs  Organization: Siemens Healthineers  Company: Siemens Medical Solutions USA, Inc.  Experience Level: Experienced Professional  Job Type: Full-time  Equal Employment Opportunity Statement  Siemens is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, creed, religion, national origin, citizenship status, ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability unrelated to ability, marital status, family responsibilities, pregnancy, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity, transgender, sex stereotyping, order of protection status, protected veteran or military status, or an unfavorable discharge from military service, and other categories protected by federal, state or local law.  EEO is the Law  Applicants and employees are protected under Federal law from discrimination. To learn more, Click here.  Pay Transparency Non-Discrimination Provision  Siemens follows Executive Order 11246, including the Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision. To learn more, Click here.  California Privacy Notice  California residents have the right to receive additional notices about their personal information. To learn more, click here.

description: Position Summary / Objective: The Account Manager (Inside Sales) plays a fundamental role in achieving customer acquisition, retention, and margin growth objectives. You will make dozens of calls per day, working with customers, prospects, and channel partners, generating interest, qualifying prospects, and closing sales. You will generate revenue by soliciting and obtaining orders, understanding and interpreting technical requirements, providing technical information, and developing accounts. Supervisory Responsibilities: None Duties / Responsibilities: Source new sales opportunities through inbound lead follow-up and outbound cold calls and emails. Make a minimum number of successful calls per day; successful defined as “a two-way interaction with the decision-maker or influencer to advance the sale.” Understand customer needs and requirements. Cultivate qualified opportunities, close sales, and once account matures, transfer to the appropriate sales executives for further development. Close sales and achieve quarterly quotas. Research accounts to identify key players and generate interest. Maintain and expand database of prospects within assigned territory. Team with channel partners to build pipeline and close deals. Give effective presentation to prospects. Assess competitors by analyzing and summarizing competitor information and trends, identifying sales opportunities. Develop sales opportunities by researching and identifying potential accounts; soliciting new accounts; building rapport; providing technical information and explanations; preparing quotations. Close new accounts by answering telephone and e-mail inquiries; verifying and entering information. Fill orders by transferring orders to customer service; communicating expected delivery date; explaining stock-outs. Develop accounts by checking customer's buying history; suggesting related and new items; explaining technical features. Update all opportunities, activities, and lead advancements in Salesforce or other designated CRM system. Maintain and improve quality results by following standards, recommending improved policies and procedures. Update job knowledge by studying new product descriptions; participating in educational opportunities. Accomplish department and organization goals by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments. Critical Success Factors: Ability to identify, cultivate and close new business for GracoRoberts with customers. Gain solid understanding of GracoRoberts products and services and be able to articulate to customers. Show growth year over year for assigned territory.  Required Skills / Abilities: Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills. Excellent sales and customer service skills. Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail. Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Strong leadership skills. Ability to prioritize tasks and to delegate them when appropriate. Ability to function well in a high-paced and at times stressful environment. Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software.  Education and Experience: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience. Minimum 4 years of proven account management experience.  Physical Requirements / Safety and Ergonomics: Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer. Must be able to lift to 15 lbs.  Travel Required: Limited to none.  Work Authorization/Security Clearance Requirements: To conform to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, including the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) you must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., protected individual as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3), or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State.  GracoRoberts is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.  This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, leave of absence, compensation, benefits, training, and apprenticeship. GracoRoberts makes hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time.

jobTitle: Regional Sales Manager - East Coast Territory
description: Progressive Components has an opportunity for a Regional Sales Manager who will be responsible to maintain and develop the East Coast Territory (Southeast and New England area). The Regional Sales Manager will be managing sales by servicing existing accounts and targeting new prospects. You will be responsible for managing and developing a territory that provides a growth plan consistent with strategic goals. Dedication to achieving company goals will be critical to the success of your overall territory sales.  Responsibilities Responsible for new sales opportunities to increase Progressive Components market and customer base thru direct prospecting and/or following up on leads received. Educating customers on company products and identifies development of proposals to address sales needs. Initiates follow up actions by documenting sales leads. Participates in trade shows and industry events to build client target list, identifies key markets and establishes networks and contacts. Requirements Bachelor's degree preferred. 5+ years technical sales experience in an injection molding field. Previous experience required in the plastics industry. Experience with strategic sales, account management and project management. Must have excellent written and verbal communication. Strong customer communication skills required. MS Office skills are a must. It's of the utmost importance to Progressive that we keep our employees safe and healthy in this ever-changing COVID-19 environment. We require all new team members to be fully vaccinated upon their start date (legitimate accommodation requests will be considered). We have and will continue to strongly encourage our current team members to make this commitment to getting vaccinated to help protect each other, our families, our customers, and our visitors, as we work together to help end the pandemic.

description: Makino is a world leader in metal-cutting and machining technology. As a leader in advanced manufacturing machine tool technology, Makino enables its customers to realize the highest level of quality with the fastest time to market. When companies make the parts that matter for automotive, aerospace, medical, die-mold and other industries worldwide, they make them with Makino.  Summary  Under general direction of the VP Sales, oversees operation of distributors within an assigned territory to get maximum exposure of Company products to potential customers. this individual can be located in Mid-Atlantic Region, Northeast Region, or potentially at our headquarters in Mason, Ohio.  Essential Duties &responsibilities Works closely with marketing department to provide training for distributor personnel to improve their knowledge of the products. Provide leadership to development of annual Sales Plans, execution for those plans, monitoring of plans, and facilitate execution of penetration plans within the regions. Maintains sales management data in SalesLogix to be used for assessing risk in sales plan, understanding new customer penetration, and contributing to a national view of the sales funnel. Monitors each distributor’s effectiveness relative to potential effectiveness of other distributors and effectiveness of competitors in the territory. Motivate distributors. Recommend changes to them. Initiate effective sales programs and coordinate the efforts of Product Managers with Distributor personnel to implement and execute the programs. Function as liaison between distributors and home office. Monitor financial activity of Distributors and assist in collecting money due the company. Supervise clerical functions in regional office and maintain proper records. Qualifications Ability to communicate effectively with both, technical and executive level personnel. Excellent product knowledge relative to product offerings. Excellent presentation skills. Excellent part processing skills with the ability to communicate the complexities to potential customers and distributors. Ability to present a professional image. Ability to negotiate effectively with both, customers and distributor principals. Rational decision-making skill. Ability to travel both domestically and internationally. Education & Experience Minimum of BS degree in mechanical engineering or manufacturing technology engineering or equivalent combination of education and experience. 10 years minimum of metal cutting experience specifically focused on machining center and EDM applications within a manufacturing engineering environment. PHYSICAL DEMANDS  It is expected that this individual would be able to work a standard shift of at least 8 hours, and more as required by the individual project at hand. This individual would be expected to have hands on machine experience, and the ability to operate the equipment on a regular basis as needed, with above average capability and aptitude. This individual should be able to travel by air and automobile. Ability to lift X pounds on infrequent basis. WORK ENVIRONMENT  The work environment will usually be in an office environment, with some work in shop environment as well as travel to customer sites.  We believe that the interests of our company and people are inseparable and we are committed to developing a diverse team of creative and independent professionals. Employees enjoy a stable work environment from a company with years of success and growth in the machine tool industry.  Makino offers competitive pay, generous benefits, and ongoing training.  Makino is proud to be an EEO/M/F/Disabled/Vets employer

description: Overview of the National Account Executive  Primo Water North America is a fast-growing consumer products company that is seeking a National Account Executive for the Lowes Home Improvement retail partnership. This position will report to the VP of Sales - Retail Division to deliver corporate objectives, annual operating plans and sales targets for the assigned account. Responsible for creating, selling in and managing customer-specific business plans that meet and exceed both customer and company expectations.  Job Responsibilities Ownership of Merchant and DMM relationships with the ability to build relationships vertically within Lowes organization Strategic and creative thinking to drive growth across all business segments Proven ability to execute go to market strategy to achieve financial results Strong communication skills Review business trends to increase growth within Lowes Home Improvement Sell Lowes full Primo portfolio (Bulk Water, Dispensers, Water Direct Program, and other products) with a maintain and grow strategy Adjust strategy appropriately in the face of changing business climate Create scorecards to measure and communicate financial results Leverage analytical tools to develop new opportunities and analysis of business trends to provide weekly/monthly updates internally and externally Own development of business reviews, on-going reports and ad hoc analytic needs Proficient in all Internal systems (OTM, Oracle, Salesforce, etc.) Own relationship with Primo Operations, Customer Service and Deployment to manage new store installations, expansion opportunities, and service issues Proactively evaluate the business trends and proposes findings/recommendations Work to prepare presentations, materials, samples etc. for customer Collaborate closely with internal cross-functional teams to develop implementation plans for new products and service offerings Provide regular updates regarding progress towards goals and recommend changes that would improve the effectiveness of achieving the objectives of the customers. The position will be home based in or around Mooresville North Carolina and requires travel up to 30% of the time.   Job Requirements To perform this job successfully, the individual must be able to adequately perform each essential duty. The list below represents the knowledge, skill, and/or abilities required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  The candidate must possess a college degree; a business-related area of concentration is highly desirable. Minimum 2-5 years of progressive job experience in a sales-oriented environment, preferably within the CPG industry Ability to get plans executed using influence (vs authority) Capacity to manage, monitor and drive progress on multiple projects at once; balance of accuracy and speed is critical Strategic planning experience Good interpersonal skills and the ability to provide clear and concise information and direction to cross functional lines of management Excellent communication skills, verbal and written, with both internal and external customers Strong organizational, problem-solving, and analytical skills, including data analysis Demonstrated ability to make successful presentations to individuals and/or groups at all levels of an organization Demonstrates proficiency utilizing computers and Microsoft Office software products Ability to work cross-functionally within an organization Must be willing to travel up to 30% of the time.  Who We Are Primo Water North America is America's favorite water, coffee and filtration solutions provider--reaching customers when, how and where they need water and creating customers for life by making better-for-you beverages easy.  One of North America's largest bottled water companies, we deliver safe, great-tasting water to homes, businesses and retail locations across the U.S. and Canada via 12 regional brands and three national brands -- Alhambra, Canadian Springs, Crystal Rock, Crystal Springs, Deep Rock, Hinckley Springs, Kentwood Springs, Labrador Source, Mountain Valley Water, Mount Olympus, Nursery, Primo, Sierra Spring, Sparkletts and Vermont Pure.  In North America, we provide direct delivery to more than 1.6 million homes and business locations, and over 13,000 retail locations across 42 U.S. states and Canada, covering 90% of the U.S. population and 80% of the Canadian population. We are also proud to provide more than 22,000 water exchange and refill locations.  Please visit our website www.water.com for more information about Primo Water North America. Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled.

WE CONNECT PEOPLE TO THEIR PASSIONS THROUGH GREAT CONTENT  Blue Ant Media is a privately held content producer, distributor and TV channel operator. We own and operate numerous production companies in North America and Asia-Pacific under the Blue Ant Studios banner, creating content for broadcasters and streaming platforms in multiple genres including factual entertainment, natural history, documentary, adult animation and drama. Our distribution business, Blue Ant International, offers a substantial catalogue of content, including one of the world's largest 4K natural history offerings. Blue Ant Media operates channels under nine brands including Love Nature, Smithsonian Channel Canada, BBC Earth (Canada) and more. Blue Ant Media is headquartered in Toronto, with seven international offices in Los Angeles, New York, Singapore, Tokyo, London, Washington DC, and Beijing.  Our productions and media brands are a product of our employees who are passionate experts in all of these areas. They are fanatical about creating outstanding content and experiences; and enthusiastic about delivering it on new and evolving platforms.  We actively seek out people who embody our core values: optimism, creativity, entrepreneurism, agility and integrity. We attract creative talents who are optimistic about the evolving future of content and who take pride in seeing opportunity where others see challenges. We encourage employees to think like small business owners by taking ownership on projects and giving them the flexibility to take risks and embrace an evolving media landscape. Our team members excel at collaborating with internal and external partners and our culture fosters sharing ideas and treating all people with respect.  Are you one of us?  Sales and Marketing Manager (California, Maryland, or New York)  We are currently looking for a Sales and Marketing Manager, to support U.S. and International Channels Distribution. This position is part of the Affiliate Distribution team and is based in the Blue Ant Media office in Los Angeles. The Manager will report to the SVP, Latin America & U.S. Channel Distribution and work across the U.S., Latin America and other international territories as required. The role could be located in either of our offices located in California, Maryland or New York.  If you know the term “FAST Channel” and you get how it differs from an AVOD channel, but you also understand that cable TV still has a very strong heartbeat, this could be the job for you! Blue Ant Media Global Networks is looking for a Sales and Marketing Manager to develop and execute partnership opportunities for the distribution for our Linear TV and Digital channels in the U.S. and international markets.   This person will collaborate with our key partners to select which initiatives are worth doing and then ensure they are done on time and on budget while also meeting key business growth objectives. You must be a self-starter, a strong communicator and work well interdepartmentally (aka be as good with your peers as you are with your clients). If you have a good sense of when the juice is worth the squeeze when it comes to strategic decisions, then please, come forth.   Core Responsibilities & Duties  Develop sales materials and plan pitches to platforms and affiliates utilizing a working knowledge of the Television Channels in the Blue Ant portfolio available for Distribution. Key account management and new account development. Present carriage and distribution opportunities to clients and negotiate deals under the supervision of the SVP, Latin America & U.S. Channel Distribution. Create strong relationships with Pay, Cable, SVOD, OTT, FAST and AVOD clients; Understand their needs and advise on affiliate marketing campaigns to support audience and platform growth. Collaborate with senior management, teammates and partners in sales support (e.g., sales planning, business affairs, marketing and research) to develop general and customized solutions for clients. Work directly with U.S. & International FAST/AVOD platforms to manage marketing initiatives for launching campaigns, monthly highlights and marketing priorities. Develop strong relationships with our U.S. platforms and strategize organic and paid marketing opportunities to boost channel awareness and increased viewership time that drives revenue. Evaluating customer research, market conditions and competitor data. Monitor marketing industry news and submit reports on emerging trends to management each month.  Key Qualifications & Experience High TV IQ -- the candidate must know the pay TV/SVOD/FAST/AVOD & OTT landscape. Strong understanding of all the different OTT and streaming platforms and the effectiveness of the opportunities to our business.  Minimum of 3-5 years of sales and marketing experience. Proven experience in leading the channel distribution life cycle of a deal from pitch to execution in all media (Basic and Premium Pay TV, SVOD, AVOD, FAST, Basic, VOD and EST). Ability to explore new business models/develop term sheets in quick turnaround. Experience working on multiple, prospective deals with the ability to prioritize appropriately. Solid experience in cold calling/effective presentations. Experience in marketing, advertising, digital marketing, and data analytics. Strategic thinker with advanced marketing, sales, negotiation and problem-solving skills. Results-driven, self-starter with strong customer focus and relationship management. Demonstrated history of project accountability. Exceptional verbal and written communication skills. Experience working with both start-up and established businesses. Strong attention to details and excellent interpersonal skills. BA degree, MBA strongly preferred.   Blue Ant Media celebrates diversity in both its programming and workforce. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds who are eligible to work in Canada.  We thank all candidates for their interest in Blue Ant Media and we will reach out to those candidates that are under consideration. If you are contacted for an interview and require an accommodation during the recruitment process, please advise Human Resources.

jobTitle: Sr. Territory Business Manager/Territory Business Manager, Multiple Sclerosis, Detroit N
description: Company Description  Much like the periodic table of elements documents the building blocks of the universe around us, the Biogen Elements give shape to our company’s culture. They include fundamentals like a pioneering spirit, strong ethics, personal accountability, inclusivity, agility, and an unwavering customer focus. Because we have a unified approach to our individual jobs, because we are one Biogen.  Job Description  In this field based, specialty sales representative position you will be called upon to sell our Neurology products with key stakeholders in the Multiple Sclerosis community: including Neurologists, allied health professionals, and local MS chapters.  The Sr. Territory Business Manager/TBM is responsible for developing and executing on sales plans for their assigned territory.  In this role, you will convey complex clinical and reimbursement information to customers and key stakeholders regarding Biogen products. You must be able to utilize exemplary interpersonal skills and directed probing to uncover and address the customer's educational needs. This position works closely with cross functional peers to help ensure customers are appropriately educated about available Biogen support services, as needed.  Territory includes: Saginaw MI, Lansing, Tri-City Area and Metro Detroit area.  Qualifications 5+ years B2B and/or pharma, specialty, hospital, med device/capital equipment, and/or biotech sales required. A breadth of experiences across these disciplines is highly desirable. 3-5 years of pharma, specialty, hospital and/or biotech experience strongly preferred. Proven track record of success as demonstrated by consistent high ranking over 3+ years, achievement awards, etc. Proven ability to drive results in a challenging and ambiguous market; launch, business development and co-promotion experiences are an advantage Documented experience excelling in a collaborative team setting Customer and patient focused and able to uncover obstacles, and strategically drive for results with limited direction and in ambiguity Must have the desire and capabilities to help us achieve new levels of success as we look to the future Driving is an essential duty of this job; candidates must have a valid driver’s license to be considered Education: BS/BA preferred, MBA a plus  Additional Information  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

description: Title: Regional Sales Manager (OEM) Department: OEM Sales Position Reports to: Director of OEM Sales Territory: East Coast / Globally Products: VFD’s / Soft Starters / Complete Systems Location: Remote  IDEAL CANDIDATE: The ideal candidate will have 5+ yrs Industrial Business Development experience selling Industrial Control Package Solutions for applied motor applications directly to OEM manufacturers.   Compensation: ·      Very Competitive Salary + Bonus ·      Full Benefits - Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Disability, 401K Matching ·      Outstanding company culture, valued benefits, and vertical career mobility  Overview: The OEM Regional Sales Manager is responsible for executing strategic and tactical selling and demand generation strategies that accomplish overall company objectives and support attainment of sales, order and price quality financial targets. This position is responsible for managing overall existing customer account coverage and identifying and developing new potential OEM's customer targets.  Primary Responsibilities: Establish and successfully deploy sales and business development strategies and tactics to accomplish successful and profitable growth of Company products in assigned territory, attaining financial objectives established by business leadership Maintain high engagement with customers to ensure excellent service is being provided. Ensure high post-sales satisfaction, facilitating positive long-term relationships and high potential for repeat business with accounts Responsible for successful existing customer and new target account coverage and relationship development through implementation of defined Company strategic initiatives and programs, Manufacturer’s and Channel Programs to ensure strong customer engagement and satisfaction levels Fully leverages company Customer Relationship Management tools to maximize sales and sales management efficiencies in support attaining defined customer engagement KPIs Implement demand generation and product promotional programs to establish and sustain increased demand for Company products Maintain commitment to personal competency and skills development to attain greater specific selling, negotiations and customer engagement acumen Drive culture of partnership with internal functions to support attainment of NPS, margin and market share objectives Monitors and documents customer, industry, competitor, and market trends and changing requirements to help direct future strategic, commercial and product roadmap development Coordinates / provides product and solution training and education to key customers to highlight product unique advantages in support of addressing customer needs Established Success Measures Sales volume in accordance with annual operating plan targets Order (booking) volume targets Price quality targets in support of overall business profitability objectives Customer net promoter improvement targets Quarterly opportunity project / target account pipeline target levels Customer facing activity targets Opportunity update and maintenance frequency  Position Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Business, Marketing, or related area Minimum of three years of experience in sales, marketing, and/or product marketing in a related industry selling technology-based products, including demonstrated success in strategic and solution selling approaches Demonstrated ability to influence, negotiate and understand large project and repeat business opportunities involving technical requirements as well as commercial and legal terms Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables. Ability to read, analyze, and interpret common technical journals, financial reports, and legal documents Ability to effectively present information to top management, customers, channel partners, and other employees of the organization Ability to work independently and consistently meet deadlines Requires strong commitment to customer service and teamwork Ability to travel 50% or more, depending on customer needs. This includes both air travel and car travel, typically within specified territory, as well as travel to Pittsburgh (headquarters) as needed. Ability to conduct customer visits in person and participate in plant tours. These tours typically involve walking through industrial manufacturing environments where this position may be in the presence of mechanical, electrical, and powered industrial equipment. These tours typically require standing, walking, and balancing for extended time periods (hours at a time). Ability to effectively present information to top management, customers, channel partners, and other employees of the organization. This may include standing and/or walking for extended time periods (hours at a time).  Additional Desired Skills: Demonstrated applications and/or commercial experience with Low Voltage and Medium Voltage Drives, Soft Starters and Full Voltage Controls Experience with Microsoft Sales CRM or related system

Recognized as one of Forbe's 2020 World's Best Employers and named to Fast Company magazine's list of 2021 Most Innovative Companies, is seeking to hire a Specialty Development Sales Executive to help identify and shape opportunities for our continued growth across several Clinical Specialty areas, including Infectious Disease, Pain Management, Endocrinology, Rheumatology, Psychiatry, Neurology, Medication-Assisted Treatment, and Orthopedic Specialties.  We believe in the power of science to change lives. We are a leading global life sciences company that delivers answers for crucial health questions -- because we know that knowledge has the potential to make life better for all. Through our unparalleled diagnostics and drug development capabilities, we provide insights and accelerate innovations that not only empower patients and providers but help medical, biotech, and pharmaceutical companies transform ideas into innovations. Here, you can join our more than 70,000 employees, serving clients in more than 100 countries, as we work together to make a real impact on people's lives.  As a Specialty Development Sales Executive, you are responsible for effectively communicating and selling the benefits of our commercial products in a territory that covers the Lower New York City Region.  The right person will have the opportunity to take on additional responsibility with multiple career growth opportunities as we expand our footprint and leadership in the fields of precision medicine and companion diagnostics.  Responsibilities: Meet and exceed sales goals and achieve maximum sales growth in assigned territory Successfully build and execute an annual business plan with quarterly updates Cold call and build a sales pipeline that will provide ongoing revenue goal achievement Accurately forecast and maintain a sales funnel of new opportunities in-line with a 90-day quota Effectively manage travel logistics to maximize sales productivity Successfully sell cross-functionally within a hospital system and laboratory Attend local and national professional trade shows and events as requested Learn and sell Clinical Specialty focused products and services Effectively communicate value propositions to all targeted customers and prospects Perform in-services, training, and implementation with pertinent personnel and physician staff Collaborate and actively contribute to new business opportunities with counterparts Update all relevant customer account information into CRM Data Management Systems Provide ongoing customer support, education on focus products, and market updates for current customer base.  Requirements: Bachelor's degree in the life sciences is preferred A Minimum 5 years of outside sales experience is required Experience in the healthcare or clinical laboratory/medical device industry Proven success managing a book of business Strong persuasiveness as well as influencing and closing skills Ability to understand complex scientific literature and use clinical data as a selling factor Strong communication skills: written and verbal Excellent time management and organization skills Proficient in Microsoft Office including Word, PowerPoint & Excel Must have a valid driver's license and clean driving record The position requires some overnight travel for client visits, sales events, and trade shows.

description: Synology is looking for a Channel Sales Manager for Latin America market in the Seattle area. This exciting opportunity focuses on engaging with existing partners and recruiting new partners to build significant business activity around implementing Synology in their customers' IT environments.  Responsibilities include handling technical specifications and providing support to our resellers, developing and maintaining strong business relationships with partners, supporting key sales presentations, and coordinating multiple resources within an account and successfully closing business deals for Synology.  Our ideal candidate will have technical experience deploying software combined with proven people skills to de-escalate issues. *Successful candidates* will be self-starters, creative, and flexible with a desire to contribute, and an enthusiasm for technology!  Responsibilities Responsible for business development in Latin America from planning, pricing to inventory & supply chain. Provide technical consultation to Latin America resellers. Recruit, develop and maintain strong relationships with channel partners and resellers. Give demos, virtual presentations, in-person presentations to potential partners. Create demand using tools like marketing collateral, campaigns, webinars, events. Travel to customer and partner sites as needed. Work with internal stakeholders (Support, Marketing, Accounting, Operations, etc.) to ensure partners have everything they need to successfully resell. Qualifications English & Spanish fluency required (exceptional written and verbal communication skills in both languages.) Understanding of the local IT market with 3 years of relevant experience in the IT business; from a vendor or distributor is a plus. Experience working with data storage or networking is a plus. Proven record of achieving in sales roles. Must be organized, detail and process oriented. Ability to manage multiple tasks. Ability to work autonomously in a fast-paced, technical and complex buying environment. Attend and manage events and presentations to large groups via trade show booths, reseller events, onsite product training, and more. BA/BS is preferred. Traveling abroad is required We offer Competitive salary Comprehensive benefits package Great team environment Here at Synology, we strive to re-define what a network-attached storage (NAS) can achieve, and to bring unparalleled power and versatility that will revolutionize the way data are managed with a thoroughly new digital experience.
