description: We are looking for a dynamic sales professional to maintain and grow value-added Apparel, Promotional Products and Print revenue from cross-channel business partnerships within existing high potential clients in the Key and Strategic accounts segment. The CPD Development Manager is the primary customer point person for all Graphic Communications needs and acts as the advocate and voice of the customer while identifying growth opportunities within the assigned customer base.    This position focuses on Account Penetration and Relationship Building to forecast business and meet or exceed assigned sales quotas. It is also responsible for data integrity and the accuracy of work products, maintaining customer information in Office Depot’s CRM.  This is a sales position with the primary responsibility for developing cross-channel business partnerships with high potential clients from medium to large-sized accounts which may have multiple locations within a defined geographical territory. This position manages the business relationship with identified accounts that have complex specific adjacency in Copy and Print related needs. In addition, this position assists in the deployment of new products, services, and solutions throughout both BSD and NAR Divisions through established partnerships with other sales associates.  Qualifications Engaged in sales activities outside of the office, face-to-face, including, but not limited to, creating relationships with non-Office Depot customers and develop a clear, complete understanding of their potential business issues and needs for more than 50% of work time. Sales activities also include selling to existing Office Depot customers a further and deeper range of products and services from office Depot. Note: Administrative maintenance and invoicing issues, even when accomplished at the customer’s site, do not count towards the over 50% of work time that is required to be spent in sales activities outside of the office. The primary focus of this position is sales, not administrative maintenance of the customer. Travel is required. Ensure effective execution of tactical and operational Copy and Print segment of the sales plans for all products and services relevant to geographical scope. The Development Manager will stay in tune with the changing demands of the marketplace and provide management with recommendations for training, new products, assortment and service enhancements in Copy and Print segment. ;Works under the direction of sales management to launch all new products, services, and solutions to both NAR and BSD Field personnel within a defined geographical territory. Identifies key targets from region listing & develops selling & penetration plans using a consultative selling approach to offer Copy and Print solutions. Partners with BSD sales associates to achieve a defined contract sales quota based on account/territory potential. Schedules joint face to face calls to customers in attempt to meet and sell Copy and Print programs and solutions. Applies Copy and Print adjacency expertise to design and implement customer programs. Sells to multiple levels of decision-makers within larger, high potential accounts by developing partnerships with customers. Schedules face-to-face contact with current or prospective buyers on a daily basis. Sells value and innovative Copy and Print solutions beyond the core product to meet buyer needs. Directs account sales strategies as they relate to specific Copy and Print adjacency offerings. Designs optimal product/service mix to match essential buying criteria. Partner with Field Support Leaders, RVPs, and BSD Directors & VPs to ensure that Copy and Print adjacency selling programs achieve their revenue and IMU targets.  Other Information  Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience Minimum 3 years’ experience in Copy and Print related field Sales experience, preferably in a complex business-to-consumer and business-to-business service-orientated environment; or demonstration of skills and learning through an internal development program and selection process.  Pay, Benefits & Work Schedule  Office Depot and OfficeMax offers competitive salaries, a benefits package, which includes a 401(k) and more, along with plenty of opportunity to move and grow within our organization! For immediate consideration for this exciting position, please click the Apply Now button.

Position Overview As a Sales Manager North America you will be joining our growing global sales team presenting the Mews offering to hoteliers in the North American region. The ideal candidate will be ambitious, tenacious, and passionate about changing the hospitality industry through innovative technologies. Our goal is to radically change the interaction between guests and hotels.  Responsibilities: Generate leads and revenue by selling Mews Systems to the Hotel & Hostel industry Identify the key regions and segments to achieve success in hitting targets set by you and your Sales Director Generate new business with an ability to grow an extensive, qualified pipeline through a process driven culture that delivers consistent results Demonstrate “high achiever” traits as a strong negotiator with a consultative approach which ultimately cultivates success in every client interaction Create, implement and manage strategic sales plans to achieve high growth targets which you will report regularly to the team Ability to leverage established relationships and proven sales techniques for long-term succes  Requirements Fluent English Previously worked in Hotel/Hostel Sales or Hospitality Software Sales Higher Education preferably in Finance/Business or Management/Hospitality Minimum 3+ years of sales experience The candidate must have the ability to communicate, sell and close business at all levels from Departmental Management to Board Level Ability to work in a fast-paced company, both independently or as part of a team Customer oriented with a mindset focused on being the voice of the customer internally Highly motivated, structured and organized Ability to take feedback, learn quickly and adapt to new situations A driver of new ideas and suggestions in order to move the company forward Outgoing, social, ready to communicate with employees, customers and partners across different countries and different organizational levels A genuine interest in new technologies that bring innovation in hospitality  🎉 What’s in it for you? Did you know that Mews was voted the Best Place to Work in Hotel Tech in 2021? You do now. Most of that is down to our inspiring team, but part of it is because of some pretty amazing perks. As well as awesome colleagues and stimulating work, you'll get: Company shares 📈 Unlimited holiday (no, this is not a typo) 🏖 Health and wellness plans 🙏🏽 Flexible Benefits via Ben Platform 📖 Remote/flexible working 🧘🏻‍♀️ Regular team events, socials and a legendary annual company gathering, Mews Con (the only con that’s actually a pro) 🥳  🤷🏻 Who is Mews? We want to get to know you, so it’s only fair we tell you a little bit about ourselves first. We were founded in 2012 by a team of former hoteliers, and since then we’ve been transforming hospitality for both hotel staff and guests. Essentially, Mews is a powerful software platform that acts as a central nervous system for hotels, hostels, apartments and more. We use smart tech and automation to make day-to-day operations easier for hoteliers, so they can focus on the thing that really matters: providing remarkable guest experiences. More than 2,000 properties across 60+ countries are powered by Mews, with more joining every week. Bookings, payments, operations, guest management – everything a hotel needs to operate can be done through our solution. We work with some amazing hotels, including Sage Hospitality Group, Machefert Group, The Student Hotel, and Tsogo Sun Hotels.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Hospitality

description: Overview: Ever imagined selling a blue ocean product, with no competitors and incredible market demand?  Want to move into the fintech world from traditional financial services?  Ready to go all in to accomplish non-linear career growth?  Then, let me explain the simple math of selling at ForUsAll...  The simple math:   Total 401(k) Assets = $6.7T Total 401(k) Assets in crypto = $0  % of Americans interested in crypto = 60%  # of companies offering crypto in the 401(k) = 1   We’re ForUsAll, a well-established San Francisco-based financial technology company that’s expanding hard-working Americans’ access to 401(k) plans. We just launched the Alt401(k) which allows employees to invest in cryptocurrency alongside traditional mutual funds.  Founded by experts who transformed the 401(k) for Fortune 500 companies, we’re backed by prominent venture capital and financial technology veterans who share our vision of bringing that expertise to small and mid-size companies.  Your Opportunity: As an Account Executive, you’ll help educate clients on how we can immediately improve their 401k plan by offering investments employees care about, ensuring compliance with all regulatory requirements, and lowering the total fees charged to their employee retirement savings. You are provided with 100% lead flow from our internal sales team.   What Is Expected From You: Attend initial client exploration meetings via video conference, set up by our SDR team Identify potential client pain points and help them understand the benefits of the ForUsAll services and platform Research all relevant data on target companies before and during sales process to ensure a successful outcome Continuously expand your financial acumen to ensure you are prepared for all potential client questions and are seen as a knowledge expert on 401k plans and financial products Seamlessly transition potential clients to the Client Advisory and Operations team for implementation and long term support Stay in touch with product team to know the pipeline and time horizon for product updates and improvements so these can be added to your sales process  We’re looking for someone who is competitive, goal-oriented and mission-driven to help fix the retirement landscape. Our team not only values resilience, passion, and empathy but also the drive to build a company from Series B upward; this is not a 9 to 5 career; you will work hard and have a huge upside when successful.  Qualifications Required: Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, or other quantitative focus 5+ years of professional experience; 2+ years building sales pipeline, cold calling, ABM; 3+ years closing Obtain a FINRA Series 65 or hold a prior investment advisor designation  Extremely comfortable on the phone and video conference  Benefits:  401(k) Salary Commission Stock Options Medical - Monthly premium 100% covered by the company for individual Dental - Monthly premium 50% covered by the company for individual Vision  Commuter Pre-Tax Benefits Flexible work environment with occasional remote work opportunities  Closing:  ForUsAll is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status and operate in compliance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.
industries: Investment Management, Financial Services, and Computer Software

description: About The Team  Since 2015, Revolut has introduced over 10 million customers to a new way to handle their money. From instant spending notifications and built-in budgeting controls, to global currency exchange and stock trading, customers simply get more with Revolut.  We approach Sales at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex issues, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. From on-boarding flows to new feature presentations, our goal is to both inform and delight.  Put simply, we build things we want to use ourselves, that we’re proud to show to our friends and families.  About The Role  We’re looking for an experienced Enterprise Sales Manager with proven experience selling SaaS / employee benefit / HR management solutions to join our team in New York (or remote from US). Your mission is to take Revolut’s latest offerings to businesses to market and relentlessly focus on winning net new logo acquisitions of key enterprise accounts.  You will play a central role in developing Revolut’s commercial footprint in EU market. You will help grow our customer base in the territory by coordinating prospecting efforts into target industries and verticals.  What You'll Be Doing  You will be hunting; building a strong network of enterprise customers and opening doors to generate revenue across Revolut’s solutions Own the full sales cycle from outreach to close; engage and align effectively in C-level meetings with Enterprise prospects, actively listen to understand business objectives and challenges, and align Revolut’s solutions to accomplish partner goals You will establish a trusted/strategic advisor relationship with each key customer and drive the continued value of Revolut’s products and services. Manage and report accurate forecast and pipeline, achieve sales goals on a quarterly basis, and mentor sales executives on strategies to reach their goals Establish an effective relationship with internal Operations, Product, Engineering, and Marketing teams to ensure operational excellence  What You'll Need  Minimum 5+ years of experience in sales or business development within a fast paced B2B enterprise Proven track record of selling software / SaaS / web services into large enterprise accounts Have an impressive track record of meeting and exceeding quota on a consistent basis Developed network of contacts, clients, and partners in at least one of the European countries with emphasis on established connections that open doors in verticals like Healthcare, Retail, Hospitality, Manufacturing, Construction, Education, Energy, Transportation etc. Strong presentation and listening skills: comfortable presenting and negotiating with senior executives (C-level) Happy to shift from strategic thinking to rolling up your sleeves and supporting implementation Be able and willing to travel for meetings, conferences and industry events if local policies and guidelines permit  NICE TO HAVE  Entrepreneurial spirit, problem solver and deal closer, with a positive, creative and innovative mindset Experience from reputable start-up is a plus Strong cross-functional project management skills; comfortable in a complex selling environment with multiple decision makers at many levels both internally and externally Highly curious and a quick learner who thrives in a dynamic and fast-paced collaborative environment  A little about us… When Revolut was founded in 2015, we had a vision to build a sustainable, digital alternative to traditional big banks. Our mission now is to help our customers improve their financial health, empower them to have more control, and promote financial cohesion across the communities in which we operate. Launching into 2020 with 10 million Personal customers and over a quarter of a million Business customers only reinforced our belief in the vast need across the world for better financial services. As our customer base has boomed in the last year, we’ve expanded our team to match that growth. We started 2019 with several hundred employees; we closed it out with 2000.  What we’re looking for…Revolut is being scaled up by people all around the world who share our vision. We’re looking for people who align with our five core values: we believe that we Get it Done because we Think Deeper and are strongly rooted in the Dream Team. We Never Settle hence why we always Deliver Wow. You want to join a community of forward-thinking people - we are here for you. We believe in empowering our Revoluters in their work, giving them autonomy and ownership of what they do. We want everyone at Revolut to own their story and their successes - working with us means you’re not just another cog in the machine.  Perks And Benefits  You’ll get to work in one of the hottest and fastest growing tech startups in the world right now We’ll arm you with all of the latest tech equipment Competitive salary Competitive 401(k) plan Competitive vacation policy Flexible work hours  By applying for the above role, you confirm that you have reviewed our Data Privacy Notice for Candidates .
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Do you want to join an international team working to improve the future of healthcare? Do you want to improve the lives of millions of people? Grifols is a global healthcare company which, since its foundation in Barcelona in 1909, has been working to improve the health and well-being of people all over the world. Our four divisions - Bioscience, Diagnostic, Hospital and Bio Supplies - develop, produce and market innovative medicines, solutions and services in more than 100 countries and regions.  Summary  This position offers an exciting opportunity to make an impact on patient's lives! At Grifols we are united around a strong sense of pride - operating under the highest standards for quality and safety to ultimately ensure the health and well-being of people around the world.  Grifols USA Hospital Division provides advanced solutions and cutting-edge technologies to enhance safety and efficacy in the hospital pharmacy, throughout the drug compounding process. Our products, capital equipment, software and devices are uniquely designed to improve institutional compliance with guidelines and regulations, in order to ensure high standards of quality and safety for both the pharmacy staff, and the patients served.  As a Pharmacy Solutions Sales Representative, you will be the point of contact for all of the Hospital Division’s products - driving sales, engaging with current customers, prospecting new accounts and promoting our portfolio of pharmacy solutions in various hospitals and outpatient centers throughout your region.  Primary Responsibilities For Role Increase market share through prospecting, setting appointments, cultivating relationships, discovering business and clinical needs, presenting and providing solution demonstrations, overcoming obstacles, and developing proposals/contracts. Will be responsible for both new business revenue and current customer renewal business within the designated territory. Will assist in post-sales implementation support, if needed. Interface with prospective customers and existing customers to effectively map Grifols solutions to market needs within assigned territory. Drive revenue growth within the assigned territory by meeting with and managing the relationships with key decision makers and those who influence decisions at hospitals and outpatient facilities. Develop and execute strategic business plans to meet established sales goals. Consistently improve working knowledge of the compounding pharmacy, our product applications and competitive products Utilize Salesforce.com for territory management. Collaborate with non-sales team members to ensure optimal client satisfaction. Adhere to all company policies and procedures Additional duties as assigned by manager  Education  A Bachelor’s degree is required, a concentration in business, science or healthcare is strong preferred.  Experience  Minimum of three (3) years of healthcare solutions sales experience, preferably managing complex sales. Pharmacy solutions sales, Electronic Healthcare Records Software sales, healthcare IT sales, medical device sales, or capital equipment sales is highly preferred.  Knowledge, Skills & Abilities Healthcare industry knowledge, preferably with focus on pharmacy, medication delivery workflow and/or Healthcare Information Technology Must be proactive and have demonstrated ability to achieve sales objectives Must possess strong business acumen, along with the personal characteristics of professionalism, commitment to excellence, detail orientation and accountability. Strong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple tasks, priorities and deadlines within a large geographical area. Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to interact with personnel at all levels and manage relationships. Excellent verbal and written communication, including effective presentation skills Experience negotiating contract terms and conditions. Ability to travel 50% of the time A valid driver’s license and good driving record are required. This job description is accurate at the date of publication and may change over time. It is not intended as an exhaustive description of the job. Other duties may be assigned and qualifications required may change. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skills, education, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  EEO Minorities/Females/Disability/Veterans  Grifols is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to compliance with all Federal, State and local laws that prohibit employment discrimination on the basis of race, color, age, national origin, ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, citizenship, genetic disposition or characteristics, disability or veteran's status or any other classification protected by applicable State/Federal laws. We will consider for employment all qualified Applicants, including those with Criminal Histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.

Kuebix is a leading TMS (Transportation Management System) provider that caters to $5 million - $20 billion businesses. We are looking for a driven, enthusiastic BDR who will help identify and cultivate opportunities for the SMB, Mid-Market, and Enterprise sectors of the sales organization. shadowing, coaching Learn best practices and business tools used including, but not limited to, Salesforce, Microsoft Outlook, G-Suite, Drift, Outreach, Zoominfo, LinkedIn and Netsuite Earn a high prospecting and sales activities within Salesforce Understand critical competitive information and discover customer needs Successfully adjust to metric driven environment within your territory Execute high volume of activity with inbound and outbound phone calls, emails, and social outreach Conduct effective discovery calls to ensure leads will convert Within 6 Months, You Will Show strong knowledge of product features, use cases, and competitive landscape Support the advancement of the sales lifecycle for the opportunities specifically including lead nurturing/qualification and deal support Demonstrate confidence and persistence in your pursuit of qualified leads Necessary Competencies Lead Nurture & Management Ability to Work Remotely Cross Functional Collaboration Lead Qualification & Conversion Adaptability External & Internal Interpersonal Skills Organic Lead Generation Intellectual Curiosity Prospect Focus & Orientation Professional Communication Skills Territory Acumen Coachability Required Skills Comfortable making consistent calls and talking to new people each day with the ability to convey commercial insight Ability to multitask, take initiative, prioritize, and manage your time effectively Tenacity to handle rejection and continue with a positive attitude when reaching next potential client Superior communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills, both verbal and written Stay current on industry trends and maintain extensive knowledge of competitor’s offerings Thrive in a small team environment where you can make a big impact Experience utilizing a marketing automation tool; CRM database Competent with M.S. Office and/or Google Office <5% Travel Preferred Skills Experience with SalesForce CRM Transportation or Supply Chain Industry Experience Understanding of SaaS Technologies and Sales BA or Prior Business Development, Inside Sales or Lead Development Experience Experience with Sales Engagement Platforms, Outreach Inc. Experience with a solution-selling methodology or proven experience learning a complicated vertical and/or sales process Our Company  Kuebix (a division of Trimble) provides a Transportation Management System (TMS) that powers North America’s largest shipping community. We are transforming the transportation industry with a common TMS platform for shippers, carriers and intermediaries that enables new levels of visibility and efficiency for the entire market. By connecting all logistics stakeholders on a single platform, shippers gain unprecedented access to available capacity and competitive pricing, while brokers and carriers increase their business and gain superior asset utilization. Kuebix is a modular solution that scales to meet the needs of supply chains of every size and level of complexity. Built on the latest cloud technology, Kuebix’s connected platform simplifies ERP and other integrations, resulting in rapid onboarding and ROI. Trimble is transforming the way the world works by delivering products and services that connect the physical and digital worlds. Core technologies in positioning, modeling, connectivity and data analytics enable customers to improve productivity, quality, safety, and sustainability. From purpose-built products to enterprise lifecycle solutions, Trimble software, hardware, and services are transforming a broad range of industries such as agriculture, construction, geospatial and transportation, and logistics.  Pay Equity  Trimble provides the following compensation range and general description of other compensation and benefits that it in good faith believes it might pay and/or offer for this position. This compensation range is based on a full time schedule. Trimble reserves the right to ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and offer additional benefits and other compensation, depending on circumstances not related to an applicant’s sex or other status protected by local, state, or federal law.  Bonus Eligible?  No  Trimble offers comprehensive core benefits that include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Disability, Time off plans and retirement plans. Most of our businesses also offer tax savings plans for health, dependent care and commuter expenses as well as Paid Parental Leave and Employee Stock Purchase Plan.  Trimble Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, gender, age, color, religion, national origin, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws, or any other protected factor. EOE/M/F/V/D

description: Are you a self-motivated and gregarious business development representative that wants to make money selling an innovative technology? Do you want to join a high energy company with an amazing culture? If you thrive in a competitive and collaborative team environment then this may be position for you!  About Us  ChowNow is unique among tech startups in the restaurant space. We power branded online ordering systems for independent restaurants across North America – via websites, Google, Instagram, and through branded iOS and Android apps – and we do it all for a reasonable monthly fee regardless of order volume. We operate this way because of our belief in being fair, sustainable, and equitable with our restaurant partners. And the same goes for our workplace.  Diversity, teamwork, and mutual respect are among our core company values. And we pride ourselves on giving our teams plenty of opportunities to make their mark. To date we’ve created over 20,000 apps for our restaurant partners – something that’s never been done before in our category. And as we expand to new markets, further spreading the word about the ChowNow difference, those opportunities to create, build, and grow will only increase. If this sounds like the kind of workplace, and the kind of mission, that appeals to you, we’d love to talk.  Learn more by checking out our reviews on Glassdoor (they’re excellent). Together we can preserve neighborhood flavor, one restaurant at a time.  About The Position  The Territory Sales Manager role is a full-time, high base salary + generous commission outside sales position based in Austin, TX. You will sell online ordering and marketing solutions in person within an assigned territory. Most of your time will be spent in the field or working from your home office…which provides lots of freedom and requires self-discipline. We’ll provide you with the right tools and on-going training while you grow our restaurant network and grow your career.  As a Territory Sales Manager, You'll... Execute a buyer centric sales process. This is about solving real problems, not just pitching. Become a world-class social seller and subject matter expert within online ordering and restaurant marketing. This requires building your personal brand online. Meet and exceed a fair quota for new restaurant accounts. Prospect for potential restaurant partners through Internet research, social media, cold calling, “cold walk in’s”, and real world networking. Connect with restaurant owners online, on the phone and in person. Owners are tough to catch so you’ll have to be creative and persistent. Demo ChowNow as a solution to a restaurant owner’s problems & negotiate agreements. Hand-hold restaurants during the setup process while transitioning the relationships to a ChowNow Account Manager. Within 30 Days, You'll... Progress through our Ramp Camp (ChowNow’s New Hire Onboarding Experience). Learn the suite of ChowNow products; be able to discuss the ChowNow origin story with prospective clients. Learn to navigate through salesforce (Creating Leads, Opportunities, Flipping Accounts to “Closed Won” - YESSS!) Start to master your ChowNow pitch, from your elevator pitch to close. Learn the lay of the land, begin to understand your territory at greater length and strategize on what’s your first and next move. (Start to generate leads/ opportunities out in the field). Learn the sales process from A to Z (From finding the leads, to saying hello, to asking for the close and finally making sure everything is correct in Salesforce). Start to build a relationship with your SDR. Within 60 Days, You'll... Hit/ Exceed your ramp quota. Learn to manage your calendar and travel schedule. Become a road warrior by driving activity out in the field. Start to maximize your efficiency and organization . Begin to build relationships with our partnerships (US Foods). Continue to develop your relationship with your SDR, learn how to strategize and become more efficient in the field. Within 90 Days, You'll... Hit/Exceed your ramp quota. Fully understand the sales cycle. Be on your way to become a sales guru. Build a book of relationships with our partnerships that you will use throughout your career here at ChowNow. You Should Apply If You’re an experienced, hungry sales professional with 3+ years of experience, and a proven track record of winning deals in a short sales cycle. You enjoy the entire sales process (prospecting, qualifying, positioning, closing, and supporting client onboarding). You’re genuinely curious about people, local restaurants, and food trends. You enjoy build lasting relationships that enable you to build a book of business where referrals are the norm. You practice as hard as you play. You’re a market expert, you know your competitors, you’re up to date on the latest trends, you’re coachable, and you’re willing to put in the time to master your craft to understand how your buyer makes decisions. Sales to restaurants a BIG plus. The ability to thrive while working in the field with your own home office is a HUGE plus. About Our Benefits Competitive Salary Ongoing training and growth opportunities. A "Best Place to Work" winner multiple times where we focus on creating a great employee experience. A remote first culture and monthly stipend offering flexibility to work where you want and how you want. Rock solid medical, dental, and vision plans. Mental Health Coverage - we offer several programs to support your mental health and wellness goals. 3 weeks paid vacation; paid holidays; we expect you to work hard, but still enjoy your personal life 7 weeks of baby bonding time for all new parents (within the first year of birth or adoption), 8 Weeks of Paid Pregnancy Leave. 401(k) Matching Employer-contributing student loan assistance program. Commuter benefits (including Uber Pool). Employee Stock Incentive Plan. Pet insurance for your fur babies Quarterly Industry Speakers Series. Quarterly Tech Events (Women, LGBTQ, Diversity, Inclusion). Consistent & fair leadership: we’ll share info, set clear goals, show you respect, and treat everyone fairly. Enough freedom to spread your wings while still holding you accountable. Fully stocked kitchen and cold brew on tap. As one of ChowNow’s core values, “Celebrates Diversity”, we are committed to an inclusive and diverse work environment. ChowNow is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status. description: Are you a self-motivated and gregarious business development representative that wants to make money selling an innovative technology? Do you want to join a high energy company with an amazing culture? If you thrive in a competitive and collaborative team environment then this may be position for you!  About Us  ChowNow is unique among tech startups in the restaurant space. We power branded online ordering systems for independent restaurants across North America – via websites, Google, Instagram, and through branded iOS and Android apps – and we do it all for a reasonable monthly fee regardless of order volume. We operate this way because of our belief in being fair, sustainable, and equitable with our restaurant partners. And the same goes for our workplace.  Diversity, teamwork, and mutual respect are among our core company values. And we pride ourselves on giving our teams plenty of opportunities to make their mark. To date we’ve created over 20,000 apps for our restaurant partners – something that’s never been done before in our category. And as we expand to new markets, further spreading the word about the ChowNow difference, those opportunities to create, build, and grow will only increase. If this sounds like the kind of workplace, and the kind of mission, that appeals to you, we’d love to talk.  Learn more by checking out our reviews on Glassdoor (they’re excellent). Together we can preserve neighborhood flavor, one restaurant at a time.  About The Position  The Territory Sales Manager role is a full-time, high base salary + generous commission outside sales position based in Austin, TX. You will sell online ordering and marketing solutions in person within an assigned territory. Most of your time will be spent in the field or working from your home office…which provides lots of freedom and requires self-discipline. We’ll provide you with the right tools and on-going training while you grow our restaurant network and grow your career.  As a Territory Sales Manager, You'll... Execute a buyer centric sales process. This is about solving real problems, not just pitching. Become a world-class social seller and subject matter expert within online ordering and restaurant marketing. This requires building your personal brand online. Meet and exceed a fair quota for new restaurant accounts. Prospect for potential restaurant partners through Internet research, social media, cold calling, “cold walk in’s”, and real world networking. Connect with restaurant owners online, on the phone and in person. Owners are tough to catch so you’ll have to be creative and persistent. Demo ChowNow as a solution to a restaurant owner’s problems & negotiate agreements. Hand-hold restaurants during the setup process while transitioning the relationships to a ChowNow Account Manager. Within 30 Days, You'll... Progress through our Ramp Camp (ChowNow’s New Hire Onboarding Experience). Learn the suite of ChowNow products; be able to discuss the ChowNow origin story with prospective clients. Learn to navigate through salesforce (Creating Leads, Opportunities, Flipping Accounts to “Closed Won” - YESSS!) Start to master your ChowNow pitch, from your elevator pitch to close. Learn the lay of the land, begin to understand your territory at greater length and strategize on what’s your first and next move. (Start to generate leads/ opportunities out in the field). Learn the sales process from A to Z (From finding the leads, to saying hello, to asking for the close and finally making sure everything is correct in Salesforce). Start to build a relationship with your SDR. Within 60 Days, You'll... Hit/ Exceed your ramp quota. Learn to manage your calendar and travel schedule. Become a road warrior by driving activity out in the field. Start to maximize your efficiency and organization . Begin to build relationships with our partnerships (US Foods). Continue to develop your relationship with your SDR, learn how to strategize and become more efficient in the field. Within 90 Days, You'll... Hit/Exceed your ramp quota. Fully understand the sales cycle. Be on your way to become a sales guru. Build a book of relationships with our partnerships that you will use throughout your career here at ChowNow. You Should Apply If You’re an experienced, hungry sales professional with 3+ years of experience, and a proven track record of winning deals in a short sales cycle. You enjoy the entire sales process (prospecting, qualifying, positioning, closing, and supporting client onboarding). You’re genuinely curious about people, local restaurants, and food trends. You enjoy build lasting relationships that enable you to build a book of business where referrals are the norm. You practice as hard as you play. You’re a market expert, you know your competitors, you’re up to date on the latest trends, you’re coachable, and you’re willing to put in the time to master your craft to understand how your buyer makes decisions. Sales to restaurants a BIG plus. The ability to thrive while working in the field with your own home office is a HUGE plus. About Our Benefits Competitive Salary Ongoing training and growth opportunities. A "Best Place to Work" winner multiple times where we focus on creating a great employee experience. A remote first culture and monthly stipend offering flexibility to work where you want and how you want. Rock solid medical, dental, and vision plans. Mental Health Coverage - we offer several programs to support your mental health and wellness goals. 3 weeks paid vacation; paid holidays; we expect you to work hard, but still enjoy your personal life 7 weeks of baby bonding time for all new parents (within the first year of birth or adoption), 8 Weeks of Paid Pregnancy Leave. 401(k) Matching Employer-contributing student loan assistance program. Commuter benefits (including Uber Pool). Employee Stock Incentive Plan. Pet insurance for your fur babies Quarterly Industry Speakers Series. Quarterly Tech Events (Women, LGBTQ, Diversity, Inclusion). Consistent & fair leadership: we’ll share info, set clear goals, show you respect, and treat everyone fairly. Enough freedom to spread your wings while still holding you accountable. Fully stocked kitchen and cold brew on tap. As one of ChowNow’s core values, “Celebrates Diversity”, we are committed to an inclusive and diverse work environment. ChowNow is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.  Read here about your California privacy rights.

description: ABOUT EVENTSFORCE:  Eventsforce is a global market-leading supplier of an end-to-end event management platform that allows events planners to deliver virtual, hybrid and in-person events and meetings and provide great experiences to their attendees.  But we’re not just about technology, we’re about people too! We pride ourselves on building strong, long-lasting relationships with our clients, which is reflected across all our teams from Customer Success to dedicated Account Management and Customer Support.  We are looking to add to our professional, dedicated, and hardworking team an independent, talented, top-notch Director of Business Development with a great work ethic who thrives in organizations that constantly adapt and evolve.  JOB SUMMARY:  Experienced sales professional to promote our technology-based products and services via direct sales. The DoBD oversees USA and Canada sales territories. Responsible for generating new business from prospects and closing deals independently.  RESPONSIBILITIES: Direct sales and prospecting activities. Advise prospective customers regarding the products and services that will address their needs and requirements Provide information necessary to produce sales forecasts, sales pipeline analysis, and win-loss analysis reports by updating the sales database and/or providing other documentation as necessary Online demonstrations On-site demonstrations and sales presentations (travel to client location may be required) Ability to build relationships through attending industry events Preparation of proposals Execution of contracts and collection of first payment Preparation and execution of work orders Maintain accuracy of sales database all sales reports and trace updates. Establish and maintain strong working relationships with clients and organizations within assigned territory as well as any other accounts assigned. Work in partnership with Executive Team to foster new business ideas and opportunities REQUIREMENTS: Previous experience in Business-to-Business sales at a level of $1 Million per annum or higher Software sales experience Direct sales experience in the hotel, event management, or destination marketing space is a plus. Proficient with Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Outlook) Excellent communication skills both written and verbal. Able to make presentations and public speaking engagements Some knowledge of event management/CRM systems and online marketing preferred. Highly organized with the ability to multi-task Must be able to travel and perform sales missions and attend conferences, meetings and events as directed WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR: Professionals with solid skills and solid principles People who know the web like an old friend Employees who thrive on problem solving and figuring things out Someone other people want to work with (organized, easy-going, non-toxic) WHAT IS IN IT FOR YOU: Fulfilling work at a company that makes an impact in hundreds of communities across the globe The ability to set a career trajectory and move along a growth path Great co-workers, including geeks, parents, artists, gamers, veterans and average joes and janes 100% paid medical benefits for employees and short-term disability paid by the company + options for vision, dental, long-term disability & life 401(k) with employer match This position is available to Tucson-area, Denver-area and remote candidates. At this time, Eventsforce can currently only employ remote staff who reside in the following U.S. states or Canadian province: Arizona, British Columbia, California, Colorado, Florida, Georgia, Idaho, Maryland, Michigan, Minnesota, Nevada, New Mexico, North Carolina, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Washington, and Wisconsin.  Qualified candidates, please apply by going online at:  Powered by JazzHR  h1tuj6ZUeZ
industries: Consumer Goods, Financial Services, and Accounting

description: Position: Regional Sales Manager-South East, USA (multi-state)  Location: Reside in Major Market within Regional Territory (Florida)  Employee Type: Full Time  Education: Collegiate Degree Preferred  Experience: 5+ Years Outside Sales  Travel: 65%  Jeffrey Court is one of America’s premier suppliers of hand-crafted ceramic tile, natural stone, glass, and metal decorative accents. Since 1991, Jeffrey Court has built a solid reputation with tile and stone distributors, dealers, designers, and architects for providing quality high-end materials at reasonable prices. The Jeffrey Court brand is supported by in-stock availability, superior marketing programs, national advertising, fashion forward design and impeccable customer service.  Jeffrey Court seeks a highly motivated sales representative to grow with us - we offer competitive salary plus commission compensation, health insurance benefits, 401k plan with company contribution, and advancement opportunities.  Primary Responsibilities Include Sales of Jeffrey Court ceramic, stone, glass, and metal products Development of comprehensive marketing and sales plan for the territory Prospecting identifying and managing of key distributors and dealers Increasing brand awareness with designers, architects, contractors, and builders Coordination of specifications / bidding process for all architectural projects Participation in local / regional designer and distributor shows 65% travel requirement based on territory needs Requirements In depth knowledge of multiple segments including distribution, dealers, A&D, new home builders within territory Minimum of five years of field sales experience Interior design background strongly preferred Tile experience strongly preferred Advanced presentation skills Strong ability to manage large geographical territory Ability to plan complete, on-going travel arrangements Jeffrey Court is one of America’s premier suppliers of hand-crafted ceramic tile, natural stone, glass, and metal decorative accents. Since 1991, Jeffrey Court has built a solid reputation with tile and stone distributors, dealers, designers, and architects for providing quality high-end materials at reasonable prices. The Jeffrey Court brand is supported by in-stock availability, superior marketing programs, national advertising, fashion forward design and impeccable customer service.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Building Materials, and Design

description: Description  We are looking for an experienced Automotive B&B Sales Professional to execute sales strategy for North America region. Sales Manager will be responsible for all key front-end related activities including business development and strategic account management.   Responsibilities Maintain existing and expand the customer portfolio (Tier1 and OEM) to meet the company's strategic growth targets in the region Acquire new customer business, develop, and execute new approaches and opportunities for expanding customer base Define, propose, and implement a specific strategy and relevant organization for new opportunities Work closely with Business Dvp, Product Management & Marketing, R&D and Operations (for new products development) and to evaluate the Cost/benefit ratio of new opportunities, on a short as well as on a long term prospective.  Leverage existing products and solutions offerings and relationships to expand them into new accounts (automotive and non-automotive) Be accountable for operational/financial metrics and overall business results: target setting, annual budget planning for sales and account management organization, resource planning, risk assessment etc. Implement and follow KPI’s to ensure the profitability of actions plans and of this growth strategy Participate in relevant industry events and professional associations  Requirements: The ideal candidate for this position will be an International Sales Manager with regional-level leadership, with both strategic and strong ‘hands-on’ abilities. Already worked with/for main Tier-1 or/and OEMs  Education: An engineering degree or equivalent At least 10 years of experience, mostly in sales development in an international context in automotive industry Solid knowledge of connectivity modules, embedded systems and software, telecommunication and auto electronics IoT understanding a strong + A driven individual, with listening skills, curiosity, and open mind to see opportunities A structured way to work as well, to build trust with both customers/partners as well as internally with the BDO and the COO. Proven track record in commercial challenge and turnover growing setting the goals, At ease with numbers Fluent in English, other languages are + Dynamic, self motivated, hard working professional who thrives in a very fast paced environment. Must have sense of urgency in all aspects of daily job. Strong oral, written, presentation and interpersonal skills.

Summary The Key Account Manager is responsible for driving new account acquisition and the upsell of TeleSign solutions to existing enterprise customers. The Key Account Manager will be responsible for developing and executing a comprehensive account/territory strategy to achieve specific targets. They will oversee the creation of opportunities and articulation of the value prop for TeleSign solutions within their defined territory. The position reports to the VP, Americas Sales.  Essential Functions Consultative solution-sell the suite of TeleSign services by mapping business challenges with technology solutions Close net new business with named accounts, including some of the largest companies in the world Identify key decision-makers, approvers, and influencers and develop strategies to increase deal confidence Drive incremental revenue inside named accounts by uncovering net new use cases, growing adoption of current opportunities, and upselling and cross-selling additional services Lead generation, qualification, and opportunity management to contract closure Partner with SDR’s (chartered with driving lead/opportunity generation in the Strategic Account Director’s accounts), Customer Success (engaged for customer deployment), Solution Engineering, and HQ Sales Operations team Work closely with the Global Carrier Business Development team to develop and close market-making opportunities Develop long-term strategic relationships with key accounts Create and manage a robust pipeline  Essential Requirements 5+ years in demonstrated Enterprise sales experience with a proven track record of consistently exceeding annual team quotas and performance targets The ideal candidate will have an understanding and/or experience of information security, SaaS models, identity and authentication, and B2B2C sales models Experience in selling into the financial services industry – Banking, Fintech, Payment, and Lending companies Experience navigating complex sales cycles Strong written and verbal skills Strong collaboration and communication within departments with the like-minded goal of achievement Self-motivated and entrepreneurial Attention to detail Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent  Why TeleSign TeleSign connects and protects online experiences with sophisticated customer identity and engagement solutions. Through APIs that deliver user verification, data insights, and communications we solve today’s unique customer challenges by bridging businesses to the complex world of global telecommunications.   Our global team consists of the best and the brightest in the industry and we treat them as such. We provide a variety of excellent benefits ranging from the standard: 401(k) matching, free lunches, generous PTO, and flexible schedules to the not so standard: quarterly performance bonuses, in-house massages, our state of the art office with panoramic views of the marina and hills, and so much more! ;)     TeleSign is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We believe our differences help us create a better workplace, a better product, and a better community. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ancestry, religion, national origin, marital status, pregnancy, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, genetic information, disability, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation.  TeleSign also participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S.  TeleSign is an Affirmative Action Employer and as part of the commitment to AAP, it will seek to ensure affirmative action to provide equality of opportunity in all aspects of employment, and that all personnel activities, such as the recruitment selection, training, compensation, benefits, discipline, promotion, transfer, layoff, and termination processes remain free of illegal discrimination and harassment based on protected characteristics.  TeleSign does not accept unsolicited resumes from individual recruiters or third-party recruiting agencies in response to job postings. No fee will be paid to third parties who submit unsolicited candidates directly to our hiring managers or HR team.

Regional Sales Manager Do you want to learn more about a leadership role within a fast growing company with a mission to drive clean energy business? We believe there is a better, less expensive, cleaner way for families to power their homes. With Sunrun’s residential rooftop solar, storage and energy services, homeowners are saving money while dramatically reducing the amount of air pollution and carbon dioxide (CO2) they release into the atmosphere.  Our mission is simple – to Create a Planet run by the sun. We hire, build, and grow great teams, and Sunrun’s talent distinguishes us from all other companies. We are looking for passionate, solution oriented leaders who have the courage to help customers change the way they power their lives. Join nearly 4,000 and growing Sunrunners on our mission to Create a Planet Run by the Sun! Our Regional Sales Manager role requires travel within your region (as you meet with field sales consultants out in the field as required in your region and to a local branch. However, during the COVID-19 period, we have shifted most sales consultations to virtual presentations.  We are following federal and local government guidelines in adjusting our working model to increase both employee and customer experience, while keeping safety top of mind. We provide necessary PPE to all our employees and maintain safety as our primary concern during this time.   Position Summary: The Regional Sales Manager is a sales leadership position responsible for organizing, motivating and leading a team of regional sales consultants. The Regional Sales Manager is accountable for the combined performance of the team and for ensuring that the team reaches their monthly and annual targets.  A strong candidate will have a track record proven leadership abilities (communication, relationship building, training & development, performance management), as well as direct sales experience to manage all aspects of the territory. This role requires the ability to train and evaluate sales consultants abilities, ensure the highest standards of sales skills and measurable sales results are being met and maintained, articulate Sunrun’s value proposition, manage and track opportunities through the sales pipeline, and demonstrate highly accurate forecasting ability while mentoring existing sales consultants on improving pipeline forecasting and ultimately increase revenue within their territory. The core competence of a successful Regional Sales Manager is the ability to manage, motivate, and mentor a team of sales consultants to move opportunities through the entire sales process and to close sales, all while upholding our Sunrun values and way of doing business.  Responsibilities Include: ⦁ Partner with our Retail and Ad Teams ensure adequate lead generation to ensure leads are being tracked and converted to opportunities and sales by consultants. ⦁ Ensure that sales consultants are motivated and enabled to successfully meet Sunrun's sales standards including self generation sales, referral sales and company opportunity sales. ⦁ Using SFDC reports and regular meetings to manage and track the process of sales through the pipeline to installation. ⦁ Work with consultants and Director of Regional Sales to manage and analyze both individual sales Pipelines and regional Pipelines from sale to install. ⦁ Produce and maintain detailed S&OP forecasts for their assigned region including regular updates and recommendations as well as competitive pricing insights. ⦁ Ensure that all team members maintain professionalism and proper etiquette through all forms of communication. ⦁ Prioritize multiple tasks in a fast paced team environment ⦁ Assist the Field Sales in closing business at customer sites when needed. ⦁ Ability to effectively collaborate on escalated pertinent customer concerns/issues with all necessary internal departments and stakeholders. These departments include Operations, Engineering, Legal, Finance, Marketing, Facilities and HR. Always to work as a team with internal departments. ⦁ Drive Strong partnership with Sunrun Operations Managers for overall local level profitability ⦁ Ownership of regional customer relations issues, both in a proactive and reactive capacity. ⦁ Assist Director of Regional Sales in establishing, maintaining and communicating up-to-date customer requirements and competitive analysis for their region. ⦁ Maintain a thorough and current knowledge of industry and locatl market conditions, rebate and tax incentives, and electric utility rate schedules.  Qualifications: ⦁ Ability to drive a vehicle during the normal course of business. Must maintain a clean driving record with the ability to pass a driving background check. Must be 21 years of age and possess a valid driver’s license. ⦁ Minimum 3-5 years of management-level sales experience with a strong working knowledge of the Residential Solar Market and sales “best practices”. ⦁ Demonstrated ability to maintain high attention to detail and accuracy in forecasting monthly, quarterly and annual sales for their region. ⦁ Must have high ethics, integrity, and humility and have a desire to build world-class sales and support organization. ⦁ Has been a sales manager in a growth technology, construction industry, or solar industry. ⦁ Has developed and executed tactical sales plans. ⦁ Has a proven ability to transfer sales skills and knowledge to sales professionals under their direct management. ⦁ Ability to utilize SFDC report creation for all tracking and forecasting activities. ⦁ Proven leadership ability to influence, develop, and empower sales employees to achieve objectives with a strong “team” focus and approach. ⦁ We offer an attractive compensation and benefits package designed to reward you for your hard work and performance. Our benefits include competitive base pay, paid time off, tuition reimbursement, health and welfare benefits such as medical, dental, vision and matching 401K. Sunrun is proud to be an equal opportunity employer that does not tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind. Our commitment to Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging drives our ability to build diverse teams and develop inclusive work environments. At Sunrun, we believe that empowering people and valuing their differences will help us create a planet run by the sun for everyone. We are committed to equal employment opportunity without consideration of race, color, religion, ethnicity, citizenship, political activity or affiliation, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, sex or gender, or any other basis protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Title: Sales Solutions Consultant Department: Sales Reports to: Director, Sales Operations Employment Type: FTE Exemption Status: Exempt Experience: Mid-Level Travel Required: 50% Location: Remote  Overview of the Role:  The Sales Solutions Consultant is responsible for walking through demonstrations of the Privia Health suite of tools with prospective physician practices. This individual will be required to build relationships with prospective providers and care center staff, as well as Privia employees.   The ideal candidate is someone comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, excels at relationship building through establishing credibility and displaying a high level of emotional intelligence, and has high attention to detail.   Primary Job Duties: Assist with recruiting independent physician practices through demonstration of Privia’s technology platform, including athenahealth’s suite of services. Anticipate and handle objections during the sales process articulating clear and concise responses that position the benefits of the platform. Work with Sales & Marketing teams to align messaging throughout the sales process. Partner as a trusted advisor to the sales team, helping to form comprehensive strategies for each opportunity. Develop sales strategy, build sales funnel, manage leads, and track pending deals using Salesforce (CRM). Create relationships with prospective physicians, providers and office staff. Acts as a SME for Privia Health’s technology platform and workflows and liaison to other Privia stakeholders.  Contribute new ideas and share best practices with a rapidly scaling national sales team.  Minimum Qualifications: 5+ years experience with an ambulatory EHR (athenaNet preferred) Experience demonstrating or training clinical workflows to providers Experience in sales, recruiting, negotiations and/or networking Persuasive communicator Experience with CRM software such as Salesforce.com (preferred) Willing to travel locally and nationally Must comply with HIPAA rules and regulations  Interpersonal Skills:         A solutions-focused, consultative approach to sales Ability to quickly establish credibility with physicians, providers, and practice staff Highly self-motivated, independent and metric driven Display empathy and deep understanding of physician and provider pain points Street smart and savvy – ability to think on your feet Excellent time management, communication, analytical and organizational skills Positive attitude toward company, work, clients, management, and team members  Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools or controls; reach with hands and arms; climb stairs; balance; stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl; talk or hear; and taste or smell. The employee must occasionally lift or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.

Manages Small Format retail accounts (e.g. 7-Eleven, Circle K, Speedway, Hudson News) plus wholesale accounts (e.g. McLane, Coremark, Vistar) and oversees Blue Diamond's complete portfolio of products to include Snack Nuts and Nut Thins. description: Job Description  Tenneco is one of the world’s largest pure-play powertrain companies serving OE markets worldwide with engineered solutions addressing fuel economy, power output, and criteria pollution requirements for gasoline, diesel and electrified powertrains.  We are looking for a New Business Development Manager (Remote). They will be responsible for developing and growing the sales in N.A. by expanding sales of SP’s products and customers breath and depth. This will be accomplished by creating new opportunities for existing customers and products as well as generating new customers with current products and new customers with new products. Primary focus with be the LV and CV markets.  Our recruiting team is ready to act immediately. You’ll first hear from someone in Talent Acquisition to schedule a phone screen, and then the next step will be a personal interview with our Hiring Manager. We pride ourselves on moving through the process quickly, and you can be sure of transparency and prompt communication.  Responsibilities Provide a market growth strategy based on market research to Global Sales Director and management for review and approval. Strategy to include products needed as well as barriers and challenges for success. Communicate customer strategic issues (e.g. changes to ‘Terms and Conditions’, significant changes in volume announcement of a new model and/or powertrain, opening of a new plant and/or plant closure, announcement of a partnership/alliance, etc.) and appropriate customer news (e.g. bookings, etc.) to SP Leadership. Work with the regional sales directors to establish targets for each new segment. Provide timely communication with the Sales Director about the ‘voice of the customer’ Work closely with Tier Business Manager to identify key tier account growth based on New Business Development award Drive new product implementation and specification at the OE’s. This may call upon the OE sales team for support. Assist to develop the business plan and the 5-year strategic budget with the Tier and OE Buisness Manager and the SP Management Team. Ensure all opportunities are captured and followed up in Sales Force. Develop contacts at the platform engineering management level and mfg operations at the new customers and OE’s Lead customer reviews to the management team Chair global cross functional customer team meetings Develop the customer sales and business strategies required to achieve SP’s business objectives. Achieve strategic plan annual revenue Deliver profitable bookings to achieve 5% minimum p.a. growth greater than market Maximize material recovery by balancing the overall business goals and objectives to ensure a minimum of 70% material recovery Achieve profit enhancement of 25% minimum p.a. Achieve or improve the pricing budget Leader customer profitability improvement initiatives Required Experience  EDUCATION: Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Engineering or other related discipline  Skills/Experience Minimum of 10 years sales experience Minimum of 3 years experience in New Business Development or similar experience. Required experience working with strategic planning, product positioning, competitive analysis and revenue improvement Must be proactive, innovative and a self-starter with excellent communication skill and the ability to effectively interact with all levels of the organization Strong analytical skills with a demonstrated ability to solve customer problems Strong computer system skills Must be able to travel up to 50% of the time An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Regional Sales Manager Missouri Region Only candidates in the Missouri region will be considered for the role  Overview: Eagle Eye Networks is seeking a Regional Sales Manager for its Missouri region responsible for accelerated growth through the development of a reseller channel and demand generation efforts. This is a hunter role. The RSM ensures profitable growth by planning and executing a territory expansion strategy fulfilled through a channel of security systems integrators, alarm companies, IT / networking service providers and other types of independent service companies focused on the delivery and support of secure, cloud-oriented, video management systems.  Responsibilities include: Direct Channel Expansion: Collaborate with Eagle Eye leadership to develop an expansion strategy for the region and achieve assigned new dealer onboarding goals and objectives Proactively train direct dealer’s sales representatives to meet hardware and subscription sales target and commitments Coordinate technical certification of dealer’s operational resources Ensure dealer and Eagle Eye are successful in the ordering and payment processes  In-direct Channel Support & Growth Work with Eagle Eye & Brivo leadership to develop a plan to: a) support Brivo RSM & ASM sales efforts, and b) collaboratively train underperforming Brivo (video), dealers Work with Eagle Eye’s National Account team to support the growth of Eagle Eye’s and Brivo’s assigned national account programs Coordinate cross-selling efforts with Eagle Eye and Brivo Strategic Partners  Demand Generation Develop relationships with consulting engineers within the region to achieve assigned goals and objectives in terms of new, specified opportunities Develop relationships with multi-site end-users in a franchise or corporate businesses in the quick-serve food, property management, light retail, or similar verticals Receive and manage inbound leads from the website and other sources to efficiently result in channel expansion and revenue recognition  Performs Risk Analysis and develops mitigation plans Effectively manages stakeholder communication Desired Skills & Experience: 5+ years of field sales experience, preferably in SaaS, information technology, or security sales experience with video, access or intrusion systems Successful experience selling as an employee of a major security manufacturer is a plus Consultative/solutions sales with 90+ day B2B sales cycles Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written Demonstrate self-confidence, energy, and enthusiasm in a professional manner Present ideas, expectations, and information in a concise, well-organized way Demonstrated ability to meet/exceed a $1.5MM+ quota

jobTitle: Manager, Business Development - Georgia Bulldogs Sports Marketing
description: LEARFIELD is the leading media and technology services company in intercollegiate athletics. The company unlocks the value of college sports for brands and fans through an omnichannel platform with innovative content and commerce solutions for fan engagement. The LEARFIELD suite of services includes licensing and multimedia sponsorship management; publishing, audio, digital and social media; data analytics; ticketing, ticket sales and professional concessions expertise; branding; campus-wide business and sponsorship development; and venue technology systems.  Headquartered in Plano, Texas, the company has long had the privilege of being an advocate for intercollegiate athletics and the student-athlete experience. Since 2008, it has served as title sponsor for the acclaimed LEARFIELD Directors' Cup, supporting athletic departments across all divisions.  Our people-friendly culture is a hallmark of our style and approach to business and is rooted in values demonstrating intentional and active care for other people. The company and its employees strive each day to live by the company's value statement: "build the team, grow the company, have fun, love and serve others."  Georgia Bulldogs Sports Marketing is LEARFIELD's local, dedicated entity representing the University of Georgia. In complete collaboration with the university, this team is committed to extending the affinity of the University's brand to businesses and corporations of all sizes looking to align with the undeniably loyal and passionate collegiate sports fan base.  As exclusive multimedia rights holder for the University, our team manages all aspects of the rights relationship. Providing corporate partners with traditional, digital and other non-traditional media opportunities to bolster their own brand and garner maximum exposure through inventory such as venue signage; digital engagement including social media, the official athletics website, content, digital gaming and retargeting, event sponsorships and promotion; corporate hospitality; television and radio game broadcasts and coaches' shows.  Our growing sponsorship business seeks an experienced, motivated sales professional to join our team located on campus in Athens, GA or Atlanta, GA. If you're interested in combining your passion for sports with your successful track record in sales, we want to speak with you!  Our ideal candidate will have demonstrated traditional media, digital and other non-traditional media experience in developing integrated marketing partnerships. You will be responsible for delivering a high volume of new business by implementing high-level integrated marketing partnerships for the university athletic program while also building and maintaining lasting relationships with our corporate partners as well as the athletic department staff.  Responsibilities: Develop and sell creative marketing solutions that exceed the needs of the client Leverage your passion and empathy to develop a long-term business partnership between your client and the collegiate athletics programs they sponsor Create and present integrated marketing packages using traditional, digital and other non-traditional marketing channels to meet client's objectives Understand the changing landscape of sponsorship marketing to include a product mix that focuses on the benefits of digital and social media assets and solutions Speak confidently to clients about the advantages of digital and social in sponsorship proposals Collaborate with vendors, sponsors, property staff, and appropriate university athletic personnel to ensure implementation of sponsorships and contract fulfillment Participate in game day events to share and highlight the collegiate sports experience with existing and potential sponsors Conduct yourself in way that demonstrates a strong commitment to team collaboration and success  Qualifications: Minimum of 3+ years selling comprehensive integrated sports marketing partnerships including major media elements (signage, radio, social, digital, etc.) or other relevant B2B sales experience Ability to analyze a client's traditional, digital and non-traditional marketing needs based on the customer's marketing targets and objectives, and craft an integrated marketing solution(s) to meet those needs Strong knowledge of digital marketing, including but not limited to social media, content marketing, banner ads, mobile, retargeting and websites, including interpreting performance analytics for all areas. Advanced negotiating skills, ability to identify and influence key decision makers Strong competitive spirit – desire to win the business through hard work and determination Excellent communication, organizational, and presentation skills Driven to succeed and able to overcome obstacles Ability to adapt your style/messaging to the needs of the client Ability to quickly establish personal relationships through trust and empathy Bachelor's degree from an accredited four-year college or university  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status. LEARFIELD is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Female / Minority / Disability / Protected Veteran / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity.  #35601183

Trox is quickly becoming the biggest name in the educational technology industry, and we are looking for passionate, talented people to help us achieve our vision: enable more access to technology and improve learning outcomes for all students.  Trox is currently seeking a Sales Coordinator to assist wtih supporting our sales team and process. This role plays an important part of our goal to bring technology to students; we are proud to serve thousands of school districts reaching 27 million students in North America.  Summary  The Sales Coordinator provides direct client assistance in the following areas of sales support: equipment and integration order management (including entry/status/invoicing/returns), project coordination (including coordination of logistical but not technical aspects), problem resolution, and administrative support. This position is assigned to support specific Sales Representatives.  Essential Functions  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Completing order entry, updating orders as needed, working with the warehouse to stage and ship orders, provide tracking as needed, and invoicing orders Communicating pricing adjustments, product availability and status of back ordered items with the appropriate parties (in collaboration with the purchasing department) Processing returns and corrections to orders or invoices Monitoring and closing out open orders and returns Processing internal documentation for integration proposals upon acceptance and maintaining documentation throughout project changes and completion. Serving as the point of contact to the customer for integration project logistics, including: verifying the site/shipping information, setting/confirming client expectations, obtaining approval for any direct shipments and coordinating project installation dates, including rush product changes Coordinating product availability in conjunction with scheduled installation dates, including rush product changes Creating and maintaining client files; ensuring the correct documentation is accessible and properly organized/named Sharing responsibility for regular report and contract maintenance with other Sales Support staff Gathering information for assigned Sales Reps and preparing documentation for clients as requested; may include quotes, new account applications, tax exempt documentation, contracts, and product or project information Providing support for assigned Sales Reps, including fielding miscellaneous questions and serving as a point of contact for customers when Reps are unavailable  Competencies Organization Professional and courteous communication Detail Oriented Basic math skills, the ability to calculate discounts, margins, interest, and percentages Problem solving Teamwork Decision Making Flexibility  Required Education & Experience One to three years of customer service experience. Experience with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint)  If you are seeking a new home in a fast growing company and would like to contribute toward improving learning outcomes for students in the US and Canada, please apply for immediate consideration. Trox offers a generous PTO and holiday package along with medical, dental, vision, life and LTD.  Powered by JazzHR  JYhYNcW6Gg
