As an Operating Room Sales Specialist with our Patient Monitoring business, you will promote the Patient Monitoring’s capital and consumable portfolio that addresses respiratory surgical complications.  As a goal-driven Operating Room Sales Specialist, you are the primary person responsible for driving revenue generating sales to key hospital personnel and the end customer.  Your primary responsibilities include accurately forecasting your business, owning customer relationships, understanding and targeting customer product needs, and developing and executing the sales strategy around those opportunities.  Bring your sales talents to a leader in medical technology and healthcare solutions.  Rooted in our long history of mission-driven innovation, our medical technologies open doors. We support your growth with the training, mentorship, and guidance you need to own your future success. Join us for a career in sales that changes lives.  A Day in the Life                                                                                 Responsible for driving capital and consumable product portfolio sales that addresses respiratory surgical complications to the Operating Room area of care, as well as the C-Suite level of a hospital Lead territory opportunity development and activities that translate to accurate monthly, quarterly, and annual projections.  The Operating Room Sales Specialist will maintain sole ownership of providing accurate forecasts to their Regional Business Manager each reporting period for their territory Identify, qualify, prepare, and execute effective sales strategies that maintain the existing base of business and support the close of competitive and revenue growth opportunities Probe, develop, and close all related product sales inquiries/leads with existing customers within assigned geographic territory Coordinate and collaborate with regionally aligned field sales team to drive incremental RMS revenue and achieve target sales goals Develop, negotiate, close, and manage profitable agreements Effectively utilize and update sales tools to accurately address trends in existing base of business, create call strategies, and to manage territory and strategic business plans Effectively deliver strategic messaging in a variety of settings, including trade shows, presentations, and board meetings Provide product feature and benefit application consultation, drive value messaging, as well as clinical support Lead the local team in the coordination and support of clinical evaluations and pre-sales support Conduct post-sales activities, including implementation, product education, in-servicing, and ongoing support Maintain and build customer relationships to understand, align, and support customer initiatives Maintain detailed level of knowledge of related products and applications Maintain a comprehensive understanding of related programs and value-added offerings Utilize Specialist and Clinical resources in an efficient and cost effective manner to optimize sales process Inform Regional Business Manager and local area team members of new account opportunities Complete all assigned projects and administrative duties in a timely manner Consistently maintain all Vendor Credentialing requirements      Networks & ERGs  Medtronic has four Diversity Networks including a global Medtronic Women’s Network and U.S-based Networks representing Asian, African, and Hispanic/Latino descent employees. Between site-based and Network-affiliated ERGs, there are over 21,000 enrolled employees operating more than 200 ERG hubs in 65 countries  Diversity & Inclusion  We seek out and hire a diverse workforce at every level: We need fresh ideas and inclusive insights to continue to be an innovative industry leader — that’s why we make it a point to seek out, attract and develop employees who are patient-centric, passionate, and who represent the same wide variety of life experiences as our patients. To learn more about Inclusion & Diversity at Medtronic  Click Here

Inside Sales Account Manager  The companies sales account managers excel at both transactional sales and relationship sales – they call it transrelational sales!  They are committed to making their communities safer, smarter and more secure. They deliver security solutions for business, residential, law enforcement and non-profits, specializing in video surveillance and access control. Their customers range from Fortune 500 companies to their friends and neighbors. They are stable (been around since 1989) but they are nimble, passionate and they are disrupting the industry through their unique way of partnering with their customers. Their customers choose them – and stay with them – because they are relationship focused, easy to do business with, and deliver results. Their employees choose them – and stay with them - because they feel valued and respected, and because they care about their personal growth and career development. At heart, they are a bunch of nice people, working for the good of each other, their customers, and their communities. Due to their growth, they are looking for an Inside Sales Account Manager. In this role, you’ll carry your own book of business, developing relationships with their network of nationwide security dealers. Your success will be dependent on your ability to create and sell technology solutions. Your customers will come to see you as their go-to person for ensuring success.  Here’s what their sales team does:  Establishes customer relationships to understand their businesses and how to help make them successful Services existing accounts and develops new accounts by maximizing direct communication with decision makers Determines job specs and product solutions Uncovers new opportunities through outreach, referrals and networking – no cold calling Maintains sales pipeline integrity by establishing realistic expectations for sales opportunities and delivering on those expectations Understands business intelligence including what their competitors are doing and what sets us apart Establishes pricing, develops bids and walks customers through them   Qualifications:  Bachelor’s degree or 3 to 5 years of successful inside or outside sales experience You want a career in sales – you’re motivated by solving problems and by making good money You understand business fundamentals – profits, margins, pricing, service You drive for results – you’re known for getting things done You’re good at learning technology – you can understand and pick-up on technical specs quickly You’re really good at managing your time – their account managers run their own show You build and maintain creditability with others – your customers will come to depend on you for answers You’re good at all the essential communication skills – verbal, written and listening You’re self-motivated, enthusiastic and have an optimistic outlook You’re trustworthy – have integrity and a strong work ethic     Compensation and Benefits Their comp package includes a base plus accelerated commission. There is no cap on the commissions you earn and their most successful sales team members earn six figures. They offer a wide range of good benefits including medical, dental and vision insurance along with disability and life insurance. They have a generous time off allotment and a 401k with a company match.
industries: Information Services, Information Technology and Services, and Computer & Network Security

description: Company Description  Accolade at a glance…  Accolade provides personalized health and benefits solutions designed to empower every person to live their healthiest life. We help millions of people and their employers navigate the complexities of the healthcare system with empathy, expertise and through exceptional service while supporting them in lowering the cost of care and improving health outcomes. Accolade blends technology-enabled health and benefits solutions, specialized support from Accolade Health Assistants® and Clinicians and access to expert medical opinion services for high-cost treatment decisions. We consistently receive consumer satisfaction ratings over 90 percent and have been recognized by Inc. Magazine as a Top Place to Work 2020 and Business Intelligence for Excellence in Customer Service 2020. Please visit us on LinkedIn, Twitter, Instagram and Facebook and at accolade.com  Job Description  The Dir, Business Development (Midwest / Remote) is responsible for identifying and retaining strategic business relationships, educating and building trust in the market, and developing and executing strategies to generate sales leads.  A day in the life… Builds relationships with key consulting/brokerage offices and leadership within a territory Develops, executes and maintains an effective strategic sales and market penetration plan for assigned territory Consistently identifies opportunities, develops sales strategy in conjunction with the regional sales executives and market development representatives Effectively presents Accolade’s offerings to consultants and brokers Effectively leverages Accolade executives, the pre-sales team, marketing and product to support consultant presentations Develops and manages a pipeline of consultants and brokers likely to produce leads and sales in alignment with objectives that are established annually Establishes joint target list and maintains pipeline of sales opportunities with secondary partners such as TPAs, health plans and strategic partners Documents all consultant and broker contacts and activities in Accolade’s sales tools and systems (Salesforce) Executes against a partnership arrangement Solicits product and market feedback from consultants, brokers and partners. Communicates this feedback to sales leadership, marketing and the product development team (feature requests, market trends, competition intelligence, new opportunities) Complies with all corporate policies and completes all administrative tasks on time Qualifications BA in a business or technical related area of study Minimum 8 years of consulting experience or strategic selling of complex, multi-stakeholder solutions Experience with health & welfare benefits, health benefits/HR outsourcing, SaaS solutions, and/or benefits software required Embraces and thrives in a culture of transparency, accountability and trust Self-starter with ability to work independently, prioritize work and coordinate multiple tasks within tight time constraints Ability to navigate the strategic levels of organizations, identify key decision-makers, build relationships with senior executives and schedule meetings with key stakeholders Ability to establish strong team relationships in a matrix organization Ability to perform in a dynamic and fast-paced environment Possess account knowledge, executive-level contacts and industry relationships inside the employer market space Command of social media and marketing campaigns for the benefit of lead generation, gaining access to executives and networking with key stakeholders Strong aptitude with business software tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook etc.) Strong business acumen Demonstrated ability to accurately forecast monthly, quarterly, and annual revenue Flexibility in work schedule is required; 25-50% travel depending on location Where permitted by applicable law, candidates must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by date of hire to be considered, if not currently employed by Accolade, Inc. The Company will provide reasonable accommodations to qualified employees with disabilities or for a sincerely held religious belief.  Please note that a request for exemption due to a personal preference not to receive a vaccine is not protected by law. All requests for exemptions from this mandate shall be directed to the Company recruiter who shall route the request to the Company’s human resources department.  Additional Information  What is important to us...  We Find Joy And Purpose In Serving Others  Creating an enduring company that is hyper-focused on our culture and making a meaningful impact in the lives of our employees, members and customers. The secret to our success is:  Making a difference in our members’ and customers’ lives is what we do. Even when it’s hard, we do the right thing for the right reasons.  We are strong individually and together, we’re powerful  Trusting in our colleagues and embracing their different backgrounds and experiences enable us to solve tough problems in creative ways, having fun along the way.  We roll up our sleeves and get stuff done  Results motivate us. And we aren't afraid of the hard work or tough decisions needed to get us there.  We’re boldly and relentlessly reinventing healthcare  We're curious and act big -- not afraid to knock down barriers or take calculated risks to change the world, one person at a time.  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Hospital & Health Care

description: Job Description:  DataRobot is looking for a talented and hungry Corporate Sales Representative. This is an incredible opportunity to build a SaaS sales career with a tech unicorn valued at over $6B. We are well-positioned to emerge as the dominant vendor in the Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning space and are undergoing tremendous growth as we move toward an eventual IPO. We’ve garnered some of the top sales leadership and GTM talent on the planet with a lineage of scaling start-ups to massive exits and countless examples of meteoric career growth.  Responsibilities  The successful candidate will play a fundamental role in achieving our ambitious customer acquisition and revenue growth objectives. You will consult and partner with senior executives at large and mid-sized companies to solve complex business challenges. You must be comfortable self-sourcing new sales opportunities, developing new interest and meetings in your assigned market (Pipeline Generation), engaging with senior executives, qualifying prospects and closing sales. You will be expected to:  Meet or exceed assigned sales goals and work effectively as a sales team member; promote camaraderie, share best practices, provide assistance, be a positive influence Leverage Leading Indicators and Data in your business to ensure you are tracking above your quota goals Collaborate and leverage an ecosystem of resources including pre sales, post sales, channel partners, customer success and leadership to promote DataRobot and drive incremental new business Conduct Proof of Value technical validation engagements with customers to validate our technology and tie the technology back to customer value Stay current with industry trends, show dedication to continuous learning on all fronts Provide feedback to peers and internal teams to aid in the development and improvement of sales materials Maintain full use and adoption of the sales tech stack, including Salesforce.com, Outreach.io, GSuite, Zoominfo, LinkedIn Navigator, etc.  Key Characteristics  You’ll know you’re a good fit if you have the following traits:  Coachable, curious, life-long learner who constantly seeks development Intelligent persistence, diligently pursuing every lead Customer-centric, putting the customer’s success before all else Detailed-oriented, organized, with strong time-management, the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously in a fast paced, deadline and data-driven environment Excellent verbal and communications skills Sense of urgency with the ability to thrive in a metrics-driven culture Self-starter with solid problem-solving skills  Experience & Skills  1 to 3 years of sales experience in a business to business environment; Knowledge of or experience with using value-selling/consultative methodologies, playbooks, and processes (examples include MEDDIC, SPIN, Sandler, SNAP, Miller Heiman, Challenger, Gap Selling, etc.) Strong experience and success in outbound sales and prospecting roles Interest and excitement for the machine learning/predictive analytics space Ability to deliver compelling presentations and demonstrations to individuals and large groups  At DataRobot, we value diverse backgrounds and understand that the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can discourage really awesome people from applying. We believe “Growth happens outside of your comfort zone.”, so if you’re smart, curious, and emotionally intelligent, please don’t hesitate to apply — we’d love to hear from you.  DataRobot is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. DataRobot is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and mental disabilities. Please see the United States Department of Labor’s EEO poster and EEO poster supplement for additional information.  All applicant data submitted is handled in accordance with our Applicant Privacy Policy .
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Job Summary  A4D is seeking a Senior Business Development Manager to lead the growth of new business for strategic clients. The BDM will be responsible for identifying new business opportunities and designing marketing strategies for the clients. The ideal candidate has a general understanding of all aspects of digital marketing and can have in-depth and strategic discussions that challenge the client’s point-of-view. You have the ability to think strategically to find ways to add value for the clients. This is a remote position.  Responsibilities Prospecting advertisers for strategic partnership opportunities Successfully conduct sales calls and meetings to understand prospect needs and provide insights on how A4D can provide value. Research and create sales proposals and other forms of follow-up to advance the sales cycle and nurture prospects into strategic partners Negotiate contract terms Able to ask tough questions and handle the pressure of a sales environment Some travel and willingness to host video calls Reports directly to VP of Sales Plus if you already have a book of advertisers in the performance marketing industry that you can carry over your relationships. Requirements At least 6-8 years sales or client services experience within the performance marketing industry Have an understanding of all digital marketing channels Excellent presentation capabilities and preparation/follow through Ability to manage and prioritize many clients and deadlines concurrently, while also managing internal and external expectations for workload. Proven track record of sourcing, developing, and maintaining business relationships Resourceful: Great at solving unstructured problems with little to no supervision in a fast-paced, high stakes environment. Team Player: Demonstrates a strong ability to contribute to the business along with business unit team members and managers; establish collaborative relationships with peers. Must have strong interpersonal skills and the ability to establish, develop, and maintain business relationships. Excellent written and verbal skills; a great communicator in every medium 4-year college degree or equivalent experience Why A4D? Opportunity to make an impact quickly and grow in your career Generous benefits plan: Medical, Dental, Vision & Life 401 (k) Retirement Plan Paid Vacation and Sick time An environment to continue learning About A4D Inc.  A4D - Leading the Way in Online Customer Acquisition  A4D has been a leader in online customer acquisition for more than 14 years, with a network of trusted partnerships as well as a large portfolio of owned & operated properties that include physical ecommerce products, lead generation for insurance, legal help, home services and so much more. A4D excels in revenue generating partnership opportunities for publishers, agencies, networks and advertisers.  If you’re passionate about what you do and want to take on projects that impact the company, you’ve come to the right place. A4D empowers their employees to command ownership of what they do and fosters an environment where you can pitch ideas and take on projects that you believe in. We’re looking for smart, passionate people who want to join us and are ready to make an impact.  A4D - Where Technology and Advertising Merge  Technology continues to play a larger role in our everyday lives. Advertising, one of the oldest industries, has yet to completely embrace the benefits that technology can bring to it. At A4D we are transforming technologies to facilitate the complexity that is the Advertising world. Using systems like personalization engines that use machine learning to building our own video testing platform that uses the cartesian product, A4D is fully committed to solve marketing problems via technology.  A4D's Advertising Network offers our advertisers a one-stop solution for scaling their advertising marketing solutions. Performance based marketing is an amazing alternative for advertisers frustrated with the expensive and non-guaranteed results of CPM and CPC advertising. The CPA model is the optimal method of buying online advertising because the advertiser defines the acquisition they are seeking in advance (a sale on a website, a form being filled, a download, etc.) and only pays when either of those acquisitions occur.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Online Media, and Internet

description: About Us: Real Designs (dba Maruca Design) is a woman-owned small business that manufactures and sells (wholesale & retail eCommerce) artsy and functional women’s bags, from handbags to backpacks and accessory bags. We are committed to creating durable, functional products with an artistic flair. Maruca bags have both a strong local fan base as well as a loyal national following and can be found in a variety of venues from art galleries and museums to boutique stores and botanic gardens to mention just a few. Our seasonal offerings give us versatility and desirability across multiple revenue channels as well as geographical locations and age groups. All our bags are designed, cut, and sewn in Colorado and our fabrics are all made in the USA. Check us out at www.marucadesign.com.  Job Summary We are seeking a skilled, adaptable, and reliable sales and marketing associate to help take our company to the next level. In this position, you will plan, implement, and track sales and marketing activities for both house accounts and independent sales reps nationally.  Sales Responsibilities: • Communicate via email with all accounts as needed regarding product launches and promotions. • Outreach to house accounts monthly to keep them informed, engaged, and placing orders • Review all inquiries from new wholesale customers for potential conflicts and review requests with the territory rep prior to approving them. • Manage sales orders coming in via IndieMe website and track orders on spreadsheet including ad dates, sales order dates and dollars, and advise assigned rep if applicable. • Research and cold call potential new accounts, some of which may include in-person product presentations to local prospects. • Track all tradeshow sales and determine ROI for each show. • Sale Rep Support: - Serve as primary contact for reps on all issues or concerns. - Run weekly order reports and send to reps every Friday - Run Monthly Rep Commission Reports and send to Reps - Prepare Sales Rep Kits each season (twice a year) according to input from the fabric designer. Pull and pack kits and prep for shipping. Tag all the rep kit bags with labels. - Monitor and track regional Rep Trade shows and send email communications out to wholesale customers announcing details of the show 10 days in advance and send reminder emails a day before the show. - Perform a bi-annual review with reps to remove/deactivate closed accounts from our mailing list and in ERP system prior to catalog mailings. - Communicate pertinent information to reps regarding product availability, fabric outages, special promotions, sales. - Advise reps prior to sending any emails sent directly to wholesalers.  Marketing Responsibilities: • Meet with the creative team to review upcoming weekly highlights. • Update and manage Social Media Calendar. • Schedule and track IndieMe ads for placement in their eNewsletters & Expo Catalogs. • Post social media and create email campaigns in Constant Contact. • Find and develop content for weekly postings related to our seasonal theme. • Respond to all social media comments and questions daily. • Assist the creative team to develop and post Facebook and Instagram Ads. • Manage requests for donations and gifts with management’s oversite and approval.  Other Responsibilities • Finished goods inventory counting 1-2 times a year. • Sales reporting associated with Art Fair sales or online seasonal sales. • General understanding of both retail and wholesale sales trends. • Investigate other 3rd party sales opportunities. • Assist customer service with entry of wholesale orders when needed. • Pulling and packing orders for retail and wholesale shipments when needed. • Process, invoice, and create shipping labels for retail and wholesale orders when needed. • Assist with counting and inspecting incoming product that seamstresses drop off at the beginning of the week when needed. Once inspected, help to restock the shelves. • Assist with bundling cut goods and findings at the end of the week for seamstress pick the following week when needed.  Qualifications • Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Business administration, or related field • 2-4 years’ successful work experience in a sales and marketing management capacity • 2-4 years’ experience with social media: Facebook, Instagram, and Google Ads. • 2-4 years’ experience with email campaigns (Constant Contact)  Required Skills • Proficiency with all Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, Outlook) and email software programs. • Experience using ERP software platforms and running reports • Sound knowledge of current sales & marketing practices and KPIs. • Solid analytical and problem-solving skills. • Outstanding conflict resolution skills (with kindness) when dealing with reps, retail customers, and/or wholesale customers. • Excellent organizational and time management skills and an ability to prioritize daily tasks. • Exceptional communication, interpersonal, and customer service skills. • Strong experience implementing, managing, and tracking social media postings (Facebook and Instagram), Google Ads, email campaigns, and other digital marketing platforms. • Creative outside-of-the-box thinker. • Must be extremely detail-oriented and highly organized. • Ability to work in a small team environment to get the job done with enthusiasm.

Job Summary:  The Walt Disney Company's Media & Entertainment Distribution (DMED) is a new, global business segment that is responsible for all monetization of content—both distribution and ad sales—and oversees the operations of the Company’s streaming services (Disney+, Hulu, ESPN+, among others) and domestic broadcast and cable television networks.  The Ad Sales Strategy team identifies, evaluates, and implements strategic initiatives to drive advertising revenue for Disney’s portfolio of brands across all linear and digital formats. The team focuses on cross-functional projects that will best position Disney for long-term success in today’s rapidly changing media and advertising landscape.  By collaborating with key stakeholders, the team's primary objective is to identify new revenue channels and enhance existing ones through commercial and data partnerships, advanced advertising products, and strategic alignment across sales, operations, product, and finance.  The Ad Sales Strategy team is seeking a Manager to directly support a broad range of strategic initiatives. Key projects will focus on unlocking digital advertising capabilities—such as programmatic and audience-based buying—to accelerate revenue growth. This role will be instrumental in informing the long-range roadmap for TWDC’s advertising strategy and will work cross-functionally across multiple internal teams, including finance, product, sales, operations, and business development.  Responsibilities:  Evaluating the financial impact of new advertising products and capabilities Creating proforma financial models to evaluate commercial partnership deal terms Managing high-level projects across multiple operational groups to develop and refine key business processes and reporting aligned with our long-term strategic roadmap Completing secondary market research to identify key trends and inform the five-year strategic plan Closely manage projects from beginning-to-end: manage day-to-day communication and provide updates to the leadership team, identify key issues, and manage data gathering Develop executive-level presentations to summarize strategic initiatives for the leadership team Create ad hoc financial models and analyses to support decision making and strategic initiatives Complete market research and track industry trends  Basic Qualifications:  5+ years of professional experience with a background in management consulting, investment banking, strategic planning, and/or business operations. Advanced technical skills in Excel and PowerPoint, with experience in financial modeling. Strong analytic mindset, ability to structure and handle ambiguous data and projects. Proven ability to interface and build relationships with diverse stakeholders at all levels of the organization.  Preferred Qualifications:  Advertising, media entertainment, or technology experience preferred, not required.  Required Education  Bachelor’s degree in business administration, finance, math, or related quantitative field of study.  Preferred Education  MBA preferred.  852108BR
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Information Technology and Services, and Financial Services

description: As a Sales Development Representative (SDR) you will have the opportunity to impact the bottom line and create new business opportunities for Builder. You’ll be finding and qualifying high potential leads, and will pass them to the senior sales team to take forward. Your role determines the success and pace of growth of the entire company – developing the pipeline of future paying customers.   This role is perfect for someone who has early experience in driving top of the funnel leads and qualifying opportunities that turn into potential sales.   What you'll do ●       Outbound lead generation activities to support the sales teams ●       Identify target industries and organizations by working closely with the sales & marketing teams ●       Gain a deep understanding of these target industries and organizations –what are their challenges and goals? ●       Prospect into target organizations using a range of outbound sales tools, campaigns, events and referrals ●       Achieve your monthly goal of qualified opportunities for the sales team ●       Maintain CRM meticulously and ensure that all information is conveyed to the sales team ●       Gain a deep understanding of Builder’s USPs and communicate these effectively ●       Create excellent templates for emails and phone calls, and constantly test & iterate to improve them

Army Enterprise Account Manager  Job Description Oracle seeks an experienced Enterprise Account Manager to join its dynamic and growing Oracle Linux and Virtualization Sales organization, covering the United States Department of the Army. In this role, you will manage relationships within the Department of the Army (DA). The Enterprise Account Manager will leverage key relationships within the assigned customer base to sell the Oracle Linux and Virtualization portfolio of solutions. You will be responsible for building and cultivating new and existing executive-level relationships. The Enterprise Account Manager is responsible for identifying, qualifying, and closing new Oracle Linux and Virtualization opportunities. You will manage accounts including the entire sales process from business development prospecting and specifications through contract negotiations, signing, and post-sales support.  Primary Job Responsibilities  Create high-value relationships based on sustainable pipeline Identify, develop, and close new sales opportunities within assigned accounts. Work closely with VAR’s and Federal Systems Integrators to identify key programs within assigned accounts. Accurately plan, forecast, and close new Oracle business. Work closely with Pre-sales Engineers to identify key projects, programs, and initiatives within assigned accounts. Working with Pre-sales Engineers to establish proofs of concepts and pilot implementations to highlight benefits of Oracle Linux and Virtualization offerings. Demonstrate a thorough knowledge of Oracle Linux and Virtualization and the market dynamics for targeted growth Become a trusted adviser for senior IT and business executives within assigned accounts  Required Qualifications  10+ years of experience working in IT sales with an exceptional track record. Track record of sales to the U.S. Army. Proven track record of exceeding sales objectives and territory/account development. Broad understanding of the government IT acquisition process. Solid understanding of the partner ecosystem that exist within the U.S. Department of Defense (DoD) Outstanding written and verbal communication skills Excellent presentation skills along with sales and marketing skills Willingness to travel Bachelor’s degree or equivalent.   Desirable Qualifications  Experience selling Linux, Virtualization, DevSecOps, Cloud Native solutions Understanding of Linux, Kubernetes, OpenStack, Virtualization, and automation software Experience selling operating systems, middleware, storage, automation, or cloud infrastructure software solutions is a plus. Experience selling open-source software technology or other software/support.  Sells a subset of product or services directly or via partners to a large number of named accounts/non-named accounts/geographical territory (mainly Tier 3 accounts).  Primary job duty is to sell technology software products and related services in a defined territory. Identifies, qualifies and closes new opportunities. Manages accounts including the entire sales process from business development prospecting and specifications through contract negotiations, signing, and post-sales support. Leverages the Oracle sales model to maximize revenue growth and increase local market share. Builds and expands business partner revenue and self-sufficiency.  Acknowledged authority within the Corporation. Acts as a leader of large-scale company initiatives. Viewed by peers as a leader and top contributor and by line management as a key business partner.12 years applicable experience including 9 years of sales experience. Successful sales track record. Ability to penetrate accounts, meet with stakeholders within accounts. Oracle knowledge and/or knowledge of Oracle's competitors. Interaction with C level players. Team player with strong interpersonal /communication skills. Excellent communication/negotiating/closing skills with prospects/customers. Travel may be needed. Bachelor's degree or equivalent.  If you are a Colorado resident, Please Contact us or Email us at oracle-salary-inquiries_us@oracle.com to receive compensation and benefits information for this role. Please include this Job ID: 114384 in the subject line of the email.  About Us Innovation starts with inclusion at Oracle. We are committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can be themselves and do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued, that we are inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. That’s why we need people with diverse backgrounds, beliefs, and abilities to help us create the future, and are proud to be an affirmative-action equal opportunity employer.  Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.

Job Description  The position is described below. If you want to apply, click the Apply button at the top or bottom of this page. You'll be required to create an account or sign in to an existing one.  If you have a disability and need assistance with the application, you can request a reasonable accommodation. Send an email to  Regular Or Temporary  Regular  Language Fluency: English (Required)  Work Shift  1st shift (United States of America)  Please Review The Following Job Description  Responsible for the supervision of a staff of SSA's. Establishes individual and team priorities, monitors workflow and customer service efforts of staff. Works with internal departments, including Underwriting, Client Services, and Sales, to ensure overall customer satisfaction to meet departmental quotas and business objectives.  Essential Duties And Responsibilities  Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time. Assigns team workload and coordinates staffing needs to ensure illustrations are processed in a timely manner while managing customer expectations and satisfaction. Prioritizes and balances on-going SSA workload among staff to maintain service standards Provides and/or oversees SSA on-boarding and training Responsible for on-going educational and career development of existing staff to include problem/conflict resolution, global knowledge of case processing, and accomplishment of personal objectives Act as key escalation point for agent concerns Performs regular audits to ensure illustrations are processed effectively and service standards are met. Meet with staff regularly to review audit results and coach accordingly. Work with carriers, producers, sales staff and any other internal staff to respond and resolve escalated issues Understands client contractual arrangements to best manage account relationships Manage the hiring process to include screening potential candidates and conducting interviews. Work with VP to maintain overall staffing levels. Makes or recommends termination, and performance improvement plans, and conducts performance and salary reviews Leading regularly scheduled meetings with staff to review sales goals, priority cases, provide general updates and information, and identify opportunities for improvement in process. Participate and/or facilitate regularly occurring meetings with client services counterparts to help drive business. Required Skills And Competencies  The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Effective interpersonal and written communication skills Ability to provide excellent customer service to both internal and external customers Effective time management skills Ability to prioritize and accomplish multiple tasks simultaneously Capable of working independently as well as in a team environment Ability to work in a self-directed fashion Experience with PC's in a Windows environment Four year college degree in business or a related field or equivalent combination of education and relevant experience Ability to work without close supervision and to exercise independent judgment and problem solving in a professional area Demonstrated time management and organizational skills Strong attention to detail and accuracy Ability to communicate precisely and professionally in both verbal and written communication with internal and external customers alike Ability to react to change in a productive and positive manner Ability and willingness to support team to accomplish team goals Minimum 1 year experience as SSA Proven leadership ability (credibility with carriers, peers, trust, process review to get things accomplished, using resources effectively) Solid interdepartmental, carrier, and external customer relationships High level understanding of all Crump internal departments and how they relate to case management process Truist supports a diverse workforce and is an Equal Opportunity Employer who does not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, gender, color, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status or other classification protected by law. Drug Free Workplace.  Thank you for your interest in Truist! BB&T and SunTrust have come together in a transformational merger of equals to create Truist, the premier financial organization in the country. You may notice references to our legacy company names, BB&T and SunTrust, in places throughout this site. All such references should be understood to refer to Truist moving forward while we continue to transition to the Truist name.

Swiftly is the leading digital platform for Brick-and-Mortar retailers, top CPG brands and the millions of customers in their stores every day. Our technology provides a best-in-class, digitally connected shopper experience on-line, in-app and in-store. We’re building a culture where personal and professional growth drive business growth. Make an impact on customers and community, work with cool technology and build things that impact millions of customers every day.  Swiftly is growing and we are looking to add a seasoned sales professional to our team. You will build and foster ongoing relationships with CPG brands in the retail space. In this role you will balance business development with warm leads to grow our client portfolio and expand our Retail Media Network.  Qualified Candidates Will Possess: -5-7+ years of experience selling in the CPG advertising space -A proven history of developing relationships from both warm leads and expanding your own network -Strong verbal and written communication skills, including presentation experience  Ideal Candidates Offer: -A background in retail media sales  Swiftly’s office is in Seattle, WA  Swiftly’s product teams operate on west coast time with offices in Silicon Valley and Seattle. Many team members operate remotely, and virtual opportunities are available for those with a successful background working with geographically distributed teams. Unfortunately we are unable to provide immigration support.     Working For Swiftly We are working on a set of problems that require the best in the industry to get right. Our employees are the pillars of the future of the company and they are treated and compensated as such. We're a growing team of experienced industry professionals building an organization that can solve tough problems and values a collaborative environment.   Every Swiftly employee:  -Has demonstrated the ability to work collaboratively in an ambiguous, fast-paced environment  -Takes ownership of their domain from the ground up, from inception through deployment to customers  -Leaves their ego at the door and ensures the best idea leaves the room  -Is always experimenting with new technologies and learning new skillsets   If you've ever wanted to work on a project that blends a gorgeous consumer experience, sophisticated logistics, and scale that rivals the largest technology players, Swiftly is the place for you.   Swiftly is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Swiftly does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.
industries: Computer Software, Retail, and Online Media

description: My client is a growing start-up becoming a leader in Digital Experience Monitoring for Cloud Applications.  Microsoft and Forrester are starting to reference them  They are looking for a Senior Sales Executive in Boston (must be located near here) They are kooking for someone who is entrepreneurial in spirit and ok working for a small start-up to help them grow. They have a lot of inside/marketing support but not a huge/established sales team as of now. description: Be part of our Sales Incubator company that helps brands sell to the world's largest retailers. The ideal candidate will be responsible for overseeing the success of all sales and marketing strategies. This candidate will be knowledgeable about the market and our competitive advantages in order to best recommend new sales strategies for success.   Responsibilities Foster new business relationships and manage existing relationships Recommend sales strategies for improvement based on market research and competitor analyses Conduct budget reviews to ensure sales and marketing activities are within budget Attend industry trade events along with networking opportunities and other relevant meetings  Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent 5+ years' relevant experience Experience working with Salesforce.com or similar CRM

We are seeking an experienced Territory Sales Manager in multiple markets nationwide.  The Territory Sales Manager is responsible for achieving sales objectives and growing sales volume for client’s products and services within targeted accounts in an assigned territory. They are also ultimately responsible for growing the business through the delivery of branded products, marketing strategies, service excellence and technical superiority.  Job Responsibilities Include: Sales performance and customer relations Developing a trusted advisor relationship Utilizing corporate tools and applications to document, plan, monitor, and meet sales objectives within their territory Developing and maintaining strong working relationships with partners to ensure successful customer relations and achievement of sales objectives Consistently achieving established sales goals Communicating with District Sales Manager on an ongoing basis regarding personal growth, sales results, and plans of action  REQUIRED COMPETENCIES: To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies: Problem Solving - Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; Gathers and analyzes information skillfully; Develops alternative solutions; Works well in group problem solving situations; Uses reason even when dealing with emotional topics. Customer Service - Manages difficult or emotional customer situations; Responds promptly to customer needs; Solicits customer feedback to improve service; Responds to requests for service and assistance; Meets commitments. Interpersonal Skills - Focuses on solving conflict, not blaming; Maintains confidentiality; Listens to others without interrupting; Keeps emotions under control; Remains open to others' ideas and tries new things.  Oral Communication - Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations; Listens and gets clarification; Responds well to questions; Demonstrates group presentation skills; Participates in meetings. Judgment - Displays willingness to make decisions; Exhibits sound and accurate judgment; Makes timely decisions. Motivation - Sets and achieves challenging goals; Demonstrates persistence and overcomes obstacles; Measures self against standard of excellence. Attendance/Punctuality - Is consistently at work and on time; Ensures work responsibilities are covered when absent; Arrives at meetings and appointments on time. Dependability - Follows instructions, responds to management direction; Takes responsibility for own actions; Keeps commitments; Commits to long hours of work when necessary to reach goals; Completes tasks on time or notifies appropriate person with an alternate plan.  EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor’s degree strongly preferred. Demonstrated sales results with 1 to 3 years sales experience preferred. Demonstrated computer skills. Demonstrated presentation skills. Customer service experience or client relations strongly preferred. Must have a valid driver’s license, valid auto insurance coverage, and access to a vehicle.  Capable of regularly operating a vehicle for an extended period to travel the territory up to 90% of the time. Capable of driving for an extended period under a variety of conditions and spending extended periods sitting in the vehicle. Must have an acceptable Motor Vehicle Record (MVR) as driving is an essential job function. Flexible work schedule and occasional out-of-the-area and overnight travel are expected. Candidates must live in the territory.

description: About Kommute:  The future of work is here and the challenges to build stronger connections with co-workers, customers, and candidates are greater than ever - so that’s why we created Kommute. Kommute is a video messaging platform that makes it easy to communicate more efficiently and effectively at work through instantly shareable audio, video, and screen-share recordings.  The Sales Coordinator Role:  Looking for that ideal role to kick start your software sales career?  You will be employee number five into a scrappy start-up, with veteran entrepreneurial expertise and funding. We are a remote first team with our headquarters in Atlanta, GA. As our team grows, our "Remote Roadie" philosophy aims to build collaboration hubs throughout the US - ensuring you are never more than 45 minutes away from a Kommute teammate. In addition to our Headquarters in Atlanta, we currently have hubs in Pittsburgh,PA and Greenville,SC.  Your primary responsibility will be to support our leadership team in all sales-related activities while we tenaciously meet our sales goals every day, every week, every month, every year.  You will: Assist others in managing all sales-related activities, from coordinating meetings to preparing sales materials. Maintain an up-to-date, organized sales CRM with detailed notes, contacts and deals. Conduct prequalification calls and/or lead reviews of inbound leads to accurately identify qualified sales leads. Draft sales emails based on current sales campaigns and strategic messaging. Conduct market research and market segmentation analysis and report findings. Prepare accurate, triple-checked sales data and reports using CRM analytics. In time, conduct sales meetings and product demos with qualified prospects. Know that feedback is a gift, and remain fully open to your personal development Be reliable, if you commit to a course of action you will follow through and execute the details of your projects. Persist on the day to day grind, and realize for our mission to persevere you will be stretched beyond your comfort zone, yet realize that is where your individual growth will be found. Offer to assist in any area of the team that needs your expertise. Confidently report directly to the CEO. Your Background: At least one year of experience in a software sales or software support role (No exceptions). Experience working within a CRM system or equivalent. Experience demonstrating Web-based software remotely to prospects. Great interpersonal skills to collaborate in a positive, constructive, fun manner. A self-starter attitude and the willingness to go above and beyond. Excellent communication/presentation/storytelling skills, and a sense of humor. Bachelor’s degree in Business, Philosophy, Marketing or a related field required. Powered by JazzHR  IDArsWktl7

This candidate should be comfortable with frequent travel and be able to generate new sales leads on a regular basis. The candidate should be able to keep track of their sales and effectively communicate with other team members while out in the field.   Responsibilities Establish and maintain relationships with clients Educate clients and conduct product demonstrations Generate potential leads for future sales Set and exceed quotas Track and report sales in organized manner Communicate effectively with other members of team  Qualifications Bachelor's degree 2- 5 years of sales experience Strong work ethic and communication skills Ability to travel in order to do business

We’re thrilled to announce Handshake’s $80M Series E funding round. From the start, we’ve made it our mission to break down barriers and create equitable access to great jobs. We’re expanding our mission to build a platform students love, that helps early talent of all backgrounds receive access to opportunities – no matter who they know or where they go to school.  Handshake is the number one site for college students to find a job. Today, the Handshake community includes 18 million students and young alumni at over 1,000 colleges and universities. We connect up-and-coming talent across all 50 states with nearly 500,000 employers recruiting on Handshake — from every Fortune 500 company to thousands of small businesses, nonprofits, startups, and more. Handshake is democratizing opportunity and ensuring college students have the support they need to find a great job and kick-off a meaningful career.  Everyone is welcome at Handshake. We know diverse teams build better products and we are committed to creating an inclusive culture built on a foundation of respect for all individuals. We strongly encourage candidates from non-traditional backgrounds, historically marginalized or underrepresented groups to apply.  If you are not sure that you’re 100% qualified, but up for the challenge – we want you to apply. We believe skills are transferable and passion for our mission goes a long way.  Want to learn more about what it's like to work at Handshake? Check out these interviews from our team members!  We are hiring across multiple locations in Atlanta, Chicago, Denver, Seattle, LA, SF and NYC. If you are not in one of these locations, please apply to our remote role!  Your Impact  We’re looking for an Enterprise Account Executive to join our Employer Sales Team - showcasing Handshake as the premier way for top brands to recruit emerging college talent. You will be responsible for developing and delivering a stable book of business: prospecting, cultivating, and closing new accounts while growing existing customer relationships and helping Handshake hit growth and attainment targets. You will maximize revenue while producing value and brand awareness for hundreds of current and prospective clients across the country.  Your Role Handshake can drive ideal candidates to their businesses Develop and cultivate deep relationships with senior executives at the Director, SVP, and VP levels Interact and collaborate across Handshake, engaging with the University and Student teams to build and grow our multi-sided talent marketplace Actively source and provide valuable market research, including industry-specific information and trends for customers and teammates Conceive and pitch creative recruiting solutions that match individual business needs Command, report and forecast sales activity - from prospecting target accounts and contacts to closing deals and growing existing relationships Update and create sales proposals, leading complex relationships with recruiting teams around the country Work closely with the Employer, Student, and University Product teams to gather, analyze, and understand customer requirements to develop product enhancements Generate scalable revenue and hit target quota on a quarterly and annual basis Expand pre-existing and new customer relationships by encouraging adoption and managing annual upsells Your Experience At least 3-5 years of sales experience in Enterprise SaaS sales and/or HR business development, minimum 1 year of Enterprise closing experience Experience operating in a high-growth business environment like Handshake A strong history of quota attainment and excellent performance on a high-reaching team Willing to work out of our San Francisco office or remotely on the West Coast, with availability for domestic travel up to 40% Bonus Areas Of Expertise Experience preparing sales proposals, forecasting, and account planning Knowledge of how online recruiting technology works - and the ability to explain it in ordinary terms Possess relationships with key HR decision makers at national Fortune 1000 companies and other top brands. Ability to successfully drive revenue and growth through the development of long-term strategic relationships with existing customers Benefits Stock: Ownership in a fast-growing company. 401k: We care about your ability to save for your future. Family Focus: Parental leave and flexibility for families. Time Off: Flexible vacation policy to encourage people to get out and see the world. Healthcare: World-class medical, dental, and vision policies. Goodies: Whatever hardware and software you need to get the job done. Team Fun: Regularly scheduled events, sports, game nights, book clubs. Learning: Learning & Development opportunities for you to grow your skills and career. Great team: Working with fun, hardworking, nice people who are committed to making a difference! ...And much more! We value diversity of all kinds, and are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other. We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome people of all different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives.  Interested in what Handshake’s San Francisco HQ is like when we’re together? Check out this video:  Just browsing or not ready to apply? Keep in touch with us!

Summary Responsible for achieving revenue targets by acquiring and maintaining customer relationships in the East US region for all Pulse products. Also, responsible to manage distributors branch offices and representatives to achieve regional financial objectives. Coordinates with Sales Business Unit (SBU), Product Business Unit (PBU) and Operations leadership to meet customer requirements and resolve customer issues.   Can be located anywhere in the East Coast.  Minimum Qualifications Education: BSEE or BA in Marketing or Engineering, or equivalent experience.   Experience: Minimum of five (5) years sales experience in electronic components or other related industries combined with team and customer account & territory management   Knowledge: Basic knowledge of electronics and familiarity with circuits. Basic understanding of component manufacturing processes and technology.   Skills: Strong computer familiarity with MS office products including Excel, Word and PowerPoint. Superior interpersonal, communication and negotiation skills required.   Challenges Identify the decision makers at the customer for product and design. Qualify Pulse parts and effectively compare competition. Engineering, organizational, and strong people skills are required.   Developments in reschedules, cancellations, pricing, and credit disputes. Problem solving, record keeping, and negotiation skills required.   Getting new designs sampled or committed. Pertains to new products and packaging concepts.   Bring various elements of Pulse organization together (marketing, planning, engineering, etc.) to properly and efficiently meet account expectations and requirements.   Developing credibility with internal Pulse organization regarding accurate, objective reporting to Account Manager in real time.   Identify market drivers and/or trends at customer. Drive actions within Pulse and Customer base to successfully place Pulse in a position to grow revenue in the sales territory.    Specific Position Duties   Work with Pulse design engineers to meet customer requirements while maintaining compatibility with Pulse design and manufacturing concepts.  Provide input to product marketing and engineering on business and technical trends at the customer.  Provide sales and bookings forecasts as appropriate and as directed by the Director of Sales and Marketing.  Act as key contact or liaison between assigned key account(s) and all Pulse departments.  Interact with operations as necessary to meet customer requirements or to resolve business or technical issues.  Make presentations to management as necessary.  Develop and initiate workable procedures and business plans to maximize business at accounts.  Maintain up-to-date mailing and phone lists of all contacts.  Obtain necessary information and data from account for Pulse review and decision making.  Establish and provide regular updates on sales and marketing objectives.  Provide knowledgeable and efficient technical interface between account project engineering functions and Pulse design engineering functions.  Provide product marketing with latest known technical information in order to meet leading edge product needs in the marketplace.  Help solve account related problems within the Pulse organization.  Understand market for customers' products that utilize Pulse products.  Demonstrates leadership to other Account Managers through effective sales skills.  Coordinate and deploy regional FAEs and PBU resources to effectively drive design wins

Copado - #1 Native Salesforce DevOps Solution  Sales Program Manager- US - Remote   Copado is a fast-growing organization that believes in it’s people to enable our business to scale and grow. We provide our people with flexible working environments and benefits for our international organization.  Copado is looking for a talented, hardworking individual with great energy, and initiative to help mature and scale one of the fastest growing applications in the Salesforce ecosystem.  The Program Manager will join the global GTM Strategy & Operations team partnering closely with our Marketing, Enablement and Alliances teams. The role will operationalize programs and plays across vertically aligned sales teams, and will work the Data & Analytics team to define a standard way of tracking results including pipeline volume and conversion analysis. The Program Manager will ensure visibility of upcoming playbooks with stakeholders across the GTM organization to ensure alignment, and provide regular executive level updates of impact.  This is an excellent opportunity for a proven Sales Programs Manager, marketing project manager, or an experienced sales operations professional to play a leadership role in a rapidly growing GTM organization.  Responsibilities: Collaborate with Product Marketing to create and rollout sales plays across the global GTM organization Work with Sales Enablement to build and evolve Copado’s sales methodology  Partner with Marketing to assess and optimize account-based strategies  Build on Copado’s customer success framework to drive upsell plays and conduct strategic account planning with cross-functional sales teams Collaborate with Alliances organization and Partner Marketing to build repeatable partner sales campaigns   This job is for you if you: Have a working knowledge of effective sales strategies (seed, grow, advise) 4-6+ years of experience in sales/marketing operations or sales development Have experience coordinating the rollout of programs across a global GTM team Have experience collaborating with Marketing and Sales Enablement to build sales plays and ensure sale readiness Have used data to quantify and identify opportunities Have worked with stakeholders to turn insights into actionable sales plays adopted by a global sales team Previous experience in the Salesforce.com or Dev Ops ecosystems is a plus  You are a fit for Copado if: You are energetic and enjoy working in a fast-paced global environment You have high adaptability and flexibility, including the ability to manage deadline pressure, ambiguity, and change You love working in an agile environment and continuously strive for improvement Want to be part of the growth of an early stage organization

About: Spotter is the largest O+O creator platform.  We leverage our proprietary underwriting and predictive technology to identify and acquire YouTube's top YouTube Select and premium creator's content with high viewership, engagement, and quality audiences. With over 120 channels and 100,000 videos in our O&O library, we deliver effective and efficient media with brand suitability controls on the world’s largest advertising video platform.    The world is seeing an unprecedented shift in its consumption of media and entertainment away from linear television. At the same time, the creator economy and viewership within YouTube is growing faster than ever. Spotter has a unique and stand alone platform that offers key advantages to the world's top brands and holding companies.  Overview:  The Account Manager works directly with a team of our sales Account Directors across the U.S. to grow revenue by building and implementing media plans and tracking the performance of these campaigns that run on Spotter’s portfolio.  Responsibilities: Develop media strategy and recommendations  Present media plans and provide plan maintenance including objectives/strategies and updates with designated sales team Build presentation decks and sales materials to support media plan strategy Prepare and issue buying specs and guidelines to buyers including delivery goals and budgets for use in negotiations  Review and verify media buys & collaborate with the Ad Operations team to ensure a smooth campaign process  Qualifications:   B.A. or B.S., preferably in Marketing, Advertising, or related field   3-4+ years of experience in media planning/strategy   Outstanding written and verbal skills, with ability to present to clients, maintain client correspondence and internal documentation  Detail-oriented, good follow through, able to multitask, and work well under tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment in order to meet client and internal deadlines/obligations Strong working knowledge of Google Drive, Google Docs, Google Sheets, Google Slides, & Google Ads along with Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, & PowerPoint)  Spotter is an equal opportunity employer. Spotter does not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic characteristics or information, marital status, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, and related medical conditions), gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, sexual orientation, military status, veteran status, use of or request for family or medical leave, political affiliation, or any other status protected under applicable federal, state or local laws.   Equal access to programs, services and employment is available to all persons.
