description: Company Description  Open to anyone in the Broward County area.  BUILD your career with an organization that is a leader in national advertising focused on local flavor. As part of our team, you will help our clients reach more than 21.1 million homes each year with the best deals available.  LIVE your passion through a culture that actively supports community involvement and delivers hope to missing children and their families across the nation through its involvement in the Have You Seen Me?® Program.  CREATE our future by delivering highly relevant, useful and smart content - when and how people need it - to make the best decisions possible in navigating their local community.  Home & Décor Ideas/Clipper Magazine (a Valassis company) is a leader in print & digital advertising solutions for hyper-local businesses all over the country. We mail on a monthly to semi-monthly basis, to over 451 markets across 22 states. Each edition is filled with money-saving local deals and coupons as well as major regional and national advertisers.  Job Description  As an Advertising Sales Representative for our Home and Décor Ideas publication, you will prospect new business in the field and maintain your existing account base in the home improvement categories. You will sell our multiple print & digital solutions to local, small to medium-sized business owners within your territory. Although the Home and Décor Ideas publication will be your primary area of responsibility, you will have the ability to sell our entire suite of products to all types of businesses. Our other products include Clipper Magazine, the SAVE wrap, postcards, Total Loyalty Solutions, and more.  What You’ll Do New Business Development, In-field Cold Calling Evaluate Prospective Client Needs, Establish Solutions, Build Long-lasting Relationships Manage Entire Sales Process Including Payment Collection Daily Salesforce CRM Reporting Follow-up and Customer Service to Existing Clients We’re looking for someone with outside sales experience, preferably in advertising. We have a great training program that outlines our products, systems and strategies. This is an exciting opportunity for someone who is financially motivated and looking to take control of their future success. This position is also a great way to experience ownership of a publication, without having to take on the financial responsibilities that come with operating your own business.  What We Need  Qualifications B2B Sales Experience (Media Sales preferred) Excellent Customer Service Skills High Energy, In-Market Prospector Consultative Solutions Seller Technology Skills - Comfortable Building & Presenting Virtual Presentations What We Offer  Additional Information Salary + Uncapped Commission Full Health Benefits Package 401(k) with Company Match Paid Vacations and Holidays Opportunities for Growth In-Field Support from Corporate Office Teams in Pennsylvania & Local Management Comprehensive Sales Training If you believe you’re a qualified candidate and would like to join our team, please click "I'm Interested" to submit your resume for review. We are currently scheduling interviews.  We are the best local advertising in America with a national reach.  Home & Décor Ideas, Clipper Magazine and its digital compliment, LocalFlavor.com, helps small-to-medium sized businesses grow through multiple marketing solutions.  Home & Décor Ideas, Clipper Magazine and its affiliated brands* feature local advertisers and national brands to create a one-of-a-kind, community-oriented publications that reflects the unique "flavor" of each market. Each edition offers special values on all goods and services desired and sought after by consumers.  Our digital marketing solutions include LocalFlavor.com, which hosts additional savings and half-price Deals. A customer-retention program, Total Loyalty Solutions, gives local merchants the online power of larger companies with a suite of digital tools, including branded mobile apps, email marketing and website services. Clipper Magazine also publishes under the brands Local Flavor, Mint Magazine, Reach, Great Deals, Market Magazine, Get1Free. Clipper Magazine considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin or ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or any other classifications protected by law. In addition, Clipper Magazine will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.  EEO is the law. To review your rights under Equal Employment Opportunity please visit: www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf.

Overview  This is an exciting new role where the successful candidate will be selling Rain Bird products to influential customers at top golf courses in the US. He/she will work collaboratively with Rain Bird sales colleagues and golf distribution in assigned markets to grow sales and increase market share through education and demonstration of the irrigation industry’s latest product technologies. He/she will strengthen Rain Bird’s market position as the industry leader in central control technology, establish and build highly productive relationships with key influencers, and educate and successfully sell customized irrigation solutions to new and existing golf courses.  Responsibilities  The Product Sales Manager operates as a “solution-based” sales role with the flexibility to build relationships with the highest opportunity customers and make inroads in top markets, driving sales growth in those markets with high energy efforts to promote Rain Bird’s technology benefits. The successful candidate will be capable of analyzing customer needs and system design, presenting product benefits to best meet the needs for each application.  Qualifications  MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: 4-year bachelor’s degree. 5+ years of successful sales experience with progressive responsibilities. Proven technical sales competence, preferably in golf course products. Track record of delivering successful presentations in front of both end users and golf course executives. Proven track record in negotiating business deals. Excellent verbal and written communications skills. Ability to achieve results individually and through collaborative influence. Working knowledge of personal computers and commonly used business software (i.e., Word, Excel, PowerPoint). Willingness to travel up to 50% of time to achieve sales objectives. Desired Qualifications Golf course industry experience Golf irrigation experience Experience in training distributors and end customers Fluency in foreign language(s) Rain Bird is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

About innRoad innRoad is a rapidly growing Traveltech SaaS company offering best-in-class Property Management, Rate Management, Channel Management and Guest Conversion Solutions to lodging clients focused on growing their business. Named one of New York City’s “Hottest Startups”, innRoad serves thousands of properties in multiple geographies and is poised to increase market share while continuing to help existing clients streamline workflows, increase revenue and reduce costs.   The Opportunity Our Sales Operations Manager will work directly with the V.P. of Sales and provide assistance to the Sales team while enhancing our programs and systems. As a Sales Operations Manager, your mission is to connect people, processes, and data. The ideal candidate is an individual who thinks two-steps ahead; a true team player who enjoys supporting deals to closure and can work in a fast-paced environment without losing sight of the details and guidelines.   Responsibilities -Sales Systems & Reporting: ensure the effective administration of HubSpot/Salesforce to support clarity and accountability of sales activity and progress Provide accurate, real time visibility into team performance from MQL to Closed deals Ensure that Salesforce CRM data is collected accurately and efficiently Develop insightful Salesforce Dashboards and Reports to monitor inbound lead volume/source tracking ·       Manage sales operations process to enable team productivity Proactively identify bottlenecks and opportunities in sales process Includes lead prioritization, scoring and distribution / territory management -Help in selecting, implementing, and maintaining Salesforce and other sales automation/enablement tools Responsible for roll out, on-going training, adoption and optimization of tools Increase sales team productivity and effectiveness by simplifying processes Own vendor relationship including renewal dates, pricing, etc -Work with marketing to create sales enablement and training tools as needed based on feedback from Sales Manager and Sales VP -Assist with recruiting and on-boarding of new sales reps   Qualifications Experience in a selling or sales operations role utilizing multiple technologies Comfortable analyzing raw data in excel and coming up with actionable recommendations Proficiency in Salesforce and Microsoft Excel Program management skills Detail oriented Strong analytical and problem solving skills Ability to understand the bigger picture of the business and translate to system and process requirements to ensure objectives are met Ability to own the end to end process of sales process and conversion rates throughout the funnel   Perks & Benefits innRoad offers a comprehensive benefits package including health, vision, dental, healthcare FSA, dependent care FSA, 401K Match, generous PTO, and observed holidays. We have a culture built on collaborative teamwork, respect, transparency, can-do attitudes and professional growth. ** This is a Remote Work Opportunity**

Job Description Overview Reporting to the Chief Revenue Officer, Regional Sales Managers (RSMs) will be part of a dynamic team that is selling the world’s premier, SaaS-based, intellectual property management system and IP lifecycle solutions. RSM’s will be responsible for developing and driving their territory’s sales strategy, identifying and qualifying leads while consistently closing business on a monthly/quarterly basis – all in order to meet or exceed their annual sales quota. RSM’s will sell MaxVal’s complete range of products and services to corporations within the USA. Ideal candidates will have the ability to consult with customers, identify requirements, present technical information in easily understood terms, demo the solution and develop quality revenue relationships that meet/exceed customer' needs. This is an outside sales role which supports the individual working remotely from our headquarters, which are in Los Gatos, CA, although working from our headquarters’ offices is preferred.  Responsibilities  Identify prospects, grow and manage sales pipeline to achieve targets Leverage consultative selling skills to propose solutions aligned with prospect needs Coordinate software demos and service presentations with prospects and internal business development team Manage sales process from opportunity identification to close Develop and deliver presentations and proposals as appropriate Participate in conferences and tradeshows Leverage CRM system to ensure accurate sales forecasting Manage and monitor health of customer relationships  Requirements  3+ years of successful experience selling enterprise software products or services Experience with legal or intellectual property subject matter is a mandatory Self-motivated, able to work independently and as a member of a remote team Proven ability to build and manage a sales pipeline and achieve targets Excellent communication skills (presentation, verbal, and written) Knowledge of/experienced with use of sales CRM Demonstrated expertise in building and maintaining client relationships Capable of traveling up to 50% Bachelor’s degree  Character -         Passionate and energetic about selling technology solutions -         Hungry, self-starting sales individual with career advancement aspirations -         Straightforward and honest with a strong team orientation -         Intelligent, flexible, and passionate about work -         Resourceful and energetic with an innate sense of urgency -         Able to present and communicate technical solutions clearly and concisely -         Understand business concepts and how tech solutions resolve customer pain or create opportunity

We have an immediate opening for a Business Development Specialist/Manager at our Deerfield Beach, Florida headquarters.  Our company provides final assembly, labeling, and packaging services of drug delivery devices to the pharmaceutical and biotechnology industries and soon clinical fill-finish capabilities. Scientists and Engineers work closely with our partners to continuously create and introduce innovative, patient-centric solutions to enhance patient compliance and user experiences. Dedicated project managers work closely with their partner company counterparts to develop and maintain program timelines in line with our partners’ strategic and business needs. In addition, for those partners who wish to have SHL handle the final assembly process, SHL Pharma offers robust final assembly and labeling capabilities that enable our partners to improve speed to market and reduce the number of parties involved and have one clear point of responsibility.  Job Overview  The Business Development Specialist/Manager is a vital member of the Business Development team and is responsible for driving leads and potential customers to the Directors of Business Development in order to ensure a successful sales process.  Main Responsibilities  Build and manage relationships with existing and potential customers and clients. Work strategically with the marketing, sales, and legal teams to drive standard templates for product proposals and quotations. Research potential partners via analytical tools and industry publications. Participate and support in-person and virtual industry conferences.  Skills and Qualification  College degree in Business, Marketing, Engineering or other related field. Minimum of 2 years working experience in fields relating to sales and/or marketing, business consulting, and/or financial analysis. Excellent understanding of tools for financial evaluation, such as the break-even points, cash flows, etc. Excellent written and verbal communication skills required for internal/external interactions and presentations. Ability to excel in a fast paced, deadline driven environment. Ability to develop strong relationships with others. Ability to foster a positive company and brand image. Demonstrated team management and leadership ability is a plus.  We Offer  Exciting opportunity in a fast-growing international medical device company A modern working environment, with multicultural and dynamic teams Competitive compensation package  Interested in joining SHL Medical and in supporting us with your expertise and personality? Then we look forward to receiving your application including CV, motivation letter and all other relevant documents. For more information on SHL Medical, please visit our website: www.shl-medical.com  Is this not quite what you are looking for? Further interesting career opportunities can be found on our SHL Career page: https://www.shl-medical.com/careers/join-shl/  Please note: For this position we do not consider applications from recruitment agencies.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills including building presentations and driving conversations in a business setting. Strong interpersonal communication and collaboration skills. Experience using financial, customer and operational metrics to drive strategy. Manages key supplier & interpersonal relationships to ensure successful program implementation. The ability to travel 50% - 70% or more of the time based on the locations of the Regional Accounts. Professional Experience Knowledge of MS Excel, Word, and PowerPoint Utilization of SalesForce.com and or other CRM tools Utilization of virtual meeting tools Certifications/Licenses Valid driver’s license with clean driving record. Proximity to a major airport. Willing and able to travel by plane or car often. FleetPride is the leader in the industry comprised of retail, service, distribution and wholesale divisions.

Why Birdeye?  15 years ago brands controlled customer experiences. But in 2021, it’s customer experiences that control brands. Customers now choose businesses based on shared experiences, not ads. So marketers now have to create and promote great experiences, and they need a platform that can do this at scale.  Birdeye is an all-in-one Experience Marketing platform for multi-location businesses. More than 60,000 businesses of all sizes use Birdeye every day to be found online and chosen through listings, reviews and referrals; be connected with leads and customers on the channels of their choice, and deliver the best customer experience with survey, ticketing and insights tools.  Founded in 2012, Birdeye is headquartered in Palo Alto, and led by alumni from Google, Amazon, Salesforce and Yahoo. Birdeye is backed by Salesforce founder Marc Benioff, Yahoo co-founder Jerry Yang, Trinity Ventures and World Innovation Lab. The company has been the highest-rated Experience Marketing platform over the last 5 years on G2.  To learn more, please visit: https://birdeye.com https://topworkplaces.com/company/birdeye/  What You'll Do:  At Birdeye, the sales team is responsible for all sales efforts and the team's success is central to our move up market. As the Mid Market Sales Manager, you’ll manage a team and help them generate demand, interest, and excitement for Birdeye while creating a steady pipeline of business to arm the Sales team.  Responsibilities: Learn the Birdeye sales process, from outbounding, to discovery and demos, to getting deals over the finish line Coach all your team members to fully achieve their quota each month / quarter Scale your team as needed to enable all of Sales to achieve our revenue goals Develop Mid Market sales reps' skill sets to move them into the next step (Enterprise or leadership) Use your sales abilities to effectively move a team in the direction of the company Empower your direct reports to succeed through training & motivation Help develop promoted Sales Development Representatives into Account Executives  Grow your management skills by working with our VP of Mid Market Sales Willingness to learn to sell the product yourself during the initial ramp period  Requirements: 2 - 4 years in proven sales leadership in a closing role 4+ years in a sales role (SaaS and B2B preferred) and a top quota performer at your company Passion for hiring, onboarding, coaching, motivating, and developing your team Incredible leadership and mentorship skills with the ability to learn from others while teaching and leading an ambitious, growing team Experience with high growth companies and the ability to find clarity in rapidly changing environments Someone who has the drive to be promoted; managing a small team is not your ultimate goal  Why You'll Join Us:  At Birdeye, we know that our success is tied to our customers’ success, so we are continually raising the bar for ourselves and others around us to deliver meaningful results.  We seek to innovate and to be the #1 product in our category, which means we need to drive results for our customers and to always deliver what we commit.  Our quality needs to be world-class and second to none, so we are exceptionally hands-on to get work done. We roll up our sleeves and DO.  Working at Birdeye means being part of a tight-knit family that helps you succeed and loves to celebrate with you! We find strength in diversity and inclusion, so we strive to find different points of view and expect everyone to represent their authentic self at all times.  Benefits: Employer-paid benefits with multiple health plan options (HSA, PPO) Unlimited PTO 401(k) with company match Flexible work from home options available Maternity & Paternity Leave Employee Resource Groups - network with like-minded "Birds" Abundant opportunities that come with a dynamic and fast-growing organization!

description: Company Info  Teva is a global pharmaceutical leader and the world's largest generic medicines producer, committed to improving health and increasing access to quality health solutions worldwide. Our employees are at the core of our success, with colleagues in over 80 countries delivering the world's largest medicine cabinet to 200 million people every day. We offer a uniquely diverse portfolio of products and solutions for patients and we've built a promising pipeline centered around our core therapeutic areas. We are continually developing patient-centric solutions and significantly growing both our generic and specialty medicines business through investment in research and development, marketing, business development and innovation. This is how we improve health and enable people to live better, healthier lives. Join us on our journey of growth!  Job Description  Teva is searching for a Regional Sales Manager (RSM) to join our psychiatry sales team in Boston, MA. This position will be part of the newly created sales team focused on the psychiatry space and responsible for the performance of a yet-to-be-approved long-acting injectable therapy for schizophrenia. The RSM will hire, onboard, and build out a regional team comprised of 8-10 sales associates. The RSM will be responsible for achieving and delivering results in a compliant and ethical manner. The RSM will possess an understanding of organizational objectives and align resources appropriately to meet those objectives. While pursuing their goals, the incumbent will uphold the culture and values of Teva in all interactions and business matters. They will analyze trends and apply knowledge to help the sales team accomplish its sales goals. Additionally, the RSM will effectively and efficiently plan and complete all business activities via aligned objectives and analytics and will maximize available resources. The RSM will build and maintain strong, mutually beneficial networks/relationships with both internal and external stakeholders. The RSM will possess impactful and influential communication and presentation skills and keep the objective in mind while moving the sales team towards a solution.  Essential Areas Of Responsibility  The following areas of responsibility are essential to the satisfactory performance of this position by any incumbent. Any nonessential functions are assumed to be included in other related duties or assignments. Identify, recruit, coach, and retain top talent for the Teva Psychiatry sales team Develop expertise and coach others on regional business focus areas, including settings of care, payer and pull through opportunities, and flawless execution of the marketing strategy Develop effective business plans to meet and exceed regional sales goals Coach/train others on different settings of care to identify key business opportunities Demonstrate a collaborative sales approach and coordinate efforts between sales leadership, other Teva sales teams, market access, sales operations, and training Adhere to all Teva compliance guidelines, operate with integrity, and ensure the sales team adheres to these policies Review weekly/monthly data reports to identify trends and make plans to address concerns Coach teams on the execution of the defined call plan for each territory representative Coach teams towards success from hire date onward, providing appropriate counseling, encouragement, and oversight to ensure effective execution of brand strategy Spend 90+ days in the field, supporting local sales representatives The ideal candidate will live in Boston, MA Qualifications  Any equivalent combination of education, training, and/or experience that fulfills the requirements of the position will be considered.  Education/Certification/Experience Bachelor's degree required Minimum of 1.5 years of pharmaceutical first line sales management or related people management required A record of successfully achieving sales goals and building, coaching, and developing effective sales teams required Experience in psychiatric therapeutic areas strongly preferred Specific experience with long-acting injectables for the treatment of schizophrenia preferred Experience successfully launching products in the psychiatric space across multiple settings of care preferred Injectable and in-office administration experience within a mental health facility preferred Skills/Knowledge/Abilities  Ability to interact with customers in live and virtual environments and proficiency with technology  Understanding of reimbursement coverage and pull through strategies as well as experience in all pertinent settings of business (CMHC, specialty pharmacy, private practice)  Proven written and verbal communication skills  Valid US driver's license and acceptable driving record required  Teva Pharmaceuticals USA, Inc. requires all U.S. new hires to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 (unless an accommodation is legally required) prior to the first day of Teva employment. As required by applicable law, however, Teva will consider requests for reasonable accommodations.  Additionally, U.S. new hires for customer facing roles will be required to complete all credentialing requirements for access to their customers’ targets within 60 days of their start date. Such credentialing requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional vaccinations and medical testing. Any request for an exception to the credentialing requirements will need to be approved by the national sales leader within the first 60 days of employment.  Travel Requirements  Extensive travel throughout the assigned region, which may include air travel and weekend or overnight travel.  Function  Sales  Sub Function  Medical Representation  Reports To  In process of validation  Already Working @TEVA?  If you are a current Teva employee, please apply using the internal career site available on "Employee Central". By doing so, your application will be treated with priority. You will also be able to see opportunities that are open exclusively to Teva employees. Use the following link to search and apply: Internal Career Site  The internal career site is available from your home network as well. If you have trouble accessing your EC account, please contact your local HR/IT partner.  Teva’s Equal Employment Opportunity Commitment  Teva Pharmaceuticals is committed to equal opportunity in employment. It is Teva's global policy that equal employment opportunity be provided without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, disability, pregnancy, medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, ancestry, veteran status, national or ethnic origin or any other legally recognized status entitled to protection under applicable laws.  Teva Pharmaceuticals is committed to equal opportunity in employment. It is Teva's policy that equal employment opportunity be provided without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, disability, pregnancy, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, ancestry, national or ethnic origin, citizenship status, military status or status as a disabled or protected veteran, or any legally recognized status entitled to protection under applicable federal, state, or local laws.

description: Our Company  Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.  We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!  The Adobe GTM Strategy and Analytics team is seeking an experienced sales strategy and operations analyst who will bolster our multi-platform analytics environment. By partnering with executive and sales leadership, your insights will advise market strategy for solutions at the very heart of the future of work and groundbreaking digital experiences. As a sales analytics and strategy analyst, you will employ quantitative methods and data science methodologies to support our strategic direction and drive growth.  What You'll Do Build reporting and analyze business performance utilizing SQL, PowerBI, and Excel Employ sophisticated data and modeling methods to discover opportunities to improve sales performance Optimize ways to communicate findings and insights to partners in the field operations organization Proactively identify and mitigate issues with data that may impede the progress of business objectives or inhibit the measurement of performance Build and nurture relationships with internal teams to identify new business needs and address them with data-backed recommendations What You Need To Succeed Bachelors Degree (BA/BS) 3 - 5 years of work experience in sales operations, finance, strategy, or management consulting Expertise in using business analytics and sales data to make decisions and find trends to validate or invalidate existing GTM strategy Proven track record of converting complex scenarios into manageable workstreams to generate compelling insights Comfortable working on multiple projects and able to shift priority as needed while maintaining high quality results Advanced skills with Salesforce.com, Excel, PowerBI, Tableau Advanced knowledge of SQL, data modeling, and transformation in joined data sets Thrive in a collaborative team with an innate desire to source and encourage diverse approaches to problem solving Willingness to try new things Attention to detail and pride in delivering your best work Bonus Points Analytics experience in B2B software sales Experience with Alteryx and Snowflake environments MS Analytics, Statistics, Applied Economics

Responsibilities With supervision of Strategy/Marketing team, execute recurring marketing tasks: Social media postings Internal communications Email campaigns Editorial calendar Interface with project management With supervision of sales management, execute as-needed sales and BD tasks: Research companies and prospecting contacts Using existing target lists, consolidate and catalogue prospects into a central sales tracking system (Excel or CRM based.) Support pitch development workflow in conjunction with VP, Business Development and Program Management Help prepare RFP submission questionnaires Edit slides and presentations at direction of pitch team and editorial Develop and maintain a slide library to include key sections of capabilities tagged for easy search Work with the VP of Business Development and VP of Marketing, along with business unit leads, in identifying and writing up key case studies in a variety of services and client types that can be incorporated into pitches and marketing pieces. In conjunction with Marketing, ensure that CM’s accounts on the lead generation websites, such as Source Explorer and Tealbook, are kept up to date and evaluated semi-weekly for possible prospects. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES: Highly organized, deadline oriented. Multi-tasker Understanding of fundamental sales and marketing principles – may or may not have Med-Com experience Good eye for creative, able to apply design rules to document/slide creation Excellent Powerpoint Intuitive communicator, with good writing skill Ideally familiar with basic Adobe Creative Suite software (photo, image, document editing) ClinicalMind is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity and to attracting and retaining the most qualified employees regardless of race, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender, age or disability. description: We're looking for a Sales Development Manager who will be tasked with identifying and generating sales opportunities through both inbound and outbound calling activities, as well as overall management of the Sales Development team. The right candidate will be one who works well under pressure, thinks out-of-the-box, easily initiates relaxed but informative two-way phone conversations with prospects, and is highly self-motivated. The right candidate will also understand how to assess a company's needs and cater the outreach to each prospect specifically. This role is remote.  Responsibilities: Respond, engage and qualify leads Manage a team of 4 SDRs Engage current users to expand awareness, educate, ask for referrals, identify new opportunities and develop account intelligence Effectively partner and work across teams, including Marketing, Sales, and more to develop account intelligence, relationship maps, and use case opportunities through direct account engagement and insight tools Schedule appointments and demos Hold intelligent and engaging conversations over the phone and email Act as the subject matter expert on PandoLogic  Requirements: Demonstrated ability to collaborate with a distributed sales team Previous management experience Capability of understanding customer pain points, requirements and correlating potential business to value that can be provided by PandoLogic Strong and professional communication skills -- written, verbal, presentation Aptitude to manage numerous requests and time demands concurrently while achieving production goals Promotes a strong sense of urgency for reaching goals and key deliverables Contributes fully to the team effort and plays an integral part in the smooth running of teams without necessarily taking the lead Drive, Grit, Team Oriented: strong desire to compete and win BA/BS degree required Experience with CRMs such as Salesforce preferred  Why PandoLogic?  PandoLogic delivers Hire Intelligence to Talent Acquisition organizations by sourcing quality applicants faster and more efficiently through the use of big data, artificial intelligence, and proprietary campaign algorithms that fully-automate and optimize the job advertising and decision-making process.  We bet you'll love our awesome company culture, great benefits, and crew of collaborative, bold, resilient, innovative, and caring people. We love it here, and we think you will too.  Anything else you should know?  PandoLogic is being acquired by Veritone Inc. (NASDAQ: VERI), a provider of an operating system for artificial intelligence, later this year.  We were sought out by Veritone for our AI – our belief in it and our commitment to it – by a company that is focused on using AI for good. To build a safer, more vibrant, transparent, and empowered society.  Veritone is supporting our destiny, keeping our team intact, and honoring our roadmap – this is an incredible growth opportunity.  As a wholly-owned subsidiary of Veritone, there are no material changes expected for employees and customers.  Integration with their platform will reinforce our tech backbone and allow us to bring trillions of data points – from all sorts of agnostic sources – together to create insights that will power the workforce of the future.  To learn more visit http://www.pandologic.com.  PandoLogic is committed to providing equal opportunity employment to all individuals regardless of race, color, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are flexible. We are kind. We are PandoLogic.

description: Title: Business Development Representative  Location: Remote  Division: Kuebix  Kuebix is looking for a Business Development Rep for the US territories. Kuebix is a leading TMS (Transportation Management System) provider that caters to $5 million - $20 billion businesses. We are looking for a driven, enthusiastic BDR who will help identify and cultivate opportunities for the SMB, Mid-Market, and Enterprise sectors of the sales organization.  Appeal Of The Role Work in a high energy environment with frequent cross functional interface and visibility Structured approach centered around the buyer’s journey Leadership team that focuses on professional development and career progression Clearly defined goals and expectations No micro management; once proven and meeting expectation, freedom to drive yourself towards excellence True meritocracy; advancement in society is based on individual's capabilities and merits Opportunity to be involved in a growing and progressing role A Day In The Life Identify new prospects and opportunities through outbound calling/lead generation activities using the Kuebix Freemium Customers, Channel Partners, Trade Show attendees, TDS, LinkedIn, ZoomInfo and other similar search tools (5%) Document all interactions, sets appointments, maintain files, report progress and forecasts into our SalesForce CRM (10%) Consistent navigation through organizations, doing deep discovery and speaking to multiple decision makers to generate qualified opportunities that progress through the sales funnel, generating new revenue (10%) Conduct high volume (40+) of phone calls in addition to using multiple contact channels to reach key decision makers (50%) Participate on project teams as needed to support Sales and Marketing initiatives (5%) Coordinate targeted account outreach in high yield industry verticals with sales to divide activity and accelerate market development (10%) Respond to email enquiries, answering incoming calls, redirecting calls, and managing inbound chat (5%) Qualify inbound leads, creating opportunities and next steps for Account Executives (5%) Within 1 Month, You Will  Role Progression: Complete new hire on-boarding including eLearning courses, shadowing, coaching Learn best practices and business tools used including, but not limited to, Salesforce, Microsoft Outlook, G-Suite, Drift, Outreach, Zoominfo, LinkedIn and Netsuite Earn a high level knowledge of our industry and market trends Within 3 Months, You Will Develop your own personal prospecting brand Interact on a frequent basis with prospects and customers Track records of all prospecting and sales activities within Salesforce Understand critical competitive information and discover customer needs Successfully adjust to metric driven environment within your territory Execute high volume of activity with inbound and outbound phone calls, emails, and social outreach Conduct effective discovery calls to ensure leads will convert Within 6 Months, You Will Show strong knowledge of product features, use cases, and competitive landscape Support the advancement of the sales lifecycle for the opportunities specifically including lead nurturing/qualification and deal support Demonstrate confidence and persistence in your pursuit of qualified leads Necessary Competencies Lead Nurture & Management Ability to Work Remotely Cross Functional Collaboration Lead Qualification & Conversion Adaptability External & Internal Interpersonal Skills Organic Lead Generation Intellectual Curiosity Prospect Focus & Orientation Professional Communication Skills Territory Acumen Coachability Required Skills Comfortable making consistent calls and talking to new people each day with the ability to convey commercial insight Ability to multitask, take initiative, prioritize, and manage your time effectively Tenacity to handle rejection and continue with a positive attitude when reaching next potential client Superior communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills, both verbal and written Stay current on industry trends and maintain extensive knowledge of competitor’s offerings Thrive in a small team environment where you can make a big impact Experience utilizing a marketing automation tool; CRM database Competent with M.S. Office and/or Google Office <5% Travel Preferred Skills Experience with SalesForce CRM Transportation or Supply Chain Industry Experience Understanding of SaaS Technologies and Sales BA or Prior Business Development, Inside Sales or Lead Development Experience Experience with Sales Engagement Platforms, Outreach Inc. Experience with a solution-selling methodology or proven experience learning a complicated vertical and/or sales process Our Company  Kuebix (a division of Trimble) provides a Transportation Management System (TMS) that powers North America’s largest shipping community. We are transforming the transportation industry with a common TMS platform for shippers, carriers and intermediaries that enables new levels of visibility and efficiency for the entire market. By connecting all logistics stakeholders on a single platform, shippers gain unprecedented access to available capacity and competitive pricing, while brokers and carriers increase their business and gain superior asset utilization. Kuebix is a modular solution that scales to meet the needs of supply chains of every size and level of complexity. Built on the latest cloud technology, Kuebix’s connected platform simplifies ERP and other integrations, resulting in rapid onboarding and ROI. Trimble is transforming the way the world works by delivering products and services that connect the physical and digital worlds. Core technologies in positioning, modeling, connectivity and data analytics enable customers to improve productivity, quality, safety, and sustainability. From purpose-built products to enterprise lifecycle solutions, Trimble software, hardware, and services are transforming a broad range of industries such as agriculture, construction, geospatial and transportation, and logistics.  Pay Equity  Trimble provides the following compensation range and general description of other compensation and benefits that it in good faith believes it might pay and/or offer for this position. This compensation range is based on a full time schedule. Trimble reserves the right to ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and offer additional benefits and other compensation, depending on circumstances not related to an applicant’s sex or other status protected by local, state, or federal law.  Bonus Eligible?  No  Trimble offers comprehensive core benefits that include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Disability, Time off plans and retirement plans. Most of our businesses also offer tax savings plans for health, dependent care and commuter expenses as well as Paid Parental Leave and Employee Stock Purchase Plan.  Trimble Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, gender, age, color, religion, national origin, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws, or any other protected factor. description: Position Summary  Making the future is everyday life at Samsung. We’re seeking innovators who are called to not just change the world, but build a better one. We enable the best technology hardware on the planet, but our best is always a prototype for something better and our people thrive with a driven mindset – better builds on better. We believe that innovation and growth are driven by an inclusive culture and a diverse workforce. We aim to create a global team where everyone belongs and has equal opportunities, inspiring our talent to be their true selves. Together, we are building a better tomorrow for our customers, partners and communities.We ae currently looking for a Field Sales Manager who will be responsible for driving sales and maximizing retail success. With minimal management oversight, this role will build brand awareness and advocacy with both retail sales personnel and consumers. Through training and consumer facing activities, the Field Sales Manager will be accountable for driving product awareness, sales, and improving the consumer journey within the assigned territory.  Role and Responsibilities    Reponsibilities:  Responsible for driving sell-out of Samsung products across multiple channels within an assigned territory Implements and executes sales strategies designed to maximizes Samsung market share in order to meet or exceed revenue objectives for the brand Develop and deliver customer specific sales tactics, training and brand advocacy programs by creating and maintaining partnerships with retail sales personnel and store leadership Through one-to-one and group training, utilizes full discretion to create programs intended to ensure all sales personnel are highly knowledgeable on the unique selling points of Samsung devices and are actively recommending Samsung devices to consumers Field Sales Managers are responsible for meeting or exceeding sales revenue and unit goals, as well as rep knowledge, rep recommendation rates and training engagements as measured by in-store mystery shops and the Market Communication System.  Background/Experience  2-5 years in territory sales with strong preference for experience working with National Retailers and/or National Carrier Operators preferred: Bachelor’s degree preferred Experience using sales data and insights to recommend and drive localized and customized sales programs in differing channels Strong background in operational excellence and merchandising execution Self-starter and willingness to take initiative and drive localized revenue growth programs in targeted channels while adhering to Samsung Brand expectations Strong experience managing competing priorities and collaborating with internal and external stakeholders.  Skills and Qualifications    Necessary Skills/Attributes  Build and develop strong partnerships with respective channels in aligned territory Utilize sales reporting and other analytics to identify and prioritize high-opportunity store locations based on Samsung performance Ability to drive sell-out of Samsung products through in store activities, which includes but not limited to a variety of innovative customer-centric tactics including in-store training events, contests, small-scale incentive programs developed at your discretion per individual store, and consumer engagement events to improve sales performance within territory. Act as Samsung brand advocate and spokesperson for both local and national consumer events  Ensure Samsung’s retail brand standards are maintained by regularly inspecting all Samsung branded displays and marketing materials Validate, analyze and interpret a broad range of retail-related data including industry trends, competitor pricing, competitor incentives, promotional activities, and customer and RSA brand preference/sentiment.  Strong collaboration with peers and sales leadership to provide key on the ground insights and feedback to support the development of district and regional strategies. Excellent verbal and written communication to work with both channel leadership and Samsung Retail leadership  Physical/Mental Demands and Working Conditions: The position requires the ability to perform the essential duties and responsibilities in the following environment:  Operate a computer keyboard and view a video display terminal 50% of work time, including prolonged periods of time.  The movement and transportation of equipment, most of the time under 25 pounds. Performs work under time schedules and stresses which are normally periodic or cyclical, including time sensitive job stress, fatigue, unpaid over-time, intellectual challenge, constant technical data feedback, language barriers, and business management stress. Machines, tools, equipment, and work aids representative and commonly associated with PCs, printers, and office work areas. Frequently works additional hours beyond normal schedule. Under very little direct supervision with a high level of responsibility to apply general policies and guidelines where decisions are seldom monitored and consequences of decisions adversely affect operating results and management decisions.  Complete access to confidential company data where disclosure may jeopardize the company’s competitive position.       * Please visit Samsung membership to see Privacy Policy, which defaults according to your location. You can change Country/Language at the bottom of the page. description: At CrowdStrike we’re on a mission - to stop breaches. Our groundbreaking technology, services delivery, and intelligence gathering together with our innovations in machine learning and behavioral-based detection, allow our customers to not only defend themselves, but do so in a future-proof manner. Because of that we’ve earned numerous honors and top rankings for our technology, organization and talent. Our culture was purpose-built to be remote first, and we offer flexible work arrangements to help our people manage their personal and professional lives in a way that works for them. If you’re ready to work on unrivaled technology with a team that makes a difference every day, let’s talk.  About The Role  CrowdStrike is looking for highly motivated, self-driven, and experienced Enterprise sales executive dedicated to making a difference in global security by protecting organizations against the most advanced attackers in the world.  As the Regional Sales Manager, you be managing 30 to 40 Enterprise accounts and will take CrowdStrike’s product capabilities and value to potential clients, match our strengths to clients' needs, and help our partners and clients defeat the adversary. The successful candidate has executive level contacts and is flexible and adaptable to rapidly changing situations. You must be extremely results driven, customer focused, technologically savvy, and innovative at building internal relationships and external partnerships to attack the market with passion!  Opportunity is available to candidates located Detroit or Grand Rapids, MI  Essential Functions Identify, develop and execute account strategy to close new business opportunities and expanding revenue with customers across the assigned region; independently and cooperatively. Scope, negotiate and bring to closure agreements to exceed booking and revenue quota targets. Target and gain access to decision makers in key prospect accounts in the assigned territory. description: Position Overview  As an Account Executive, you will drive Reach’s future growth by building relationships with prospective clients, demonstrating the Reach value proposition for their businesses, and turning them into satisfied users of the Reach platform. You will be empowered to prospect, build relationships, and close business with leading brands.  You are an adept salesperson, capable of engaging in business and technical conversations across multiple levels of the organization, including C-level. You have experience working with upper-middle market and enterprise level companies. Your in-depth understanding of the buyer’s journey lets you lead a complex, multiparty sale in a highly consultative manner. You are naturally analytical and enjoy digging into business models and helping customers quantify their investment decisions. You get excited about prospecting, and are capable of independently leading a sales cycle from start to finish. You are used to building value in competitive situations and enjoy working on products that require deep product understanding based on technical knowledge.  Culture Complement  Reach is a 100+ person company with offices in Austin, Calgary and San Francisco. Those that thrive at Reach are open to new ideas, respectful of other’s thinking, empathetic to those around them and inclusive in their approach. It is a hard-working team that balances practical with creative and works to find solutions that will enhance both the business and the needs of the customer. The right candidate for Reach is one who is smart, passionate, accountable and collaborative. They are excited about the opportunity to disrupt the marketplace and are driven in their mission to serve the customer. This hire is an enthusiastic and optimistic and knows how to take educated risks. They interact well with all levels of internal and external stakeholders and do not bring ego into the workplace.  What You'll Be Doing Generate quality sales opportunities through proactive, strategic prospecting, attending conferences, etc. as well as research industries and individual companies to find the best targets Establish and develop a relationship with representatives at target companies through a variety of mediums including trade shows, face-to-face meetings, calling, and emailing Identify key questions and pain points for prospects and translate those for the Reach marketing team to inform content creation Assist in developing initiatives that focus on long-term plans to increase opportunities and revenue Develop a deep understanding of the payments industry and build relationships with key players in the space Build custom business cases with prospects  Requirements 5+ years of sales experience, preferably at a technology/ecommerce company, with a track record of top performance Able to quickly understand Reach and its place within the payments and ecommerce technology ecosystem. Successful candidates are able to identify a target’s needs and decision makers, and tailor outreach accordingly Experience in a startup environment and excitement about the opportunity to take on a lot of different responsibilities is a plus. Experience engaging with a variety of buyer personas in target customer organizations.  Personal Characteristics Possesses confidence and creativity in how they present themselves to the marketplace. Intellectually curious. Open and balanced communication style, thrives in an entrepreneurial, high-growth environment. Warm, outgoing personality and confidence-inspiring attitude. An “at ease” sales style and fluid rapport-building skills. High-energy self-starter with a can-do attitude, an ability to learn quickly while setting strategy and getting down in the weeds to get the job done. Loyal; trustworthy; fun to be around. Strong “hustle” mentality with desire to work in a dynamic startup. Entrepreneurial mindset.  Benefits Flexible work environment Full Healthcare benefits 401K Paid Time Off and Sick Days Self-Directed Career Development Plan (Annual Budget + Paid Days)  Next Steps:  At Reach, our corporate culture is very important to us. As part of our interview process, we'd like to get to know more about you. Prior to meeting with the hiring manager, we will send a couple of questions from the manager to selected candidates with a link to a video recording which only our in-house recruiter and hiring manager will see. While we recognize the one-way video may not be the preferred interview style, compared to an in-depth initial conversation, it is meant to show us how you think through problems rather than be impersonal. We appreciate your interest in joining Reach!

description: Professional Services Sales Executive - Must be in NYC/NJ/Philadelphia Area  CTI helps enterprise clients accelerate digital transformation providing effective strategies and excellence in solution delivery. We collaborate with businesses and our technology partners to enable our clients to leverage Advanced Analytics, Data Engineering, Data Science, and Cloud paradigms to accelerate business value. We seek a Senior Sales Executive, a "hunter," who will lead the charge to grow our client portfolio and professional services revenue.    RESPONSIBILITIES  Business Development  ·      Create, nurture, and manage client relationships at the Director, Vice President, and CXO level in Fortune 1000 enterprises. ·      Initiate thought leadership-based discussions to position oneself and CTI as a premium brand. ·      Be solution-oriented and a problem-solver. ·      Interact strategically with client's vendor relationship organization and maintain a smooth flow of MSA's, SOW's, invoices, and payments. ·      Work closely with CTI Leadership, Practice Leads, Partner Sales organizations, and Client decision-makers across all business units. Account Development  ·      Develop a deep understanding of clients' business objectives and challenges, organizational structure, and key client stakeholders to lead and manage the account strategy and execution plan. ·      Collaborate with all CTI technology partners to expand into new areas and drive growth in existing areas. ·      Assess potential competitive and business risks and develop strategies and mitigation plans for active sales cycles.  ·      Collaborate with CTI employees assigned to the client account and engage them in contributing to account expansion activities.   QUALIFICATIONS ·      7+ years' experience selling and expanding project based professional services that create business value in enterprise accounts. ·      Demonstrable history of professional services revenue generation by acquiring and growing new accounts. ·      Strong business acumen, presentation skills, and the ability to interact, create, and sustain a strategic trusted relationship with Director and C-level executives. ·      Proven ability to develop sales "win themes" and execute the sales strategy through complex pursuits. ·      Experienced at successfully aligning internal teams and technology partners to win business. ·      Strong understanding of Advanced Analytics, Legacy and Cloud Data Platforms, and Modern Data Management. ·      Experience selling value-add services in collaboration with sales teams technology partners such as Informatica, Talend, Qlik, Snowflake, Tableau, Confluent, Snowflake, and Microsoft or similar vendor sales teams is highly desirable.  WHY CHOOSE CTI At CTI, it is our people that make us unique. Our core values are an active part of everything we do. Each one reminds us to stay true to ourselves while driving exceptional outcomes for our clients. ·       Develop your career and ride the wave of innovation in advanced analytics, data science, data engineering, and modern data management. ·       Enhance your skills by working collaboratively with our elite team of consultants. ·       Demonstrate your entrepreneurial spirit while working with a team of seasoned, talented professionals. ·       Keep pace with the latest digital transformation technologies selling solutions with our partners applying innovative data science, engineering, and management technologies in various industry domains. ·       Grow professionally by taking advantage of our opportunities to increase your role and responsibilities. ·       Work on a variety of projects and in a variety of industries - you will never be bored - Most importantly, you will be surrounded by respected leaders in the fields of Data Analytics, Data Science, Machine Learning, and Modern Data Management with unmatched energy and drive. Visit www.ctidata.com to learn more about us.

Who we are:  Farrar Corporation began in 1933 as a blacksmith and repair shop. The green sand foundry was added in 1967 as a way to make our own castings and then grew to the point that Farrar dropped its own product line to focus only on providing cast and machined parts to O.E.M. customers. In the early 1990’s, Farrar began producing Austempered Ductile Iron (ADI) in addition to the standard ASTM grades of Ductile Iron. Farrar is a family owned/privately held corporation that is currently in its third generation of ownership. Through the years we have grown into a nationally recognized company known for our service, specializing in providing finish machined ductile iron castings and assemblies.  What you will do here:  The Sales and Marketing Manager is responsible for all activities related to Sales and Marketing for the corporation, including the creation of print and digital assets (including website updates and maintenance), internal and external communications and brand development. This position will take the lead on operating contracts and sales content and materials for the Sales Representatives. This person will assist in strategic marketing and plans, including working with leadership to (a) determine goals and objectives; (b) monitor sales performance and (c) make necessary adjustments to achieve said goals and maintain budgets. Also responsible for monitoring and ensuring compliance with all company sales practices. This person will lead a team of three or more Business Development and Sales Representatives.  Primary Responsibilities Evaluate customers and markets for both future potential and profitability Develop and maintain good channels of communications with customers. Increase brand awareness and increase market share. Evaluate, optimize and provide ongoing analysis of market conditions, pricing strategies and customer pricing reviews and updates. Prepare annual sales/revenue forecast and sales department budget. Call on all in-house customer accounts on a regular basis and as needed. (I feel like you need to say something about this in your summary of the position) Coordinate all marketing activities with sales, financial, customer service and production departments. Manage all operating agreements with Sales Representatives and LTAs with customers. Develop all brand content for use across marketing channels. Update and maintain the company’s website. Develop social media content calendar; execute social media across platforms. Work closely with Customer Service for communications with customers on pricing changes, lead times, etc. Lead planning and execution of the annual sales meeting. Manage and hold all Business Development and Sales Representatives accountable for sales goals and projections. Evaluate, recommend and present business case for Farrar presence at Expos, Conferences, Trade Shows, etc.  Preferred Qualifications B/A in Business, Marketing, or a B/S in Engineering 5+ years outside sales experience required 5+ years Sales/Marketing of Engineered products and services 3-5 years marketing experience (specifically content creation, basic graphic design skills, web and social media development) 3+ years of supervisory/leadership experience Efficient with Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint) Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public. Proficient in website analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Omniture, Web Trends) Experience in setting up and optimizing Google AdWords campaigns Individual must possess and embrace the Company’s Core Values: Integrity: honest and truthful and always do what you say you’re going to do Stewardship: maximize resources for the good of today and tomorrow Continuous Improvement: raise the bar every year Teamwork: in all areas Commitment: to our customers and company values What are we offering you?  Overall, we are excited about what we have here, which is the chance to work with a group of dedicated, smart and innovative professionals that know how to get work done! All team members take pride in upholding and living our values in everything we do - integrity, stewardship, teamwork, continuous improvement, and a commitment to creating value for our customers through building long lasting relationships. We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package, a relaxed atmosphere, development and growth opportunities and the ability to play a role in making a difference in our team and customers lives. We have a leadership team that is dedicated to transparency, innovation, and growth. With a long standing and proud history, we feel like we are just getting started and will constantly be driven to achieve more. If this sounds like you, we want to talk to you!  Benefits Generously subsidized company sponsored medical, dental and vision insurance 401K with company match and immediate vesting 6 paid company holidays per year  Farrar Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind: Farrar Corporation is committed to the principal of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Farrar Corporation are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, family or parental statues, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Farrar Corporation will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Farrar Corporation encourages applicants of all ages.  Powered by JazzHR  0AmwomFRm9

description: Company Mackinnon Bruce International are partnered with an innovative biotechnology company with specialised abilities and focus surrounding In Vitro models to provide researchers with new technologies designed to give a more precise prediction of human responses. They are currently looking for a Business Development Executive to join their team on the East Coast.  Role The ideal candidate will be responsible for representing the organisation and engaging with their customers across the pharmaceutical, biotechnology and academic sector. The Business Development Executive is further responsible for driving sales revenue and building relationships at the decision-making and scientific levels of customer organisations, creating plans for them to utilise the products and services available.  The Business Development Executive will be responsible for: Managing the relationships and communication with key business accounts Being knowledgeable of business models of current and potential accounts to highlight how the organisation’s products and services can add value Generating revenue by building and closing a pipeline of orders Working closely with other business functions of the organisations such as Marketing and R&D Strengthening relationship reach within accounts Ensuring clarity of order conversion to revenue  Requirements As a general requirement we are looking for candidates with proven sales experiences within the Life Sciences space, with 5-7 years’ experience in a relevant sales post. The candidate would also have a strong scientific background, with at least a bachelor’s degree (Advanced degree is preferred), with a good understanding of cell biology, microfluidics, neuronal diseases, cancer biology and inflammation.  Furthermore, a proven track record of successful sales in the Biopharma and Academic sectors and a strong understanding of drug development processes involving small and large molecules are also desired.

About Drips  Drips enables brands to connect with consumers through AI-powered, Conversational Texting®. Backed by a proprietary natural language processing model, our platform has handled over half a billion humanized conversations to date, enabling us to deliver automation at a scale that no other competitor in the messaging industry has been able to match. That’s why we’re the platform of choice for some of the world’s most recognizable brands.  Drips’ focus on empowering brands to capture intent and drive meaningful conversations has sparked rapid growth since the company was founded in 2016, and Drips will nearly triple our 2019 sales this year. We are well funded and looking to accelerate the next era of growth and expansion of our team.  However, we’re more than just a high-growth company; we’re also a community. Even though we work remotely, we still embrace the core values that help us achieve personal growth. Every member of the Drips team has a direct impact on our company! If you want to love the product you work on, solve hard problems, and grow your career — we want to talk with you!  Job Overview  Drips is looking for a passionate and empathetic Senior Business Development Manager to coach, manage and grow our BDR team. Your main focus will be ensuring the BDR team is delivering repeatable and profitable discovery calls that evolve into pipeline and closed won deals. This will be crucial in scaling the organization and providing a predictable revenue stream. You will measure BDR performance by booked discovery calls and pipeline generated. You will monitor and coach daily prospecting efforts such as outbound calls and emails, and work with sales to ensure BDR opportunities are closing.  Job Responsibilities Manage a team of remote BDRs Provide day to day coaching and professional development, including weekly 1:1 meetings, shadowing sessions, and routine co-selling Understand the nuances between verticals within our ideal customer profile segments and ensure proper account targeting Create, manage, and analyze outbound BDR prospecting cadences to ensure optimization of outbound efforts Continue to grow the team through recruiting, onboarding, and training new BDRs Report out to leadership on a monthly basis on BDR performance Track and communicate monthly goals to team to drive consistent performance month over month Qualifications 3+ years of experience in a business development role or sales closing role or 2+ years of experience managing a sales development or sales team BA/BS degree or equivalent Expert in Salesforce, SalesIntel or ZoomInfo, and a sales prospecting platform such as Groove, SalesLoft or Outreach Ability and desire to step in as player-coach on a daily basis that includes tactical management of BDRs Background of hiring, training, and enabling BDRs for success Undeniable passion for driving pipeline and revenue Impeccable organizational and time management skills Core Values  Drips core values are central to how each employee executes in their role daily and exceeds. Below are how we exceed in each core value:  Lean – We find the right mix between administration and simply doing things. Over complicating tasks can add time without providing benefit, however just doing things without a plan can add time when course correction is required. To exceed, we finish work in a timely manner while reviewing to make sure we are striking the right balance between the two. Implementing streamlining methods to existing processes ensure we evolve and stay lean.  Passion – Expressing passion daily is the desire to do the job but evolving in the job to expand beyond the base role and taking on additional projects and roles to help teams outside your own while maintaining your individual workload. Understanding that all of the activities we take are to enable our clients, and thus Drips as a whole to be successful. Asking the question, “How is what I am doing today, enabling the success of my teammates and my clients”.  Happiness – Finding the balance in both your personal and work life. Participating in group and team activities as you see fit but understanding that life is about more than just coming into the office daily. Drips has overall wellness programs and additional benefits that assist. True enthusiasm for what we do is essential but comes from understanding the business overall and how we fit into it.  Improve – Never accepting the status quo and being entrenched in a process or workflow. Finding ways to streamline and innovate while bringing those improvements to leadership. Improvement also means understanding the anticipated benefit and it improves our daily working experience, your teammates and Drips Clients overall.  Team – We support and assist our teammates, even if it is outside of our typical duties. We take on additional projects for their added value whether they impact your day-to-day work or not. Being part of a team involves being in close contact every day, respecting each other and the work we do is essential however to exceed in Team, we move outside of our direct team, to the company team as a whole and understand how we impact everything and the value we provide.

description: Regional Sales Consultant – Central Region Remote-Home Office (available CT and for periodic travel to customer visits once restrictions lifted) If you are an inside salesperson, account manager, business development manager or account executive this role is for you!  The Myers-Briggs Company, the worlds most recognized name in supporting talent development, is looking for another A player for its US Enterprise Sales team. We are looking for someone who understands that attitude, emotional intelligence, urgency and a strong commitment to accountability are the cornerstones of success in their roles.  This position would be ideal for someone who has a proven record as a player coach or for that very special person who has been overachieving as an individual contributor and thinks they are ready to take this to the next level  The Regional Sales Consultant, SE is a true player/coach role who will be responsible for initiating, developing, and establishing new business within the region, to increase and grow revenue streams, while sustaining existing business in states within the assigned territory of the South East region. Use industry expertise to coach, manage and develop regional Customer Success Representatives to develop their capabilities to identify, develop and close new opportunities. Maintain current and accurate customer contact database (Salesforce) and manage customer accounts engagement with The Myers- Briggs Company product and services.  Your responsibilities will include: Attainment of Identified Accounts Revenue Goal - Work in tandem with Customer Success Reps within the territory to complete daily tasks and strategy. Initiate conduct and follow-up on sales calls designed to grow MB strategic market(s). Conduct regular schedule of meetings (in-person and remote) with region’s Top 150 customers, F1000 customers & to prospective customers in MB’s strategic market(s), conduct regional business development strategy to develop and expand portfolio of customers within region. Daily use of Salesforce.com tasks, leads module and Opportunity pipeline is required. Lead Regional Account Revenue Strategy Meetings on a weekly basis. When required, provide appropriate client participants for MBC product review panels, focus groups, testimonials, case studies and other customer-based input requirements. Collect and add customer needs/trends information in MBC strategic market(s) to Salesforce.com CRM to keep it current. Respond to the Senior Vice President, Global Sales with accurate and well-researched data to requests for customer/market-based information. Manage Regional Customer Success Representatives by working closely to consistently hit or exceed individual quarterly sales quotas and KPIs, while executing on the key strategies for their region. Partner with and support the SVP of Global Sales to finalize, rollout and monitor the achievement of KPIs within team thru coaching and development opportunities. Provide ongoing performance coaching to ensure team success that includes developing and delivering performance evaluations and goals for each Representative. Proactively identify and partner HR to effectively address and manage performance or employee relations issues to resolution. Lead regional progress meetings to identify trends across the regional sales team, identifying barriers (and steps to remove along with timeline) as well as key learnings. Report out regularly on progress and status to SVP of Global Sales. Gathering and leveraging actionable insights from the market in order to drive performance  Your Professional Experience Includes: 3+ years of Consultative Sales experience at the enterprise level. Proven closer who fully understands pipeline dynamics, enterprise selling methodology 3+ years experience managing employees Personality that exhibits and understands the performance value of urgency, transparency, accountability and goal based time management Strong EQ, Learning Agility and Critical Thinking skills Training and high-level execution skills in sourcing new business in a timely, stage driven methodology Experience with ERP systems, Salesforce.com and any outreach Basic math competency; strong analytical skills; excellent communication skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills. B.A. or B.S. degree required   Our corporate culture is mission driven. We are a certified B Corp and a California benefit corporation, taking all stakeholders (including our employees, community, customers, and the environment) into account to make a positive difference. We have a culture that is emotionally intelligent, aligned, results-focused, cross-functional and committed to the professional development of all employees.  While we’re best known for our products like the Myers-Briggs Type Indicator® assessment (MBTI®), our reach extends well beyond a single instrument. We are a group of professionals who provide expertise in the talent development industry, as well as to career counselor and educators and individual consumers. We offer solutions to help improve individual and organizational performance and address whatever people development challenges businesses and professionals face – from team building, leadership, coaching, and conflict management to career development, selection, and retention. Perhaps this is why millions of individuals in more than 170 countries use our products and services each year. Our customers include the majority of the Fortune 500 companies, as well as businesses of all sizes, educators, government agencies, training and development consultants and consumers looking to understand themselves better.  Working at The Myers-Briggs Company gives you the opportunity to make a positive difference, be accountable, experience genuine respect from your colleagues and peers, and feel valued and supported. We work to create an environment that fosters excellence and encourages employees to contribute, learn, and grow throughout their career.  Our company is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

description: TeamDynamix is hiring an Enterprise Sales Executive to join our team. And we are now introducing Integration Platform-as-a-Service (iPaaS).  As an Enterprise Sales Executive, your primary responsibility is selling the company’s portfolio of Enterprise Service Management solutions to corporate, higher education, state & local government organizations. This position represents a significant opportunity to participate in a high-growth, fast-paced and innovative SaaS organization. This role reports directly to the VP of Sales and is eligible for remote work. Utilize sound business acumen, strong technical aptitude and a hunter sales mentality. Effectively manage a prolonged sales cycle and persuade a committee of key decision makers to take action. Systematically generate a robust pipeline of qualified sales opportunities. Nurture prospects through the sales process from cold to sold. Skilled in the art of contract negotiation. Excellent written and oral communication skills required. Strong presentation skills and a polished, professional demeanor.
