Do you want to work for a profitable and rapidly growing market leader? Are you seeking a new career challenge?  Invenia has partnered with a manufacturer of advanced sample preparation tools to hire a territory manager based in New York. The company has developed a platform that has sustainable, competitive advantages in both the pre-analytical and process technology life science market segments, and have worked with leading laboratories to develop workflows and protocols to improve extraction, automated parallel processing, and sample input decrease.  Role responsibilities: The successful candidate will join a growing sales team, where you will be responsible for selling the companies research tools to customers in hospitals, pharmaceuticals, and biotech within the defined region.  What we are looking for: The ideal candidate will have a Bachelor’s Degree or higher in a biological related subject, as well as a network within the life science industry already. You must have experience selling technical, scientific capital sales experience, preferably to life science laboratories in the academic, pharma, and biotech space, selling digital genomic equipment is also preferred.  We are looking for a highly motivated, enthusiastic and target orientated individual, who thrives on the independence and variety offered by a field sales role.  This is a fantastic opportunity to join this growing organisation, where the company offer a very competitive salary and commission scheme, plus full benefits package. If you feel that you have the skills and experience necessary, please apply to find out more information regarding this opportunity.

Location: Remote  About Hello Bello:  Hello Bello is so much more than just a baby company – we're on a mission. We believe in 'Premium for All' and are committed to creating the highest quality products at the most reasonable cost, because every child deserves the best. We believe in doing better for babies, parents, and the planet. We believe in doing good and giving back. We believe in exceeding expectations and going above and beyond. And while it's all serious business to us, we also believe in having fun – and we try to with product design, content, and community. And obviously with each other, too. Join us!  Role Summary:  Hello Bello is looking for a Manager, Sales & Operations Planning who will be responsible for managing the S&OP process steps for the company. This role will focus on balancing demand and supply to maximize customer order fulfilment, improve service and optimize costs. You will work with other functions such as Sales, Marketing, Operations, Sourcing, Product Development and Finance, to reconcile top-down financial plans and sales plans with the bottom-up operational plans.  Responsibility: Drive the Sales & Operations Planning process from end to end and to higher levels of maturity Product lifecycle: ensure portfolio changes are communicated and included into the demand plan Demand review: work with sales and finance to ensure statistical forecast is built and multiple market intel signals are collected to generate a consensus forecast that will be analyzed and compared to prior cycles and target plans Supply review: ensure supply constraints are clearly spelled-out with options to make trade-offs Monthly meetings: Prepare and present monthly reporting of key performance indicators in a user friendly format for Sales & Marketing leadership team S&OP executive review: reconcile supply to demand, align with financial plans and present various scenario Frame perspective for decision makers in the organization Communicate decisions made and ensure follow-up Assists the VP Supply Chain with strategy development and execution as well as with supply chain optimization Develop inventory strategies and monitor performance to ensure objectives are met; report on excess inventory Work closely with Sales, Marketing, Finance, and Operations to prepare and present sales operations data for strategic project management initiatives  Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain, Operations, Business Management, or related field 5+ years of experience in Supply Chain, specifically in planning roles; fast scaling company experience strongly preferred Solid experience with statistical forecasting, demand and consensus planning, constrained capacity planning, supply planning and detailed production planning High proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, especially Excel and PowerPoint Successful relationship and stakeholder management, with the ability to communicate and influence effectively across all levels of the business Deep understanding of supply chain business processes and challenges Ideal candidate has experience working in CPG retail environment (Walmart and/or large grocery retailers) Good understanding of sales and finance/costing processes that support the supply chain High analytical and data-driven  Benefits & Perks: Medical, dental, and vision insurance 401k and FSA option at your discretion Paid Vacation and Holidays Employee discounts on Hello Bello products
industries: Logistics and Supply Chain, Consumer Goods, and Retail

jobTitle: Business Development Manager - Central United States
description: GemOne is a brand new tech company within TVH Holding that aims at developing future-proof solutions for optimal fleet performance management in multiple domains such as: track & trace, operational efficiency, security & safety and service & maintenance. We offer cloud-based solutions and the necessary hardware components to intelligently gather and enrich data of industrial equipment to streamline fleet management related processes.  To support the rapid growth of GemOne, we are looking for a Business Development Manager for Central United States. You will: Do active sales and business development, prospect new customers and develop new relationships, promoting our IoT solutions to stimulate and grow sales. Be the first point of contact for our clients Prepare and plan customer visits to i.e. mixed fleet rental companies and dealers. Monitor the region to detect commercial opportunities and identify actions to monetise these opportunities. Ensure sales ops execution, quality and keep up to date with industry trends. Ensure proper quality of back-office work and maximising customer experience. Initiate and maintain good contacts with existing and potential customers and TVH sales reps in order to build a network of relationships that contributes to reaching the sales objectives. Work independently, strongly collaborating with GEM One sales colleagues and with TVH sales reps and report to the National Sales Manager.  Requirements Master’s degree or equivalent in experience. 10+ years’ proven experience in new business development and consultative sales in a B2B environment, of which at least 5 years’ sales experience in solutions (preferably IoT) and/or material handling or heavy industry. Native English (written and spoken). Must have the art of listening down to a science and feel comfortable cold calling prospects. Strong analytical skills, organized, result oriented and structured. Autonomous self-starter who takes charge. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and spoken. Tech-savvy, good computer and technical skills (MS Office, G-suite, CRM, mobile applications,…). You live in Central United States and you can easily travel (+/- 3 days a week)  Benefits A great opportunity to grow personally and professionally in a scale-up environment with the backing and certainty of a large global corporation (TVH). You’ll be part of a dynamic team, where initiative and entrepreneurship are highly valued. You’ll join an innovative, collaborative, technical and international environment where you have the exciting opportunity to help shape the future of GemOne. A learning environment with numerous opportunities for personal development, through i.e. permanent guidance and professional (internal/external) training courses. A flexible work arrangement, with the ability to manage your own time. An attractive salary package with extra-legal benefits
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Job Summary  DESCRIPTION  AWS Sales is seeking a Specialized Sales Operations Leader to work with the WW, APAC, EMEA, US, and Japan Specialized Sales teams to continuously evolve forecasting models, analyze historic results, and make business recommendations to senior management based on those analyses – all in an environment of rapid growth and increasing complexity. This will include working with the Specialized Sales leadership to develop, implement and manage the business processes, systems, reports and strategies that optimize business functions to meet organizational goals and initiatives.  The Specialized Sales Operations Leader will lead a team and act as a trusted advisor to Specialized Sales leaders, leveraging data and analysis to land business insights, develop GTM strategies, and scale the business. Your insights will drive incubation and growth for some of the newest and most innovate offerings in the AWS portfolio. You will drive improvements to the reporting tools, methods, and processes utilized by the team to increase the availability and granularity of actionable data to their customers. This position also manages the administration and execution of the team’s targets, including segmentation of business goals, measurement of goal attainment, evolving and driving various demand generation campaigns and proposing improvements to the Business to increase its effectiveness in driving desired results. This position will be responsible for managing the rhythm of the business activities such as Monthly Business Reviews, Quarterly Business Reviews, and other cadenced reporting and metrics.  The successful candidate must be able to roll-up his/her sleeves, and work directly with the models/data. He/she will be passionate about their work, detail-oriented, analytical, and have excellent problem-solving abilities. He/she will be experienced at working with large data sets and the technical tools needed to work with them. He/she will have superb communication and customer-relationship skills, outstanding analytic insight, and be a passionate advocate for their customers to other internal parties. Active collaboration with leadership in AWS Data Warehouse/Business Intelligence, Business Development, Finance, Marketing, Recruiting, and Compensation will be crucial to the effective execution of the responsibilities. He/she will drive towards simple, scalable solutions to difficult problems, have excellent project-management skills, and be able to communicate complex analytical results, both written and verbally, in a clear and easy-to-understand way.  The responsibilities of this role include hiring and managing a team of high-performing sales operations professionals.  This position is available in all US office locations, including but not limited to Seattle, SF Bay Area, Irvine, Chicago, Austin, Denver, New York, Boston, Atlanta   Basic Qualifications 6+ years of experience in a senior leadership role in Business Planning, Operations, Strategy, Finance, Business Development, or other related fields Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Computer Science, or related field Experience hiring and managing high-performing teams Preferred Qualifications 15+ years of experience in a senior leadership role in Sales Operations, Sales Strategy, Finance, Business Development, or other related fields Proven experience with the development and implementation of systems/tools utilized for CRM, variable compensation, revenue reporting, forecasting, sales force automation, etc. Experience working within a high-growth, technology company would be highly beneficial Strong business-process design experience Exhibits sound business judgment, a proven ability to influence others, strong analytical skills, and a proven track record of taking ownership, leading data-driven analyses, and influencing results Able to operate successfully in a lean, fast-paced organization, and to create a vision and organization that can scale quickly Experience rapidly growing an organization and attracting, hiring and maintaining top talent Expert level in Excel Strong written and verbal communication skills, with a track record of presenting to senior management Experience leading the development of department strategy Deep experience in prioritization of deliverables and tasks Exhibits sound business judgment, a proven ability to influence others, strong analytical skills, and a proven track record of taking ownership, leading data-driven analyses, and influencing results Motivated self-starter, proactive and action-oriented Strong problem solving and collaboration skills Experience working as a sales representative Meets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this role Meets/exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexity for this role Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us. Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. This position is subject to a background check for any convictions directly related to its duties and responsibilities. Only job-related convictions will be considered and will not automatically disqualify the candidate.  Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. description: Job Description  Do you enjoy working remotely and enjoy variety in the work you do? Do you want to work with a company that values its people? If so and you are a Sales Representative looking for a company you can grow and develop with please apply.  Remote Sales Representative Responsibilities Collaborate with the Executive Management team in identifying company opportunities and in crafting your annual, quarterly, monthly, and weekly target reach-out plans Work from a remote office setting while traveling up to 50% to meet with claims administrators, insurance companies, law firms, etc. Execute sales goals with integrity and tenacity Remote Sales Representative Qualifications Proven sales experience Experience with property and casualty claims is a bonus Salesforce or other CRM experience preferred Remote Sales Representative Benefits Base salary $50K + Commission Medical, Vision, and Dental Insurance Long-term disability plan 401(k) and company profit sharing Paid holidays, vacation, and PTO Tuition reimbursement Travel reimbursement Recruiter Managing this Job  Job Number: JN -092021-67888

description: Full-Time  Overview  We’re SmileDirectClub, and we believe everyone deserves a smile they’ll love. We also believe that you deserve a job you’ll love. Good thing you found us, and we found you. At SmileDirectClub, we’re all about empowering transformation. We want people to become more confident in how they look, how they feel, and how they think. So we’re spreading smiles and positivity all over the country.  It’s no small task. That’s why we’re looking for energetic, passionate, and confident team members who can help turn frowns, into life-changing grins. Are you up for it?  We are looking for a Regional Sales Manager (RSM) to join the SDC Partner Network team reporting to the National Sales Director . The Regional Sales Manager is responsible for achieving organizational sales objectives through effective leadership in the assigned area. The regional manager will lead, coach, and develop a highly talented cross functional team that excels in supporting the build-out of SDC Partner Network.  Responsibilities  Provide leadership and direction while meeting sales goals and managing the sales activities and development of sales representatives. Develop and implement strategic business plans to meet Regional, area and Company goals. Implement and uphold all company compliance policies and procedures for self and region. Create revenue budgets to reflect individual territory growth targets Develop and communicate the overall strategy. Work with field sales team to develop supporting tactics Establish performance metrics and communicate progress regularly Recruit and select qualified candidates to fill open sales positions within the Region. Build a strong regional team through evaluation of the activities and effectiveness of sales representatives on a consistent basis, providing guidance, coaching and support to increase competence. Develop and implement an effective territory business plan Travel with team members, bring business discussions to prospects and customers, provide a positive learning experience by example Set expectations, define goals, and stimulate desire to win as a team. jobTitle: Area Sales Manager - Dallas/Ft. Worth Texas)
description: Why Us?  With a mantra of Empowering Human Potential, Hanger, Inc. is the world's premier provider of orthotic and prosthetic (O&P) services and products, offering the most advanced O&P solutions, clinically differentiated programs and unsurpassed customer service. Hanger's Patient Care segment is the largest owner and operator of O&P patient care clinics nationwide. Through its Products & Services segment, Hanger distributes branded and private label O&P devices, products and components, and provides rehabilitative solutions to the broader market. With 160 years of clinical excellence and innovation, Hanger's vision is to lead the orthotic and prosthetic markets by providing superior patient care, outcomes, services and value. Collectively, Hanger employees touch thousands of lives each day, helping people achieve new levels of mobility and freedom.  Could This Be For You?  Develop strategies and tactics to secure/expand Hanger Clinic opportunities within Health Systems, Integrated Delivery Networks (IDN), individual hospitals and large physician networks. Partner with Regional Vice President, Area Director, Regional Director and Area Clinic Managers to drive growth through high level partnership with local market healthcare leaders. Build, manage, train and guide area sales team to execute area growth strategy.  Your Impact Develop strategic alliances with health systems, hospitals, and large physician groups by leveraging Hanger Clinic value proposition and commercial strategy. Develop and sustain long term relationships with key accounts. Prepare proposals, presentations, responses to RFPs, etc. to improve contracting efforts with health systems and hospitals Build, train, manage and coach area sales team to execute local sales strategy, provide service, and deliver any necessary technical, clinical, or business support to customers. Partner with Area Director to build post-operative service plan to manage the amputation episode of care. Create and execute sales plans to maximize full contract opportunities; collaborate with Area Directors and clinic leadership to ensure we are well positioned to capture new opportunities. Collaborate with all stakeholders to create hospital contract implementation plans. Conduct quarterly business reviews with hospitals; collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to ensure all contractual obligations are met. Serve as a direct representative to client facilities, the medical community and to the community at large. Create/foster an Account Team culture that is centered on taking exceptional care of customers in assigned accounts through timely and respectful responses and by driving a very high level of customer service and satisfaction. Minimum Qualifications BS/BA or equivalent combination of education and experience Five years medical sales experience; previous management experience preferred A valid driver’s license and driving record within the standards outlined within Hanger’s Motor Vehicle Safety Policy and Procedures. Additional Success Factors Knowledge of the local market health system marketplace Proven track record in identifying, developing, and closing sales involving multiple players Ability to obtain access to all health systems in assigned territory through vendor credentialing process Act with integrity in all ways and at all times, remaining honest, transparent, and respectful in all relationships. Keep the patient at the center of everything that you do, building lifelong trust. Foster open collaboration and constructive dialogue with everyone around you. Continuously innovate new solutions, influencing and responding to change. Focus on superior outcomes, and calibrate work processes for outstanding results. Our Investment in You  Employees working at least 20 hours per week are eligible for the following benefits: Competitive Pay Health Insurance Dental Insurance Vision Insurance 8 Paid Holidays per Year Paid Vacation Time Off Paid Sick Time Off 8 hours of paid time to volunteer in your community Floating Holiday Life Insurance Medical Flex Spend Account Dependent Care Flex Spend Account Free employee assistance program 401(k) Full-time employees are also eligible for short-term and long-term disability insurance

This progressive Oil & Gas business is seeking a Sales Representative to take ownership of a stable territory in addition to being tasked with increasing revenue by 5% annually. This is an excellent opportunity to join a leading name in the market with a presence in oil and gas, utility, infrastructure, chemical and mining industries.  Responsibilities include: ·         Full ownership of sales and marketing activity within the territory in addition to cross-selling other areas of the business ·         Build relationships with current customers and liaise between the customer and the management team ·         Generate sales within current clients in addition to identifying news prospects and winning new business ·         Networking at industry events and trade shows   Key Reasons to explore this opportunity: ·         Very entrepreneurial environment with autonomy to develop and implement a sales plan as you see fit ·         The business is a leading innovator within the industry investing significantly in a market leading technology department to focus on innovation and R&D; ultimately offering a continuous stream of new chemical and equipment solutions ·         The business is focused more on bespoke client solutions as opposed to it’s larger competitors offering “one size fits all” services ·         Market leading bonus and incentive plan ·         Well defined career path offering fast track progression   Desired skills and qualifications: ·         Previous experience in Oil & Gas ·         Project management experience ·         Sales oriented ·         Strong technical and selling skills ·         Excellent communication and people skills ·         Good computer skills, Proficient in MS Office ·         Self-motivated ·         Ability to manage numerous projects ·         Strong computer skills ·         Focus on safety

description: About The Opportunity  Grubhub is dedicated to connecting hungry diners with our wide network of restaurants across the country. Our innovative technology, easy-to-use platforms and streamlined delivery capabilities make us an industry leader today, and in the future of online food ordering.  We strive to create a workplace that reflects the diversity of our customers and the communities we serve. When you join our team, you become part of a community that works together to innovate, solve problems, take risks, grow, work hard and have a ton of fun in the process!  Why Work For Us  We have a fast-paced environment and that is what our teams thrive on. Grubhub believes in empowering people and offering opportunities for development, as well as professional growth. We value strong, positive relationships in all areas: with each other, our customers and our greater community. Want to be a part of a team of diverse collaborators in an authentically fun culture? If so, we want to talk to you - and hear what’s your favorite restaurant for food delivery!  The Impact You Will Make Work closely with the Senior Manager of Restaurant Sales and the Director of Restaurant Sales to lead an inside sales team Train, coach, motivate, and manage a team of Sales Executives to improve individual results Identify opportunities to improve effectiveness and efficiencies with processes, tools, product offerings, and employee development Use Salesforce.com to develop regular tracking and reporting of key performance metrics and translate these metrics into implications and recommendations Develop effective coaching strategies and content for team meetings Encourage transparency and align broader company initiatives with department goals Monitor success outcomes from each team member through the creation of recognition programs, dashboards, and leader boards Coordinate with The Restaurant Sales Management Team to ensure proper communication and alignment across teams Be a respected leader while maintaining our collaborative and dynamic team culture Develop clear expectations and instill accountability for employees across all aspects of their performance Cultivate an open sales environment while maintaining competition and self-reliance Encourage employees to contribute new ideas and solutions to problems Take on projects outside of the scope of day to day responsibilities as needed by the sales department Contribute to the sales strategy as it relates to the department as a whole What You Bring To The Table Have a coach’s mentality: you love helping others succeed and strive at pushing your team to its fullest potential Experience in developing processes, meeting deadlines, paying attention to detail, while remaining organized Possess a analytical, data driven mindset Experience working in a metrics/data-driven environment Have a deep interest and enthusiasm to work for a rapidly evolving company Experience with working in a high activity, high volume environment Have an understanding on how to analyze metrics and using them to improve performance Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to work across multiple internal groups Basic proficiency in Microsoft Excel Bachelor’s degree Experience with Salesforce is a plus! And Of Course, Perks! Flexible PTO. Grubhub employees are provided a generous amount of time to recharge their batteries. Health and Wellness. We provide programs that support your overall well-being such as generous medical benefits, employee network groups, company-wide fitness challenges, and a comfortable and casual workplace! We also support our parents by offering 8 weeks of paid parent bonding time, a 4-week returnship program, and 6-8 weeks paid medical leave. Learning and Career Growth. Your personal and professional development is a priority at Grubhub. From day one, we empower you to lead and be an active participant in your career growth. We provide continuous learning opportunities, training, and coaching and mentorship programs. MealPerks. Who’s ready for some lunch? We provide our employees with a weekly Grubhub credit to enjoy and support local restaurants. We also offer company-wide meals several times a year to bring our Grubhub family together. Fun. Every Grubhub office has an employee-led Culture Crew that connects people through fun, meaningful events and initiatives. Some of our popular past events include: Wing-eating contests, Grubtoberfest, 5k Runs, Bring Your Child to Work Day, regular happy hours, and more! Social Impact. We believe in the importance of serving the communities that support our business. In addition, employees are given paid time off each year to support the causes that are important to them. Grubhub is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster is available here: DOL Poster. If you are applying for a job in the U.S. and need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to TalentAcquisition@grubhub.com and let us know the nature of your request and contact information. Please note that only those inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this email address.  CA Privacy Notice: If you are a resident of the State of California and would like a copy of our CA privacy notice, please email privacy@grubhub.com.

jobTitle: National Sales Manager - MOS in School Products (REMOTE)
description: National Sales Manager, MOS in School Products (REMOTE) Museum of Science, Boston www.mos.org  Innovation and creativity come from the unique perspectives of a diverse staff. We value your perspective.  SUMMARY STATEMENT: The National Sales Manager will manage a national territory, lead the internal proposal process, manage a team of regional and sales development representatives, and be responsible for monthly, quarterly, and yearly reporting of our sales team. They will coordinate with key stakeholders across the organization to manage goals and grow strategic opportunities. The National Sales Manager will provide innovative ideas for financial growth, oversee a team of 2-4 , and build scalable solutions for prospecting leads generated by the marketing team. They will lead both strategy and execution for growth of the MOS in School products. The National Sales Manager will coach regional managers on how to negotiate and close large customer opportunities. The National Sales Manager will be report out the overall performance of the sales team to the MOS in School leadership team on a monthly, quarterly, and annual basis.  RESPONSIBILITIES: Drive sales of curriculum/supplemental business of >$7.0M in annual sales, with annual growth target of 5-8% in PreK-8 STEM education market. Manage a defined territory (>$1.5M), focusing on T1 states, while maintaining T2-T3 states. Oversee and support 2-5 sales regional and development representatives Lead the creation of a minimum of 1 RFP per month Travel requirement of a minimum of 20% to a maximum of 60%  WORK SCHEDULE: Monday – Friday 9:00 am – 5:00 pm  REPORTS TO: Vice President, STEM Education  MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelors of Science or Arts degree. 5 or more years of educational sales experience. Demonstrated knowledge and hands on experience with sales tools and reports Communication, interpersonal and leadership skills Experience writing proposals, negotiating large customer deals Experience growing a territory Experience managing a team (directly and indirectly) Experience analyzing sales performance metrics and trends Demonstrated presentation skills Demonstrated experience and knowledge of sales tools (CRMs)  STARTING SALARY: Exempt (Salaried). $85,000 - $90,000 base and eligible for commission based on sales goals.  BENEFITS: Benefits for full-time, exempt (salaried) staff include: free parking, T accessibility, 23 vacation days, 12 holidays, 10 sick days, medical, dental, and vision insurance, short- and long-term disability, life insurance, retirement and savings plan, health care/dependent care flex spending plan, a Museum Membership, employee discounts, employee referral program, tuition assistance, professional development, direct deposit, free admission, free Duck Tours, discounted movie passes, and much more!  VACCINATION POLICY: Staff, interns, and volunteers will be required to show proof that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment. The Museum will consider an exemption from the vaccine requirement if they are unable to get vaccinated due to a qualifying medical disability or a sincerely held religious objection. The Museum is not required to provide an accommodation or exemption from the vaccine requirement if doing so would pose a direct threat to others in the workplace or would create an undue hardship for the Museum.  The Museum of Science is fully committed to Equal Employment Opportunity and to attracting, retaining, developing and promoting the most qualified employees without regard to their race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, citizenship status, veteran status, or any other characteristic prohibited by federal, state or local law. We are dedicated to providing a work environment free from discrimination and harassment, and where employees are treated with respect and dignity.  No phone inquiries, please. Qualified applicants will be contacted within two to four weeks of initial application.

jobTitle: Strategic Account Manager - Health - Americas (Remote possible - EDT)
description: Board of Innovation is an independently owned business design and innovation strategy firm. We have a hybrid work policy that allows us to attract the best talent. Our hubs are located in Antwerp, Amsterdam, New York, and Singapore but our talent is globally distributed. This diversity allows our business designers to uniquely help the world's largest organizations navigate fundamental shifts. And we do this by developing growth strategies, innovation capabilities, and new businesses with many of the world's largest organizations (have a look at our cases here: https://www.boardofinnovation.com/client-cases/ )  We are looking for a Strategic Account Manager (SAM) to support our Health business in the Americas. Your role will be to collaborate with our account teams and business development support resources to identify and close new business opportunities in leading Health oriented businesses. As a SAM, you will act as both a hunter, identifying new prospects / leads in target clients, and a farmer, broadening and deepening our relationship with existing clients. You will use your business acumen to identify how Board Of Innovation could help innovate their business.  We're looking for someone with previous experience as a Strategic Account Manager for Health businesses who has a strong network, knowledge of the industry, context of the strategic issues facing companies and the ability to both sell on a stand-alone basis and support our existing delivery resources in sales efforts that logically take place as part of on-going engagements.  Consider the below job description as a starting point for yours: You will come from a consulting, agency or other relevant background You have a track record of building relationships in large, enterprise companies (multi-national, $1Bil in revenue or more) in the health space You have experience supporting client relationships of delivery teams by Seeking ways to deliver incremental value Expanding relationships to peers and superiors Supporting existing delivery resources in proposal development and sales execution You consider yourself to be a Strategic Account Management expert You are an expert in strategic account planning Expert in account plan execution You either are, or are willing to become, a subject matter expert on anything (corporate) innovation related This position will report to the Americas Head of Business Development (Gregg) on weekly sales results and collaborate closely with other sales team members    Requirements You can comfortably navigate complex conversations with C-Level management in the health industry You have a desire to meet and exceed measurable performance goals. You're a go-getter. You have a strong background in strategic account mgmt in a consultancy / agency environment Your communication skills in English are impeccable You're data-focused. Improving conversions are your guilty pleasure. You have the ability to deal with and thrive on objections on a daily basis. You're okay with a full remote-role    Why work at Board of Innovation? You enjoy being part of a global innovation consultancy working for some of the biggest brands in the world (like Roche, GE Healthcare, Astrazeneca and many more). You thrive in an entrepreneurial environment and want to contribute to our overall business strategies and growth. You want numerous on-the-job-and-beyond learning opportunities, and you'll receive a self-development budget. You look for a place where you can be your whole self, and become part of a highly talented, ambitious, (from time to time hilarious) international and diverse team (27 different nationalities and counting!) You are eager to build a global professional network through our offices (New York, Singapore, Antwerp, Amsterdam) and clients worldwide If you're interested, you enjoy creating positive change in societies and with INGOs (Unicef, SOS Children's Villages,...) through our .Social branch. You will get a market-conforming remuneration package, benchmarked with local standards. Every year, we gather our colleagues from around the world for a week of team bonding, workshops, strategy sessions, and unwinding - we call it ‘Summer Office’. You can work flexibly when (EDT timezone) and where you're most productive. We don't have typical 9 to 5 expectations. And of course, remote work is highly supported!  Where You'll Be We are a distributed workforce with Hubs in Belgium (Antwerp), the United States (New York) and Singapore. Where in the world? For this role, it can be anywhere from where it’s comfortable to work within Eastern Daylight Time. Contract or payroll? We’re open to discuss both options. In countries where we don’t have a legal entity we can provide compliant payroll and contracts through our global EOR partner.  Board of Innovation recognises the positive value of diversity, promotes equality and challenges discrimination. We welcome and encourage people of all backgrounds to apply. Interested? Read more about our culture, mission and values: https://www.boardofinnovation.com/about-us/

At SmileDirectClub, we’re all about empowering transformation. We want people to become more confident in how they look, how they feel, and how they think. description: About Sunvalleytek  Sunvalleytek is “To be amazing in all that we do.” Founded in 2007, the Sunvalley Group has grown to become a leading eCommerce company that is home to six major international consumer brands: RAVPower, TaoTronics, HooToo, USpicy, Anjou and VAVA,. From energy-saving LED desk lamps to next-generation portable chargers to newest 4K TV projectors, millions of customers benefit from our products each day and trust us to enhance their lives. This will be done by developing an appropriate level of communication with clients and internal team members to better understand and mitigate any issues the customers may face.   Responsibilities Work cross functionally within the company to communicate with all stakeholders in customers' success Create and maintain relationships with customers to better understand and achieve their needs Make visits to our customers to identify opportunities for growth within our platform Manage all reporting about the health of customers' accounts  Qualifications Previous account management experience for ecommerce vendor accounts Former vendor managers at Walmart or Wayfair is a huge plus!!! description: Job Title: Territory Sales Manager (VFD) Position Reports to: National Sales Manager Industry: Industrial Controls / Applied Motor Applications Products: VFD’s, Soft Starters (Complete Control Solutions Packages) Territories: Florida, Georgia, Alabama Location: Remote  The Ideal Territory Sales Manager candidate will have 5+ yrs Industrial Controls Distribution Sales experience with selling Low/Med voltage VFD’s, Soft Starters, and Electric Motor applications.  Compensation: Highly competitive salary + bonus Full Benefits – Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Disability, 401K Outstanding company culture, vertical career mobility and valued benefits  Position Summary: The Territory Sales Manager is responsible for executing strategic and tactical selling and demand generation strategies that accomplish overall company objectives and support attainment of sales, order and price quality financial targets. This position is responsible for managing overall existing customer account coverage and identifying and developing new potential customer targets through both direct account coverage and coordination of selling efforts of Company contracted Manufacturer’s Representatives and authorized Distribution partners. Foundational commitment to individual and team core competency and organizational development, adherence to company code of conduct policies, responsible expense and cost and overall business and personal integrity are required.  Lead Responsibilities - Territory Sales Manager Establish and successfully deploy sales and business development strategies and tactics to accomplish successful and profitable growth of Company products in assigned territory, attaining financial objectives established by business leadership Maintain high engagement with customers to ensure excellent service is being provided. Ensure high post-sales satisfaction, facilitating positive long-term relationships and high potential for repeat business with accounts Responsible for successful existing customer and new target account coverage and relationship development through implementation of defined Company strategic initiatives and programs, Manufacturer’s and Channel Programs to ensure strong customer engagement and satisfaction levels Fully leverages company Customer Relationship Management tools to maximize sales and sales management efficiencies in support attaining defined customer engagement KPIs Implement demand generation and product promotional programs to establish and sustain increased demand for Company products Maintain commitment to personal competency and skills development to attain greater specific selling, negotiations and customer engagement acumen Execute established Manufacturer’s Representative and authorized Distributor development and performance management activities in accordance with establish program requirements Drive culture of partnership with internal functions to support attainment of NPS, margin and market share objectives Monitors and documents customer, industry, competitor and market trends and changing requirements to help direct future strategic, commercial and product roadmap development Coordinates / provides product and solution training and education to key customers to highlight product unique advantages in support of addressing customer needs  Established Success Measures Sales volume in accordance with annual operating plan targets Order (booking) volume targets Price quality targets in support of overall business profitability objectives Customer net promoter improvement targets Quarterly opportunity project / target account pipeline target levels Customer facing activity targets Opportunity update and maintenance frequency  Position Requirements - Territory Sales Manager Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Business, Marketing or related area Minimum of three years of experience in sales, marketing, and/or product marketing in a related industry selling technology based products, including demonstrated success in strategic and solution selling approaches Demonstrated ability to influence, negotiate and understand large project and repeat business opportunities involving technical requirements as well as commercial and legal terms Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables. Ability to read, analyze, and interpret common technical journals, financial reports, and legal documents Ability to effectively present information to top management, customers, channel partners , and other employees of the organization Ability to work independently and consistently meet deadlines Requires strong commitment to customer service and teamwork Ability to travel 50% or more, depending on customer needs. This includes both air travel and car travel, typically within specified territory, as well as travel to (headquarters) as needed. Ability to conduct customer visits in person and participate in plant tours. These tours typically involve walking through industrial manufacturing environments where this position may be in the presence of mechanical, electrical and powered industrial equipment. These tours typically require standing, walking and balancing for extended time periods (hours at a time). Ability to effectively present information to top management, customers, channel partners, and other employees of the organization. This may include standing and/or walking for extended time periods (hours at a time).  Additional Desired Skills - Territory Sales Manager Demonstrated applications and/or commercial experience with Low Voltage and Medium Voltage Drives, Soft Starters and Full Voltage Controls Experience with Microsoft Sales CRM or related system

jobTitle: Sales Enablement Business Partner (Alliances and Channels)
description: There is only one Data Cloud. Snowflake’s founders started from scratch and designed a data platform built for the cloud that is effective, affordable, and accessible to all data users. But it didn’t stop there. They engineered Snowflake to power the Data Cloud, where thousands of organizations unlock the value of their data with near-unlimited scale, concurrency, and performance. This is our vision: a world with endless insights to tackle the challenges and opportunities of today and reveal the possibilities of tomorrow.  Snowflake, the company that delivers the Data Cloud to Mobilize the World’s Data, is actively seeking a Sales Enablement Business Partner to support the Alliances and Channels segment.In this role, which reports to the Director of Sales Best Practices and Enablement, you will be a key contributor to the vision and realization of our overall Alliances Enablement Strategy and a strategic conduit between alliances and the sales organization.  YOUR PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES WILL BE TO: Collaborate with leadership on an annual enablement plan that aligns with the Alliances strategy and goals; and lead communication, associated change management and overall execution of the plan. Establish yourself with the Alliances leadership as a key member of their extended leadership team. Collaborate with leadership on best practices and playbooks. Define and deliver corresponding enablement needed for successful implementation and adoption. Collaborate with the Global Sales Onboarding team to shape and continuously refine the onboarding program so it is relevant for Partner Alliance Managers. Ensure Partner programs and customers are represented to the field in a relevant and an effective manner. Build strong partnerships and align with internal and cross functional SMEs on enablement content creation and delivery. Manage the intake process and prioritize enablement requests based on expected business impact. Demonstrate discipline to build, work and strategically revise the plan versus reacting and responding to ad-hoc requests. Collaborate with your Sales Enablement peers on common needs across the business to create greater scale, and share content and other enablement artifacts to reduce unnecessary work. Take a hands-on approach in building, implementing and managing critical enablement programs that ensure the organization is well-equipped with the content, training and resources to meet and exceed quotas.  QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS: A minimum of 12 years of related experience with a focus in enterprise software, sales and alliance enablement. Bachelor’s degree Strong business, technical and sales acumen. Understanding of complex sales cycles, processes and methodologies. Experienced in designing, building and delivering enablement programs. Ability to lead through influence. Ability to establish executive sponsorship and secure support from a diverse group of internal stakeholders and cross functional partners to successfully deliver programs. Ability to manage competing priorities across multiple projects, while meeting deadlines and producing quality deliverables. Highly organized with excellent communication skills (including presentation skills). Experience working in a fast-changing environment that requires strategic thinking, resourcefulness, agility, results-oriented decision making and commitment to excellence. Direct enterprise software sales experience, as an Account Executive or Partner Alliance Manager, strongly preferred.  Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.  How do you want to make your impact?

companyName: Elevate - An Elm Street Technology Solution
description: Who Are We?  Elm Street Technology offers a portfolio of real estate marketing and technology services that together provide one vendor, one point of contact, one solution fully fused into one platform to deliver a single source for new leads, client relationship management, and client retention tools for real estate agents, teams, and brokerages. Elevate from Elm Street Technology is the single solution that real estate professionals need for everything, including high-end IDX websites, lead generation tools, powerful CRM and incubation tools, mobile app, social media management and blogging, and client retention tools. Our goal is to be a one-stop shop for real estate digital marketing needs - and we are well on our way there!  Elm Street Technology was founded in 2016 and continues to grow exponentially. We are now over 300 employees strong between the US and Canada.  Come join the team and grow with us!   Who Are We Looking For?  The Senior Account Executive is responsible for high quality contacts to potential customers. This representative will often be the first contact prospects have with the company, so a strong virtual/in-person presence and customer service ability is necessary.    What Will You Do?  Quota-based sales of EST products Attendance of up to 5 industry conventions annually Drive brand awareness Ensure customer satisfaction Self-Generated sales opportunities as well as following up on company provided opportunities Recognize sales opportunities and engage EST specialists for demonstration facilitation   Who Are YOU?  Customer Service and/or Sales experience preferred Familiarity with laptop-based Zoom calls, as well as with several sales productivity tools like Salesforce Ability to travel Excellent verbal and written communications skills Dependable Ability to excel in a fast paced and changing environment Real Estate Industry Sales experience preferred Experience with SAAS platforms or other types of software sales   Why Work With Us?  Make a positive impact: Our solutions help grow clients’ businesses and we’re passionate about what we do! Competitive salary + opportunities for growth Work in a collaborative environment focused on input and creative ideas from all team members for company growth A full suite of benefits choices to fit your needs: Medical, Dental, Vision, Group Life, Long- and Short-Term Disability, Health Savings Accounts with a company match, Flexible Spending Accounts, Pet Insurance, Monthly Wellness Reimbursements, etc. 100% company-paid premiums for medical, dental, vision, life, and long-term disability insurance for employee coverage Generous 401(k) plan: Earn a 50% company match on your contribution Recharge: Start out with 80 hours vacation + 32 hours discretionary time + 24 hours floating holiday = 136 hours of paid time off PLUS 8 company-wide paid holidays. Earn more PTO starting with your 2nd work anniversary. 2 months paid parental leave Flex time arrangements with your manager

Job Description  At Cloudera, we believe that data can make what is impossible today, possible tomorrow. We empower people to transform complex data into clear and actionable insights. Cloudera delivers an enterprise data cloud for any data, anywhere, from the Edge to AI. Powered by the relentless innovation of the open-source community, Cloudera advances digital transformation for the world’s largest enterprises.  Are you able to quickly understand where individuals are and where they want to go and build trust and lead them down a specific path to generate big results? Are you able to challenge the status quo, engage customers in new ways and earn their trust and business? Are you ready to be intellectually stimulated and earn financial rewards along the way?  Responsibilities Align with company’s strategic objectives, handle and grow revenue and market share at designated Enterprise accounts to improve customer success at all levels in the customer organization. Develop and deliver business plans to address customer and prospect priorities and critical needs. Convey public and acquired intelligence about customer technology footprints, strategic growth plans, technology strategies, and competitive landscape and trends Introduce domain product and service experts/specialists while maintaining account oversight. Own account relationships and drive overall customer success for these assigned accounts. Build consensus and develop relationships at multiple levels – executive sponsors, influencers, and decision-makers. Lead large scale transactions to close large scale deals Build pipeline, forecast business, lead the internal team, communicate key updates and competitive intelligence. Exceed quarterly and annual new and expansion software subscription, renewals, professional service, and training business goals. About Our Top Sales Performers Minimum 5+ years of exceeding enterprise software sales targets Fast-moving start-up and vertical use case driven experience Data management or Data warehousing experience Containers, Kubernetes, and public cloud infrastructure technology knowledge and experience BA/BS or equivalent educational background

This position is perfect for someone who is seeking to grow their career in a luxury retail environment, has a strategic sales mindset, willingness to learn, and a passion for forming meaningful relationships with a global clientele.   The Gallery Sales Manager is responsible for the day to day operations of the Cambria Gallery at Buckhead . You will drive guest/partner relations, event management, and the customer experience as well as leverage the Gallery for events and functions. In addition, it is for those who thrive in a design focused and results driven environment and see themselves as more than a Retail Manager, you are a true brand advocate & leader to a team.  Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Manage Gallery during open hours Develop and execute plans to drive growth of customer traffic within the gallery Provide information to ensure homeowners and designers understand the benefits of Cambria Assist guests with design solutions for their project, as requested Drive and track all potential sales opportunities within the Gallery Deliver and present estimates with potential customers on a daily basis Assist the local market reps with sales efforts within the architect, design, and building community (including but not limited to lunch and learns, dinner and learns, executive gallery tours and presentations) Manage communication between homeowners, business partners and the appropriate internal Cambria representative to assist with each unique situation Manage sample and marketing literature inventory within the Gallery Work with Cambria Marketing to track and manage leads from the gallery Stay educated on design trends & new Cambria programs Participate in approved local and National industry related organizations Research and improve ways to enhance customer experience, product knowledge and generate more event partnerships based on the local community surroundings Actively seek out more information on the Interior Design and Building Industry while also maintaining education on the competition Perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned  Requirements: Experience in a retail or showroom environment providing excellent guest & B2B services Experience in the home, building or interior design industry is a plus Possess customer network or capability to build a network focused within the designer and builder community Passion for sales and ability to close business Strong attention to detail, high level of organization and initiative Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high-energy environment Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills Proven project management skills Excellent organization skills, as well as the ability to maintain focus under pressure Strong experience in Google Suites and Salesforce  Minimum Requirements: Education: College Degree (preferably Marketing, Interior Design / Home Fashion, Retail Management Experience: 5+ Years, in the kitchen/Bath industry, design industry or home building industry. Systems: Google Suites, PowerPoint, Excel, Word, Salesforce, etc.  Additional Requirements: Physical Requirements: Must be able to lift up to 40 pounds for displays, samples and other marketing materials   Cambria offers a competitive benefits package that encompasses Health and Dental Insurance, Paid Time Off, 401(k) plus matching, Discretionary Profit Sharing, Flexible Spending Account, Life, Supplemental Life, and Disability Insurance, Referral Program, Tuition Reimbursement, Employee Assistance Program, Employee Discount and Professional Development Assistance.  Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.  For additional company information, please visit www.CambriaUSA.com  We are an equal opportunity employer. M/W/VET/DISABLED
industries: Building Materials, Design, and Architecture & Planning

description: Job Description:  DataRobot is looking for a talented and hungry Corporate Sales Representative. This is an incredible opportunity to build a SaaS sales career with a tech unicorn valued at over $6B. We are well-positioned to emerge as the dominant vendor in the Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning space and are undergoing tremendous growth as we move toward an eventual IPO. We’ve garnered some of the top sales leadership and GTM talent on the planet with a lineage of scaling start-ups to massive exits and countless examples of meteoric career growth.  Responsibilities  The successful candidate will play a fundamental role in achieving our ambitious customer acquisition and revenue growth objectives. You will consult and partner with senior executives at large and mid-sized companies to solve complex business challenges. You must be comfortable self-sourcing new sales opportunities, developing new interest and meetings in your assigned market (Pipeline Generation), engaging with senior executives, qualifying prospects and closing sales. You will be expected to:  Meet or exceed assigned sales goals and work effectively as a sales team member; promote camaraderie, share best practices, provide assistance, be a positive influence Leverage Leading Indicators and Data in your business to ensure you are tracking above your quota goals Collaborate and leverage an ecosystem of resources including pre sales, post sales, channel partners, customer success and leadership to promote DataRobot and drive incremental new business Conduct Proof of Value technical validation engagements with customers to validate our technology and tie the technology back to customer value Stay current with industry trends, show dedication to continuous learning on all fronts Provide feedback to peers and internal teams to aid in the development and improvement of sales materials Maintain full use and adoption of the sales tech stack, including Salesforce.com, Outreach.io, GSuite, Zoominfo, LinkedIn Navigator, etc.  Key Characteristics  You’ll know you’re a good fit if you have the following traits:  Coachable, curious, life-long learner who constantly seeks development Intelligent persistence, diligently pursuing every lead Customer-centric, putting the customer’s success before all else Detailed-oriented, organized, with strong time-management, the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously in a fast paced, deadline and data-driven environment Excellent verbal and communications skills Sense of urgency with the ability to thrive in a metrics-driven culture Self-starter with solid problem-solving skills  Experience & Skills  1 to 3 years of sales experience in a business to business environment; Knowledge of or experience with using value-selling/consultative methodologies, playbooks, and processes (examples include MEDDIC, SPIN, Sandler, SNAP, Miller Heiman, Challenger, Gap Selling, etc.) Strong experience and success in outbound sales and prospecting roles Interest and excitement for the machine learning/predictive analytics space Ability to deliver compelling presentations and demonstrations to individuals and large groups  At DataRobot, we value diverse backgrounds and understand that the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can discourage really awesome people from applying. We believe “Growth happens outside of your comfort zone.”, so if you’re smart, curious, and emotionally intelligent, please don’t hesitate to apply — we’d love to hear from you.  DataRobot is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. DataRobot is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and mental disabilities. Please see the United States Department of Labor’s EEO poster and EEO poster supplement for additional information.  All applicant data submitted is handled in accordance with our Applicant Privacy Policy .
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: The Regional Sales Manager (RSM), reporting directly to the Director of Marketing / USA Sales Division is someone with a lot of sales expertise and will be responsible for growing sales for WATERAX core products and developing our key channel partner network in a specific geographical market region.  Role & Responsibilities Articulate and leverage the organization’s unique abilities to deliver value to the market; Responsible for developing, retaining and increasing sales and gross margins with key channel; Ability to identify and qualify business development opportunities grow through dealer channel and company resources to maximize sales revenues and meet corporate objectives; Manages existing sales channels and aggressively recruits new ones in key regions with less coverage; Diligently forecasts annual, quarterly and monthly sales goals and keeping tabs on the needs of the market; Develops specific plans to ensure revenue growth; Routine key account management review to ensure sales objectives/target and provide quarterly results assessments of our channel partners; Delivering reports on sales goals, targets, and additional sales insights; Participate in regional forestry events, conferences and tradeshows; Establishes personal contact and rapport with top echelon decision-makers for each key account and develop positive business relationships; Relaying customer insights and sales data to product team and operations to support product development; Plays an active role with the Product Development and Marketing team by providing them with valuable customer feedback on product features, requirements including competitive intelligence;  Education & Experience University degree in marketing or business studies is preferred; A minimum of 5-7 years of related experience in sales management or the equivalent combination of formal education and experience; Experience in developing marketing and sales strategies; Willingness to travel up to 75% of the time; Good working knowledge of Microsoft office suite is required (PPT, Excel, Visio); A valid driver’s license; Understanding of WATERAX products, services and capabilities. Must demonstrate ability to understand our products and mechanical concepts and to successfully communicate them to customers and sales channel partners; Knowledge of the Fire industry and experience in wildland firefighting is an asset;  Skills & Competencies Highly professional and positive attitude and ability to deliver customer-focused service; Strategic thinking, strong listening skills and patience to work with customers and understand their needs; Energetic and able to adapt to a fast-paced environment where priorities change quickly, and multi-tasking is a must; Professional communication skills through email and phone calls; Natural curiosity and passion for excellence, improvement and problem solving; Innovative, creative and decisive; A positive attitude and professional appearance along with the ability to thrive in a small company environment and build strong relationships with coworkers, customers and partners; Must be persistent, action-oriented, results-driven and self-motivated; Ability to manage several projects simultaneously, delivering high quality work; Excellent people skills, including experience working with a variety of cross functional and international stakeholders; Diplomacy and tact in interpersonal relationships; Excellent time management and direct selling skills; Problem-solving and analytical skills to interpret sales performance and market trend information; Proven leadership and ability to drive and motivate sales teams; Excellent oral and written communication skills; Effective channel management;
